Reviews.Author: Samuel C.
Reviews.Content: I can't really say anything that hasn't been said... it's good!!My fave are the #2 (1/2 chicken and 2 waffles).And the obama special...

Reviews.Author: Alexis B.
Reviews.Content: ambiance: dark, busy, outdated (but probably very intentional).  You will feel like you travelled back in time when you step inside.  But that may add to the "experience".food: good and consistent, but certainly not what it's hyped up to be.  but if it makes people happy, then that is a good thing.  happy is good.service: very friendly, but a little rushed.overall: 4-stars

Reviews.Author: Eric J.
Reviews.Content: Honestly I thought the whole vibe was dingy and gross. The place was so dark and not dark in the intimate "I want to take a date here" kinda way. I ordered a fried chicken sandwich cause honestly the sound of chicken and waffles to me just sounds about as apetizing as peanut butter and pickles.The waiter was off and got my order wrong. He seemed pretty annoyed when I asked for him to take it back. The chicken sandwich was okay but the fries sucked.Don't see what the hype is about, pass.

Reviews.Author: Stefanie G.
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review by saying this: My mother forbid me from eating fast food. I've eaten 2 Egg McMuffins my entire life. Last night I was introduced to the scintillating combinations of fried chicken, waffles, and breakfast food that Roscoe's offers. I was put on a wait list with a party of 6 and got in immediately at 12 am on a Saturday night. I was pleasantly surprised.....the chicken is tender and the quality is better than I expected. They even made the omelette I ordered with only egg whites!!!   4 out of 6 waffles were soft in the center. The cornbread was dried up. The service sucked hard. The security guard was rude. The wait for the food was way too long. I was impressed by the funky 70's vibes, but they didn't have a decent soundtrack going off. The LAX location is bigger, cleaner, and apparently the staff is way nicer. Either way, I understand why this place is a classic.

Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: Ok, this was my first time at Roscoes. I must say that the food was very good. I had the Scoes #2. Chicken with Gravy and waffles. The chicken was very good. The gravy was lovely. The waffles were very tasty. So why 3 stars. The service was bad. My server was pretty awful. It took her more then 10 minutes to even greet our table. She forgot to bring my waffles, which is an honest mistake. But she never apologized. And we had to chase her down to get our drinks refilled and for to go containers because she was standing there chatting with fellow servers. Probably the worst server in LA. However, the food was pretty darn good. I may try another one instead. Hopefully the service will be better.

Reviews.Author: Peter J.
Reviews.Content: I did not sit down in the restaurant, so my review is purely on the to-go aspect & taste of the food. -There is a line outside, because it is popular. -I got Obama's Special: 3 wings and waffles-It really is just that, fried chicken and waffles. You don't mix them or anything, but they are separate entities that are just on one plate. Interesting, I guess it is the whole sweet and salty alternating tastes that makes it feasible. My overall impression is that it is just fried chicken and waffles, nothing too special, but I think it would be a good place to check out if you had an extended time in LA. Not a go-to place if you only have a few days.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly P.
Reviews.Content: My rating is about 3.5 stars but it was a good experience so I'll give it a 4.I came here for the first time with my boyfriend before we were going to head over to the Jimmey Kimmel Live Concert. We arrived here at around 2PM and to my surprise, there wasn't that much of a wait. We drove by the location at first in hopes of a parking lot but there was none, all parking was with the meters -- which were PACKED! We drove around for a bit and finally found free parking just a crosswalk away from Roscoe's, thank goodness! We were seated as soon as we arrived and our waiter was really friendly and attentive. It was pretty busy inside but nothing too crazy. My boyfriend and I both got the #1 on the menu (two pieces of chicken & two waffles) with side orders of gravy and corn bread (I'm a sucker for good corn bread). Our total turned out to be ~$32.00. The wait for our food wasn't too long which I really appreciated.FOOD:- The chicken was well seasoned & crispy although I had expected more of a crunch from the waffles since they turned out to be quite soft and meh. - Three scoops of butter and two syrup cups per plate -- wowza! I scooped off a lot of the butter and barely got half-way through one of the syrup cups. - The gravy was something else! And I mean that in a good way. It was a lot different than the gravy that I'm used to... so flavorful and wonderfully seasoned. - The corn bread was big! The edges were ever so crispy while the bread so crumbly and delicious. Both my boyfriend and I could barely finish one helping of it because we were so stuffed from our chicken & waffles. SERVICE:- Our waiter came by about 3-4 times throughout our meal to check up on us, asked us how our meal was and to refill our water which I really appreciated given that there was a crowd coming in for the lunch hour. I enjoyed my trip here and had a good time although it didn't live up to what many had hyped it up to be for me. This is also definitely a treat because you are just so stuffed afterwards!

Reviews.Author: Lorena V.
Reviews.Content: If you're wondering why the wait is so long.. keep wondering. It's crazy. Don't expect A+ service here. The waiter/waitress will come literally one time to check on your table and that's all. Good luck with refills or questions. You can't split the checks. All must be on a credit card or cash only.    If you're a tourist, make sure you know what you want right when they hand you the food menu. If you want to experience the waffle and chicken, but don't feel like eating a lot get #13 (Carol Special) with the eggs & onions... or the mac and cheese (even though the egg is overpriced) I'm giving them 4 stars because, of their customer service or else they would receive all 5 stars from me!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence S.
Reviews.Content: Visited Roscoe's Hollywood while on vacation. The food was delicious and lived up to its reputation. I had the waffle with 3 chicken wings. I consider myself a wing connoisseur, and these wings were fried to perfection. The waffle was on point as well.  What I liked even more than that was the staff. Everyone that we came in contact with was friendly and engaging. They had a ball with my kids. I would probably eat there on a weekly basis if I lived in that area.

Reviews.Author: Ana Z.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with fried chicken and waffles. The fried chicken was juicy, well seasoned and so darn crispy! We asked for extra crispy waffles and it came out soft, flimsy, it wasn't too great. Their syrup for the waffle tasted like tap water... What happened there?

Reviews.Author: Roy C.
Reviews.Content: Listenin' to Snoop dogg and Dre, ridin' down sunset blvd, ride or die, this is westside, Roscoe, tell me when to go, here with gangbangers, hipsters, kids playing with legos,this that crack chicken, HAM from the get-go, mac n cheese, cray like mac dre, this that served daily in thug mansion, gangster paradise, chicken, waffle, sizzurp, leanin' real nice, this that Iggy Azalea, fancy straight golden, got me yellin' murder, baptized in red light

Reviews.Author: Liane M.
Reviews.Content: I wish I could eat here everyday without gaining any weight! I love the food! I always order a #10 I believe.. Which is a Thigh/leg and a waffle. Then, I always get a side of their macaroni and cheese! Which to me is delicious! Their waffles are the best waffles I've ever had! The food comes out quickly, great portion sizes, and chicken is cooked to perfection. Need I say more?

Reviews.Author: Maria S.
Reviews.Content: Extremely overrated.Roscoe's gets so much more attention than deserved. The chicken and waffles are basic. You're better off toasting your own frozen Eggo waffle and buying chicken from the deli at Ralph's. Not to mention overpriced.

Reviews.Author: Cyntia C.
Reviews.Content: Expected a little more. Not bad, waffles are good chicken is average. Their gravy chicken is really good. This place might have been to hyped up for me and therefore expected a little more but nonetheless, it's a must try for everyone.

Reviews.Author: Alyse R.
Reviews.Content: Always a go to spot when out in Hollywood.Chicken and waffles make a great combination. And roscoes really knows how to do it right. Every time I go the waffles are cooked perfectly. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the flavor combination is just bonkers. The Mac n cheese is pretty good too. It's true. They do have long lines, especially right after the bars close. But what can you expect for such amazing food? After being seated, I've never had to wait long for my food or drinks.

Reviews.Author: Margarita L.
Reviews.Content: Best chicken and waffles ever.  Service is quick, food is fresh , the chicken comes out hot and super juicy. Our waiter Angel was perfect, even suggested a better deal, filled up drinks, and was on top of everything. Not only a famous spot, but constantly great.There's something about the waffles and syrup combined with undertones of cinnamon and vanilla that make it absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Author: Steven R.
Reviews.Content: what else needs to be said about roscoes

Reviews.Author: Micki B.
Reviews.Content: This place is my mecca. It's always poppin', so be prepared to wait. But, your patience will be well-rewarded. Food comes out really quick and the staff is all friendly. I haven't branched out much on the menu, but as the name proclaims, this is THE place for chicken and waffles. I usually get the Obama Special (3 wings and a waffle) or just order #18 (a leg or thigh and waffle) and then add another waffle to it. Carol C. Special is popular among my friends, but I prefer dark meat. The chicken is perfection. It's hot with a profound crisp on the outside that doesn't get soggy or hard, and inside the meat is moist and juicy. I like to pour on everything I can, and don't hold back from dunking your chicken in syrup or hot sauce. It's an experience. You will feel your arteries clog as you eat, but it's so worth it. And your body will beg for more.

Reviews.Author: Megan B.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it. I totally admit that I don't eat chicken, but I still think their other food should be good, right? Plus, my family had their classic combo and they weren't too blown away either. It was funny cause we sat down and the waitress immediately asked where we were from and assumed we were tourists, so I guess it's a tourist spot though we're local to LA. We went for father's day and we got a variety of food: chicken + wafflesscoe'schef's saladmac n cheese + greenshouse combo #3 frieslemonade sweet teaThe food came fast and hot and the service was good. I couldn't believe that my mac n cheese and greens were $5 sides and in such small dishes, though! I got sweet tea and it was definitely sweet and I ended up adding water to mine (probably sacrilegious) to dilute it. The salad wasn't bad, fries were fresh and homemade, and mac n cheese was nice and flavorful. The greens were too bitter and salty unfortunately for my taste. Highlights are their candied yams (sweet but delicious), waffles (so fluffy and light yet crispy), and corn bread (light and flavorful). I can't say I'd go back, but I was happy to go and make family happy! If I did, I'd probably just order a waffle!!! Overpriced for basic food, though I could never complain over a lack of flavor! I think I'm just not cut out for this kind of food.Also, parking isn't too bad, just have to walk a few blocks.

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: Took about a half an hour to be seated and had to drive around the block to find a parking spot. Inside Roscoe's has a strange dim light setting which is odd at first, but you get used to it. The food came quickly, I got the thigh + waffle + an extra thigh. My wife got the Obama. The waffle was very good, I wish I would have ordered a combo which contained two. However, the chicken was greasy and salty. My wife's wings were a little dry on the inside and greasy on the outside. My disappointment is due to my love for fried chicken. This particular fried chicken wasn't anything special and I don't feel would be worth returning when I come back to town just for the chicken. Definitely a good place to get some waffles, though.

Reviews.Author: Charlie C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing.

Reviews.Author: Jacob H.
Reviews.Content: Not too sure what the fuss is all about here. It was just ok. The best thing here was the Gravy. I've had food in the south and this just doesn't compare. The chicken was extremely dry and the fries were limp. I really wanted to like this place but after that meal I don't think I'll come back. That gravy though.. dang.. it's the saving grace of this place.

Reviews.Author: Errol W.
Reviews.Content: Great food fast service believe the hype. Chicken and waffles what a great combination. Savory chicken set off with sweet syrup and crunchy waffle it was great. I had the scoe's 1/4 southern style chicken and waffle. Wife and kids had the Obama special 3 wings and a waffle. I was also surprised by the other offerings on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Christine N.
Reviews.Content: Who would have thought to put chicken and waffles together in one place? The crispy chicken with the soft waffle is a genius combo! The wait can get pretty ridiculous so it's better to go early or pick other eating times unless you don't mind the wait. But the food is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Wiseley F.
Reviews.Content: Similar to my review for Roscoe's in Long Beach (yelp.com/biz/roscoes-hou…), I've gotta say that this one is much better.  Just a few things to consider: 1) This location is relatively smaller than the others. Expect a long wait during normal meal hours. If it's convenient, have someone arrive early to put down your name because they don't accept reservations2) Do NOT park at the shopping plaza across the street (they have security checking)2a) There are numerous meter parking spots along the nearby streets3) Make sure to check out the special of the day! The deals are amazing!!4) Do NOT bring the leftovers home! It's not the same!Other than that, I suggest you order any combination of chicken and waffles and dig in. Mac n cheese is also a good idea but it comes in a tiny portion.

Reviews.Author: Shanno N.
Reviews.Content: Well I live within walking distance to one, and although I haven't been so much where security knows me by name, I'm getting there. However, I have been here enough times where I can now eliminate the fries, potatoes, rice, and mac & cheese. My surefire meal: -#13 Carol C's Special (1 chicken breast+waffle) $10.40-Cornbread $2.80Yep, it's nuts I pay that for cornbread, but it's sure not something I would make myself so I might as well treat when it's available, and when I know it's going to be good. In addition to everything being packaged neatly, they give you a little white bag that has a few syrups, hot sauce and a butter. I have been to Roscoe's only about five times since I've been out here, and I keep kicking myself on delaying my visits. My excuse used to be the distance to locations, but that reason is no longer valid.  Service has been consistently decent, and I hope to not let more time pass between my next visit.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: First off, parking sucks so just be prepared to search the surrounding neighborhood for a space. The service is extremely fast, our chicken and waffles were brought to us within 5 mins of ordering. Chicken was crispy, moist and well-seasoned. The waffle was so delicious, almost tasted like a funnel cake. The Mac and cheese was amazing and really cheesy, although it was $5 for a tiny side.This place is a staple of Los Angeles and a definite must try for both locals and tourists.

Reviews.Author: Judy H.
Reviews.Content: As a New Yorker visiting the West Coast, I had gotten multiple recommendations for Roscoe's. Needless to say, there was a lot of hype going to the Hollywood location. My friend and I arrived at Roscoe's early Sunday evening (roughly around 6) and were lucky enough to be seated within 15 minutes.I ordered the Carol C special - "one succulent breast and one delicious waffle", the menu proclaimed. The waffle was crispy, though a bit thinner than I would've liked. The chicken breast was in fact succulent, but I couldn't taste much flavoring. While both items were not bad, they're little more than standard fare and not worth the hype - honestly, I've had much better in New York. This is a great experience for visitors and tourists, but I just don't see this being a place I would consistently frequent.

Reviews.Author: Kristin H.
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations! We went on a Saturday morning around 11:00 a.m., found free parking up the street, and got in after less than five minutes of waiting. The service was very fast too--our chicken arrived within 10 minutes of ordering, and it was very hot and fresh. Definitely didn't sit under a warmer. The chicken was fantastic, the syrup and gravy were both flavorful, the mac and cheese was very homey, the waffle was good, and the waitress was super friendly.We only came because of this place's reputation. I feel like we had some sort of charmed, fluke experience, because all of the other reviews said we'd be waiting for an hour. I don't think it would have been worth an hour wait, but considering we got in so quickly, it was a thoroughly pleasant  experience. I probably won't be coming back any time soon (kind of a "been there done that" experience) but I'm glad we went.

Reviews.Author: Jenna T.
Reviews.Content: Whats the hype? I don't get it. Okay the waffle is good, the Mac and cheese is yummy, and the chicken is fried perfectly. Being a huge brunch/lunch person, I rather sit in a nice brunch spot than wait for a selection of different variations of chicken and waffles. A hour wait is not worth it to me. Staff is friendly and somewhat attentive. I don't have any complaints about the staff. Just not worth the hype.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: The food here was delicious as always. I always get the Carol C. Special because that's all I can really eat, it's a chicken breast and a waffle. The chicken was good, a little bit dry, but the waffle was amazingly delicious.

Reviews.Author: Alice L.
Reviews.Content: During my trip to LA, I had to make a stop here after hearing so much about it. Luckily, there was no line when we went. There was a sign outside claiming they had one of the best mac and cheese in town so I had to try that. Among the 3 of us, we ordered the #2 Scoe's (with gravy and onions), the Obama Special, and a side of mac and cheese.This place was such a disappoint and was an example of how chicken and waffles shouldn't be. It was like I ordered chicken with waffles on the side, and chicken AND waffles should be more of a union. The chicken wasn't bad although I didn't feel like there was a lot of gravy. The waffle was good, I'll give it that. The mac and cheese is definitely far from being the best I've had and such a waste of $5 for such a tiny amount. The Obama special was alright also but just overall, the chicken here just did not stand out to me.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy M.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS. I thought waffles and fried chicken sounded weird, but the combo is great. Need to head back here soon. It's been a long time.

Reviews.Author: Matt J.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is, they do what they do and do it well. The waffles are great, the chicken is good. Where loose fitting pants (non skinny jeans) and a loose fitting shirt and get busy while you here. Worry about working out later. This place and business is certified!

Reviews.Author: Shakeel T.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for years every time I'm in LA I make a stop here.  My personalFavorite the Obama ha ha right?It's just right and of course don't forget the Corn Bread

Reviews.Author: Venus B.
Reviews.Content: No complaints I got the number 1 with a biscuit. Delicious and satisfying. Surely returning each time I visit LA.

Reviews.Author: Karen R.
Reviews.Content: Had to try the legendary Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. Defiantly lived up to all the hype! The Mac-N-Cheese is a must!!!The portion was so much. Couldn't finish the whole plate. Wish I had shared with my friend. Watch out. You'll want everything on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Tariq P.
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the woman below Roscoes is falling off dramatically. My service from my waitress was poor and rushed. My water had a piece of hair in it and I asked for plastic silverware and was DENIED the silverware. My waffle was FAIR but my omelette was so sloppy that I couldn't stand to eat it. My date became ill from the meal and next thing you know I see Trina the rapper come in and she is waiting on her food 20 mins and she called it in ahead of time.I think this establishment is running on its name and sadly the name will only get you so far! New management is need my experience was terrible Id pick Gladys and Ron's (which isn't much better) over Roscoes any day!

Reviews.Author: Velvette W.
Reviews.Content: completely impressed! great service, fast fast fast service! and of course sooo yummy!!! it was my inlaws first time there and they were so happy!! i can't wait to come back :)

Reviews.Author: E ..
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles  - Hollywood.First of all, I am sure I got exactly what I was supposed too..We got a whole bunch of chicken and waffles and greens,and it was good. We had Syrup,Grits, Cornbread and butter.I very rarely drink Beer while I eat, I like Iced Tea or Coffee.The food, was well, whatever, I wanted to see Snoop Dog,so we should of gone to the Long Beach location.During our meal one group of Crips looking gangsters,got some take out, but other then that it was just yourstandard Hollywood transvestites and homeless folk andhookers milling about, Boulevard of Broken dreams...The Chicken was OK, but no better or worse then any random Dayton's visit (Dayton's is an OCMD Boardwalk Fried Chicken)If I was hungry for Chicken, it's doubtful I would go back.

Reviews.Author: Dillan T.
Reviews.Content: Hate to rain on the parade but the chicken and waffles were ok, nothing special.Good: potato salad and waffles.Bad: long wait outside, sketchy building, fried chicken was bland

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and the waffles are amazing! Seriously the best I've ever had! But the cornbread sucks and the collard greens are just so-so. fun place but not my favorite

Reviews.Author: Boku S.
Reviews.Content: Fuck you , killing then game, game killed . Best chicken n waffle place I've been to yet. You know its good when you see 25 different nationalities eating here.  Whoever Roscoe is. I wanna shake his hand.

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to try chicken and waffles the way it was intended to be served. Came here early in the morning and the services was fast. Waitress and staff were extra friendly. i ordered just chicken and waffles with all dark meat. The Chicken was good, but nothing great. All the seasonings were good and nice and juicy. The waffle was barely cooked and was really soggy. Tho the combination of flavors was awesome - i wish the waffle was crispy and fluffy in the middle. They might be better off just serving their chicken with eggo waffles. Overall i would come back and order it again. Roscoe's is the biggest brand name in chicken and waffles industry!

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: Yay..I'm review #2000. My girlfriend picked the place. I was wanting a breakfast burrito. But it was only fair for me to give this place a try. So I wasn't really too impressed. I went for the eggs, chicken sausage, biscuit and grits. The two sausage patties were small and heavily fried. The biscuit tasted old and combined a sponginess on one side and a hard chunk on the other. My girlfriend liked her meal though as she selected the chicken and waffle combo. The breast was large but the waffle looked pretty average. I guess there is only so much you can do with a waffle. With a zillion choices to eat in Hollywood I think I will seek out other options next time.

Reviews.Author: UE C.
Reviews.Content: 1) 2 orders of 1/2 fried chicken with waffles -  nothing special :/ I personally think Popeyes fried chicken tastes so much better and the waffles were so plain  - $40 2) Mac n cheese - tasted just like one of those instant microwaveable Mac n cheese u can get from super market  - $6 3) biscuit - :/ - 80 cents 4) corn bread - not the worst but not the best I've ever tried - $4 5) their speciality drinks - lemonade with fruit punch, lemonade with oj - way too sweet, feltl like we were just drinking syrup - $12 6) 20 mins wait - the wait time was too not long coz we came at 3 pm SaturdayOverall, I will never go back here, overrated ! Overpriced! Subpar service ! Nothing special ! I really don't get what all the hype is about. $70 for lunch at this place is pretty absurd. Some of the best brunch places I've had don't even cost this much!

Reviews.Author: Daniel A.
Reviews.Content: Don't go if you hate to wait to be seated.. waitress came, took order.. but to wait 32 mins to get your drinks.. and people walking in after you have already received their order. Some leaving.. this place sucks for their service..

Reviews.Author: Bea Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is a must try if you are visiting Los Angeles. We went on a Tuesday morning for breakfast. There is plenty of street parking and note that every parking meter accepts credit card on the meter itself. The parking is not expense (compared to NYC). The place is large with 2 rooms for seating. We were greeted right by the door and got seated right away (the place is not packed but for a Tuesday morning, you wonder how come no one is working).The waiter was nice and friendly. The decor of the restaurant is old school all wooden everything and with pictures of President Obama everywhere. It's dark inside also. We ordered:Scoe's #1 (southern style)Scoe's #2 (with gravy)2 coffees (strong and good)We let our toddler son eat the waffles and he nom that down really quick. The waffles tastes good even when it's cold. The chicken is crispy and juice. I liked the gravy but next time, will probably just go with no gravy. Huge portion and we were definitely stuffed at the end of the meal.Will definitely come again if we are every in the area.

Reviews.Author: Era W.
Reviews.Content: First time I have ever been here. Boy have I been missing out!!! Went out with my friends after going to a club. DECOR: Its a hole-in-the-wall place, but most of those places have the BEST food.SERVICE: Our Waitress was friendly and cool and the service was very prompt!FOOD: I had the #18, a Chicken Leg and Waffle, It was soooo delicious!! The Chicken was perfect and the waffle was DELISH!!! Definitely will be coming back here with my friends!

Reviews.Author: Tish B.
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Cali! And this staple was on my list! OMG! So GOOD! The waffle was so soft & the chicken was perfectly cooked. We got our food in no time and the chicken was hot....my sister had the ice tea lemonade and it was so good! We should have taken some to GO!

Reviews.Author: Maria M.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best fried chicken & waffles combination ever, portions are generous and service is great, very close to hollywood and the walk of fame etc if you're visiting LA.

Reviews.Author: Yiv G.
Reviews.Content: Scoe's waffles have a magical secret ingredient and the chicken is the best fried chicken in the world. Get an Obama special - 3 wings and a waffle. YUM!

Reviews.Author: Liz J.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently ate at this Roscoe's location while on vacation. Though we saw many reviews about long wait times, we were seated quickly. We each ordered the 2 waffles and 1/4 chicken with onion gravy, the chicken was smothered in a very good homestyle gravy. The waffles were okay, nothing amazing, though the cinnamon syrup does add nice flavor. We will definitely eat here again. Our only real complaint is the lack of parking during certain hours.

Reviews.Author: Gayle R.
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk right in and be seated.  The gentleman at the door had a great big smile and hello and took us right in.  Every meal was the best.  We all had a bite here and there of each others'.  The collard green are the best I've ever tasted...Gravy smooth as silk.   Chicken crispy and moist....waffle's plumb and crisp. A GOOD cup of coffee and the meal was perfect.  We would go back.  xoxox

Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: This place seems like it's a punchline, because of its name but it's actually really good. The chicken is no joke and the waffles melt in the saliva of your watery mouth. They actually also have some healthy options like chicken salad. I've even had sandwiches here, which don't get a lot of publicity. A must try is the macaroni and cheese. It is one of the best mac and cheese dishes I've had that doesn't include add-ons like lobster. The cool thing about this place is that they also serve beer and they're open late on the weekends. I feel like they know they're a tourist attraction so they embrace what they have become and many people often are taking pictures inside and outside. Unfortunately there isn't a lot of parking in the area directly in front of the restaurant so you may have to scour the surrounding metered spots for a few minutes. And because it is a tourist attraction, expect a long wait. It's OK though, because it will be worth the chicken.

Reviews.Author: Jenn M.
Reviews.Content: order the chicken and waffles.don't question why it's the perfect combination.use ALL of the syrup

Reviews.Author: Casey R.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to try a Roscoe's for quite a while. I finally had the opportunity to go to their Hollywood location last week. We got there around 11 on a Sunday and were seated right away. When we left we noticed there was a line around the block. So I guess get here early on the weekends.Our waitress was really friendly and I ordered the 3 wing combo with a side of greens. My wife ordered a waffle with a side of chicken sausage. The fried wings were good and rank up with some of the best I've had however I know a place closer to home that are just a good and much cheaper. The side of greens lacked flavor. It didn't have much salt, tang or heat I'm used to having in my greens. My wife's waffle was good but nothing amazing. It has a mild cinnamon flavor to it. Her chicken sausage was very tasty even though it looked like petrified dung. Overall the meal was A-OK but I probably wouldn't come back. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I'm not sure if the prices are this high at other Roscoe's or if it's only this location. I'd imagine the rent at this location is very high.Note: They don't take AMEX.

Reviews.Author: Ray W.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a must-go for whenever I'm in LA. Regardless of which Roscoe's I go to, the chicken and waffles are always on point. I usually get the Scoe's with 1/2 Chix smothered with gravy and two waffles on the side. I must admit, I never end up finishing it. It's a very big portion but the 1/4 Chix simply isn't enough. The chicken is fried to perfection and falls right off the bone. I don't know how they make the gravy but it is the most delicious gravy I've ever had. I almost want to scoop it off the plate and eat it by itself. The waffles however could use some work. They tend to be a tad soggy and are not as crispy as I would prefer. However, I come here for the chicken, the waffles are simply a plus.The service would be my only complaint. There have been many times where I sat around waiting for 15 or more minutes before a waiter came to take my order and once they bring me my food, they go about their business and never check in to refill my drink. I understand they are busy but it would be nice if they checked in at least once during my meal.Overall, it's a great place if you love some good chicken.

Reviews.Author: Mario P.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes is one favorite place to go when I go to Los Angeles I love the the number 1 with waffles and chicken Breast of course, but the service was mediocre. I would say believe the hype it's delicious.

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: What can be said about Roscoe's that hasn't been said already. If you're a tourist in Hollywood then you've got to experience this Roscoe's right here. This spot is as legendary as The Walk of Fame.

Reviews.Author: Lupita R.
Reviews.Content: Had the special of the day which was a waffle and two drumsticks and it was delicious! First time there and I will definitely go back. We tried the cornbread and the mac and cheese but weren't as satisfied with it. The rest of the meal was amazing though and the prices were great for our budget.

Reviews.Author: Amy S.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in here to bring some friend's who were visiting from out of town. We got there around 4pm so it wasn't crowded and we were seated right away. I ordered the thigh and waffle with a side of gravy. The table for a side of mac n cheese and greens to split. The food came out very quickly. The portions are HUMONGOUS so watch how much you are ordering.My chicken was very tender and juicy and the coating was nice and crispy. The waffle is light and fluffy and super delicious. The mac and cheese was nice and the greens too. Everyone was very very happy with their food. The service was very friendly and the price very reasonable.The only issue is the parking... we spent about 20 minutes driving around before we found street parking.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: This food was so good. Chicken was so juicy and amazing. Waffles were alright. I got the iced tea and it was also terrific. Staff was suuuper friendly I loved everyone. The menu seemed a little overwhelming at first so I had to look at it for a while. Its a bit pricey but it was worth it to at least try it. They ended up getting super busy so careful what time you go at. Parking was hard to find here.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn V.
Reviews.Content: Do I really need to write a review here? Let me just emphasize the good. If you are craving crispy fried chicken...this is the place. If you are craving a crispy waffle...this isn't the place.If you are craving good mac and cheese...this could be the place.You can eat the chicken and waffles anyway you want. Make it into a waffle sandwich or drizzle syrup all over the chicken or add some gravy. YUM!-Give it a try!

Reviews.Author: Ashley O.
Reviews.Content: Another place introduced by coworkers.. Seriously the best chicken I've ever tasted.. And the waffles omfg. I can't even begin to explain how GOOOOOD they are . Prices are good too.

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: What happened here at this Hollywood location? Am I spoiled for going to Pasadena or Pico location? It was Friday night around 8, early for the Friday party rush, we got our table quickly but the inside of the restaurant was soooo cold. A table that came after us boxed up their food and leave soon after they got it since she was too cold to enjoy the food.I had Scoe's #1, 2 piece dark meat w 2 waffles, chicken were super brown and the waffles lack that wholesome aroma and were dry. I also had a side of liver, crunchy fired but lack of flavor and must eat while still hot. The rest of the party had Jenni Joan  omelet and more chicken and waffles, didn't hear any complain. The service thou was really slow our waiter also had tables on the other side of the restaurant and we had to wait extra long just to ask him for some Tabasco and ofcourse he brought the red rooster. When we finally got the right hot sauce we asked for the fried chk was already cold. Not to mention the there was about 5 drops of it in the bottle he slammed on the table which was gone as soon as he walked away and we hair to wait for his gracious return to ask for more. Same story with ordering second round of drinks. Survey said the number one complaints in restaurant is waiting to pay & leave and this is the case here. We waited and waited after we were done to get our check. Growing up around this neighborhood and watching Everything evolved for the better, this Roscoe's is a big bummer to me. I'll take the extra drive to the other locations instead.

Reviews.Author: Christina D.
Reviews.Content: I like hot, crunchy-on-the-outside-soft-and-chewy-on-the-­inside waffles and flavorful, crunchy fried chicken. Roscoe's offered neither of these. Maybe their quality control folks leave at midnight, and we came around 2 AM. I can understand they may be a little lack luster about the food at, say, 3:45 AM, but two hours before closing?? Seriously? Everything on my plate was flavorless (except the syrup), the biscuits were dry, and both the chicken and waffle were cold and soggy. Not to mention it was overpriced for the excuse of chicken and waffles they served. You're paying for the hype here, because I'm damn sure you're not paying for the ambiance-- it's not in the best area and it's down right dirty, unless having their menus coated in maple syrup is part of the gimmick.

Reviews.Author: Holly R.
Reviews.Content: Good food! (I actually like the one in Oakland, ca more. Better flavored chicken and a wider menu selection)Their waffles are soooo delicious! The greens are really good too! If you're in the area I would recommend going by for sure!

Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: It's an LA institution. Much like Pink's, Carney's, and Mel's; Roscoe's is one of THOSE places that when you have friends from out of town come you eat there - There isn't anything I could say that's new.- Waffles are thin, but flavorful and match so well with the fried chicken.- The prices are a little high for fried chicken and waffles ($13)- The specials are the best price- Order their fried giblets (they are delicious)- The staff are nice- If you see a line outside, keep driving cause that line will take forever to get in.I gave this place a 3 star because the prices are high for what it is. The flavors are great, but they're not better than many other waffles I've had with fried chicken. And I really really have to be in the mood or close proximity to Roscoe's to go and get it.

Reviews.Author: Marjorie U.
Reviews.Content: One word to describe this place "hype."  The chicken is just ok. It wasn't really memorable. I find the fried chicken bland. The good: It's crispy and not greasy.  The gravy was thick and bland.  The waffle's good I give you that but that's basically it.  I'm just glad I didn't have to wait hours for a bland chicken. If you're in a group expect to wait for a long time but if it's just the two of you, then waiting is not really an issue.  I guess I was just expecting that I'll be in "chicken heaven." Sadly, it didn't really happen. Service is good though.

Reviews.Author: Robbie M.
Reviews.Content: Chicken is a hit or miss. The waffles is consistently good.

Reviews.Author: Candy R.
Reviews.Content: Which came first, the fried chicken or the golden waffle?I really don't care, I'm just happy they both made it! Yep, you guessed it! This is the original Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles! PROS:--- Where else can you go and order fried chicken and waffles as a plate and not get stared at? Yeah, I didn't think so! It's okay, you're safe here. I ordered the Obama Special aka #9 on the menu which consisted of three fried chicken wings and a well rounded waffle with a very, very generous tablespoon of whipped butter and maple syrup. The waffle was so fluffy and rich and the chicken wings were fried to perfection. --- According to CBS Los Angeles, they have the "best" Mac & Cheese in town! Honestly, I must agree. I ordered a side of it and I was in ooey gooey, cheesy heaven. Try it!--- Their gravy, is a nice consistency and delicious and goes super well with the chicken! Try this combo, now!--- Freshly squeezed O.J., enough said.--- Don't fret, this isn't the only location, so if waiting is not your game check out their other locations. They have chains. CONS:--- Be prepared to wait for this delicious concoction. Luckily, my boyfriend and I didn't have to wait but I hear that's not always the case so just be ready; but have hopes that you'll make it in because you will. Stay positive. --- Staying positive is a huge attribute when it comes to parking! That's right, folks, street parking it is. Ugh, this can be such a headache just stay positive and be patient. Well, at least try. Overall, I could see myself going back everyday. However, my tummy can't handle all that fat, 24/7, like I wish I could but that doesn't mean I can't go back again one more time, or twice, or three times...

Reviews.Author: Sherry J.
Reviews.Content: I ordered Scoe's #1 and it was okay. The waffle was above average, but my chicken was really dry. Being a place with "Chicken and Waffles" in it's name, those two specific items better be on point. Sadly, it was not. I think this place has just become one of those "must-visit" restaurants if you are in town- maybe even on the verge of becoming toursy.

Reviews.Author: Glenn C.
Reviews.Content: I first ate here in the 1980's.  I hadn't been for a while until today, when I was free for lunch and within a 20 minute drive. I love this place. Mostly, I love the waffles. These are the best waffles I've ever had. I usually get the Carol C.  The chicken breast is always huge and tasty, and the one waffle is usually enough.  But not today - one waffle was not enough. I had to order another waffle because it was so good.Service is always excellent here. I've seen a few celebs here over the years so if you're into that you might like that too. I've always been lucky with finding a place to park along Gower north of the restaurant. Don't forget to feed the meter - LA parking cops are quick.

Reviews.Author: Siddharth G.
Reviews.Content: More hype than deserved. It's a great place for munchies but thats about it. Don't know if I'll come here for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy S.
Reviews.Content: this place sucks ,the chicken was so bad  fake butter fake maple syrup  canned patatoescrap crap ,eat her and you will not be able to crap,,, KFC chicken taste 10 times better go to kFC get you food then go sit in this place hide the box if they see your KFC stuff They might be like  ,,what the heck you doing ,, had a chicken leg here the went to KFC had a leg ,,the leg from KFC was so gooooooooood  next to this junk ,,,,I feel sorry for the folks who think this is good grub  ,, god help them because they can not help themselves,, the people were nice inside because I was giving them my money ,,, bama thinks this chickens good ,,,,joke

Reviews.Author: Tiffany J.
Reviews.Content: I've always loved this place, unfortunately my recent visit was not so enjoyable. Because of the language barrier, it was hard to understand our server. I would assume that it was tough for her to completely understand us as well because our order was incorrect. I'm feeling like there was a change in management, recipes, or both. The food was bland and after it was dropped off we never saw our server again. The guy at the register nearly snatched the bill out of my hand because he was in such a rush and he never ONCE looked up at me. I CAN say that I was happy about my diet coke. They no longer serve you a can soda. WOO HOO!I hate to give bad reviews but Roscoes just didn't cut it this time around :( really disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came for lunch after a nice long hike .. And roscoes was basically heaven. Maybe we were just really hungry ? Chicken and waffles: simple and delicious, eat the chicken with some hot sauce to balance out the heaviness. We also ordered a side of collard greens and potato salad which went great with our meal. Fried liver: so good ! I think it's cooked in the same batter as the fried chicken, generous portion, and very yummy. Parking is a bit of a pain, and the service is pretty slow...but if you're in the mood for chicken and waffles, there's no place better to go !!

Reviews.Author: Phil K.
Reviews.Content: I live in Fairfield, CA & we were driving through LA & we thought we'd try this very hyped location for chicken & waffles. Upon arriving the exterior was different from what we expected. We were greeted by the door by a gentlemen who was very welcoming. He brought us to our seat. The diner had an all american vintage feel. It smelt good. There was a good mix of people there..The food.. OMG! The chicken was like I've never tasted. Brown gravy, waffles & a soda.. Simple but delicious. We even bought thirst on the way out.We need more simplistic great food diners like this in Cali! Go ROSCOE'S!!

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: Definitely hits the spot when you are hungry. I got basic 2 waffles with white meat fries chicken. The combination of syrup, savory chicken, waffles, and a bit of hot sauce is something to crave! I usually hate unhealthy food but coming here after the Hollywood hike,  I found myself loving every bite. If I had to pick, the chicken is the best part for how crispy it is. Finger linking good!

Reviews.Author: Anna K. S.
Reviews.Content: You have to try this, even if just for the novelty of it. What's not to love about fried chicken? What's not to love about a good crispy but soft waffle with syrup? What's not to love about pouring gravy over all of that combined? You will have to judge for yourself whether you like that marriage, or if it makes your lip curl. I liked it.I, personally, love gravy over everything, everything! But I've been here, done that, decades ago, and haven't been back since. It's not a meal you can eat regularly unless you're 15 with a metabolism like a runner. Just sayin...

Reviews.Author: Meg B.
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is an LA staple. You come to LA and you probably think, "I must go to In N Out for the first time." No, no, sir -- you MUST go to Roscoe's! Yes the line is long, parking sucks, and you'll likely wait more just to get your food, but the greasy deliciousness that awaits is like your mouth has been personally introduced to the most glorious experience it will ever experience. I highly recommend it, and I also say get an appetizer of mac and cheese. Oh, and all you need is one chicken breast and a waffle - there's a lot of food in just that, and you won't leave hungry!Atmosphere looks like it hasn't been updated since it opened - lol - but other than the strange flimsy menu and lack of modern decor, I love this place. Obviously I can't go often because I value my arteries, but I will be back at some point!

Reviews.Author: Paul G.
Reviews.Content: Yum!  Great soul food at good prices.  Beware on a hot busy afternoon.  Waiting out side is HOT!  Def worth a try.  #yum

Reviews.Author: Justin R.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed eating here.  I was living in the Ventura county area at the time of my last visit.  A friend and I decided to take a mini road trip to try this place out.  It was worth the drive!  I loved the food, but to be honest, it's so filling we couldn't even finish our plates.  Go on an empty stomach, and bring a friend to drive you home, because you will want to take a nap afterward for sure.

Reviews.Author: Shane W.
Reviews.Content: Extremely fast preparation, great staff, and hardly had to wait for the food to come out. The meal was nothing short of amazing. BELIEVE THE HYPE. Some of the menu items are a bit overpriced but still worth every penny. Only con is the parking. It is street parking only, and the parking lot next to Roscoe's will tow if you park there for the restaurant. The street parking woes, though, should be expected given the location.Overall, a very good southern style restaurant. There was a lot to live up to, but they definitely surpassed my expectations. I recommend.

Reviews.Author: Judy V.
Reviews.Content: Fried chicken and waffles at 3 in the morning?!?! YES!!!I wanted to try Roscoe's for a long time and have heard of the long wait. So one night, my friends and I decided to get some. We ended up driving to another location (GPS fail moment) and met the manager or owner, he told us they were closed but to go over to their Hollywood location. The manager or owner was really nice and charming. We got there and the place was still busy, not packed or with a long line outside, but still a lot of people eating. Took our order back to our hotel to chow down on some chicken & waffles..OMGGG!! What is this?? The waffles was good, but not life changing. The chicken is like .....sooo....freakin'......delicious!!! It's juicy, crispy, and if you dip it in the hot sauce, its like heaven in your mouth! Even we drove all over and had to go to another location in the wee-hours of the morning, just having to eat the chicken was all worth it! BTW, their mac and cheese is pretty good too.
Reviews.Author_Location: Alum Rock/East Foothills, San Jose, CA

Reviews.Author: KJ R.
Reviews.Content: Price was reasonable. I could've ordered more if I wanted to but this time, It was just enough for me. Of all the Roscoe locations i have been to, this is by far the best and most consistent when it comes to service and quality of food. I ordered #13 and I was satisfied with it. If you're not familiar with the area, expect parking to be a bit of a challenge.

Reviews.Author: Nina S.
Reviews.Content: I always have both the fried chicken and the waffle. Perhaps it's the excuse to put syrup on the chicken. Try the greens and you will have less guilt after eating the fried chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Luciana C.
Reviews.Content: I'd never tried Chicken and Waffles before this - and was extremely wary. But, this experience was great! (The cool decor reminded me of being inside a Breaking Bad adventure).I'm not into fried food, but I had the fried chicken and it was tasty (tried to stick to the inside meat and succeeded as it was plentiful). The Buckwheat Waffles were awesome and not cardboardy in the slightest. The sides were good too (cornbread the best, collard greens a little salty).4 stars for a Chicken and Waffles newbie. The only downfall was that I wasn't that filled, since I tried too hard not to splurge.

Reviews.Author: AJ Y.
Reviews.Content: Man oh man oh man!!!!!Haven't eaten here in years!!!! 2001 I think was the last time I've had their food. So YUMMY!!Service: 4.5 StarWe were greeted right away.  Taken to our seats in the back. And given a menu.  Our server/waitress was Rose.  Real cute little old lady.  Very sweet and polite.  We ordered the item that we wanted and she made sure she had our order correct.Food: 4.5 StarBig Mamma Special (Scrambled eggs delicately mixed with onions & cheese, served with potatoes smothered in gravy & biscuit) = It'll put you to sleep but freaking good!!Side of Greens = Love it!2 pieces of Corn Bread = Super delicsh!!!!!My brother from another mother had:1/2 Chicken Smothered with Gravy & Onions with 2 Waffles = WOWOWOW  super delicsh with the waffles and the syrup.  I know the chicken was good because he ate it all up, bite for bite, piece by piece.  Grits = Texture and fairly yummy (Viewed only.  Brother finished it) LOL2 Arnold Palmer drinks (ice tea and lemonade) = Refreshing (ask for more lemonade than ice tea) Overall this place deserves a 4.5 Star.We are definitely coming back.  Need to try the rest of the menu!!!!!!!Thank you my brother for the great idea for lunch!!!! Till the next time!

Reviews.Author: Kailin D.
Reviews.Content: I was a regular for quite sometime at the location in Pasadena, and so  it was no surprise to me that this place is great. Our server was really nice and brought me samples before I ordered to help me make my decision. Also, everyone working was just generally very nice and respectful. The food was amazing as always, except i didn't really enjoy the cornbread this time around. But you win some you loose some. Everything else was fantastic!

Reviews.Author: Cecilè C.
Reviews.Content: Like my good buddy A.J. says, it was overwhelmingly good.  I too haven't had the food in a while but it was fresh, fast, and yumE... Best part was the conversation between us, and just enjoying time/space.Rose, the waitress was delightful, and had her business with us on point.  We had an eavesdropper who had to come over and make friendly, mainly because A.J. was in Uniform and is a woman magnet... But that lasted until she had to breakaway (thank G') no, playing..Back to Roscoes, the food was good, service like I said was really good, and overall you get Roscoe's for its comfort!  If you have NOT been in a while, you should stop reading and get your comfy on.--go

Reviews.Author: Mironda R.
Reviews.Content: I hate yo life! I love your fried chicken. I love it so much I bumped you to 4 stars, when in actuality you should be a 3.. It's probably because I love your fried chicken.So yes folks, that's exactly how I feel about this place. Waiting 60 minutes for your table, having the person who passed by you a hunnid times without saying one word is your server, looking around to see see folks who arrived after you already eating, and then trying to close out the check. It's either cash and 1 card or split on 2 cards.. So 2 payment types are your option.. so bring cash or let someone put it on their card and get reimbursed.So that aside, let's talk about my food. I got the #22 House Combo with 2 thighs, collard greens, mac n cheese, and hot water cornbread and a side of candied yams. The collard greens and mac n cheese were average to me. The cornbread and chicken was FIYAH.. and the yams were like eating a bowl of dessert.. sweet goodness, but I only needed 2-3 pieces for a good fix. Let's take a few words to focus on the chicken -- the skin was seasoned and friend to perfection. The thigh was the perfect bit of juicy and the size was fair. Oh the chicken.One last takeaway.. While it's great to sit with your group, groups of 2 and 3 sat MUCH quicker than large groups. consider breaking your group up to get in and out.

Reviews.Author: Heather J.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good! I think I thought it was going to be amazing though because so many people rant and rave about it. Everything tasted good but the service was pretty bad. I get that they are busy but I waited tables for 3 years and they broke the number 1 rule! you never leave glasses of water empty :( I have the patience to wait and the understanding from being a server but we pretty much went through the whole meal with no water!!! So I was gonna give a 4 but I have to do 3 for the no water thing!!!

Reviews.Author: Brittany R.
Reviews.Content: I've been hesitant to write this review because it may cause me to be emotional... you see I moved back to Texas after having eaten here only one time. I believe that is a sin. This was one of the first dishes I ate after being a vegetarian for 11 months and I couldn't believe I went through so much of my life without coming here. Thank you man on the corner for suggesting this place. Hands down the juiciest, crunchiest, chicken and sweetest cinnamon waffles I've ever eaten. Even their packaged syrup was perfect, how did they do that!? I've tried them at other places nothing comes close to comparing...I need a return trip to L.A. asap.

Reviews.Author: Lorena C.
Reviews.Content: Duh it's Roscoes and it's delicious. I love their Chicken and Waffles. I think their waffles taste like Churros and I am addicted to Churros! I love their Mac n Cheese. I always get either the Sunrise or Sunset drink. This is must if you haven't been.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: Nope. Never again will I return to this location. I'm assuming with all the hype this place has, the service doesn't need to be outstanding, but here it was absolutely terrible.We showed up here after catching a show at Pantages. First, there is no hostess at the door. There is a security guard. The set-up is very weird..I almost felt like I had to show my ID to get in at Roscoe's. The place seemed small, but afterwards I realized that there are two separate rooms. Bare bones kind of place, which is fine. I wasn't expecting much. Our waitress finally comes over. No greeting. Just a, "you guys ready?" Why yes, yes we are. Because we've been sitting here for 15 minutes so we've had plenty of time to figure out everything. She's in a rush. I get it. It's Friday late night and it's busy. I get that too. I'm not looking to be your best friend, but some courtesy would be nice.We ordered two cokes, two Obama specials (three wings and a waffle), and a side of Mac and Cheese. Food takes a decent amount of time, but the chicken was piping hot, so I'm not complaining. Unfortunately, the waitress comes over and throws down our plates and performs an immediate about face and dashes without even asking us if we have everything. I look down at the table. Look up at my boyfriend. Look down at the table and say, "Damn. Where's my Mac and Cheese?" I REALLY wanted Mac and Cheese...it's actually the whole reason I was looking forward to going. At first I thought to myself, well maybe she'll bring it out later. WRONG. As a matter of fact, we never saw her again until she brought us the bill (didn't ask us if we wanted anything else, just dropped the bill off) so I didn't even have the chance to ask her about it. And when she did bring us the bill, I tried to stop her before she dashed off again to ask if we would be charged for the Mac and Cheese, but..alas..she ignored me and sprinted away while all I could get out was, "umm -excus...." Luckily, we weren't billed for it, so whatever.I've never felt so dismissed by a waitress ever. In any case, the food here is good. Fried chicken was delicious and the waffle was great. A great late night grub fest. Sorry the waitress ruined it. And I hate that the decent part of me always leaves a good tip because I just feel too bad to do otherwise, because this lady definitely didn't deserve it from me.

Reviews.Author: Shady L.
Reviews.Content: I went to the  Roscoe's Chicken & Waffle in Long Beach and the location is way better in Long Beach. This location here in Gover/Los Angeles is a bit sketchy. My family and I seen a guy sitting up on the ground about three houses from the restaurant and he was just staring at nothingness and he had pink frosting on his forehead. I wonder if he was drugged up. Also, a lady with barely any clothes looked at us like she wanted to take our stuff.The food is def. 5 stars. I've taken out a star because of the location. While we were eating at Roscoes, I kept on asking my husband to look out for our automobile. I think I will go back to the Long Beach location next time. I'd feel safer and will probably enjoy my food better instead of worry about our car and our lives.

Reviews.Author: Brandy C.
Reviews.Content: Went here for the first time this weekend's live in San Diego and I can tell you we will be here at least once a month.  Food doesn't get any better than this. We ordered the #3 to share and a side of greens. WOW! now my mama made the best waffles but these were darn near perfect. and the chicken, so crispy yet moist all through. Perfection! And the greens were good too.We were told they had a 15 minute wait, we were called inside in just 2 minutes. the wait for food was pretty non existent and the building though it looked a bit rundown on the outside was a bit old fashioned on the inside but clean and the restrooms were remodeled and very clean. The staff were all so nice considering we were there on a Saturday morning with a line out the door.

Reviews.Author: Heather R.
Reviews.Content: Wanted some late night food after the club on a Saturday night and so my friends and I decided to hit up Roscoe's. It was my first time there so I didn't know what to expect but when I had an order for their wings and waffles with a side of smothered potatoes, it was amazing! I've tried other chicken and waffles before but it wasn't as good as this. Maybe because their chicken was seasoned in a way to make it taste well with the waffles...I don't know but I was almost able to finish my meal that night.The only downside was that my friends and I had to wait for a long time to get in and we were extremely hungry from drinking and dancing all night. My friends and I were separated into 2 tables since it was packed but we didn't care, just as long as we had food in our tummy's. Plus its a small and popular place so I kind of expected it to be busy.  But I'm glad that I was able to try this place out for the first time and I might return again if I'm ever around that area.

Reviews.Author: Dimeko P.
Reviews.Content: Got the 1/4 chicken and waffle plate, Mac n cheese and two biscuits for lunch. Best chicken I've had in Los Angeles. Liked it so much..we came back later after a night out. Delicious!

Reviews.Author: Justina T.
Reviews.Content: I never thought chicken and waffles sounded like an appetizing pairing. I like each food item separately, but together?! That's just crazy.But crazy in a good way!I ordered the Carol C. Special (which comes with a fried chicken breast and one waffle) and the sweet potato pie. The former was about $10.50 and the latter $5.40. Ten dollars for a piece of fried chicken and waffle??? This had better be the best chicken and waffle I've ever eaten.I can't honestly say if this was truly the best, but it's delicious nonetheless. The fried chicken breast was crispy and well-endowed with warm, tender flesh. The waffle was crispy and buttery. I ate both food items separately because I wanted to savor the individual flavors. I was a little disappointed by the sweet potato pie (it was my first time) because I love sweet potatoes. The pie was sort of like a pumpkin pie but with sweet potato mash instead of pumpkin filling. It was a generous portion (the slice was probably about 1/6 of an entire pie) with a bowl of whipped cream.My server was super sweet and all the workers were quite friendly. There was a family with a loud baby right next to my table, but the restaurant was loud overall, so it was ok.I don't think my arteries would appreciate my coming back any time soon, but I wouldn't mind eating here again.

Reviews.Author: Pam R.
Reviews.Content: I'll give you 4 just for the AMAZINGGGGGG WAFFLES! I can't remember what combos I had but I had collard greens, chicken, waffles, corn bread & mac & cheese Living in the south for almost 2 years now I've had my fair share of all but the chicken & waffles combo had to fly 3,000 miles to have that So the rest of the food is definitely a solid 3 I've had better chicken better, greens better ...you get the pointBest things I had were the waffles & the corn bread

Reviews.Author: Bret W.
Reviews.Content: In my best of dreams, I dream of Roscoe's!!  This place is a must-see, must-go place.  Nothing fancy here... no Beverly Hills pretension.  Instead this Roscoe's offers a very comfortable place in which to come on in and indulge in comfort food that will leave you full & satisfied.  I like the # 2/"Scoe's" platter.  Prices are pretty darn good for the good food.  They don't have their own parking lot, but there is usually street parking available.

Reviews.Author: Dori R.
Reviews.Content: It's an hour plus drive to Hollywood for us, but this is a "gotta try" place.  Liked it so much that this was my second visit within a year!  Expect a wait if you go on the weekend. It was nice being seated right a way today...that's what we get for coming on a Thursday afternoon, lol. The Obama is the perfect serving for me, 3 wings w/ a waffle, and also had to get the mac and cheese! Delicious, delicious, delicious!! The best waffles ever!! Wish they had their own parking lot, but it is what it is and so what if it's a mission to find a place to park...it's a given in LA.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Glorious. Who would've thought this combo would be this tasty?

Reviews.Author: Hy M.
Reviews.Content: Went there because Obama had been there.  Fried chicken stayed crispier longer, but I have had better fried chicken.

Reviews.Author: Ellen P.
Reviews.Content: I expected so much from here but it was a big disappointment....The chicken and the waffle is just average. The cornbread is pretty good....I would recommend that people try it just to check it off the bucketlist but I probably won't visit again.

Reviews.Author: Nida A B.
Reviews.Content: Perfect late night grub especially after burning up some calories after laughing my head off during The Book of Mormon show at the Pantages! We walked over from the theater to Roscoes and I've had chicken and waffles before in Oakland but this was one of those places I've been wanting to eat at for a while now and check off my foodie list!  We all ordered the Obama but got different sides... The chicken was amazing!! Really hot and juicy chicken pieces... And the waffle was a perfectly sweet addition! I got the Mac n cheese as my side, my husband got chicken sausage and our friend got the potatoes smothered in gravy. I think the price for the sides should've given us a larger portion of sides but overall I would go back for some good comfort food! :)

Reviews.Author: Randy H.
Reviews.Content: How do you not love Roscoes? I had the number 23 which is the yams and greens with thighs. Oh what heaven is. My only knock is the wait.  But as long as their open I will be a customer. Whether late night or for lunch this is one of the best spots ever.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Personally, I don't know what a the big deal is--it's just chicken and waffles. They aren't any special kinds of waffles--just average waffles. The chicken wasn't super moist or crunchy. The syrup was nothing memorable and I actually think they buy their supplies from Ralph's.  NO REALLY WHAT IS THE BIG DEAL?!

Reviews.Author: Joshua G.
Reviews.Content: There's a reason why this place is famous, the chicken is amazing and the waffles are the best I've ever had. Not to talk it up but the chicken is cooked well, the seasoning is just right. Not over the top. The skin is flavorful, the meat is juicy, and it's not drenched in oil. The waffles are awesome! They're not over filling, crisp, and even if you take some home and have them the next day, they're great. The rice and gravy was also something I tried that I must say was amazing. Rice was cooked just right and the gravy was perfect. Not too salty or bland. Overall, I'll be going back the next chance I get.

Reviews.Author: G C.
Reviews.Content: Food, service and prices were pretty good.  I'd visit again when in the area

Reviews.Author: Cameron P.
Reviews.Content: Back for more Scoe's special! Chicken smothered in that gravy plus a couple waffles....There's just something so special and distinct about the Roscoe's flavor and experience.Been coming here since my friends and I could drive back in high school... around the time Tupac featured it in his epic video "To Live And Die In LA" as the don Makaveli. This is an equally legendary LA staple that is locally revered, nationally treasured and globally renown. If you want the savory and perfectly cooked down home southern fried chicken to accompany that slightly sweet, slightly cinnamony, all bomb ass waffle, accept no substitutes.Expect a slight wait during peak hours of "open to close" but this is truly one of the rare places that I would tolerate it as it just does you so good and so right from the inside out.Jeez, I just re-read what I wrote for Roscoe's and I don't think I've spoken this highly of a restaurant. I should get paid for this. And I will accept a Scoe's Special as an installment.Done. =P

Reviews.Author: Brianna G.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes has amazing chicken and waffles. And that's exactly what you should get there. I would recommend anything else on my menu. Maybe a biscuit since their waffle is so good. But the name pretty much tells you what to order.

Reviews.Author: Lucas C.
Reviews.Content: Dear Hollywood people, Roscoes Chicken and Waffles is the biggest scam in town, as much as I paid of their subpar food, I could have bought 3 whole chickens at the grocery store and fried them up with so little effort and a blindfold on and it would be leaps and bounds above the swill they are serving. Seriously, I've have govt issued food that tasted better than their "gravy" over rice. Their fucking flavorless gravy. The easiest thing to make tasted like it came out of a can, and an old rusted dented one at that, with no label, and in the price saver section near the bathroom in the grocery store. I've never felt so ripped off by how much I paid for that shit. Really almost 6 bucks for a half cup of bland mac and cheese!? 4 bucks for a shitty dry biscuit! Fuck them, fuck them, fuck them. Sorry bout all the fucks. Why is there a fucking hour wait to get in this place? And return customers!!!? There are so many amazing places to eat in LA over this hole. Don't eat there. It's way overhyped. It's the Pinks hot dogs of Chicken shacks but at least Pink hotdogs have flavor. Respect your tastebuds eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: In terms of LA Roscoe's, this is the one I prefer. My friend's car got broken into at the one on Pico. If you go during peak hours, which is actually 9pm-2am, there will probably be a line outside, anywhere from 10-60 minutes. I came with a huge group of 12+ one time and we definitely waited at least an hour. But you kind of expect that.Service here is pretty slow. If you get service at all. The place is typically packed and more than the wait staff can handle at a time. But again, set reasonable expectations before you go.I couldn't decide what to order... Um hello. Of course that's not true. I got a chicken and waffle meal, obviously. Any newcomer has to, and even if you're a regular, this is a meal that is just too good to pass up. If you don't get why chicken and waffles go great together, just get out of here.The waffles are a bit soggy for my tastes. I don't like them crispy either, but they always seem a little weak here. At least they taste alright. The chicken tastes delicious, but sometimes you get more fried than actual chicken which is problematic for me.I come here more for the experience of getting an LA delicacy with pals than an a 5 star restaurant course. It is what it is.

Reviews.Author: Les W.
Reviews.Content: Great waffles.  Real butter and tasty syrup.  prompt service and a good value.  Slightly pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Abby R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's never disappoint! My favorite place to get some chicken & waffles. So good and always hits the spot! I usually get their Scoe's 1/2 Chicken with gravy smothered all over & 2 waffles on the side yummm!!

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: So this isn't my first rodeo here. Been here 4 times prior - it's famous and it's "feel good" food.Tonight was a little different, a director friend of mine and I decided to go here for a 9pm dinner. Saturday night wait was expected - 20 minutes. Decent service, hi, how are you, ready to order, bring food quickly and then drop off the check. You don't come here for the outstanding service right?So tonight we tried the #2 Scoe's which is 1/4 chicken white, gravy, waffles and added the Mac and cheese. Do Not Get The Gravy on the chicken! It was like slop and while I still ate it all it completely ruined any flavor in the batter of the "famous" chicken. Maybe order on the side if you NEED gravy in your life, but don't waste your time. That was the first and last time I ask for gravy on anything. (Learned my lesson)Waffles were a tad soggy, I don't care though since drenched in syrup and butter it just tasted like amazing-ness to me but my friend didn't finish his because of it...The Mac and cheese is $5.40 and the portion fits in your hand... So I felt a tad ripped off and it wasn't mind blowing. It tasted "homemade" but lacking something still.I mean we live in a culinary bomb shell with places like Steampunk and another place I have brunch at on Santa Monica (always forget the name) making REAL chicken and waffles with chef flair and textures, why are we still rating places like this 4 or 5 stars? This will be the last time I come here for awhile, I love the place but my palette has expanded to something better, a better, fresher take on a classic dish.So in turn, it's good still. Skip the gravy. Go once and have #1 Scoe's, eat it all up and then go somewhere else next time you want even better chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: R A.
Reviews.Content: Egh wasn't all that great. I usually go to their  long beach location. Meet up with a couple friends from the valley and decided to try it out. Everyone loved the food ( most of them were first timers). Took us about an hour to be seated ( group of 9) and about half hour to be served on a Saturday evening which isn't too bad. Parking is difficult since it's street parking, and the street meters have a one hour max time. The service was great but their food lacked flavor.

Reviews.Author: Queen B.
Reviews.Content: Food was excellent.  Chicken was seasoned and fried right.  Was seated promptly was catered to attentively.

Reviews.Author: Shelley C.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I don't get what the hype is about for Roscoe's. Everyone always talks about how amazing it is but when I finally tried it, my group and I weren't impressed. I prefer Bruxie SO much more.The fried chicken doesn't come on the waffle, and the chicken was just alright. The waffle however was very bad. It was plain, kind of hard, and overall flavorless. It was difficult to finish.The mac and cheese side everyone recommends was only okay. And the service at this Roscoe's was okay. Took a while for them to do anything with our table.I don't recommend Roscoe's, or at least this Roscoe's. It was way too crowded for food and service that was meh.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne D.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why people rap and sing about this place. I've been several times and it's just not all that. People act like anything with salt is the bomb. It's not it's just salty! The waffles aren't good and the chicken is salty. Golden Bird's blows this place out the water. This place seems to be on hype status cause I can't see what's it all about. There are many other chicken and waffle places that deserve the recognition that this place gets. NEXT!

Reviews.Author: Minda W.
Reviews.Content: Got the Obama special on a semi-crowded Saturday lunch. We waited for 40 minutes for a table for 6. We waited a lot more time for them to both take our order and bring our food out.Here's a few tips:- It's not a line, you have to go put your name on a list and wait- If you're paying with a credit card, you have to physically get up and pay (they don't come get it for you, and are actually quite rude about it)Pros: The waffle and syrup were mind blowingly delicious. They drown the whole thing in butter (well, it's up to you how much butter you actually use), so that's also kind of tasty. But seriously, that syrup could end wars. The Obama was a very satisfactory amount of food; my friends that got the thing with a half chix and 2 waffles (forgot the name) were overly full, but I was perfectly content and ready to face the rest of the day without keeling over to die.Cons: The fried chicken is very average/mediocre. The service is basically terrible, so  only come if you're ready to spend 2.5+ hours on lunch, and the employees don't pay attention to you and can be rude. Don't expect more than 1 drink refill per hour.

Reviews.Author: Marissa K.
Reviews.Content: Sorry but what's all the hype about?I've been wanting to try Roscoe's for a while now and finally got a chance to try it during my visit to SoCal.  Since I've only been here once and had a mediocre experience, I will keep this review relatively short.Parking here is terrible, as in, you need to hope to find street parking that's somewhat close to the restaurant.  Not their fault though, and luckily I was able to beat a wait by coming around 6:00pm on a Thursday night.I ordered Scoe's 1/4 chix with 2 waffles.  The fried chicken was good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  The waffles were extremely soft, and it would have been nice if there was some crisp to it.I was also able to try some of the sides such as the candy yams, mac & cheese, greens, biscuit and gravy.  The candy yams and mac & cheese were definitely my favorites of the whole meal.   The greens on the other hand, were waaaaay too salty for me, and I actually really like salty food (sigh).  The gravy lacked flavor and was super thick.Anyway, this joint is way overpriced for the amount and quality of the food.

Reviews.Author: Tutu A.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food . One of my best meals of 2014. Get the Obama special !!! Excellent butter and syrup !!!! For another one of my best meals in the LA area, check out Road to Seoul Korean BBQ

Reviews.Author: Kenya S.
Reviews.Content: Is it me or is this joint overly Boosted?!?! For as long as I can remember I have heard nothing but "if you're in LA you have to try RC&W". So our flight landed a little early and we couldn't check in until later so we were hungry and thought oh yeah Roscoes here we come. There's street parking so you pay the meter. We walked in and were seated right away.  It was around lunch time so it was popping to say the least. Me being the little on top of it investigator that I am had already checked out the menu upon arriving so I knew what I wanted. I ordered the 3 wings and waffle combo. I was going to add a side of Mac and cheese but I'm so glad I didnt. My sister eded up getting a plate that came with 2 wings a side of greens, m&c and a slice of cornbread so i was able to sample her's. I'll start with the waffle, it was actually really good. I loved the cinnamon taste and warm syrup combo. Now the chicken was a decent size for a wing but it was very bland. No season whatsoever which I found to be strange considering this is supposed to be a "soul food spot". The greens were horrible they tasted like they needed to be boiled at least 10 more minutes. I swear the glory greens in the can have more flavor and a better texture than the one's they have, and the nerve to be selling sides for almost $5 each. The cornbread looks very appetizing and soft and warm.... Ummm complete opposite. That cornbread was  beyond dry. Jiffy is 10 times better seriously. I doubt a bird would even peck at it. The M&C was cold and bland also.I'm usually all for taking my left overs but  we left that mess on the table. They can keep those dry birds. I can't do nothing with no dry tasteless food. Yuck Word of advice don't believe the hype. Rudy's Chicken in Dallas, TX still has my vote for some of the best chicken I have ever tasted in my life. I doubt i'll return, maybe i'll try a different location if I do but jeez I was so disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Anne A.
