Reviews.Content: Even though Roscoe's doesn't have the best waffles in town nor the best fried chicken in town, Roscoe's will always hit the spot for my craving of Southern comfort food, especially during the late evening hours.If you're looking for a place to eat during the early morning hours in Hollywood, Roscoe's is the place to be for chicken and waffles, and other late night eats.This place expanded around seven years ago so now there's a lot more space to feed the hungry local studio employees, tourists, celebrities and people from all walks of life to dine together for a soul soothing meal.

Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: So I'm vacation in Los Angeles, and one of the things on my MUST DO list is eat at Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles. My friend and I went on a Friday night, and I was fully expecting to wait forever but to my surprise we only had to wait for 5 minutes for a table! I ordered a Carol C. Special, which is one breast and a waffle, plus a side of mac and cheese and a biscuit.The mac and cheese was pretty good (but it's hard to mess up mac and cheese) and the biscuit was soft and a nice golden brown. The chicken breast was nothing to write home about - I prefer spicy chicken anyway - but the waffle...oh dear lord, that waffle was probably the best waffle I have ever eaten. Perfectly cooked, and it had kind of a sweetness and spice to it - maybe something cinnamon-y? I still daydream about that waffle. Plus they give you enough butter to smother that thing twice over if you're so inclined.One thing to note: they don't do separate checks but if you're paying with two credit/debit cards they can split the balance between them.

Reviews.Author: Amanda B.
Reviews.Content: We visited Roscoes for breakfast on a Friday morning. Note: I called the night before to ask about opening time, and they said 8am. They didn't actually open until 8:30. They told me that a line would be forming by 10am, but when we left the restaurant was basically empty. We all ordered what we figured we were "supposed" to order - chicken and waffles. My husband and I got the meal that came with half a chicken, 2 waffles, and gravy. It was more than enough for two of us.  We could have split the quarter chicken. The gravy was so amazing, it makes my mouth water thinking about it. Underneath the gravy...lots and lots of it...the crispiest fried chicken, not greasy at all. The waffles were great, too, but for me, the chicken and gravy were the star of the show. My parents got chicken sausage, and they had good things to say about it, but I was too stuffed to try. Being a tourist, I had hoped and imagined that the place would be packed with celebrities, but the only celebrity I saw was a picture of Obama on the wall! Maybe celebrities don't really eat waffles that often... All in all, I'm so glad we visited this iconic restaurant. My husband requested it since apparently he has wanted to visit it since seeing it in a TV show when he was 10 years old.  It made quite an impression back then, and certainly did not dissapoint!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie V.
Reviews.Content: PROS:- FOOD: Obama #9: 3 fried chicken wings & waffles! (It was DELICIOUS!) - DRINKS: The "Lisa" which is lemonade and iced tea... BUT they said there is no refills? Which is dumb, in my opinion, because the soda & other drinks were free refills but not this one? But the waiter was awesome and gave us a free refill anyways!! :)) - Saw a famous person (Questlove) eating here... So we knew the food was going to be BOMB!! - We got our food FAST! Probably 5-10 minutes after ordering - HAND WIPES! I don't believe in using utensils so these wipes came in handy after my meal CONS:- Long wait (about 35-40 minutes) and this was on a Sunday evening - And you have to wait outside with limited seating, so make sure you have a jacket for those chilly nights - Only 3 wings in the Obama meal? I'm a hungry girl! I want more meat!! - Service was a little slow when we needed a refill (but then again he did give us a free refill to make up for it)

Reviews.Author: Brandon B.
Reviews.Content: Extremely overrated place! I don't understand why/how Roscos gets so much hype. First, parking sucks, it's only street parking which makes it hard to find any parking.  Second, there's always a wait, which I don't mind waiting if I get good service. As for getting decent service, that NEVER happens. I've been to four different Roscoes and it's all the same when it comes to the service, really bad. I never get a decent amount of refills or the server never checks back with us to see how everything's going.Third, the food is ok. It's average at best. To be honest I wouldn't drive out my way for them. You can tell they don't make it fresh cuz it's always out 3-5 mins after we order. Their chicken is ok, KFCish, I've had a few of there side dishes which were pretty good. The waffles are AMAZING tho. Overall this place is whatever! Don't believe the hype!

Reviews.Author: Stephen S.
Reviews.Content: one of my must stop when I travel to LACan't go wrong with the chicken with gravy!

Reviews.Author: S A.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if  I'm just not a huge fan of fried chicken and waffles or not but I came here and it really wasn't all that. The chicken is good but I paid $7 for one chicken breast which is way too much. Also their so called best Mac n cheese want that great either and I believe it was $5. The service was just not good, I asked for a refill on my drink and never got one. Also they tried hustling for tips which I would have gladly tipped if I received good service but there's no need to tip someone that provides poor service. All in all, we paid about $35-40. I won't be coming back here again simply because I believe it's all hype since Obama came here. But if you're a fan of chicken and waffles then u should try this spot yourself and be the judge.

Reviews.Author: Mark Z.
Reviews.Content: My first time here. Parking very difficult at this place. I ordered the Ck breast and waffle with a side of Mac and cheese . The chicken was ok, nothing crazy. The Mac and cheese I was disappointed in, it was mushy and not very flavorful. I think this place is over rated.

Reviews.Author: Sung K.
Reviews.Content: This place was hyped up to the max when I visited LA.I mean, Roscoe's was a big name when it came to chicken and waffles, and I definitely got my hopes up for this meal.But I was pretty bummed out. The chicken was cooked well and you could really taste the seasoning in the coating of the chicken. But the waffle? Man, it tasted like it was just microwaved and served. Biscuit was pretty good and the sunset was not bad either, but not to write home about. Would I return? nope. Probably would go to Sylvia's or Amy Ruth's in NYC if I want C&W.

Reviews.Author: Ordale A.
Reviews.Content: Halfway through my meal I was compelled to open the Yelp app on my phone just to make sure I was at the right location. You know, the one with four stars. My meal was extremely disappointing. It reminded me of going to "that" relative's house who doesn't know how to season food. On second thought...Rappers Delight: "Have you ever been over a friend's house to eat and the food just ain't no good? I mean, the macaroni's soggy, the peas are mush, and the chicken tastes like wood." My chicken was overcooked. The skin was brittle and unchewable, so I had to pull it off. The meat inside was just bland. I was going to send it back, but then I tasted the waffle. It was very...soft. Think: Eggo Waffle in the microwave. That's not necessarily a bad thing, but I like the texture of a Belgian waffle. My order came with two waffles, and after eating half of the first I realized that there was no need to send the chicken back. I was done. After looking at the smiles on the faces of the people around me, I accepted that perhaps this was a cultural preference. I know people who come to DC and can't stand our wings with mumbo sauce. I didn't complain. I just tipped my waiter and went somewhere else. L.A./Baby Bubba...we're still friends!

Reviews.Author: Steve S.
Reviews.Content: This place has awesome food and awwesome service! i recommend it to anyone looking for the awesome chicken and waffles combo!

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: I love that a "deacon" type greeter shows you to your seat (maybe that was just based on shifts and time I went but dude was cool straight from a baptist church lol). Lemonade is freaking awesome. Potato salad is good not great. Chicken is good to very good but not amazing! All in all 4 stars average doesn't feel right but everyone is entitled to an opinion. Definitely have to try just once...but if you are an up and coming rapper, R&B artist or if you're just heavy into the urban hip hop scene then you MUST come here...it you don't like urban or hip hop or R&B I'd skip this place if I were you!*great mix of customers but this restaurant attracts the hip, young, and urban but you'll see plenty of tourists and executives that want a "down home" comfort food type experience. All are absolutely welcome here but the vibe leans urban hip hop IMHO and area can seem sketchy especially at night...but it's cool!

Reviews.Author: Mimi D.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes is a place you have to try at least once so I was excited to stop by while in LA. It's practically a landmark. First off, the workers there are sooo sweet and hospitable and put a smile on your face. Very genuine people that add to the experience. Our server was very attentive and extremely sweet so he gets 5 stars!The food wasn't exceptional. The waffle reminded me of an eggo waffle and wasn't anything special. The chicken had good flavor but was a little dry. I saw the homestyle plate on the menu and regret not trying the plate with chicken, Mac and cheese, greens and cornbread- it looked so good! I will definitely give it a try when I ce back because my chicken and waffle experience hasn't totally blown away my expectations taste wise.  The Mac and cheese looks like it can make up for that though(:

Reviews.Author: Igor T.
Reviews.Content: I'm getting hungry just writing this review.  I love this place.  I recommend then #1 SCOE's plate.  It's 1/4 chicken (i get all white meat)  with 2 waffles.  Mix that all up with the maple syrup and butter and it's amazing!!! If you like fried chicken, this will definitely not disappoint.   If you like waffles, these are great as well.  mmmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Maryam Q.
Reviews.Content: Finally went here couple months back!! Wasn't disappointed ...went there around 1 am so beat the club rush but there was still a little bit if a wait...ordered a bunch of sides and fried chicken...everything tasted so good and the service was really good ... can't wait to go back again!!!

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: dammm....like my 4th time eating at a roscoe's this year. I'd like to state that their quality has always been the same: Real damn good.Just some damn good chickin and some of the best butter I've had in my life. I'm more shocked at how good the butter is than the meal itself. "I can't believe it's butter." There's gotta be more in that butter than butter itself.

Reviews.Author: Maria P.
Reviews.Content: I like Roscoe's Chicken, Maybe i just like it so much that i want to give it another chance...and another....and another....and maybe I will...and maybe this review will change. The last two times I have been there I have been disappointed. First occasion; waffles were sweaty and soggy. The chicken was juicy yet lacked the crust i was expecting from friend chicken.Second occasion: Waffles were sweaty and became soggy....the chicken was juicy...and had a small amount of meet in it.Did the high volumn downgrade the quality of the place? I don't know but after my last visit I really do not want to go and waste another $20, when my waffle maker at home can something better for a way lower price.

Reviews.Author: Will K.
Reviews.Content: I want to say "Don't believe the hype".  When, in reality, I'm just not a huge chicken and waffles fan.  This place is known for that.  So why 4 stars?  Because, it's one of those places.  Food is done right (friend chicken on par with the best I've had).  Service is AWESOME.  Quantity is good.  Prices are good (especially with the quality).  Think of it as a normal "greasy spoon" eatery with about 30 times more personality and style.  If you're in LA and someone says "you gotta go to Roscoes", they're right.  Things can get a bit sketchy outside, so be aware, but inside, on point. Why not 5 stars?  It's not them, it's me...  But very much worth a stop.

Reviews.Author: D J.
Reviews.Content: yes this is some good food period cant go wrong with roscoe's

Reviews.Author: Alyx F.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes has great food and is truly an LA classic that you have to experience.  If you want the classic experience, order fried chicken with gravy and waffles.  Make sure you eat the chicken and waffles together to get a truly delicious treat for your tastebuds.It isn't the absolute best friend chicken or waffle that I have ever had, but the combination is so unique and works well together.  Next time I would get the fried chicken with the gravy on the side so that it keeps the fried skin crispy.

Reviews.Author: Jay J.
Reviews.Content: 1.)  Friendly and attentive staff.  My buddy and I were sobering up/in a goofy mood and the waiter put up with our sh*t and for that, I commend him.  (we weren't that bad, but still, I was impressed).  :-)2.)  Very close to clubs in Hollywood which makes this very convenient for us club/bar hoppers.  Excellent choice of location!3.)  SUPER large portions!  If you can't get full off a chicken and waffles plate I really don't know what to tell you.  4.)  Food quality.  The food was orgasmic.  I honestly have found a new love.  I'm sorry Thai/Mexican/Italian food, I found a new lover.  I must say, this one hits the spot late night too, no pun intended!!!!! :-p5.)  Reasonable prices.  honestly I think the prices are great considering how amazing the food taste and how much they give you.  I feel like I get a great deal every time I come here.  :-)Thank you for providing such delicious food at such a great value. I will be back.  I am craving your chicken as we speak!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Christian A.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Service is alright. Food is extremely addicting. Great quality food. Good place to enjoy a good meal.

Reviews.Author: Charlie T.
Reviews.Content: The worst part about my meal was when I realized I was out of chicken and waffles.  Ill come here for Thanksgiving instead.  #danksgiving The maple syrup is spectacular and the service is quick. Its so good. I wish I could eat here everyday. Maybe I will?

Reviews.Author: L L.
Reviews.Content: Four stars because of the wait.  It always seems to be busy.  On a hot day, I do not want to be sitting outside of an establishment with no shade, waiting to be seated. However, the food is excellent so I will be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Sam P.
Reviews.Content: What an LA iconic restaurant, once you figure out which door is the entrance. I've been hearing about Roscoe's, or Scoe's if your nasty, for over 20 years. Who would have thought that chicken 'n' waffles would blow up like this?The service is on the slow side and there aren't any frills to the dining room experience. Just shut up and eat some good soul food. As for the waffles, think fluffy Eggo, not firm Belgian waffle. Check the special of the day posted at your table. On the day I went, it was $6.00 for 2 chicken thighs and a fluffy biscuit with rice and gravy.

Reviews.Author: Erica U.
Reviews.Content: The fried chicken is amazing. the Country Boy #9 is my usual. There's usually a long line so I get my order for take out and walk down the block and sit on the ledge near the psychics house heading toward Hollywood Blvd. That way you can eat quickly and not have to worry about the rest. Fried chicken is always amazing, the waffles are sweet and delicious, the lemonade is great. nice staff. what more can you want.

Reviews.Author: Malisha W.
Reviews.Content: A bit pricier than Chicago chicken and waffles but good

Reviews.Author: DeShawn A.
Reviews.Content: I didn't eat much while here except for the macaroni and cheese which would have been good if it weren't so salty! This location was very crowded and we had about a 30 minute wait. Customer service was okay. The waitress was friendly. Hopefully I'll be able to visit again and try something else. Wasn't great but just okay.

Reviews.Author: R L.
Reviews.Content: I came here thinking I was going to have some of the best fried chicken and waffles in LA. Yea right, It was the most straightforward and bland chicken and waffles I have ever had. The waffles were dry and tasted so basic, it was syrup 'n cardboard. The chicken was also surprisingly dry and had no flavor. Our table was never attended to after placing our order. Service needs improvement.The best thing about this place was leaving.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: Got here near midnight Saturday night and the place was full!  It's a popular joint.Waffles were tasty, but not the crunchy kind. Chicken and batter were tasty.

Reviews.Author: Tom L.
Reviews.Content: My second time ever coming here. I forgot how the food tasted like the first time, but the second time it was really good. My girlfriend and I came here after visiting universal studios, which was only a couple miles away. We got there around 4 and we immediately got seated. After we finished eating a lot of people started to come and it started to get crowded by 6pm.I got the schoes #1 that came with a leg, thigh and 2 waffles. I personally don't think it's anything special, but it was really good and the service was good as well.

Reviews.Author: Valerie O.
Reviews.Content: It was average. Had takeout. The chicken was good. The waffles were ok, I've had better. I also had Mac n cheese which had no flavor. This place is rely small. Its always packed and the wait was 25 min if i ate there.

Reviews.Author: Ty W.
Reviews.Content: If we go to LA, we're stopping at Roscoe's...maybe even twice if I can haha! This location is not hard to find but the parking sucks. The handful of times we've been there the wait to get in wasn't bad, even with large parties. They also seem to be really on their game with getting food out cause the last few times they were fast!Now that I've been here a few times, I can say this is hands down some of the best fried chicken I've ever tasted. My plate of choice is the #8 with one waffle and a chicken breast. When they do it right, the skin has the perfect crispness and the chicken is so moist and flavorful. The combination of chicken and waffles with a little butter and syrup is to die for...literally, no one better touch my plate when I'm eating! I've tried a few of the side items and in my opinion, none of them really stand out. Get the chicken and waffles and leave the sides for everyone else.The reason I said when it's done right is because this last visit my chicken was killer as usual but my wife got a dud piece or something. It was terrible...super dry, no flavor and the skin was soggy. Just not like usual and restaurant inconsistency drives me crazy. Other than that, the prices are more than reasonable, their service is always good and it's a must try if you're in LA!

Reviews.Author: Helen D.
Reviews.Content: Not great. They sat us down and forgot about us. I had to go find a server... Apparently they were all attending the other dining area. The chicken wings was not great and the waffles were mediocre. Felt ripped off, overpriced, not worth what we paid.

Reviews.Author: Jilly G.
Reviews.Content: We heard about it, read about it and tonight  we drove up to Hollywood to try it! The fried chicken is delicious!  Had the meal combo with chicken breast, Mac n cheese, green & cornbread; the other stuff was decent.. But #1 is the chicken for sure.  Waffle was just a waffle, but the syrup was yummy as hell. Definitely try this place at least once - it's worth it.  Please look up all of their locations, there are six of them.

Reviews.Author: Anthony K.
Reviews.Content: I ended up at Roscoe's after a night of drinking beers and watching Food Network at home...that pretty much sums up my life now. Cry for me.I never had chicken and waffles before, and I never really understood the combination. I wanted to be enlightened, but never had the opportunity. My friend offered to drive me to this quintessential establishment, and I'd heard folklore of someone named  "Big Mama" coming around and slapping your arms if you ate with your elbows on the table. It scared me and I didn't want to go alone.I guess I ordered too much. I ordered the standard chicken and waffles, chicken livers, and mac & cheese. Mac & cheese wasn't dry and tasted okay, but I could probably skip it at $5 for a small bowl. I love me some mac & cheese and I love burning cash, but sometimes the two don't pair up.Chicken liver were breaded and fried, and they gave us a full plate of it. I'd rather have had a Pho Bowl full of Mac & Cheese, but it was perfect for my anemic friend. He needs the iron or to have two pairs of socks on.Now for the glorious CHICKEN AND WAFFLES...yeah. It's copious amounts of hype. I'll give it to you; It's good. The chicken was lightly breaded, piping hot, juicy, and perfectly cooked. The waffles on the other hand were soggy like everyone else is whining about. I want it crunchy. Still, somehow like a comedy of errors, these two bed-mates make for a very satisfactory meal. It's sweet. It's salty. It's hot then it's cold. It's yes then it's no. It's in then it's out. ...YOU DON'T REALLY WANNA STAY, NO! Jesus.Back to the hype. It's like hipster prices for chicken and waffles. It's like if you went to the SGV for some good fried rice, but then found out that now there's a long ass line, the serving is half the size, they have menus with color photos and English words on it, and what use to cost $5 is now $12.85! Damn youuuuuu, Gwai-Lo! Chinese food was meant to be ordered by pointing at pictures on the walls!

Reviews.Author: Sergeant M.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food and service. Only waited ten minutes, and apparently that doesn't happen very often. The waffles and chicken look to be praised all the time, but know the eggs and biscuits also great.

Reviews.Author: Karthik S.
Reviews.Content: Okay, there's really not much to say about Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. It's damn good - most people know it's damn good and it doesn't get any better than this for chicken and waffles. The chicken is beyond perfection and the waffles are magical. Together, it's beyond magical perfection. My go-to pick is the Carol's House Special. One breast. One waffle. Tough to beat. Admittedly, the wait to get into the restaurant can be daunting and then, once you're inside, the service can be a bit laggy if it's a crowded time (which is most of the time). Still, it's worth every minute and every penny. The best friend chicken in California, by far.

Reviews.Author: Dina Z.
Reviews.Content: This is going to be short and sweet...DONTE was fantastic!!!! Best server in Los Angeles hands down! this wasn't my first Roscoe's experience, but he made it feel like the first with his warm welcome and experienced knowledge of the menu and his attitude was AMAZING! So Donte, if you're reading this...THANK YOU!!!!!Best food, best service, can't complain! :)

Reviews.Author: Manu N.
Reviews.Content: Much better and more authentic than the one in Long Beach. Had the Obama special and everything was good!

Reviews.Author: Ledam O.
Reviews.Content: Parking: Street Parking bring some coins!Customer Service: Friendly and fast/accommodating.Price: Decent prices for the servings.I came here for the chicken.Food: Delicious, chicken breaded perfectly and cooked thoroughly, not like other places where they serve chicken after biting into it you still see blood! yuck. Here you can tell they take their time to cook it right.Waffles were good! :)

Reviews.Author: Etienne L.
Reviews.Content: Best place to have Chicken and Waffles if you come down to Southern Cali. Never had a bad experience and always have great food.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia J.
Reviews.Content: Finally got to try Roscoe's.I had mixed emotions about this place.Food-wise: I was disappointed with the waffles because I thought they would be crispy. Mine were really soft. The chicken on the other hand was very delicious. I'm not a big chicken eater, but the bird was seasoned quite well with a delicious crunch.This is a noisy, sticky tabletop kind of atmosphere, which I don't mind at all.I would try this place again, just to give the waffles one more chance.

Reviews.Author: Nicole G.
Reviews.Content: Waits during lunch, dinner and breakfast are a drag. I like to go in between meals. No separate checks and service varies from good to not so good. Just depends how busy they are but I don't think that's an excuse. Wait times are killer but with the food this good what do you expect. Parking sucks. But seriously the food makes up for everything.

Reviews.Author: Andrew A.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely fantastic, I cannot say enough about how good this place is. Without a doubt the best fried chicken place in LA. Great people watching as well.

Reviews.Author: Monika L.
Reviews.Content: The chicken is so gosh darn good. Flaky and warm it just melts in your mouth. It is so buttery and moist! You know it's fresh! Everything else is just ok, the Mac n cheese tastes like it's boxed, the rice is also boxed. The greens are pretty good. I recommend just getting the chicken!

Reviews.Author: Katya W.
Reviews.Content: Food was great! They have melt in your mouth cornbread and the candied yams were delicious!! Don't think you can go wrong here, the gentlman who was the host outside was funny and seemed to have a good heart. Definitely would go back, the chicken isn't half bad either!!

Reviews.Author: Tammy N.
Reviews.Content: This place did not live up to it's hype at all. I got the waffle and 1 piece chicken. Although this place looked really old fashion and humble, for the price you pay, you don't get a lot of food at all. The chicken seasoning was good but not crispy and the waffle was super soggy. =[I would give this place another try if the lines weren't always so long. For now I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Author: Darren W.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it! For all the hype I've heard about this place, my expectations were justifiably high. First off, walking into the place feels like you've been time warped back to 1978, and it looks as if they haven't cleaned it or done any building improvements since then either (Donna Summer's "Last Dance" playing certainly added to the ambiance). I chalk that up to the nostalgic flair they're trying to create, I'll accept that. I'm here for food, not necessarily ambiance.Recommended to me was the Scoes, nice and simple. The food was served quickly... I almost feel too quickly. Don't get me wrong, I don't want slow service, but this was abnormally quick. I think McDonald's spends more time preparing my food, but I supposed that's made possible when you serve the equivalent of an Eggo Waffle with Old Country Buffet fried chicken on plates that were purchased from a school cafeteria. My friend had the Mac & Cheese, which we had both heard rave reviews about. Again, I don't get it!? Overcooked Macaroni with a few shreds of cheddar sprinkled on top does not cut it... I've had better Mac & Cheese made for me in a guys college dorm.The price for this place was rather high, considering the quality of the food. Now that I've been here, experienced it, I'm thankful to say, the experience is over and done, never to be repeated. The food wasn't horrible. It was edible, but not justifiable for the price.

Reviews.Author: Doug J.
Reviews.Content: Not just hype... It's delicious. After listening to my 16 year old daughter begging me to take her there, I finally did and I'm so glad. It was absolutely fantastic.  I ordered the chicken breast with one waffle and it was more than enough. The chicken was so moist in the inside and perfectly crispy on the outside. I can't remember having a better piece of fried chicken ever. The waffle is what will make me drive the hour and a half to come here again. I also ordered the biscuit and gravy on the side and loved it. The only negative I can say is that there really is no parking so just be prepared to walk and they should open up a gift shop because their selection of a few shirts is not good. They could really capitalize on all of the tourist in the area and sell merchandise like papas n beer. They have the famous name and an incredible taste now start marketing it properly!

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: I came here after someone's recommendation and wasn't dissappointed. I was prepared to wait in line after I had read some yelp reviews, but the two uf us were seated immediately. (We came here on a Thu night at around 8 p.m.)We did see some groups waiting outside - I wouldn't come here with more than 5 people as they only have a couple large tables. There was enough parking when we went, although I can imagine there to be fewer parking spots on the weekend.As to the important stuff: the food is really good! Our waiters were so kind and accomodating that we felt right at home. I've never had chicken and waffles before but I will definitely be ordering it again soon!

Reviews.Author: Drew E.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if you realized, but the chicken and waffle together reheat in the microwave really quickly and nicely- so order to your heart's contentment, and the leftovers will be just as good.  REAL TALK

Reviews.Author: Robert G.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Roscoe's 20 times, give or take. So I know what to expect: great waffles, good chicken, and bad service. But this time, the game changed. Blake gave us the best service I've ever had at Scoe's. He was friendly, prompt, attentive, thorough, and accurate. Hopefully he trains all the servers, because good service makes those chicken and waffles taste even better

Reviews.Author: Bernadette D.
Reviews.Content: Now these guys know how to do Chicken and Waffles. Some people would be weirded out by the idea of Chicken and Waffles as a combo but it's so good. Many places I have been outside of Los Angeles seems to not get chicken and waffles. They are way too expensive and taste bland. Roscoe always cook their chicken and waffles well. I normally don't like waffles but I'll eat the ones at Roscoe. The same goes with the syrup that seems sweet and not full of preservatives. I've been living outside of Los Angeles for awhile and I was craving some good chicken and waffles. I wouldn't want to eat it all the time. But when it's good it is definitely worth the wait.I went during lunch time which can get crowded but I was seated in less than 5 minutes. The interior makes you feel like you stepped back in time with the brown walls that are reminiscent of a lounge. The employees make you feel welcome with the host making sure people watch their step to the waiting asking me if everything is okay. Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is an institution worth going to and it is not expensive at all.

Reviews.Author: Alvin C.
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the OGs of the Chicken and Waffle. There's truly something about the combination of sweet from waffles and savory from their perfectly fried chicken. Got the herbs special which was enough for 2, but I did some work to it. Definitely recommend trying it if you haven't already. Even if you have been to a chicken and Waffle joint,  you got to try "Roscoe's".

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I don't love Roscoe's.  Of course the parking is non-existent as expected, just find a meter and you should be able to finish your meal within an hour.  This establishment looks authentic-- so it made me believe that the food would taste authentic too.  This wasn't my first time trying chicken and waffles; I've had Bruxie before and once again wasn't "wow'ed".  I ordered the "#2 Scoe's", which was 1/4 chicken with 2 waffles, a huge dollop of honey butter, maple syrup, and gravey.  I still haven't reached that blissful moment where somehow fried chicken and maple syrup taste like a pairing.  The chicken was dry!!  They do ask which meat you want, so maybe I'll specify only dark meat next time.  The gravey was very thick and oil-heavy.  I didn't want to smother the chicken with too much of it... The combo I ordered was under $10, so that was to be expected.  I'm not coming back though.  I'm sorry, I just don't like chicken and waffles.  I don't think I'll ever like them together.Oh and to pay, they'll bring you your bill but you have to go to the main counter to pay.  And they make it kind of hard to just walk out without paying because they had a security guard near the exit... no joke LOL.  I always wondered why there was a security guard posted in broad daylight (lunch hour).

Reviews.Author: Joshua T.
Reviews.Content: The service is quick, the food is great, scoe's #1 1/4 chicken with 2 waffles is perfect to share with your date. Overall it's awesome every time I come out here for some food

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: Waffle mix very tasty.The service was fast, prices reasonable and portions were huge.Excellent all the way around.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: Nothing like protein after working out at bootcamp!but all seriousness....  its a great hang out spot, but not my definition of good eats....  maybe i am too accustomed to my hormone injected KFC...but their chicken is a bit scrawny and waffles are are a bit soggy for my taste....

Reviews.Author: Mariam F.
Reviews.Content: Yum. The ideal after bar food! I didn't give it a 5 only because the Chicken N Waffles in the Bay Area has a chocolate chip waffle that is amazing and beats these waffles.

Reviews.Author: Joey B.
Reviews.Content: I can't lie, I expected Roscoe's to be good, but nothing amazing.  I couldn't decide whether a 4 or a 5 star was appropriate, but after thinking about it, I can't find any reason to discredit this establishment as anything other than a favorite restaurant of mine. You would think the combination would be odd, or not work, but it most definitely does.  The menu is very diverse, and Chicken and Waffles are actually only combined on a few platters, while they have many varieties of different food choices available on the menu.  I personally always get the #1, which is a 1/4 chicken I believe(breast and leg if I recall).  It's the perfect combination of this small Los Angeles area chain and the serving is excellent.  I've been here 3 times, and while It's been a while other than when I was just visiting LA(just moved down here), I remember almost every experience and I have never had a bad one.  The menu, again, is wonderful.  Biscuits and gravy, chicken, waffles, and various menu items mix and match breakfast, lunch, and dinner specialties that likely fit into the fried home cooked dinner category.  I always go with the #1, as mentioned, and the food is excellent. The waffles are thinner, and remind me of Eggo waffles but more focused production when it comes to quality and overall taste.  They are seriously excellent.  The chicken tastes just like what your mom probably made growing up, amazinly well made fried chicken and it compliments the waffles PERFECTLY.   Finally, the service is impeccable.  This is why I couldn't give it less than 5 stars.  The food, price, and portions are all great, and to top it off, the service is attentive, friendly, and fast.  None of the servers or staff I've ever dealt with were ever not smiling, helpful, or unhappy to assist you.  The food service comes quick, drink refills are quicker, and the staff is attentive to checking a few times.  I think it helps the area is much smaller than your standard restaurant, which is nice anyways so that you are surely getting any help whenever you can.  Cannot say enough good things about this place.  If you are visiting LA it's a must have and staple that you need to have at least once, regardless of whatever predetermined notions you have about the food combination. Their flexible hours, wonderful staff, excellent meal portions and quality at a great price make this somewhere I visit at least monthly.

Reviews.Author: William C.
Reviews.Content: I haven't had Roscoe's since college. I ended up at Roscoe's waking up from an inebriated nap and watching Guarnaschelli tearing it up on Iron Chef.  Yeah, that's my life. Laugh at me. First of all, I enjoy soul food. No, I LOVE soul food. Ox tails, greens, sweet corn dressing, succotash- it's southern hospitality at its best. Chicken and waffles is not soul food. Roscoes is not soul food- it is hype rolled in batter and deep fried. All these rave reviews on yelp are from people trying to act cool and fit in. You are part of the hollywood crowd if you eat at Roscoes after clubbing right?  Based on the riff raff loitering outside of the restaurant and the lingering smell of cannbis. . . I think not. For our appetizers, we had mac-n-cheese and livers. The mac-n-cheese reminded me of the cafeteria mac-n-cheese at my work. I have no complaints about the mac-n-cheese and I have no compliments either. For $5, it certainly wasn't worth a miniscule four ounces. The livers were battered, deep fried, and delicious. You really can't screw up deep fried livers. I wish there was a sauce that I could dip the livers in. Luckily my gravy from the chicken was the saving grace.For my entree, I had ordered Scoes's #1. Chicken and waffles; it is such a bizarre combination. I really enjoy both foods independently, but together they are a non-sequitur. The waffles were good even though it had soggy spots.  The chicken breast was seasoned well on the outside, but the meat was dry. One a more pleasant note, the staff was very friendly. I was greeted by smiles from all of the staff.

Reviews.Author: Tracie P.
Reviews.Content: I always have a bomb experience at Roscoe's on Gower. This is the first time I went past midnight on a Saturday and I was surprise that there were so many people waiting to get in. We got there around 12:40 and the line didn't take too long to get in ~25-30 minutes.A+ for service, the servers are always friendly and attentive. I don't remember who helped me last night, but he brought our food out very quickly.The food was good as always. I got a thigh and a waffle and my boyfriend got a thigh, leg & rice. We also got a Sunset drink (lemonade & fruit punch) and a side of cornbread. Other than when I'm eating at Roscoe's, I normally HATE eating waffles but I enjoy theirs so much for whatever reason and that's why I keep coming back! Also, the fried chicken never disappoints!My only complaint from last night is that the cornbread was a little dry, I was constantly drinking water while I was eating it.Other than that, my Roscoe's night was terrific and I'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M.
Reviews.Content: I had the Obama special which was wings. All good and meaty. I had gravy on the side. The waffles were great as always. I can honestly say it's the best fried chicken I've ever eaten. Collard greens on the side topped it off.  Wasn't a huge fan if the chicken livers but they were prepared fine

Reviews.Author: Angel G.
Reviews.Content: Chicken is great here no doubt about it, service is horrendous, by far the absolute slowest wait staff i have ever encountered. Its not like its a one-time thing, i regularly go to this place and order the same thing every time (Carol B. Special = 1 waffle and 1 chicken breast) and typically wait 15 minutes from the time i sit til the time i order than another 15 minutes from the time i order until the time i start eating.Other than the bad service time, this place is a must visit spot just for their chicken breast alone.

Reviews.Author: Tiffani T.
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I even give this establishment 3 stars is because I love the food. The service on the other hand is terrible. When I asked if I could give them my order they gave me a reply of.."let me check the list." Uhmm, what list?? Sorry but that left me confused and irritated, and did not make my Monday any better -___-

Reviews.Author: Maurice A.
Reviews.Content: Always have to hit this when I'm in town. Scoes special aka the number 1 is always my go to.

Reviews.Author: Courtney Y.
Reviews.Content: Finally after years of waiting to try Roscoe's I got to come here on a Tuesday night around 11pm & we didn't have to wait very long for our party of four. I knew what we were getting into so I tried not to eat too much before coming here.This place serves some delicious but heavy food for those who are up for the challenge.Ordered a Scoe's #2 -- if you like gravy then I'd recommend this versus #1 which doesn't have any.Comes with two pieces of dark or white meat along with two waffles.Also ordered a side of Mac 'N Cheese - for those who like it a little crispy, this was deliciousCornbread - good but a bit dry for my tasteFriendly service, but our waitress didn't really ever come back after we ordered until we needed the check.Street parking, if you can even find any in LA right off Sunset Blvd.Next time I'll be trying some of the other combinations!

Reviews.Author: Robin S.
Reviews.Content: ROSCOES!!!!! I can never go wrong with roscoe's. So far I've been to three different roscoe's locations, and none of them have disappointed me. Now let me just say, I am not a big fan of fried chicken, but every once in a while a get a taste for some friend chicken so I come to roscoe's. This is probably the only time I eat friend chicken. I order the number nine which is the Obama Special. The Obama special comes with a waffle and three pieces of fried chicken. I also get a side of macaroni and cheese as well, I just cant eat my food without it. This location is in Hollywood on sunset and Gower. The location is nothing special, but the food makes up for it.The wait service was just okay nothing special, but I find that to be the norm for this establishment. All of the locations that I have been too, have never had AMAZING customer service, but they are all just okay, not rude or anything so that good for me. Parking is horrible at this location, I always come early so there is meter parking, but I could imagine if I came at another time, it would probably make me want to leave. The inside of the place looks the same as any other location, similar to a southern diner or something. There are pictures on the wall of president Obama, when he came to visit Roscoe's. As for just the food...I KEEP COMING BACK!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen T.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes was home to my first chicken and waffles experience from back in the day. I never really understood the combination (like fries and ice cream!?), but in this case, I found the combination to be pretty good (albeit pretty unhealthy). Now, everyone and their mother is making chicken and waffles and it's hard to stand out above competition. I split the 1/2 Chix & Waffles w/ gravy on the side with a friend, but it was really too big and we weren't able to finish all. The chicken was pretty good. Crispy, moist, flavorful, but a little salty. The waffle was a big soggy (it definitely was stuck to my plate), covered with an ice-cream scoop sized butterball. Honestly, I think the waffle just needs to step up it's game and it's got a good thing going. We also got the mac & cheese side (which was on the review highlights, but it was probably there for telling people not to get it). It was dry and pretty tasteless. Definitely wouldn't order again. Pretty decent, but I know there's better out there.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: If you live in LA you've been to Roscoes and it's really good. If you're from the south and want a taste of home, itll do in a pinch. Mostly it's great because it's iconic more than because its great on its own. It's one of those LA landmarks where you might see some famous people and you get to wait in line if you go a peak hours and pay too much for food you could get better other places. All that being said, it's worth going to.

Reviews.Author: Shaka S.
Reviews.Content: Is it over-priced? Yes. Is it oh-so-satisfying? Yes, again. I kick myself every time I walk out of the building with my to-go order. I think to myself: Fifteen dollars for three chicken legs and a waffle?! Robbery! But then, when I make it home and bite into that crispy, tender chicken leg and shove a huge, sweet 'n buttery piece of waffle into my mouth it all becomes worth the price. I've dined in once or twice. It was alright, I guess. The staff was friendly enough and it was warm and welcoming. They really do their best to give off the whole..."down-home"... vibe. I kind of have a thing about tourists and tourist attractions, though so I prefer to just take my food home. So to end this....the food is good but what you're really paying for is the experience. With that in mind be prepared to come out of your wallet a bit. That's all.

Reviews.Author: Nathan N.
Reviews.Content: The food is awesome! We had a little wait at 11pm but it was well worth it once we were seated and ordered we received our food very quickly. We didn't see much of our waiter but if he did come by my mouth would have been full anyway. Awesome place to eat!

Reviews.Author: Krista F.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is simply the best. Aside from the obvious chicken and waffles, I'm completely obsessed with their syrup. It seems to have the perfect mix of vanilla and cinnamon to it that gives it a subtle warmth. I also highly recommend the macaroni and cheese.

Reviews.Author: Mark L.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best fried chicken. Just awesome dude.The waffle sucks. I'd go back for the chicken no doubt though. It was bomb. Good sunrise too (OJ+lemonade). Try the side dishes! Mac n cheese, grits (I love grits), sweet pot. fries, etc.. Good good.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: There was a group of us.They were all unsure about the food, but luckily, the excitement of the trip was contagious.I ordered the fried chicken breast, a waffle, and collard greens, which I would later be teased for because of the price of the side. And do not forget the sweet tea! It may be growing on me, but only within the sanctuary of a southern restaurant. If I must have it, then I will only have it done right. The waffle was so sweet and so thick, warm and steaming right from the griddle. I almost wanted to go out on the veranda, sip my sweet tea and watch the sunrise over the swamps. It felt so old-style southern, to munch on it, lightly drizzled in a little maple syrup and a dollop of churned butter. It probably also helped that I was wearing a long, cotton dress, only enhancing that southern charm that surrounded the meal. The fried chicken was done so well, moist, succulent, sweet just like the waffle. I am convinced that the batter they use for the waffle is also used for the chicken, or at least some of it, because the flavors meld so well together that it makes a person, me in this case, sigh with desire, with contentment, like a good morning kiss from the love of your life. I ate the chicken piece by piece, with my hands, never with a fork, only making sure I touch the greasy, crispy brown fried goodness. The collard greens were better this time around. They weren't drenched in oil, in vinegar, as one can see. They were piled high and so delicious. Warm and with a slight bit of crunch still within them, I still used my fingers to eat them. This, perhaps, was outside the southern charm, the southern manners that this place may benefit from, but I didn't care. There was no reason to scorn me for enjoying this soul food, just me and the food, nothing else. Roscoe's wins hands down, because the sweetness and the golden crisp of the fried chicken blew me away. And the fact that it could be eaten later, in my case later that evening, and in MJ's case, a night ago, made this meal something that was worth enjoying day after day, never once the taste disappearing.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This place never gets old and it is always a treat to come here! The wait is always worth it and is one of the reasons I love LA

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: I really had no idea what to expect; As this was my first time having Chicken & Waffles together, I thought this is either going to be amazing or just.. horrible. Luckily it was amazing! WOW the Chicken was surprisingly tender, moist & juicy! packed with great flavor and not too much salt either. The waffles & mac n' cheese was great too! well done, I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: Food: Wow, all the hype of this place really was true. Hype is something that is not real, and this food was all real. I ordered the Scoe's, but with the 1/2 chicken instead of the 1/4. I felt that this place would be like the countless other food places which give smll portions of food at lucrative prices. The lucrative prices were present, but the food taste and portion size was definitely worth the price. The order of chicken was so big it required its own plate. The chicken was SMOTHERED in gravy, which was quite the delicacy. The waffles tasted awesome as well, but because I spent so much time on devouring the chicken, they got cold pretty quick, but still tasted marvelous. I only managed to eat all of the chicken, and a waffle, with one waffle left. Simply put, this place's food rocks! The only negative I have is that some chicken portions are just riddled with bones, which I feel should not be on the platter. Also, the Sprite that time was really old tasting, and by that I mean the carbonated drink had gone flat. Atmosphere: This place seems to be always packed, so if you're really dying of hunger I suggest you do not come here, or expect to wait a while. From what I saw, there are only tables and chairs, and I am quite fond of booths, so I did not like that fact. You pay up front.Customer service: Pretty bland. The lady outside taking reservations did not seem to enjoy being stuck outside, which made my first views on the place not so good. I feel people should love what they are doing, or find work elsewhere. The waitress was pretty good, but she did not offer much on the etiquette of the place, even though I told her it was my first time here. I spent 10 minutes waiting for her to come back to our table, so she could see I was leaving the cash on the table, but it turns out she left, seeing as we were her last table. The cash register lady was also not so customer friendly, just counting the cash earned from the day. She also initiated the conversation we had by telling me, "You do know tip is not included in the check, right?" Obviously I knew...

Reviews.Author: Jonas S.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is easily one of the most popular restaurants in Los Angeles. Why?....I'm still trying to figure that out. There's ALWAYS a pretty long wait to get in, and when you finally do get inside, you realize that its nothing to write home about. I understand that chicken and waffles are good, but there really isn't anything about Roscoes that stands out for me. Don't get me wrong, it was good...but, it wan't anything worth waiting the hour to get. Not only that, but the woman at the hostess stand outside is so rude!Maybe it's me, but I wan't a big fan. I'll be taking my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Leann R.
Reviews.Content: So so good!!! I'm a southerner and I have to say, this place can fry the heck out of some chicken. Delicious!

Reviews.Author: Renee D.
Reviews.Content: I'm from Ohio and when I found out I was going to Anaheim I immediately looked up to see how close was the nearest Roscoes. I got an opportunity to go and I'm glad I did. If for nothing else for the reason of saying I got to go. The chicken was good it was fresh and hot; the food came out quickly. The waffle was very thin but flavorful. When you walk into the restaurant there's a sign that states that they are ranked no 1. For their Mac & cheese so I had to try. It was just ok. I know some regular folks who have better mac & cheese. Overall, the food was good but I don't have to go again. I'm a foodie so I'm just very glad I can add them to my list of famous food places.

Reviews.Author: Ben L.
Reviews.Content: The wait was short for seating. After seating it took 10 mins before we got menus. 45 mins later a waiter showed up and said he didn't know we hadn't been helped! He was really nice and our food came quick like in 10 mins. He comped our sides and drinks so that made up for it. Chicken and waffles were great but the Mac n cheese is what's happening here. The lighting is weird and feels like you're in a club. Good R&B old school music though.

Reviews.Author: Ashley D.
Reviews.Content: Everything good you hear about roscoes is true. They really live up to their hype with their soul food. I always eat here whenever I make a trip to LA. I get the "Obama special" which is three wings and a waffle. Their Mac n Cheese is a MUST HAVE too! Everything is delicious and I am not even playing. I've eaten at two locations in LA and both are hellllla gooood. MUST TRY!

Reviews.Author: patty t.
Reviews.Content: Brought my kids here so they could taste the food at this landmark Hollywood location. They loved it! Juicy battered chicken and waffles with lots of butter and syrup. DOn't know why the combo of salty and sweet  works, but it does.

Reviews.Author: Jay J.
Reviews.Content: This place has changed a lot since the last time I was here.  They expanded, so your wait to get in is very short.  We didn't even wait 10 min.   But there was only 2 of us.  Service was good, but the food was even better!  It came so fast once you place your order.   Everything was fabulous!  The chicken is seasoned, and the waffles were awesome, like no other waffles that I've ever had.  There are a lot of places that try and do the chicken and waffles, but you can't just do plane waffles, these are like cinnamon waffles! I've been to a couple of Roscoe's, but I think this is the best one.

Reviews.Author: Barbara M.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Roscoes location very original the vibe is always Hollywood and it's also the closest to my house! This location is probably the busiest as well, on a weekend be prepared to wait around 30 mins to an hour but trust me it's worth the wait go for a walk down sunset while you wait ;)Nooooow when it comes to the food there is no question BEST waffles and chicken in the world!!!

Reviews.Author: Ringo M.
Reviews.Content: I still don't understand the concept of Chicken&Waffles, but they are delicious!But what is the big deal about Roscoe's? If I were to order a bucket of KFC and fix myself a box of Eggo's, would that be any different? I also paid $2 for a glass of Minute Maid orange juice, and if they use Minute Maid, i don't suppose their chicken is free range or anything like that.....So why would I pay 13+ per person when I can use the same amount of money and feed a whole table. Enlighten me, Yelpers. Tell me how Roscoe stands out from other chicken&waffle stores? Or from KFC&EGGO for that matter.

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: Had the "Obama Special", formerly known as the "Country Boy". If I were to base my presidential vote solely on the integrity of his namesake lunch plate, well, I wouldn't have owed so much in taxes for last year.I guess I should've known that three wings wouldn't fill me up. Mostly "fry" and bone, I immediately regretted using up all the meat making little chicken/waffle-ette sandwiches drenched in syrup. I didn't get much of a sense of flavor in the chicken itself. It was my first time, and probably last. I'm going to be 30 in two years and I don't work out nearly as often as I should. Probably best for me to stay away, especially when Popeyes is pretty much just as good AND less than half the egregiously high price. Also -- the valet was $14?!?!?!? HHAHAAHHAAHAHA. It's Hollywood but c'mon man.

Reviews.Author: Elena D.
Reviews.Content: So I have always been wanting to try this place heard it was the best!! Since me and my husband recently moved here that's the first place I wanted to go!! So we went and I had the biscuits and gravy ... I must say I love biscuits and gravy but this was nothing like what I have tried the gravy was more like mash potato gravy tasted bland... Biscuit was dry... I was really disappointed.... I will not be going back :(

Reviews.Author: Zerrilyn P.
Reviews.Content: First stop during our "Fab Four SoCal Vacay"...Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles!!We all came on an empty stomach, so of course we were feeling pretty hungry and excited (more hungry though lol) when we got there.  I was excited because of the fact that I could compare it to "House of Chicken and Waffles" in Oakland.  And honestly, I would have to say it's a tie between the two, that is...if you're talking about the food itself :)We went to the one in Hollywood...not too far away from the Hollywood sign haha...location isn't all that pretty though...parking is just horrible b/c the plaza right next to it absolutely doesn't permit Roscoe's parking....we were lucky enough to find one spot left on the street.  And of course it had to be near a group of weirdos gazing at you while getting out of your car...they were harmless though.The ambience of the restaurant is pretty dim, but well kept.  We came at a good time, only several tables were occupied.  Wait staff is excellent and courteous.  I ordered the Obama special (1 waffle and 3 chicken wings), which was just the perfect size for me.  I also ordered the Eclipse (oj,fruit punch and lemonade)--it was way too sugary, ick..., but luckily the guy brought our table a round of water.  The waffle was warm and soft, and the fried chicken was sooo yum...evenly cooked and crispy!  It was so good I used my syrup as dipping sauce for my chicken lol...everyone else had big ass portions of 1/2 chicken and 2 waffles.Thanks for a good first-time experience Roscoe's...I'll be back here one of these days, but while I'm here in NorCal, I have Oakland's Chicken and Waffles to help satisfy my cravings haha.

Reviews.Author: Tiara F.
Reviews.Content: MY WAITRESS IS A THIEF!!Although the chicken is alright, the service was horrible. My waiter ignored us on plenty of occasions and NEVER filled our drinks up. I've worked in restaurants and I know what it takes to give excellent customer service, but I've never been to an establishment where we barely got any service at all. She did not ask us if our food was ok, if we needed anything, NOTHING.So naturally, I did not leave her a tip. I believe in giving great tips to great waiters, but this lady was horrible. Not to mention... SHE ADDED HER OWN TIP TO THE RECEIPT!! How crazy is it to look at your bank statement and see that the authorized charge was much higher than what you originally paid for. Unfortunately, I cannot dispute the charge because I was in a hurry and my husband signed the receipt without putting a line through the tip and adding the total amount. That was our fault, but still, that doesn't mean that it's ok to commit credit card FRAUD. I'm pretty sure that she knows that adding your own tip without the customer's authorization is illegal and she can potentially be fired. Obviously she doesn't care.

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: Went to Roscoe's and ordered the Scoe's...yummalicious!!  This was my first time going there so it was quite the experience.  I absolutely love the seasoning and breading that is on the fried chicken. I could probably eat just a plate of that but I wouldn't want to give up the waffles that quickly. We went at 9 pm so there were a lot of families enjoying dinner but it was interesting being greeted by a security guard like I was going into a club. I thought I'd get carded but I hear that it can get a bit crazy in there after 11 pm.  I'll definitely have to go back again because I some a few more dishes I have to at least try! If you've never been there before, you have to at least go once for the experience.

Reviews.Author: Ben S.
Reviews.Content: Plates of cardio-vascular disorders coming right up! Chicken and Waffles never is intended to be healthy, but my heart races in excitement every time I eat this stuff ... then it stops after for a few seconds. It's just good food. Great soul food done right and fast. The service here is a little faster than the Pico location. It also looks a little newer if you sit in the larger dining area. So definite pluses already for this location. Regardless of the décor, what I love most about Roscoe's is that they keep it simple and traditional. No gimmicks, no fancy ingredients or new scientific methods to cook the damn bird. Just plain good ol' food. Recommendation : Scoe's 1/4 Chix with Gravy on the side. Put some hot sauce in the gravy and dip away! Preserve the waffle! Never drench with syrup, just dip. But eat both simultaneously so the waffle is still delicious and not an after thought. Mmmmm

Reviews.Author: Mahogany C.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of their chicken I always get the 6.99 meal special. i think it's two thighs with rice, gravy and a biscuit. Just enough food for just the right price! The only downfall is the long wait at times..... but I guess if you want to go to a popular restaurant be ready to wait your turn.

Reviews.Author: Sharon C.
Reviews.Content: They do not take reservations and you may experience a wait. Parking is hourly so you'll have to vote someone in your party to go out and feed the meter to avoid being ticketed.I had the chicken wings, greens and macaroni and cheese. My food came out quickly and was fresh. All the items were delicious and were respectable sized servings.I'll definately go back for more when in the area.

Reviews.Author: Joanne W.
Reviews.Content: If you want to fatten up, this is where to go to in L.A. I was here with two friends last week for a concert, and we ended up here. I had myself Herb's Special: two wings served southern style, with two waffles. Boy, it was delicious. I can't even explain.(Tip: Go early, because you're going to wait for a bit)!

Reviews.Author: Ashley N.
Reviews.Content: You would think after a nice tiring hike up the hollywood sign, that Roscoe's would be like .. the ultimate reward. Or at least that is why I thought ... but man... I was wrong. Luckily our wait was not long, or I would be even more bitter about my meal. I ordered the chicken and waffles (obviously) and was ready to be blown away. Once I got my food... I was not impressed. The waffle was nothing extraordinary except a plain buttermilk waffle. The chicken was basically the same chicken I could have gotten from KFC. AND I had to pick out bones?? Not cool... Don't get me wrong it wasn't a crappy meal or anything. In fact, it was very filling, and portion wise- you could comfortably split a meal between two. Prices weren't too bad. I think it was like ~14 a portion? Overall, there was just nothing special! I just expected much more from such a popular restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: Okay, went to try the Chicken & Waffles. We got a side of greens and mac & cheese. The service was quick and the food came hot. The chicken and waffles were good, the side dishes were just okay, nothing to write home about. I would go again just for the chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Heidi B.
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the hype is about this place, well ok the waffle was awesome! Although my experience wasn't all that, I will give it another shot next time I'm in town!Pros: excellent customer service, quick to take our orderCons: the fried chicken skin was so hard, I started wondering if I was biting on a bone.Not sure how the Mac n cheese got it's world famous status as it wasn't all that, and it was also cold!The tables were sticky to the touch, made it hard to get comfortable.

Reviews.Author: Nasto D.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a must every time we head to LA. The portions are good and the taste is divine. I always get the Natalie Special which is two waffles and my other half switches things up each time. The waffles I can speak for. We enjoy trying foods and the waffle mix is one we have tried to recreate, but unfortunately we've been unsuccessful (perhaps honey, cinnamon, and.... not sure)This has been the only location we've tried and each time we've been, we've sat in the same spot. It is bittersweet and makes for a reminiscing experience. Perhaps I will step outside the box, but for now this Natalie will stick with the Natalie Special!!

Reviews.Author: SJ Y.
Reviews.Content: Somehow ended up here around 1am and got in without much waiting! Got the Sir Michael and Mac n Cheese. It was pretty good. Chicken was crisp, mac n cheese was rather heavy but I am sure that's how it's supposed to be, and gravy was on point. Slightly regret not getting waffles, but oh well. The grit tasted quite interesting...it was like oatmeal with quinoa.All in all, not too shabby. Came out to be around $16.50 for the food.

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: This place is OVERHYPED, OVERRATED, OVERPRICED, and the food is just plain GROSS. You have got to be drunk to enjoy this food.  If this is LA standards for a 4 star restaurant, I'm not sure I want to eat in LA. I came here with my boyfriend and dragged his family along because it seemed like one of most popular eateries in LA based on Yelp reviews and word of mouth. My boyfriend and I got Scoes No. 1 with 1/4 a chick and 2 waffles. We also got a side of Mac and Cheese. I got dark meat and my boyfriend got white meat. This meal was expensive for fried chicken and waffles. We payed a whopping 11 dollars per plate and an extra 5 bucks for a tiny bowl of Mac and Cheese. The chicken was bland. The skin tasted like oil. I thought maybe it would have a CAJUN spice kick. This place is supposed to serve soul food I thought, but the chicken was tasteless. My dark meat was tender, but my boyfriends meat was tough. Any of the fried chicken chains has better tasting chicken, particularly popyes and it's a lot cheaper too. I've had fried chicken in gas stations in Louisiana, and the chicken tastes a lot better. Soul food should have a cajun spice kick, and roscoe's chicken does not!The waffles were supbar. They were SOGGY. Waffles should be CRISPY. Lego Ego waffles from a box fixed in a toaster taste better. We got mac and cheese because according to yelp reviews it's the best. The mac and cheese was also pretty tasteless, chunky, and seemed to mostly consist of butter. The pasta texture wasn't that great either. I think Mac and Cheese from a box tastes a lot better. Our server was friendly, but not super attentive and the restaurant wasn't that busy at 3 pm. It took her a while to get our bill. The restaurant doesn't have it's own lot and you have to pay for street parking. The surrounding area of the restaurant is a bit sketchy and so is the crowd for being near Hollywood, but maybe most of LA is. Overall, I was embarrased to drag my boyfriend and his family here. Next time I want the fried chicken and waffle experience, I'm heading to Popyes Chicken and popping a waffle into my toaster at home.

Reviews.Author: Lisa G.
Reviews.Content: Ahhh.  I've been going to Roscoe's for years, or maybe decades and it still makes my taste buds happy every time!  Since they expanded this location, it has helped with the lines.  However, on Sundays there are still massive, horrid lines.  I've been here more times than I can count and every time I get the Scoe's 1/4 chicken with waffles.  If you like gravy, you can get it with gravy.  The waffles are big and sweet.  Throw your diet out the door when you go and you won't regret it.  Smother the waffles with butter and syrup.  Go ahead and order some cornbread and mac n cheese while you are at it.  Also get some sweet tea.  You'll go home with a food coma.Street parking only.  You can usually find parking on Gower.  One side of the street is metered, the other isn't and has a 1 hour time limit.

Reviews.Author: Cristine G.
Reviews.Content: I was just telling myself, "what? I haven't reviewed this Roscoe's?"  The first thing I noticed was the rank sewer smell as I opened the car door to the parking spot right in front of the entrance (whoa great parking- lucky me ... It was 11 pm though). So we were ushered to a table and given menus. Hmm, the prices have gone up. Still we ordered the 1/2 chicken with waffles and gravy on the side. A few minutes later our food came out. I asked my boo if my eyes were deceiving me or do the waffles look smaller? I was right. And they were soggy too.  Still I proceeded to dig in. I was starving. I was enjoying the soggy waffle and the juicy chicken breast when my boo said he noticed something skittering across the table. We looked under the plates, the spice bottles and so on. When I turned to the wall beside me I saw mr. Roach strolling right on my line of vision. I immediately stopped it with the balled up napkin if was holding. My boo came to the rescue, brought more napkins and finally took him away. The night watchman was walking by and asked what the fracas was about so my boo showed him, and he called the manager over. She asked "are you guys good?" "Yeah, we're good alright. Good to go." I was trying so much not to hurl the chicken and waffles that felt too much like alien food roiling around in my stomach at this time. Needless to say we couldn't get away from there fast enough. Sorry Roscoe's I won't be coming back to this location. I'd drive to Pasadena or Long Beach if I really have a craving for chicken and waffles next time. Hopefully Mr. Roach's cousin won't show up uninvited either

Reviews.Author: Geoffrey C.
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this review quick because we were seated quickly, served quickly, and scurried out quickly.  I guess this is what we get for arriving at 11:55pm when they close at 12:00am?Pros:- Quick food- Delicious food (for the most part). *I recommend the Scoes*- Good amountCons:- Waffles too soft for my taste- Not many windows compared to other locations, so it feels darker and more enclosedThey didn't seem too happy about wanting to serve us so close to closing, but luckily my friend was persuasive and they let us eat.  It was obvious they didn't need our business, as they were already busy through the day.  However, they could have at least not made it obvious that they were trying to get us out ASAP.  When we paid and left, our waitress was right behind us to leave her shift of the night.  They're lucky their food is so damn good that I'd come back again.

Reviews.Author: Carol C.
Reviews.Content: Live in the San Francisco bay area but whenever I come to Los Angeles, coming to Roscoes is a must. No matter what I do on my stay here I always come to get some delicious chicken and waffles! Their is always a wait before you get seated but its well worth it. All the food is great especially the side of Mac n cheese. Can't wait to come back and satisfy my craving!

Reviews.Author: Daniel M.
Reviews.Content: Another thing Los Angeles is famous for, we set trends out here. I love the chicken & love the mac and cheese. Great on a Sunday for hangover

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: These reviews are seriously cracking me up!YES this place is GHETTOYES this place is noisy YES the service isn't top-notchand YES there is a waitIt's freakin Roscoe's!If you want a 10 minute wait, smiley Disneyland service and a bland, white-bread crowd, go to the Olive Garden.I believe that the best restaurants have a personality. Roscoe's doesn't care about kissing customer's asses and delivering perfect service. They serve delicious, fattening, unhealthy food and conduct business the same way they did years ago. They're staying true to their roots and that's why I like them. How many times do you hear people complain when businesses loose touch with their humble beginnings?Roscoe's hasn't let the fame get to their head and that's why I love this restaurant. The food is simple and great and unique to LA, you can't get this anywhere else. So sit back, relax and know what you're getting yourself into and you will love it. If you're too good for a "ghetto" experience, there are plenty of other places you can try.

Reviews.Author: Megan D.
Reviews.Content: Carol C Special Please!! I drive here from San Diego as often as I can for the most amazing waffle and fried chicken breast on earth! The lemonade is to die for and so is the mac and cheese!

Reviews.Author: Charlene I.
Reviews.Content: Pros:  - FOOD!  Bomb ass fried chicken!  I could eat a #1 everyday for the rest of my life...lol- Fast!  They seat you, take your order and you get your food in 10 minutes =DCons:  Parking & wait time...especially on the weekend...but if you come here expecting this, then you'll deal just fineAnd basically that's all you need to know! Haha

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: First time here and it didn't disappoint! I came here on a Sunday night at 6pm and ordered the Obama special with a side of Mac and cheese. It was absolutely delicious from start to finish. The chicken was moist and crispy. The waffle was crispy and the Mac and cheese was heavenly. I will be back. Big portions and a cheap price!!

Reviews.Author: M L.
Reviews.Content: There was a 45 minute wait which could've been attributed by the Sunday afternoon church crowd.  Once seated, we waited FOREVER for a waiter to visit our table and bring us water.  We asked several other waiters if they could alert our server that we were ready to order but we still waited some time to even be greeted.  You know it's a problem when a table that was seated after you receives their food before you.The food was not bad but also nothing extra special.  Very similar to Chicago's Chicken & Waffles on King Dr.  You would think bc Roscoe's is the original chicken & waffle spot that you'd be getting something worth flying to the other side of the country for but not so much.  BTW, I ordered 2 thighs, mac & cheese, greens, cornbread with a side of candied yams.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne A.
Reviews.Content: Not the first time trying  chicken and waffles but the first coming to roscos. I had heard people speak highly of it and I came in highly disappointed,our waiter took forever to take our order he even took orders from people who sat down long after us. Then orders took forever to come and he messed up on our and didn't get our side orders. The food was decent, I had better. The Mac and cheese was gross, biscuit was super dry, the rice and gravy was blan...I don't plan to come back anytime soon and rather eat at the house of chicken in waffles in Oakland,ca

Reviews.Author: Windy S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not even a chicken fan but oh man this was my favorite breakfast of a week long LA trip! The neighborhood is sketchy & god help you if you end up on the wrong street here... But stick to gps and you'll be fine. Maybe coincided waiting for your table inside this place or in your car. Everything was affordable and portions were large and tasty. Perfect when you're craving comfort food or something to really fill you up!

Reviews.Author: Dominique V.
Reviews.Content: I entered this place with a very closed mind.I have always considered waffles an item that I would never order. Really never liked them. However, the waffles here were outright amazing! I can honestly say they were the best waffles I have ever had! They were soft, fluffy, and full of flavor. The reason I only gave it four stars is because I didn't really like the chicken. I had the gravy and onions one and the southern style one. Both I felt were kind of dry. To be fair, I don't really like fried chicken or gravy. Lots of other people swear on this chicken though.Like others, I experienced some awful service.  Maybe they are just really busy.Final point; I would love to go back and have their waffles again.

Reviews.Author: Noel I.
Reviews.Content: As much hype as this place gets, I wasn't impressed. Maybe we came on an off day for the restaurant but it just didn't meet any of my expectations that all the hype has implied. First off, I have to say its expensive. We ordered a 2 piece dark and 2 waffles combo and another combo that was one breast and a waffle and two drinks. That equaled up to about $30. Now I can see paying that if the pieces of chicken were huge pieces but they certainly were not. The flavor of the chicken was well missing. It had no flavor. It's like they dusted the chicken in flour and threw in the fryer. Now I'm an avid dark meat person because of the tendency of it being moist and juicy. The thigh and drumstick they gave me was drier than the Sahara. You probably could use it as a shammy to soak up water after washing your car. The meat on those pieces was pretty scarce and what I could get was just unappetizing. The waffles were somewhat soggy and just didn't hold up to the butter and the syrup. The service was ok and at least I get to say I tried it. I did discover something that was pretty good. After putting hot sauce on my dry pieces of chicken, some of the sauce got onto my syrup covered waffle. I have to say the hot sauce on the waffle was pretty good. I know gross but hey you like what you like. Maybe I'll might give it another try but we'll see. There are so many great places to eat in LA.

Reviews.Author: Ozzy Z.
Reviews.Content: Jean Jones Omelet! Thats my favorite dish there! The waffles are also great! I've been coming to this place for years and never really encountered any issues or anything. Sometimes the waitresses are a bit flirtatious, which is never a bad thing. Lol. This place isn't for everyone, but worth a shot. Don't forget to check out the mural on top the register area.

Reviews.Author: Tracy T.
Reviews.Content: Highlights: - I like that they offer a wide range of combinations. I was especially happy when I saw a combo where I could get a side of mac n cheese, collard greens, corn bread, and 2 thighs. I honestly love sides more than chicken and waffles, sorry Roscoe! - The best part was that I was also able to place a side order for a waffle to complete my chicken and waffle experience. Score! - This was totally enough to share for a light brunch without feeling disgustingly unhealthy and allowed me room for dessert afterwards around the vicinity.Improvements: - I still don't get the idea behind chicken and waffles. I like my chicken separate from my waffles and they both should taste amazing. The chicken felt like it was over fried, not much meat left as it was crisp to the bone.  - My waffle was filling, floppy, and soft. I like crispier waffles. Over hyped and overrated.- I thought the sides may have came to the rescue, but nothing really stood out. The corn bread was dry and butter didn't really do it justice.  - Wait time was about an hour for a party of 8 on Sunday for lunch. Street parking around the area is only 2 hour at most 7 days a week with meter maids walking around. Tip:There was a line before lunch and still a bunch of people outside waiting after lunch. Have someone in your party come earlier to put their name on the wait list or else I hope your group has a lot of patience.

Reviews.Author: Michal T.
