Reviews.Content: As I contemplate what to write about this place, I realize that not much needs to be said about the epic combination that is chicken and waffles, the name speaks for itself to a degree higher than can be achieved by any extravagance of authorship. But I'll try regardless.This place is awesome. To start with the peripheral points: it's clean, spacious, has hefty portion sizes and a welcoming staff.Now for the meat: the food here is delicious. The fact that you can get a huge plate of perfectly cooked waffles paired with moist chicken drenched in gravy that still retains its crispy skin is splendiferous. If I lived in LA and didn't mind the weight gain this would be a staple for me. Waffles are one of man's greatest inventions and although chicken has its detesters, I eat it almost daily. What this place has done is certainly commendable, as in these times of constant divorces, Roscoe's has married the perfect couple of ingredients in the holiest of matrimonies. And this relationship is sure to stand the test of time as we came here late one evening and the place was flooded with more people than the hottest club in Hollywood down the street. So yes, quell your misconceptions and sink your teeth into a nice meal at Roscoe's and you won't ever look back. If you don't trust me, just look at the other thousands of reviews.Cheers!

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: If you like EXTRAs on your food and drinks you'll like this place. Lemonade = extra extra sweet = goodBiscuit has extra butter on it = not necessary Chicken = extra good Collard greens = extra soft and salty = good Mac & cheese = extra creamy Grits = my extra favorite Service was subpar

Reviews.Author: Rose W.
Reviews.Content: Came here because my friend visiting me told us we had to try it. Because our wishlist was long, this was our second food stop of the night.THE FOOD is okay. It's not anything special - just waffle and chicken. I wasn't really sure how to eat it, so I tried different techniques, such as: -pouring gravy unto the waffle-pouring syrup unto the chicken (don't do it)-eating a piece of chicken then a piece of waffle-eating a gravy-soaked piece of chicken and then a syrup soaked piece of waffle -forking in a piece of chicken and waffle in at the same timeI didn't really have an epiphany or discovery of the best way to optimize the taste, because it was just chicken and waffle. Perhaps it was because I had already eaten before coming here, but the chicken/waffle combination was not anything out of this world nor was it any different from my expectations of what chicken and waffles should taste like. THE SERVICE was very friendly. We came in, told the waiter that we just wanted to try their signature dish, because we had heard alot and we were just trying things out. We originally felt bad because there were four of us to a table, and all we wanted was one dish to share. But he was very understanding and super chill. He recommended Scoe's "1/4 Chix smothered with gravy & onions, 2 waffles, our own mix" so we got that. He even got us individual plates so we could share!THE AMBIANCE was lively. The place was well decorated, and one of my friends, who had visited the Long Beach location, said this one was classier and nicer than the other one.Okay - so I still don't understand the chicken and waffles thing, but I really enjoyed my experience at Roscoe's and I would definitely visit another time when my stomach isn't full to see if I will have a food epiphany.

Reviews.Author: Jacob D.
Reviews.Content: Not only was the food delicious but the service was also great! My phone was almost dead and I was waiting on an important call from the hospital. I I asked to charge my phone and they didn't hesitate at all to assist me. They came by and asked if everything was on and gave comfort to my wife. Great job!

Reviews.Author: Hai L.
Reviews.Content: The first time I had Roscoe's, I wasn't sold right away. The chicken was good, but not blown away like everyone else seems to be by it. However, the next couple visits I was all about it! Maybe it was a fluke and the chef was in training or something? Awesome menu, could pick and choose over so many items. Service is always excellent here too. Great atmosphere, and great location!

Reviews.Author: Melanie T.
Reviews.Content: I love frequenting this specific Roscoe's location. I feel like they have the best food.  This place is always busy during the normal peak times. Arrive 15mins before the rush and you'll be seated and served in no time. I must say their waffle size has gone economical size it's still a good size to share with two people though. Keeps your chow-down in check!

Reviews.Author: Marcela Q.
Reviews.Content: Not much to say other that it's delicious. Every time I go to SoCal I have to go to Roscoes. The wait may be long but it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Had chicken and waffles with gravy and corn bread. Waffles were nothing special, but the meal in general was okay. Nothing stellar. People come here because of the "name." There are better food joints around Hollywood. I'd skip Roscoe's and head for Pink's Hot Dogs next time.

Reviews.Author: Sean T.
Reviews.Content: Solid good food.

Reviews.Author: Kelly K.
Reviews.Content: I know what your problem is. You think us folk from the country's real funny-like, dontcha? Yeah, well saddle up the mule, ma. Slide me some grits, I's got to get me some edu-cation. You asshole!Chicken is fucking delicious and everyone loves it fried. Add some greens, corn bread, red beans, rice, greens, and a slice of sweet potato pie. All for sharing, of course. Don't go to Roscoe's by yourself, that's just greedy. This is my favorite Roscoe's even though the parking sucks and there's condoms littering Gower. Oh, you think I jest?Something about chicken smothered in syrup just gets me going. Now, I wouldn't get in the trunk of a car with the promise of Roscoe's, but that's another story. If you like fatty, delicious Southern home cooking, Roscoe's is what you need! I'd probably eat here every day if these jeans would let me. They already know the red beans and rice didn't miss me. I'm a fan of the Carol B Special, because it leaves room for all the greens and other side deliciousness. 'if you haven't gone, go, you silly goose!

Reviews.Author: LPthang S.
Reviews.Content: Heard a lot of good things, I myself came from the bay to try it out and I must say the food was ok. I have had better, but the waitress was great! May come back to get chicken and waffles...

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: The original Roscoe's Chicken and waffles!Get ready to get down and dirty, cause you gotta use your hands. MMMMMMM tasty. I ordered a half chicken meal to share with my boyfriend. I had collared greens and mac n' cheese for my sides. And I put the gravy on the side. Good stuffThe line looks long but it moves pretty fast and be sure your whole party is there or you won't be sat until they are.

Reviews.Author: Robbie C.
Reviews.Content: I went to this Roscoe's with my family on December 27th for the very first time because I heard you MUST go there when you are in LA and my daughter wanted to go here for her birthday. The good: the food was delicious and the service was friendly! The bad: the prices are unreasonable. This place will "nickel and dime" you especially for the sides, Potato salad for $4.90? I expected more that a sherbet size scoop of potato salad with a lot of lettuce under it. I ordered the 3 wings with greens ($10.90) and when I asked if it comes with cornbread I was surprised to learn that I would have to pay an extra $2.80 if I wanted a piece.Don't be fooled that this is a "down home" restaurant because they charge like an upscale one, My bill for one adult and 3 kids was $78.15! I can feed a family of four for a week for that much money, I have this receipt taped to my refrigerator to remind myself to never go here again. ..

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: What a trip!  I actually passed by this place twice trying to find it.  All I saw was this single story building with no windows.  I finally saw a small "Roscoe's" sign and ventured in.  I have been to the location on Pico so I "get" the kitch factor.There is a huge difference between rating some food and experiencing a meal.  This is such a throwback, ethnic, cool, legit soul food Mecca that you kind of give them a pass on the less than stellar dishes.  From the funky facade to the gentleman that seated us, to the lemonade, to the ethnic clientele, to the concept of a piece of spicy fried chicken served atop a sweet and soft waffle, this place is a blast.  I had the red beans and rice with greens, corn bread and a fried chick breast. It was all delicious.Such a funky spot.  I loved it.

Reviews.Author: Saroya W.
Reviews.Content: Whoever thought of the combination of chicken and waffles was a genius. Roscoe, whoever and wherever you are, thank you for bringing this wonderful idea to fruition and creating a chain of restaurants. I've come here for dinner, for late night eats, and I'm always pleased with what I get, which doesn't really change. Why would you get anything but what this place is named for? Well, I did get fries on the side once, and those were good too.Only bummer is because this place is delicious, it is always so crowded in the evening. It can get pretty loud in the restaurant for one thing. And then sometimes the wait can be ridiculously long for a table.But if one is visiting the Los Angeles area, this eating experience should not be missed.

Reviews.Author: Saad C.
Reviews.Content: Long overdue review... How this place is in business and so popular has been something that i've still been trying to figure out til this day...its almost as absurd as George W. Bush being elected for 2 terms...The fact that this place is rated so high is just the epitome of how ignorant Americans really are. It already has hype so the majority of these superficial ignorant people that walk in here come in with the mindset that they're about to have an amazing meal, and of course you got autographed photos of celebs hung up all over the walls, so these ignorant people think theyre eating at some legit spot that celebs endorse and dine at....when the truth is its all just marketing.There is nothing good about this place.... Ok, maybe the waffles are kind of good, but why go here for waffles when you could go somewhere else much better, like Griddle Cafe? The chicken isnt great and not worth $12 or whatever the price is.. I'd rather pay double the price and go to a different place to eat.  In fact, I'd rather buy a couple pieces of chicken from KFC, warm up some eggo's at home, and that will still be better than this shit.  And by the way, the one star is for the fact that my last visit here, there was a hair in my friend Shah's waffle (gross) ... they simply just replaced his waffle with a new one, and didnt charge him for one... uhh... the waffles cost like 30 cents to make, why not just not just comp him for both of the waffles instead of just one, is $8 a big deal for you guys?

Reviews.Author: Kevin R.
Reviews.Content: When it comes to famous restaurants, LA definitely has its fair share. A lot of them are fine dining celebrity hot spots but Roscoe's is good old Southern soul food that anyone and everyone can enjoy (although it's had plenty of celeb customers as well). The Gower location of Roscoe's is probably the most famous, even though it's not the original (which I believe is in Long Beach). This stretch of Gower gets some seriously traffic. Especially if you're here late on a Saturday night, like we were. The valet is always backed up, and for us it was no different. Regardless, it's still better than searching for a meter, so just save yourself the headache and cough up the $8.When we showed up, around 9pm or so, there was a bunch of people waiting outside. I thought that meant we were in for an insanely long wait, but to our surprise we were seated immediately. Not only did we have absolutely no wait time, we were also sat in the very back of the restaurant in a small two-person table directly under the, according to the guy that sat us, original Roscoe's neon sign. So cool! As if that wasn't enough, directly in front of me was the framed photos of Obama's surprise visit not too long ago! I took plenty of Instagram photos, believe me.Besides the sign and photos, one thing that stood out was the security. There were humungous security guards made of solid muscle standing at each door. Hmm... Scary or comforting? You be the judge...As it says in its name, you come here for two things -- chicken and waffles. Well if that's what they're famous for, that's what I'm getting! However we took it one step further. Instead of getting one of their delicious looking combos, we ended up getting a bunch of side orders to share. We got four chicken legs, smothered potatoes, mac and cheese, and, of course, one waffle each.The chicken was absolutely amazing! It was so tender and juicy with a nice crispy exterior to round things out. The smothered potatoes were quite possibly the best potatoes I've had. Usually I'm not crazy about these boring, starchy things, but I can appreciate the good ones. The mac and cheese was so gooey and cheesy it put the Vons heat lamp stuff to shame. The waffle too was delicious! One thing you MUST do is take a bite of the chicken and waffle together. I thought it was a weird mixture, but it turned out to be so delicious it basically blew my mind. And yes, it was my first time trying this amazing combination. But it for sure won't be my last time!Roscoe's serves up what can be called the epitome of comfort food. It's listed in plenty of tourist books that chronicle the famous LA hot spots, but unlike most, it totally, completely lived up to the hype! They don't skimp on the portions and you're guaranteed to leave full and satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Dianne B.
Reviews.Content: Lol I really don't understand the hype with this chicken and waffles stuff! I've tried chicken and waffles from many places and still to me its still taste like chicken and waffles nothing special.We ordered chicken and waffles and a side of Mac and cheese.-I like my waffles crunchy and the one they serve is soggy kinda like an ego you took from the toaster a little to soon? Yep exactly like that!-The chicken was ok nothing special it was chicken . It had a nice crunch and was quite juicy but nothing out of the ordinary. -The Mac and cheese was pretty good. Really creamy and cheesy. Small side portion but hey that's me being greedy lol.Now I'm quite upset that people kept recommending this place to me but to be fair they weren't horrible I guess from all the "hype" I expected it to be amazing but it was "JUST OKAY." Service was quick and it was pretty cheap. Of course I have to give them a couple more chances before I completely shut them out but for now I could live without Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: good chicken. must go to eat spot whenever im in so cal. i had the breast and waffle meal with an extra breast and a side of mac n cheese

Reviews.Author: Paul H.
Reviews.Content: No other chicken place matters. Only Roscoes. Best chicken ever. I prefer the wings with a waffle, the Obama Special is perfect. It's also affordable.

Reviews.Author: Ann W.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's lived up to the hype!!!  This was a bucket list item that we were glad to cross off the list.  Seated and eating within 10 minutes, which was awesome because of the tricky street parking situation out front (1 hour limit on weekdays).Chicken and Waffles...best combo since PB & J!!!!

Reviews.Author: Maya N.
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time. Chicken and biscuit were good. Waffle was sad, soft, and seemed microwaved... And the woman in the front when we were paying was so damn rude. Her attitude alone made me never want to go back. This place was way too boosted. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Katherine T.
Reviews.Content: Fastest service yesterday night. I felt like I ordered with the waitress and my food came out right away. My friends had the Obama special (3 wings and a waffle) and I had one leg & one waffle plate. So good. I was trying to give up eating out...but you got to make an exception for Roscoes. Apparently voted the best Mac & Cheese in town...I must try that next time. Roscoes didn't do it for me until I learned that you had to pour syrup onto your chicken and waffle. My friends can tell you this...I'm a slow learner.

Reviews.Author: Elaine L.
Reviews.Content: Pretty long story if I was to get into the details of how I got to and from Roscoe's, it's a funny one but it's not related to Roscoe's directly so I'll save it for my friends haha.For some reason, I searched up the hours for Roscoe's and this once site told me that the place closed at 8pm, so my friend and I were rushing from UCLA to get to Roscoe's during prime traffic time on Wilshire and Santa Monica. I arrived at Roscoe's around 8pm, seated and ready to order. I was seated fairly quickly and my waitress was really nice.  I decided to try their fresh squeezed lemonade which turned out to be sweet and refreshing. However, the regular size was a bit small and little pricey, considering that there was no free refill.In the end, I ended up ordering my food to go because my friend had no way of finding parking. I'm assuming that it's pretty tough to find parking around that neighborhood since most of the streets were 'No Parking.' A bit of a turnoff. I ordered their original with the waffles and crispy chicken and didn't have to wait long for my order.  I was pretty satisfied with my to go order when I saw that inside a huge bag there was about 9 containers of butter, syrup, and spicy sauce.  Wow, talk about unlimited supply! I didn't end up finishing all of it, but it was nice to know I didn't need to worry about not having enough.Partially because I was extremely hungry at the time, I devoured the chicken which was juicy and tender.  The waffles themselves were decent, not the best quality, but they were very filling since they give you 2 huge slices of waffles.Definitely will be returning to Roscoe's again sometime in the future, but not sometime soon. My stomach can only handle their fattiness once every 4-5 months.  Also, I would rather go to the one in Rosemead which is closer to me and has a parking structure.  Seriously, being able to find parking is a determining factor!

Reviews.Author: Angela L.
Reviews.Content: Second attempt at trying to dine at Roscoe's. The first one failed - it was a Sunday afternoon around 2 pm, I drove all the way to Sunset Blvd thinking everyone should be done eating lunch at that hour it must have been a great, empty time to try it. Nope. Line went as long as the next block. Some other day.Last Wednesday, about lunch time, I thought: weekday! No one surely has time to eat out. Nope. When we arrived, there was a wait but it seemed tolerable, so we opted to wait. About 10 minutes, we were in.I've never been to the southern states, and I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in. The place had that "feel" and "ambiance" of what I think a restaurant in the south might be (wherever I may have picked that idea up). The service was nice, and I went to get the #2. 1/4 chicken with 2 waffles, and the onion gravy on the side. I also ordered a mac & cheese side.It was okay. To me, I thought that it was hyped too much as the best "chicken and waffles" in Los Angeles. I have never had chicken and waffles, and what interested me during this visit was the combination experience, not so much the taste of the chicken and waffles itself. Digging into the chicken gave me that salty taste in my mouth, but a shift to the buttered waffle and maple syrup brings out the balance of the whole dish. But I've had better chicken. I've had better waffles - and I also prefer my waffles a bit more on the crunchy side. Mac & cheese wasn't good, I wouldn't recommend it. Overall, an interesting experience to try a sweet and salty combination - and I appreciated it a lot - but people should be a lot more careful on tossing around the word "best".There's plenty of street parking, but during peak hours, a lengthy walk might be a bit necessary.

Reviews.Author: Doron K.
Reviews.Content: Who doesn't love Roscoes? Been coming here even before Jackie Brown and Swingers mentioned it. Just as good as ever.

Reviews.Author: Kali C.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice now and CANNOT see what the big gotdamn deal is. The chicken is naaaaaaaaaaaasty. NO flavor at all! I swear it was like some white folks made it! No amount of hot sauce could make the shit palatable. EVen the mac n cheese was bleh, all cold and chunky....the ONLY good thing was the waffles, and I can get that shit for cheap at the store. Leggo my eggo, you know? ANYWAYS, maybe the 3rd time will be a charm, but that 3rd time is going to be a looooong time into the future. I am in NO hurry to go back.

Reviews.Author: H. A.
Reviews.Content: Deliciously juicy fried chicken!Waffles were ok, but I wish they were crispier.I  also wish they had REAL maple syrup. Parking is annoying.

Reviews.Author: Zane T.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the hype? I know this place is popular but WHY? What are you ordering that I didn't? Chicken and Waffle is pretty simple but nothing about this stood out, I don't understand the hype about this place.

Reviews.Author: Ralph V.
Reviews.Content: After a nice morning hike up to the Hollywood sign, we decided to try this legendary place out (just a mile or so from the trail-head). Six of us went: 2 adults and 4 kids with bottomless stomachs (ages 8-13). We ordered 2 plates of fried chicken and waffles. The waffles were a bit soggy, but the fried chicken was oh so delish. I also ordered the Big Momma plate. The scrambled eggs were supper fluffy and tasty, and the potatoes and gravy were rich and thick. There was enough food to go around for all 6 of us.Bathrooms were spotless. You can tell the patrons respect this establishment by the lack of graffiti on the bathroom walls, and the employees do a great job keeping it clean. Bonus points there!I would give this place 5 stars if the waffles were crispier and the wait times were shorter. We only waited 1/2 hour, but in the past the line to get in was waaaay too long. It was our 3rd attempt to go, and 1/2 hour wait was nothing compared to previous times. The other 2 times the line was so long that we just went to another place. If you're ever in the area and the wait-time is less than 1/2 hour, I recommend you try this place out.

Reviews.Author: Tom C.
Reviews.Content: If you're craving some good food at 2am, this is your place. Super fast service, delicious chicken, and even better waffles. Found it be better than the mid city location

Reviews.Author: Justin H.
Reviews.Content: ***3.5 stars***I've had Chicken & Waffles before and the experience was pretty lackluster to say the least. Having been in the area, I decided to meet up with a friend at this particular location to see what the rage was about. Living on the east coast, we don't have this chain out there, so I hoped it was going to be tasty. The waffle was pretty tasty, and the fried chicken wasn't bad as well. Reasonable prices, and portion size was pretty big. Overall, much better than my first experience. I wouldn't mind going back for Chicken & Waffles, but not exactly something I consider must-eat.  The only real knock on Roscoes is that this particular establishment was a bit dreary in terms of lighting, and the service was pretty subpar. Good food, but the restaurant could be better.

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: This is fine. I've now lived in the 3 biggest cities in America, and am going to tell you something. The fried chicken at a Chicago chinese buffet can whoop this chicken's ass in a taste test.It's not bad, don't get me wrong, but if you're in Chicago, and can wait for five fuckin' hours while the slow assholes who get annoyed when you come in and order, HAROLD'S is about infinity + 1 (yes, a White Men Can't Jump reference) better than Roscoe's.Sorry my friends.

Reviews.Author: Erin J.
Reviews.Content: This place is all kinds of right! I thoroughly enjoy fried chicken, mac n cheese... you know what, lets just say southern food in general bc I'm from Alabama. :) This place is always packed and the food consistent. I brought along my best friend who hasn't ever had southern comfort food!! Imagine ordering 2 crispy, moist chicken thighs with a side of collard greens (no pork, yeah!), yams, sweet cornbread and an Arnold Palmer...errr, I mean Lisa's Delight. She ordered the same dish except with a water. My friend enjoyed the collard greens and thought the yams were mad sweet, but she liked overall! The food was hot, fresh and my drink was sweet enough to send me into shock or a coma. hahaha. The meal gave me everything and more than I wanted, however, I didn't finish my meal because it was so big.  Afterwards I tried to convince the waiter to bring me a wheelbarrow full of pillows to wheel me out to the car, but fortunately I was able to waddle back to the car as my friend strutted (bc she's taller). WARNING: This is a very heavy meal and will lead to drowsiness, a full gut and possibly crazy dreams...use your discretion! LOL

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: Scoe's is all about the chicken and waffles. This was my first time visiting the Hollywood location. Parking could be a bit difficult at this particular location. We got there before the Sunday church crowd got there.Their chicken is alright. Not the best I've had, but solid. I like to get them smothered with gravy on the side. For drinks, I like to get their sunrise, basically lemonade and orange juice. Now their waffles, that's something special. I'm not sure what their secret ingredients are in that batter, but it's what makes theirs unique. I also love the texture of the waffles, slightly on the hard side, just perfect.For whatever reasons the combination of fried chicken and waffles just really work for me, and apparently many others. It's a real slice of Los Angeles and I definitely recommend it at least once if you are visiting LA.

Reviews.Author: Don F.
Reviews.Content: Chicken, Waffles, Grits, Arnold Palmer, Beer, Ice-T Energy Drink. Everything about this place is epic. GO NOW!!!

Reviews.Author: michelle h.
Reviews.Content: Chicken & waffles. Great combination! Came at night so there wasnt a wait! Ordered, and the food came out QUICK! A little too quick..Chicken wasnt juicy, and didnt have flavoring...waffles were soggy...ehhh.

Reviews.Author: Edward P.
Reviews.Content: Pros: One of the best, if not the best, Chicken and Waffle spots in LA. Period.Cons: Parking will be an adventure to find and the wait time is usually long.Overall: If you are feeling like Chicken and Waffles and have nothing but time to spare, then Roscoe's is the place to be.

Reviews.Author: Daniel D.
Reviews.Content: Interesting place. The place had actual Police watching inside the place... ( input current events )awkward dining setup. If they had to money they could use a makeover so it doesn't feel like a cafeteria. It could be made to look like a southern dining room, that my 2 cents.tables felt  and looked sticky, although they did wash each table after each guest, but I am guessing the rags haven't seen the washer lately. we were sat quickly. table of 2.I had the fried chicken breast and wings and sweet potato ( the greens suck! do something with that please. that almost makes me want to lower my rating. ) mac and cheese wasn't special. and the grits were grits ( I aint southern ) some of the wings were burnt. hooters has better wings ( smaller but they have something else larger ) the waitress was nice and friendly, and the refill of sodas was quick.

Reviews.Author: Henry D.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I went on a bad day but the chicken was terrible and the service was even worse. I ordered the 5 thighs take-out order in additional to a couple of combination meals. I sat in the chairs by the door which was close to the kitchen window. One of the managing staff was working the window but proceeded to sit down and eat. She apparently wanted some food to go too and I noticed that my order had been stacked to the side. The manager opened up the container with chicken thighs and ended up taking that container. Finally, another order of thighs came up, was pushed to the side and after sitting there for at least 10 minutes, one of the waiters looked at the stack, asked the manager a question and then bagged I up for me. Just totally unprofessional for the manager to take part of my order and then ignore taking care of the window or assigning someone else while she sat and ate by the kitchen window and table next to me.When we got back to the hotel, the chicken breast were so overcooked that it was like eating chicken jerky. Even worse, I didn't think you could dry out chicken thighs but these were the worse and driest chicken thighs I have ever had.I have eaten at the Long Beach and the Pasadena Roscoe's which I would definitely give 4 stars for the quality of the food and decent service. The Hollywood location was the worse...maybe it was a bad day but I can't muster up much more than one star for the service and food that day.

Reviews.Author: Stephen H.
Reviews.Content: MY GOD!!  The chicken is SO good!  Waffles ame grits werw good as well. We ate breakfast two days in a row there...

Reviews.Author: Karl K.
Reviews.Content: It's a lot like Pink's--------Why on earth would I compare this place to Pink's?  Simply put, because the food has been completely overshadowed by the hype.  Are the waffles delicious? Yes.  Is the chicken perfectly fried and scrumptious?  Sure.But a lunch for two of  "half fried chicken and waffles" (which translates into a drumstick and a thigh, plus two waffles) and two soft drinks was 35 BUCKS.  WTF?!  It is so ridiculously overhyped, just like Pinks.  I really don't care about the autographed headshots of various celebrities who fake ate there.  And now that the POTUS has been there? Fuggedabout it.  They even have an Obama special on the menu [as I shake my head in disbelief; this is exactly what Pink's does - they make minor adjustments to what they already serve, and give it a celebrity name]35 BUCKS FOR FRIED CHICKEN, FOLKS.   I mean, you can get a whole thanksgiving dinner in Beverly Hills @ Stinking Rose for that price.  Think about it.

Reviews.Author: Trista L.
Reviews.Content: A GREAT PLACE to eat at! Chicken was seasoned nice and juicy. Waffles were perfect. The only  trouble I had was the fact that this place at this location is VERY small, and not a lot of parking. Other than that, waitress was nice, hostess was very polite and prices was reasonable, you do get lot for your money!!!!!

Reviews.Author: JP A.
Reviews.Content: Could have been an off night in the kitchen but.....We live down the street and always see the lines waiting to get into this place. Figured we'd give it a try. I'll compliment the  fried chicken as it was really tasty, a bit too salty but tasty. The rest? Not so good. Don't trust the pics of mac and cheese you see here. We got a little cup for $5 or something but, I think they forgot the cheese. We just got Mac and Grease. The waffle was soggy...like it had been waiting for a while to be served...and Pilsbury could make a better biscuit. Another thing, they have these little containers with 3 poinsettias in each for decoration on the little wall separating the tables....but there wasn't a leaf on one of them. Seriously. Just green stems sticking out of dirt. Nice touch! Honestly, I think Denny's might do a better job.

Reviews.Author: Warren T.
Reviews.Content: First time at Roscoe's! I decided to come see what the rave was all about. I ordered the waffles with white meat fried chicken. The fried chicken and waffles were typical quality found just about anywhere. I didn't get what the hype is all about, but it's decent quality. The portion size is also huge. I wasn't able to finish it.

Reviews.Author: Kim S.
Reviews.Content: Every visitor that comes to LA must try this place, whether your a big chicken or waffle fan. Yes I know the combination sounds a little crazy, but it is one of America's favorite southern dishes to have for breakfast or a late night meal. As for California, you know any thing goes down in LA when it comes to food and culture. I tried to get Dutchman to come here but he was not having it. I think he was offended that Americans would dare mix waffles with chicken.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R.
Reviews.Content: Carol C. is my girl.We've been eating at Roscoe's on Gower for over twenty years, since I first came to Los Angeles. Back then, it was a third the size that it is now and there was a longer wait to get a table. Still can be a line, but they usually move things along pretty well. What about the food? The Carol C is my regular order: Fried chicken and a pair of waffles. The fried chicken is excellent. As good as you are likely to get outside of grandma's kitchen: crispy outside, tender and thoroughly done inside. I like it with the thick Southern style onion gravy. Get it on the side and you can apply it where ever you want. The waffles are good - I like the batter - but sometimes come out just a little underdone. I ask for the them well done and I get them done just right for my taste. The buckwheat waffles are also excellent and by all means worth a try. Wonderfully rich and grainy, with lots of flavor. The biscuits are good. So are the grits. The greens are not up the standard of the rest of the food.The service can some times be a little slow. You may need to get tough to get a refill on you coffee. But that is a small complaint against what is a pretty good meal. Carol C? Why yes, I believe I will!

Reviews.Author: Ada W.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THEIR FRIED CHICKEN SKIN!!! The chicken inside isn't that good when you have it for leftovers, but the skin still tastes hella good when I ate it for leftovers.I had the special of the day which was 2pc chicken and rice with gravy with a side of Mac and cheese! The Mac and cheese is supposedly the BEST. It's good, but maybe not the best? Idk, I'd buy chicken from here everyday if I could.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla Y.
Reviews.Content: Hey it's my 100th review! =)I've always loved Roscoes, but this Gower location is my fave.  The staff is always friendly and smiling, even when it's late, crowded, and everyone's drunk.   Sometimes on weekends if it's super packed with a long wait, you can just order it to go, and the food comes out really fast.  Then just eat it in your car. Anyway, for me, it's all about the egg, cheese, and onions.  I've tried to replicate this seemingly simple dish at home, and I can't ever get it just right.  Maybe I'm not heavy handed enough with the cheese, or butter or what, but it's just not the same at home.  This dish is just so creamy, cheesy, soft and delish.  Add a few dashes of Rooster on top, mmmmmm!We always get the same thing, the Scoe's special #2 (two pieces chicken your choice white or dark meat, with two waffles) with gravy on the side, two orders of egg, cheese and onion, and if we're REALLY hungry another thigh on the side.  They usually know it's a split order and will send the waffles out on two plates instead of one, and double the serving of butter and syrup, with no split plate charge.I love the waffles here, just soft enough, but not soggy.  I'm not a big fan of sweet, so I put a lot of butter on my waffle, and just dip the tines of my fork into the syrup and get a piece of waffle like that.  For me it's the perfect amount of salty and sweet.As for the chicken, now I don't indulge in fried chicken often, and actually come to think of it, Roscoe's is the only place I actually eat fried chicken.  It's always perfectly cooked, never under done or over done, the meat is juicy (can't vouch for the breast meat though, bc I'm strictly a dark meat girl, except for wings that is), and the skin, OMG the skin.  So crunchy and salty, not too greasy considering it's deep fried, and then dipped in the gravy is just about the perfect comfort/naughty food.Once we came here and I was kinda drunk.  After our meal I went for my chap stick.  It had a red cap.  Apparently I had already replaced the cap, but somehow knocked over the red cap of the Rooster sauce.  I picked it up and tried to use it to cap my chap stick and couldn't figure out why it didn't fit.  The waitress who was walking by, without skipping a beat, said to me "That's for the hot sauce!" Oh my was I embarrassed. LOL!

Reviews.Author: Abigail A.
Reviews.Content: First of all: never have I ever thought that chicken, waffles & syrup would complement each other. EVER. I ate dinner here before a clubbing event (turns out the club was a block away from Roscoe's). We were lucky to have found meter parking. One of our friends had to circle the streets for a while to find a parking spot. It was a bit dark in the restaurant so reading the menu was hard to see under the red lighting. My friend and I shared a platter. I believe we ordered Scoe's which consists of chicken with 2 waffles and gravy (ordered that on the side). We also ordered a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese though. PURE GOODNESS. My recommendation is that you order gravy on the side so your chicken won't turn soggy. We also learned that a platter DEFINITELY fills up 2 people. My only issue was when we got our bill. I came with a group and once we paid at the counter (you have to walk to another room). We learned that they could only accept 2 credit cards out of our group of 4. It was a bit of a hassle since most of us wanted to pay card but we figured it out.I will definitely come back to Roscoe's and hopefully try out the other joints in Long Beach, etc.

Reviews.Author: Camille P.
Reviews.Content: Craving gone!! Scoes #2 always hits the spot! Chicken smothered in gravy and syrup covered waffles.

Reviews.Author: D C.
Reviews.Content: Was in L.A. to visit and decided to come by and pay homage to (what I had heard) the legendary Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.  Get it straight, people...this is a Waffle House and the decorum matches this, right on down to the greasy-feeling menus and tables.  But s**t, I'm into that so it worked for me! I didn't come for award-winning service or the Morton's Steakhouse "experience". Just come correct with the food and that's I care...which they did. Huge portions of chicken and the waffle was delicious (I got the Obama Special...3 wings/waffle). They are putting something in that waffle batter that I MUST find out; real tasty.  The reason I felt the need to even review this place was the fact that they must have broke a world record in order turn-around time.  Our table of 3 ordered our food and I swear in 90 seconds flat, our food was in front of us. Never seen anything like that before.  So given the good food and quick service, it didn't bother me any when we paid up and our grumpy cashier lady was muttering to a co-worker how she wanted to kill another co-worker. Hell, I went ahead and got me a Roscoe's t-shirt to boot! Can't blow my high!

Reviews.Author: Temenah C.
Reviews.Content: This was my first Roscoe's location. Back in the day, it was a tiny little place and the wait was always mad long because in addition to it having bomb food, it's in Hollywood and is a tourist spot. Also, since it's Hollywood you'll see your fair share of celebs. I've seen Kirk Franklin and a few others enjoying a delicious plate of chicken and waffles.I've been recently and noticed that it expanded so the wait isn't as bad. The service is always good and the food never disappoints. I think the only thing I noticed that was different from when I used to frequent this location is that the yams are super sweet. I don't remember them being as sweet as they are.Anyway. This is my go to spot when I'm leaving LA late night (code for drunk after the club). I highly highly recommend to get there at around 1am if you're going late night. The clubs let out at 2am and Roscoe's can get a teensy bit ratchet and crowded.

Reviews.Author: Jen K.
Reviews.Content: To the north end of Hollyhood but you'll still get your fair share of crazies outside.  Not the best of ambiances for waiting outside... but at least you're somewhat entertained despite being kinda creeped out.  Parking is non-existent, everything nearby on the street is 1 hr only, which doesn't work out the best when you add in the wait time.  Normally I wouldn't care too much, but there was a meter maid pretty much hawking outside so I made sure to move my car up a few spots after an hour so that I wouldn't get ticketed.  Wish I knew earlier there was 2 hr parking a block up on one of the perpendicular streets!Service was sub-par, but it was Saturday at noon-ish, so they were pretty busy.  The chicken was super juicy and deliciously fried, the waffles were great, and the sides (rice&gravy, mac&cheese) were good too.  Add in the fact that it's decently priced.. and I'll be back for sure. :)

Reviews.Author: Joss P.
Reviews.Content: AMAzing :) the only thing that could be better is the service.

Reviews.Author: Nathan P.
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, I was blown away with how good the food tasted when I ate here. Every item I ordered was 5 stars. The Fried chicken breast and waffle was fantastic. The fried chicken was the best fried chicken I have ever had. The waffle was great as well and those together were just great. The Mac & Cheese was delicious. I am very happy I chose to order a side of it. The side of eggs with cheese and onions seemed simple but wow were they good!The older black host that seats people was a real character! Very animated and funny. I loved it!If I could try to find something to complain about I would say I would like to have had 1 more coffee refill but 2 was fine.  The coffee had a real good taste, I wanted more and more!I am not from LA, so I wanted to try something that was quintessentially LA. I would recommend all to come here. I want to go back

Reviews.Author: Julie D.
Reviews.Content: The wait was so long... the service was good but still took a little long.  I ordered the 2 Scoes and it was delicious but there was a lot of bones in the chicken.  The chicken was tender though and it was smothered in gravy which was really good. The waffles were good with the syrup but it was soggy before I put the syrup on it.  3 stars only because I expected the chicken to be better and wasn't expecting the waffles to be so soggy.

Reviews.Author: Andrewd S.
Reviews.Content: I got the the 3 wings and waffle combo. The meal was great. I have been wanting to go here for a long time and I was fully satisfied with the meal.

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: I had tried roscoes awhile back and I remember really enjoying it and told myself I had to back soon. Well I finally did the staff is still friendly and accommodating. The inside of this place feels very warm and coZy. However, on the day I went I was not impress with my food. The waffles were okay. And though I do love crispy chicken my piece of chicken hardly had any meat and I wasn't fully satisfied so I ordered the Mac n cheese since outside they have a sign claiming its "the best in LA" and I have to disagree.Maybe I came on a bad day but I was not impress by the food ill give it another try soon.

Reviews.Author: Albert L.
Reviews.Content: This Roscoe's is smaller and more rustic (aesthetically) than the one in Long Beach but is still defined by the solid comfort food the Roscoe's chain has been famous for.I had my favorite Jeanee Jones omlette here and although the portion was overall a bit smaller than I remember, the gooey combination of cheese and chicken wrapped within a fluffy layer of egg still won my heart. Such small pleasures in life are best served with a "Sunrise" lemonade I might add. ;-)Our server was extremely nice and friendly and checked up on us often. Street parking isn't the easiest to find but not impossible if you're willing to walk a bit sometimes. Don't be surprised if you smell the scent of a nearby medical pot dispensary when waiting outside. =P

Reviews.Author: Steve N.
Reviews.Content: #2 Scoes special with gravy on the side.  Yum, chicken and waffles!  Beats donuts and chili. ;-)

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: Never ever EVER again will I come back. My guests and I decided to dine at this location for dinner. We were seated first and the two girls that came in after us were seated at the table behind us. Tell me why their drinks were ordered and food and still no one greeted our table? We sat there a whole 15 minutes before we decided to get up and leave. The place was practically empty so the staff were not  busy. As a matter of fact they were all lounging around having conversations that weren't work related although most of the language that was spoken was Spanish. I have never experienced such poor service from an establishment that can use the business.So despite that my car takes 91 gas and its current hitting $5/gallon. We decided to go to Roscoe's on Pico in which the manager on Pico needs to manage this location. As a MBA grad in business management. This location is headed for disaster.As I walked out the door. I expressed my issue to the cashier who then shrugged her shoulders at me. I see why unemployment is so high, because people like these folks. I think they forget, that our consumer dollars is what pays their rent and feed their children. You guys need to wake up!!!

Reviews.Author: Charm G.
Reviews.Content: Definitely had better...the waffle was "Waffle House" standard at best.  The chicken was greasy and flavorless.  I definitely will not return.  Granted Roscoes paved the way, I will stick to Gladys and Dames on the East Coast!

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: I'm honestly a bit disappointed with all the hype...Yes, the chicken was fried & delicious but the waffles...they were soggy & pale.The gravy was on the thicker side but still flavorful.And unfortunately, because we sat in the back corner ... service was pretty awful.I literally had to wave my hands and scream to get menus, water, napkins, beer, and the tab...wow. And the mac  & cheese?....I'm a huge mac & cheese fan. This one was very cheesy but the noodles were overcooked & dry.

Reviews.Author: Marc T.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes chicken and waffles is amazing. The food is great. The location is easy to get to from the valley. Take the 101 get off on grower avenue and make a right. The restaurant is on the left. The food tastes amazing, unlike anything I've had before. The service was good the waiter was accommodating. The restaurant was busy but the food arrived quick. Everything was right. I had a great experience overall and will come again. This is also a classic spot.

Reviews.Author: Nicole L.
Reviews.Content: Went for a late night snack after a friend had me out sooo late like I was a youngster again.  LOL.  The Mac n Cheese is to "live" for.  Should've gotten another side to have for lunch the next day.  The chicken and waffles were pretty good even though I am more of a Belgium waffle fan.  It hit the spot!

Reviews.Author: Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a recent trip to Los Angeles!My friend told me he wanted to have something he can ONLY get in LA! So we went to Roscoes! Awesome place to be. The wait wasn't that long for a Saturday night, we waited about 30 minutes for a party of 3.I had the Scoe's #1 (Recommended by our server!) which is 2 waffles and 2 pieces of chicken (Leg and Breast) I also had a side of Mac n Cheese.The food was awesome! Definitely better than I expected! I think i ordered way too much food cause I couldn't finish everything! But it was well worth it. Prices are good, $10.70 for Scoe's #1. Service was great! My cup was never empty. Guy kept refilling our drinks. Love the atmosphere. Will definitely be back when Im down in LA again!

Reviews.Author: Yvette E.
Reviews.Content: I only had the waffles here (I'm a vegetarian) but the waffles were delicious! I had the buckwheat waffle. My friends had the 1/2 Chicken and waffle combo. They had a choice of either white, dark, or mixed meat for the chicken and it came with two waffles. They enjoyed their meal very much. They also got a side of mac n cheese, which they said it was very tasty.

Reviews.Author: Yi Z.
Reviews.Content: Meh...apparently this one is the original location. We woke up early on a Saturday and decided to get a classic LA meal of chicken & waffles. Now I realize that it was a bad idea because the meal was far too heavy and oily for any of us.  I love my dark meat chicken but the bloody insides even grossed me out a bit.  The unrenovated dark decor is perfect if you're hung over and not very nice if you're not.I really liked the biscuits and that was about it.  I feel kind of bad that I dragged other people along to this substandard meal.

Reviews.Author: Vivian C.
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe that this place is so popular because I've had a pretty mediocre experience every time I come here. I'm afraid that at least for me, this place is way over-hyped. I went here with some family and we tried to ordered a variety of things from the menu. The chili cheese fries with fried chicken were really good and came in a huge portion. I liked the fried chicken, which was crispy on the outside and still moist on the inside. To put it simply everything else just didn't seem like it was made to order. It was obvious that they were made in large quantities and to be served. The waffles were slightly soggy and not crispy at all, the mac and cheese was cold, and the biscuits weren't light or crispy. On top of that there is usually always a long wait to get in, so in short, you could probably find better chicken and better waffles elsewhere...

Reviews.Author: Duncan W.
Reviews.Content: I am going to get shot for this, but this is perhaps the most overrated restaurant in all of LA.It is not all that cheap, the chicken is small (and not fried that well - comparable to KFC).  The waffles are just...waffles.  Sometimes they are a bit too burnt.Parking really sucks, atmosphere is weird.Ask your friends if they want to see a huge disappointment, then bring them here.

Reviews.Author: Timothy D.
Reviews.Content: Not sure what all the hype is about.Chicken was dry and waffles were soggy.  I would have expected nice juicy chicken and crispy waffles.  There are far better places to eat in the Hollywood area than this place.  On to the next.

Reviews.Author: Erika L.
Reviews.Content: Hide yo kids, hide yo wife.... So I haven't eaten chicken in years and I have never craved it more than I did here.Although I resisted - my best friend practically had an orgasm next to me while devouring her meal. Told her I would write her part of the review verbatim and it was "That is the best motherf*ckin chicken I've ever had in my motherf*ckin life. Can't believe you ate a salad like a bitch."I had a salad like a loser - yes I know. The staff was amazing and friendly. The wait was less than 10 minutes. This place is badass and people literally groan and moan while eating! That good.Insane. If I ever come back to the carnivorous side of life - this will be the reason why.

Reviews.Author: Sierra R.
Reviews.Content: BEST BREAKFAST HANDS DOWN!Whether you are sober, drunk or hungover; this is the spot to eat at! I don't even want to label this spot as the "drunk spot" but, if given the situation it is literally heaven. I have been here about 4 times now and it never gets old. I get the same thing every time which is... a chicken thigh, 1 waffle (one waffle is about a foot, covers the whole big plate) & a root beer. That's about all it takes to get full here for me. (Another good tip: When eating the chicken with the waffles, make sure you dip it into the syrup instead of pouring onto your plate; this way, if you can't eat everything, you can have left overs for home. ;)

Reviews.Author: Hazel N.
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Roscoe's; I am from the bay, so whenever I make a trip to socal, this is the first spot I visit. This spot in particular has a lot of room, so the wait is not bad at all.My boyfriend and I were greeted upon arrival. Our waitress was fantastic, and our  food was delivered in a short amount of time. My boyfriend is picky with his fried chicken, but he was able to devour his whole meal (mind you this was his first time at Roscoe's).  We both enjoyed our meal, especially their waffles. The only downside is sometimes the waffles harden if they are taken too long to eat, but other than that we were satisfied.The mac and cheese was delicious. We finished that side dish in a matter of minutes.We will definitely be visiting this location again.

Reviews.Author: Figaro A.
Reviews.Content: half chicken came out too hard and dry.   the waffle was still good.  whoever manning the fryer must've been texting or not paying attention! i would not recommend any of the salads/side orders, only the waffle and the (sometimes good) fried chicken.

Reviews.Author: Tierra M.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS! I've been in LA for 2.5 months and have been here 5 times. There is ALWAYS a wait but down fret as soon as you are seated the food comes out smoking hot in about 15 mins. This location only has street parking. I love the macaroni and fried wings of course!

Reviews.Author: Otha D.
Reviews.Content: #vakseen4taste - Celebrity consigns do wonders for businesses lol. This place is highly overrated and the product of great marketing. I ate here Saturday for the 2nd and last time of my life. I wasn't impressed the 1st time I ate Roscoes and only went Sat because a family friend drove in from San Diego and insisted. First there's the 40min wait. Granted you can expect to wait at almost any LA brunch spot at 2pm on a Saturday but at least the food will be good. Once seated, the food actually came out pretty damn quickly....like 5 minutes, which helps because you're starving after sitting out front in the sun for almost an hour. That's the 1 positive thing...they get the food out quick. It's like they have a conveyor belt in the back lol. That's also the downfall. My chicken breast was dry and overcooked. My waffle was undercooked...almost doughy. We actually had to send our waffles back. The chicken wasn't full of flavor or seasoned well and the waffle was nothing special. Honestly an Eggo would've had more flavor and fluff. I also ordered an over-easy egg and that didn't come until I was 60% done with my meal. Great experience right? With so much notoriety you'd think they'd have the food to match. Not to mention our service has ehhh. We had to ask random servers for things that we actually asked our server for. All in all a wack experience. I'll never go back and don't recommend you go either. 3/10 #vakseen4taste

Reviews.Author: Allen M.
Reviews.Content: I like this location because it is just around the corner from The W Hotel on Hollywood Blvd. it is only like two blocks away, so it is a short walk.Roscoe's has best fried chicken and waffles on the West Coast. The chicken is crispy and is not greasy at all. I love this place. They should open a location in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Aleta B.
Reviews.Content: The food was good. Service was soooooo bad! Was actually going to get up leave, but I promised the kid fried chicken. I had to go find a waitress to take drink orders and remind them that we were seated at a table. The slow service would not have bothered me if it was consistent. But after seeing table after table seated, orders taken and served food before we were even offered a drink was just too much!Chicken was fried nice, waffles were good.  The combo was tasty.I am a fan based on the food alone. Even then, it's more the concept I'm a fan of.

Reviews.Author: Jeremiah S.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Carol B special or the Obama special. One time I got a free chicken wing, and it was a huge chicken wing, and it made my day. This place is crowded because it's goood, for impatient pricks like me I suggest avoiding Sunday and try and go after 2 PM.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa L.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's was good, especially if you love fried chicken.  After a 45 minute wait, we were seated and served promptly.  The server was friendly and patient, the portions were huge, and the price was just right!  Given that this place is an institution, I'd recommend trying it!

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch right on New Year's Day. I've never had chicken & waffles before and we all figured it would be a great way to start the new year! There was a 1-hour wait, but oh man. It was quite worth it. Prices are obviously a little steep, but you absolutely do get giant portion sizes and plenty to snack on later. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Armand W.
Reviews.Content: The food was pretty good. chicken and waffles you can't really mess up. just grab the chicken wings not breast when eating with a waffle unless you prefer your chicken to be dry.

Reviews.Author: Gooi Z.
Reviews.Content: I ordered Carol C., which includes fried chicken and waffle. I like the chicken a lot, but not so much on the waffle.

Reviews.Author: Haik K.
Reviews.Content: What kind of butter is that!? Once upon a time, my friends and I ditched a day of high school and went on what was at the time comparable to the 7 tasks of Herculeus of a ditch-day. Several bus, rail, metro, and miles walked later we arrived to our destination of roscoes. We all ordered the same thing, 2 waffles and 1/4th a chicken except for a vegetarian friend that got the mac n cheese and biscuit. None of us managed to finish it but maybe it was the journey that made us to believe that the food was unbelievably good.FLASH FORWARD to now. Nothing has changed. The waffles are still soft and fluffy, and when you spread that unbelievably delicious butter across the surface and then drench it with some good ole maple syrup you can help but devour it in seconds. The chicken, my God! Large slice of chicken beautifully fried to attain that perfect crisp, all while keeping the chicken generally moist and well cooked. It no longer takes me 3 hours to get here and Im a big boy now that can finish his plate. Still, something about the nostalgia and the good food keeps me coming back for more on those nights when I feel like taking a break from the hollywood crowd. here is a tip, parties of two usually get in quicker than parties of 3+ .

Reviews.Author: Jay B.
Reviews.Content: When I was growing up, the mention of Hollywood & Sunset Blvds would always conjure up the dirtiest of little secrets, streetwalkers, and drugged out paraphernalia.  I realize these are old stereotypes that have been burnt into my mind from the likes seen in the movies:  Foxes, Requiem for a Dream, American Gigolo, True Romance, and yes even Pretty Woman.  I know that things have been cleaned up a lot in Hollywood, but what can I say; Roscoe's just brings out the dirty filth in us all, especially at Sunset and Gower! So to start with, I didn't realize how big it was...Well Greg T and Anthony N, I know you're going to hate this review, but...  DAYUM!  This place still serves the best crisp succulent breasts and thighs around.  It even beats out Jolanda standing down on the corner!So take heed the steps to being completely satisfied at Roscoe's:-  Be sure to clean and wipe those hands and fingers as "finger lickin'    good" brings on a whole new meaning in Hollywood-  When you can't stand it no more, and you're about ready to pop your    top, quickly pull off that plastic cap on that bottle rocket-  And shake that red hot cock* sauce all over Carol C's or     Country Girl's luscious golden brown breasts-  Hold your head down as your entire focus needs to be at waist-level    and begin the lickin', suckin', and chomp fest-  Take that moist golden brown waffle and pour that sticky hot goo      in all those little holes and crevasses-  And, lastly if it takes more than 10 minutes, just thank God      because most wouldn't last 5 minutesHeck now, if you people have something other than Chicken & Waffles on your mind - get your head outta the gutter!  *puff puff*  ;PBut while we're on the subject, If the Adult Entertainment Industry needs a writer, I could be persuaded...  Who am I kidding?!  A writer in pr0n?  Ha!  A non-existent job indeed!So Roscoe's you've done it again!  You really give people the bird, and still serve up stuff that gets me all hot and bothered.  by the way, if you haven't had their Chicken Chili yet, you're really missing out - can you say mushy mushy?Ps.  * = rooster

Reviews.Author: Rhea S.
Reviews.Content: Oh SNAP!No wonder Snoop D O Double Gizzle loves this place!It was definitely an experience. I mean, where else would the "host" be a big black man with a jacket and hat that both have the word SECURITY written across it? Only at Roscoe's! I was impressed with the service, the atmosphere, and the food. It wasn't as "ghetto" as many people claim it to be. I ordered #1 - SCOE's 1/4 chicken prepared southern style, 2 waffles $10.20. Whoa, talk about a heart attack on a plate! Everything was delicious! The chicken was moist and the skin was extra crispy *drool*. The waffles + syrup + butter = delicious! I had such a hard time deciding what to eat more of ... chicken? waffles? chicken? waffles? It didn't really matter because I couldn't have finished all of that food even if I really tried. The portions are HUGE! I'm a fan! Although, I can't promise to be a regular customer because my badonkadonk would be out of control!

Reviews.Author: Stephy S.
Reviews.Content: Bartles & James Mojito... Check.Bartles & James Margarita... Check.#1 with half white and half dark meat... Check.More butter than any one human should consume... Check.Having great convo opposite a funny guy in a mustache... Check.Vince Vaughn and Steve Byrne noshing on chicken behind us... Check.Killer way to spend an average Wednesday night in Hollywood... Check.I love you Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Ariel L.
Reviews.Content: While researching on what to do and eat in Los Angeles -there were many suggestions to eat the chicken and waffles at Roscoes. After eating at Roscoes, I don't understand the hype over it. The chicken and waffles were just okay. I had the "obama chicken & waffle" special.  I've had better chicken at Popeyes.The waitress forgot to bring out the side order of fries we ordered too. It might have been best if we hadn't reminded her, because the fries were soggy & gross. For a $4.50 plate of fries, it was way too much fries for one person. Waste of $4.50 and potatoes.If this is what people on the internet suggest to eat in LA, I'm glad I didn't listen to the other suggestions. I found better food on my own!

Reviews.Author: Niko X.
Reviews.Content: If you're as drunk as I was Saturday night and find yourself on the crowded sidewalk outside this place, not eating here is not an option.  The line on a Saturday night after 2:00 A.M. is in three words off the hook.  I'd say we waited around 1/2 hour; however it would definitely have been much longer had the ten of us not pooled together $30 to bribe the host staff (this was not my idea for the record).  While not necessarily part of everyone's experience here... I need to mention for the record that I met, in line, 7 out of the 9 other people I dined with.  It just goes to show that drinking really does crumble social boundaries... so long as everyone plays nice.  And speaking of the line... you'd think you were waiting to get into Studio 54.  This place definitely gets the after hours club crowd...as could be inferred by the copious amount of recently shaken money-makers.    I think it took us four hours to decide what we wanted.  The menu is not drunk people friendly.  There are just two many options... do I want one waffle or two...and how many pieces of chicken?  Dark meat or white meat? Leg or thigh?  Both?  Are we still talking about chicken?  Why are there ice cubes on my lap? Why am I still thirsty?So I finally decided on the one piece thigh and waffle combination.  The thigh was very small, but it tasted wonderful.  As others have mentioned the waffles are thin, crisp on the outside and chewy in the middle.  The syrup was pretty average, and I assume it was not actual maple syrup given the huge quantity they brought out.  And then there was the mount  Everest of butter.  Holy good God it was huge!  There was literally a stick's worth of whipped butter piled atop my waffle.  I used maybe 5% of it.  The juxtaposition of crispy fried chicken skin, dark meat, waffle and syrup in one bite is quite possibly one of the great hidden pleasures of late night Los Angeles.  The hype is right.

Reviews.Author: Jaye C.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost: good luck with finding parking! We lucked out and had princess parking right in front of Roscoe's. But on a very busy day, there's no chance you'll be getting a good spot. You may end up walking from the next block over."Wait so.. do you eat the chicken and waffles at the same time?? I don't get it?" was what one of my friends said when we paid a visit here before leaving LA. Kinda located in a ghetto area, I was scared for my Nor-Cal self considering I'm in an unknown territory and God knows how people think my face is constantly mean-mugging when really I'm just thinking about what to eat. Very casual environment and family friendly. Don't let the people outside scare you off.Home-style cooking here, the food is something my bf's dad could whip up in the kitchen along with all some good southern classics like grits, collard greens, and biscuits. Food: So I took my friend's advice who is an LA native and ordered the Country Boy with waffles. I thought the chicken was great since it wasn't as oily as I'd anticipated it to be. but the only sauce we had on the table were ketchup and Louisiana hot sauce and Tapatio. Was I supposed to ask for a special one? Someone please educate me on this!Anyway, the waffle and chicken combo tasted great together (yes that's right TOGETHER). I thought it'd be weird but then again it's almost like eating a sandwich minus the veggies and the bread being a tad sweet.Service:Our lady was a little off that day. She gave my friend two wrong drinks that belonged to the next table, then gave us too many utensils with not enough napkins. We weren't ready the first time she came back but took our drink orders down. Then we didn't see her again for at least 15 minutes, and by this time we were starving. She did keep our water filled though.Overall, I thought it was a little overrated, maybe we came here on an off-day, but for sure I didn't see what's special about Roscoe's. I still like 99 Chicken more (NorCal/Santa Clara), than here. I'll have to give it another try when I come back in August, and this time with gravy.P.S. No celebrity sighting here for me, maybe next time?

Reviews.Author: Tony Y. Jr. Y.
Reviews.Content: I don't take emergency situations lightly.  So, when fellow Yelper Antho L. called me with some distressing news, I had to act accordingly.  Antho informed me that he'd never been to Roscoe's House of Chicken N Waffles, and that very statement left me baffled and speechless.  Without a doubt, I had to entertain his invite and join him on this outing for some good food that sticks to your ribs.  Roscoe's has seen me before, so I was ready to eat and to hear more of why Antho had never been to Roscoe's.As expected, it was crowded on a Saturday night but we were able to be seated rather quickly.  People from all walks of life come to Roscoe's, especially this location in Hollywood.  The Hollywood location has been remodeled, expanded, and shortened in terms of wait time due to the expansion.  With all the changes, I was hoping there were no changes with the taste of the food because I wanted Antho to like this place, given this was his first time dining here.  It's been a long time since I've had fried chicken, so I ordered the #19, which comes with fried chicken, rice and gravy, and I ordered a side of sweet potatoes.  Antho ordered a similar dish, and also ordered a waffle.  The food was good, filling, and served quickly and hot!Not only was the food good, but the service was good.  Roscoe's is a humble home-style restaurant for everyone.  Nothing fancy and the waiters aren't pretentious, however, they are presentable, down-to-earth, friendly, and will make sure you're a satisfied customer.  If this place is good enough for celebrities to dine here, it's good enough for you!

Reviews.Author: Aunny D.
Reviews.Content: I'll never forget my first time...I was young and inexperienced, he had done this many times before. It happened on a rainy night in Long Beach, he had the breasts, I had the thighs...and a waffle. I'm talking about my first trip to Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles, of course. What the hell did you think I was talking about?! Geez. Perv.  Since then, Roscoe's rarely disappoints. I have eaten at several locations, but I'd have to say my favorite alternates between the Gower and the Long Beach restaurants. Long Beach will always have a special place in my heart. Not to mention I've seen Snoop D-o-double-G eating there before. That's always a plus. When you roll into the LBC and you have an actual Snoop sighting. Word. The food is no frills, the decor follows suit. I love Ms. Amy K's description of this location ("the decor in the front room reminds me of a pot head who found Jesus and then redecorated it to look like the family room with the latest in wall  read more paneling circa 1970"). I couldn't have said it better myself! This place gets realllllly crowded on the weekends, especially Sunday. So for the full experience I recommend going late at night or during the middle of the day so you don't have to deal with the crowds. The food is always on point, and they serve it up quick! Order some cornbread to start, and make sure you go several times to try everything on the menu. Trust me on this one!

Reviews.Author: Mel D.
Reviews.Content: I really, really enjoyed my meal at Roscoe's. After my first bite I felt like I missed out all of these years!  My friends raved about it but it never appealed to me. One reason for never trying it was the "chicken and waffles" combo. It baffled me. I take everything back. Taking a bite of salty chicken and then taking a bite of the sweet waffle with syrup was heavenly. This is without a doubt a place I will go on my cheat days. I can imagine one meal is about a few thousand calories if you eat as much as I did. My friend and I split a few things so I tried the chicken, waffles, rice with gravy and last but not least the mac n cheese. Loved it all. The chicken had the perfect amount of crisp on the outside and the inside was very moist. The flavor of the batter was sensational. I haven't eaten a waffle in years and boy did I scarf it down drenched in syrup. It was really good! I walked out of there 5 lbs heavier!You can't beat the price. They had a special for $6. 2 thighs, rice and gravy. I thought the thighs were breasts because they were pretty big!  How can you beat that?  Maybe to those Southerners out there  Roscoe's may not be up to par, but for the L.A. area, this is some good a$$ food.The service was very good. We ordered, went to go wash our hands and boom, the food came out. I'm not sure about the parking - we parked down the block at a meter. Neighborhood is so-so, I can imagine it was quite sketchy in the past but they are trying to revitalize it. It's only a block from the W hotel but it's still not in the greatest neighborhood.I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Author: Roger M.
Reviews.Content: Whats better than fried chicken and waffles for breakfast?! Roscoe's is the place to hit up in LA when that is the combination you are looking for!  This place seems to have constant business with mad people coming in and out.  We came here quite early, like around 10am-ish so it was a breeze getting a seat.  I thought there would be a long wait from all the previous reviews and past attempts of trying to come here.So after driving on the way over here in your typical day-time LA traffic, I was starving and couldn't wait to get some food up in my system.  We all ordered the two piece chicken and waffles plate.  I'd have to say that everything was on point in filling up my belly.  All that butter, gravy and syrup + the fried chicken has more than enough calories and fat for one entire day but its worth the splurge :PThe meal was too big for my morning appetite so I just took the chicken to go and ended up giving it away to some homeless person later on in the day. Seems many of ya'll are complaining about the valet parking prices.  You can always park a little bit further away on the street, which I do recommend after eating a meal @ Roscoe's.  You'll at least burn off a bit of calories during your brief walk :P

Reviews.Author: Josephine Z.
Reviews.Content: After seeing Maz Jobrani at the Comedy Store off Sunset, my sister wanted to try Roscoe's. I couldn't decline, although we stuffed our faces with some Zankou Chicken goodness about 5 hours prior. She asked me to call to see if they were still open. It was about 11, so there was NO WAY they were closed. But, her insistent ass made me call anyways.  ::ring ring:: ::ring ring::Roscoe's Chicken operator: Hello? Roscoe's Chicken.Me: Um. Hi, I know this is silly, but are you still open?RCO: (boombing voice) uhh ROSCOE'S!!! -hangs up- In translation- Of course we're open, you dumb b*tch. I turn and look at my sister wanting to backhand her...Mary: Well, are they open?Me: She hung up on me. I told you they were open.Driving down Sunset, I almost get sideswiped by this Hyundai. I honk at them to let them know that another living soul is in the left lane. We slow down and a black lady sticks her head out of the Hyundai and yells, "I don't giva dayuumm!". Let's just say, I dreaded the red light due to the awkward feeling that emanated between the two vehicles.We finally reached our destination and found a parking spot a few yards away from Roscoe's which had about ten people waiting outside. We walk up to entrance where a security guard/bouncer/hostess stood who looked like he could choke the life out of me with the hand that was holding a clipboard. Bouncer: Welcome to Roscoe's. Just thought I would let you ladies know we're out of chicken this evening. (I knew he was kidding, but my sister who's a naivete, believed him)Mary: It's okay.Bouncer: Well, we only have thighs. Me: It's okay. I don't mind dark meat.  (as soon as those words left my mouth, I was hoping he didn't think that was a pickup line)Bouncer: So, you only came for the waffles?Mary: ::giggling:: Yeaaah. We drove all the way to LA to eat here from San DiegoMe: *glaring at bouncer* You're joking, right? Bouncer: ::laughing:: Yeah. Of course we got chicken. So you Chargers fans?Mary: Oh yeah. But, we're Lakers fans, tooBouncer: I guess you ladies are safe. (safe? safe from what?) Is it just you two tonight?Me: Yeah. (nervous laugh) Just us. Alone.Bouncer: We'll seat you now. Right this way...So that's the magic word: LAKERS.After getting seated and ordering two #1's (1/4 fried chicken and 2 waffles), grits w/ butter, and mac and cheese we just chatted away. When the food got to our table, we didn't speak. Have you seen those Carl's Jr. commercials? You know, the one that has a dude or chick doing nothing but stuffing their face with a burger and ending with, "Don't bother me. I'm eating."??  THAT'S how I feel when I eat at Roscoe's. As I intricately pour equal amounts of syrup on each piece of waffle that I cut into to, or take pieces of chicken and smother in the hot sauce and shove in my mouth...don't bother me. I'm eating.

Reviews.Author: Andrius A.
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why this place is so popular. Its so crappy.The parking is crappy, the service is crappy, the decor is crappy, the waffles are crappy, the eggs are crappy, the mac is crappy, the biscuits are crappy, the corn bread is crappy, but the grits... the grits...I can fuck with that. Let me just have a lil butter, salt, and a whole lot of pepper, and its on like a mutha...

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C.
Reviews.Content: What happened to Black Moses? Next to the macaroni and the elderly waiter dude, the surly portrait of Black Moses was my favorite thing about Roscoe's. Maybe they had to take it down because it was too awe-inspiring. Maybe they sold it to a collector of fine art. All's I know is, I miss him :(

Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: *** After 775 review, average rating is 4-stars? ***Well, I am certainly in the minority opinion here.Roscoe's is a 2-star at best for many reasons:slow/poor service dry/overcooked chickenmediocre side dishes (meh)dark/uninspired wooden decor*** It's 4-stars b/c there is lil competition in LA. ***

Reviews.Author: MP N.
Reviews.Content: Truly is Amazing food, love love the fried liver. Fried chicken is juicy and the waffles are yummmy! Highly recommend this place for everyone who loves to eat. Love eating here.

Reviews.Author: Rachel G.
Reviews.Content: When you're drunk and in Los Angeles at 2am on a Saturday night,  Fried Chicken dipped in syrup and butter on top of waffles sounds like the best idea you've ever had in your life.Like a, "Rachel, you're a genius!" kind of idea.Like a Nobel Peace Prize kind of idea.  Like a "You deserve a raise" kind of idea.And you know what!?  It truly was the best idea I've ever had in my life.  EVAR!!!Well it was anyway.  Until I woke up the next morning.With syrup in my hair.And waffles under my fingernails.And chicken in my teeth.And impacted bowels.Oh yea, I'm hot.

Reviews.Author: Herman N.
Reviews.Content: When I get home from trips to LA, I am overridden with guilt.  I can't begin to look at other fried chicken establishments because I have secretly made love to the chicken and waffles/biscuits at Roscoe's.Roscoe's is one of a few "must-stops" for me in LA.  With a good thin batter mix and hard frying, which leaves a delectable thin but very crispy skin, they have some of the best fried chicken in Southern California.  I find the batter here very neutral, meaning that its not overridden with a lot of spices or flavor.  This is okay because I get to customize my chicken with either Louisiana style hot sauce or with a squeeze of lemon.  I've tried their gravy and really not a huge fan.  it tastes a little too mass produced.  Hence, I would just stick to it being Southern fried crispy.I've had both their waffles and their biscuits, and truthfully, I prefer the biscuit.  I'm a sucker for any type of biscuits, and Roscoe's makes them big and fluffy.  Also, one plus with the biscuits is that you can easily make a little sandwich.  This leads to another recipe that I have created for FC:1)  Cut your biscuit in half2)  Rip off a big slice of chicken (I prefer juicy thigh meat) and make sure you leave the skin on3)  Place the meat inside the biscuit4)  Grab some honey and pour generously on top of the chicken/skin5)  Put the top of the biscuit on, VOILA - a Honey Fried Chicken Biscuit!Roscoe's is open late and with multiple locations throughout LA, a great late night option.  The place gets crowded, especially at night, so be prepared to wait.

Reviews.Author: Rebekah T.
