Reviews.Content: I skipped breakfast that morning, since we were planning on lunch at Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. It was part of our vacation, tasty food was part of the whole trip. We got some sun while we waited for out seat, but we were called before the estimated 30 minute wait. I ordered an ice tea when i sat down and probably drank about 3 refills. I love the Southern California Sun, but it made me thirsty.We all split the Roscoe's Special, chicken breast, thigh and 2 waffles. We added on a thigh and a side of greens, gravy on the side. The portions were big and it was enough for the three of us hungry girls.  It was incredibly good. The Chicken Breast was really big and juicy. We consumed probably 1/3 of the bottle of Louisana Hot Sauce, it goes really well with anything. It all ends up mixing together anyway, gravy and waffles, chicken and syrup - all doused in hot sauce. I miss the Roscoe's in Oakland. I need more Chicken and Waffles in my life. :)

Reviews.Author: Al C.
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is the first time I have been to this Roscoe's and if you don't know it is there you will miss it. First, how could you not seat anyone waiting for other people to show up when noone is there? I don't get that. I like Roscoe's food, I mean I only go there when I know I will be eating chicken and waffles & nothing else. Though the mac & cheese I sampled was pretty damn good. The place is kinda scuzzy to put it lightly but it is not much different than eating in your moms old kitchen back in the day & watching her make some chicken for the family eating some while she does. Though I know my mamas kitchen had less gnats, well actually no gnats flying around as much as this place did. Service was ok, I appreciated the fact that I got my beers fast. I will stick to the Pico location, it's what I know best. I need to try the Long Beach locale though.

Reviews.Author: Arnold G.
Reviews.Content: If you ask me what my favorite restaurant in the whole world is, I will immediately say "Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles." Aside from my parents, it's the one thing I truly miss about living in Southern California. There are some places here in the Bay Area that have tried to capture the magic---Home of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland being the most prominent---but it's just not the same. The concept of eating fried chicken and waffles on the same plate sounds crazy to most people at first, but for some reason, the salty/sweet combination works. Like sex, it's all about chemistry, and Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles is a 20-minute food orgasm on a plate.Now I'll be the first to admit that Roscoe's doesn't have the best fried chicken, but it's very good and I usually get mine smothered in gravy. The waffles on the other hand are really, really good...slightly crispy on the outside and served with LOTS of butter and warm syrup (a lot of people like to pour the syrup all over their chicken, as well). From what I've been told Roscoe's syrup is their own secret recipe, and I actually think the syrup is the key to their success.There are several ways to order at Roscoe's. My old standby is the #2 Scoe's Special, 1/4 dark meat fried chicken, smothered in gravy, with two huge waffles. I generally eat the chicken first and then have the waffles for dessert, but sometimes I mix it up a bit. When I'm with a large group of people, I like to order some of the sides, like red beans and rice, mac and cheese, smothered potatoes, and cornbread.I've been a Roscoe's whore since the mid 90's and over the years, I've brought almost all my friends, coworkers when we were in town for trade shows (including our Japanese CEO who loved the food but was mad that they don't serve alcohol), and I even took my parents to the more ghetto Pico/La Brea location (they got over their initial fears and really enjoyed their food, and my mom asked "why haven't you brought me here before?"). It's also the only place I've ever brought anyone where the food was so good it reduced them to cursing after every bite, i.e. "Goddamn, this is muthafuckin' good" or "Muthafucker, this is the best food I've ever had."I went home this past weekend and had planned on returning to the Mecca of chicken and waffles in order to do have another taste before I wrote this review/love letter to Roscoe's, but our plans got a little screwed up and we didn't make it. So I write this, my 300th Yelp review, excited about the milestone, but muthafuckin' hungry because I didn't get my muthafuckin' chicken and waffles, and I won't be back home for at least another muthafuckin' month. MUTHAFUCKER!

Reviews.Author: Fancypants X.
Reviews.Content: Nothing says classy like going to the liquor store next door, grabbing a few bottles of something strong & drinking it on the sidewalk to tide you over during Roscoe's 30 minute wait. The security guard standing at the roped off door with clipboard in hand (wait, is this a club or a restaurant?!) took down our name. Our party of three was *way down* on the list. When I asked how long the wait would be, he responded with a well rehearsed, "not long." I overhead him using that same phrase for the next five groups inquiring about the wait. Apparently, "not long" is roughly 30 minutes on a busy Friday night. There are some foods that just belong together (ham+eggs, spaghetti+meatballs, burger+fries); you don't normally think of chicken+ waffles as a match made in heaven, but it really, really is. Fluffy, pillowy waffles lightly covered in butter & syrup. Chicken that is so crispy, well seasoned & juicy on the inside. Gravy on the side. It's the ultimate comfort food combination. This is the third Roscoe's location I've reviewed. Here are my other two:W Pico: yelp.com/biz/roscoes-hou…W Manchester: yelp.com/biz/roscoes-hou…They just keep getting better+better.

Reviews.Author: Bryan K.
Reviews.Content: Shooting down the freeway from SF to San Diego over the holidays, I convinced my bro and his family to take a minor detour here.  Boy can I be persuasive, I should sell used cars!All the reviews said this location had moister fried chicken than the Pasadena location, but the Pasadena waffles were crisper.  Yep they were right.  But the chicken and waffles with gravy were fine nonetheless.  I recommend you get the gravy on the side... so you keep the chicken nice and crispy.Oh yeah another tip, the half chicken and waffles is way too much food for one normal sized sane human being -- get the quarter chicken instead.  I mean, I still finished it but still... gluttony is not good (*).* Except on Mon-Wed-Fri and the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: Which Roscoe's is the superior Roscoe's?  Which one has better chicken?  Which one has better waffles?  Which one has nicer waitresses that call you "darlin" when you sit down?  Everyone likes to put their two cents in.  Including me.Now, I normally like to be above doing chain restaurant comparisons (like, no, the Jack in the Box on Cool St. is waaaaaay better than the one on Loser St.), but after having eaten at two different Roscoe's, back to back two days in a row, I feel ready and willing to jump right into the convo.  Blame it on the clogged arteries.I held my own personal Hollywood vs. Pasadena contest.  The Gower St. Roscoe's was the winner.  Their fried chicken is juicier and more tender than the one in Pasadena.  Higher heat setting and shorter cook time makes theirs a tastier wing and thigh.  Our server at Gower St. gave me free gravy to smother my fried livers in.  So nice.  Plus, it's homier at the Hollywood location.  All the other menu items were pretty comparable.  Though I concede that the waffles in Pasadena had a crispier shell, which was yummy, but the chicken thing... Pasadena gave me dried up overcooked chicken.  No ma'am.  I can overcook chicken at home, thanks.

Reviews.Author: Nancy Y.
Reviews.Content: Here for the 2 piece dark fried chicken and 2 waffles, $9. I actually like the waffles more than the fried chicken.  The waffles are made from what seems to be wheat flour. Crispy on the outside and doughy on the the inside, the waffle are a bit chewy, and quite filling. Served with a huge pile of butter, about 3 mini scoops and 2 little cups of syrup.  I had about a third of the butter and 3 cups of syrup cause the waffles really soaked it up.  The fried chicken is good, though I wouldn't say it was fantastic or anything like that. Very thin fried batter on the outside with a good taste of spices, perhaps a bit like chinese fried chicken and surprisingly not oily at all.  The drumstick is a little small and a bit dried on one side, but quite good overall.  The thigh piece a bit bigger, though it wasn't salty enough for me so I added salt.  Also tried the chicken with the tabasco hot sauce on the table, and prefer it without as it overpowers the flavor. And I ate it with the waffle at the same time, as recommended by previous reviewers.  Another diner was dipping his drumstick right into the maple syrup which was kinda of funny.  I'm a three-piece chicken type of girl, an earlier reviewer wrote that the two-piece would be more than enough and it is!  Couldn't finish my waffles, which I really liked.  The fried chicken is good, Popeye's fried chicken is better.Smallish type of place, I like the casual and down to earth atmosphere and peeps. The bathroom bothered me just a tad as it was really cramped and tiny, they should upgrade it.  The waitress told me they open till 4am on weekend nights.  It's seems a great place for 3am chow.  I found parking right on Sunset Blvd, and walked around the corner, where there was no line.  We walked across the street to eat. and chilled some more in the lounge area. That worked out nicely!

Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: It's just one of those places that you hear about, and when friends visited in college, you just had to come here.  I didn't really venture to this place as i lived in Irvine on a regular basis, more so when i came back from the Bay or went to the Bay. Now i think it's the greatest thing, i mean delicious Fried Chicken wings and thighs and your desert being Waffles, or so my roommate said "eww's that gross like it was blended together."   I usually get the 1/2 Chicken smothered with Gravy and Onions on the side with 2 Waffles, and im pretty stuffed.  We got the grits one time, because we're asian and we had no idea what it was, do not get we didn't like it.    Now this is the 1st Roscoes so the line can get pretty long, and you can't call ahead.  Do not park in the Copy or Sushi plaza you'll get towed, just try on Gower you'll find something.  Other than this my trips to socal are not complete without a meal here, i can do without pinks but i have to get this.The waffles were crispy here unlike the one in Long Beach, i don't dare go to another one anymore, it's the Original or Bust!

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: Since the dawn of time, the belief that fried chicken and waffles could even be remotely be consumed together was a taboo. Even the smallest mention of the two in the same sentence meant death by deep fryer. But times have changed and while we still enjoy mutton and mead, society no longer looks down on those who eat these two together. In fact, they call the pioneers of this combination, geniuses.  For some reason unbeknown to me, chicken and waffles hits a spot in me that I never knew existed. The ability to smother your fried chicken in syrup and eat it WITH your waffle is amazing! Roscoe's put the concept on the map for the rest of LA and it has been frequented by many, many, many people.Being a watershed for tourist eateries in Hollywood, Roscoe's is busy at all hours of the day. When we went at 11am, we were able to be seated quickly despite the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. But I could imagine a pretty long wait if I went on a weekend night. As a health freak, this definitely wasn't the meal I had in mind to start the day. But I knew what I was getting myself into and if I was going to go to Roscoe's I was going to go big. Hannah W. and I shared the Half chicken & 2 waffle combo. The fried chicken portions were HUGE, but more importantly, the waffle mix was amazing. Together (and with syrup) they make a good combo. On the other hand, $15 for this meal seems a little expensive. I'm not an expert on fried chicken, but I'm going to say that if you're looking for bang-for-your-buck value, you better be looking at KFC and Eggos. Still, if you have friends visiting from out of town, you HAVE to take them here. Their trip won't be complete without it!

Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: The world of Roscoe is probably relatively unknown to the general East Coast population.  In fact, I know it is.  But if that day should ever come when Roscoe decides to branch out to my side of the world, I will be among the first to welcome them -- with an open mouth and empty stomach.  At first I was tempted by E-Z Ed's Special but I came for a single purpose and would not be sidetracked.  This is all you need: chicken, waffles and syrup.  God, don't forget the syrup!  It's such an ambiguous pairing but one that works so well together.  I didn't even allow room for a side.  Every succulent bite is better than the next.  This is unadulterated, delicious comfort food.  Even the somewhat dingy setting seemed appropriate. It's called Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles for a very good reason.  A trip to SoCal would not be complete without stopping here.

Reviews.Author: Lexie J.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!! It is not an everyday kind of thing... because... well, that just can't be healthy.BUT it is sooooo yummy! The waffles are perfect, the chicken is awesome. I prefer not to smother it in gravy though... gravy on the side to dip in :) I am weird!OK, so I am weird, I also need my chicken and waffle on separate plates because I don't like sweet and savory mixing. OK, I am going to stop now other than to say... if you are checking reviews to see if you should go try it...Go try it NOW :)

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth N.
Reviews.Content: I always hear great things about Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles.. and after my disastrous experience of chicken & waffles in Atlanta, I thought I'd give it another shot from a famous name. I walked about a mile to get to this restaurant, and I'm sad to report that I am disappointed. Maybe I ordered the wrong meal or something.. but it just wasn't as I expected. I ordered a side of Mac & Cheese, and french fries, and the mac&cheese was absolutely gross, and the fries were overwhelmingly greasy. The service was good, and they did a good job of keeping tabs on me. But I felt that I could have just made the food at home and save myself some money.I did like that the portion sizes were huge. I ended up taking the food to-go, and miles later a homeless black man asked me if I had leftover food in my bag. I gladly gave the extra food to him, and when he opened the box he was really excited to find that it contained Chicken & Waffles. I think that moment was the highlight of my experience (what are the odds!).

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: Why didn't I think this would be a wondrously delicious meal? The idea seems so insane to me now. I knew eventually I had to go here, just for the novelty of it. Famous house of chicken & waffles. Okay, weirdos, I'll try it. My friends, I loved it. I ate every last, precious morsel. But before I go waxing poetic and writing poems, you should know it's not exactly the combination of chicken & waffles that make this place so fantastic. The end result is not exactly better than the sum of its parts. The parts are what make it (are you surprised?). Fried chicken that has a ton of juicy meat that isn't insanely greasy is hard to come by. Someone must have sold their soul at Roscoe's, because they have somehow figured out the perfect fried chicken. They somehow made me, avoider of fried chicken at all costs, love fried chicken. I didn't expect much of the waffles, especially when they came out looking like a larger version of frozen Eggo waffles. They definitely stand on their own with cinnamon goodness. The mix of savory, salty, and sweet is the thing here. If you don't like that, you're not going to be impressed with the marriage (or illicit affair?) of chicken & waffles. The flawless fried chicken and maple syrup are an unexpected but perfect match, then throw in something sturdy like waffles and everything is complete.  I feel like this is really a side note, but I also tried the mac n cheese and their gravy on the side. The mac n cheese was delicious, but is out-shined in my memory by the chicken & waffles experience. The gravy was actually quite tasteless. Perhaps I got a bad batch, but I had to try it a couple times before I could even get a taste. Their lemonade hybrid drinks are delicious! I tried the Eclipse (lemonade and fruit punch), expecting it to be too sweet, but it was absolutely perfect. More tart than sweet, which is just how I like it. These dishes can be forgotten though, when you know what everyone is coming here for.I don't mean to say angels will sing when you have this meal, but for me they certainly did. It's fun, and above all really, really tasty.

Reviews.Author: Ellen C.
Reviews.Content: My first experience was in the Pasadena location years ago with a friend who only ate chicken breasts (Don't get me started on him). We had take out and our order was messed up royally. We ended up getting only one chicken breast, 6 corn breads, and some fries. The chicken was dry and I only had a small bite. We were sharing that one piece amongst 4 people. So, I was pretty excited when I had another chance to check this southern comfort food place again. I came here for their infamous chicken and waffles this time. I ordered the chicken wings. Crispy, greasy, and tender. Everything a fried chicken should be. The grease was running down my mouth. (It wasn't as gross as you're thinking right now). The waffles were sweet, golden brown, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Smothering the waffles with butter and maple syrup really enhances the flavors. The homemade lemonade was delicious. Slightly sweet and tart. The servers amazed me with their prowess of holding plates. Our server was carrying 5 plates at a time. I also ordered the macaroni and cheese. It was creamy and cheesy, but it reminded me of the Kraft powdered mac & cheese. There was no stringiness to it, just runny. Parking sucks in Hollywood, but we found free parking on the street. Service is fast, even though is was bustling with people.I'm utterly happy I was able to have a better experience here.

Reviews.Author: Narek M.
Reviews.Content: Being the 704th reviewer of this place, maybe you can't be a true LA YELPER, until you do review this place.A week ago I went here for the first time after the sickest Metric concert, and besides the meh service, the food is prettty damn good, I had a waffle and a whole chicken breast and mhmmm, I was satisfied, but still a noobie. Tonight I went back after the Laker game and service was muchhhh much bettter, and the fooooood was just as good as I remember if not better. Anyone who lives in the area this place is sorta all it's hyped up to be, tourist attraction you say? Oh, for good reason...good reason indeed.I'll definitely be shipping any first timer friends who want to go there very soon :)

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: Oh, Roscoe's...why have you tempted me with your chicken and waffles for so many years but have somehow evaded me actually eating your chicken and waffles until now! I have been wanting to go to Roscoe's for years on end. You would think that all that time waiting would really over-hype the place for me...but no. Roscoe's DID NOT disappoint! Alright, so it's my first time at Roscoe's, what should I get? Well, let's ask the waitress!Me: Hi there, it's our first time here. What would you recommend?Waitress: *laughs* The chicken and waffles.Sweeet. She went on to suggest that between the two of us, we should get one of the bigger plates to share (#3 and #4), which included 1/2 a chicken (you can choose dark or white! I chose dark of course, so four pieces of chicken total) and two waffles. We had the option of getting gravy over the chicken, on the side, or no gravy at all. We opted for the gravy on top of the chicken and wow, that was a good good choice! So it's been a super long running debate between my friends and I on whether the waffles should have syrup or gravy on it. I voted for the gravy. So how to settle this debate? Well, let's ask the waitress!Me: So do people usually put syrup or gravy over their waffles?Waitress: *laughs* Well, we provide syrup for the waffle and gravy for the chicken, but you can really do it anyway you like!Haha, I'm sure she was thinking like "Silly asian girl. What are you thinking?!" And alright, so maybe I didn't win because she didn't say that the gravy goes over the waffle like I thought it should...but I did it anyway and it was amazing. So this is how it went:1. Cut a piece of gravy smothered chicken2. Dip the chicken in more gravy3. With the chicken still on the fork, cut a piece of waffle too4. Dip the chicken AND waffle in gravy5. Eat it all in one bite6. Die of happinessSo they also have other things on the menu including chicken *wings* and waffles, chicken and biscuits, eggs, omelettes, chicken liver, sandwiches, chicken burgers, and salads. They have a lot of the standard sides too like fries, mac & cheese (which was yuuummy), rice, grits, greens, corn bread, etc! The vibe of this place was super chill, comfortable and our waitress was suuuuuper sweet and answered all my silly questions :) There's a security guard at the door that's much like a bouncer, which was interesting :D AND their open late! Sweeet. Overall, I loved it. Hands down, if I'm in the area, I'm there. Probably a good thing that I don't live in the area. My arteries are grateful.

Reviews.Author: Valentina D.
Reviews.Content: My skin's all plump and shiny from the grease infusion I received from 2:35 am to 4-something am ('cause who's looking at their watch at this point) from Roscoe's.  Reg had promised us a five-star experience, and by the Waffle Goddess Roscoe's delivered!We were stumblin' in there after a very fun party at BGL, hungry as wolves, still looking good, but fading fast.  When we heard that the wait would be 45 minutes ("As in the number 5 next to the number 4?" I asked incredulously) we were bummin' big time.  But LO!  The Waffle Goddess smiled upon us, and after 4 minutes of hemming and hawing about having to wait, we were ushered into the magic sanctum.I noticed right away that this wasn't my momma's late nite restaurant.  It was a big gang-y, a bit hipster-y, and a whole lot Not Canter's. I loved it, of course.  And the smell...oh, slap my face and call me Charlize, it smelled so heavenly in there. So that's star number two (star number one is just for being open so late).  Star number three: our starry-eyed star of a waitress, who treated us like queens and kings and made sure we were comfy and called us honey and sweetheart and told us about her studies and who is a hard worker and a completely admirable person. She was adorable and competent and quick and polite...so give her a raise right now, mr. Roscoe, 'cause she's helping bring people in, I guarantee.Stars four and five (and six and seven) are for the finger lickin', delectable juicy crusty tantalizing chicken and all the fixins.  I got number 13 (or was it 17...I'd had a few drinks, people!) which was a chicken breast the size of a football, with a large waffle (gravy on the side, paid extra).  We all shared the cheese grits, which were as delicate as the most creamy parisian sauce, the greens (appropriately vingeary and a bit bitter, which I loved), the mac and cheese (good, but not as good as my x's recipe). The overall atmosphere was fun, laid-back, edgy,and all about the food.  Cholos, bespectacled intellectuals, and the glammy likes of us mixed and mingled and grinned at each other over huge mouthfuls of great food.  It was the perfect end to a fun day (dance class,  daytime Emmy party, Blue Goose Lounge, lots of laughing) and again I say: I heart you L.A.

Reviews.Author: Sam W.
Reviews.Content: I do in general try to eat light and be health-conscious however I do make a few exceptions when going to my favorite landmark restaurants and Roscoe's makes that list. I will forego a low calorie count to enjoy the best fried chicken in So Cal! The place is simple and smaller than the ideal size to accomadate all the people who want to eat here but I'll forgive them for that because the service is fantastic and food is just the home cookin' you loved from granny back in the day! You can go ahead and use permanent ink when adding this address to your book because you wll always want to come back!

Reviews.Author: Rho L.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles, the concept is like an illuminated light bulb over the head. Duh no shit, of course that works! That being said, Roscoes execution, while commendable, could use a little tweaking.I've come here on many a drunk-to-be night, usually with out of towners that just want to see what the fuss is about, and they always leave with a satisfied grin on their face. Because its so landmark, the wait/service can be slow. Bring a snack for the wait.I'm a dark meat girl. Let's get that out there. The chicken itself is southern fried. While it's battered nicely and fried to a yummy crisp, i found it a bit dry, even the dark meat. The waffles are ok, nothing out of the ordinary in terms of waffles. But somehow, when you combo up two "ok" items, the end result is something a little better than ok. I like roscoes for the novelty and because it's a must-go for visitors, but I definitely would op to eat elsewhere if I were really hungry (which i am all the time).

Reviews.Author: Michele G.
Reviews.Content: Not only do I love Roscoe's Carol C (waffle and a chicken breast) with a side of smothered potatoes, but Roscoe's is entwined in my marriage.Way back in '87, Roscoe's founder Herb Hudson catered the wrap party for now-cult-classic John Cusak and Tim Robbins' film, "Tapeheads." At the party, I had one bite of Mr. Hudson's chicken with waffle soaked in maple syrup and told him: "You need to open a restaurant." What a dork I am! Little did I know he already had a restaurant: Roscoe's. That same evening, King Cotton, lead singer of the Bonedaddy's, who played a character named Roscoe in "Tapeheads," introduced me to my husband.Here's King doing the Roscoe chicken and waffles rap: youtu.be/o9dBiw7xfVU My husband produced some of the Bonedaddy's music for the movie. We bonded over Roscoe's food at the party. Then Mr. Hudson would personally bring his chicken and waffles to the studio where my husband produced music with Bo Diddley and the Bonedaddys, and I would go visit while recording. So it was only natural we would go to Roscoe's on quite a few of our dates.Last night, we took a client from Australia to Roscoe's for chicken and waffles. It was just as tasty as ever.My husband and I have now been together about 25 years and brought our daughter up on Roscoe's. So Roscoe's is part of our life, I guess you could say.And how many other places serve Bartles and Jaymes wine coolers? One sip of those, one whiff of the chicken and waffles and I'm back to 1987.

Reviews.Author: Ti B.
Reviews.Content: I had Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles today.Wow.Ugh....Ouch.mmm....Yum.Whoa!I had the 1/4 chicken, waffles, really dry cornbread...really dry, and grits.  Wow.Ugh....Ouch.mmm....Yum.Whoa!The end.

Reviews.Author: Josh S.
Reviews.Content: I needed something BIG and FAMOUS for review #200.  No shack, home and garden store, or barber would do it justice.  If you see #199, you'll see some buddies and I did a mini-Yelp taste of LA and one place I have been dying to try is ROSCOES!!!!  I mean, we're talking chicken and waffles here.  The Lakers eat here.  Rappers eat here.  Hollywood stars eat here.  This place has cult status!  Now you see, being white, my desire to dine here sometimes gets laughed off like I'm telling a racially insensitive joke.  NO.  No joking involved.  I love fried chicken, I love waffles, someone says eating them together is the sh!t, I WANT TO TRY IT.  So 2 of us 4 had already been here multiple times and loved it but they were willing to hit it up after our Langers and Scoops trips even-though we all were starting to walk like penguins.  We get there at like 3pm so the crowd is fairly light and we're seated quickly.  My buddy starts raving about the SUNRISE.  I'm like what is that, it sounds good.  Its a half and half of fresh OJ and fresh lemonade!  Man this place just loves putting 2 great things together!  The 4 of us order basically the same thing, 4 Sunrises, 4 waffles, 2 w/breasts, 1 thigh, 1 leg.  The place is quite a trip.  Half the place looks like it came out of a Tyler Perry movie while the other half is a mix of pretty much everyone else.  I guess a good representation of LA as whole, a mixing pot.  One table next to us did look like the HILLS let out a tour bus here and all these blonde late teens or early 20's, both sexes, with tons of hair product rolled in and looked really uncomfortable.  But like I said, it was a mixing pot and they ordered like the rest of us.  Finally the food arrived and while I wasn't hungry, I was hungry.  I was still a little unsure of eating them together, with syrup, but since I'm heading off to Rome in a couple days, "when in Rome...."  I poured syrup all over the waffle, the chicken and dug in.  The mildness of the waffle and syrup really worked well with the chicken.  Was it like eating the pastrami at Langers, no, but it was still pretty damn good.  Finger lickin good!  (Oops, wrong eatery)  I was very happy we came and I enjoyed the sunrise so much, I've been making them at home on occasion now.  Roscoes is definitely part of LA and beyond that, a good meal one should try at least once in their life.  And don't be a wuss, eat the chicken with the waffle!!!

Reviews.Author: Nette B.
Reviews.Content: Parking SUCKED... It's really over rated for me.  I was expecting it to be like "AAAAAHHHH" but no.. I've actually tasted better chicken.  The waffles and chicken does have a good combination (sweet and salty).BTW, they have a security guard at the entrance.  Why?  It's a chicken joint.    Don't ever think I'll return nor will I spend too much time writing a review.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: An institution for Southern California where the waffles meet the chicken. It's almost marriage made in heaven for some people.The difference between a Roscoe in Long Beach and Hollywood is quite vastly different. Whereas the LB version is more cleaner and roomier while the WeHo version is more smaller in space and very dimmer in terms of lighting. Obviously this place is more grittier than some of the other spots like in Pasadena.I have been to Pasadena and Long Beach's locations, this one at WeHo definitely trying to be more ghetto in terms of clutter and more reminiscent of a chicken shack than the other two "posh" spots. The pricing for the menu is obviously not cheap at all where a piece of chicken plus a waffle and gravy is going to set you back already at more than $8. Again, only ONE piece of chicken. You can why the sticker shock is going to make people paused.The chicken is always delicious and very tender.The waffles with butter and syrup are better than your store bought Eggo. It is very soft and fluffy. Not a toasted crispy like your Eggo. I suggest to try out their greens.The catch about coming to this place is to avoid weekend's prime lunch and dinner hours as it is a long wait outside the door. There's not much of a space and an accommodations for huge group is almost next to impossible, if not much longer wait.The service is impeccable. Much more friendlier than I encountered at the Pasadena's location. Very down to earth with a smile to boot.I guess to come to Roscoe's is more for the dining experience than to just getting a plate of chicken. We can always ordered a bucket of chicken from KFC. To experience a finer dining of chickens with a side of waffle is worth it. You do need to experience it once in your lifetime.

Reviews.Author: Joseph A.
Reviews.Content: It's 1:30 am and leaving a bar... A friend says, "I'm hungry". In my head, "Great! There goes my diet."  Another friend who's from out of town says, "Roscoes!!". I go along with it since I'm hungry too and my friend from out of town isn't always here. I've been to other Roscoe's locations in years past but not at the original location. Glad the wait wasn't too long as half my friends were half asleep on on bench and newstand.Ordered the traditional chicken #1 Scoes - 1/4 wing, waffles, a ice cream scoop of butter and a shot of maple syrup. Soooo good.. Chicken with hot sauce. Waffles were okay. Even though I ate it all.  Had a taste of my friend's cornbread.  A bit bland and dry. Was expecting much better.Other than that, service was quick and friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: This place is open until 4am!!!! And I know what you are thinking--after your night out at the bars you want some food so you think, what could be better than chicken and waffles???? I have been to another roscoe's once before and eating there alone was definitely enough calories for the night, so the fact that we decided going here after a night out was well....ummm....a whole different experience.We ate so much food here thinking we were hungry when really you never usually that hungry after a night out....Amanda and I split the chicken thigh and waffle and a piece of sweet potato pie. The chicken was glorious and the waffle was as well (after we shoved aside the ice cream scoop of butter ha ha) but the sweet potato pie I thought my aunt could make a better one. And the whipped cream was just thrown on the very edge of the plate so that more whipped cream ended up falling onto our table instead of into our mouths!! Our friend Kevin at the monster combo complete with gravy and the gravy here is just as good as the gravy at the pico location, so go gravy go! Sam got the eggs scrambled with TONS of cheese and onions. Wow they were tasty but definitely awful for you! And some potatoes in a gravy sauce complete with a biscuit which didn't taste as fresh as it should...Overall a good roscoe's experience with better inside decor than the pico location, but I still think the food was better at the original pico spot. Gotta love chicken and waffles and syrup and gravy until 4am!!!!

Reviews.Author: Glen C.
Reviews.Content: I remember a Tech N9ne lyric where he talks about eating at Roscoe's on Sunset and Gower....anyways, I went here recently to meet up with Barry, Carlos, Al, Andrius, Cold, Ski, Ayesha and everyone else for Barry's Yelp mixer.  I arrived kind of late because of the damn traffic. Right before me, Barry was late as well.  It was really really cool meeting up with other Yelpers since this was my 2nd time hanging out at a Yelp event! I actually didn't eat anything because everyone had already finished their food.  Man, Al C. didn't even eat his chicken, so I guess it was that bad!? haha! Yes, the mac and cheese did look good! The place...wow... outside, I was lucky to find parking right in front of the restaurant! Once I got out of my car, I wasn't surprised by the 2 guys that were trying to sell me some incense that smelled like glad in a bottle and some bootleg movies because at the other, BETTER Roscoe's on pico, they had people selling stuff, but the people there actually sold good stuff like Malcolm X shirts, hats, etc.But yeah, so I went inside and met with everyone. I was amazed because this place looks like a damn bomb shelter inside for the next generation's underground railroad! haha! LOL @ Al C. saying that there were gnats flying around!? hahahaha! WOW!  The staff was pretty damn cool, but you will get claustrophobic  eating inside this "Rosco's Bomb Shelter & Biscuits".Man, I believe one of our guests got sick after eating the food here, too! So in a way, it's good that I didn't eat! At least some of us hit up Delancey's right after!Great experience going here and all, but I don't see myself coming back to this one!I will stick to the one on Pico as well!

Reviews.Author: Nicole A.
Reviews.Content: What can I say about Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles that hasn't been said before? Probably nothing I can really contribute but may I say that their cornbread is the best fucking cornbread on this earth? Moist, crumbly but soft, delicious and smeared with butter - my god. I only got that. No chicken, no waffles. Just cornbread.

Reviews.Author: Viennelyn C.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and Waffles? Who can say no to that! This place seriously lives up to its reputation. The food is ridiculously delicious and the staff is very accommodating and helpful. I even enjoyed the hour wait outside of the restaurant. In that hour of waiting, I had a lovely conversation with the security guard who was guarding the entrance,  browsed through samples of incense from a street vendor and enjoyed the 80 degree winter weather of Southern California. As for the food, I highly recommend ordering the:- Country Cowboy- SCOE'S 1/4 Chix prepared southern style with 2 waffles- Mac & Cheese (Side Order)- Candy Yams (Side Order)- Sweet Netta Ta Ta PieOnly bad thing about this place is the parking. However, the food compensates for the annoyance of finding street parking. Other than that...two thumbs up! I love Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles!

Reviews.Author: Lea H.
Reviews.Content: I finally came here after years of everyone of my friends being astounded that I had not been to this magical place yet.  Well, I wish they had not talked it up so much!  The food was so greasy that it left me all gross for a couple of days!  Soooo not worth it!The chicken was so salty and dry, I was like WTF?!?!  My mom makes better fried chicken than this!  They also put so much salted butter on their waffles that even after I removed all the butter off my waffles it still left a crappy salty after taste!Roscoe's was a bit too crowded and a bit too ghetto for me...the only decent aspect about this waffle house was the quick service, but that isn't too surprising since pretty much everything is fried here.I doubt that I will ever come here, unless I am extremely drunk and I don't know exactly what is going on lol!  Good Luck!

Reviews.Author: Laura B.
Reviews.Content: Came here last night...errr this morning with some yelpers after the UYE at BGL. This place was c-r-a-z-y. There must have been 25-30 people waiting to get in at 2am and we were no exception. Luckily, someone got there before the rest of us to put our names on the list (Carlos i think?)...but did that help us eliminate a 30 min+ wait. However, smart yelpers that they are, some people decided to grease the palms of the powers at be to get us in....which worked, sort of. Until it took forever to get the tables cleaned. That being said, the rest of the experience was fantastic.It was really nice to actually sit down and be able to talk and meet with other yelpers in a somewhat quieter environment...especially when eating delicious chicken and waffles. The chicken is alway moist on the inside and crunchy/flavorful on the inside. And the waffle......wow. Best waffle in my life. They're so addicting, I could eat a stack of them. This is the only place in the world that you will see maple syrup and Louisiana hot sauce on my plate simultaneously.After we were seated, the service was pretty good, although, we were easy customers. Oh, there was quite strong presence of a specific "herb" in the restaurant...ahem, i think you know what i mean. didn't come from us though! This place is probably good for curbing late night munchies...if you can get in.I prefer the Pasadena location b/c it's closer to where I live and not nearly as difficult to get into.Good conversation, good people, good food. What more could you want? There was one among us who was mostly unconscious the whole time, but he seemed good to go by the time we left. Nico, hope you found your keys!

Reviews.Author: Tatiana D.
Reviews.Content: I can tell you how I feel about you night and day....night and day...night and day.Who better than Al B. Sure to lay down the soundtrack for my first Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles experience?I'm a fan of eating my breakfast sausage with maple syrup, so eating fried chicken with waffles made complete sense to me. Boyfriend and I planned to eat there before our LA Public Library excursion. This location was easy to get to and parking wasn't bad. We got there at around 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon. You tell them how many people for your party and then you look all cool while you wait outside in front of the Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles sign. Then the "bouncer" calls your name and lets you know your table is ready. It only took about 5 minutes for a table but on our way out (2:30ish), there was quite a line.The decor is really cool, just like a rumpus room, complete with wood paneling and saloon style doors before you enter the restroom. The menu is simple, there's a selection of breakfast and then the chicken & waffles.I ordered Scoe's #1, which is two waffles and two pieces of chicken. I'm a waffle lover, borderline waffle snob, and these waffles were on the mind blowing scale. It's not a plain waffle, there seems to be a touch of cinnamon in the batter. You can even see little specks in the waffle. I was even eating it dipped in the gravy that came with my boyfriend's food (he got Scoe #2). The waffles were huge and there were two of them!The chicken is the bomb ass p****y. No other way to describe it. Usually I don't like to eat the skin by itself but this skin is like no other. Halfway through my meal, I was sad that I didn't order more chicken. Note to self for next time: TAKE SOME CHICKEN TO GO and ORDER LEMONADE! IT'S IN ALL CAPS SO YOU KNOW IT'S IMPORTANT!! I FEEL LIKE I'M KANYE WEST WRITING IN HIS BLOG!!! so I'll stop with the caps but the lemonade was damn good.Service was great. The music playing was all old school soul, Chi-Lites, Stylistics, etc., which made me love the place even more!The marriage between the perfect fried chicken and the perfect waffles is beyond my wildest dreams. These dreams have been fulfilled.

Reviews.Author: stephanie k.
Reviews.Content: This review is for this location only. I've been to other Roscoe's and enjoy the chicken and waffles. I will never EVER go to this location again. First off seating took about 45 minutes and once you get in its small and hot. We sat down... looked at the menu. I look around to see a roach crawling on the wall near the table across from us. I notify the rest of  my party. As we get  up to leave the lady (customer) kills the roach and keeps eating. UGH!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Vivian C.
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles is just full of great food that's missing up north in the Bay, and Roscoe's is one of those great things.  I love chicken. I love waffles.  Putting it together is seriously the best idea ever!  I came here this weekend with my friend.  We walk in, and the host was not welcoming at all, to say the least.  Thank goodness the food was good, and the service was quick.My friend and I both ordered Scoe's #2, with two pieces of dark meat, two waffles made from their "own private mix," syrup, and gravy.  I enjoyed the chicken and gravy, but I thought the waffles were kind of soggy and nothing special.  It's a lot of food, and the two scoops of butter, two jars of syrup, and giant bowl of gravy is way too much for one person.  But really, it just all makes me laugh.  Oh, Americans. I'm also not sure what kind of "special mix" they used, because the waffles tasted like an Eggo to me, but mushier.  So, why the 4 stars?  Because, consumed altogether, it was eating awesomeness in my mouth!  It goes so well together!  It helped that my chicken was piping hot.  My friend and I slathered gravy and syrup all over our chix and waffs, and gobbled that whole thing up.We ate voraciously!  Ravenously!  Happily!Only minus one star because of the mean host and because the waffles weren't all that special.  I left the place with two main thoughts in my head, one happy and one not-so-happy: 1) that was a delicious meal, and 2) I feel really disgusting and this is why Americans are so damn fat. But, I think number 1 trumps number 2 in this case.  Chicken and waffles.  GENIUS, I TELL YOU!

Reviews.Author: Luigi C.
Reviews.Content: After visiting all the way from Texas, this place was definitely on the list of places to try when in Los Angeles. I've heard many great things about chicken and waffles so I'm glad that the first time I got to try it was at the famous Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles.It makes sense why this place has over 1,000 reviews, fan pages on Facebook, and specials on TV -- because it so good! The fried chicken is tasty and seasoned very well although I found it to be a little greasy, but that's fried chicken for you. To my surprise, I actually enjoyed the waffles more than the chicken! Not to take anything away from the chicken, but the waffles are damn good here! Both paired well with each and I see what the buzz is all about. Salty meets Sweet.  Houston has it's very own version of Roscoe's called the Breakfast Klub, for me, they're both as equally as delicious. But when it comes down to the waffles, Roscoe's has the slight advantage and when it comes down to the fried chicken - TBK has the slight advantage. Ultimately, a toss up between the two!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is an obscure eatery hidden on a side street in Hollywood.  It look like an old nightclub from the outside:  wood-paneled, no windows, and attended by a host who seems like a bouncer who restricts entry into the dining room.  Very odd.  However, inside holds a lively bustle that is actually quite surprising after having waited outside.The chicken is alright.  The dark meat, such as the drumsticks and wings, is pretty good.  However, there is not much going on taste-wise.  It just seems like pieces of chicken are thrown into the fryer without much seasoning with many spices.  Moreover, the white meat is extremely dry and tough.  In fact, I had to eventually give up on it because it was too difficult to eat.On the other hand, the waffles are delicious.  They're both fluffy and slightly crisply.  Eat them fast, though, or else they become soggy.  The best part is the syrup, which I was very impressed with.  It's rich and has a slight hint of cinnamon.  If you're not minding your health, spread the waffles with butter before dipping it in the syrup to add a little bit of creamy savoriness, a wonderful combination with the sticky syrup.The service is quite good, despite the initial impression with the bouncer/host outside.  The staff is friendly and efficient.The experience at Roscoe's is pleasant.  However, though I truly am disappointed, I must give only three stars.  Although the waffles are great, the chicken, the other half, is not quite as impressive.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and Waffles. I can't believe it's taken this long for me to give it a try since I've heard about the combination for years. Of course I've also heard that Roscoe's is probably the best place to get them. I was super excited when my boyfriend brought me here. I was a little daunted by the long line but we got lucky and we didn't have to wait at all!I have NO idea why this place is so dark. I mean they really need some more windows or something. I really wish it was a bit lighter since I like being able to see what I'm eating. I wasn't sure what to order since the menu was a lot more extensive than I thought but I ended up ordering the combo that came with two waffles and some fried chicken with gravy. My boyfriend wasn't in the mood for chicken and waffles so he got the Chicken sandwich. We also got an order of the chicken chili over beans. I love waffles and this was perfect for me. Those waffles were delicious! I mean what kind of butter was that? It's super light and fluffy. Yum Yum Yum. The chicken with the gravy was also super tasty. It's so strange how everything tastes so good together. I mean how could that even work? I don't usually eat the chicken skin because it's artery clogging but I ate all of it here. It was awesome. The chili was also good but nothing too special. The same goes for the sandwich also. Good but you should probably stick with the classics here. The price was reasonable for the amount of food you get. It's super crowded and I'm just glad we didn't have to wait in line for so long since I am horrible with waiting. Forget being healthy, give me some fried chicken and waffles drowned in syrup! 4/5

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: I like to come here sometimes after a night out of dancing and drinking.  It's right on Gower so it's an easy destination.  If you plan ahead and get there before 1:30am you miss the drunken crowd and get seated pretty quickly. Warm toasty waffles+crisp, succelent golden fried chicken+heavenly sweet maple syrup+LOTS of creamy BUTTER=heaven.You have to get some corn bread and mac&cheese too! Who knew fried chicken drenched in syrup would be so delicious!Not everyone is impressed, but if you have to at least try it once..personally I love leaving a restaurant and feeling stuffed.Drunken antics may lead to gulping down shots of maple syrup so beware!

Reviews.Author: Toni L.
Reviews.Content: What was everyone smoking when they came in here? Seriously, this food is not good. I'm not sure if the problem is specific to this Roscoe's or if it's a universal thing, but their chicken and waffles did not work.Food: I'm not against the idea of mixing chicken and waffles together, but the truth of the matter is that when you combine BAD chicken and BAD waffles you've just created a recipe for disaster. The chicken was dry as hell. I seriously wanted to just throw it away. Truthfully the waffles were okay, but it wasn't like I'd sell my left arm for a taste. The condiments are pretty limited as well. Value: Cheap? NO. A dinner here will definitely not cost you under $10. More like.. $18-25. Service: Pretty standard. Atmosphere: The restaurant was super dirty inside (I had some weird lip marks on my glass and my utensils were gross). It was dimly lit and more in a creepy than mysterious fashion. Synopsis: Don't be sucked in by the hype. As a lover of both fried chicken and waffles eating at Roscoe's was one of the most disappointing times in my life.

Reviews.Author: Fredy U.
Reviews.Content: I don't always eat fried chicken, but when I do I eat at Roscoe's. My guiltiest pleasure when visiting Los Angeles. The awesome combination of sweet and salt keeps me wanting more. Chicken is always very juicy, never dry. You simply must try this place when in LA, you will wonder how you ever survived without this combination of food.

Reviews.Author: Beth F.
Reviews.Content: Instructions for RCW:1) Don't eat a thing twenty four hours before visiting Roscoe's -- you will need all that space in your belly.2) Don't be a wuss! Order that crispy sweet waffle with some good, flaky, greasy southern fried chicken on top and pour gravy/syrup/whatever turns you on over it all.  3) Go home and take an "itis" nap.  Nothing better than a great meal and with a nap following and after eating this glorious-who-would've-thunk-it-only-in-LA combination you will want to lay down and dream of the next time chicken and waffles come together in your mouth.

Reviews.Author: Patrick O.
Reviews.Content: "What's Soul Food?" asks a young kid to an adult. The adult answers "about the second leading cause of death for people over 40" Also, last time I checked, isn't it county law to post inspection grade for a restaurant in clear public visibility?HOW HAVE THEY NOT SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN????Doesn't anyone CARE that they're serving SOUL FOOD to patrons who obviously already have another harmful substance - alcohol (or others) in their systems @ 2 AM.WHO'S GOING TO STOP THIS MADNESS?? WHO??Show me em' because if they get in the way of my drunken chicken n' waffles, then that man I'm sorry is going to get a swift kick to the nuts...and also my bill for the grub because I'll drunkenly forget to pay.

Reviews.Author: Corey Tess T.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that I only go after a night of clubbing. I have never been here for breakfast (as in when i woke up) or lunch.. or dinner.. but let me tell you.. when you have danced for hours, had some libations (shall we say) and are on that sort of after math high (I dont wanna go home yet!) this is the perfect place to go and pig out!Some things to consider: There WILL be a line.. (but it is 2 or 3 am!) no, there WILL be a line and don't park in the shopping center where it says NO PARKING for Roscoe's because the tow truck guy knows where he can find some easy money too at 3am on a Saturday night..There is nothing healthy on the menu..  you will see drunk people.. the staff is not super friendly, they are tired and sick of drunks.. but the food is YUMMY.. it is Southern comfort food in LA..  fried chicken, waffles.. what is better than that??? Some bad coffee..  yay...Don't try to cut in line or get cute about it.. people will smack you down. although if you are a pretty girl and the door guy likes your looks, he will put you ahead of other groups.. don't tell him I said so though..  better to wait your turn :)

Reviews.Author: Nikki H.
Reviews.Content: Yes! This joint is just as good as everyone talks of. In this case I do believe the hype! I have tasted this goodness with my own mouth! I have only eaten here once which is lame considering I lived in the Valley for 11 years. Now I am gone and feel that I did not get my fill of the most delicious waffle I have had in my life. The chicken is great, but the waffle is the show stopper.They have a delicious mac and cheese! Mmmmmm yes so good, taste similar to mine that I bake at home from scratch, casserole style so yes is a winner for sure!I would return again just for the Waffles alone.

Reviews.Author: Jeanette S.
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that I barely had Roscoe's for the first time last weekend!!! Where has Roscoe's been all my life?!?! After a night out in Hollywood last weekend I ate my first plate of fried chicken and waffles, and will definitely be coming back for more. As recommend by my good friend Kristina H, (a long time Roscoe's fan) I ordered a #13  which is 1 waffle and a piece of fried chicken, and added a side of macaroni. I can not even believe or begin to describe how delicious this waffle and fried chicken are! As mostly everyone always thinks before coming here, I thought how can this possibly be good??!?! and then I got drunk and all that changed haha. The fried chicken is so full of flavor and juicy, and not dry on the inside and overly greasy on the outside like most fried chicken. I'm usually not a huge fan of waffles, but oh man this one was so good! I couldn't even believe it and it actually compliments the chicken somehow. The side of macaroni was great too, but I was pretty full already so I didn't eat that much of it.They do not split checks, so you and your friends better have some cash left over from the club and/or bar before eating here. So yea from now on fuck Denny's and Norm's I want Roscoe's at 3am every time from now on. Just be prepared to wait, it gets crowded here.

Reviews.Author: Miriam W.
Reviews.Content: *Disclaimer: I am black. So I review here without fear!*For putting waffles in your name, when the waffles ain't all that, you lose a star. I am a waffle fiend. I was grossly offended. The true waffle fiend hunts for utter lightness, crispness on the outside, buttery light density on the inside, and crevices to cuddle your butter and syrup with. You get crevices, but nothing else, with these imposters.They're basically gigantic, double-trouble eggo waffles. They are limp and heavy before you put the butter and syrup on them. They had not an ounce of crunch to them. Okay, they might have when they left the kitchen, but within mere seconds, they were ... moist. They did have whipped creamy butter, instead of heavy pats. That's a good thing.Alas, I did not complete them, not because I was so full on goodness, but because I was more interested in comforting myself with the good cooking in all the side dishes. Roscoe's, for having deliriously sumptuous candied yams (more like stewed yams in syrup, but never ye mind, I had mini-orgasms and sugary toothroot shudders), and pretty good chicken, and pretty good greens, I shall forgive you many things. Verrrrry good gravy. I did typical bad-for-you comfort food things, like dip my chicken and my fries in the gravy. It was terribly clever, if I do say so myself.Outside the south, it is very hard to get good homestyle cooking unless you go to a transplanted Southerner's house (that would include black folks, we bring the food with us when we bail). And we don't want to go to the South for home cooking. I don't want to visit my Aunt Maxine and sit watching her make homemade baked beans and greens with fresh hamhocks, I am too d@mned impatient for that.We had a wait, but they were efficient. The seating was cramped, with gads of stuff on the table tops that got in the way of our meal. We had to keep consolidating plates to avoid drowning in the excess. Our waitress was nice.Their lemonade/orange juice thingie drink is good times. I was simply thrilled to be a black person surrounded by black people in west hollywood. That's rare you know, in Hollywood. ;)

Reviews.Author: Adolfo H.
Reviews.Content: It's late at night and your with your homies, hungry and well...it's gonna be that kind of night. Roscoes isn't so much food as it is a meal, that you shouldn't have, but you can't stop yourself from.  I have never eaten here during the day, or at a reasonable hour.  And yet they serve Waffles at your beck and call. Only in America my friends.If you have never been here,  and have heard hype ect.... don't believe it as much as understand who and why people eat here.Who eats here?I do for one and secondly people who are willing to eat chicken and waffels in the same meal, defying the laws of breakfast and dinner. Not brunch not linner but   Brinner.They serve half chickens legs, breast ect. depending on what your willing to eat in one sitting they  will have your size, they will have gravey they will have greens they will have rice. The chicken is not the greatest you've ever had. But that was never the point. this leads me to the Why?Why eat here?This is the sort of place that is meant for friends looking to fill up at night, wanting to experience not novelty but a genuine meal.There is usaully a wait, and the first thing you notice is the the very distinct Roscoe whiff that come from inside... think chicken.This one in particular is smaller than the one on Pico. But service is decent.I recommend the orange juice mixed with the lemonade... I enjoy  these.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles is delicious and great. I've been coming to this location for a while and it use to be the smallest. They've recently renovated and extended it since it was one of the most busy locations that they have. No matter what time of the day or night there was always a line of people waiting outside. They're known for their (in their name) Chicken & Waffles. You can pick if you want white or dark meat or a mix of both. I highly recommend that you do try their chicken & waffles for your first visit.  But they do have a number of different combo plates as well as sides. Their mac and cheese is delicious. A place for some great comfort food. Their greens are ok, just my opinion. The place gets super busy so don't count on a server to constantly check up on you. You might have to flag them down if you are in need of some extra service when you've been served your food. Another thing to note are their drinks, my favorite is a sunrise it's a mixture of lemonade and orange juice they also offer a sunset both delicious.  If you're visiting LA or know people visiting LA be sure to take them here, it's all street parking up Gower, don't try to park in the different plazas especially the one where Denny's is off of Sunset because they tow and ticket there. Great place for groups but you'd have to wait just a little longer but it isn't too bad now that the place is bigger.Side note at this location you might see random celeberties or random things going on there or on the streets of LA that it sits along.Right before Soulja Boy got big this is what we witnessed outside at roughly 3am...youtube.com/watch?v=Qf21…youtube.com/watch?v=N6jC…We've ran into Yuck Mouth and other people before too hahaha.

Reviews.Author: Dean K.
Reviews.Content: There are those things in Los Angeles that you only do when friends come to town. This was one fo them for me. I had a friend visit last week and he really wanted to check out Roscoe's. I never thought much of it but being a foodie I had to check it out, I mean it is an LA staple. I was also curious because I spent a few years in North Carolina and have eaten A LOT of southern food, so I needed to compare.The atmosphere is whatever, sort of "divey" but whatever thats cool, thats exactly the place this food should be served! So we both ordered the Chicken and Waffles with a side of gravy, and I also got the arnold palmer there, which I think they call Lisa's Delight? Anyway, that was the best I have ever had!The food got to the table, We each received 2 waffles, that had what looked like, well let me describe it this way. Imagine someone using both hands to reach into a tub of whipped butter and bringing out 2 fistfuls of butter and putting it right on top of your waffles. AMAZING! So I basically made a butter sandwich with the waffles as the bread. Then I added 2 shots of syrup and let that marinate for a bit. Next I cut up some chicken to get ready for my first bite. I thought the chicken was pretty damn good, some of the best I have had and that saying a lot. Anyway, I assembles some chicken and aforementioned waffle assembly then dipped it into the gravy. WOW!Let's put it this way. Eating here is like an edge of your seat thrill ride that grabs you by your mouth genitals and never lets go.ITS THAT GOOD!

Reviews.Author: Maisha R.
Reviews.Content: It's been over 10 years since I first visited Roscoe's and as I bit into the waffles and fried chicken wing dipped in a little syrup and hot sauce, it tasted just as great as I'd remembered. The waffle had that delicious cinnamon flavor and the chicken was fried well but lightly. Going early on a Saturday morning in an effort to beat the crowd proved to be a successful strategy as there were just a few tables of people dining inside. The service was efficient; my food came out within 10 minutes of my ordering, which was great. Roscoe's clearly stands the test of time and it continues to be some of the best chicken and waffles that I've had.

Reviews.Author: Chad F.
Reviews.Content: As the 3rd leg of a Yelp trek across LA, it was admittedly my fault for being stuffed when I walked in the door.  With little room left in my gut, I ordered the #18 (chicken leg or thigh and a waffle) and washed it down with a sunrise (orange juice and lemonade). The sunrise was absolutely fantastic. Thanks Josh!  The chicken was good, not great and was actually overshadowed by the waffle, which was delicious.  Crispy and flavorful, I wished I had hit up Roscoe's after the Dodger game instead of before.  I was thinking 3 1/2 stars, but in retrospect Roscoe's is a solid 4 stars.  If I dropped in famished,  it could even touch 5.  Safe to say I will be back when I have more room to consume.

Reviews.Author: Fabian M.
Reviews.Content: Great place to come with family and friends, been here on several occasions and have been treated pretty well.The food is really delicious and doesn't take a long time to get to your table after ordering. To drink I always get the Sweet Tea which is a favorite of mine.I ordered a #4 ($16.40)today and was just enough food for 2 people to be satisfied.My only thing from giving 5 stars was that the waitress never came to check up on us and also last time I came here I had 2 waiters fighting over who will take our table (both of them didn't want to take it).Overall great food and good people.

Reviews.Author: Nadia L.
Reviews.Content: So I've heard about this place forever but to be honest I'm not sure what the fuss is all about. I've heard about my friends driving down from the bay just to get some Roscoes which is craaaazzzyyy!!! Granted the chicken is pretty good but I guess I'm just not a big fan of the whole chicken and waffles idea. Maple syrup on my fried chicken along with the waffles is definitely not my ideal meal; however its definitely worth it to just say you've had Roscoe's before. Also, chicken and waffles for $14+ is not my idea of the best way to indulge and get a great meal. I think I would rather spend my $14 somewhere else. Plus parking sucks!

Reviews.Author: Ericka L.
Reviews.Content: Now, I make some good chicken and waffles but nothing that rivals this popular place!! Came here with my family and our wait was short, waitress was a cute old lady who had a great sense of humor, and the food was awesome. Waffles so soft and chicken so crispy, man, texture overload!!! I am not sure if the version of this place that they built in Chicago is better but I am sure anxious to give it a go!

Reviews.Author: Lawrence L.
Reviews.Content: Good eatin' here!  Chicken and waffles as a combination - who would have thought????  Scoe's #1 came with 2 big waffles with 2 scoops of whipped butter, warm maple syrup, and your choice of 2 pieces of southern style fried chicken (or as the menu says "1/4 chix").  Had a side of their candied yams, mac n cheese and greens.  The greens stood out on the sides as a big winner (good spice/ seasoning and tender).This one was located in Hollywood, which was a pretty popular spot for a Tuesday night.I would definitely come back when I am visiting in SoCal.

Reviews.Author: Kait R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a must try for those living in LA or visiting LA. The combination of waffle, syrup and chicken in one bite is just a joy. So glad I tried this place.The waffles are nothing special, but when you dip it in some syrup and add a piece of chicken, it creates a wonderful combination of flavors and textures. Don't go here because you want good waffles, because you'll be disappointed.I would recommend #1 Scoe's 1/4 fried chicken and 2 waffles.

Reviews.Author: Amber N.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time on Thursday the 14th for some lunch. Parking was a breeze (I used metered parking) on the street...just be sure to make it back before the hours up or your ass will have a ticket. There were 3 of us who went and we all ordered #13.... a fried chicken breast and a waffle ($8.50) each...which is kind of pricey for 1 waffle and 1 piece of chicken. The waffle was so damn GOOD. I was surprised as I'm not much of a waffle lover. The breast was tasty too.1 side of macaroni & cheese was ordered....and 2 iced tea/lemonade drinks.The drinks were very sweet and good....and there was NO refills on them 8(The Macaroni n Cheese was scrumptious....I didn't order it....but I tasted it.Our waitress was SO friendly...I LOVED the experience I had dining hereI'll definitely be back sometime soon

Reviews.Author: Cleophus B.
Reviews.Content: This place is so damn overrated (I'm only writing this review out of boredom). I view it as a spot for tourists and people that do not eat fried chicken too often. The chicken is no better than what my grandmother makes (and me). If you're going to get chicken, just get it smothered, at least it'll be somewhat "exotic" to some of you. Now, I will admit that the waffles are the bomb.Each time I go, I order the 3 wings (smothered) and waffle. I've tried their sides: mac n' cheese, greens, and smothered potatoes and those were just okay too.As for all the locations, I've been to them all except the one on Manchester & Main and the newly opened Inglewood location. I prefer the low-key Long Beach location, because I never had to wait there. Roscoe's is not horrible, but you're much better off going to someone's family potluck, if you want to experience down home fried chicken.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: I had to try it..It is L.A landmark after all.  For someone who drive to South Central to find good fried chicken and Soul Food,  my visit was a disappointment.It's like some of the Jewish Deli in Los Angeles ..over priced .. food is not good.. but buzzing with people.I went there with group of 8 people.  none of us was impressed by the food. ( mix race, mix age 20-30,, mix gender)   We did took a picture in front of West La location.  in honor of Chris Tucker. It's a defiantly a Los Angles thing to do. but i wouldn't crazy about the taste of their fried chiken. or the dry waffles.

Reviews.Author: Amie G.
Reviews.Content: Went here for an early lunch today. My husband put our name down and after 40 minutes he went to ask how far we were on the list. The man at the front said "25 minutes, like i already told you" - which was strange because it was the firs time he asked. We waited about another 20 minutes while about 6 other couples were called for a table (all had arrived after us). My husband went to ask again and the man at the front was extremely argumentative. He accused my husband of asking every 5 minutes about our table, and accused him of doing the same thing last weekend (again, this was funny because he had never been there before!). After being asked several times, he finally allowed us to see where our name was on the list - which was 2 pages back from where they currently were. They skipped our name by mistake and seated 2 pages worth of people after us. Fair enough, mistakes happen, but they wouldn't own up to it tried to blame it on us saying we tried to pull the same thing the weekend before.Very strange, and a very bad first experience. We ended up leaving and eating somewhere else. We wont' be going back. I guess they figure they do a good business and pack the place every day so they don't have to worry about being nice to people.I would not recommend this place to anyone. There is no point in spending so much time trying to get into a restaurant only to be treated so rudely.

Reviews.Author: Dana L.
Reviews.Content: Went here last Saturday around 11:30am for the first time, not a good time to go if you're really hungry.  The wait was an hour long so we got take out.  When people say this place is good, it's not just because it's popular.  The waffles are amazing and they have a lot of different sides for non-chicken eaters like me.  The mac and cheese, biscuits, and cornbread are all solid choices.I would go back but maybe at a less popular time.

Reviews.Author: Deborah K.
Reviews.Content: I like fried chicken.I like waffles.I like gravy.I like biscuits.I like cheap food walking distance from my house.I like Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles.  Especially the #13: One Succulent Breast.  One Delicious Waffle.With a side a' gravy.  Comped.  Yay!  And my friend's biscuit.The gravy has onions.  The chicken is, fried in...crack maybe?  It's CRISPY.  And even the breast meat is juicy.  The beans and rice are really tasty and comforting with butter and honey, which I realize isn't actually good for you, but my goodness who the hell cares?  This is what I want when I have the flu.The whole thing embodies "comfort food".  Salty.  Fattening.  Inappropriately delicious.  My dining companion yelled at me for not finishing my biscuit.  As she neared fullness she started shoveling gravy-covered rice into her mouth to get it all in before her stomach had a chance to protest.Ahhhhh gluttony.   The good kind.  The kind that says "Here's a plate of food that's just a bit more than you need, packing in about 3x as many calories as it should, and honey, eat it up!  Eat It Up!I like fluffier waffles, but these taste amazing.  So I forgive them their flatness.  The chicken skin doesn't even taste like chicken skin.  It tastes like...Oh.  Sorry.  I was eating.  I don't remember.  But it was good.Honestly it's not like it's a song on the palatte, or anything.  It's just the best comfort food ever.And for that?  It's PERFECT.Oh, and the gravy has onions.  Yay.

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about the amazing chicken and waffles at Roscoe's, I realized I couldn't call myself a self-respecting Angeleno without trying it for myself so I went on a saturday night around 8:30 and waited about a half hour to be seated.I didn't need to look at the menu because I knew what I was going to get but I heard that they had huge portions so I split the 2 waffles and 2 legs plate with my cousin. It was just the right amount of food for about 10 something which was such a bargain because just 1 waffle and 1 leg is about 8 bucks. The food didn't look like anything special but it tasted really amazing. maybe i was just starving but there's a reason so many people line up for this place. It's pretty heavy--not something I'd eat everyday or every month for that matter but it's definitely worth trying at least once.

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere abd friendly service of Roscoe's appealed to me since i spent the first 16 years of my life in Tennessee. Though i came here for waffles and eggs, i was happy to see soul food staples like grits, greens, and of course, fried chicken on the menu of a restaurant in the middle of Hollywood. In fact, they serve fried chicken about a dozen different ways. So why the three stars? Well, for one thing, i dont eat chicken. But more to the point, i came here for breakfast food, so that's what i'm reviewing. The waffles are not much better than what you would find in the frozen section of your local grocery store, and are served with enough butter to kill a small animal.

Reviews.Author: Rockets P.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to try this place after many trips to SoCal. I ordered the Scoe's #1 dark meat. The batter on the chicken is delicious and I'm surprised it wasn't greasy for fried chicken. The waffles were great and I detected a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg in the mix. They were named best Mac and cheese in LA but I'm not so sure about the title since my order was cold and just not impressive. Definitely hit the comfort food spot on my trip.

Reviews.Author: Vicky L.
Reviews.Content: I like fried chicken but I'm not big on waffles, so my review may be a little ironic. I never planned on trying the place out but today, against my will, my boyfriend thought he would take me.My first thoughts on their chicken? Just "okay." People hyped this place up a little too much so I guess I expected more. The fried chicken is nothing I can't find at a local grocery store or anywhere else for that matter. The fries were horrible; dry and bland. I have to admit though that their waffles were awesome; soft and fluffy! The only reason I'd ever go back is if someone I was hanging out with wanted to eat there. What can I say? I'm a people pleaser :)

Reviews.Author: Andrea K.
Reviews.Content: All i can say is #13....One succulent breast and a waffle.straight grub!!The mac n Cheese isn't perfect, but that's not what they're there for ....Where else can u get a juicy piece of chicken and a perfectly cripy and soft, sweet waffle?Yeah, no where! hahaI love this place...and the Louisiana Hot Sauce flows like a river!!Mmmmm!xo-andrea

Reviews.Author: Joanna P.
Reviews.Content: Giving it 4 stars because it's Roscoe's! And it's DEEELISH!But the experience is a big fat ZERO.So Mimi (my dog), Grace (my sister), and I decide to go for a late night snack. First of all, Grace cannot drive so I'm sitting there scared for my life getting car sick and wondering when I can have my damn chicken and waffles. Second, the area is a bit.. ghetto. The one on Gower isn't as ghetto as the other ones but still.. I was scared so I made Grace (my YOUNGER sister) get out of the car and go get the food while Mimi and I were safely in the car. Apparently this is how the conversation between Grace and the guys who worked there went...Grace: *Places order..*Guy #1: "Anything you want babe. Did you just get off work?"Grace: *WEARING PENGUIN PJS* Uhh.. no. I'm in high school."Guy #1: "Oh what high school?"Grace: "Harvard-Westlake. It's in North Hollywood."Guy #2: "So how old are you?"Grace: "17..."Guy #2: "Oh, you're too young for me."Guy #1: "Are you in high school?"Grace: "YES."Guy #1: "What's your nationality?"Grace: "Korean."Guy #2: "You're the hottest Korean we've seen tonight. Do you have an older sister?"Grace: "Uhh.. yes..." *Takes food and leaves*Hahaha. Thank goodness I made her go get the food while my dog and I were safe inside a locked car =) THANKS GRACE!

Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Q.
Reviews.Content: There is not much I can say that hasn't already been said in the previous 727 reviews, but I needed to add my two cents, apparently. + We found street parking (painless enough), then had our name added to the list, only to have it called before we could even sit down on the bench outside. - We were seated at a tiny two-top table next to a divider wall and were very uncomfortable, but assumed that since there were only two of us, it wasn't our place to complain+ Upon seeing two not-so-small people (my husband and I) hunching over the tiny table, the cutest little old man (John) came over in a hurry and moved us to a four-top where we had room to breathe- The service was swift from the get-go of seating to ordering, but once our food arrived, our waitress (Irene?) fell off the face the planet. She never once came back to refill our drinks and my husband's was empty for the entire meal. Lame. Even with both of us trying to get her attention, she never returned to check on us and I had to flag down our old buddy John to request the bill after we gave up on quenching our thirst+ THE FOOD -- the saving grace, the reason Roscoe's has not only survived, but thrived, in several locations and for so many decades. Every bite of moist fried chicken and perfectly cooked waffle are joy. There is no reason to complicate your order with gravy or grits -- just stick with what God blessed them with and you will leave happy (although maybe thirsty). Thank you for reminding me of what soul food really is, Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
