Reviews.Content: I'll try to give you a fresh angle in this sea of reviews:Chicken liver and gizzard lovers,  know you can get it done the right way, your way, at Roscoe's.  You can get smothered chicken livers and eat them true soul food style with rice.  I'm about to faint thinking about it.  You can get a gigantic order of fried chicken livers or gizzards (but they don't offer a mixed plate - whinewhinewhine) with sides for about $10.Here's a tip:  if you're bringing fried livers back to your hotel room, make sure you'll have a place to store them.  Our hotel didn't...and I had to go sit in the lobby and eat those leftover suckers cause my kids couldn't stand the smell.I'll be honest.  I don't even care about the waffles.  However, my kids do and they don't like the "classic" soul food preparation for waffles, which seems to include nutmeg (often a lot) in them.  If you are not a nutmeg lover, you just may wish to note this.I can't complain about anything I've had at Roscoe's any time I've been in town.  The chicken is on point, the sides are kickin' and LIVERLIVERLIVER.  Also, as part of my healthy lifestyle, I will point out the soda pop is bottomless and they don't mess around with refills.  I took that as a personal challenge on my last visit and...well...let's not go there.Practical note:  four of us ate to bursting with enough leftovers to feed at least 3 of us again handily for about $55.  And - this location is dark, it has almost no windows!  I guess they want to give you privacy while you chow.

Reviews.Author: Ron N.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I didn't give their chicken breast enough credit the last time I reviewed Roscoe's.  It's just so damn succulent and scrumptious that I can't think of many other places that have bomb chicken.This time around my friends and I also ordered the sweet potato pie for the first time.  I don't remember the last time I've even had sweet potato pie so I felt it was the right time... and what better place to have it than Roscoe's?  My my my.... it was some good stuff, and with the whipped cream it was even better.  So sweet and so tasty for my tummy.I must say that between Gower and Pico, this one is my favorite location.  Everytime I come here I feel "L.A." and everytime I go to the one on Pico I feel a bit ghetto and don't really feel like I'm getting an L.A. experience for some reason.Lastly, parking really really sucks unless you get lucky.  I wish they had a private lot.  If you try to park next door in front of Red Ribbon you risk getting towed.  My friends made circles around Roscoe's for about 15 minutes until they decided to just park at Denny's across the street.  Luckily they didn't get towed.  What a happy ending to a wonderful day.

Reviews.Author: Jamora C.
Reviews.Content: If Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles asked me to do an infomercial testimonial for them, i'd do it in a heartbeat. And my testimonial would sound like this:"My name is Jamora and I've been on a diet now for the past six months. But when I like to cheat and get a lil fat again, I go to Roscoe's House of Chicken n Waffles. I love their Southern style fried chick'n... I cover it all up with an extra order of gravy mixed in with some maple syrup and gobble it all down. Why do I turn a blind eye to calories when I go to Roscoe's? Well their chicken is extra crispy, flaky in just the right places, and after you get through the breading... the chicken is quite tender. And the waffles? Girl, you better plan two extra days of exercise after you eat a stack of those. Buttery, fluffy, round... crispy... I can already feel my body producing an extra layer of fat in anticipation."Despite the lines, parking nightmare, and perhaps not the best service, you still wanna get there and be like the Cookie Monster, but with fried chicken (fried chicken monster!).

Reviews.Author: Stephen R.
Reviews.Content: Warning: Colorful language follows...Mutha'fukin'hellyeah! Roscoe's goes off! Down home chicken and tasty waffles are the Sunday hangover cure you always wished your WASP parents prescribed. This is by far the greatest marriage of total opposites since Ric Ocasek and that really pretty chick! Go. Stop reading and just go. You'll thank me later.g'on now!

Reviews.Author: ben h.
Reviews.Content: Yup, I am a fan of this Southern California classic joint. While I enjoy the ambience of the Pico location more, I find that I am near this Hollywood location most often. When passing by, if I have the time, I cant resist the temptation to go inside.The ambience here reminds me of a Southern Church where they might be having one of those pot luck or baked bean dinners. What you typically find here is off the cuff service....which means you will be quickly seated by someone who is just doing there job. You will quickly be asked what you want and your food will arrive rather quickly.Some days, my craving is spot on and I will rave about my food, other days, I wonder if my fond memories are jilted in some way as things will be just ok.The waffles are absolutely delicous (say 8 times out of 10). They are best first thing in the morning when you know they are hot off the iron. They are unlike any waffle I have ever tasted. They come with plenty of syrup and butter too. Usually I scrape off butter at any other establishment, but here I slather it on. Perhaps its the environment in the room that causes me to partake in such cholesterol clogging activity. The first time I ever went to Roscoe's, I remember four giant scoops of softened butter and four containers of hot syrup....usually you get two, and as with most first times, I long for the time when four scoops was what I got (whether or not I used all of it is a different story).Skip the coffee, unless you like it old fashioned and weak, being a trained barista, its god awful for a coffee snob like me. I usually order a diet coke. I drink a lot with my food and the wait staff is happy to refill the glass countless times so that I slosh as I exit.Now for the chicken. I have had it both simply fried and smothered in that delicious onion gravy. If you ask me, stay away from the breast, it WILL be dry. The dark meat however is simply delicious. I prefer my chicken smothered because the gravy is so damned delicious. It will come on a separate plate when ordered with the gravy. Otherwise it will sit nestled next to your waffle awaiting to bathe in pools of syrup. Either way, its pretty delicious.Recently, I tried one of the House combos, simply because if I like a place, I want to try everything on the menu. I had the macaroni and cheese with greens, cornbread, and chicken. I placed the order by phone on a Saturday night and was placed on hold. As I drove into the lot, I finished  placing the order and told them I was already here. After waiting 50 minutes, I learned they forgot to put in my order. I got some mild apologies and my food free....no complaints here : ) (note although I did get breast instead of leg, even after repeating LeG three times on the order.)The macaroni was just like a modest homemade version. Not the best, but will do when the craving arrives (Swingers on Beverly has a far better late night version). The greens however were extraordinarily tasty and served as perfect fodder for the dry fried breast. Voila! Moist chicken when dipped in the green juice. The cornbread, well, its adequate. Use the butter before biting into the crumbly square. But then again,  I think Boston Market has the best (there processed Mac n Cheese is up there too...hehe)I suspect I will be visiting again very soon (I am craving it now) as this is a place where fond food memories are made. I look forward to trying the biscuits n gravy, the beans n rice, and the chicken livers n grits very soon.

Reviews.Author: Drew K.
Reviews.Content: Home sweet home. Like my laughable skills in the bedroom, my visit to the left coast will only last longer than a sneeze. But there are a few places I need to hit up, and Roscoe's is the gold standard.Roscoe's is the real deal because the founder is from the mean streets of Newport Beach. Ha! Just kidding...he's from Harlem, but he's gone from "ashy to classy," and probably has a home (or two) in my 'hood. Roscoe's is authentic soul food, and the place hasn't changed its stripes.  I've been craving "best of the best" fried chicken, but the pickings are slimmer than Calista Flockhart. It doesn't help that the entire east coast has bought in to this ridiculous notion of healthy eating and exercise.Anyways, I've been getting my short term fix from Popeyes in Fenway, but there's only so much Sriracha sauce I can add to their fried chicken. I've become so desperate that I stooped so low to try KFC in NYC...no, not Kentucky Fried Chicken, but Kennedy Fried Chicken (this is basically the McDowell's of fried chicken in NY - see Eddie Murphy's comedy classic "Coming to America"). The fried chicken was o.k., but the mac n' cheese and mashed potatoes were AWFUL. It was like something they would have served on "Fear Factor." I keep it simple at Roscoe's. I walked in, ordered the Combo #9 and #13, with corn bread and sweet potato pie. I don't even know why this place offers collard greens. It's like a sushi joint that offers french fries. Anyways, bottom line is that Roscoe's is still phenomenal after all these years.  Like I remembered, the place was pretty crowded, and I should add that my friend (who shall remain anonymous) from Connecticut seemed all nervous and antsy, and quietly whispered that she felt like she walked on to the set of a Tyler Perry sitcom. Gotta love the New Englanders...sometimes they can be "wicked hahsh."

Reviews.Author: Allison P.
Reviews.Content: Ain't nothing in LA better than Roscoe's. Everyone is skeptical at first about the flavour combination of chicken and waffles, but I've never met a person who didn't like it once they tried it. I always get the 'scoes #2 but it is delicious without gravy as well. For first timers I would suggest getting the gravy on the side so you can try it both ways.

Reviews.Author: Sherrie G.
Reviews.Content: If you are AFRAID of eating a LOT because you are a beautiful LA person with beautiful insides to match your wonderful outsides, then...at least get the one chicken breast, one waffle meal.  A little maple syrup will fall on the juicy chicken...then...you might want to try a little sausage afterwards to get some salty balance in there, oooh but, why not some gravy too, oh my...wait wait, what are they having over there?  Oh, it's a giant piece of cornbread!  Well, why not.  Can I have some butter to smear all over this puppy?  Wait, there's Mac and Cheese too?  HA YOUR DIET, IT HAS FAILED.

Reviews.Author: Iris Y.
Reviews.Content: F*ing delicious.  So I went more of a lunch-y route and chose the chicken sandwich (breast meat) with the fries.  Heaven ensued.  First off, I am pretty sure they give you about 4 giant potatoes worth of fries.  !!!!  The fries!!!  Clearly homemade, and delicious.  Just sprinkle them with a little salt and pepper and you don't even need ketchup, they're that good.  The sandwich came on wheat toast with chopped lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.  Pretty solid sandwich, it seems like something that my grandmother would have made if she was a fried chicken making grandmother (she tended to make polish dishes for us, and clam chowder).  The chicken was a tiny bit dry, but the crispy crust had such a good flavor that it didn't matter.  So good.My boy had the same meal as I did, and he gave it a thumbs up as well.  Our friend got the chicken breast/waffle special, and oh man, it looked fabulous.  (That's what I would have gotten if I hadn't wanted a sandwich.)  He also got a side of the smothered potatoes and the gravy was so flavorful without being too salty.  Next time I go, I'm definitely getting the waffles.

Reviews.Author: Krista P.
Reviews.Content: Oh Hollywood... you disappointed me. LB Roscoe's is where it's at. Because in an hour I can drive to Long Beach and, uh, you know, be IN LONG BEACH.

Reviews.Author: Travis H.
Reviews.Content: Chicken wings n waffles....Nothing fancy but easy to see why they pack em in here and the other locations too.Not fan of the mac n cheese, a bit bland and tasted like instand cheese mix.

Reviews.Author: Marcus M.
Reviews.Content: We are at the legendary Roscoe's "The house of chicken ' waffles" in Hollywood on Sunset and Gower which is 1 of 5 locations throughout the Los Angeles Metropolitan Area. Others being located in Mid City, South LA, Long Beach, and Pasadena. Is you've never had soul food, then you need to visit Roscoe's. Roscoe's offers several combos and plates such as, eggs, grits, waffles, chicken, mac and cheese, and some sandwiches. I your not sure what to get then order the Country Boy Combo with 3 piece wings and a side of waffles. The flavorful, buttered waffles compliments the fried tasteful chicken wings amazingly well.I even walked out with a $10 "Roscoe's" tee shirt.

Reviews.Author: Kevin S.
Reviews.Content: Fried Chicken + Waffles + Syrup = A party in my stomach and you're invited.. I think.Chicken is not too greasy and the waffle syrup is scrumptious.  Definitely a must go to if you are taking a trip down south.  Don't be tempted to order anything else off the menu, the restaurant is called "House of Chicken & Waffles" so stick to the staples and your stomach too will be partying like mine.P.S.  They really must expand and open up a location in the bay area

Reviews.Author: Magda N.
Reviews.Content: I only came because I was in the area and heard once that President Obama did a visit here (there's a picture of him too inside!), and said it was the best waffle he had ever had. For me, I'm not a big fan of eating waffle with chicken, I like to eat it with something sweet instead. But, it was a decent enough meal, and the atmosphere was really cozy. I would probably go back some other time because it was a really good place to eat, talk, and just hang.However, you'll have to park on the street and since there isn't many spots, sometimes you'll have to park a little further. But I personally don't mind.

Reviews.Author: Pooja B.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I have waited this long to write about Roscoes but now I can say I have been to all locations at least once. This is my most recent though. I love Roscoes I don't even know how to explain the relationship I have with spot. I get butterflies and so giddy when I know there is Roscoes so close in my future and I will be able to sink my teeth into that juicy ass thigh and then take a big bite of that delicious red beans and rice. I must say the Gower St. location has by far had the best tasting and most fresh meals though. I usually go to the Pasadena one but after this location I may just have to make the drive out more it seems so much more worth it. All I know is Roscoes is one of my happy places that I like to retreat to when I know I am going to have a great meal that will definitely give me the ITIS...That made my Tummy Hurt!!!...

Reviews.Author: Av A.
Reviews.Content: I am a fan, but my gosh Roscoe's you are daaangerous for my health.Came here with a bunch of friends before hittin' up The Do Over at Cabana Club and enjoyed every single bite. I opted for the Country Boy [3 wings with choice of waffle or fries or potato salad].. Never have I tasted such crispy goodness and tender juicyness. The potato salad I got with it wasn't anything to write home about, but are you really there for that? Neh.Their portions were generous and the prices leave no room for complaints. I would definitely recommend and come back to this place. Oh, and they serve beer here as well, score.Group tip: They do not split up checks, only one cc/atm is accepted for payment and the rest cash so plan accordingly!

Reviews.Author: Gerard I.
Reviews.Content: We needed some grub before the Social D concert last night. To Rosco's! They're right around the corner from the Palladium. I ordered the Scoe's Special #1. It was a mixed order which meant it came with a thigh and a breast and a side of their world famous waffles. The chicken was smothered in gravy and tasted great! The GF had the regular fried chicken with waffles. I had a bit of her chicken and it really does put KFC to shame. The portions are also huge. The waffles were amazing and I'm convinced that the secret ingredient in them is brown sugar. It's been at least 8-9 years since I've been to the Pico location and I've never been to the one in Pasadena. I think this one on Gower is the original location. I liked it it.

Reviews.Author: Mitchell F.
Reviews.Content: How I love Fried ChickenHow I love wafflesIt was a good combo, but each person has a different perception. The chicken is perfectly fried to a delicious golden brown and the waffles are generously patted with butter. Try dipping a drumstick into syrup.There was no ambiance but it didn't take much away from this joint! It was wonderful! Try it and you'll see what I mean.

Reviews.Author: Isaiah D.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to eat. It's a must eat spot whenever you're in LA....much like having Chicago Deep Dish Pizza in Chicago, or having White Castle when you're in the Mid-West/East Coast, or having a Gray's Papaya when you're in New York.The combo of Chicken & Waffles and they way the make it at Roscoes is one of a kind. I'm having a Roscoes #9 in my picture, along with Lisa's Delight (similar to an Arnold Palmer - Ice Tea & Lemonade - but waaaaay better). I also love having sides like: Mac & Cheese, Smothered Potatoes, & Grits with Brown Sugar, yum!!!!They remodeled the Hollywood location so it has lots of room now! The Long Beach one is the other one I like going to as for cleanliness & room. Pasadena is ok too, but if you're more daring, go to the Pico...it's more "hood" and you gotta roll "haurd homie"! :)If you haven't had Roscoes Chicken & Waffles....you're sleepin'!!!

Reviews.Author: Erica C.
Reviews.Content: Me and Chicken are bffl. Fried, grilled, sauced up, naked fingers, you name it I'll eat it. I'll bust a window out your car for a box. Back at home my friends nicknamed me Erica 'Where the chicken n shiet" C. Me and chicken had some good times. I was once officer of a student organization (Asian Business Students) and being officer gives you the privileges of ordering your food of choice for your events. I ordered fried chicken of course for an event. I was happy. The members were happy. So happy in fact that they lifted their piece of chicken to Crystal (my roommate and best friend who I convinced to join Asian Business Students even though she's not Asian or a business student). The members started thanking her and winking at her for her apparent good choice in food and her influence on my decision making. I'd also like to add that Crystal, although African-American, is a vegetarian.On to the review... my friend who is living in Hollywood this summer insisted that she HAD to take me Roscoe's and that I will die a million times over while eating Chicken n Waffles. There are places in Texas that offered this combo but I never really had the desire. I like savory and salty just the way it is. I like my sweets the way it is. I often had dessert before dinner. I'll spare you that tangent of a story. But I'm not in L.A. very often so why the hell not. Best. Decision. Of. My. Life. I brought my little cousins along and we shared the 2 orders of the 1/2 chicken with waffles, crac n' cheese, and potatoes in gravy.Holy hell. I'm not a waffle fan but the waffles here are amazing. Fluffy, buttery, and perfect. The chicken? Perfect. Together it was a party in my mouth exploding with sweet, savory, crispy, and fluffy. The mac' n cheese so so freaking delicious I started calling in crac' n cheese cause I swear they put crack in it based on the way I could not stop stuffing my face with it. The potatoes and gravy were good in their own right.My friend was right. I died a million times over during this meal and I'm dying now that I'm back in the middle of america aching for Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Craig W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, very very fried chicken and pretty darn good waffles. And I don't even like waffles.The mac and cheese as a side dish is rich and creamery and a great addition to the rest of your meal, especially if you are aiming for atrociously high cholesterol levels and/or cardiac arrest inside the restaurant.The place is absolutely no frills and can get hot and crowded inside.  But the prices are right and the menu is simple.Special mention goes to the rude twerp who was working the register when we were there.  However, our waitress was a sweetheart and very attentive.If you want fried food, they do it right.

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: My cousin & her friend were visiting from good ol' Indiana and they wanted to try the famous Roscoe's.  It is sad that I've lived here for almost 8 years and never tried it.  It was a Saturday afternoon and there was only a 15 minute wait.  The line system was pretty proficient and we got in quickly.  That's where the trouble started.  SERIOUSLY bad service.  We waited so long, just to get drink orders when everyone around us was quickly served.  We had like 3 different servers and whenever we asked for something or ran out of beverage, they either took 15 minutes or completely forgot.  We were there for over an hour and a half....most of that was spent waiting on the bill.  Well, just as we thought we were finally escaping, we take a look at the bill and realize that a couple drinks were added on when I'm the only one who had something other than water.  Overall though, I'm putting two stars, because the food was pretty damn good, even though one of our plates of food was cold.Maybe I'll be back, but it will be at a different location.

Reviews.Author: Paul D.
Reviews.Content: Seriously...I made my father take me to a Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles when I was younger because he raved about it after work one day...However, he took my mother, my brother and me to the one on Pico for him and my mother's wedding anniversary...My mother was terrified (being the traditional Asian woman she is...), but Roscoe's had left a lasting impression in my mind...Flash forward 15 years...I can't get enough of good ol 'Scoes...People are always skeptical..."Seriously Paul?  Chicken AND waffles?  Together?  On the same plate?  You must be out of your mind..."I've turned every doubting Thomas into a fundamental believer that chicken and waffles belongs more together than peanut butter and jelly...My cousins and Mom (she converted too...) love the grits there and I love dunking my chicken in the onion gravy while getting mouthfuls of butter and syrup soaked waffles...I usually get a half chicken dunked in gravy with 2 waffles...I wonder why I have high cholesterol...The southern hot sauce is just like the stuff I used to get in SC, BIG plus..."Paul, these are the best waffles I've ever had...""Paul, this is the best fried chicken I've ever had..."Duh...Wait can be a little long if you go late...Best to go on a week night for a late dinner...

Reviews.Author: Nanette L.
Reviews.Content: I've never eaten chicken and waffles in the same sitting and thought this was a bizarre combination until I read the mouth watering reviews.  I've ordered the leg and waffle and wow the leg was excellent.  The chicken skin was fried crispy like a thick cut of Hawaiian potato chip and not greasy at all.  Across from me, my niece had some big ass tits; oops I mean "big succulent breast" chicken (as written on the menu) which she said was very moist.  The establishment smells of hygienic cleaning solution which is a bit over powering when you are trying to eat and concentrate on the flavor of your food.  The atmosphere can be defined as simply southern.  The waitress was attentive.

Reviews.Author: E F.
Reviews.Content: We took a vacation to the Los Angeles area.  So we thought or place we wanted to see and go to and Roscoe's came to mind.  We reside in San Francisco and we've heard so much about Roscoe's.  We wanted to see the big deal with this restaurant.  First thing, the street parking is metered and when we went on that particular day, they started towing cars.  Luckily, we found parking across the street. And one of the staff members constantly announce when the meter maid is coming giving out tickets.The wait staff and host were all very attentive and friendly.  The food came quick.. The portions are huge and everthing that we ordered tasted great.  We're from San Francisco and we ate at a few Soul Food restaurants that taste just as great as Roscoe's... Like Gussie's on Eddy Street & Fillmore Street in San Francisco.. and Nellie's in Oakland... So if you guys are in the area check those restaurants out.

Reviews.Author: Anjie P.
Reviews.Content: This is the most kitschy Roscoe's I have been to. The walls are covered with headshots of your favorite brothas and sistaz of hollywood. The man at the door is dressed in a sharp suit and full of... personality. Don't go here on a Sunday morning unless you want to wait for a really long time. Drive by on a Sunday morning to see the line of people in the coolest church clothes ever. The parking is a bummer, though, but it's worth it for the bomb ass food.

Reviews.Author: kristy s.
Reviews.Content: From Snoop Dogg to Larry King, David Beckham to Adam Sandler, to pretty much everyone I know in LA, I may be the only one to be missing out... I must have been living in the Dark Ages to not know the delicious combination of fried chicken and waffles at LA establishment - Roscoe's.I mean, Roscoe's has been around since the mid-70s (well before I was born in this city of angels) and sad to say, my first visit was only about a week ago. But boy oh boy, was I happy I went.After a tiring day of Universal Studios lines and rides, my husband and I headed to Roscoe's for dinner. With a healthy appetite, I ordered the house special "Scoe's #1" - 1/4 chix which equates to two pieces of fried chicken (I chose one thigh and one breast) with its two waffles and maple syrup.The first few bites... absolutely incredibly burst of sweetness and savory flavors, with the right amount of salt and oil, and textures both crispy and soft. I finished most of my plate and smiled in satisfaction, having finally tried one of LA's quintessential good eats.

Reviews.Author: Athena V.
Reviews.Content: First of all, WHY IS IT SO DARK IN THERE? I could hardly see where I was going when I walked in. Make sure you wait for your eyes to adjust to the darkness before you move around lest you bump into tables and people.Our server was great because he was patient with us first-timers and answered all our little questions.The food however, was ok. It was neither amazing nor heavenly. It was just OK. So don't hype yourself up thinking you're gonna have the best fried chicken ever like I did, because you'll be disappointed. I ordered the #1 SCOE's which came with two pieces of chix and 2 wide, but thin waffles for $10.70 and it was alright. I mean, the chicken skin was on the salty side, and the piece of leg that I got was slightly overcooked. The waffles were delicious but only because they added cinnamon to their batter. Other than that, it tastes like regular ol' waffles. I DO like that their waffles are on the softer side though. It was more like a pancake pretending to be a waffle. I also ordered a side of cornbread thinking it was gonna be the awesomest cornbread ever but nay, it was not. Some quick tips about this place, you don't have to be suckered by the valet people who charge $10 dollars, or have to resort to parking meters. Just drive 2 blocks towards Carlton Way and find free street parking there. Trust me, you'll need the walk after the waffles expand in your stomach. Also, if you want a less salty chicken, perhaps you should order #2 SCOE's because the chicken is bathed in gravy and my friend finished hers so I assumed it was good. Another thing! I saw people complaining about how dry the chicken was. When the server asks you whether you want White or Dark for your chicken, go for dark. White meat (which is usually the breast and wing) is notoriously dry when fried. Go dark meat (the thigh and legs) if you want chicken juiciness.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Up from San Diego, I recently dined here for the first time with my brother and a colleague (also first timers). Party of three on a summer Sunday at roughly  7pm. I checked us in with the hostess who, when asked, said the wait would be about 20 minutes. We joined the other waiting parties on the sidewalk outside the front entrance. Actual wait time: 9 minutesIt was pretty busy, but it was hardly packed. In fact, I later overheard a waitress telling another waitress that "this was nothing". The hostess brought us to our table and gave us each a menu. About a minute later, a waitress kindly asked if she could relocate us to a different table (no big deal). Our new table, #22, only had 2 chairs when we got there, however, an available chair was conveniently just a few feet away. I disregarded the fact the waitress failed to acknowledge the chair shortage; the situation was resolved nearly as fast as it was presented.Wooden tables and chairs plus plenty of chicken decor equals an atmosphere that is simple and homey...casual with a splash of southern country complete with t-shirts for sale.The menus seemed overused, slightly greasy, and poorly formatted. I felt it would have been a bit easier on my indecisive eyes if they hadn't squeezed everything onto a tent-style food and beverage "list." The majority of entrees are pretty straightforward and are comprised of the same key elements; a meal essentially  consists of a piece of fried chicken, waffles or a biscuit, and perhaps eggs or grits. The average price for a meal was easily $10. My brother ordered the signature meal, a chicken breast served with an order of (1) waffles. From the list of Side Orders, he requested a side of scrambled eggs with onions, and a side order of cornbread. Our colleague pulled the trigger on the chicken sandwich served with fries after being torn between a few different choices. When my turn to order came around I made a coin-flip decision and went with an order of Chicken Chili Cheese Fries (I'd been drinking) and a side order of cornbread from the Side Orders.The table next to ours was a larger party that we shared the sidewalk with while waiting out front for a table. I was pleased to see them already enjoying their food, giving the (hopeful) impression our food wouldn't take very long to arrive.Roughly 10 minutes later our food is placed before us in two waves with my brother's order coming out just shy of a whole minute before the rest of our order. The dishes were piping hot, the presentation was respectable and the portions were ultimately quite satisfying. Throughout the meal we each reiterated how the food was PFG. The meals (and three waters) came to $32 and some change. The overall experience was quite satisfying, although I couldn't say Roscoe's exceeded my expectations. Service was kind yet relaxed and somewhat lacked the comforting, hospitable feel. The kitchen's efficiency is consistent with the simple nature of the "no substitutions" menu. Next time I'm starving in Hollywood, Roscoe's will be on my list, but it won't be on top.

Reviews.Author: Allison C.
Reviews.Content: I love Roscoe's! The waffles are the best! The chicken is good too, but there is something completely unforgettable about the flavorful batter they use for their waffles. I just can't put my finger on it. The only waffles I've tasted that compare were consumed in Belgium, and that is saying something. Give them a try. They are an LA staple and Hollywood iconic eatery for a reason.

Reviews.Author: Daph D.
Reviews.Content: I know I'm about a decade too late to jump on the fried chicken & waffle bandwagon here. Ah makes me reminisce about the good ol' Rush Hour days. I've had some belgian style waffles and fried chicken in NYC before so I suspected that this place will be 10x better. Sadly, I was disappointed!There was a 20 min wait in nearly 90 degree weather. There's nowhere to sit inside, so myself and about 10 other people were waiting in the sun. Melting! Cranky! Hungry! Finally we got a table and I was pretty underwhelmed by the decor. With all this soul food, the restaurant didn't seem to have any soul of its own. The best I can describe is bland cabin fever. Food was just ok, definitely nothing worth driving over 10 miles for. The waffle wasn't that crispy. The gravy texture was a tad clumpy, and it didn't enhance the flavor of the chicken and waffle. The cups for drinks are on the smaller side. So if you're like me, and drink A LOT during meals, you'll be asking for 3rd's of your diet coke.

Reviews.Author: Kunney T.
Reviews.Content: It's an LA institution.  Like many LA institutions, it's a bit overrated.  The others have summarized it pretty well.Just a note - the one on pico has a lovely large lady waitress.  She will slap your arms - and hard! - if you put your elbows on the table.Beware!

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: This place is not overrated one bit!! All of the legends are true...they do have the best chicken and waffles ever!  What an award-winning combination the fried chicken and double waffles are.  As far as the waffles go...I can honestly say they are the best waffles I've ever had.  I used to love the pecan waffles from Waffle House, but these waffles beat them in every way.  They have a cinnamon hint to it that's just to die for.  I love that they're double-stacked and come with lots of butter.The chicken is crispy on the outside, soft chicken on the inside, and really the perfect compliment to the sweet and hot waffles.  The place is so very cozy and gives you that southern hospitality feel.  I came here for breakfast and had one of those great meals that I'll probably tell my grand kids about.

Reviews.Author: Brad T.
Reviews.Content: This review is a tribute to all the Yelpers who post one sentence reviews.  You know who you are.  Some people are Elite and have 300+ reviews and all of your reviews are one sentence.Here is my sentence: I've been to Roscoes a couple of time and it sucks - 'nuff said.  But seriously, I've been there and the food is very average.  There are other comments I'd love to make here, but I'll quit while I'm still ahead.

Reviews.Author: Martin L.
Reviews.Content: This isn't health food.  But, this is amazing crazy flavor.  My favorite dish by far is Fried Chicken & Waffles.  Hello! its the name of the restaurant.  But my favorite way to eat is is a little different.  First order the thing smothered and waffles w/o butter.  Then debone the chicken pieces and put them onto the waffle.  Add lots of red rooster sauce.  Mmmmmm the best.This is one of the best spots to go after a night clubbing in hollywood.  Or, if you just want a late night snack.  Be prepared for a wait and characters.  Most times i've been there are a couple of people selling stuff ourside.  Sneakers, lighters, stuff.  Its part of the charm for me.Also expect characters.  First time I came here, was waiting with some buddies.  Into the mini mall in front pulls up an older cadillac.  Out comes a guy in bright green suit.  Chats it up with us.  We thoguht it strange he didn't put his name down for Roscoes.  He told us he was a pimp, then started pointing to girls across the street, "They're mine"This place def has character :-) and amazing food.

Reviews.Author: Brandon W.
Reviews.Content: This place was on my list of famous So-Cal restaurants I had to try.  The whole fried chicken and waffles thing never struck me as an amazing combination, but I'm no expert on soul food.  That being said, if I were starving and drunk, it would probably be one hell of a combination.  Unfortunately on the day I went I was only hungry.SERVICE AND DECORI went here late in the afternoon on a Saturday with a large party.  We had to wait about 20 minutes and they were unable to put us all on one table, but they did put us in the same general area which was fine to me.  Given its customer load, it's relatively clean.  I was actually very impressed with how clean their bathroom is.Service was friendly but not incredibly attentive.  Our food came out really fast, but we hardly saw our waitress ever again after that.FOOD AND VALUEI ordered the #1 (Scoe's), which came with:Fried chicken (dark meat): You can choose either dark or light meat when you order.  It's excellent fried chicken.  The batter was very tasty and contributed well to the overall flavor.  The chicken itself was very tender and moist.Waffle: Not the best I've had.  Cripsy, but thin and didn't have much in terms of flavor.  Some may enjoy their maple syrup, which has a distinct taste over other maple syrups I've had; it tastes like they had some cinnamon or other herb to add to the flavor. Sunrise (lemonade + fruit punch): Insisting on getting the "full" experience of Roscoe's, I also ordered one of their special drinks.  Very, very sweet, but delicious.My portion of the meal ended up being about 14$, which is a little overpriced, but expected.CONCLUSIONTo those who were in a similar situation as me and want to try it just because it's popular: fried chicken and waffles is exactly what it sounds like.  Roscoe's serves good fried chicken, but I wasn't terribly impressed with the waffles.  I would go back if someone invited me and it was convenient, but I don't find myself excited to return.

Reviews.Author: Jenn T.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is the only restaurant that I've ever been to that I loved SO much that I ate SO much that I ended up making myself sick.  And that my friends, is saying a lot.With so many reviews, there isn't really much to add, so I'll make this short and sweet.I got the chicken breast with one waffle. The breast is huge.  It was like half a damn chicken.  I ordered mac and cheese and cornbread on the side.  Trust me, even though the side of mac and cheese is $4 and it's miniscule, it's still worth it.  The chicken was great.  The waffle was great.  The mac and cheese was great. The service was great.  IT WAS JUST GREAT GUYS.

Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: As a Roscoe's virgin, the first time here I had to try the Chicken & Waffles. (And they serve chicken breasts for those of us who don't like bones!)The waffles were delicious, not super fluffy but more of flat waffle. They reminded me of the waffles at Waffle House...Once you've tried the classic combo, they have tons of other items on their menu...like CORNBREAD. Next time I'm there, I will be the girl in the corner with the pan of cornbread.

Reviews.Author: Jamie J.
Reviews.Content: Yes, I know.  Chicken and waffles isn't your normal combination.  But trust me, it doesn't taste normal either!I was one of those skeptics that didn't want to try something that sounded so weird.  But, after hearing about it on Jay Leno so many times, I decided to give it a try.  WHOA!  This is good stuff.  I know probably in the south that they're used to this, but this is the first time I had it and I think to myself, "I'm gonna move!"  Haha!  But seriously, the food is phenomenal.  I had the "beginners plate" which was a waffle with some fried thighs and stuff.  For you adventerous types, try the liver.  No thanks for me!This location is a little hard to find and parking is even harder to find.  The restaurant didn't look to clean inside and was very small, but all I can say is that you won't notice.

Reviews.Author: Chuck F.
Reviews.Content: I was in LA for a conference and wanted something I couldn't get in San Diego.  I suggested to my colleagues we try this spot.  Maybe it was an off night but comparing this to the Long Beach location, I wasn't overly impressed with the food/ service.Ambiance:  A little dark and gloomy inside the restaurant with a 70's style waffle house.  But we were here for the food =)  Interesting concept:  LCD monitors looped local informercials.Food/ Service:  I ordered the Southern style 1/2 chix (gravy on the side) and waffles plate with a couple of side orders of collards and cornbread.  It was somewhat quick (good if your really hungry), but the chicken seemed over cooked and somewhat dry?  I generally expect my Southern Chicken somewhat greasy...  Hahaha!  First thing that came to my mind...  Was it pre-made prior to my order?  I couldn't confirm it but I think so =(  Although, our server did refill our drinks, he never did bring my gravy (although I reminded him quite often).  The collards were flavorful with bits of ham =)  The cornbread was okay at best.Again, it may have been an off night...  But I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Jackie D.
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what to get...but the bf told me that it's all good. i have to say that i am a sucker for southern style fried chicken. hell, i even made the bf take me to the grocery store at 2am to buy supplies to make it the next day.i got the normal chicken and whatever else comes with it. it was yummy. i normally don't even like chicken too but this was delish. i liked the potatoes and gravy too. the drinks with oj and whatever else are good too. i highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Josh L.
Reviews.Content: After living in LA for nearly 5 years, I finally made it to Roscoe's.  While my vegan/gluten-free girlfriend was working (!) I decided to sneak away and dive into sin.I decided to go for the standard fare: 1/4 chicken (fried) with 2 waffles.  The waffles were superb.  A hint of cinnamon, thin, and a butter and syrup magnet!  These were awesome.The chicken was good, but not great.  It was a TAD dry, but it was damn tasty and complemented the sweet waffles very well.It was hard for me to decide between the fried or the smothered chicken...oh well I guess Iill have to come back.The doorman was awesome, and my waitress and water dude/busser were nice also...the cashier seemed to have a 'tude though.Very good.  I can see myself craving that sweet/savory combination again...yup, in fact, right now it sounds pretty damn good...

Reviews.Author: Aly R.
Reviews.Content: Here in Los Angeles - there are plenty of culinary institutions - from the famous to infamous.Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is one of those places - to which I have never been before.Whenever I drove by the Pico location - I would always see at least 4 people waiting outside. Much to my suprise, at this hollywood location, no people waiting outside. Hmm, strange. Maybe it was because it was cold and rainy that day, and people wanted to stay inside?DMTB and I walk inside, and we get seated right away. I had the utmost intention of trying chicken and waffles - I mean the place is called: Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. So I order the 1 waffle and 1 chicken breast. We ordered a side of grits too - another thing I've never had.I've had this idea of what the waffles and chicken were going to taste like, and I was disappointed. I was seriously expecting a burst of fresh spicy flavor - and it fell extremely short. The fried chicken - while perfectly cooked, the batter was just so average. I could hardly taste any kind of spices outside of salt. The crust itself was good, but seriously lacking any flavor.The waffle was large, and again, had a hint of cinnamon, but that's about it. I guess I can understand the both the chicken and the waffle were underwhelming - when combined together. But hardly any flavor and hardly any flavor does not equal into flavor. It doesn't combine here. Would I go again? Personally, no. I've had and made better chicken and waffles - respectively.

Reviews.Author: Lorraine G.
Reviews.Content: Still one of my favorite places to go after years of going.Waffles are sweet and crunchy with a soft middle.Chicken is tasty, crisp and not too greasy.Prices have changed over the years...and I'm not use to shelling out $4 for a tiny bowl of greens...but gotta love the food...the recipes haven't changed so they still have their SOUL. One of the few places in Los Angeles where I can get me some grits!We went on the early side, 9am on a Sat., which was great as we beat the crowds, but the wait staff was still slow to get our order, check, etc...

Reviews.Author: Dalar G.
Reviews.Content: This is the WORSE restaurant I've ever been to in my life!!!First of all the food is horrrrrrible! It's not fresh it looks like some warmed up leftovers. You literally can not swallow the chicken it's so dry and nastyMy dish was cold... But that's not even the bad partMy friend asked for a to go box and the bag came with FUCK U written on it! Are you serious??? I didn't even bother with the waitress because she was a rude ass bitch but even when I asked for the manager instead of an apology he came back with a new bag and threaten to called the cops on me for being mad! Haha I find that hilarious I know roscoes is famous all over US and they probably won't care about this review but no one has the right to treat their customers like this place does! If I could I'd shut this place down but since I cant I want to let you all know so you don't spend your time and money here! AVOID THIS PLACE it's ran by a bunch of idiots. -Customer service was horrible -Food was nastyWhy the hell would anyone want to go eat here...

Reviews.Author: Andrew W.
Reviews.Content: one of the best chicken'n'waffles locations that i have been to (and believe me, there are a TON of knock offs.)if you want the original...the best...make it Rosco's

Reviews.Author: Dustin C.
Reviews.Content: Fried chicken and waffles. A very interesting combination but you all knew it was gonna happen after sausage and pancakes. The fried chicken is nothing to write home about. Pieces are on the small side and I don't think they use 11 herbs and spices. It's all about the waffle. That sweet, fluffy, buttery goodness is hard to put down. I sometimes think they put crack in the batter because it's so addicting.  You'll feel your arteries clogging up after each bite but this meal is worth the risk.This place is pretty small so try not to go with a large group. By large I mean more than 4 people.

Reviews.Author: Yvette L.
Reviews.Content: Good down home cookin'. Well not my home, but you know what I mean. I mean this place has got some grub for that diabetes! Macaroni and Cheese, Greens, Cornbread, Fried Chicken, Potatoes, grease, lard, love. If Lenchitas married Roscoe they would procreate and have the cutest most delicious babies on the planet.The wait can get ugly so be prepared. The place isn't fancy, it's cozy and it's small, but it's awesome. go.

Reviews.Author: Julie J.
Reviews.Content: Hard not to love Roscoe's as much as I love great waffles and southern grits and greens prepared the right way.The chicken is secondary to me, believe or not, because I tried to avoid fried anything as much as possible.  Don't get me wrong--the wings and such are awesome here.  I'm just partial to the supertasty waffles - regular and buckwheat...okay now I'm getting hungry...guess where I'm headed today ;-)The wait @ Hollywood location at least - like most good spots - can be horrific at popular dining hours--for good reason since the food rocks.  Love their big-city-appropriate later hours. (So many good LA places close too early, but that seems to be improving around here maybe.)

Reviews.Author: Jims L.
Reviews.Content: I want to believe that I like fried chicken and that I love waffles - so why can't I love Roscoe's?This place isn't even cheap - I think if it were I'd have given it five stars..People who visit this place without me also almost always manage to tell me later about the Jeanne Jone's dish...Anyhow, people rant and rave about this place, and I still can't figure out why.  Maybe I don't know how to appreciate my comfort food.

Reviews.Author: Bryanth S.
Reviews.Content: One of the pre-requisites for LA dining cuisine. Chicken is tasty and the waffles are amazing. It's chicken and waffles. Together. No where else can you get this combination. What's not to like! If your into hip-hop, chances are you'll meet a celebrity. My one cousin met E-40 and another Method Man! Kinda ghetto with the body guard/bouncer at the front door though.

Reviews.Author: Tula L.
Reviews.Content: About 10 seconds after we pulled up and took the prime parking spot right in front a Bentley pulled up and a bunch of really glamorous guys got out looking a little irritated to have to walk around our subaru to get in the door......but you want to hear about the food...it was good, or I should say the chicken and waffles are good.  The cornbread and biscuit, not so much, but the star of the show was crunchy and juicy and hot and fresh in every way I want my chicken to be.  Overall, Roscoes is a Los Angeles institution not to be missed, you'll probably be back again and again, whether for the glimpse of fame or the chicken is up to you...

Reviews.Author: Allan H.
Reviews.Content: soooo wrong but at the same time soooo right.Crispy, tender and moist chicken. Crispy, tender and moist [after you drown them in butter and syrup of course] waffles. Mac and cheese NOT from a box. Greens.All of these gourmet delights in a loud and casual room, filled with Hollywood's......, um, er "finest". What more could you really want from a late night dining experience. Just go already.

Reviews.Author: Audrey L.
Reviews.Content: When asked where the best fried chicken is, most of the time you'll get Roscoe's as the answer.I did enjoy the chicken and the waffles here, but I wouldn't go out of my way for them. I feel that the food is super hyped up. It's worth a shot, have fun trying to find parking unless you valet. It can also get very busy at night.

Reviews.Author: Franz K.
Reviews.Content: So being from the south, when I came to LA last summer one of the things I had on my list was to try a Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.  We ended up going to the one on Sunset.  The wait was about 45 minutes on a Sunday . . . perfect time to get a session in and build up the appetite lol.The food here was good . . . I mean the whole concept of ordering Chicken and Waffles and eating them at the same time is something a chain restaurant should embrace in South Florida.  I had the Country Boy . . . which is 3 wings and a waffle.  Complimented each other well and I savored every bite lol.  I was told to get the Biscuit and Gravy side, but I forgot to order it but none the less it lived up to my expectations.Service was good, no complaints, it was a great experience, one that I hope to do again the next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Author: April M.
Reviews.Content: This place seems to be super popular only because so many people have, by word of mouth, made it so popular. Someone says it's to die for... and everyone else has to think so too. And just because it's an LA staple doesn't make the food taste good... that's all just hyped novelty that in no way affects the quality of the meal.So let me tell you honestly: this place is waaayyy overrated. If you've eaten fried chicken and/or waffles at any point in your life, you don't need to spend your money here. The food here is very basic and the portions aren't very big. Go to Ralph's and buy some Eggos and one of those pre-cooked whole chickens from the deli area. You won't be able to tell the difference.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: oooohh my goodness gracious!!!!Roscoe's is de-freakin-licious! I have been wanting to try chicken n waffles for awhile now and I finally had the chance to when we were hangin out in Hollywood the other day. And can I just say, that I was 110% satisfied. I loved the atmosphere, it was friendly and loud and chaotic and wonderful. The staff was super friendly as well. We split 2 orders of Scoe's (i think it was either #2 or #3 on the menu) between 4 people and it was plenty of food. The combination of the fried chicken and the hot sauce with the sweet mapley buttery waffles was divine. I will definitely go back whenever possible! yeeeaaah.

Reviews.Author: Jacquee P.
Reviews.Content: Three little Asian girls walked into Roscoe's last Friday in the middle of the afternoon and were swept into Roscoe's to get their bellies filled. Half a chicken with two waffles, candied yams, and corn bread. All of the chicken was delicious and moist. Even the breast! And the crispy skin! Ohhhhh. It took so much self-control to leave the little fatty bits behind. Waffles have something special in them. Like cinnamon and brown sugar? It felt so good after the meal to burp and remember my waffle memories of waffles dipped in butter and syrup.Yams were a little too sweet. I know that they're candied, but they were floating in their syrup.Corn bread was kind of dry. I like my cornbread with butter and creamed corn baked into it. The restroom is AMAZING! So clean and automatic! Exactly what a 21st century bathroom should be.  The service was super friendly and quick. The bathroom was closed for repairs at the end of our visit and I had to go so bad that our waitress let me use the staff restroom! It was nice too but not as nice as the one for the patrons. I think that they deserve a 21st century bathroom too. Maybe one day...

Reviews.Author: Ken K.
Reviews.Content: Being more of a breakfast fan, I prefer the waffles over the chicken.  Now I'm not saying the chicken isn't good, because it is, especially when you dunk it in a side of their gravy and onions.  But their waffles w/ a touch of cinnamon and a lot of syrup just hits the spot for me.If you've never heard of this place (how have you not heard of this place?!), don't dismiss it just because it sounds strange.  Simply put, the combination of sweet and salty works.  It's the yin and the yang for food.And it's always fun to run into celebrities (usually at this Gower location).

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: LA I love you, but you're bringing me down.You know why it says that on that song? Because, as if I had to tell you, they (the folks of LA County) are the only ones that have Roscoe's, and that gets my goat, and I don't even have a goat!History lesson:African Americans were the ones that traditionally popularized this odd combo. They would come home from church late in the AM and can't decide whether to serve breakfast or lunch, so... they served both, side by side.Fortunately for me, and anyone that has come to this place to eat, you can have your breakfast up until they close, and I LOVE my breakfast. Serve it to me hot, serve it to me in bed, serve it to me at Roscoe's, I LOVE my breakfast.The Good:1) The Fried Chicken. The smell alone will make your stomach growl. 2) The Waffles. Their own mix. This isn't your breakfast Eggo, folks.3) This particular Roscoe's has a nice location, a staff that's attentive even when busy and they never seem to stop smiling and the crowd that seems to come here a wonderful one. Don't believe me? Go and see. 4) On my last trip here, I tasted something that was scrambled eggs  "delicately" mixed with onions and cheese. I had to stop eating it halfway because I wanted to eat it the next day because it was SO GOOD! So good, that I had to control myself. Imagine that, me and self-control in a Roscoe's?The Bad1) I don't know why I have to repeat it. We don't have one in the OC. Why? Why not? Whose idea was that?The Ugly1) See above. I have to go to Long Beach or do something in Hollywood to have an excuse to go to Roscoe's. That's just wrong. So, if you are reading this, and I'm not trying to be funny, you better be halfway out the door already. I know it's a drive from the OC, but it's worth it, promise.

Reviews.Author: Kislev A.
Reviews.Content: Very good chicken but waaaay overpriced. $6 for a small piece and a waffle.Plus, parking sucks.

Reviews.Author: Anya R.
Reviews.Content: OMG I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!Every time I get a chance to go- I take anyone that is down some chicken and waffles.  I've gone at morning times where its pretty easy to get a table and AFTER the club hours when you are waiting in a line like you were for the clubs in Hollywood! If you think its weird to eat something salty (chicken) and then sweet (waffle) your dead wrong.  Its such a wonderful combination.  The service is quick and fast so you're in and out pretty quick. You should always bring cash too because if you are in a big group you can only put down two cards per transaction. They have the "economy" special tacked on the wall- I believe it was 6 pieces of 5.00? haha.  It was great. I always order the same thing and I've yet to try anything new because I love this so much its the Jeanne Jones Omelette.  The Omelette has so much cheesy and huge piece of chicken inside.  Then the waffle, with the butter on it melted.. their waffles are thin and really big and have this cinnamon tint.  Just melts in your mouth. I'm gonna dream about Roscoe's tonight.. I just know it!

Reviews.Author: Sean B.
Reviews.Content: I really wasn't that excited when my friends remembered about Roscoe's and wanted to go there for 'brunch' on this rainy Sunday morning. It's not that I have anything AGAINST it, per se... but fried chicken and waffles, together, I just wasn't feelin' it.We drove out to Hollywood and found easy street parking. One nice thing about a rainy Sunday, you're not fighting for parking spots. It felt like everyone in the world had slept in, and even at 11:00am we were able to be seated pretty much right away (we waited maybe 2 minutes).Inside, it definitely had a hole-in-the-wall southern diner feel to it. Wood paneling was old-school, signs were mostly handwritten and sloppily taped to the walls. Seats weren't particularly comfortable and the place wasn't what I'd call "spotless" by any stretch of the imagination.Ordered our choices from a slightly dirty laminated paper menu, and awaited the delivery of our southern cookin' specials. I was hungover, I was hungry, and I was lukewarm about chicken and waffles.Until I took a bite. Absolutely. Kickass. The syrup was less syrupy than any I've had. Hard to describe it further, it was just sweet and delicious and just less sticky than what I'm used to. It mixed with the melted whipped butter on the fresh waffles and just became awesomeness... and I'm NOT a huge waffle fan, so that's saying something. My friend insisted that I take a bite with the fried chicken the waffles with the butter and syrup in one bite. Fine, fine, I'll humor him.DAMN! Sooooo frikkin' good. Every bite I had for the rest of the meal was like that, a piece of fried chicken on top of the waffle bite. I paced myself so I ran out of each at the same time. THAT good.Four stars instead of five because, frankly, the sides disappointed. The mac and cheese, though raved about by many Yelpers, was pretty mediocre to me. The chili we tried out tasted like any from a can. The sweet potato pie, likewise, seemed like it could have been from a shelf at Ralph's.But the chicken and waffles... yeah... I get it now. I really do.

Reviews.Author: Alan Y.
Reviews.Content: Is Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles overrated?  Absolutely not.  From the food to the service, this place is worth every penny.I can't remember our waitress' name but she was extremely kind and patient with a table full of first-timers.  I ordered the #9 (3 wings and 1 waffle).  The waffle was one of the best I've ever tasted.  The wings were also good, fried well just the way I like it (well done skin yet still juicy on the inside).  To drink, I had the Sunrise (lemonade and fruit punch) which was the perfect amount of sweetness.  How big of an effect did this place have on me?  I'm going to name my first born Roscoe S. Young.  Don't judge me...try it for yourself.

Reviews.Author: Tai F.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is an LA icon. Before I had ever spent any notable time in the LA area I knew what Roscoe's was. It's my uncle's first stop whenever he's in the area. While part of the love is due to nostalgia, part of it is for their delicious, finger-licking chicken and waffles. Sure, it's not gourmet, but that's not really why you are here, is it?It was a busy holiday Monday afternoon and we waited about 20 minutes for our table. We were seated in the corner. The service was average but friendly. They were packed! I only looked at the menu for a second because I knew what I wanted. The first time I went to a Roscoe's I loaded up on tons of sides to complement my chicken and waffles but that's unnecessary for two reasons: 1) the chicken and waffles are the star, 2) the sides are very meh. CP and I both had a juice drink. Mine was called the eclipse. I think it was OJ, fruit punch and lemonade. I know it was awesome!CP had chicken and waffles with gravy. I had them without. We ate and enjoyed immensely. I told him he was gross for mixing gravy with his chicken, waffle, syrup goodness. He said I was crazy not too. But for all you non believers out there: A bite of chicken and waffle covered in syrup is truly a blissful experience. There's a reason Roscoe's is so busy and has been around for so long. You feel like you are experiencing something truly Los Angeles. AND it tastes delicious while you do it.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: My dining experience with Roscoe's could only be described as the Apocalypse of my recent savory food journey...Having read numerous reviews about Roscoe's, my expectations were high so my girlfriend and I decided to take a look at this monumental, Hall of Fame caliber restaurant. Once we stepped inside the restaurant, a host pointed their index finger on the wait list without saying anything. Having waited for 40 minutes, the host took us to our seats, remained silent, and immediately walked away after she distributed the menus. Also, it took the waitress around 20 mins before she finally come to our table. Being said, my expectations about Roscoe's plummeted drastically and we anticipated for any additional misfortunes.We ordered the half chicken and waffles and was totally disappointed about this infamous food option. The chicken was not the best that I have had. The crust of the chicken was greasy and the meat seems a little dehydrated. Waffles were served lukewarm and wasn't fluffy at all. Combining the food with their one-of-a-kind rude restaurant service, Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles became the first 1 star restaurant on our list. Having our dissatisfaction rate at a all time high, we would never, ever in our lifetime, return to this place again!!!

Reviews.Author: Darrell M.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, to put it bluntly.  This place is my SH*T.Fried chicken, waffles, awesome drinks (oj + punch + lemonade = awesome!)The chicken is always big and juicy, the gravy is all onion(y) and rich, and the waffles are full of cinnamon, and I'm pretty sure, something magical.Roscoe's is amazing.  The food is great, the location is fine, and the staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Author: Jorsha M.
Reviews.Content: Came on vacation from North Carolina with my husband. I've heard great things about Roscoe's but we were disappointed. The chicken taste like it was cooked in old burnt grease and the waffle was ok. The waitress took our order and that was the only time we saw her. I'm a strong believer in leaving great tips but this day was a bad experience. A tip was left that was less than standard. Maybe this was an off day for Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Moye I.
Reviews.Content: I am not a fan of fried chicken, but I am one of waffles. So Roscoe's fulfills my waffle cravings quite nicely.But if it's too crowded, you should definitely check out their place on Pico!Once, we bet our friend to down two shots of syrup and a pat of butter. You guys can do that, too.

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: This is a favorite of locals and tourists alike it seems.  The manager indicated that celebrities frequent the place and that Stevie Wonder had been in there just the other night.  Lo and behold, during our second visit here (not my choice), DMX was sitting at the table next to us with his family.  The food is nothing to write home about, but it's a fun place to go with a big group of people (I was with 5 other women).  The portions are large.  I was a big fan of the yams.  YUUUUMMM!!!!  I never tried the waffles, so I can't comment on that.  The collard greens were also good, but I've had better in NYC.  I would recommend visiting this joint if in the area, if nothing else but for the atmosphere.  Who knows...you too may have a celebrity sighting while chowing down on your fried chicken and mac and cheese.

Reviews.Author: Danette R.
Reviews.Content: A Hollywood institution. I INSIST on eating here every time I'm in town. You have not lived until you've had a Jeane Jones Omelet atop a fluffy waffle and drowned in syrup.

Reviews.Author: Liz X.
Reviews.Content: I know a million people have already written reviews about Roscoe's, but it's sooooo good that I had to add my accolades as well.  Chicken and waffles?  Odd combination, you say?  Well, just try it.  The chicken is superb and just goes really well with waffles and syrup.  Who knew?  Apparently, everyone in LA.  And of course, the grits, biscuits, and mac and cheese are just as delightful.  I love that it's in the middle of Hollywood.  The waitstaff is friendly and nice.  Of course it gets crowded, but that's because it's so good.  I took a friend who was visiting me and she still talks about it to this day.  It's also a great way to see and walk around Hollywood but not in that scene-y annoying crowded H'wood way.  Just go and eat chicken and waffles, please.

Reviews.Author: Koku K.
Reviews.Content: So...it's is a bit overrated. It's not the greatest meal on Earth, or even close to making the runnings, but the chicken and waffles are pretty damn good.  It is an institution, so you'd be playing yourself if you didn't make it out to Roscoe's at least once or twice in your life, but it's no place I frequent on a regular basis.  It's a very carve your name in the tree bark with "I Was Here" written underneath it type of establishment.  As for this particular location, the dining room is small and it gets super packed, so the wait may be long depending on the time of day.  If you're particularly conscious about the restaurant grading system; the last time I was here it was rated B.  I only saw the grade after we were leaving, as it was inconspicuously located.  I just felt like that was worth mentioning for some dramatic effect.  I would've sat down to eat regardless.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: Went to LA for the weekend and we made it an objective to go to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles after watching Snoop Doggs new reality show.  Came on a sunday afternoon and we were expecting a long wait but we put our names down and were seated in less than 20, the hostess was really sweet too.The waffles are sooooo delicious and I love the gravy and skin on the chicken (yes, im chinese and I LOVE CHICKEN SKIN).  Shout out to Napolean T for ordering the 1/2 lb of chicken and finishing all of it.  I loved the greens and the corn bread too.  We ordered so much food and took the corn bread home but it was no good the next day.If you're going on a road trip to So-Cal, Roscoe's is a must!

Reviews.Author: Frank L.
Reviews.Content: This is the first chicken and waffle place I have been to. In the fast food fried chicken category, I really enjoy Popeye's chicken. Especially their Gravy, umm yummy...The fried chicken here is battered well and delicious especially if they served it to you hot right off the fryer. With a dash of their signature Louisiana hot sauce, It's hard to not eat it all including chewing on each bone. My GF usually orders the fried chicken with gravy sauce, according to her; they are crispy and wet at the right places.After all the chicken, I can never finish the waffles. So now when we come back here, I just order parts of the chicken with green on the side. Their green reminds me of my mother's Asian home cook style green, which is not too bitter, makes it perfect for being a side of a plate of meat.Overall my GF and I come back here once a month.

Reviews.Author: Honey T.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles is just to die for! I am just so happy that I was able to experience it again and now during my yelping days so I can write my review! Roscoe's chicken is the crunchiest, juiciest and amazing fried chicken ever! It amazes me that it is finger lickin good, but it is not needed to lick the oil on your fingers because there is none! I often wonder how they make their fried chicken so good and it is not even oily! The greens is my favorite! I can have 4 side dishes of this with squeezes of lemons and plenty of shaken Tabasco...oh what a treat! And even a better treat that Roscoe's will be opening a chicken and waffles across from Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas!!  Yay!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sam N.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes from a vegetarians point of view:I was dragged to Roscoes by some chicken and waffle loving guys expecting the worst...I can't guarantee there are truly vegetarian dishes that are cooked separately from all meat and never touch any chicken grease knives or pans...but since I am not that kind of crazy vegetarian, there were a good number of menu items without meat that sounded amazing and deliciously fattening.I ordered one waffle and a side of mac and cheese. I was expecting grossly heavy and greasy food but they were actually both pretty decent. The waffles aren't like big fluffy Belgian waffles-more like a pancake and an eggo waffle combined into one. Loved the overly sweet syrup. The Mac and cheese was seriously better than the waffle. Soft noodles with multiple kinds of cheese baked with it. The coffee is expensive , wtf!  Overall pretty good and although I wouldn't go by choice myself, I'd be more willing to eat some tasty Mac and cheese with my friends next time.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: Came here after a fun-filled day at Universal Studios. I must say...it doesn't live up to the hype. It's still very popular, though, so I'm sure Roscoe isn't complaining. We went at 5:00 and there was already a 30-minute wait. How ridiculous is that? There's also not a lot of parking in the area. They have valet for $10 and there's 1 hr metered parking within a couple blocks. I parked two blocks away for 2 hr metered parking for $2/hour. The restaurant itself is pretty nice. It's more spacious than I imagined. The service was okay - not fantastic, but not disastrous. I ordered the chicken thigh and waffle - one of the cheapest things on the menu. The chicken was okay, but I dare say that Popeye's is better. The waffle was pretty phenomenal, though. I think what made it was the whipped butter and syrup. It was sooo good, but so bad for my heart. I also tried my friend's gravy and rice. It was very heavy, but very yummy.I also ordered cornbread, which I was very disappointed in. It was dry and flaky and didn't have a lot of flavor. I thought the cornbread at Souplantation was better. I think I'd come back for the waffles, but not for anything else. I'm glad I tried it once, but I probably won't be coming back any time soon.

Reviews.Author: Christine V.
Reviews.Content: Has anyone heard of the "Economy Special?!" This place is so, so, SOO worth it it if you're coming here for that. $6 for 5 pieces of crispy, fried chicken thighs when you order to-go?! I'm there!!I've come here on several occasions during my little escapades just for this deal, and I am always rushing home to eat it. It makes my car smell delicious!!

Reviews.Author: Leana S.
Reviews.Content: Hyped to the Nth power.Not worth the wait. Over priced. G-hetto (duh). C- staff. 2 stars because I've most definitely experienced better. There's a man outside with a mic, mumbling names and wait times. LOL. Effing comedy. There's one law-suit-waiting-to-happen-it'll-break-soon bench in front of the sign for anyone to sit and wait for their table. Other than that, it's standing out the street of Gower baby. Sorry bout it. Take note: there will ALWAYS be a lot of you out there. Maybe you'll enjoy the street vendors. Buy yourself a pair of sunglasses and a new shirt because if you go during lunch hours, like me.. You'll find yourself waiting (sweating), under the hot LA sun.I've been here 2 times. IDK why. My first experience was not memorable. My second visit wasn't any better. 45 minute wait for drrrrrrry ass chicken and waffles that taste like they were not made with love.I'm better off ordering some spicy Popeye's to go, bring it back home and make my own waffles. It'll save me about $15. Go for the experience, I guess. Don't say you weren't forewarned. Good luck finding parking.

Reviews.Author: Chloe-Lynn O.
Reviews.Content: We don't have this back on the East, so I truly can appreciate the authenticity of a place like this.My first initial reaction: EW, chicken AND waffles?!  (and that was back in 2003), but since then I always, ALWAYS make it a point to eat there when I'm visiting Cali.I usually get a Lisa's Delight to drink and the chicken breast and a waffle (#13), with the butter, syrup, and hot sauce-- it makes for one banging meal.My friends get sides of collard greens (yum, bitter!), the cheese and onion scrambled eggs (fluffy and buttery), and rice w/ gravy-- so I pick at their plates as well.If you go to the one in Hollywood, sometimes you have to wait to be seated, but it's well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Danny D.
Reviews.Content: I knew what I was getting into being a vegetarian going into a place claiming to have Chicken & Waffles: my dinner was going to be coffee.Imagine my surprise when I found they served Waffles on their own (granted, it's a bit of a given, but I make no assumptions). And that they're fantastic, with hints of cinnamon and easily ripped apart and dunked in the restaurant's dual shot glasses of syrup.I can say nothing about the chicken, but if it Roscoe decided to establish a House of Waffles (and not a Waffle House) he'd have been just fine.

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: I live within 5 minuites of a different Roscoe's location but I prefer this one. Service is wayyyy faster here than any of their other locations. Last time I was there we got the #1 & #2 along with some sides. The food was there in less than 5 minutes pipping hot. The chicken is always juicy and cripsy, not oily. The mac & cheese was a little oily but hey it's real cheese. I'm afraid to try the rice & gravy, it looks addicting. The "sunset" is my beverage of choice, so delicious.There's a good mixture of people that dine at this location. So people that lack skin color shouldn't be afraid lol As for parking there's lots of free street parking in that area so not to worry. My only gripe about this place is the credit card policy. You can't just give the card to the waiter like you would elsewhere. You have to stand in a long ass slow line to pay while you're going into a food coma.

Reviews.Author: Kyle H.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and waffles are fantastic!  As good as I have always heard.  The optional onions and gravy they drench the chicken with really makes it.  Artery clogging be damned, its WORTH it.  Very nice, convenient location.  I didn't give it a perfect rating because there isn't a parking lot.  Valet only?  Come on!  I got a decent spot on Sunset just around the corner, but of course that's metered.  Very nice, casual, relaxed atmosphere.  And again, can't recommend the chicken and waffles enough.  Sounds like a crazy combo, but the mix of flavors totally works.  Give it a try!

Reviews.Author: Diana D.
Reviews.Content: I love this place... HOWEVER...Too expensive or maybe too little food?  One waffle is $5!  Whaaaaaat??  The waitress suggested I get two because it's a better deal for $8.  What are these people smoking??  The waffles are bomb though LOL, so I guess, they charge what they can get away with... in other words, rip-off.I got the Obama special (I think that's what it's called?) - three wings and a waffle for almost $9 and a lemonade for $3 (Disneyland drink prices).  I have to say, the food is pretty amazing (everytime) but, still really expensive for fried chicken and waffles!  I guess you're not really paying for the food though; you're paying for the Roscoe's brand... which is weak.All in all, I'll be back.. but I'm only here a few times a year, so I shouldn't go broke yet :)

Reviews.Author: P. I.
Reviews.Content: When people first hear about Roscoe's, they're like 'wha? Chicken and WAFFLES?'.  If the person is a good human being w/ an advanced palate who can appreciate the finest things in life, then Roscoe's is damn near an orgasm on a plate.If they are un-American and have incredibly whack taste, they'll say that it just tastes 'weird'.  Stay away from these people.  This is the most famous location out of all the Roscoe's.  Sometimes at night, you can also see Big Mama, who will whack you over the head if you have your elbows on the table.  If you're nice, you can enjoy fluffly waffles, perfectly fried chicken that dances w/ the Red Rooster hot sauce that perfectly compliments it, and dip it into the wondrous gravy [tip: request the gravy on the side].  I will get married one day. And I will get it catered by Roscoe's. Believe that.

Reviews.Author: Dee G.
Reviews.Content: Soooo delish I went straight for the "chicken and waffle" combo. Who would of ever thought that this combination is good together! Def going back

Reviews.Author: Tomi B.
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the fuss is about.  It started off bad when we asked about parking & the "valet" said $10 so he could "watch our car" (we opted to park 50 feet down for free).  We then get seated in the empty back dining room as punishment for not using the valet but asked to be seated in the main dining area.The food is so meh.  The chicken breast wasn't too bad BUT an Eggo waffle is more flavorful & crispy than the soggy frisbee that they put on the plate.  The corn bread had the texture of baked wallpaper paste & sand and the chicken chili had the texture of Alpo canned dog food.Disappointing meal & experience.

Reviews.Author: Janet N.
Reviews.Content: Okay seriously, Roscoe's must be putting magic in those chix and waffles because I am fiending away. The wait wasn't long at all and the security guard kinda irked us at first, but reassured us our safety. You all know LA is crazy right? Especially at night.I got Herb's Special;  Half chix covered in gravy and 2 waffles. This is as good as it gets, they are generous with portions here and the meal is stick to your ribs status. Don't even get me started about the waffles, they are a deliciousness I have never tasted before. It's sweet and cinnamon-y but not overpowering and the chicken was covered in the best gravy I've ever had. Sorry gra'ma!Gawd, someone buy me a ticket to LA nao!

Reviews.Author: Scott W.
Reviews.Content: Beyond classic.  Roscoe's is a Los Angeles institution and it hasn't changed one bit in the 20 years I've been eating there (unless you count the additional space they recently added to the dining area!)  Any L.A. native hating on this place needs to pack it up and move to the Northwest Territories because you don't deserve Roscoe's or the Sun.If you've been here then this review isn't for you.  Shoo.  Go read something else.If you haven't been here, here is the drill:1. Be prepared to wait if you're going to this location.  If you want faster time-to-eats try the Pico Blvd. or Lake St. (in Pasadena) locations.  They're not nearly as (aesthetically) cool as this one but you won't have to stand outside for an hour.1a.
