Stop whining about waiting.  The line should tell you something about the quality of the food.2. Once you get in, ask yourself this question: how hungry are you?  2a. Kinda hungry?  Order the Carol C (one waffle, one piece of chicken!)2b. Really hungry? Order Scoe's Special #1 (two waffles, two pieces of chicken!)2c. Do not be tempted to order anything else - that's for vets and even then do you really want to come to a "House of Chicken and Waffles" and get something else?  What's WRONG WITH YOU?3. Enjoy the best waffle(s) you've ever had in your life.  The chicken is really good but it's the waffles that have been delivered down from upon high to us mere mortals.4. Waddle out of the establishment and plan to double your exercise plans in the morning.If you have been going to Roscoe's for a while and are looking to branch out, I'd recommend the Jones Omelette - it might be even worse for you than the classics!

Reviews.Author: Jeena L.
Reviews.Content: Tip: They don't let you wait inside due to firecodes. Understandable so why can't they have a sign that simply states that? Did the host really have to come out kicking us out and taking our menus? That gave me a bad first impression, all I could think about was how rude the man was. There was so much hype about this place so I needed to check this out for myself. I had high expectations but compared to my local "Breakfast Klub" down in Houston, it puts Roscoe's to shame. I ordered Obama's special with chicken wings and waffles. The waffles aren't super great nor was it delicious/crispy/fluffy/thick like fellow yelpers mentioned.The wings were "aite" - nothing too special but a bit better than KFC's chicken wings since the batter was thicker. Im glad my family and I came on a Thursday at 1PM when it wasn't crowded and didn't have to wait long because they would have left disappointed.Anyways I'll be sticking to my Breakfast Klub down in good ol' Houston. It was a nice try Roscoes.

Reviews.Author: Rick S.
Reviews.Content: Really good soul food. Red beans and rice. Fried chicken breast albeit a little dry. This place is an institution. If you're in LA you've got to try it!

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: The parking at this location can be annoying depending on when you come. I've made a tradition of coming here once a year before school starts. I'll probably continue this tradition for years to come even though I finish my grad program this summer. Deep fried chicken and waffles. ENOUGH SAID. Roscoe's reputation precedes it. Back when I was in high school this was a combination I, and many others, would've never fathomed! Nowadays, there aren't many people who haven't heard of this famous pairing. I personally love the spicy/salty/sweet flavor profile so a bite of hot sauce doused fried chicken with syrup smothered waffle is astounding! 1. Scoe's does the trick for me. A quarter chicken, I prefer dark meat, with 2 waffles. Just scrumptious!

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's presents a bit of a paradox because when you're in the mood, there may be no better place to eat in Los Angeles, I say un-hyperbolically.  But if you go too often, the novelty fades a bit, so ration yourself.  Don't be shy- put your syrup on the chicken, get a little bit of everything on your fork.  That's why its called chicken & waffles, it's not chicken OR waffles.  I shouldn't have to be reminding people hundreds of years after the domestication of the chicken, but the breast is the blandest part of the bird, so take a chance with some dark meat.  Best drink in the house is the sunrise- fresh orange juice with fresh lemonade.

Reviews.Author: elisa o.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this joint!!!Service is exceptional and the staff is AWESOME!  HOSPITALITY!!!!Things ordered on this trip....Breast of chicken with waffles.Thigh with waffles.Biscuits.Grits.Mac and cheese.That's about it!A great big shout out to Jeff on this one since he is the one that introduced me to this place!  And all I can think about is ROSCOES!!!Parking is on the street.  Never had any problems, usually found parking within a block and make sure you carry quarters!!!

Reviews.Author: Gina T.
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes i did succum to the hype and had to try Roscoe's chicken and waffles.  Honestly the combination sounded weird and kind of gross when i first heard it, but i was proven wrong!  Being from the bay area, i dont get to enjoy the Roscoe's experience often, but when I do visit LA, i always make it a point to go!I always get the breast meat + waffle (forgot the name but i think it's #12 on the menu... hehe) and both times i've been here i've cleaned the plate.  I dont know if its because i always come here hungry or if their fried chicken and buttery waffles are really that good!oh, and i never... and i mean NEVER... eat the skin off my chicken, fried or otherwise.  but at roscoe's i gobble it up!  if you are in the LA area, i'd definately suggest you try it once!

Reviews.Author: Chris G.
Reviews.Content: I won't say too much, but this place was awesome.They were very friendly, and everything was great.I think next time I'll get 2 drumsticks instead of a breast and drumstick though.Great Mac n Cheese, and a great waffle. Almost as good as Waffle House for us Southerners (look it up LA Yelpers)

Reviews.Author: Laurin A.
Reviews.Content: I like this location the best.  Please come to the Bay though? I can't get enough of their chicken.... so crispy and perfectly seasoned.

Reviews.Author: niki h.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the complaints about parking on here.  Do people expect a tiny place like Roscoe's to have a massive, free parking lot in the middle of Hollywood?Please.There are clearly two kinds of people who've eaten there: those who love it for what it is, and those who feel it didn't live up to their expectations.Yes there's going to be a line, yes you're going to have to wait, yes it sometimes will be longer or shorter than the host(ess) predicts.  I go to Starbucks first, get an iced tea and an L.A. Weekly and settle in until my name is called; no big deal.  They don't even mind if I walk in with the Starbucks cup.Roscoe's is not gourmet, it's not upscale, and i don't think any of their chefs (who probably are just fine being called "cooks") will appear on Top Chef any time soon, and that's fine by me.  It's not hip, it's not trendy, they're not trying to impress anyone, they do what they do and they do it well.  When I go to Roscoe's, I go for one thing: the #13 Carol C. Special - a chicken breast and a waffle, and I've never been let down (and at $8.50, I find it to be very reasonably priced).  The breading on the breast is always crisp and tasty (it's only ever been "dry" in the sense that it's not greasy when you pick it up - which is NOT a bad thing) the meat is always moist, and the waffles perfect.  I could use a little more syrup, but that's a minor complaint.As for any of the other stuff on their menu?  I haven't a clue.  It's would be like going to Versailles and NOT getting the Pollo Versailles.It's called Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles for a reason. And it's not called Roscoe's Fancy Pants Chicken and Waffles Palace with Plenty of Free Parking for a reason too.

Reviews.Author: Brenda M.
Reviews.Content: After years of hearing about this place, I finally had the chance to try it on a Tuesday night after a visit to Griffith Park. I of course ordered the chicken and waffles. I also ordered a biscuit as I could not resist. I was pleasantly surprised that the chicken was not as greasy as I had imagined but yet very crunchy and delicious. The biscuit was decent but not memorable. The waffle was light. The sweet tea was yummy and hit the spot. We didnt have any problems getting a table. Overall I liked the chicken best and would return for the chicken. I would like to try the mac n' cheese on my next visit. *Parking: street or valet, NO lot

Reviews.Author: Shannon F.
Reviews.Content: Over-rated, Over-rated, Over-rated...I think people just get over-excited because they are so shocked to find soul food in Los Angeles.   I have eaten here several times, and each time I keep thinking, "Is this what people are so excited about?  Maybe I just came on a bad night"... And again, the next time, same experience.What I can definitely say is fun is the atmosphere- loud and bustling, and it feels like some place you might find in the South.  The chicken is just ok- which is such a let down for me since everyone says it's the best chicken they've ever had.  I guess I had better fried chicken than this for EVERY Sunday Dinner growing up, so I have a different opinion.   Maybe if you have lived here your entire life, you've never had real home cookin...I give the chicken 3 stars- it just doesn't live up to the hype.  And it is terribly greasy.  The waffles and cornbread are pretty good.  And an added bonus:  Since they have waffles, they have syrup.  And my family always put syrup on their cornbread- laugh all you want, but try it sometime.. It's pretty heavenly.  Needless to say, I was happy to find a place that serves cornbread and syrup, even if they aren't intended to be eaten together.  Of course, you know, this restaurant is COOL... and if you eat here, and say that you LOVED it, then you might be COOL too.   Hopefully the cool kids don't throw rocks at me for only giving it 3 stars.It is a rarity to find a place serving home cookin' here in SoCal, so I guess go ahead- be excited.  Maybe this is the best chicken you'll experience in your lifetime..  But I've had better.

Reviews.Author: Nadiyah S.
Reviews.Content: I don't like waffles, but they're SO SO good here. Don't forget the BUTTER AND SYRUP!  Don't be afraid and get super generous with the stuff.  It's good.  At first glance I was really not impressed because they didn't look or feel crispy or even look appealing, but they made a believer out of me.  I just slather that butter on, fold the waffles up like a taco, and dunk it in the syrup!The fried chicken is good, the chicken in gravy is super good too.  I haven't tasted good gravy like that in a while.  HOWEVER, do NOT waste your time on the sides.  Not only are they super over-priced, but they weren't even good.  I wouldn't even eat them if they were free.  I love me some good fixn's so I was really disappointed with my greens, potato salad, and cornbread.  They all went untouched.

Reviews.Author: Evelyn C.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a Roscoe's virgin anymore!! :) The atmosphere was very relaxed and welcoming, pretty down to earth, sadly it took us some time to find the place thanks to my terrible GPS. We found parking right in front. (the meter's limit was an hour =/ ) The service was great, for the most part, we were seated right when we walked in, our waiter was really friendly and did tell us before he went on his break and brought us refills just in case we ran out before he got back. But when we went to pay for our meal the lady at the register had a small attitude when we wanted to split the check.. Anyways, great food!! crispy chicken and fluffy waffles what more could one ask for. Oh and i saw the game [[thee rapper]] there! We didn't go up to him though, didn't want to disrupt his Roscoe's dinner with his friends. But i must say he looks a lot happier and nicer in person. In all it was quite the experience coming here. The servings were huge, which was good because we got to take lots of yummy leftovers home. It was getting pretty packed when we were getting ready to leave, but the place is a fair size so I'm sure being seated wont take too long.

Reviews.Author: Immunity B.
Reviews.Content: Whoever decided to put these two together - genius. Chicken and waffles together are top notch. Although I was a bit confused at first. I had to ask my cousin, "so should I make like a sandwich with the waffles? Or - eat them on top of each other or what?" haha But no. It turns out you just go ahead and do the damn thing.I ate here for the first time this weekend. Fantastic eatin'.The place was highly recommended by my cousin. The parking lot was small, but we found a spot with no problem. But who cares about parking. Service was great. We didn't have to wait that long to be seated either. We ordered our meals, and the server was friendly throughout. She kept coming back to check up on us too. Now that's how you treat your customers.Chicken was phenomenal. Warm, moist, crispy, and wholesome. I wish I could say, "tastes just like how we used to do on our grill back home." But, I'm asian. We were doing the fried rice thing in my fam. But yeah, fried chicken here was excellent.Hands down - best fried chicken and waffle's I've ever had. And both together in one meal, no less. 5 stars for food and service.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: One thing you'll learn about my reviews, they're honest, open and probably offends people.  But, it's my opinion on something, regardless if it goes along with popular opinion or not.Now that my legal disclaimer is out of the way, I love Roscoe's!  I went here about a year or 4 ago with my old roommate, mostly because of the novelty of eating fried chicken and waffles.  The concept sounds basic enough, but would it be worth $11 or whatever it was?Yes.That is some good eats.  Don't go if you:1. are not hungry2. are afraid of being the racial minority3. have health issues4. don't like bad parking5. don't like waiting for a whileThis isn't the kind of place you go every week.  It is still a bit of a novelty, but the food and experience is worth it.  Get the sweet tea.  I've traveled a lot lately, and especailly in the south (Tennessee and down) they love their sweet tea.  Just do it.If I had my own angioplasty business, I'd be handing out cards just outside the exit here.

Reviews.Author: Kris D.
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I love to do business in Los Angeles is having the opportunity to go to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles in Hollywood as it is usually pretty good. Unfortunately, my last visit there was not consistent with my past experiences. The chicken breast was not good, it was dry and overcooked! I was not allowed to switch my grits to rice (first time I have ever been denied that after years of going there).The mac and cheese was still good and the waffle was good as usual.On the plus side, they have expanded the restaurant and it now has a lot more seats and valet parking! =)Will I go back? Probably!

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: I've waiting a real long time to try Roscoe's, my wife has been bugging me forever but we finally had the opportunity on our recent trip.The exterior of Roscoe's is very non-descript, it looks as hole-in-the-wall as a hole-in-the-wall can get. It almost looks like a dive bar from the outside. Once inside, all we see is a really small room. We were seated in the corner of this small room, which was OK, but it was super dim like they wanted to hide something. Little did we know that there was a much bigger dining area on the other side of the wall that was brighter and in view of the kitchen.I ordered a #3 (half chicken with two waffles, no gravy) with an OJ while the wifey ordred the special of the day (I think it was 4 pieces of chicken with gravy over rice).The chicken was delicious, especially when you get some crispy skin with a chunk of meat on the waffle with some sweet syrup..yummmmy. I was definitely getting my hands dirty. The OJ was delicious by the way, freshly squeezed. The restroom was surprisingly super clean and brightly lit, my mom would approve.Definitely worth another visit, hopefully on the brighter side next time.

Reviews.Author: Gabi R.
Reviews.Content: I just moved to LA a few months ago and when we decided to try Roscoes for the first time a few weeks ago....I tried hard to keep my expectations low. I had heard all the hype but didnt wanna be disappointed. Holy crap was I NOT disappointed. First time my boyfriend and I went, was a saturday brunch. We're thinking..."the wait is gonna be ridiculous"....we waited for all of 3 minutes before being seated. REPEAT....on a saturday at about 11:30 AM. pretty much impossible on a weekend in hollywood. We were seated, ordered 2 sweet teas. The sweet tea is amazing. Has a passion fruit/mango taste to it that makes it so hard to stop drinking. Free refills on the tea BTW.My boyfriend ordered Skoes 1/4 chicken meal and I ordered the Carol C Special. The food was on our table within the next 15 minutes. The chicken was savory, succulent...perfectly seasoned and fried. The kind of fried chicken that falls off the bone. The waffles were golden brown, soft...but not too soft. Meals come with a dollop of butter on top of the waffle(s) and syrup. I personally suggest cutting your desired amount off the chicken breast and then pouring the syrup all over the waffle and chicken and enjoy. My BF's meal was a little too much food....(he ordered the carol c special the next time we went). Mine was the perfect amount. Our bill was decent, the service was fast, welcoming, and knowledgable. Second time we went, we went with 2 more people. Food came out pretty much immediately. BF got one of the mixed juice drinks and it was so good my taste buds didnt know what to do with it at first. Dont go with a group if you want to split checks...they dont allow you to. You also pay at the counter in the back room, you do not pay the waitress directly. Street parking was ample as well, even though theres a 1 hour limit. You will be out of there within the hour unless you linger. Honestly, Ill be going to this place for a very very long time. They basically do one thing...chicken and waffles....and they do it really really well.

Reviews.Author: Joel F.
Reviews.Content: Within the intimidating facade of this landmark Hollywood eatery, you'll find food that could kill a shaolin monk.Why is this?Simple -- fried chicken in quantities such as this can kill.I only had the the namesake chicken and waffles once.  Half of it came home in a box.  It was just too much for my teeny, tiny tummy!This place is really amazing.  Part hole in the wall, all bad ass chicken and waffles.  Cool :)

Reviews.Author: E C.
Reviews.Content: Fresh waffles and succulent fried chicken.Southern food.

Reviews.Author: Elaine W.
Reviews.Content: A veritable Los Angeles landmark! You can't say you've visited LA until you've drooled over some Roscoe's.I don't normally eat fried food but I will make an exception for their fried chicken. It's just so mouth-wateringly amazing...mmm.And the waffle -- it's got the right balance between soft and slightly crispy. Drenched in syrup, it can't be beat.The line is fast (don't be discouraged by the number of people waiting outside) and your food comes perhaps even faster once you're seated! Plenty of bigger tables so a good place for groups. Just be forewarned --once your chicken & waffles arrive, I can guarantee there will be around 2 minutes of silence as everyone

Reviews.Author: Adrienne T.
Reviews.Content: I FINALLY made it to the famous Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles!I wanted to go to the "real" one on Pico, where Tupac filmed his video, and where they say you can see those Cali cars with switches going up and down, and probably a celebrity or two, but I just didn't have time or cab fare to get over there.Anyway, I DID see a blue BENTLEY parked outside this one, AND the production crew from "Desperate Housewives" was inside and not happy because part of their huge order hadn't been taken, and they were having to wait.Because of someone on here, I got a "Sunrise" to drink. OMG! If you like SWEEEEET Kool-Aid, you'll love this. It's a mix of lemonade and fruit punch, and is pure heaven.I couldn't quite figure what to order, but I knew I had to get chicken and waffles.  So, I ordered 2 drumsticks, a waffle, and a side of macaroni and cheese.  I figured anyplace that feels comfortable charging $4.20 for a regular side sized portion of mac & cheese, must be pretty confident that it is darned good.The Mac&Cheese was WORTH $4.20 for a small side. Culinary delight, it was.  The chicken was your very basic chicken, and the legs were small.  I still prefer Church's and Popeye's.  The waffle was okay, but kind of doughy, still edible, though.I guess overall, I wouldn't really go here for the food again. I'd go to people and scene watch from a different Hollywood perspective.  This is working folks and real neighborhood folks just kind of doing their thing, and a BUNCH of tourists who LOOKED like they were from Idaho, watching them and eatin' fried chicken. Too funny!Be sure to get your FAMOUS Roscoe's t-shirts. They make hilarious souvenirs for your friends, especially the bourgeosie ones!

Reviews.Author: Laurie V.
Reviews.Content: It's fried chicken; and it's waffles --- nothing better. You get the savory with the sweet =)And sometimes you can spot a celeb or two in the restaurant...FUNThe only thing I didn't like was the mac and cheese --- do not samps that! I've had wayyy better, which is a disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Dano G.
Reviews.Content: Finally, after everyone facebooking and posting pics and swearing by their mothers' graves that this was the best place to ever eat on the face of the earth, I got a chance to eat here.I thought it would be intimidating, I was picturing a lot of one-visit veterans to look down upon me from their high-horse and insult me with such snappy remarks as "Oh, you never had Roscoe's?" or "I got to Roscoe's all the time!" or "We used to go to Roscoe's but now everyone goes to Roscoe's so we go to another place that not many people know of yet that I read from a celebrity's tweet."Not the case, yet the "bouncer" seemed scary, he was actually very courteous. My girlfriend already went earlier without me, I know, how rude, huh, experiencing this place without me. What a crock of bull. I refrain from watching specific movies because our schedules conflict. "What? You're gonna watch that tonight? With the guys? But we we're supposed to watch that movie together!" In this case it would be "What? You at there with the girls? But we we're supposed to eat there together!" Clearly, my girlfriend did not read the book on guidelines to a perfectly happy and reclusive relationship.She and the girls texted us that they saw Stevie Wonder inside.We replied with 'Did he see you?"What was supposed to be a 20-25 minute wait, was trimmed down to 15 minutes, and we were in. The wait staff was polite and quick. The menu prices were good. A friend ordered Chicken and Potato Salad. Not one to be a one-upper, though, we could not help but point out the name of the place. It is not Roscoe's House of Chicken and Potato Salad.The prices are decent and you can easily afford a filling meal for around $10.Though, I did expect a lot more delicious and tasty meal due to everyone's over-hype.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: I've been hearing kvelling over Roscoe's for years, but just finally made it here.  And it gets the following from me: eh.  Maybe I'd heard so much that it couldn't have lived up to my expectations, maybe it's that I'm not a soul food person and also a vegetarian, but really, everyone's wetting their pants over this?The restaurant has a strange layout: you can only enter through the small dining room - and you have to wait outside if there are people ahead of you - and you can only exit through the main dining room.  There was a security guard holding open the door for us when we came in...I'm not used to restaurants with guards.  The restaurant itself seemed dark.  As for the food, the waffle was good, yes (it was the round flat kind, not the Belgian kind, and it tasted like there were spices in the batter), but not as good as the Omelette & Waffle Shop in San Pedro, and also, at Roscoe's, the only topping for your waffle is syrup (or jelly, I guess).  I wasn't in need of anything fancy, but a blueberry waffle might've been nice.  The mac n cheese was very cheesy and also kinda oily.  I much appreciated the generous head of whipped cream atop my hot cocoa, but $2.60 for cocoa from a machine?  Speaking of price, all the side dishes seemed overpriced, and I wasn't the only one to say so.  A friend ordered a hard-boiled egg and was given eggs over-easy, and then there was some sort of issue where she had to say fine, scrambled egg.  Why couldn't she get the egg that's on the menu?  The chicken eaters seemed ok with their chicken.  I was afraid to try either the biscuits or sweet potato pie due to potential lard inclusion, although I reaaaaally wanted to order the pie.Both stalls in the women's restroom were almost completely out of toilet paper, and there weren't any wrapped rolls I could see elsewhere in the restroom.  The servers were hard to flag down if we needed anything, and they seemed harried.  Food came up fast, and the bill came with handiwipes, which I thought was a nice touch for a place that serves fried food.

Reviews.Author: Tuan L.
Reviews.Content: There aren't many places that specialize in chicken and waffles, so it's pretty special when you can find a place like Roscoe's growing up. The Hollywood location has a lot of history. This is pretty evident as you browse the pictures of the famous entertainers on the wall that have been their before. There isn't anything too fancy about the decor, but then again, we're talking about chicken and waffles, not squab and crepes. The fried chicken is very tender and seasoned perfectly. The waffle isn't thick like some places that serve breakfast, but rather thin. Not the greatest waffle, but is satisfying. Great for late night eats, but beware, the wait could be long.The wait staff is extremely friendly and attentive. There isn't a parking lot, so you'll need to find street parking.

Reviews.Author: Teresa S.
Reviews.Content: We had heard all of the fanfare regarding Roscoe's and decided on our SoCal sojourn we'd need to pay a visit.  Apart from two visit to Waffle Houses (those were in my pre-Yelp days), I've never really raved about waffles.  But the hype was enough to pull us in to try them.Big, burly bouncers in front of a waffle joint?  Do patrons get into barroom brawls over who gets the wishbone?  Three outside and one stationed between the front part of the restaurant and the "inner sanctum."  Very weird.  I digress (as usual).  Back to the review.   We went early on a Friday night and I thought judging from the amount of people milling about out front we'd have to wait until the cows came home.  Luckily since we're a "party of two" our wait was as long as the woman took to pull the menus.  We were seated in the front part of the restaurant which was also crowded and noisy as hell.  As soon as we were seated our server came over and got our drink orders and came back in enough time to allow us to decide on our meal: a #13 for me (waffle and chicken breast), a waffle for him and a side of mac-and-cheese.  Surprise!  I barely had time for a Yelp check in and our food was in front of us.  Quick service I will say.  A steaming hot plate of a big waffle and a chicken breast the size of a softball.  The side of mac-and-cheese (at a whopping $4.50) was barely bigger than an ice-cream scoop.  Jeez.  The waffle, chicken and mac-and-cheese were unremarkable - simply average.  I was trying to discern the difference between a 'Scoe's waffle and every other waffle.  Perhaps a dash of vanilla?  Sorry, but Dominicans put vanilla in everything.  The chicken was juicy but it was in a scalding hot oil bath.  And the mac-and-cheese, well that too was ... average.  OK - but nothing to write home about.    We went, we ate, we yelped.  Enough said.

Reviews.Author: Bobby A.
Reviews.Content: Whenever I hear the name Roscoe, I always think of Rosco P.Coltrane from the Dukes of Hazzard so with a name like Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles, I just had to go investigate.Southern soul food done right is unheard of in Canada but it's one of the regional cuisines of the US that I love. Fried chicken, grits, collard greens, sweet potato pie, biscuits and gravy, mint juleps, I love it all.Came here to try the chicken and waffles and it was excellent, seriously probably the best fried chicken I ever had. You have to try this place!

Reviews.Author: Claire S.
Reviews.Content: I think I finally understand the true meaning of comfort food. I came here with some friends on an exceptionally unpleasant evening.I ordered the 2 Scoe's - 2 waffles with 2 pieces of fried chicken, smothered in gravy and onions, and a side of the macaroni and cheese. The waffles didn't look like anything special, but were amazing - drenched in syrup and butter, rich with flavor. The chicken was just as rich, heavy with gravy and delicious. The macaroni and cheese, while not necessarily worth it for the price (~5 for a mini bowl), was quite good.I left feeling like I was wrapped in a warm blanket of homey, fatty food, which normally I would abhor the feeling of, but it was indeed truly comforting. While I can't justify coming here regularly, it was a nice experience!

Reviews.Author: Hannah K.
Reviews.Content: So good. If you're eating your chicken and waffle separately you're doing it wrong! It's just not the same. It may seem odd to mix chicken, waffles, syrup, butter, and hot sauce, but somehow it just works.I got the Obama special last time I was here- 3 wings and either a waffle, potato salad or fries. (this was the Country Boy Special). Their mac and cheese is good, but their cheesy eggs were better. Long wait but it's worth it.And yes, this is the original location.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: The best I've ever eaten, by far. Forever a Roscoe's girl! Their chicken is so juicy and tender. It simply cannot be beat! Chicken and waffles is such a simple and delicious combo! Don't forget the hot sauce on the chicken! Chicken smothered in gravy is amazing as well. There isn't really a wrong way that Roscoe's serves it up.The beans and rice are delicious as well! Cornbread is on point! Pie is awesome... I haven't tried one thing here that I did not like. I have no complaints about the food! The only problem I have is the wait and the parking... especially at this location, the parking is ridiculous! We had to park about 5 blocks down the street and walk. I mean it is in LA, but it seems to me that parking could be better. Other than that it is a 5 star deal!

Reviews.Author: Steevens A.
Reviews.Content: Always a pretty darned good eat on a Friday night. Go to this location early (before 7) and there is basically no wait. Unfortunately, no street parking on the Roscoe side before 7, so you will be taking a stroll to the restaurant.Their location is extremely clean all-around. The tables, the floors, even the bathrooms are pristine. She had the #13 Chicken & Waffle (THE STANDARD!) and I had the #16 Chicken Sandwich (Breast) plus fries. They give you a crapload of fries, although they are a bit greasy. Had to also get the cornbread on the side as well...All around, our meal and the service was fantastic! Oh, and I picked up a t-shirt on the way out. I'll be back here again, as I always am every few months.

Reviews.Author: Juan F.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoe's, why oh why did I wait so long to come back and see you again?Had the chicken and macaroni and cheese and greens.  We shared a waffle.Delicious, down home southern cooking.  You can't beat it and we left so satisfied.  The portions were HUGE, which I didn't remember....We showed up around 2:30-3 PM and there was still at 35 minute wait, proof Roscoe's is good any time of day, I guess.

Reviews.Author: Melody D.
Reviews.Content: The place is crowded, the decor is... well, kitsch might be a nice way to describe it, and on a busy night you're going to be waiting your ass on the curb for at least 20 minutes.  But ask yourself:  where else in this town am i gonna get myself some good ol Southern cooking?Be forewarned that the portions are enormous.  A $9 meal will get you two giant waffles (and two giant pats of butter + syrup) alongside half a chicken-- southern style or ladled in gravy, depending how you like it.  My basketball player boyfriend finished his food up nice, but I had a little trouble.  Remember that as good as the food tastes in the moment it's not great take-out, so if it's two girls out for a chicken wing, do yourself a favor and split the #1 or #2... you won't be finishing it.  There's also the option of getting just bird or just batter, but honestly, what the hell are you doing there if you're not going for the combo?Little sweet, little crispy, lots of tasty.

Reviews.Author: Lauren R.
Reviews.Content: The evening after I moved to Los Angeles, I was inducted into Roscoe's fandom. I've been here for a while, and the love hasn't ceased. I've eaten at every location with the exception of Pasadena, which means I've witnessed various landmark eras that will forever be etched into my memory, along with the smell of fresh waffles, piping grease and booming voices telling you to "sit the hell down".Yes, Ma'am. - Just before Barack Obama took Senator Clinton for the Democratic presidential nomination, Pico Roscoe's was swathed in the greatest Obama shirts ever. "The Black man is running! What you gonna do about it?"Wish I'd bought one. That's what I should have done about it.  - The long-closed curio shop next door to Gower Roscoe's; I used to have really interesting conversations with their resident Incense Dude. There's also the rest of the story concerning the first time I dined at Roscoe's, when I spotted R&B artist Ginuwine get up and dance to his own song ("Ride it ..my pony") as it played in the restaurant, then sat down and proceeded to polish off his chicken and waffle dinner. I've played favorites. Haven't we all? I used to order the chicken burger, having taken a liking to drowning it in red rooster sauce. Yes, I was the person at your table looking longingly at your waffles without ordering one of my own. After a bit of time, I started ordering 'my usual' - which I refer to as The Key of G, the Big Mamma Special, well-done. Fluffy scrambled eggs with cheese and onions, a side of potatoes slathered in gravy, a biscuit and the all-important iced tea. I'm sure a lot of other milestones in my life will be associated with Roscoe's. In fact, I may go have one this afternoon.

Reviews.Author: Maureen G.
Reviews.Content: While the waffles and chicken are good (not great), the service is TERRIBLE! I walked in and was waiting around for someone to seat me, take my order, or greet me. The restaurant was not busy and I had to ask the women at the cash register for help. Even then, they were pretty uninterested in attending me. The waffles and fried chicken are good. Nothing exceptional, but not bad either. Good for the Monday thru Thursday price!I think there's too much hype about this place. Maybe another location would blow my mind. Maybe another item on the menu would do the same. All I know is that the beans and the macaroni both had me wishing I had ordered those instead.

Reviews.Author: Dina A.
Reviews.Content: With 1174 reviews already, we hardly need another one here, but I have something to say, dammit!This place is a trip. Not like a lovely-cruise-through-the-Caribbean kind of trip, but more like an I-got-lost-in-a bad-neighborhood-got -mugged-and-got-food-poisoning kind of trip.The service was horrible.A child VOMITED on the floor right by our table. I'm not kidding.The food was terribly overpriced, and...it left a bad taste in my mouth...literally...I was "enjoying" the food again at 3:00 am when I got up to take MORE Tums.Never again.

Reviews.Author: Raul R.
Reviews.Content: One of the best parts of being an Angelino is having the privilege to come eat here whenever the hell you feel like it. Over the years, i've developed a favorite ordering routine. I start off with the Scoe's #2 (thats with the smothered onions and gravy, and two delicious waffles), slap them bitches with a bunch of buttah and syrup, move on to the delicious mac & cheese,  pick at the eggs with cheese and onions, and wash them shits all down with a fat ECLIPSE. damnnnnnn!!!!! just remember that if you dont die of a heart attack of goodness, you will be handicap for the rest of the day. you will be stuffed! One thing that pissed me off one time though, is that the bitch-ass waiter told me i had to pay for a lemonade because i decided to squeeze a lemon into my water and add sugar? are you kidding me? fuckin loser. Otherwise, bombass food.. Walk here after a night partying at the music box. Build up that hunger on the dance floor my friends..

Reviews.Author: Grayson C.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's had always been something my friends and I talked about going to try. Even living in Northern California, we would joke about driving to SoCal to partake in Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. Thankfully during this past visit to Los Angeles Roscoe's made the cut. I ordered fried chicken that was smothered in gravy with onions, grits, and it had a biscuit. So much food. Our server took our order, and our food was out immediately. It did not disappoint either. I had requested for dark meat when asked, and I received 2 fairly big pieces of chicken (thigh and leg). The gravy was excellent, and the seasonings on the chicken where fantastic both the meat and the crispy fried bits. Hands down Best Fried Chicken I have ever had. The biscuit was tasty, but I was not impressed with the Grits. I tried my buddies waffle, and it was really nice. The batter was not overly sweet, and had just enough vanilla that it was noticeable without being overpowering.Our waiter was super friendly, and was joking around with us quite a bit. He had made a comment about wishing the water was Tequila that cracked us up. I love comfort food, and this place really set the bar on fried chicken. Between the food, cozy atmosphere, and friendly staff, this is a place I plan on making a staple every trip I make this way.

Reviews.Author: Fabian R.
Reviews.Content: I live around the corner from this place and all the time it seemed so full, people all the time in this restaurant, and friends were telling me that it was very good. so i decided to try it with them one dayand YES it is good, the fried chicken is so crispy and the portions are big, the chicen is not greasy, and has good flavor... same with the wafllestotally would go again

Reviews.Author: Lyndsi W.
Reviews.Content: It's an event when going here, has been forever. The key is to order a piece of fried chicken and a waffle. Step one: Cut up the waffle into bite size pieces, and cover with syrup.Step two: Pull fried chicken apart into bite size pieces and put on top of waffle.Step three: Top off with their hot sauce to your liking.Hands down no joke. Best way to do it!

Reviews.Author: Eamon S.
Reviews.Content: If Snoop Dogg likes it than you will too. What more can I say great soul comfort food, Chicken and delicious Waffles don't get no better than Roscoes.

Reviews.Author: Josh G.
Reviews.Content: Such awful service.Such a fucking good waffle.Such a great review.

Reviews.Author: Katrina T.
Reviews.Content: Chicken & Waffles is a MUST as you can see from everyone's reviews. Get it with the gravy too. You might want to share with someone.... My gf and I got the 1/2 lb chicken which came with 4 pieces of chicken and 2 waffles. The waffles aren't that great, but feels like it tastes amazing along with their chicken! The gravy is pretty thick but their chicken is so fresh. It is like a better quality chicken than what you would get at KFC. Pretty cool how they have a chicken option named after Obama! I didn't know he visited that location! The place gets ghetto at night so this location seems pretty exclusive. You sign up, then wait outside until the "bouncer' tells you it's OK to go in. Are all Roscoe's like this? I've only been to this location multiple times so don't know the process of the other restaurants. Anyway just read everyone else's reviews because they're all pretty much the same. Chicken & Waffles FTW.

Reviews.Author: Angelica V.
Reviews.Content: The food was ok never can go wrong with the Mac n cheese. I just wished they had better service, our waiter only came twice to check on us and that's including the first time to get our order worst part it wasn't even busy!! They have very poor service for how famous and popular this place is :/

Reviews.Author: Polina T.
Reviews.Content: Came here today for the second time with the boyfriend. Last time we went was on a Sunday and had to wait in a long line. Today we didn't have to wait at all! Last time I got the #2 (quarter chicken, gravy, and waffles) this time we got the #4 (half chicken, gravy, and waffles) to split. Both were equally amazing! This place doesn't disappoint! Our service has always been quick, both to take our order and deliver. This place is definitely worth all the hype!

Reviews.Author: Cindy S.
Reviews.Content: I've heard a lot of hype about this place (especially being The Original) and that might be the reason for my disappointment. *Before I start- please note it is a bad idea to try and walk from the Chinese Theatre to Roscoe's on a hot day. It can be quite a long walk in a not so nice area...This place is located in a random area, there weren't too many other businesses around being a few blocks on a side street off Hollywood Boulevard. It looks small and rundown from the outside.When we arrived we were served water and seated fairly quickly. It took them a while to take our order and even a little longer to bring out our food. There were only about 5 tables in our section so I'm not sure what took so long. My boyfriend and I both agreed the chicken was good but we've had much better at other places. Mine was a little over fried and dry. Pieces were kind of small. The waffle and syrup were fabulous. The syrup had some sort of added cinnamon flavor. The collard greens were good and mac n cheese was different, good, but nothing special. Prices were a little expensive. I think this place is a little over rated. Sandra Dee's in Sacramento, California is way better! Glad we have Sandra Dee's closer to home. I prefer them over Roscoe's any day!

Reviews.Author: Randy G.
Reviews.Content: 1200+ Reviews!  4 Stars!  Why? For Soggy Waffles?  Watered down syrup?  A staff that runs around crazy even when they aren't fully packed....I really want to say this is between 2 to 3 stars somewhere...but maybe cuz I was so hungry...so I'll just leave it at 2 for now!Got the Chicken and Waffles with Gravy.....I didn't eat almost all day so I was starved...Chicken with Gravy is not bad...I can probably make the same thing though....or go to KFC and pour the mash potato gravy onto my fried chicken!Waffles were so soft it feels like they didn't even cook them fully...and luckily I'm not much of a syrup person...cuz that tasted like the most generic watered down BULK syrup you can get for a restaurant....What all the hype about might be the Sweet Potatoe Pie?  but I don't eat that....or maybe the chicken chili with fries?  didn't get that either...so...for what I had and my take on the place for now....It's a good quick meal...but nothing to go dancing around the streets about!

Reviews.Author: DeShaun C.
Reviews.Content: I'm not new to soul food. For one thing, my parents both grew up in the south--North Carolina and Georgia, to be exact.Growing up, I never even thought this place was real. I'd just hear about it on sitcoms and figured it was fictional. Well, turns out the place is not only real, but it's great. I made the mistake of ordering a 2 thigh meal, with an extra thigh. I didn't expect the thighs to be so large! I ate two but man...what was I thinking? Definitely larger than your average piece of chicken. I remember there being macaroni and cheese, which was creamy and flavorful--not gritty, not gummy like some places. In fact, the only thing I didn't care for was the cornbread...that was pretty dry and I'd skip it. I devoured everything else, including the collard greens. This is of particular significance, because I don't like collard greens. When my mom would cook them, I couldn't even stand the smell of them, but these? I ate the whole thing. The portions are big, so I suggest you share, or come very hungry. I did a little of both and still had leftovers. Service was friendly. As I was told by the man at the door, we apparently beat the Sunday rush by coming in before 11am. You should try to do that, too.

Reviews.Author: Nhu-Quynh N.
Reviews.Content: I've heard about this place for quite some time and I've finally came around to try the food.  My boyfriend ordered the regular wings and grits and biscuit. The wings were flavorful on the outside as much on the inside.  The grits, I'm not really a fan--truth is I don't really know how to really eat that.  Hah.  The biscuit was good, very fluffy.  I ordered the Scoe #2, white meat.  The gravy was sauced all over the meat.  It came with two waffles.  Definitely a hardy meal.  I was definitely in a bad food coma because after we ate, we went around LA and I was exhausted a few hours later and I came home to sleep and woke up at night fall.  Must be that good.  The mac and cheese was delicious, small portion but fulfilling. Staff is ok.  Not much of a humor person.  But she was sweet though.  She came around often to ask if we were ok.  So I appreciate that.

Reviews.Author: Lauren B.
Reviews.Content: Now, this is coming from the experiences I have had coming here due to out of town friends wanting to come and coming after Amoeba closes at 11pm [me going on a Friday and Saturday].Let me just say:Service always sucks.[and no, this is NOT because they are busy]The "host"/security guard is a joke.Food isn't anything special (waffles are pretty much Eggos/ chicken is dry).The food is over-priced.Hope you get the server "Devron, like Chevron" as he is dooooope.For me, the only Pro to this place is that they are open 'till the wee morning hours.I really am not sure what all the hubub is about as you can make these menu items at home and in a much healthier way.

Reviews.Author: Evan J.
Reviews.Content: I'm happy to see the hundred or so reviewers before me have covered the merits of Roscoe's quite thoroughly.  There must be crack in their syrup.  It's just amazing.Order the #13, Carol C. Special or split the #3, Herb's Special with a friend (an especially good value).The Gower location is small and busy.  You'll usually find less of a wait on Pico.

Reviews.Author: Scott M.
Reviews.Content: I can positively say that after trying a number of chicken and waffles spots across the country, Roscoes Chicken & Waffles is certainly not the King of Chicken and Waffles.This location is in Hollyweird, and I think its the original location.  We waited at this place for 90 minutes for some average chicken and waffles at  2am.The place is smaller than I could have ever imagined.  But does seem to be a spot full of good stories and a variety of different ppl.  You would think pretty much anything is good at 2am after you are a bit tipsy...but not the case.  The waffles were pretty tasty, but I was really disappointed in the chicken.I come from the south, so I have had the best of the best in fried chicken..perhaps I should have known that they really cant do it like they do down south on the west coast...For 90 minutes, and a group of 6 guys, this place was disappointing for sure.

Reviews.Author: Aaron R.
Reviews.Content: My heart stopped. Stopped. Blip Blip Blip.... Beeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee...Number 23, chicken breast, mac and cheese, greens, cornbread and a waffle to round it out being that this was my first time at Roscoes.Sweet Tea.Dear lord.Anyway, it is a pretty bare establishment, it could be a wood paneled diner but it isn't.The menu is all over the place.The food is just fine. Not the best southern food ever, but perfectly tasty no less.

Reviews.Author: Tim R.
Reviews.Content: Review #250, how you like them apples? Been here a few times and usually get the #1 SCOE'S plate (1/4 Chix prepared southern style, 2 waffles, in their own private mix)-food is out fast-good service-wish they had more dessert optionsMust visit LA restaurant. Forget your health and diet for one day and just go HAM.Butter, sizzurp, chicken, and waffles. What else do you need in your life?

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: quick tip: ask them to make your waffle extra crispy, no one likes a soggy waffle. Also for the (chicken) darkmeat = juicy inside, white meat = dry insideI just ran my half marathon i was hungry and craving something greasy and unhealthy. No place better to fill my hunger and wishes than Roscoe's. This place gets super busy, wait time average is 30 mins. But they have some legit chicken and waffles. Whoever is seasoning their chicken knows what their doing, My waffle came out nice and crispy. The was chicken crispy,flaky, and moist inside. I cant say the same for my friend though his waffle came out soggy and he ordered white meat so his chicken was dry inside. Our meal came with 2 waffles and 2 chicken (breast)(drumstick) each. We were more than satisfied, definitely will be back when i'm in LA

Reviews.Author: Susan C.
Reviews.Content: I try to eat here every time I'm in L.A.  My friend lives in West Hollywood so getting here is a quick drive down the street.I am a fried chicken fanatic.  I love it.  I love grits, and butter, and waffles, and mac and cheese and I love Roscoe's.  I remember when they had a false Roscoe's in Oakland like in the mid-90's and because they weren't actually Roscoe's they changed their names to something else and still served chicken and waffles (which didn't have the same batter recipe).  And with a little bit of confusion I remember asking the waiter, "is this Roscoe's?" and him replying quite defensively, "this isn't Roscoe's!"  Jeez Louise, yeah obviously not cause no one as Roscoe's would be so rude.  Hahaha.Anyway, everything I listed is freaking delicious.  Hot, crispy and oh snap, I forgot to mention their gravy!  Oh yeah, I ask for a side of gravy and put some on the grits, dip some fried chicken in the gravy AND dip fork fulls of mac and cheese in the gravy as well.  Oh gravy....

Reviews.Author: Jack C.
Reviews.Content: I'm dating this black chick now and we rolled into L.A. "Imma get myself some waffles and fried chicken" - she says"saaay waat gurl?" - I said in shock since I've never heard of that combination"ohh yea, you never heard of Roscoe's chicken?" - she says in wide-eyed surprise"ehh...no. Why don't we get ramen? It's healthier" - I said condescendingly. "We always get Asian, let's get soul food. Roscoe's chicken is like a national treasure kinda like Niagara Falls or the Washington monument.So we went, we had a fantastic time! All I have to say is - I love dark meat, especially thighs!

Reviews.Author: B B.
Reviews.Content: This service and every employee well maybe for the nice girl at the front are horrible, food is good but avoid this location

Reviews.Author: Kase C.
Reviews.Content: Already a southern soul food tradition, Roscoe's was made famous for bringing chicken and waffles to the west. For those who think it's a weird combination. Let's think it through. Fried chicken with honey is a classic combination. Taking that into account, fried chicken and syrup isn't that far of a stretch. And instead of biscuits, why not include a different starch, one that goes better with syrup. And then there you go, chicken and waffles. Although Roscoe's has all sorts of crazy chicken and waffle combinations, whenever I go, I just get the original Chicken and Waffles. If you're new to the experience or only visiting once, skip the giblets and order what made them famous, the classic Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin L.
Reviews.Content: EVERY time I stop in Los Angeles, a trip to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is a must.  No if ands or buts.  It's a necessity of life.  And every single time I go... I'm never disappointed.  Of course if you come on a busy day you have to wait a little while.   Understandably the service sometimes is lax because it's so busy.  No worries.  The food makes up for it all.  They even expanded the place since the last time I was there.  Oooooo child.  I had half a chix... gravy on the side.  2 waffles.  Mac n Cheese, greens, the candy yams and a tall glass of the most delicious lemonade ever.  A hour and a half later it was all gone....  The most heavenly meal ever.  The 3 Roscoe's virgins I brought with me also had the exact same experience and couldn't stop talking about how happy their stomachs were after the meal.  If you know what's good for you, hop in your car, throw on some old school baby makin' music and drive your ass out to Roscoe's right now.  Get your chicken and waffle on.  I can't wait until my next visit.

Reviews.Author: Renee H.
Reviews.Content: 1. Black people's version of iHop but costs more.2. Stuff that passes for soul food in LA.3. Not bad but not great either.4. All hype no substance5. Go for the novelty of saying that you've been to the famous Roscoe's

Reviews.Author: Jasmine J.
Reviews.Content: This place is over rated!! I never been to a Waffle House before and I was really excited to go to Roscoe's.  I've hear good things about this place for years. However I was disappointed when I got there. The waitress was rude. After she took our order and brought us our food she did not come back to our table to check on us at all. I did see her sitting at table near by as if she was on her break. There were 2-3 waitresses who sat around doing nothing. I never been to a restaurant where the employes took breaks in front of the customers.The food was ok. I had eggs and waffles. The eggs were good but I did not like the waffles. They were soft and much smaller than I imagined. My friend had chicken and fries. She did not like her food either.The only positive thing I would say about My time here was that we did not wait long for our food to be served. It took about 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Zuhair A.
Reviews.Content: Best. Anything. Ever. Hands down.

Reviews.Author: Matt F.
Reviews.Content: Well, already having been reviewed didn't stop 438 other people, so why should it stop me, right? Yeah!I will forever be in debt to Roscoe's for being my first Chicken and Waffles experience. Before hearing of Roscoe's I had never even heard of the combination before. It was as foreign to me as GummyBears and Steak, or Meatloaf and Fruit Roll-ups. "But, They're from two different worlds!" I argued, like someone had just suggested that Lois could carry Superman's baby. But Oh, how wrong I was.It was my first night in Los Angeles and having been name checked in both Swingers and Jackie Brown holds a lot of weight for a guy like me, so despite my concerns and confusion, Roscoe's was the choice for that first dinner.The atmosphere inside was dark, but very welcoming, and the staff were downright charming. We were shown to our table amid a near full house of fellow diners, even at nearly 11 o clock, the place was booming.Once I had drank in the ambiance and it was time to order, I thought I might as well go with the namesake meal, and the most basic essence of Roscoe's, and that seemed to be the Carol C Special - "One succulent breast and one delicious waffle". My apprehensions continued even when it was put down in front of me. Now, I didn't at the time and still I don't know who Carol C is, but after a couple of bites, alternating between pan-fried Chicken and a large waffled all syrupped up, I wanted to make dirty love to this meal's namesake in appreciation. It's one of the best meals I've ever had. My first dinner in Los Angeles became my first, second and third dinner in Los Angeles, returning the next 3 nights and always remaining faithful to my culinary lover, Carol C. But alas, the Carol C special lives at Roscoe's in L.A. and although I wish on a daily basis there were Roscoe's locations anywhere near Toronto, I know we're from two different worlds, but one day we will meet again.

Reviews.Author: Denise C.
Reviews.Content: Someone took me here in Los Angeles, and I don't know why because "Chicken and Waffles" was completely strange to me. It's part of African-American soul food. The dishes are too expensive for the portion they offer. The dishes are bland. I didn't like the gravy. The waffles were flat. The chicken serving is tiny. You go to Roscoe's in LA and you might start wondering how the hell POPEYE'S became POPEYE'S in the first place!?However, I did catch Ashton Kutcher there and got his autograph, and that might be the only reason to hang out at Roscoe's. Otherwise, skip it and go eat some dim sum.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey W.
Reviews.Content: You (hopefully) know about the food. What you may not know is that this is one of the best TAKE OUT restaurants in the city. My office breakfast order this morning was handled with patience and care by the staff and management at Roscoe's Hollywood. They triple-checked the order both on the phone and in person, had it ready within the 10 minutes they quoted, and bagged it with plenty of utensils and condiments. It's great late at night or for a leisurely Sunday, but don't forget it as a superb take out spot!

Reviews.Author: PUFF S.
Reviews.Content: I went to Roscoe's because everyone tells me that their chicken and waffles were really bomb.It had been a while since I had good fried chicken, and waffles didnt sound bad either, so I ordered the normal chicken and waffle. It don't feel like Roscoe's uses the highest quality ingredients, as their chicken seems kinda KFC-ish, and the waffles were flat and hard. This is an average chicken place, and an average waffle spot, and they get an average 3 star rating from me. Better Chicken, and better waffles can be found around town....but I guess the chicken/waffle combo keep s people coming back

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm mmmm mmmm....the name says it all!  * licks fingers *i just hate waiting for a table.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: It's soooooooooooo good. There's nothing better than fried chicken and waffles. Seriously, people think it's a weird combo, but I love it. This is the second location I've been to and frankly this is nicer one. I think I spent the whole time at lunch watching this one girl who was eating alone here with her SLR and camera books, she went around the whole restaurant taking pictures and writing notes. It's just interesting and ballsy to see someone eating alone nowadays without talking on the phone.I ordered the dark meat combo with mac, yams, and collared greens, because I forgot how good the waffles were, then I stole a couple bites from a friend and was transferred to a little bit of heaven, but only for a second. The chicken was tasty as usual, and the yams were sugary sweet just like I like it. I love visiting LA and going to Chicken & Waffles, I think we manage to go every time. Unfortunately no one was brave enough to split the fried livers, which is another one of my favs, but alas maybe next time.

Reviews.Author: Lily A.
Reviews.Content: I always hear about this place...and finally I got to enjoy a plate of fried chicken and waffles...we were in Hollywood, and after a long night of dancing and meeting weird guys we ended up at Roscoe's. It's a small joint, but it looks like they were looking to expand, according to the doorman. There was a long line of people waiting, but finally after giving the doorman some cash, he got us in sooner, 'cause my tummy was hungry. Of course I ordered the chicken and waffles. It was an interesting combination, and I fully enjoyed my meal, but maybe because I was a bit drunk from partying. If I was sober it might be a different story. Maybe I was just expecting too much, because there is always all this hype with that title. But definitely I will have to try the place again when I'm not as intoxicated. But one thing is, I don't think it's worth the wait for what I got.

Reviews.Author: Matt L.
Reviews.Content: A must for every Angelino. Roscoe's is a staple of Hollywood. I mistakenly assumed it was just a "black place". Completely Incorrect. It's a food place. The portions are huge. I got a 13, breast and waffle. The service was vey quick, very friendly, and ideal.  The breast is about twice the size of my fist, and the waffles are like a square foot. The waffles have some secret cinamon spice, that makes them unique and ever so tasty.  I love the grub here.  This is definitely an eat-then-take home place for me. The beers are a little expensive, $5 a bottle, and I hate having to valet, but when in Hollywood, what are you gonna do?It's a freaking winner!

Reviews.Author: Noel J.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, I was taken here by my friend Brad, and every time we were in there area we had to go back. This is not my best review seing that I have only ordered the same damn thing every time I go. I get I believe the number 12 or 13 (its been a while). Its the chicken breast with the large ass waffle. I cover it in hot sause and syrup and go to town. For desert I get the biscut and gravy. Then I cry becasue I am so full. So go there for sure on an empty stomach.I can only give it a 4 because it is probably the most un-healthy meal ever. But you know what? Some times you just have to say "Fuck it."

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: I think this place is a little overrated for their food. Their fried chicken was ok and the waffles seemed like ones that you and I could make at home with a standard waffle machine. The place is very ... authentic maybe? I think that's what people come for. And the concept.It was very confusing when we went because the whole place just looked closed even though it was open, and when you walk in everyone just stares at you as they eat their food and you wait a good 10 min for a waitress to come over only to tell you that you can sit wherever you want. When you get the food, it's hot, and it's just pretty standard in general, nothing really super special or spectacular. I guess now I can say I've been?

Reviews.Author: Em B.
Reviews.Content: My hubby and his friends tried to replicate Roscoe's one night by subsituting deep-fried turkey and frozen Eggo's for their famous chicken and waffles...yeeeeah...not so much.Back to my review. After an hour long wait, we were seated by our friendly waitress. It was tiny inside but cozy. We both got the Carol C. Special  (waffle + chicken breast) with a side of mac-n-cheese. The chicken was juicy, flavorful with crispy skin, the waffles were delicious with a hint of vanilla in them, and the mac-n-cheese was some of the best I've had. Lip-smackin' gooood!Definitely a must-try if you're in the Hollywood area!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany A.
Reviews.Content: Good grub!2 blocks away from Hollywood Blvd, so the area can get pretty busy.  We parked right across the street for 1 hour parking and were in and out of there with 7 minutes to spare!  There was no line and the food came out fast.  My husband and I each got the 1/4 chicken (asked for dark meat), 2 waffles and gravy on the side. Our friend got 1/2 chicken and had enough to take home and another friend got 1/4 chicken (white meat), a biscuit and grits.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  Didn't see if they have healthier options since I was there for their namesake.  Was tempted to try their Chicken chili since it said it was new, but was too full from what I already ordered. The location is smaller than their Long Beach location, but still a great spot.  :)

Reviews.Author: Andrea L.
Reviews.Content: OK, I freaking LOVE Roscoe's!   Nothing tastes better after a night out in Hollywood or West Hollywood or where ever you're at, than Roscoe's.  Don't be lazy end up at the Denny's across the street or worse, the Denny's on Sunset by the 101 fwy.  Go to Roscoe's!  Yes, there is a wait, but hey- it will give you and your crew a chance to sober up a little... think of the drive home.  Just saying.  The chicken from Roscoe's is spicy, crispy and delicious- even if you aren't drunk!  And the waffles are my favorite!  I don't say this lightly.   Pretty sure I've eaten at some very lovely brunch spots all over the country so I know what I'm talking about- trust.  The recipe for the chicken and waffle batter that are used here are exclusive to this franchise and are quite distinctive and delectable.  Roscoe's is very much a part of my Los Angeles repertoire.  When I lived in Hollywood, I would call in my order on Saturday mornings and drive down there to pick up my comfort food.  Sigh.  Those were good days...  If you can get here for breakfast, brunch, dinner, or just stumble in at the wee hours of the morning- please do.  Its awesome I promise!  xo

Reviews.Author: Adam T.
Reviews.Content: It is what you think it is.  Roscoes is the original and best chicken and waffles.  I have been to 4 out of 5 of their locations and they were all great.  My favorite is the Gower location though.  It is nice and small and feels a little more homestyle.  The service is always great.  Sometimes you can get a lady that is a little feisty, but that is just part of the experience.  Even if they snap at you for putting your elbows on the table they are still going to take care of you.  I usually prefer the Scoe's, 1/4 chicken with two waffles, and a side of hot water cornbread.  They have everything from greens and red beans, to giblets and livers.  I also suggest making your own waffle and chicken sandwich.  A little chicken, maybe some mac n cheese, throw in some hot sauce, drizzle a bit of syrup, and wrap it up in a waffle.  Done!

Reviews.Author: Nadia A.
Reviews.Content: I ate well that morning and so did all my friends but I give it a 3. I thought it was ok - the fried chicken was not exceptional like Kelsey And Kim in Atlantic City..... The waffles were not HOT when served it was warm - therefore it was not as appetizing as it would have been if it was nice and HOT!I ordered the half chicken and waffles with a side of salad - the rest if my friends either ordered wings or 1.4 chicken with waffles............. they were satisfied so I guess they would have given it 4 stars biut it really was a 3 for me - Happy Eating.....................

Reviews.Author: JayChan H.
Reviews.Content: You must must must try it. You will be hooked for life. I love the Pico/La Brea location 'cause Big Momma keeps ma elbows off da table!Chicken, waffles, greens and a Sunrise, please and thank you.I take all my out of town guests here after we do the shi-shi spots. The ONLY place they ask about on return trips is Roscoe'sAtkins freaks, Vegans or impatient people.......stay away, you will hate this place.

Reviews.Author: Anna S.
Reviews.Content: Last time I went here, it just didn't have the same luster as it used to. It's still OG so I give it props, but the price always seems overboard to me and their sides usually don't cut it.  The mac and cheese is always mediocre (in my experience) and the potatoes in gravy are a hit or miss depending on how fresh the batch is. I will always love their fried chicken and there is something about their syrup that is just addictive. I liked the renovations they did with the place, it is much less cramped and the flow seems better. My best memory of this place is the time we took some friends here for the first time and the waitress/waiter? (can't remember) dropped a huge ole ball of butter on my friend's khakis. That was funny. Everyone agreed that it felt like time was in slow motion as we all noticed the butter fall down from the plate. His meal was comped but the stain was priceless. I really encourage people to try some other places for their chicken and waffles and compare the price/taste/portion ratios. You may find something better. However, this place is open so late that who wouldn't think this place was the bomb at 2 am after a night of clubbing or a show at the house of blues or whatever you do in Hollywood.

Reviews.Author: Giovanni O.
Reviews.Content: It's a classic.I Ordered # 2 Scoe's: 1/4 chicken, two waffles, and gravy w/ onions.Can never go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Author: Timothy O.
Reviews.Content: I guess I haven't been to LA in some time. It was the day after the day after Thanksgiving, and I was headed north from San Diego. As I tried to beat the traffic, I thought, "You know what would be a great breakfast? Roscoe's." I had never been to the one in Hollywood, but it was right off the 101.I had also never been here during daylight hours, but that helped with the wait (none) and the parking (metered on the street). Now the atmosphere at this location seemed different than the ones in South LA. More of the servers were Mexican instead of African American. The large mural on the wall that bisects the two serving areas seemed to be from this space's former time as a union hall. But the menu was unchanged, and the food was still tasty.I'm puzzled by the people who complain about the chicken being dry or the waffles being plain. This is a soul food restaurant people. If the skin of the chicken is too dry, order it smothered or put some syrup on it. And they don't make Rooty Tooty Fresh and Fruity wafffles. It's chicken and waffles. Your plate will be beige. The food will be too high in cholesterol, but it will be exceedingly high in tastiness. That's why people come here.So chicken & waffles - they're not just for dinner anymore!

Reviews.Author: Xuan T.
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say it but... it's not the best fried chicken in the world.  It's not the best waffle in the world.  I know what I just said is considered "blasphemous" by the hard core fans.  Before you come after me with your torches and pitchforks, hear me out first.Individually... these food items are pretty good but not mind-blowing.  You know it's true.  However...with their powers combined, much like Captain Planet, they become a force to be reckoned with.  You're taste buds will explode and arteries will suffer the shock and awe that comes from all that fatty sugary goodness.Sometimes, I like to add mac n cheese and grits.  Once in a while I'll have some collard greens because that veg group has to be represented, right?  Then...wash it all down with their Arnold Palmer... it's the best I ever had.Good eats are to be had here.  But, I don't come often because I value my cardiovascular system.  I'm kinda funny that way.

Reviews.Author: Alre H.
Reviews.Content: Eat It OR Beat It?**EAT IT!!**Roscoe's is delicious but I believe it is over-hyped. When I first had Roscoe's I thought the idea of fried chicken and Waffles was a bit awkward, but the more I ate it, the more my taste buds adjusted. Fried Chicken:Tastes nothing special, breading is the usual. I thought Popeyes had better fried chicken. Though I will admit, the chicken was very fresh, juicy, and tender.Waffles: Very fluffy but again, nothing special. CONCLUSION:The food is overpriced, probably because of its popularity, but overall, I've had better especially in NYC in Harlem called, Amy Ruth's!!! But, to satisfy your curiousity, go ahead and try it out. Just be prepared to spend about $15 including tax and tip for fried chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Stephen D.
Reviews.Content: This location in particular is a fucking treat.The guy that works the door always has a fucking snazzy outfit on and will entertain you while you're waiting outside (whether he knows it or not) and yes, you will wait. Drop off one of the party to put your name in while the driver fights to find a spot, because parking blows ass.Once inside, enjoy all the bountiful fruits that Roscoe's has to offer. I still stand by my #13 with cheesy onion eggs, grits and a lemonade. It's hard to fuck with a good thing.Oh, and, take a minute to admire the art work... Priceless.

Reviews.Author: Elise R.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm mmmm mmmm. Some of the tastiest waffles in LA. I always order the Jeanne Jones omelet with a waffle. I enjoy this omelet because it tastes homemade and it is HUGE. The cheese tastes like Kraft singles (and I LOVE Kraft singles) and the chicken comes from the fried chicken they serve in other meals. On to the waffle...I love to let the butter soak in a little and then brush it off to the side. The syrup is delicious. The waffles are soft and cinnamon-y. I never have trouble finishing my food here. I also often enjoy the mac n cheese which is made with huge macaroni noodles and fresh cheese (not velveeta or other scary imitation cheese sauce). The sweet potato pie is also worth a try. Big slices of pie...mmmmm.....ok, now my stomach is grumbling....

Reviews.Author: Beverly Y.
Reviews.Content: I live nearby and never went to Roscoe's, but I finally decided to see what all that hype was about.Meh.I really wanted to love this place, but it didn't live up to the hype.  The chicken was pretty good, I can say that, but the waffles made me sad.  I've had better.  And the cornbread wasn't that good.  It was, dare I say, dry and flavorless.  Maybe I had a bad batch?I really want to like the place, so I will give it another shot.  I'll stray away from the claim to fame and try something else on the menu.  If not, I will ask Marie Calendar's to save me some of her cornbread.

Reviews.Author: Susy A.
Reviews.Content: I love me some Roscoe's.....Red Beans & rice, corn bread, chicken breast, mac & cheese, & sum dizam greens....and to drink an Eclipse. For those of you who have not tried an Eclipse (fruit punch, lemonade, & orange juice) get one it is a must. Does anybody know what kind of butter they serve you?  OMG it is freakin delicious.This place gets better & better every time I go. Since they have expanded their service was outstanding.  Our waiter was more then accomodating.  He took very good care of us.I dont think the food is as pricey as other people say it is and they give you huge servings....so definately worth the price.

Reviews.Author: Danny E.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is good but pricey for what it is, which is average fried chicken and decent waffles.  I personally make better corn bread, biscuits and gravy at home.  My mom said they need to work on their grits, not enough flavors she says.  And trust me my mom knows her grits.My advice, buy a pack of of beer or a couple bottles of your favorite wine.  Order a bucket of Churches or Popeye's, invite your friends over and enjoy a nice meal at home.

Reviews.Author: Julie E.
Reviews.Content: Carol C's special -- 1 breast, 1 waffle -- may be one of the most perfect, delectable, concoctions, inventions, innovations, etc. west of Harlem, Roscoe's origin.  I've only been to Roscoe's twice (once in Long Beach, once in Hollywood). Each time was a magical journey into the question of "was this meal worth taking time off my life?" And each time, the answer is a resounding YES.I'm not a fried chicken fiend, but the chicken here -- crispy, flavorful skin, juicy inside -- is delightfully deliciously damn-finger-lickin' awesome. I'm from Chicago and grew up with Harold's Chicken, and yes...Roscoe's is better than Harold's. (Don't hate me Chicagoans!) The waffle, with hints of cinnamon, perfects the chewy-too-crispy ratio that waffles should have, but rarely achieve. Homemade, hot biscuits and old school mac n' cheese round out the heart squeezing perfection that is Roscoe's. The best is to pour syrup and butter on everything and make the plate into a salty, sugary pile of awesome. My brother bought a t-shirt. That's the butter on my waffle.

Reviews.Author: TSquared S.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I'm an LA native and I love Roscoe's! Been to every location and it's always our first stop when we come to town. Favorite is the Pasadena location, Sunset is always too busy. I love Jeanne's Omelette and a waffle! No matter which location or what you order, the food is consistent and always delicious!

Reviews.Author: Tina N.
Reviews.Content: I got the 1/2 chix with two waffles which is good for two people. I like crispier waffles so I thought the waffles were so-so. The chicken was decent and nothing special. I also ordered smothered potatoes thinking it would be mashed potatoes but it was just chunks of potatoes smothered in gravy.

Reviews.Author: Ligaya S.
Reviews.Content: A late night savior. Fried chicken & waffles does help to coat a stomach filled of beer and alcohol. Since I'm closer to the LB hood, it's been quite some time that I have made it over to the Hollywood location. I was so thrilled to see the expansion of the restaurant. I'm accustomed to waiting in the long lines of this location and don't mind it since I know I'm going to eat my way through the place.  I was in shock when we were immediately seated even though it was past the midnight mark of long lines. I had an order of the buckwheat waffle and a thigh as a side, which really hit the spot. The chicken was finger lickin' good, tender and skin was crisp and oh so tasty. I then proceeded in drenching syrup on the buckwheat waffle and it was out of this world.I've tried chicken & waffles meals at other establishments in southern California and beyond, but Roscoe's definitely beats everyone, hands down. Everyone visiting LA must and I mean MUST visit here, it's a place that should be on everyone's LA eating itinerary!

Reviews.Author: Miss P.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, but hard on a sensitive stomach!!But you must experience this just once in your life.Fried chicken and waffles, cornbread, candied yams, and collard greens.Mmmm!!Busy every time I've ever gone.Very greasy!!

Reviews.Author: Harrison G.
Reviews.Content: (This first sentence of the review may sound racist, I apologize).  The moment you step into Roscoe's it's like stepping into the South.  You are immediately assaulted with smells of fried chicken and buttery syrup, noises of large groups of friends laughing, and a friendly, "Hello, how many people in your party?" from the nearest waiter.  You know that this is not your everyday LA restaurant.While I have never lived in the South, my brother went to school in Atlanta and I visited him several times.  I swear that the atmosphere in this place immediately reminds me of a mom and pop hold in the wall kitchen in that city where the fried chickens and biscuits are piled high and don't stop coming until you say so.Really, what could go wrong when you mix two incredibly greasy, unhealthy foods into one meal?  Very little, if anything.  The fried chicken is always crisp and juicy.  The waffles are never too thick or dry.  I rarely add butter to my waffles or pancakes, but it's not hard not to resist going overboard in this restaurant (for extra points, get your fried chicken smothered in gravy and/or dip it in the syrup and butter!).My only complaint is that I lived 22 years before eating here.

Reviews.Author: Patricia B.
Reviews.Content: MmmMm!!!! What an amazing combination..chicken & waffles. I ordered two pieces of chicken with a side of rice smothered in gravy & a biscuit. It was completely delicious. Although, I'm not a big fan of the rice (because I don't like pilaf rice..) but it was still tasty. The chicken was fried to perfection! Gravy was delicious with the chicken. The waffles were also good. SO good.Service was extremely slow but our server was nice. I think she forgot about us but I was so full I didn't really care much except for the time when we requested water and it wasn't brought to us..so we had to ask again. That was a tad bit annoying because I need to wash down all the food that I devoured, haha. Overall, the hype lives on..this places is delicious. Service sucked though.

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
