Reviews.Content: So out of all the restaurants in Hollywood, this was the place we HAD to try. My mom and my friend and I had just been through a very long taping of the Dr. Phil Show (no we were not IN the show...) and we were STARVING. Soul food? Yes please!My friend had the waffles and they looked and tasted awesome! They give you like 7 tablespoons of butter on top of them too. My mom and I both had fried chicken.I had the wings with eggs, grits, and a biscuit. The biscuit was good and fresh, but as it sat, it began to get stale...boo! The grits and eggs were okay but the chicken was extra delicious. The skin was extra crispy!I also had my mom's greens and they were also pretty tasty. Her mac and cheese was also VERY buttery!Overall this place is definitely a classic and I would recommend it to anyone with a breakfast/dinner craving.

Reviews.Author: Mari K.
Reviews.Content: I don't think I *need* to write a review... it was just sexcellent!We walked in and an old black gentleman in the corner yelled to the waitress, in a scatchy voice, "Put 'em at table 4!"I ordered a waffle, some fried chicken with collard greens, and mac & cheese.Listen, I lived in the south for a couple of years and this place was on par with some of that deliciousness I experienced in Virginia, South Carolina, and Louisiana. Magnifique!

Reviews.Author: Janet N.
Reviews.Content: Great place to stop by after the clubs, not to mention the convenience! Only thing is that everyone is thinking the same! So, going to grab chicken and waffles and a glass of sunrise at 2am wont happen till about 3am, lol. Been doin this for four years, now... Employees are always friendly and helpful, including the customers (high, high probability that everyone has had something to drink ;3 ). Great place. Horrible parking.

Reviews.Author: Shalini G.
Reviews.Content: i did it i did it! i finally went to Roscoe's! we ordered the 1/2 chicken w/ 2 wafflesand the daily special (2 thighs rice, gravy and a biscuit)mac n cheese sidegrits sidechicken batter is amazing! cooked so crispy and yumwaffles..eh ...they were waffles...how exciting can a plain waffle be?rice and gravy...good.biscuit...buttery but a bit too dense..no flakey'smac n cheese...so different from any i have ever tasted...but i really liked it!grits...mmm...just there...if it wasn't for the heap of melted butter it wouldn't have had any taste at alllooking forward to the new spot coming soon to the disneyland area!service was quick and friendly...bathrooms were clean!parking was easy (of course it was still only 11 am)oh and star sighting!

Reviews.Author: Sunny G.
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting for years to try Roscoe's. It was delicious and I will be backRating 1-5, 5 being the best(4) carol c special, breast and waffle:The chicken breast was a little dry which was disappointing but still great breading and flavor. Next time I'll get the a thigh. Waffles were yummy goodness the cinnamon was a great touch for added flavor. (4) Obama, with 3 wings and waffle: Great!

Reviews.Author: An N.
Reviews.Content: This time I got the Obama special, which was 3 chicken wings and you got to choose one of 3 sides, waffle, fries or a potato, and it had to be one of those 3. I really wanted mac 'n cheese but they said no. So I got french fries, which came out pretty undercooked. I mean there's fries like In 'n Out where it's not fully cooked but these were not like that at all. I didn't even touch my fries. The chicken wings seemed as if they had a light batter on it, it wasn't crispy enough.  Also, our server was never around when he needed to be, he never brought us what we would ask for, but we did see him when he brought the check even though we had to ask someone else for it after waiting thinking he'd come eventually.

Reviews.Author: Mallards R.
Reviews.Content: Crispy, juicy, sweet... So good! Chicken and waffles are delicious. Also tried the omelette with chicken, cheese and covered in chicken chili. It also comes with a waffle. Sounds like a strange combo but it was surprisingly so good and flavorful. It's a must try, along with the standard chicken and waffles, of course.

Reviews.Author: barry C.
Reviews.Content: Ahh...yes!  Fried chicken, waffles, grits, yams, biscuits, sweet tea, corn bread.  C'mon!  It don't get much better than this. I was thinking about all the "ethnic" restaurants in Los Angeles one day and I grew sad when I realized that black Americans (or African-Americans or Americans of African decent although I really dig the word Negroes.  Call me old fashion) don't have any place we can call our own.  But then I realized our place is Roscoe's.  But to be even more accurate this is one of the few "American" restaurants in this town.  You want food that will unify all the self-segregating ethnic groups?  Fried Chicken.  Waffles.  What else do you need?  Fuck the immigration office, you wanna test a person's Patriotism and love of this country take them to Roscoe's, order up some yard bird and sit back.  If they're not grinning ear to ear within 30 seconds, take said sad sack of poo poo to the Tom Bradley terminal or the Mexican or Canadian border and bid them adieu.And they just added a new wing!  Chicken.  Waffles.  What?

Reviews.Author: D D.
Reviews.Content: Kitsch, yes.  Cheap, yes.  Different, yes.  I am a Southerner and I have to say eating their greens reminded me of my grandmother's!!  Love the mac and cheese, fried chicken and greens.  Try it.  I never eat fried chicken, but if I am gonna, it will be here.  I loaded mine with hot sauce too...just the way they do in the South.  Nice to know you can still get comfort food in this land of healthy eats.We even had a guy outside trying to sell us stolen True Religion jeans on the street for $70.  I never see that in LA either.

Reviews.Author: mellani l.
Reviews.Content: So for the longest time I've always heard about the infamous Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles.  So while visiting a friend in LA we decided to come here for dinner. I was a little skeptical at first thinking "oh this place is hella hyped up, it's just gonna be whatever, I'm gonna end up paying $10 for a meal that's just okay" but oh no my friends, was I wrong. To my surprise the food here was unbelievably good. The chicken is cripsy on the outside, moist on the inside. The waffles were flavorful. But when you mix them together it's even better, I mean how can it not be, one delicious item plus another delicious item equals a ridiculously delicious dish. The place, however, is kind of small. The service was just all right, the valet guy was totally gross preying on out-of-town girls (really creepy). But above all I'd still come back. I'm actually a little jealous that there's none in the bay because I find myself craving for it. Damn you So-Cal!! I guess I'll just have to wait until my next visit to LA.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: This was my second time coming to Roscoe's.. the firs time we went to another one in LA... I was suprised that there wasn't a wait this time because the last time we came to Roscoe's there was a waitlist to get seated... When we first arrived we noticed there was actually Valet for Roscoe's.. but found parking in the front.. it was my friends first time here.. and they had the #1 with the quarter chicken and waffles mix... they liked it a lot... I had the Big Momma's special this time.. which was scrambled eggs with onions and cheese... their eggs are the BEST! It tasted so creamy and cheesy... it came with a side of potatoes and gravy which I could've passed up for something else instead.. I also ordered a side of mac n cheese which also could've been better... The service was timely and friendly.. If I ever make another trip down here I'll be sure to try something different on the menu..

Reviews.Author: Tyson T.
Reviews.Content: DEFINITELY,  a place to go in LA. Been here a couple of times.One day, my friends and i sat in a stuffed up car headed up to LA for a conference and had not eaten all day. We were all in bitchy moods and Roscoe's cured our anguish and filled every hole in our stomach. We were ecstatic after and each had a bottle of redline after.The  car ride back was much more enjoyable.Thank you roscoes, for combining waffles and fried chicken in such a wonderful way.

Reviews.Author: Liza N.
Reviews.Content: Delicious. Woulda never thought to put maple syrup, waffles, and fried chicken together ... except in some kind of inebriated state ... but I went for the gold and tried it ....12+ hours later I'm still food comatose. Wake me in a week.

Reviews.Author: Natalie O.
Reviews.Content: Great... I'm going to hear it from my Roscoe friends...  Sorry didn't enjoy it as much as I wish I did.  I wish this wasn't the last meal before heading back to the Bay!Ordered the 1/4 fried chicken and waffles... what do I think of the chicken?!  I like Popeyes better.  The waffles were not fluffy and was dry.Corn bread, what can I say... my 1 yr old thought it was a teething ring, she couldn't bite into it!  Sigh...Maybe I need to try a different location... :(

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get a table quickly at Blue Palms Brewhouse (awesome burgers) and were pressed for time to eat before the Social D show, so we went to Roscoe's as a spur of the moment Plan B (my first time).The service was slow initially.  It took a long time for our server get to our table to take our orders (I ordered the 1/4 chicken and waffles).  To be completely fair about the service, it was busy, and once our server got to us, she was right on top of it from then on.  It didn't take long for our food to hit the table.  A few bites later, all was forgiven.  I can't say I've ever had a better waffle.  As my buddy pointed out, a lot of times there isn't much to a waffle, but these waffles pack a punch.  The fried chicken was damn good, too.  Bring your appetite.  I was pretty hungry when I got there, but I had to tap out without finishing everything on my plate.  Will I be back for a rematch?  You bet your ass I will.

Reviews.Author: Joey N.
Reviews.Content: There's not many more good things to say that others haven't said already, so I'll just add that on this particular occasion, I was craving something simple & wasn't in the mood for heart attack city, aka "Herb's Smothered Special" so I opted for a simple bowl of chicken chili over a bed of steamed white rice with a leg/thigh side. It was the perfect size & just hit the spot without giving me the customary bloated & guilty complex I normally get when leaving Roscoe's hallowed halls. The chili itself is actually not half bad. It's definitely different from beef based chili and is somewhat lighter, however not that much as it is Roscoe's after all. ;)The chicken is the same as what you would get with the regular combos and plenty of people here on Yelp have already covered that so I'll not bore you with the details.If you're in the mood for a just right portion, then I recommend you to try it at least once with the piece of chicken on the side. (How many is gonna be your call) This is by no means going to satisfy someone really hungry as it is just a small bowl of chili & rice so, "Caveat Emptor" :)

Reviews.Author: Seena A.
Reviews.Content: Seeing Xzibit on my first trip here definitely made an impression... Anyway, getting to the FOOD!I love fried chicken. Yes, ok, so I can't eat it ALL THE TIME otherwise I'd be 200lbs heavier but it was my "fat day" so I obliged to my out-of-town friend's request to dine here.I've never been able to comprehend why having chicken and a waffle would be a good idea but since I ate them separately I guess I still don't get it. Either way. the waffle and the fried chicken were surprisingly both good. Normally at places that are so hyped like this, the food tends to fall short of expectations but the chicken was really moist and didn't leave grease on my hands. That actually made me feel better about downing a billion calories. My vegetarian friend who only had the waffle said that it was honestly the best waffle he's had so for you non-fried food or non-meat eaters, there's something here for you, too.Huge line here, which I'm assuming is always the case especially at the Hwood location so be ready to wait!

Reviews.Author: P H.
Reviews.Content: I think I could come here and eat their fried chicken and waffles all day long.I love their waffles .. it has a hint of cinnamon to it. &&their chicken is fried to perfection! Crispy outer layer and soft, moist meat! Just the way it should be.There's limited parking outside & the place wasn't too crowded in the evening.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: I always get #22 for the mac n cheese, collard greens, and cornbread because those sides are so dank with the mounds of gravy I drench my chicken in. Usually I go with another person so the other gets chicken and waffles and we just share all the sides. The waffles taste super bomb with the maple syrup AND the gravy. I think their gravy makes everything magical. That and a corona.This place had a wait but it goes by hella quick, especially for small party of 2.

Reviews.Author: Heather D.
Reviews.Content: The waffles and chicken oh my. They are as good as many write and rave about. The syrup is also good. It could be a heart attack but you know its very good. They staff there were very helpful. The only issue I had is that its a bit scary because there's lots of wierd people that go there. But who cares, if you get shot or stabbed outside you had a good meal.

Reviews.Author: Fanny C.
Reviews.Content: I cannot begin to describe how much I love this place. The first time I heard about this place, I was quite skeptic about the combination of fried chicken and waffles all on one plate. But I took my friend's word for it, and tried it. My first bite, it was love. The fried chicken is not your average Kentucky Fried Chicken. The pairing of the fried chicken, waffles, and the syrup (you cannot pass up the syrup), is extremely delicious. When you get the chicken, you HAVE to get it smothered with gravy. That's the best part.Doesn't matter which Roscoe's you visit, you'll always have a great time.

Reviews.Author: Janeen S.
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOOOOODNESS.... let me think of the yummyness again!..*pause*ahhh ok I'm good now.SO... for ALL the 8 years my sister has been living in L.A I haven't had the chance to eat at Roscoe's..... I'm always disappointed, but whatevs... I FINALLY tried it last week and it's as good as I thought it would be!!! (Can u tell I'm a happy camper now?)I had the platter with a chicken breast... greens... mac and cheese and hot watah corn bread and a side of waffle! whheewwwwwwww man... first of all our table was full.. then my tummy was full! I took my time eating... I took a piece of the chicken.. placed it on top of my waffle.. poured a bit of syrup on it..and went at it... then I felt my arteries clogged but HEY... I had a great moment! I WILL be coming back here to try out some new combos... oh yeah and guess who was sitting RIGHT next to us with 3 huge body guards and a hot hot chica??? AKON! (sorry I didnt know who he was .. my sister had to tell me and tell me which song he sings.. hee hehehehe):o) Props to Roscoe's ....

Reviews.Author: Rob W.
Reviews.Content: Sunday at 5pm and only a 30 minute wait. Got Scoe's #1 and loved it. The waffles definitely have a unique flavor that I like. The service was great and very friendly. Better than the Long Beach location I think.With over 400 reviews what can I really add? Just wanted to give them my 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: From looking at the reviews I guess I went on the wrong day.I had the two side orders of friend chicken legs and it was so nasty. I love fried chicken but this time the legs tasted like it had been fried again in 100 year old oil. So it did not taste good at all. A little pricey too.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa L.
Reviews.Content: Oh Sweet baby Jesus! Roscoes is the reason I am not going to live much passed the age of 55.  I eat it once a month (I can not justify it more than that!) But good lord, it is amazin! Open til 3, but if you're doign the late night thing, you should try and aim for sometime around 1 because once the bars get out, you might find yourself waiting for almost an hour.  YES! It's THAT good. Where to begin....?the Chicken.  It's finger lickin good. It's greasy. It's moist. It's delicious.  The Waffles: Also amazing. so fluffy and good.the Mac and Cheese: This is my absolute weakness. It's not too creamy. Not too salty.  It's just perfect.  Soooo good.The perfect bite: small piece of chicken with red rooster hot sauce on it. Small piece of waffle with syrup on it.  ...it sounds crazy, but don't knock it til you've tried it.GO GO GO GO GO !

Reviews.Author: Grant L.
Reviews.Content: A bit pricey for fried chicken and waffles, though I gotta tell ya, it slaked my craving for soul food. Being a white boy, you'd think much of this may be new to me. However, this saltine grew up in Texas, om nomming on fried chicken, biscuits, gravy, and everything in between for 23 years before coming to the land of organics and snooty frozen yogurt stands.Anywho, do yourself a favor, and mix as much chicken with as much waffle with as much tobasco as you can, and clean your plate cause this place is popular for a reason.If only it were a dollar or two cheaper.

Reviews.Author: Fanon P.
Reviews.Content: Took cuz here! I mean what's a visit to L.A.without hitting roscoes?? Lame-o I shoulda took him to the pico loacation! But this ones a lil cleaner i guess?I think the one on pico puts a little bit mire soul into the cooking though!! I ordered what I usually order from there 4 wings a waffle, smothered biscuit, cheese eggs&onions.. Best thing was the waffle, chicken wings were good but seemed like it was cooked in not so fresh grease. I love chicken skin and the skin had a funny taste. The gravy on my biscuit was really watered down! The eggs were lacking flavor as well! Everything needed salt to me? Anywho Cuzzo enjoyed his waffle I did too!  Still would go to pico instead!

Reviews.Author: Tishawn F.
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into this place you feel closed in like you're in some kind of boat and you're under water the way the windows are situated.I didn't like that part, that and the price. My classmates and i came here this afternoon after our finals and it was extremely busy with several groups at the tables around us.I guess that's to be expected on a Saturday. I promised myself no long reviews since people don't read them anyway so ill keep it short and sweet. THIS ISN'T A GREAT RESTAURANT FOR VEGETARIANS BUT THE WAFFLES ARE SOME OF THE BEST IVE EVER TASTED!! My classmates had the waffles and chicken combo and we all agreed the waffles were delicious.They both agreed that the chicken was the best..hint hint *reason for the 5 stars* I couldn't afford the rest of the stuff on the menu seeing as though i had to buy all of this ala cart, so like i said i settled for the 2 set of waffles for $7.50 and a glass of water! Everything was ok till we got ready to leave when they handed us the check and we wanted the waitress to separate it.They told us they didn't do that..We couldn't understand that but didn't make a really big deal out of the issue..That would have been nice though. I gave this place 4 stars because it's good at what it specializes in..Waffles. 1 star after this because my non vegetarian classmates kept talking about how much they loved the chicken..I guess it was good.Thats all i have to go off of is their words. But if still not sure about the chicken at least you know from me that the waffles are satisfying! I'd return again for the waffles that's for sure!

Reviews.Author: Derrick L.
Reviews.Content: There's no real point of telling you what we specifically ordered from here because it's all the same either way, just a different combination of chicken and waffles from person to person. The wait was only about 25 minutes and the staff were all really nice. The chicken is great! Fried chicken is...well fried chicken but the crust on the chicken was really good. It was crispy all around and not soggy in some areas and crisp in others like some places have. It's all nicely seasoned but the seasoning is not overwhelming. I think this is due to the fact that some people like to eat it with the syrup or hot sauce.  The waffles are different from what I thought they would be. They're actually a bit savory, which compliments the chicken really well too. Mac and Cheese was great! Not starchy or gritty like other places. Corn bread.....I wish I didn't order it as it was really dry. The gravy which some selections have smothered over the chicken, was a bit disappointing. There was a film that formed on the surface that was even impenetrable to dipping chicken in. I think there was too much flour in the roux when making it. We had to constantly stir it up with our forks to scoop onto our chicken. Overall, it was a great experience and it tasted great!

Reviews.Author: Rodene R.
Reviews.Content: Went here while I was meat eating,  always in groups, and always had a great time.This specific one is classic, its so landmark, you have to visit it at least once. Its everything that Snoop Dog has ever described it to be. I've seen so many hip hop entertainers in here, its sooo genius. Besides the old "southern" cabin style vibe, the waiters/waitresses are so cool, so like, old school cool, you'd be a jerk not to tip them well. The ones I've had are soooo NOT even the "this is just a side job actor type," they're the "I'm working my butt off here, hurry up n' order I've got mouths to feed kind including yours type." I definitely wouldn't say anything if they got my order wrong...its like eating at Grandma's or something.Anyway, they 3 from me, because its not so much about the actual food recipe, but its awesome because of the atmosphere, and presentation. Its ROSCOES - chicken & waffles - great combo. Also, must must order the sunny side up drink - nothing special, but all in fun.I like this small Roscoes, and there's the bigger one on Pico Blvd. Still haven't been to the Pasadena one, but I will once I start eating meat again.Chickn' Waffles man, hit it UP!

Reviews.Author: Lovey O.
Reviews.Content: How am I the only person who doesn't get the magic that is chicken and waffles?  Was there not enough crack to go around and I got the short end of the stick?  That's the only explanation.I had dinner with some new friends...Texans who've never had chicken and waffles together.  It was fun watching them order a lot thinking the portions were small, be blown away by the magic, then slumping against the walls as the food coma kicked in.  Otherwise, the experience was pretty lackluster, just like the first time I had this brand of fried chicken in Pasadena over a year ago.The friend and I split an order of chicken with gravy, waffles, grits, and mac and cheese. Chicken is better at Popeye's, waffles were soggy, grits tasted instant (John Besh has ruined grits for me, this didn't even compare), and their mac and cheese had me wishing I had the instant stuff from a box instead.We parked down Gower, waaay down Gower.  We needed the walk afterwards.  Parking is metered, it was free by the time we had dinner.

Reviews.Author: Destinie Z.
Reviews.Content: I came here after a looooong day and saved my appetite just so I could stuff my face with a heaping plate of fried chicken and waffles.I ordered the Carol special or something like that, it consisted of one fried chicken breast and one waffle. Forgot the name of what my boyfriend ordered but it was a HUGE fried chicken piece plus a wing, he got it smothered in gravy. And we ordered mac&cheese and potatoes smothered in gravy for sides.Food came quickly and looked really good and simple, there's nothing really fancy about this place besides the flat screens on the walls. Chicken was actually pretty dry for me and my boyfriend and we had to dip it in the gravy which was disappointing.. However the waffles were AMAZING! I'd go back just for waffles and I am not a breakfast food fan at all. Mac and cheese wasn't very good, I expect something creamy and gooey when I think of mac and cheese and this was more like a cottage cheese consistency, Potatoes with gravy were okay, nothing very special. All in all, go for the waffles they're great and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Maggie A.
Reviews.Content: So I don't even like fried chicken....well, I thought I didn't!  We were in Hollywood and decided to stop on in for some take out.  They were packed and there were a ton of people waiting to be seated, but the take out service was very fast and the staff is very friendly. The chicken was amazing, I just may like fried chicken now!  There are several other locations, and we were told they are not as busy as this one.  If you like fried chicken, you have to stop in here!

Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: I love their dark meat fried chicken!For breakfast to share amongst 3 people, we ordered:- Bowl of chicken chili over beans: I love chili so I was quite satisfied with the taste of the chili.- Smothered potatoes w/ gravy: A-OK- 1/2 chix prepared southern style, 2 waffles: We chose a mix of dark and white meat. There were 4 pieces of fried chicken. I really enjoyed the dark meat chicken. I don't really care for waffles in general, so I only ate 1/4 of the waffle and found the waffle to be average/soggy. I was disappointed the chicken & waffles came out cold/warm, not hot.Overall, I enjoyed the sides and the fried chicken so much that I will definitely return!

Reviews.Author: Mary W.
Reviews.Content: Country boy (3 wings and a waffle) is my favorite, Grits with butter and sugar (some people like salt), and the sunrise drink orange juice and lemonade. I personally liked this place before when it was just one room and like 10 tables. But the wait was ridiculous before! I try not to come here anymore when i'm drunk on the weekends after clubbing because I gained a few pounds that way!

Reviews.Author: Brooklynn T.
Reviews.Content: I mean, what's not to love.  The smell of the Roscoe's waffle alone is enough for my eyes to well up now and then.There is nothing like dipping Roscoe's fried chicken in Red Rooster hot sauce.  Nothing.  You could stop there, but you would be missing out on greens, mac & cheese, biscuits & gravy, sweet potato pie, etc. The servers are always quick and courteous. They have President Obama paraphernalia all over.  I mean, really, what's not to love.

Reviews.Author: Jon W.
Reviews.Content: Who's the genius that thought of putting CHICKEN AND WAFFLES together? But DAMN, it WORKED.The combo is pretty damn good as odd as it sounds. Syrup on fried chicken works. Just like chicken & beer. Anything with fried chicken works.

Reviews.Author: Kalina K.
Reviews.Content: I guess this is as close to down-home soul food as it gets in LA.  But that's okay, because I know absolutely nothing about soul food, except that I love it all.If chicken & waffles sounds wrong to you, you have no idea--you just don't know!!What a delicious combination.  Sure, there are other things on the menu, but do you go to a steak restaurant to eat their chicken alfredo?  (answer's supposed to be "no")Good for breakfast, good for lunch.  You shouldn't be eating it for dinner, but it's good for that, too.  I find that it's the best during the drunken late-night, early-morning hours.I actually usually don't really like fried chicken, but I'll eat & enjoy it here--so that should tell you something!

Reviews.Author: Laura M.
Reviews.Content: Best Waffles I have ever had!Our waiter was great and sang to us - we loved him!!Enough said. Just go!

Reviews.Author: jay d.
Reviews.Content: I agree with some peoples reviews about this place. Its a little over-rated but to me, the fried chicken tastes better than KFC. The waffles are delicous! I even dip my chicken in the syrup! This is the only place you'll see me putting pepper and hot sauce on my waffles.. It just seems to go with the crazy theme of chicken and waffles.I always try to make it here everytime im in the Hollywood area.. Its so different from the foods we have in the bay area.

Reviews.Author: Sassy o.
Reviews.Content: Good Chicken in there, im a chicken killer. love to eat a chicken, LoL....  i went to Roscoe for my breatfast on my first time morning in LA, it was wonderful! u know what, i didnt have nice chicken in US, also im missing HK's chicken. HK's chicken is fresh and Yummy. But... Thank God, lets me found out Roscoe. i had YummY chicken and made my day  Nice too. i Love LA.... why those foods in LA, not FAIR :P LoL Stay KooL RoscoeChickenChicken

Reviews.Author: Timothy N.
Reviews.Content: I love their fried chicken.The grits taste nasty but I think you can't prepare good grits so I can't blame the restaurant.Sometimes they put too much gravy over the chicken and it just becomes rather soggy after a while but if you eat it fresh it should be good.I really like this place.  The chicken is crispy and tender.  I want to come back again the next time I'm in LA.

Reviews.Author: Rob K.
Reviews.Content: As a former New Yorker, almost every time myself or my friends are hungry and we're pooling ideas, Roscoe's comes up. Everyone pauses for a second with a "mmmm" or a glossy look in their eyes. I've only been here a handful of times since I've beein in L.A. (3 years) and I've had different, but pleasant experiences each time. Now, I'm not good as some of my friends who are fellow yelpers in naming specific menu items, but I'm sure any variation of the chicken & waffle combination is good. I, on the other hand, have a problem with sweet and salty together,  (I hate Mcgriddles), so I usually eat the chicken first and use the sweet syrupy waffles, as a desert item. Another time I've been there, I order the mac & cheese... BOMB! It was so good, I wish it would've been called Roscoe's Chicken & Mac & Cheese.I'll end this one here, I'm getting that craving again...Peace, food and...

Reviews.Author: Samantha G.
Reviews.Content: I was 100% prepared to be less than impressed with Roscoe's, but I have to say my experience actually lived up to the tremendous hype!I knew to expect a line, but even when we arrived during standard lunch time (12:30ish), our party of 2 was seated only a minute after we put our name on the list. Our server was totally friendly and helpful and came by to check on us multiple times. I got the #1 (quarter chicken, mixed white & dark meat with 2 waffles) and a side of mac and cheese. Our food came out really fast and it was way better than I expected.The fried part of the chicken was super crispy, and salty but not too salty. The meat (even the white meat) was super moist and flavorful. It is the third-best fried chicken I've had, after my great-grandma's and my grandma's. The waffle, even though it was softer than I generally like my waffles, was a great foil to the chicken and even if you're one of those people who doesn't want one thing on your plate to touch another thing on your plate, you gotta try a big bite with a little bit of everything (chicken, waffle, butter, syrup...and hot sauce :D), just to say you did. You'll probably like it, promise. The mac and cheese reminded me of the m&c from Luby's, a childhood favorite restaurant of mine that has what I consider the ULTIMATE mac & cheese. Revel in the wonderfully artificial-tasting "cheese product" while you still can, people. I've been told to come back for the omelette/waffle combo, which sounds...intriguing. I do plan to come back, but it'll take a while to recover from the calorie bomb that is fried food on top of fried food with butter and syrup and hot sauce with a side of carbs and fat. mmmmm.

Reviews.Author: Zara O.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best waffles I have ever had. Chicken was good but it's hard to top my mom's homemade fried chicken.

Reviews.Author: Andria S.
Reviews.Content: I have heard so much about Roscoe's living in Southern California all my life, so I thought I would give it a try.  The service was quite awful.  The waitress did not ask for our drink order until we were seated for about 20 minutes and was very rude when we asked what she recommends.  Of course, we ordered the chicken and waffles.  It was good. The waffles were yummy, and the chicken was okay.  It was an interesting and delicious combo, but it was not as great as people hyped.  It was definitely an experience, but I can't say that I would return again.

Reviews.Author: Hoang N.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a "soul food" type of girl. Fried chicken, gravy, mac and cheese. EEK! However, after two decades of hearing about this place... it was my turn to try it out. Yes, it was good but it is overpriced and well.... it's just fried chicken and its just a waffle.My advice: Definitely worth the experience . A must-do

Reviews.Author: Nancy A.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is good but I wouldn't say it's the best. I personally like the waffle more than the chicken. The chicken seemed overcooked. But I do recommend going there once for the experience.

Reviews.Author: Ani P.
Reviews.Content: "How can you NOT eat chicken with waffles," said a friend and a recent Roscoe's-a-holic.  There can't possibly be a more succulent and juicy fried chicken.  Finger lickin' good.  I have to remove the skin b/c it's dusted with flour and I have a wheat allergy. But even without that crispy skin, the chicken is cooked to perfection.  No need for any type of sauce and this is coming from a girl who likes to dunk her chicken like crazy in BBQ sauce.  The grits come smothered in butter and I then drizzle it with maple syrup.  This place is ghetto-fabulous.  A famous joint in L.A.  Grease me up baby!

Reviews.Author: Michael U.
Reviews.Content: Arriving early in the afternoon after a nonstop from Detroit to LA, my mother and I loaded up the rental car and feeling quite famished made our way to Roscoe's with our baggage still in the car.  Myself being a bit of a tech-nerd (camera, phone, laptop, psp, mp3 player all in tow) I was somewhat tentative to park at the $0.25 meter, but thankfully all was well.  Tiny, dirty, and not a single other Caucasian face in the crowd, $25.00 netted us some Louisiana Style Double Fried chicken Breasts, Corn Bread, Sweet Ta To Pie, Mac n' Cheese, and WAFFLES.  Snoop, Funk Master Flash, and some old NWA played on an old boombox behind the bar and the staff was incredibly friendly, fast, and helpful.  I don't normally eat "comfort food," but I have to admit the stuff was amazing and the environment was actually quite comfortable.  While it may not be the "best" food, or even the best soulfood (hey, I grew up in Toledo, Detroit was less than 1 hour away) this place is DEFINITELY worth the trip just for the novelty compared to the normal 'dining scene' in Los Angeles.  GREAT cornbread.

Reviews.Author: Nina N.
Reviews.Content: PROS:1. It's kinda cool to eat soul food in L.A. (Random: Tony Rock joked at the Comedy Union how Roscoe's should give priority seating to black people. He's Chris Rock's lil brother and he's hilarious too)2. Food comes out fast3. No Olive Garden treatment here! No annoying suck up waiters. They are to the point, honest, and they get what you want. CONS:1. Pricey (so now, I get some Eggo's waffles and maple syrup from Ralphs, and chicken from KFC. It's way more for your dollar and probably tastes better too!)2. Chicken is small compared to KFC (aka less meat to eat)3. The candied yams are TOOO sweet. The chicken and waffles are seriously not anything to rave about.

Reviews.Author: Shirley H.
Reviews.Content: Went to this place 3 times and got in twice. The first time I went, it was 10 at night and the wait was at least 45 min. Since there were 4 of us, we decided to go to Denny's down the street since we were starving. The second time I came, it was for a friend's birthday. We had to wait 30 minutes and was entertained by the valet outside. I ordered chicken and waffles and a side of corn bread. I was expecting the corn bread to be AMAZING and was totalllllly bummed that it tasted like cardboard. It was soooo utterly dry, it almost ruined the whole meal. The chicken was ok and the waffle was a little bit better.However, my second visit turned out to be much better. I'm not sure if it was cause I was hungry, but the chicken and waffles were much better the second time around. I'll definitely be going back...and maybe try something new...but that's highly doubtful. ^_^

Reviews.Author: Danster L.
Reviews.Content: I love fried chicken and waffles. It might sound like a novelty but ever since my friend Annie took me to try Roscoe's a few years ago, I have always been in love with Roscoe's. Except for the bad service and ridiculously long wait at the Long Beach location. This location however has people wait outside rather than inside so it keeps the hungry patrons and the actual people eating separate. There is a security guard who stands outside and calls you in when you're table is ready. Service is way much better here than other locations and the fried chicken is definitely big and juicy. I had no complaints with mine which was the fried chicken breast which I believe is the Carol C. special I think? Other cool things about this place is all the frame photos of celebrities with autographs. Man, they have a huge following at this location. Good times and good hand lickin' chicken!

Reviews.Author: Celeste M.
Reviews.Content: So, I've heard of Roscoe's for years and my friend decided to take me here while I was visiting LA. The staff was nice and didn't rush you too much.  There were a lot of options on the menu.  I decided to go with of course, chicken and waffles.  I thought the food was okay and it was definitely worth going to.  If I lived in LA, maybe it would become a staple for me but I'm not really sure.I'd say it's definitely worth going to, at least once, to see if you like it.  I must admit that I'm a northeastern girl, and so part of me does not understand putting chicken and waffles together.

Reviews.Author: Bryan W.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the half-chicken with two waffles.Steps to enjoy:1) butter waffles2) strip fried chicken off bone and place on top of waffles3) pour syrup over chicken & waffles4) add hot sauce provided to personal taste5) begin eatingThese are the best waffles I've had. Way better than typical Belgian waffles you get at diner's. They not as light and insubstantial as Belgian waffles. They stick to your ribs.

Reviews.Author: Erin B.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to try chicken & waffles. And after a taping of "The Price is   Right" where, sadly, we did not win a brand new car! but did get Drew Carey's explicit instructions to go to Roscoe's NOW we were happy to oblige.We actually found free parking and there was no line- the only explanation is that the gods were with us. We entered thru the door with open hours on it but were a bit confused to enter an empty room & have an older gentlemen greet us from around the corner. We were seated, coffee'd, & ordered in 15 min flat. Amazing considering the plethora of options calling our name.My first experience with " chix & waffles" met my breakfast wet dream. Sweet & savory- this is a perfect meal.I already have a feeling it is going to be difficult to impossible to replicate this experience. The dim light & wood panelling, smiling & proficient waitress, lightening fast service, and sweet, heavenly, treats of waffle & chix are truly a gift.

Reviews.Author: Audrey C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Roscoe's on Pico before and I think this one is a little lacking or average in comparison. There was no wait but te service was definitely not as good as the other location. It took forever for a waitress to notice we hadn't ordered and when she came, we each had to repeat our orders multiple times.The food arrived timely though. It was all pretty good. I got number 19, a thigh, leg, biscuit, and rice smothered in gravy. Definitely filled me up with some good comfort food. Other than the mediocre service that day, the food was pretty good, but nothing extraordinary. I probably wouldn't drive that far just for chicken and waffles though. Parking is difficult because there is no lot. There is street parking but there are time restrictions so watch out to make sure you don't get towed!

Reviews.Author: Laurie W.
Reviews.Content: OMG chicken and waffles....WHAT THE HELL....So i have been always told about roscoes and how amazing it is and blah blah blah...but to think...chicken and waffles...what the...am i suppose to eat them together?!!? with the syrup....no thanks keep my sweets with sweet and savory with savoryBut fine! we're in LA...might as well right.  Got here and there were people waiting but they seated us cause we only had 2 people.  Service was a little long but its understandable...its sunday morning and there were A WHOLE LOTTA people.If you're here and u dont do chicken and waffles....iono what to say but WTH are you thinking!?!?!  I did the chicken breast with waffles....OMG the chicken...to die for....im dying right now thinking why cant i have any...and im literally saying that...my mouth justt watered a bit =PThe fried part of the chicken doesnt feel heavy like you need to run for 3 hours to get rid of the fat and it's crispy but not to the point where you can chip a tooth, its flavor is like dancing all over, its peppery and salty and just a bit of spice..tiny bit....and the chicken...lorddd it is super moist! and they did something cause i taste the same flavor as i did with the skin and i just dont know what to do anymore if i cant have it ever again!The waffle...light and fluffy on the inside and just a bit crunchy on the outside...its a pretty big size too...combine with teh chicken...it goes well but its not like WOW i gotta do this everytime, i like them separately but they do mesh well togetherPlease come to me roscoe's...i'll be your best friend forever!

Reviews.Author: Amber L.
Reviews.Content: 5 STARS!!!!Everything that I'd heard, came true for me in Roscoe's.  I left on a cloud.There was a wait on the Tuesday night I went but the anticipation made it pass quickly.  The inside of the restaurant feels like not much has changed since this original location opened for business.  And that's alright.   Tables, chairs, floors were clean, as was the women's bathroom.  It was very homey all around and my group of 7 was very comfortable.  Our waitress wasn't there to make friends but she did her job decently enough.Now onto the food!One of the biggest juiciest breasts of fried chicken I've ever had and the wing was falling off the bone.  Simple seasoning and flavor that needed nothing else.  Golden crispy skin.  My chicken wasn't oily and that's a feat when it comes to fried chicken!The waffle was huge.  It's very thick but light - far from heavy or dense.  I could taste the cinnamon and nutmeg coming through.  It was spongy so if you like to cover your waffle with syrup like I do, you might need to ask for more syrup because the waffle just sops it right up.  That combination of fried chicken and a waffle.......  Magnifique, baby!  Mmmmm mmmmm good!!!Lemonade was pretty good albeit a tad sweet.  I can't imagine it was as homemade as I was led to believe.The prices are great!  I think my meal and drink were $13 before tax and tip.  There are other options on the menu but as I'd been telling everybody who would listen for a month, I came for the chicken and waffles.  I didn't need or want anything else!Roscoe's was everything that I'd heard it was.  No piece of disappointment whatsoever was had in my meal there.  Los Angeles is decent and all but Roscoe's is what'll really pull me back for a return visit in the future!!!

Reviews.Author: Julie N.
Reviews.Content: Came here a couple time for the chicken and waffle. my brothers and i each got 1/4 chickens and waffles which comes with 2 chickens and 2 waffles. it was filling but it was yummy!! it's one of your comfort food that get your soul after you eat it. This place is casual where you can have lunch or dinner with your family and friends. This location is in Hollywood, you can explore Hollywood after your meal. I would come here again the next time i visit LA again,

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: From the megaphones calling you in, to the overpriced, gravy-soaked food...to the waiter being a bit of a dick [albeit good-looking...still not forgiven!!], and finding out you have to go to the ATM because they won't split a bill more than 2 ways at a table of 6 people...I don't think I will ever get the hype of Roscoe's.  I'm all for dive-y joints, but this was just too much.Everything is really, really salty.  I mean SALTY.  The greens?  I think the ratio of salt:food is a good 8:2.  The only good thing was knowing that Ren & Stimpy was mostly created in that space.  For that, you get 2 stars, Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Theresa B.
Reviews.Content: Last time I had Roscoe's was about 9 years ago. We were seniors in high school and we visited the one off Pico.  I ordered the Carol special, one succulent breast with 1 waffle and it was perfect!! Mmm...i love waffles, pancakes, flapjacks, hotcakes...whatever you wanna call..i love them! These were so good, I was sad that I couldn't finish all of it!Would love to come back!! Btw, there is a Red Ribbon bakery in the plaza next door for all you dessert fiends!

Reviews.Author: Dana G.
Reviews.Content: A friend brought me here to test Roscoes against Strouds in Kansas City.  Not fair.Roscoes has multiple locations and after all, comparing fried chicken restaurants, is like comparing grandma's.  They're not the same, but life is made better by each.I don't get the waffle thing, nor the onions in the gravy, but I ate the stuff up, without a complaint, other than being stuffed.  Their chicken is really scrumptuous, with a lite coating of seasoned crust and prepared perfectly.  It is a very good thing that I live 1400 miles from the nearest Roscoes.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle H.
Reviews.Content: This place used to be the bomb, but now the food is just overpriced (but it's still tasty).  There are better chicken joints in Cali, they just aren't in Hollywood. Standing in line for chicken at 1 am just isn't my bag anymore I guess. If they lowered their prices back to what they used to be, it would easily get 5 stars, if they can't do that, at the very least add an extra room with all the dough they are raking in!

Reviews.Author: Alice C.
Reviews.Content: As you can see, everyone is raving about Chicken and waffles.I think you can get it at any Roscoe's and it will be just as good.  The reason I give this one on Gower, 3 stars, is because of the venue.  Not much room for a lot of people ... when I say it's small ... I mean it.  Have 5 ppl step inside and it's already considered, "too crowded."  There aren't visible signs to find this place unless you've been here before.  As you walk in, you're not sure if it's a run down house or an abandoned building.  The door is wood and looks like it's almost going to fall apart.  Don't get me wrong, I love their food and I think the food is consistently good at other locations, but this location sucks ass when it comes to comfortable dining and easy access.You REALLY have to search for this spot.I always order their #6:  3 wings and a waffle.  mmmm ...

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: As parking is only available in the form of "metered," these street stables will most likely already have cars parked in their dens so you just might find yourself hurrying up and down the road playing musical chairs for a while. Apparently 7 checks were listed under the "Private Lot" box - where is this lot? I must know!Stepping through the entryway, I stepped foward to ask the patron for a table of 5. He promptly ignored me, walked to the first black person he saw (it was either my little brother Wes, or my buddy Darrell - I forget) and asked him "How many?" Whatever, I still love havin' my brother from another mother.The service was undeniably sharp- smiles and promptness were consistent and offered in heavy doses. The chicken, moist, the waffles, golden, and my taste buds, .. I think they were crying, no scratch that, they just watered a lot.They also had the perfect hot sauce; don't expect the best, but one that balances PERFECTLY with the chicken. With just the right amount of vinegar and spice, I ended up repeatedly shaking the bottle up-side-down and thoroughly enjoying this moment.The cornbread, to my supreme dismay(!!!) tasted very similar to that of which I ate in grade school, and school food doesn't exactly win any awards. It was, however, a busy night so obviously the cooks were rushed.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia N.
Reviews.Content: Came here once again a couple weeks ago while I was down in LA. Brought some newbies and had them try it for the first time as well. We drove from Anaheim to LA. Everyone was hungry, cranky from the drive, and tired from the heat.... But once our meals came out and we all started eating, all of a sudden energy came back into the group and everyne was happy again! I loved it. Great food like last time, and even better experience this time because it livened up all my friends. I had gotten my own meal last time, but it was just WAY too much. So my boyfriend and I shared this time, and it was PERFECT. We were both full and didn't have to bring any home as leftovers. And I don't know if it's just me or not, but the chicken tasted better this time too! I'm definitely going to bring more friends down here next time.P.S. I'M STILL IN LOVE WITH THEIR WAFFLES (:

Reviews.Author: Panzer M.
Reviews.Content: A must every time we come to LA!

Reviews.Author: Elaine M.
Reviews.Content: When I was in LA over the summer, my boyfriend's cousin and his cousin's roommate took us to Roscoe's, mentioning that it is a place referenced in a lot of movies and is known for its chicken and waffles.I thought: Chicken and waffles? That's a strange combination, if I've ever heard, but I'm all for trying out new things and being open-minded.I passed out on the car ride there (that 3 hour jet lag from the east coast was catching up with me!) and when I awoke and we walked in, the place was BUMPIN' (yes, I said "bumpin'"...and no, that's not an east coast thing, but rather, it's an "I chuckle like an old person trying to be cool when I hear that word and we can all use a good chuckle now and then" thing). I surmised that the presence of many patrons might just translate into this whole chicken and waffles thing being pretty good after all.YUP. Turns out it is. Buttery, greasy, perfect.Chicken and waffles. Whoever thought that one up is a freaking GENIUS.

Reviews.Author: Joanne E.
Reviews.Content: It was good, but I'm not quite sure what the buzz is all about...I had the Carole Special and it was definitely delicious.  The chicken is Southern Fried goodness and extremely tender and juicy which was definitely to die for.  Was it something I'd call home about hmmm...not quite sure.We walked up the door, and mind you my friend and I have never been here before, and I was kinda confused with the bouncer and the line, I didn't know if it was a club inside or what not, so of course seeing a bouncer my friend busts out her ID and he says, "It's not necessary."  Is it just L.A?  Do people come to Roscoe's dressed in Yellow and Hot Pink Satin tube top dresses and their gold open toe pumps?  Shit I had no idea there was a dress code...hahahah next time I go I'll try to be a bit more hollywood and die my hair blonde instead of pink and blue. Anyway, back to the food and service.  IT was great the guy who served us reminded me of a mini Dave Chapelle.  He was funny as hell and patient and very attentive.  I loved the fact that he said the F-word several times, I felt right at home and the compliments he gave us gave me an ego boost especially after the feeling I felt standing around the Hollywood Barbies outside of the establishment.The next time I go to L.A. I definitely have to bring my hubby, he can for sure clean house and eat everything on the menu at this place.

Reviews.Author: Drea B.
Reviews.Content: Folks, try the OBAMA! It's new on the menu :D Do not, I repeat, DO NOT order a side salad here. Seriously, though. WHO orders a side salad at Roscoe's? I'm talking to you, New England tourist! Order chicken and waffles, folks. It's the patriotic thing to do. Order the mac & cheese, too! Oh, and the biscuits and gravy, too. Duh.Expect  a LONG wait. At least 30-45 minutes. No need to fret, though. There is a liquor store adjacent to Roscoe's! You can buy some hot cheetos and eat them with your friends as you wait in the sweltering heat. Roscoe's is a staple of LA. This specific location is a touristy, popular spot. It's a fun, lively atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Keoni U.
Reviews.Content: I heard about this joint from friends and of course my favorite movie Rush Hour 1. I came here on a Sunday afternoon. The line was outside the restaurant and the wait was 30 minutes. But what do you expect? This is the famous Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles!!!My wife and I ordered the same plate which was 2 pieces of chicken and 2 waffles. The chicken was very juicy and flavorable. And the waffles were on hit with the butter and the syrup. I've always wondered about this combination but this is DAMN GOOD!!! I wish we had one up here at NorCal. =(

Reviews.Author: Jenn N.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.  Disappointing.  What happened to Southern hospitality?  Loved the waffles.Pros: It's a destination.  Supposedly.  The waffles.Cons: Prices, dry chicken, uneven service, limited menuThis is a rare occasion where I had such an uneven experience that I highly doubt that I will return.  For many years, I had been wanting to go to Roscoe's.  Not only because it's a landmark and LA destination, but because Southern food has always been one of my favorites.  The quintessential home-cooked food. And the best combination of fried chicken and waffles!So my boyfriend and I arrived after a long drive from the Bay Area around 9 pm.  Parking is ample on the street, although it doesn't seem generally safe.  He had parked right front of the restaurant (which unfortunately has no windows so you can't watch your car).  Unfortunately, we had filled the backseat and trunk with tons of stuff (my fault for not realizing that Roscoe's is not in the best 'hood).  And checking on the car after 15 minutes in the restaurant, he saw several sketchy people looking inside his car.  He moved the car to a nearby brightly lit parking lot for safety.During this time though, our server had not even come over (even before he left to check on the car).  I already knew what I wanted and what my boyfriend wanted.  Finally, I ordered for the both of us...and the dishes came quickly.  He got the Lord Harvey (chicken lathered with gravy with a biscuit and grits) and I got Scoe's #1 (fried chicken with waffles).  I also got Linda's delight a mix of iced tea and freshly squeezed lemonade.The waffles were...amazing.  With two cups of syrup and the right amount of butter.The chicken?  Disappointing.  Perhaps I had ordered white meat, but it was dry and somewhat unseasoned.  I was given a huge uncut breast with multiple bones and a mini wing.  It seemed like they could have at least split the uncut breast in two pieces.The drink was as expected.  And it did taste fresh-squeezed!The server did check on us once while we ate.As we were hungry, we finished in 10 minutes.  Our waters were unfilled the entire time.  The table behind us got their check way before they had finished eating, which I consider a faux pas (it should either come after clearly finishing), but they waited nearly 20 minutes with a credit card in hand.  And worse of all, they were just sitting across from the kitchen/bar area.  Eventually one of them got up to find a server. (No signs for pay up front.)The bf and I waited around politely for nearly 20 minutes for the check...and finally flagging down our server (who somehow disappeared).I walked out of Roscoe's feeling that I had accomplished seeing a LA landmark...but something that amounted to nothing and a negative feeling overall.

Reviews.Author: Luân N.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a place to try once. The service is impeccable and everyone is really friendly.Kind of unsettling that there is a security guard standing next to the doorway, but after we chatted with him for a bit, we felt pretty comfortable.We were seated within 15 minutes on Father's Day Sunday at around 2pm. Surprisingly quick, after reading stories about how long it takes to get in. We ordered the Scoe's 1/4 platter, and the Country Boy Meal (Chicken wings w/ Potato Salad). I was expecting a ton of food, but I'm glad it wasn't after seeing the huge slabs of butter on the stack of 2 waffles. A heart attack waiting to happen, I'm sure! We didn't get our waters right away, but our waitress promptly apologized and brought them to us immediately.I thought the chicken was really juicy with nice spices in the batter. Dipped in the Rooster's Louisiana hot sauce made it even better. I also thought the waffles were really good. The potato salad with my fiancee's meal was also pretty good. It definitely reminded me of my mom's potato salad. How a Vietnamese woman learned to make Potato Salad like this restaurant is beyond me!It was an interesting experience, but I don't want to die early, so I think I will refrain from coming back here again. The food does make you feel like throwing up afterwards, once you realize how bad it is for you.

Reviews.Author: Val M.
Reviews.Content: I am an experience Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles diner. However, this was my first time at the Gower location. Every time that I have tried to come here in the past (at 2am after dancing in Hollywood of course) it's been too packed and I sadly walk across the street to Denny's. My friends only bday wish was to go to Roscoe's after dancing at Cabana Club. We arrived at the perfect time before the club "let out" and our party of 7 was promptly seated. Service was just okay.... we waited a while for our bill and we had to actually ask for it, after many attempts to get our waitresses attention. I ordered my usual, a #9 - Country Boy - 3 wings and 1 waffle. I LOVE Roscoe's waffles...usually. This time it was pretty tough and there wasn't enough butter or syrup in the world to make it better. I was disappointed. The other food around the table looked good, but tasted average as well. I'm usually more lenient with my reviews if I am eating somewhere after 2am because ... who wants to be anywhere besides their own bed after 2am and that includes the staff of these eating establishments. So, Roscoe's I will be back and I expect better next time.

Reviews.Author: Linda C.
Reviews.Content: Finally got to try this place and I have to say, the chicken is pretty damn good! Too bad I can't say the same for the rest of the food. The manager and staff here are really friendly. They gave me a little background on the owner and this particular location.- Fried Chicken: must try! crispy seasoned skin, tender, juicy meat- Waffle: ok, too much butter- Mac & Cheese: i've had better, thick, lacked flavor- Collard Greens: super salty- Cornbread: very dry

Reviews.Author: Gisselle H.
Reviews.Content: The service was very fast. I give this place  a 3.5 . The chicken was soooo tasty and the waffles were okay, but nothing made the waffles stick out or memorable to me. The waffles are kind of small compared to the waffle house, and to me, the best waffles come from the Waffle House in Florida. Cons: For fried chicken joint, it's a bit pricey, it's like four dollars for an extra piece of chicken. Minus well go to Popeye's

Reviews.Author: SirDoyle D.
Reviews.Content: Food was decent, no complaints there. Service was terrible! Place was dirty, and there was more flys in this place than in your grandma kitchen! I've been coming to this place for years and have watched it go down hill. Hope changes are made to bring it back to its iconic level

Reviews.Author: Melissa J.
Reviews.Content: What is not to love about eating here. The food is amazing.  I did find this location faster then Pasadena. Which I loved. Learned an amazing taste bud treat from my Sis Ang. Get chicken and waffles with a side of gravy. Just too much excitement right there.

Reviews.Author: Bernie S.
Reviews.Content: The enchantment is lost on me. I've been here probably half a dozen times, but I only go because the company I'm with wants to go. I see it as a LONG wait for high priced fried chicken and waffles that is maybe a smidge better tasting than average fried chicken (or waffles). Oh and for the health conscious... NOT the place to go :PChicken salad is downright scary. Seems like it was made from the left over crap that didn't go in the fryer. Oh and avoid any vegetable not named "potato". Overcooked, tasteless, textureless, useless.

Reviews.Author: Cindy D.
Reviews.Content: The heart attack was worth it. I think I only got the 1/4 chicken but it looked like 1/2. I cant even put into words how good this place is. This indulges my McDonald's obsession of sausage dipped in syrup.This place makes me drool. The secret is to get the gravy on the side to dip your crispy chicken in. The waffles were ok. I think the chicken overwhelmed my taste buds for me to get the full pleasure of the waffles. But the sweet and salty go so well together. I think all my waffles did were enhance my chicken experience. Piling the 2 waffles on top of each other make it soggy, they should put them on separate plates. My Arnold Palmer topped everything off.  This is a must go if you are in the L.A. area.Its so good I had to finish the chicken at least. Can't let something like this go to waste. Afterwards they give you wet naps so you know this place is finger lickin' good.The waitress' look like they belong in a 50's dinner and they are all a bit plump. I would be too if I worked here.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few good reviews here, I decided to drag a few of my friends to try it out.  After a long drive and getting lost and turning around, we finally arrived at Roscoe's.  The waffles were good, the chicken - mediocre, the grits - ewwwww (ok it was my first time, and I don't like it) But again, I found nothing spectacular and in my opinion costed a little more than it should have.  After we paid, we desperately wanted to get out of the area (it seems pretty ghetto no offense) so we hopped into our cars and drove a few blocks south to Paseo :)  and it was happy happy from there.

Reviews.Author: Marly H.
Reviews.Content: I never thought of eating chicken and waffles together before, but a friend of mine assured me that it was great. When we went in to Roscoe's there was a crowd, and people waiting outside. We were seated quickly though, and the waiter was friendly and helpful.I just got the standard chicken and waffles, and I have to say that the WAFFLE was the best part. So good. I would say it's even better than waffles served at a breakfast place. The chicken wasn't anything special, but together it was a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Monique C.
Reviews.Content: WARNING: The following review may contain explicit and graphic words that may constitute food porn.  Minors and those with heart conditions may be advised to look away.Succulent.  Absolutely, rhapsodic and succulent.  I've never in my lifetime of eating, cooking, and loving chicken have ever eaten chicken this good and my family's roots are from the south.  Roscoe's food is so damn good, it makes you want to slap your mother.  A group of six of us went on a pilgrimage to find Roscoe's and thanks to our GPS tracker (who sexily said, "now arriving at Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles") we arrived at heaven.  The chicken was moist, crispy, seasoned beyond the palates of mere mortals.  The waffles were playfully combative, biting back as you continued to nosh and roll your tongue along its firm grooves.  The greens were far from healthy but seduced you into believing this was the way mom never needed to guilt or fool you into eating your veggies.  My god, the mac n cheese actually made a tear bud in my eyes - I swear to you people, this was indeed heaven!  We enjoyed our meal so much, none of us argued or spoke of anything but our food in between greedy gulps.  Don't believe me?  One of our group members recorded the experience!  Seriously, ya'll - this is damn good food and pretty much the one reason I'd ever come back to Cali.  For real.  I don't even think Boston could handle a place like this.  (sniff, sniff - Roscoe's!!)

Reviews.Author: Mariel D.
Reviews.Content: Came here for dinner after a day of shopping on Melrose.  I LOVED IT.  We got there around 7:00 p.m on a Monday, so there was no wait.  We were seated right away. Waffles and chicken may sound like a bizarre pairing but it worked so well together.  Their chicken is crispy and flavorful.  The waffles were so thick and fluffy they just soaked up the butter and the syrup making each bite delectable.  I also had macaroni and cheese and collard greens on the side and both were delicious.  Their gravy is theeeee best.  I had it with everything from my chicken to my corn bread.  So good.  Well, we just started dipping just about everything we had in it cause it was THAT good.  lol!I had heard A LOT about this place since I moved to southern california.  Everyone said that I should try it, and I finally did.  I wasn't disappointed.  It DEFINATELY lived up to the hype and I will return for sure everytime i'm in the L.A area.

Reviews.Author: Josie H.
Reviews.Content: Located in HollywoodOpens at 8am on weekends, 8:30am on weekdaysSeriously, chicken and waffles, I would NEVER have thought to eat chicken at 8AM in the morning. Thus, I ordered the order with one breast and one waffle. Being still sketchy on the concept of eating FRIED chicken BREAST at 8am, I took a piece, and my friend finished the rest.However, the WAFFLE is seriously bomb diggity. It was so yummy that  I finished my ENTIRE waffle! props for me! My friend got the biscuit and he loved it. My other friends got the same order as I did, and they all LOVED the chicken AND waffle. All their plates were spotless except mine, but that's just me.It's a must try place if you're in the the area, but stlll....fried chicken in the morning..........I don't think I can eat that just yet:)

Reviews.Author: Gina S.
Reviews.Content: This was a must when I realized this was the place Snoop Dog loves.  And now that in the bay area, soul food/chicken and waffles is a big thing, I had to try this place.  I've never been to a restaurant where there is a bouncer at the door.  We arrived at 2pm and it was still packed!  The wait wasnt too bad tho.  Service was excellent.I was a little dissapointed because the chicken wasn't as juicy as I expected.  It was tasty, but I felt like the chicken was all batter.  There wasn't enough meat on the bone.  I think House of Chicken n Waffles in Oakland, California is better.  But I'm glad I went to just have the experience.

Reviews.Author: Michelle H.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm chicken. Mmmmmm waffles. Yes, they are great, just as everyone says, and just as I am gonna say now.The chicken has a nice, thin crust, nothing too battery or heavy just super crispy with moist meat underneath.The scent of the waffles are intoxicating!!! They are great, especially with the saltiness of the butter and the sweetness of the syrup. Not the best texture I've ever had, as I like my waffles more crispy, but the flavor was excellent.Service was reasonably fast and prices are decent too!

Reviews.Author: Benito D.
Reviews.Content: What it tries to be: Chicken and waffles, the combination you would've never thought of but works. What it is: Really good chicken, pretty good waffles, fun service.....LOOOOONG wait, seriously, don't go if you're hungry. Value: Good, not great. Environment:  Diner on one side of the foyer, bar on the other side of the foyer. Since there's a long line, get yourself a drink while you wait. Would i go again: No, the food is good, but the ONLY times I'm willing to wait in line for food is Daikokuya in LA and Phil's BBQ in San Diego. Better than/Worse than: Better fried chicken than most places. Worse line than Daikokuya. Notes: If it weren't for the bar, it would be the most annoying wait since the area isn't the greatest. If you haven't gone, don't let the line get to you and go because a) The food is good and b) It's one of those places you have to go to just to say you went.

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: Finally got the chance to try the famous chicken and waffles. Came here for an early lunch to avoid the lines.Got side order of corn bread and the number 1 with gravy on the side. The number 1 has 2 giant waffles and 1/4 chicken dark meat, which equals to two pieces of chicken. The waffle was alright, tasted like any other waffle with syrup. But the portion was huge!The chicken on the other hand was so good with the gravy. By itself it was alright, I expected more seasoning but with the gravy...omg sooo tasty! I'm glad I asked for the gravy on the side instead of having it drenched on top. This way my chicken was still nice and crispy! I think my favorite thing about roscoe was the gravy. I was really surprised at how thick it was. The thickness was like there was mash potato in it or something. I also loved how they gave a choice of dark or white meat! The corn bread was huge but it was alright... Same with the Mac n cheese. The collard greens were a bit too salty for my liking.I think if I ever get a chance to come back I would definitely just get the chicken and gravy! Yum~

Reviews.Author: Michelle Y.
Reviews.Content: I finally was able to try Roscoe's and it was pretty much worth the wait. salty, sweet, and outright delicious! Usually theres an insane line out the door, but we were able to walk straight up and get a table for four. They're not vegetarian friendly so our friend had to get a plain salad. The rest of us gorged on chicken and waffles.I had a thigh and waffle. I think i messed up because the leg looked good (wow, never would've thought i'd say that). i tore apart the meat like a ravenous being and poured syrup over the waffle with the chicken. it was yummy! my bf ordered a biscuit for us to try and told me it's one of the best ones he has ever had. he was pretty much right. it was tasty.

Reviews.Author: Mel D.
Reviews.Content: We got  Herb's Special #4 1/2 Chix smothered with gravy & onions, 2 waffles our own mix $15.45.The portion was big enough to be shared by two people.The seasoning was a bit salty but it was really good. The chicken is still crispy even though it's bathed in gravy. Two thumbs up to the waffles and chicken!Service was fast. We got seated after 5 minutes. Order was taken right away and we got our food really quick. We parked on the street. $1 for 1 hour parking.I'll be back the next time I crave for chicken!!!

Reviews.Author: C L.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, however is hyped up a little too much.  Don't get me wrong, the chicken is some of the best I have ever had, but I have had better waffles.  I would say try it if you have never been here or are from out of town.  Still a great local restaurant, which has turned into a local chain now.  It gets better marks for being an originator, but it has become a little to touristy for my likes.Overall a good restaurant.  I would return.

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: No matter what you have heard, you must try Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles. It doesn't matter which location, because they're all finger-licking delicious.What I typically order... #2 Scoe's 1/4 Chix - ($10.90) white or dark meat smothered with gravy & onions, and 2 waffles. I also drench the smothered gravy chicken with Red Rooster hot sauce and black pepper. The first bite is usually the most succulent, crunchy, flavorful... my mouth is watering just imagining it now! I've also tried #9 Country Boy - ($8.90) 3 crispy wings with one waffle. When ordering chicken without the gravy, you can really taste the flavors in the batter. It's crunchy and full of salty goodness. Drinks to try... Sunset (lemonade and fruit punch), Sun Rise (lemonade and OJ), or Eclipse (OJ, lemonade, and fruit punch). I would never image these combinations to work, but somehow Roscoe's makes it happen! Our meal for two usually totals around $30, and it is worth every penny! If you think you're a extreme foodie... you're not unless you've ate at Roscoe's regardless of where you live! Oh, and I'm still waiting until the day I bump into a celebrity again. (Met James Jones from Green Bay Packers when I went to the Roscoe's in Long Beach)

Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing!  Food is excellent! I don't think there is anything you can get that is bad on this menu. The people who work here are very friendly and you sort of get that southern type of vibe because the hospitality is so great. Food comes out fast and has great proportions. The Obama Special was my favorite 3 pieces of chicken with a waffle. So heavenly!

Reviews.Author: Shawn S.
Reviews.Content: I can only say two things about Roscoe's:1) the food here is absolutely delicious and definitely what I need for a Sunday hangover. 2) After eating the house special (chicken & waffles for you slow kids out there) I can't move, nor does my body function normally, for the next 8 hours due to a massive food coma.

Reviews.Author: Jay A.
Reviews.Content: Crispity.Crunchity.Fried chicken and waffles.Weirdest combination ever, but this place makes it work. For alot of the items on the menu, they don't do substitutions or whatever. The wait to get in is pretty long, and they messed up with letting us in by calling out our leader's name with a party of 6 instead of 8, but a different group walked in of 6. Whatever.Good food though.

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: The fried chicken tastes like my Granny used to make, the gravy is authentic homemade. The waffles were good--and what a great concept to put chicken and waffles together on the same plate. Genius. I was not a fan of the mac&cheese, but others rave, so i'm not going to put it down. Plus, the ambiance is just perfect! It's like a greasy spoon diner you'd see parodied in a sitcom--only it's the real thing. Here's a tip: You have to specifically ask for the Hawaiian punch (and why wouldn't you--it's so delicious!!). It's not on the menu, but they have it if you ask for it.

Reviews.Author: Ana A.
Reviews.Content: Finally, finally, finally tried this place! Finally!I came early, 5:30pm on a Saturday, thinking it wouldn't be busy. Wrong! There was a rather large crowd, of several parties, waiting outside the door to be seated. Note: They won't seat you until you whole party is there, so make plans to come with punctual people if you are coming from different places or in separate cars.The girl at the door was very friendly and did her best to seat us right away. There was hardly a wait and I was very fooled by the crowd at the door. Ordered the Carol C. Special, a chicken breast and a waffle. I really wanted the cornbread and maybe some mac and cheese and some sweet potato pie, but the Carol C. Special sounded like a lot of food already and it was! The chicken was surprisingly moist. Add some Louisiana hot sauce on there and you'll be in heaven. The waffle was surprisingly flavorful, not some bland, soggy excuse for a waffle that I expected. It was a lot of food for the price, and I left full. After years of hearing good and bad things about this place, I finally experienced it for myself and I have to say that I definitely liked it!

Reviews.Author: Kat N.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's did live up to all the hype, and it wasn't as greasy as I thought it would be. Definitely a good, hearty brunch/lunch place with southern hospitality. The combination of chicken & waffles boggles me but Roscoe's does an excellent job at putting them together to create a taste so savory and delicious. Yum... LOVES IT!I recommend the #2 Scoe's: 2 thighs, gravy & onions (ask for it on the side), and 2 waffles. Being a fan of healthy foods, Roscoe's is my guilty exception.

Reviews.Author: Julia B.
Reviews.Content: The portions here are really big, so don't be leery if the price seems a little steep. I got the Carol C. and the chicken breast was huge and the waffle took up half the plate. Both were absolutely tasty. Service was a little slow (drink refills, check drop, etc.) but that's to be expected on a busy Friday night. Our food was delivered very fast though. If you're in LA, definitely make this a stop on your itinerary.

Reviews.Author: Ant E.
Reviews.Content: I love roscoes! I'm use to The one In Atlanta but this one is great too. It has some ratchet people in there but the food is a B+. It's great for groups, after the bar or just to relax and enjoy soul food. Not my choice of chicken seasoning. But the drinks are off the chain!

Reviews.Author: Michelle M.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try this place for ages but I just don't find myself in the area very often. I finally got the opportunity last weekend when the plans my mom and I had fell through.I have to say, fried chicken and waffles do go together very well. The salty, the sweet, the crispy, the syrupy - it's a delicious combination. That said, Roscoe's had neither the best fried chicken nor the best waffles I've ever had. I ordered the thigh and waffle. My mom had the breast and waffle with a side order of gizzards. The chicken pieces had a bit of that "overfried" flavor. The waffles, on the other hand, could have used some crisping up. If there weren't so soft, they would have been delicious. My mom said the gizzards were too rubbery for her - they didn't trim off the chewiest parts, just breaded them whole and threw them into the fryer.FYI, they have valet parking. It's $6.50.

Reviews.Author: Loretta J.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is The Best Place to eat! Man I love it there. It is always packed, but at the same time I feel so welcome somehow. I had the chicken with that yummy fried onion gravy stuff. Don't know what they put in it but it was delicious. And the waffles...mmmm...I never would have thought to put the two together. Chicken and waffles married in eternal matrimony. Thank goodness!!

Reviews.Author: Kate G.
Reviews.Content: I'm only rating on the fact that there valet was a sweetheart and gave me a ride home after I begged for help because some creeper wouldn't stop following me and grabbing me as I tried to find my bus. I'm only lacking a star because I'm sure the food is great, but I haven't eaten there yet. Thank god there are some nice people left in this world.

Reviews.Author: Mish M.
Reviews.Content: I am an addicted regular of this place. No one does it like Roscoes. Whether you're hungry, or hungover, or drunk, chicken and waffles just works!I always get the Scoes #1 with the quarter chicken and 2 waffles and sweet black tea. Yum! The butter is perfectly whipped and soft and the syrup is so go with both the waffles and the chicken. The biscuits are great. The cornbread is good. The mac and cheese isnt my thing, I thought it was just ok. It takes a while to be greeted at your table but they're always busy. And once your order is taken your food is pretty much out in less than 5 minutes. Wait staff is really friendly.Parking can be tricky when it's busy.
