I'm always there late night so usually parking on Sunset is open. Do not park in the lot next to it, they will tow you.

Reviews.Author: Rudy Z.
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. If you are starving you want to come to this place! The service here was excellent despite the place being super packed with hungry customers. The waitress was very friendly and attentive and always had a smile on her face. I ordered the 1/4 white-meat chicken with two waffles along with a side of corn bread and Mac and Cheese. If you come here, you MUST try the mac and cheese it is perfectly made with just the right amount of cheese! The drinks are really cool! I ordered the Eclipse which is a combo of three different fruit juices (OJ, Lemonade, apple juice... i forgot which ones exactly) and you can actually see the layers when they bring you the drink! Another must try!Now as for the quality the chicken was well cooked and not to greasy because i despise super greasy chicken. The waffles were soft and somewhat crisp on the outside. Oddly enough they complemented each other fairly well, so do not be afraid to try it, given it's your first time around. I noticed the place was a little dim, but i actually liked that. It gives you a sense of calmness and relaxation. The price is just right and not overly exaggerated! I strongly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the chicken burger- over rated with nasty fries.I tasted my honey's chicken, very moist, but the waffles were "eh."Sorry!

Reviews.Author: Sandra S.
Reviews.Content: So me and Patricia were in Glendale for business (Glendale SUCKS!) but we had it already in mind to visit Roscoes' Chix n Waffles.  The closest one to Glendale is the Gower location in Hollywood.  We parked super close and we were seated immediately (3pm on a Thursday)Our waitress took a little too long in getting our order but while I was still stirring the artificial sweetner in my iced tea when my beautiful chicken dinner arrived.  Wow, a giant breast and a giant waffle with a giant scoop of whipped butter with a side of greens.  Patty ordered a giant breast, greens, cornbread, mac and cheese, and a waffle on the side (guess she was hungry).  Yum yum, smack it was yummy!  My chicken breast was juicy and a deep goldenbrown, seasoned perfectly.  My greens were ok, I've had better, but then they were home-made by a lady who grew up on a farm in Georgia.  The mac and cheese was sooooo delicious, some of the best I've tasted!  Cinnamon in the waffle make it extra good.  Cornbread was dry but unless it was straight from the oven, that's what happens.   Iced tea was good, at least it tasted like good strong iced tea and not brown water like other establishments.Roscoes is clean and tidy.  The ladies room was clean and tidy as well.  It was quiet and we weren't crowded.  Good thing too because Patty dropped a piece of mac n cheese and it fell down her cleavage.  I laughed as she picked up the noodle and popped it in her mouth.  Pothy: "What? it happens all the time!"  Me: "Whaaaaah hahahahahaha!"  I almost choked on my perfect fried chicken breast.  OK, so SUMMARY:  1. Go to Roscoes on a Thursday afternoon and you won't have to wait.  2. Order more than one piece of the delicious fried chix.  3. Order as many of the tasty sides as you like and maybe a double of the mac n cheese.  4. Don't pick food out of your cleavage unless you know the Heimlich maneuver.

Reviews.Author: Mark K.
Reviews.Content: Friggin delicious.  Two of my favorite foods, fried chicken and waffles, on one glorious plate.  Prepare to wait though, I've never had to wait less than 30-40 minutes each time I've come here.  The waffles here are gigantic and fluffy and come with a heaping pile of butter.  The fried chicken is crispy, not greasy, and moist in the inside.  When eaten together it is truly tear inducing.  They have other items on the menu besides fried chicken and waffles but I've never deviated from what makes this place world famous.For the standard 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles plate it comes out to around 12-13 dollars including tip.  Not a bargain but worth every penny imo.

Reviews.Author: Alicia N.
Reviews.Content: First off, you're either going to love or hate the concept of chicken and waffles.Secondly, if you're allowed to have sugar DRINK THE SWEET TEA.Service is quick for such a crowded place. And this is wonderful comfort food. Hint: if you like spice- add a little hot sauce to the syrup. It goes amazingly well with the cinnamon spiced waffles.

Reviews.Author: Martin K.
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit legendary amongst locals, and yet no matter how much I hype it up to friends, the experience is always shockingly good. The chicken is amazing; Every time I go it's the best chicken I've had, easily. The waffles are so incredible that I always end up ordering more than I can finish.Every time I've come, I've been quoted a 45 minute wait (Which is reasonable, considering the fame and reputation Roscoe's has), but I've never waited longer than 15 or 20.Don't overlook their mixed lemonade drinks (Sunrise, Sunset, Eclipse). They're often overlooked and understated because of how amazing the titular chicken and waffles are, but they're well worth ordering.If I was forced to find a fault with Roscoe's it's that their beer selection is lackluster. If you're not picky with what you drink it won't be a problem, but most of the time I'm forced into getting a soda or something. They do offer wine, but I've never tried.

Reviews.Author: Julio M.
Reviews.Content: +Chicken is good.+Waffles were fine.-Terrible service.-Not so good corn bread :(Conclusion: If you're looking for good fried chicken and you don't mind waiting, Roscoe's your place.

Reviews.Author: Eugene G.
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what the fuss is about but It was really hard to grab this whole concept. While visiting the parks down in Anaheim, my Fian?e and I drove up to Hollywood to try out Rosco's Chicken and Waffles. It looked really promising from the outside and also the amount of people who were lining up. We waited for about 25-30 minutes to be seated and when seated. The host and waitress were really friendly. All of the tables and surroundings were clean and the menu was really straight forward.Food also came out quite fast and dun dun dun... The real review begins..I was really hoping that the food was top notch but oh man I was let down.. and let down haarrdd.. The rice seemed to be overcooked.. the beans tasted like it came out of a can from Safeway.. and the Chicken.. oh man the chicken was a huge disappointment. It was a bit dry for me and If I wasn't truly hungry, I would've just stopped consuming. But I was famished and continue to eat it. I must say that it wasn't too greasy unlike their competitors (i.e. Popeyes and KFC) But the taste wasn't just there. I wasn't impressed and was still hungry right after my fill. I also felt that the price were overly jacked up for food that tasted like it came from Safeways Deli. ALL HYPE!

Reviews.Author: Aaron R.
Reviews.Content: Overrated!!!I decided to check this place out to see what all the fuss is about. It's nothing special. Chicken tastes bland (little flavor) and the waffles were dry. It was definitely not worth the hassle of finding parking, waiting in line, and so forth.I would give three stars for being average, but the parking/wait bring it down a notch.

Reviews.Author: Sarah E.
Reviews.Content: I am fully committed to this location! Love it!(I've been to the Long Beach location, and not only was I not diggin it, but they didn't even have sweet tea!!! Blasphemy!)I always get the Carol C. special (1 Breast, 1 waffle). SO GOOD! I always make sure to get smothered potatoes and mac n cheese......omg their mac n cheese is hands down my favorite mac n cheese EVER. It's so good that even people who don't like mac n cheese try it and like it! Oh and of course, I can't forget the sweet tea :)I love this place for the overall experience of eating here, the meal as a whole. Not to mention the place has this warm/cozy vibeAnd because of its location, this place is awesome post-concert grub!

Reviews.Author: Alana C.
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were SOOOO excited to try Roscoe's! We went....and we weren't really impressed. I had the Obama special (3 wings with a waffle) and a side of Mac and Cheese. My mom had a chicken breast with greens, mac and cheese, and cornbread. Waffle: very tasty. Greens: average. Chicken: average. Mac and cheese: not very cheesy and VERY under-seasoned. My mom didn't like the mac and cheese so she swapped it for the potato salad...which was also horrible. Also very under-seasoned. For soul food type cuisine, the food was very bland. Maybe this location just isn't good because they cater to tourists (it's Hollywood). Most black people who eat dishes like this on the regular wouldn't be impressed.  So sad...we had such high expectations for this place.

Reviews.Author: David and Rebecca S.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the greatest thing about Los Angeles.  The only negative about this place is the epic wait, but once inside, the food renders any ill will meaningless.  Roscoe's will make a man out of you.Even if you are already a woman.

Reviews.Author: Edwin Z.
Reviews.Content: HEAVEN.I get the #2, although the #1, which is the same without the gravy, is great too. Waffles are big and delicious, chicken is great...I don't even know where to begin. If you get there before 6 you shouldn't have to wait too long. The longest I've waited is about 30 minutes, but I was with a group of about 16.Make sure you walk off your meal by heading to Amoeba afterward! If you're looking for free parking, turn left on Gower instead of right (coming from the 101). After a block it turns into a residential neighborhood. I've always parked here and have had no problems.

Reviews.Author: Jewel D.
Reviews.Content: I've been to every Roscoe's location and I must say this is my favorite location to go to, just cause it's the OG and the most ghetto. Not great for groups though because this place is SUPER SMALL. Everyone who knows me knows that this is one of my favorite restaurants to go to, so I may be a little biased... but I swear there is something in those waffles that keeps you coming back for more. The chicken is nice and crispy but it's the waffles that you definitely have to try. Other menu items noteworthy of trying: Lisa's Delight (aka Arnold Palmer), Sunrise (1/2 lemonade + 1/2 orange juice), Sunset (1/2 fruit punch + 1/2 lemonade), Eclipse (fruit punch + OJ + lemonade), and OF COURSE some good ol cornbread!! As for the prices.. it's gone up over time but you can get a good, hearty meal for under $20. And don't worry about the bums on Gower...they'll go up to your car window but they won't hurt you.. haha.*UPDATE* : I just went here for dinner yesterday night and they re-did the whole place! It looks a lot nicer and classier inside. They extended the restaurant, so there's still the initial small room that they once crowded with tables, but if you walk through another doorway, you'll see that there's a lot more seating. The ambiance is nice.. they've added new paintings and different lighting. I have to admit I'll miss the old, cramped feel of the original Roscoe's...but this is a change for the better.

Reviews.Author: Hamed M.
Reviews.Content: I love the food at Roscoe's. Their eggs, waffles, and chicken. But, I shouldn't have to stand around for someone to seat me, especially when there is no worker in sight. Also, after sitting down, I shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes for a menu, and another 10 minutes for a waiter to take my order.Maybe it's just this location, because I haven't experienced the same slow service and inattentiveness at other Roscoe's.BTW, the chicken here definitely is greasy. Don't kid yourself if you only get one piece of chicken and think you'll be fine. Oil drips from the skin when you peel it off the meat.

Reviews.Author: Rachel Q.
Reviews.Content: I love me some chicken and waffles!! I don't get it too often, but when I do, I savor every bite.  Never been to this location before - was meeting some friends before the Snoop/Mike Epps show at Universal.  Found meter parking (valet was $10!) and went in to grab a table. Was surprisingly empty and asked for a table for 6. I was the only one there but the host guy was nice and sat me.  My friends were late and he joked with me asking where they were. He was super nice.  I ordered the "succulent chicken breast and delicious waffle." My friends and I shared the Mac and Cheese. Both were sooo good!  Total food coma afterwards! It was our friend's birthday, so the staff put a candle in his waffle.  Great location, great service and great food!

Reviews.Author: Lea G.
Reviews.Content: Yay! The only place I had set planned to eat at before we arrived in Los Angeles.  We went here after a night out on the town and with a hankering for fried chicken and waffles. We got here right at 10 am on a Saturday morning. Parking right on the street no hassle. There was no line (yay) and we walked in and was seated. There was a bit of a wait at the table but once we ordered two Carol C's, coffee and a side of greens; our food came pretty fast.The combo meal comes with a piece of breast meat and one waffle, which was perfect for us. The fried chicken is crisp and the waffle toasty but soft.  The most perfect thing about the combo is the syrup.  I poured it on my waffle and fried chicken (along with a few doses of tobacco sauce) and you have the perfect meal.  The greens were just ok. The service was friendly and efficient and we will definitely come back when we are in the area.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: SO GOOD.I normally hate fried chicken, and waffles, but I was really pleased with my meal at Roscoe's. I ordered the 1/4 dark meat with gravy, grits, and a biscuit, and I finished the entire thing. The dark meat was juicy on the inside, and crispy on the outside, and overall delicious. The gravy went really well with the chicken and biscuit. The grits tasted kinda funky by themselves, but when they were paired with the gravy and chicken they were heaven. The white meat wasn't as good as the dark meat (in my opinion, but I typically liked dark meat better). The mac and cheese was mediocre, and expensive. If I were to come back again I would definitely skip the sides and only order a main course.My only complaint is that they put butter on EVERYTHING. There was a huge chunk of butter in my grits and after a few second it turned into a pool of butter which was pretty unappetizing. Other than that I had a good experience at Roscoes.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy C.
Reviews.Content: Chef Roscoe is amazing. His gourmet waffles and chicken are outstanding. You'll be immediately greeted by a couple maitre d's out front wearing "security" t shirts. It creates a very exclusive feel. The crowd is very elitist.Actually, no.. HahaIt's expensive but really good fried chicken served with waffles. I've heard all the hype and thought the food was good, but, I have no desire to ever return. Service wasn't the greatest, not that I was expecting any better, but nothing really memorable about my experience. Make sure to order extra butter for your waffle... LolIf the question is: First date?The answer is: Yes!

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: Contrary to popular belief, Roscoe's is not that great and I think President Obama can attest to that. I think my mom makes better chicken!  However, their mac n' cheese is THE BOMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMBBBBB!!! Definitely get that as a side.This location is the only one I've been too. I stop by mostly after the club and they're usually really busy around this time. We always receive great, quick and efficient service.

Reviews.Author: Justin L.
Reviews.Content: I tend to make a stop at this particular Roscoe's whenever I'm in LA. My favorite item to order is the chicken with red beans and rice, which also comes with a huge slice of corn bread. A sunrise is also a must for me. Haven't really had any horrible experiences with this place other than having one of my chicken thighs being undercooked. It was immediately replaced with a cooked piece, though it would have been nice to get my meal comped.. just sayin!People say this place is overrated. I say, you need to order something that you know you will like.

Reviews.Author: Annissa H.
Reviews.Content: MMMM! Looooovvvvee their chicken!! The day after I had some I was dreaming of fried good ol' chicken!  I never really understood the chicken and waffle combo but the chicken was delicious and their waffles were good, not great, I make better waffles at home. But the waffles are hugeee.The mac n cheese was good but not amazing. The greens were okay, a tad salty. so why the 4 stars?? The fried chicken! ohhh the fried chickennnn!! loves.

Reviews.Author: Melissa C.
Reviews.Content: I hate waffles, but I loved these. They were much more flavorful than any waffle I've ever had, and were a little thicker and less cripsy. They were sort of like a waffley-pancake with a hint of cinnamon flavor. Smothered in syrup and butter, it was delicious!The fried chicken was also very good. Mom always tried to make fried chicken at home, but it was always fairly terrible, so going out to eat to have fried chicken and to enjoy it 10x more than KFC was a godsend. I was licking my fingers and picking off every bit of the skin. Mmm.People are right-- it IS expensive for what you get. My leg + waffle rang up at about $7, plus a $3 side of smothered potatoes, and my boyfriend's $9 waffle with 3 wings, but we were both stuffed for under $20, so how can we complain?Definitely going to be a new staple, although it's pretty stinkin' ghetto.Oh, I think they remodeled and added on a new dining room, at least that's what my boyfriend mumbled something about.

Reviews.Author: Marevie T.
Reviews.Content: The guy at the door (host?) was super funny! People are really welcoming here. The chicken is so awesome, it makes me feel bad for cheating on my diet... but it was SOOOOOO good. The waffle was so good, I really didn't even want to drench it in syrup. It was great by itself! Anyway, I had a lot of fun here too because there are people that come in dressed up really nice here the day that I went ... While I came in my jeans and tank top all the way from the Bay Area... nothing flashy. Lol If only there were more of these up north! ugh. I guess I have to keep up with my diet this time. lol

Reviews.Author: George M.
Reviews.Content: There is a certain vibe at this Roscoe's that all the other Roscoe's don't quite have. I live around the corner from the one in Pasadena.  The Hollywood Roscoe's has got "it". That quality that makes every man feel like a VIP when he brings his friends in, his girl in or his family in. This place is special and it deserves a special respect too.I certainly feel better after eating here than I ever would at one of those fancy places on the Westside. If I could give it 6 stars I would.

Reviews.Author: Chrisjan Y.
Reviews.Content: I finally ate here. I have tried to eat here numerous times. But my plans always fell through. This time we decided to pull the trigger and do it. It was a 45 min wait and well worth it. We had a #3, 1/2 chicken, 2 waffles, side order of livers, 2 biscuits & gravy, mac n cheese, chili chicken fries. From the first bite of the waffle & chicken I fell in love. I can't believe I have not eaten here before.I should be back in dec or jan and I can't wait!

Reviews.Author: Veronica V.
Reviews.Content: This in my opinion is the best fried chicken I have ever tasted. The only drawbacks that would keep me from ever going back were very rude guest service check in, awful parking, way over priced especially for items like mac-n-cheese (around $4 for a small bowl). Also, the worst tea I've ever tasted, Mcdonald's has better sweet tea. We got there right before lunch rush so we didn't have much of a wait however, the elderly gentleman checking in guests gave my husband a hard time while we were trying to find parking because he said he couldn't hold our table without our whole party present. With a little persuasion aka begging, lol, he held our table as we ran from the parking lot across the street which I found out later you are not supposed to use.

Reviews.Author: Alex G.
Reviews.Content: I guess you should keep in mind that I don't eat meat before eating this review.I think this place is a little overrated due to the kitsch value that ensures any place called 'House of Chicken & Waffles' will become a cult favorite amongst twentysomethings.  The quality of the food was really not impressive.  The waffles were good, but nothing special.  The scrambled eggs were well flavored and quite tasty.  The potatoes were nothing special and a little bland.None of my co-eaters expressed being impressed by the quality of the chicken, and visually it did not look like good fried chicken.  The gravy was meh.The atmosphere was busy, noisy, and overly bright.  Most of that was due to the undeserved popularity that this place enjoys.  I can't justify going to two stars because nothing was overtly bad about the experience.Bottom line: average food, not worth the wait or the hype.

Reviews.Author: Ron F.
Reviews.Content: Awesome, just awesome. Been hearing about how good this place was for years. On the way back down from a trip we finally decided to go. It was great. The environment really feels like an old, hole in the wall type of place. The wait wasn't very long ( 25-mins). I ordered the SCOE's #3, which honestly was a half chicken and 2 waffles. I loved it, and it was a good amount of chicken. I probably would have been full with just a #1 ( a quarter chicken instead of half) but I figured that being +2hrs away from Roscoes normally, I might as well eat a bunch. Word of warning, if you have a lot of driving to do after eating here, go light. The drive home was difficult, my body wanted to sleep.

Reviews.Author: Zoe B.
Reviews.Content: Great fried chicken and waffle! The fried chicken were fried well and seasoned well. I got a country boy (3 fried wings and a waffle) and my husband got a fried thigh and a waffle meal. They all tasted good. The maple syrup has a cinnamon flavor too. The hot sauce was good with the chicken as well. We love the food there, and went back the other day to get an economy special, which was 5 fried thighs for $6. We did all these by taking out because we didn't want to pay for parking. It's good to order take out and just sit back at home to enjoy the fried chicken. It happened to us that some of the fried thighs were not fully cooked (which happens when ordering fried food) so we could stick them in the oven at home. They still tasted good after re-cook them in the oven. We recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Author: Elyse K.
Reviews.Content: Excusing the fact that this place is an LA legend... I've actually had better chicken and waffles at this place here: hardknoxcafe.comThe waffles were pretty good but the chicken was unflavorful. I was expecting so much more from the fried chicken!! Hard Knox Cafe is owned by Asain folks who were raised in the south and learned how to cook true soul food. Funny huh?!?Never the less it was great to go to breakfast here.. the service was outstanding and the vibe was tight. I would go again and try some of the other stuff people recommend.

Reviews.Author: Danny R.
Reviews.Content: I tried to like Roscoe's. I've been to three different ones but I still like KFC's originale recipe fried chicken. However you can't get the waffle at KFC. I love eating fried chicken and waffle. There is one time where I got the perfect chicken here. Tasty and crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I'm looking forward to my next visit here.

Reviews.Author: Tana C.
Reviews.Content: eat here before heading over to The Pantages for a show. You can't go wrong at Roscoe's! the waffles are so yummy & the chicken fried perfectly!go with the #13, it won't disappoint!

Reviews.Author: Carson Y.
Reviews.Content: FTW!!!!Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles went above and beyond my expectations. This was one of the best meals I have ever had. I came here for lunch, alone,  and thank goodness I did. It was pure bliss and I needed to have a moment to myself. No one needed to see me stuff my face that day!! The chicken - humongous, hot, juicy and perfectly crispyThe waffle - sweet, fluffy, and a perfect compliments to the chickenThe environment - old school tavern style with no frillsThe sauce - the combo of maple syrup, butter, and hot sauce is crackThe price - so worth itThe experience - unforgettable

Reviews.Author: Peter Z.
Reviews.Content: What beats Roscoes Chicken and Waffles?! NOTHING! I always order the Obama, which is roscoes famous chicken wings with waffles! Their signature sides are also very good. Key note: put some syrup and grape strawberry jam on your waffles and eat your meal with a sunrise drink! If I had one last meal to eat in California, Roscoes will definitely be my top choice!

Reviews.Author: Emma L.
Reviews.Content: It's chicken and waffles and eggs and good eatin'.  I ate at some very upscale restaurants when I visited my uncle six years ago but I kept returning to Roscoe's, which was conveniently about a 5 minute drive away.Why Boston doesn't have a place like this (at least that I know of), I'll never know.

Reviews.Author: Julie H.
Reviews.Content: ...heart attack on a plate...but I love it!!!This is definitely my guilty pleasure...fried chicken...buttery waffles...fried gizzards...grits...oh my. For those who haven't tried the sinful combination of chicken and waffles (I know it sounds a bit strange)...just TRY IT...you won't be sorry....my only complaint is the long wait.

Reviews.Author: thrasher b.
Reviews.Content: Not that I am a lush, but I would have to be VERY drunk to rate this more than one star. We had high expectations. The hype was what pulled us through the door and we sat down and was immediately disappointed as our first plate of food arrived. It wasn't special or great. The chicken was dry, dry, dry, dry and the waffle was rubbery!The syrup wasn't bad. Hard to say this place is great, because it wasn't even good. Really disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Joy D.
Reviews.Content: SO YUMMY! Took my cousins here for the first time on Saturday and they LOVED it. We got a lil bit of everything and just shared: chicken, waffles, omlettes, mac n cheese, more chicken. They thought I was crazy for pouring some syrup on the chicken but it's so good.The service could be a little bit better as far as paying attention to your tables. Not once did our waitress return after the food was brought out to see how we were doing. And we had to wait 15 minutes after we were done eating to get our check. But oh well. If you're ever in LA and you haven't tried it yet, GO!

Reviews.Author: Eduardo X.
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the word WAFFLE.  Call me crazy, but I expect that if you put the word WAFFLE in your name then you must make pretty good waffles.  If buying an Eggo waffle and reheating it is "good," then by all means let me say they're awesome.If you want a better homemade waffle, go to The Serving Spoon.Then let's try the word CHICKEN.  Their pieces of chicken are very small and taste about as good (perhaps slightly better) than KFC or Church's.  Seriously, Popeye's has tastier chicken.So essentially I am left with slightly above-average chicken (depending on what time you go there) and a terrible waffle that came from a box in the freezer.No thanks.

Reviews.Author: Sara L.
Reviews.Content: I feel like a loser reviewing two Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles locations, but I can't help it. I've been to this location on Gower two times, and the one on Pico two times. Both are good, but I'd say that this Roscoe's does a slightly better job making the waffles (slightly more cinnamon-y and fluffy), while the Roscoe's on Pico does a slightly better job making the fried chicken (slightly more seasoned there). It evens out in the end, but that might be something to think about.Regardless of the location, the gluttonous combination of fried chicken and waffles from Roscoe's is really good, and it's just one of those places you have to try at least once.

Reviews.Author: Leslie K.
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to try to famous Roscoe's chicken and waffle combo and I'm glad this was the spot I dined at. A heart attack on a plate sounds like a perfect meal to have at breakfast, right?When we got there it was around 8 in the morning and the place had just opened. The doors were closed and we weren't sure if it was open officially, then a guy walked into one of the 5 doors that had out front and we followed suit. The place is home-y and the employees are nice. Our server, I think her name is Irene, was great and hospitable. We were being your typical tourists taking pictures of our food and she even offered to take a picture of all of us since we failed in the one-handed photo where we tried to cram everyone in the picture. Anyway, after taking pictures we got our meal. I had the Carol C. special and the waffles and the "succulent chicken breast" was delicious! It tasted like... chicken and waffles. Hah. But the chicken was perfectly fried and the waffle was fluffy, buttery, and syrupy. Mmmm... I can feel my arteries clogging right now.One thing I must say is that parking is a hassle and you'll have to gather up a lot of quarters if you plan on eating slow in that joint. Street parking is limited so get there early or plan to walk a bit.

Reviews.Author: Aaron M.
Reviews.Content: Great location! I enjoy this location more than others I've been to.*I love the Manuel Special but sometimes need to order another waffle a-la-carte if I'm feeling like a pig!!*Pros:Unique comfort food recipes that are very satisfying!!High quality ingredientsConsistently well preparedCons:Staff can be lax in attending to you after food is served and you can often hear them being super loud with each other from across the room when they are idle (but are very polite when they get to dealing with you)Waiting periods when busyHollywood parking is (of course) ridiculous and there is no parking lotA-la-carte items are kind of pricey (but good)No pork products, (e.g. bacon, sausages, pork chops, etc. -- though some will disagree that this is a con)

Reviews.Author: Jo W.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Europe, the Caribbean and even the west coast, but never to Los Angeles. Well, I finally made my first trip to L.A. and I had a such a great time. When I think of L.A., I think of Hollywood; the sign, the Walk of Fame and Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. I tried to resist the lure of Roscoe's but just could not resist. Okay let me be honest, I already knew I had to come here once I decided to come to L.A. I have actually gone to restaurants that served chicken and waffles, but forbade myself from trying it, knowing I had to have the original first. I was so excited when we pulled up to Roscoe's. Although the decor does not match my modern sense of style, it matched the theme of the restaurant. The decor make you know that although you are in L.A., what you're about to experience is a down home country meal. The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly, obviously used to all the tourist the flock here. In fact, while we are dining, a group of elderly women came in, making their pit stop on their guided tour. I ordered the Obama Special (aka Country Boy), which consists of wings and waffles. Although there are plenty of other choice, for me no there was no other option. Wings, waffles, hot sauce & syrup; the right balance of savory, spicy and sweet, I wanted to eat more. The waffles were amazing; fluffy like pancakes (I despise crunchy waffles) and the fried chicken was probably the best I have ever had. Although I grew up in Florida and it is as south as you can get geographically, it does not really count as "The South" so I must admit that I have not had much experience with southern/soul food but regardless my taste buds know a good fried chicken and it was good.My conclusion, Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles is definitely a reason alone for me to come back to L.A.

Reviews.Author: Enrique S.
Reviews.Content: Everyone was blunt and didn't co sign on no BS, love this place I came here a while ago during a trip to LA, to this day I crave the buckwheat waffle and the biscuits and gravy. So tasty and fast polite to the point service. The water and lemonade was iffy but it is what it is. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Roxanne R.
Reviews.Content: love the waffles and the chicken is yummmmmmy! the have mac n cheese that is so good!! the wait can be long but well worth it!. the best time to go is during the week because the evenings and sunday are busy busy!

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: Being from PA Dutch country chicken and waffles ain't nothing new to me.  There they are served savory with mounds of smothered chicken.  Having said that RHCW is O.K.  I've never left this place full and neither has my walletI'm a wing man I got the wing special.  3 scrawny wings and 1 side???  For shame.  You call your self a soul food place?  The wings were good and greens were mean but I don't like leaving a soul food place hungry.  Just not right is all.

Reviews.Author: Ana S.
Reviews.Content: Legendary for the famous chicken and waffles in the Los Angeles area, Roscoe's is a Southern California staple.Casual dining overlooking the glam of what the inner city part of Los Angeles is, you are guaranteed to have breakfast Southern CA style.If you like the combination of fried chicken and waffles, and you are missing the soul food in your life. This is the place for you. The prices are very reasonable and the menu is plain and simple Favorite Dish:Home Style CHICKEN SAUSAGE 2 Sausage Patties, 2 Eggs, Grits & Biscuit 2 Sausage, Waffle and 2 Eggs

Reviews.Author: Sylvia S.
Reviews.Content: Must vist this one they have the bomb Greens. Nothing like pancakes, chicken and cornbread oh my!!! Waffles are super huge and so fluffy.The guard outside was very nice I will be coming back to this one for sure!!! They take care of you here yum!!

Reviews.Author: Jessie C.
Reviews.Content: This place sure SOUNDS good, but after going there for dinner on Wednesday, I don't see what the big deal is. I ordered the Tues/Wed special which consisted of a fried chicken thigh, potato salad, mixed greens, and 2 pieces of hot water corn bread. The chicken was admittedly delicious, but everything else was average. I thought the special was OK, but almost everything else on the menu is overpriced. My friend got one waffle and the tiniest chicken leg I've ever seen for 7 bucks- what the heck?! Might come here if I'm in the neighborhood and happen to be craving some fried chicken. But I don't plan on driving all the way out here just to eat at Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: Ghetto Ghetto and Ghetto..... #nuffsaid

Reviews.Author: Kiwi T.
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious. Unusual combination at first. But proved to be one of the best fried chicken I've had. The portion sizes are perfect. I would come again and again. We were there around 1ish and waited about 20 mins. Not bad at all. Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Suzi L.
Reviews.Content: Expect a wait! Even at 12am on a Saturday!! Waits here can be crazy and you have to wait out side, so be prepared. Once you get inside it is a cool and dark room for you to cool off in after being outside. Food is so worth the wait though! Exactly the quality I have experienced at other Roscoe's locations! Love the waffles! Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Marlon L.
Reviews.Content: THE BOMB!!!!  My fav is the Jeanne Jones omelette.  The perfect omelette.  Cheese and Fried chicken with a waffle.  Smoothered potatoes with Gravy, biscuits, rice...... ALL GOOOOOD!  I love their fries.  Nothing beats fresh cut fries probably fried alongside some chicken.Chicken and waffles.  What a brilliant combination.  Just like bacon wrapped hot dogs.

Reviews.Author: Melissa C.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the food! You wouldn't think fried chicken and waffles is a good combo but when you try Roscoe's your whole world changes. Their chicken is made to perfection and their waffles have a nice hint of cinnamon in them or maybe it's their syrup. I personally love to fork a piece of chicken and waffle together and drizzle a little syrup over it.The place on Gower is a tad bit small but their staff are always friendly and cheerful.Now that I have moved out of the LA area, I try to go to Roscoe's every time I visit.

Reviews.Author: david h.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this was the original location but it was at the top of the list of six locations so I'm going to assume it was.I loved everything about it. It is old school inside and out and you feel like you are in on something that not everybody knows about (even if everyone knows about it!)I would recommend it for breakfast or brunch but I reckon it would be fine any other time. Before I went, I hoped there were things other than chicken and waffles and there were. However, the chicken (and waffles) were what I would go back for.The service was fine and the prices were very reasonable.Smiley face and star for a breakfast/ brunch spot in LA (especially if you like fried chicken with your waffles).

Reviews.Author: Leigha W.
Reviews.Content: Foodgasm. Seriously. They put something in their waffle batter that is so amazing, I think it may be cinnamon and nutmeg? Very good. The sweet and savory combination is to die for. Be prepared to walk around for awhile afterward, I was stuffed. Happily stuffed.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: I was introduced to this place by a friend and absolutely loved it! I ordered some white meat fried chicken with a couple waffles. The fried chicken, by itself, would have made for an excellent meal. But when combined with syrup, butter, and waffles, it just made my day. The dishes are also light on the wallet.It seems it gets quite busy here, but despite this, our wait time was only about ten minutes, and the service was great! I will definitely be returning for more chicken-waffle goodness very soon!

Reviews.Author: Rachel V.
Reviews.Content: To be clear, I really enjoyed the food. However, I really wish I'd been a lot drunker, then I'd probably be giving Roscoe's a glowing review. We waited almost an hour for a dirty, wobbly table (Sat. night at 6pm, not even that late), and probably another half hour for food. Waffles and mac-n-cheese were delicious, and my meat-eating friend from South Carolina said the chicken wings were top-notch. SO:If you're not from the South, you will love this place. If you are from the South, you will still love it, but save your time and money for the next time you visit home. $15 for waffles, mac-n-cheese, and bad service: not going back soon.

Reviews.Author: Carlin Y.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. I never would have GUESSED that fried chicken could EVER work with waffles and syrup and gravy, but it really does. It's almost sickening how well it works. I could feel my arteries clogging when I finished the meal, but it was perhaps the best fried chicken I've ever had. You know how chicken breast can get dry sometimes? This was crispy on the outside and still juicy on the inside. The gravy was just the right thickness and went SO well with the crispy chicken skin. The waffles were fluffy and complemented the savoryness of the chicken in ways I never imagined. I try not to think of Roscoe's when I eat fried chicken now, because it'll just depress me that I haven't found something like it in New York yet. The price was totally reasonable given the portions, and the wait wasn't long at all. It's a little far out if you're not in the area, but it was totally worth cabbing over with my friends to try this place. Don't even question it. Chicken to die for.

Reviews.Author: Dean Z.
Reviews.Content: Hands Down Best fried chicken id ever had. Get Management! The Manager SIts you down right away.

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: My son, Spencer, and I were touring LA film school and needed a place to eat afterward. We checked Yelp and found out that Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles was nearby. Spence told me that Roscoe's is Snoop Dogg's favorite restaurant and, since I am nothing if not down with the Snoop Dizzle, we decided to go.I had a combination plate that included two chicken thighs, collard greens, mac and cheese and cornbread. Spence had 3 chicken wings and fries. By some oversight, we neglected to get waffles.  Each of us had a diet coke. The entire meal (not including tip) was about $27.The service was VERY fast and our waitress was attentive, frequently refilling out diet cokes. The chicken was good, probably not the best I've ever had, but certainly top-notch. The slice of cornbread was large and cakey.  They had honey and jelly at the table, but the cornbread was very good with just butter. I liked the mac and cheese, though it could have been creamier. I was disappointed with the greens. They were kind of soggy and didn't have the touch of piquant I like with my collard greens. Spence said his french fries were, "Very southern", whatever that means.We didn't see Snoop Dogg, but it was a good lunch and certainly somewhere I'd go again.

Reviews.Author: Heather F.
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh that was delicious!!!  We spent a week in LA and tried to be total tourists, so had to try this place.  My husband and I both LOVED the food.  He said his waffle was the "best of his life" LOL.  I had real Southern food, mac n cheese, greens and fried chicken with a huge brick-sized block of corn bread and it was amazing!  I wish I had a 5 gallon bucket of those greens right about now!  I am from the South where everybody's grandma can hook up some greens, but haven't been there in and while, and I would have sworn I was at a Sunday dinner at Granny's house.Parking wasn't great and when we went on a Friday evening had to wait 30 minutes to be seated, but SO glad we decided to wait.  The service was very friendly and fast.

Reviews.Author: Dung N.
Reviews.Content: I'm so sad that there isn't any Roscoe's around my area. The first time I tried it was when I was in LA. I've seen it on TV, I've heard about it so many times and I was just super excited to see it for myself. My friend told me it was one of Snoop Dogg's favorite places to eat! Haha.I ordered the 'Country Boy' with what else, waffles! I loved every bit of it. Our waitress told us that the reason why the two compliments each other is because it's cooked with the same batter. I wouldn't have ever paired the two but opposites attract to one great meal in this case. It had a lot of flavor yet it was simple and very delicious.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy W.
Reviews.Content: A bit overpriced, and a bit overrated!  And where the heck was Snoop at?

Reviews.Author: Mae C.
Reviews.Content: Who woulda thunk it.  Chicken and waffles - the perfect breakfast marriage.  It's my unwritten mission to convert all those who have not experienced Roscoe's to chicken and waffle fanatics.My only complaint about Roscoe's is that it takes me forever and a day to decide on my sides - how does one narrow down the choices when your faced with cornbread, mac and cheese, grits, red beans and greens?  If my stomach would allow it, I'd have a feast with it all!The staff always makes you feel like you've just walked into their home and they're more than happy to serve you up a plate of goodness.  "Hey hon, pull up a seat, here's some coffee, stay a while and relax."   That kinda vibe.  I don't live in LA, but along with Houston's for the ribs, we make it a point to stop by Roscoe's for the chicken and waffles every time we're in town.  Until the day that Roscoe's decides to expand it's reach to San Diego, a two hour car ride will have to do to satiate my favorite breakfast cravings.

Reviews.Author: Angie C.
Reviews.Content: I lived in LA for years and never managed to make it to Roscoe's. My friends decided to rectify that this weekend. We had a bit of a wait, but there was a club upstairs playing a great acoustic set that we could hear from the street. I don't mind that kind of wait!Inside was a little warm for after midnight (I think the hours are wrong up top), but man was the food good. I hereby dub the waffles "crack waffles". I also cracked up my server by asking for what I was told is called the "white girl special", a breast of fried chicken and waffle. But our server had red hair and so do I, so I feel we bonded over our laughter and late night silliness.It was a blast. I certainly understand why people get cravings for this place and their crack waffles.

Reviews.Author: Grace C.
Reviews.Content: I definitely come here every time I'm in LA. The waffles are delicious and no one complains about the chicken either. Definitely give it a try. It does get crowded especially on a Friday night so keep that in mind!

Reviews.Author: Rachel T.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my sisters after hiking at the Hollywood sign! We decided to get it to go, which was awesome because we didn't have to wait in line and got the food right away! We got Scoe's #1 with dark meat which was delicious as always, and also got the mac and cheese and candied yams sides. Definitely get those sides they are amazing!

Reviews.Author: Rick R.
Reviews.Content: First time I have had this wild combination...and I loved it!!!The best fried chicken I have tasted.  The cinnamon in the waffles made me want to order another one.  The gravy made me cry...I wanted to sit in it like it was a hot tub.  Can't wait to go back...if I could find parking.  I got lucky and found a spot right in front...but I doubt that will happen again.

Reviews.Author: Darrell L.
Reviews.Content: So the day before I checked out Soul Daddy to great disappointment and to compensate, I had to take a run at Roscoe's for some real soul food. This was my first time ever at Roscoes and I ordered the chicken thigh and a waffle. I also tried the yams and the mac and cheese. The fried chicken was good, not amazing but competent. Our server was friendly fast and efficient. I was impressed how quickly our food arrived after we placed the order.So let's break it down... was the fried chicken the best ever? no, but it was good... real good. I didn't learn until after dinner that I am supposed to hit the chix with hot sauce. I've made fried chicken at home according to the Thomas Keller recipe and that is definitely a superior product, but it's a lot of work and costly to utilize Keller's recipe. The waffle... tastes good, but nothing special. The butter was soft and the syrup was good, I don't know if it is real maple syrup or fake, but it tasted good to me. The mac n cheese was again just average. No baked on crust and the noodles were very soft and just a tad bland.A little pricey as beers are $5 on up, however, I am upgrading them to a 4th star because they have an off menu item called the Economy Special. 5 pieces of chicken thighs for $6.00 that is only for take out, but it is a great deal! Would be perfect for a potluck or picnic.I think it gets above average reviews cause so many are drunk people and food tastes better when you are drunk.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: Even though I got a massive stomach ache after eating at Roscoe's, I'm still delighted to give them five stars, because their chicken and waffles are just THAT damn good. Quite possibly the fluffiest waffles I've ever had and the tastiest fried chicken also. Mmm mmm mmm! The biscuits were okay and I wasn't too impressed with their smothered potatoes, but I'm willing to overlook it, because they had some kickass chicken and waffles! I would also have loved them more if they weren't a franchise, but who cares, just pass me the chicken and waffles!

Reviews.Author: claudia r.
Reviews.Content: You should see me dip my chicken in syrup...my friends laugh at me cause I always ask for extra syrup...sorry i'm a dipper! LOL...Roscoe's is just fingerlinking mouthwatering absof*ckinlutely delicious!!! You have to try it!!! PS. yes, i feel guilty after eating so much fat...thats why I only allow myself to eat this every other mmm....2-3 months... I just feel guilty sorry! LOL!

Reviews.Author: Samantha J.
Reviews.Content: You know it's worth it when all you hear around the table are mixtures of orgasmic moans and "OHH MY GAHHD SOOO GOOD MMMMM GOOD CHICKEN GOOD WAFFLES mMmMMmmMMm OH MY GAHHHD." Yes.There isn't much parking; I guess we were lucky to find a spot quickly. We were walking toward Roscoe's and there was already a woman at the open door to greet us and take us to our table.The place is well air-conditioned - I was so cold! But you get kind of used to it once you start eating. Our waitress was so chill and nice! My friends and I all ordered SCOE'S and a few of us ordered a biscuit. I thought that it would've taken a while to get our food, but the service was surprisingly fast!Their waffles smell different than any other waffle I've had. They even taste different than any other waffle I've had. I don't know why this is, but man is it SOOOO GOOOD. They're pretty huge too; they take up over half the plate. The southern-style chicken is soo nice and crispy - I love the skin! It's yummy and soo crunchy, mm. Their chicken covered in gravy is good as well! I dipped my southern-style chicken in my friend's gravy - MMMMM. With one hand holding a fork of waffle and the other holding a piece of chicken, I was a happy girl. The combination is wonderful - whoever thought of that... man, kudos to you.I didn't get to finish all my food - I got really full, so I took some of my food home (the leftovers are still good to eat for breakfast the next morning!). When we were done, the waitress gave us toothpicks and those wipes in those little packets - good lookin' out, Roscoe's.A great experience, especially if you live in San Diego and you have to drive through all that L.A. traffic to get to your chicken and waffle destination.

Reviews.Author: Mai Z.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to go eat here in such a loooong time.  I know I live closer to the Long Beach one, but I happen to be in LA on Saturday with two of my good friends and we all never had Roscoe's before (seriously, what's wrong with us!).It didn't take long for us to get seated (there is only 3 of us).  I asked the server what is the most popular meal there.  She pointed out three items on the menu.  It's really depending on how hungry you were.  I wasn't that hungry, so I went with number 9, the three wings and one waffle.  Both my friends got the two piece chicken with 2 waffles.  One chose the breast and thigh and the other got breast and leg.  Judging from what they got, I suggest the breast and thigh (leg was kinda small).  The waffle was really good.  I'm so glad I only got one waffle.  If there was a waffle contest, I'd lose hands down!  I can't see how people can eat soooo many waffles or pancakes.  That's just too much carbs.  However, the wings I ate were gone before I even know it!  It was love at first bite!  Have you ever had those moments when you had the best, and now you can't go anywhere else because everywhere else just sucks?  Well that's how it is for me now when it comes to fried chicken!  The outside was crunchy and the spices weren't overwhelming, but you can still taste it.  The inside was extremely juicy.  I've noticed that fried chicken is not overly salted like most places (cough cough KFC cough cough).Whoever put the combo of chicken and waffles together, you deserve the nobel prize!  It's harmony when you put the two together!If I were to say one negative thing about this place, I'll have to say that I'm not a big fan of their mac and cheese.  There's no flavor to it and it's pretty expensive for the amount they give you.  Just stick to the chicken and waffles!

Reviews.Author: Czarina A.
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! I'm from Hawai'i and this is my first time eating chicken and waffles. At first I was quite apprehensive about the combination itself.... fried chicken, waffles and maple syrup??? My taste buds found it difficult to comprehend the combination. But alas!!! It was absolutely wonderful! The southern fried chicken was perfectly crispy (not soppy with oil like KFC), their gravy with onions was to die for!!!, and their waffles... it was a better version of Eggo Waffles, but of course homemade!  Everything just hit the spot! It was only a few min walk from our hotel (we stayed at the W on Hollywood) and went around noon. The wait is about an 1 hr, but it was well worth it. Though they did specialize in chicken and waffles, their combination plates were also quite yummy with greens, corn bread, mac & cheese, and of course their famous fried chicken! I can't wait to go back again! Just thinking about it makes my mouth water..... yummy =)

Reviews.Author: lucy b.
Reviews.Content: I honestly never ever thought I would like my fried chicken anywhere near a bed of waffles. Actually, I am not a great fan of fried chicken or chicken thighs... Until now! It's a long long wait outside but well worth it! The staff is wonderful and they will mix and match just about anything you like. I happen to need like a gallon of syrup and a pound of butter and the staff at Roscoe's is very sympathetic. I look forward to a visit anytime we are in the area.

Reviews.Author: Alexander Aaron P.
Reviews.Content: Get the chicken wings.Get the mac and cheese.Get the greens.so...CHICKEN WING DO YO THING

Reviews.Author: David O.
Reviews.Content: Mmh...mmh...mmh.Thank god for whoever it was that woke up one morning and decided to combine breakfast with their dinner from last night. Could food get any more delicious? I think not.Their waffles are awesome. I have had better Fried Chicken before, but their is not bad by any stretch of the imagination, crispy and delicious. I personally like to dip my Fried Chicken in the Louisiana Hot Sauce and I usually get the Herb's Special #2 and split it with whoever is with me. Continuing with their theme of combining things to great affect, their eclipse, a drink combining Orange Juice, Fruit Punch and Lemonade, is incredible.Did I mention that this place is probably the most reasonably priced popular restaurant you will ever go to? Well, it is. The best Fried Chicken you will have in the middle of the night, I guarentee it. Go, eat, fall in love, take a nap in your car, and drive home safely.

Reviews.Author: Ralph G.
Reviews.Content: This is what I usually get:A thigh and a waffle, mac n cheese, and an iced tea. If I'm extra hungry, I like to get some of the greens, corn bread, or their grits - sometimes all three.I'd say this location is a little more bourgie compared to the one on Pico, but that's because it's in Hollywood. It's still on of my favorite restaurants though!In conclusion:Good service, great people, better food!

Reviews.Author: Ces C.
Reviews.Content: Had the half-chicken with gravy & onions and waffles.  And a side of macaroni and cheese.  Our waitress decided it was a good time to go home and disappeared, so it took a while to get the check.  The food more than made up for it.  Chicken was good (I had the dark meat).  Gravy was good.  Waffles were good.  I had the dark meat.  The macaroni and cheese was awesome.  I'm not a connoisseur or anything, but it was the best mac & cheese I can remember eating.  I was with two friends, we were looking for a place to eat after a Lakers game.  And told them I know a place.  We enjoyed ourselves.  Afterwards they asked "How'd you hear about it?  Food network or something?"  Answer: Rap songs.Going back to Cali - Notorious B.I.G.Linens and things, I begin things People start to flash, 818's, 213's 313's, B.I.G. Frequently floss hoes at Roscoe's Hustler Remix - Murs (and John Cena of all people)I hustle like the homey Fo-Five, rest in peace. While you bark a lot about your glock, never had to walk the walk.  You ain't a gangster homeboy, just a dude who likes to talk a lot.  That's why you got your chain snatched in a Roscoe's parking lot Murda - The GameToday there been 10 murders in South Central alone. The boys in the hood said Cube been gone too long. So take my advice, I'm talkin' to all rappers, When you eat a Roscoe's watch out for the chain snatchers. Some Freeway songTell Philly Phil Free comin' to town.  And we can blaze thirty L's, once I get off the plane.  And go shoot past Roscoe's for chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Graham B.
Reviews.Content: There are two ways to go here:  go the straight chicken and waffle route, or get the less sweet option of the chicken covered in gravy and onions with grits.  Either one is delicious and it really depends on your personal palate.  I will say, for anyone intimidated by  the prospect of someting "smothered in gravy", don't be.  It's incredible.Their side dishes are also excellent.  I'm from the south, and the collards and grits definitely pass the test.  Though the mac and cheese was lackluster...  Don't bother with that.Service was a tad slow at first (tough to get a waiter), but once we did the food came quickly and the waitress was attentive.

Reviews.Author: Soi L.
Reviews.Content: Today(9/5/11) we had a craving for fried chicken and we were at work and since my co-worker never had Roscoe's...so I decided to call 11:50am to make an order 10 minutes before we drive to pick it up. The lady over the phone said 10-15 minutes...we get there 20 minutes later.  My friend went inside to pick up the to go food, since it there weren't any parking, I was waiting for a parking spot. 15 minutes later I was able to park and go inside. I found out our order was not ready..not a big deal being a holiday and all.  But 40 minutes into our order... Still nothing, while the lady is bringing out to go orders that are not ours and asking if it's ours and each time I would tell them that I order the country girl and two orders of waffles. Now the two lady asking me who took the order over the phone since they did not see the to-go order!?!  We were wondering if they didn't see the order in the first place...why they didn't place the order after the first couple times we told them what we order!?! So we're 45 minutes into this since my called order and we only have an hour for lunch?!?  So frustrating!!! So we bail without our order and promising to never go back again!!!

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
Reviews.Content: I heard from a couple of people that Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles was good. We waited for 27 minutes before getting seating. I love chicken, but not chicken with bones....so I ordered mac & cheese, waffles, and sweet tea.The mac & cheese was good (B+). It was not super-cheesy, but had a good flavor. The waffles were not good (C-) because they were not crispy, but instead softer and chewy. I had a hard time cutting through the waffles with my fork and butter knife. I actually had to rip through the waffles to make smaller pieces. The sweet tea was okay (C+), but was not quite sweet enough. The tea tasted like it was made with artificial sweetener instead of sugar. I also tried the chicken (my sister cut some pieces for me) and it was pretty good, (B).Overall, Roscoe's was okay but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Author: Pam S.
Reviews.Content: I don't like this location as much as I like the one in Pasadena but only because I think the service here is not as great as the other locations. This could be due to the volume that this location turns.One thing I can say about all of the Roscoe's Chicken and Waffle's the recipes are consistent no matter what location you choose the chicken and waffles are the same as well as the other items on the menu.Parking here in Hollywood is a BI-YATCH you are lucky to find any as this is in a residential neighborhood to the back and just right off of Sunset Blvd. I have never been here at any time in the past 18 years where I didn't have to wait to be seated and the food orders take longer as well as this location... again probably due to the fact that this one is a LOT busier.  It is also rather dark inside =/ and the front counter staff (every time I have been here) aren't really all that friendly and I have seen Security at this location I'm just sayin...Respectfully Reviewed

Reviews.Author: Jay E.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe...don't ask me why it took so long to review your succulent thighs and sweet buttery waffles!Venue: Small...I hope you can eat fast b/c if you don't they'll be shoe'ing you out before you're finished to let more people in. Decent parking on the street. The service is very friendly and makes you feel like you're at home. *If you want more room and not to be rushed...drive to the Long Beach location.Food: #1 Scoe special w/ side of grits, red beans and rice and a Sunrise drink. The food will make you slap yo mama...seriously.

Reviews.Author: OIivia H.
Reviews.Content: I haven't had some Roscoes in a loooong time, being that I went veg about 3 years ago, but Roscoes at 2am on a club buzz just sounded like the best idea in the world! From what I remember the place was busy but we were seated right away... The comments about the "urban community" getting preference or "being white and having to wait" are ridonkulous, there were people of all colors just chillin, eating chicken. Take a breath and wait your turn people, it's just chicken.Anyway, I got eggs with onions and cheese, and kept insisting there was no cheese in them, I distinctly remember they were really wet and runny, but I poured some hot sauce all over them and got down, I was hongray like that. The waffle was like a flat dry eggo with not nearly enough syrup. I stole some cornbread from my BFF and it was dry, hubby had chicken and said he was expecting "more." I think that pretty much sums up my feelings, I just was expecting MORE.I did get the 'itis though!

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: After a night of partying, chicken and waffles hit the spot.I got the 1 piece drumstick with waffle. The drumstick was pretty tiny but still tasty. The waffle was soft and came with a hunk of butter. I poured hot sauce on the drumstick and syrup on the waffle then took a bit of each for each bite. Yum. I actually couldn't finish my waffle.The mac and cheese is pretty good, not too cheesy and the macaroni was al dente. And if you have space in your stomach (or just order to go), the sweet potato pie is delicious. If you're going as a group, I'd suggest just splitting a waffle and ordering a bunch of chicken pieces a la carte- the breast pieces is the largest and meatiest.

Reviews.Author: Shelley L.
Reviews.Content: Beyond the best thing since sliced bread. My friend came to visit from Boston and I had to take her to this institution. I'm glad that this is not a chain because I do not want to know how many calories I ate in one meal.Chicken - why are thee so incredibly good, warm juicy, tender and amazing?Waffle- so buttery and with syrup so sweet and wonderfulCornbread - flaky and flavorfulCollared greens - so wonderful, I hope you use ham hocks for that flavormac & cheese - cheesy, cheesy, cheesy, need I say more?Sweet potato pie - you're so sweet you're like candy wrapped up in cakeI ate way to much, but I will be back again to eat way too much again.

Reviews.Author: Christina K.
Reviews.Content: Back to Roscoe's after years on hiatus. I didn't recall my first trip here as being memorable and the second time holds true. For a 1AM meal, it could be worse, but I've definitely had better waffles and fried chicken. We also tried the mac-n-cheese, greens, and mashed potatoes. Mac and greens were alright, but was not a fan of the potatoes. First off, it's not mashed so it shouldn't be called that. There were just big chunks of potato in gravy. It was bland. Felt like an old cafe or diner inside, but without charm or personality. It's interesting to look around at what club-goers look like in the light. Umm...some not so great. Dresses too short, things hanging where they shouldn't be hanging, slopped on make-up with minimal blend. As it got closer to 2-3AM place got a little more crowded since clubs were shutting down. Parking: There's a pay lot across the street...$5. Or you find street parking. I think valet was $10. There's a Thai restaurant upstairs attached to the building. Music blasting out of that place upon arrival. Weird. Then on the way out, karaoke. Who the hell feels like singing karaoke at 3 in the morning anyway?! Weird. Can't hear this from within Roscoes, but found it humorous.

Reviews.Author: Luis D.
Reviews.Content: I had less than 24 hours in LA so I was only going to get one shot at a real sit down meal and the one place that came to mind as a must go was Roscoes. I mean this place is mentioned in movies and by comedians. I figured it was a must do and perhaps maybe it would taste good too.Well, let me tell you this place does not disappoint. The staff is wonderful. They are very attentive and that is even more amazing considering this place is busy often.The food that I got was two waffles and two pieces of chicken for around 10 bucks and it was well worth it. Some may say that is over priced, but let me tell you this. I left more than full and quite happy at the strange juxtaposition of eating two sinfully delicious meals that should never have met, but thankfully for my taste buds have met.Each bite was like Jesus moonwalking on my tongue into my belly. Darn good meal and I will be coming back when I move out here. Love it.

Reviews.Author: Chel R.
Reviews.Content: Finally had the chance to try this place.I had the three wings and waffles (the obama plate)He had their daily special ..chicken with gravy rice and biscuits.I was pleasantly satisfied. Guaranteed food coma! Chicken didn't feel greasy at all and with just the right amount of crunch to bite and moist in the inside. Thistranslates to YUM!Waffles were soft and light. Rice gravy..hurt me good...and biscuits were comforting to the tummy. After a long Sunday from Brunch with my girls, attendingthe World Music Festival at the Hollywood Bowl, andgrubbin here at Roscoe's close to midnight... it was agood day:)

Reviews.Author: Jeff R.
Reviews.Content: I have, on multiple occasions, driven all the way to Los Angeles just for some 'scoe's. I am certain I will do it again.I have also written several letters to our Governor petitioning him to make marraige between man and restaurant legal so I can finally make sweet, legitimate love to Roscoe's House of Chicken 'n' Waffles. O, succulent breasts. O, delicious waffles, how I love thee! May our matrimony someday become right in the eyes of God and the law.

Reviews.Author: CHERiE Y.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's has been "Pecking Around Since 1975", so you know there's nothing foul about it (sorry, couldn't resist!)! What about it keeps customers coming back? Perhaps it's just the odd combination (Chicken? Waffles?!) or maybe it's just the fact that Roscoe's offers damn good comfort food! The Gower location is very low-key and has a cozy, locals feel. I wasn't disappointed in the food one bit :) However, for the health conscious-- I would not recommend frequent visits.

Reviews.Author: Chie J.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Fried chicken!  Roscoe's is da shit cuz,- Cheken ain't  greasy.  Finger licking good baby!- I like the gizzard for real!- Tasty syrup for the waffles - Bomb ass smothered Potatoes w/ gravyI ain't hating but the Mac & Cheese was wack - tasted like WIC cheese.  I can cook up greens better than Roscoe's with some ham hock.     youtube.com/watch?v=Nc-A…

Reviews.Author: Susan H.
Reviews.Content: We don't come here enough.    It's been a while so I had no idea they expanded.  I thought for sure we'd have to wait.  I sent hubs in to put our name down and Scoe's security guard shoo'd me in.  No wait? No!We had the yummy goodness of:-One leg, one thigh and 1 waffle -Side of mac & cheese-Two thighs, greens, mac & cheese and cornbreadEverything was so good.  The only cons of the meal were:-Our tiny table for 2 - I get that they are saving the larger tables for groups of 3-4 but seriously, these tables are so so tiny.-The stupid girls who couldn't help but gawk over some pro basketball player who was tucked away in the back trying to eat his chicken & waffles.  Groupies. Ugh. Get a life.Until next time Scoes. Tonight perhaps?

Reviews.Author: Aaron J.
Reviews.Content: I have finally found myself jealous of LA over something... Anything. As hundreds have already found out about the legendary Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles, it is the place where dreams come true. Dreams of fried chicken, hot waffles, cornbread and hush puppies, all covered in delicious syrup or hot sauce. I have never been to a place that provided a more enjoyable experience in LA, with a fun staff and fairly reasonable prices. The best part (Other than the unbelievably perfect food) was when a group of black kids sitting in the corner laughed out loud as they saw my white New Jerseyan friend wearing a purple polo, white sneakers, khaki cargo shorts and a sweater tied around his neck trotted by.Combine fun intercultural experiences with the hands-down best fried chicken I've ever had in my life and you have an institution that I have considered making the 400 mile trip solely for. I really, really wish there were a Roscoe's here in San Francisco. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. Incredible.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L.
Reviews.Content: I saw R.Kelly at this Roscoe's. No joke. And this was at the time he was getting over his 'sex tape piss on you' phase, but right before he was trapped in the closet. When my friends and I got there, there was a huge tourbus in front of restaurant. I didn't make anything of it and proceeded to wait about 30 minutes before being seated. It's pretty cramped inside, but they seat us right next to R.Kelly's table. So needless to say, we were all trying to be slick and try to look at him.Anyway, I had the chicken and waffles and it was hella good, but killing me softly inside. They give you 2 shot glasses on syrup and 2 ice cream sized scoops of butter. So after this visit, I made a couple more trips to this place mostly with friends from out of town and I've grown to not crave it because it's so fatty and greasey. But now that i'm back in the Bay Area, I wouldn't mind some right now. Ohh and a sunrise (half lemonade/orange juice)

Reviews.Author: Henry W.
Reviews.Content: Overcooked tiny pieces of fried chicken: check.Soggy, lifeless waffles: check.Mac n cheese that my blind quadriplegic girlfriend could make better: check.Sticky tables: check.Overpriced and overrated meal: check.

Reviews.Author: Leon R.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles? The novelty indeed lived up to the hype.  This is a case of the whole being greater than the sum of the parts.  Starting with the waffles, they didn't seem much different than eggos; then again, I'm no waffle connoisseur.  And what's up with all that butter? Of the three big scoops, one did me just fine.  The fried chicken was tasty, but put it together with the waffle and syrup, and you have something really special. So how does one go about attacking these seemingly mismatched items?  Chicken first, and then the waffle for dessert? Waffle and then chicken? Alternating bites of chicken and waffle? Or *gasp* chicken and waffle in the same bite? These are the kinds of questions that keep me up at night.A few gripes.  I know these guys specialize in chicken and waffles, but coffee will be scrutinized.  This is breakfast after all, and the coffee just wasn't strong enough.  Another small bone to pick was that it took ages to get our food.  My friend said that the celeb who came in after us got food before we did, but I'm not the most observant person in the AM, especially after being served weak coffee.  Kind of lame if that's the case.  Fortunately, the nice mix of families, locals, tourists, and the celeb made for a nice vibe and somewhat tolerable wait.Fun experience overall, worth braving the long Sunday morning line.

Reviews.Author: Christina H.
Reviews.Content: mm delicious! So i decided that since i was in Irvine, I would have to take a day trip to Los angeles to try all the places that people were constantly talking about. This was my 2nd stop after Pinks and i was still stuffed but i had to try it. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles with the biscuit and mashed potatoes and gravy and it was delicious!!! The fried chicken was really tasty and eating it with the waffles was something different for me but I really enjoyed it! I love meee my mashed potatoes and gravy and this was just as good as the chicken and waffles. I was over the top stuffed when i was finished with this meal but i was happily pleased. I should have stopped here first before Pinks and tried everything on the menu. Theres always next time!

Reviews.Author: Michele M.
Reviews.Content: I've been here only once and had the chicken patty sandiwch. It came with fries, but I should have gotten the potato salad. The fries were limpy, not crispy. The chicken patty was breaded and deep fried. Very tasty. The bun was toasted. Waitress came frequently. Good service. Beer and wine served. Next time I will try the waffles.Cheers!

Reviews.Author: j s.
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those people who can eat breakfast anywhere, at anytime, but here ordering the chicken omelete is a MUST!It's so cheesy, and loaded with chicken.   Toss on a ton of hot sauce, and bam!Then work your way into the waffle... go ahead.. load up the syrup, after about 4 pats of butter!!It's a great feeling walking out of this place just stuffed!It's crowded, and that's the only bad thing.The service is pretty quick also, because they want to get those tables cleared and refilled, which is quite alright with me!

Reviews.Author: Fat C.
Reviews.Content: Part of my trip to LA was to experience the famous chicken N waffles at Roscoe's. I ordered the #2 Scoes, which came with two pieces of chicken in gravy and 2 waffles. My hunny on the other hand, wasn't feeling chicken  and ordered the Big Mama Special: scramble eggs, potatoes in gravy and two sausages. His  came first and i burst out LOL. His sausages were two mini panko patties, about the size of dollar quarter. Dayum, can't yall hook us up with some jimmy deans instead? I thought i would redeem us with my order. It looked just as good as the pictures, but sadly I could not give it the overly hyped 5 star rating. The chicken came out hot and it was decent. However, i was really hoping the waffles would be the savior. I had high expectations of warm, golden brown, lightly toasted and caramelized Belgium waffles. NOPE. Waffles tasted like pancakes = MOOSHY. My dreams of savory Chicken N waffles shattered. Sad Face.

Reviews.Author: Karl C.
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in LA I visited Roscoe's and it was the BOMB.COM! At first I was not going to go because I haven't eaten Waffles since I was kid and the thought of having Waffles and Chicken together in one setting for breakfast sounded really weird to me. However a friend of mine in LA said you have to try it out and yes that I had to eat the Waffles with the Chicken. So I did and I am a fan of Chicken & Waffles from now on. :-)

Reviews.Author: Cleo M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to every location.It's home cooking...I ordered the same thing all the time. The Oscar - it's just so good. I'm not a fan of waffles, just never been my thang but grits and biscuits is all me. Each location(minus the one is Pasadena have people their you should wanna know) like "Mama" . If you haven't tried it, mmm...soul food is what you've been missing.

Reviews.Author: Sean F.
Reviews.Content: For years I, dreamed of visiting Roscoe's. No, seriously -- all it took was someone saying the magical phrase, "chicken 'n' waffles," and something lit up in my stomach's imagination. It's a testament to the joint that all you need to do is utter the unusual food combo in the title, and you get it -- yes, I would ABSOLUTELY love some chicken with my waffles.  The sweet with the savory?  All at once?  Unbeatable. Given that there are no franchises in Orange County , it's been tough for me to get there, however, and scratch this particular culinary itch.  Also, my S.O. was unconvinced (just as she, true blue Midwesterner that she is, initially expressed disgust at the concept of the fish taco --  a quick trip to Wahoo's changed her mind).  What cinched it, finally, was discovering that there's a Roscoe's around the corner from Amoeba Records on Sunset. So, I put a stake in the ground and said, "This year for my birthday?  Roscoe's for brunch, then Amoeba for presents." It doesn't get much better. A quick note on the actual food: the fried chicken can stand alone. A little dry, but explosively flavorful, and not abundantly greasy. Only unusual thing to note: erm ... ENOURMOUS parts.  No, really: the breast was as big as my forearm. Like whatever hovers above Pamela Anderson's  solar plexus these days, such things do not occur in nature. The waffles? I would not eat them unaccompanied. They're a bit mushy, and reminded me a bit of soggy Eggos. Smothered in syrup and butter and eaten in the same bite as a hunk of tender fried chicken, though?  Heaven on a fork.

Reviews.Author: Amanda A.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend is all about this place. Last time we went to LA, we had to go eat chicken and waffles. We arrive at the place and of course, I was skeptical about the combo. So, I ask the guy resembling Bernie Mac if I could see the menu, and possibly get something like 2 eggs any style with some bacon and toast...Bernie replies, out loud, in front of everyone:"Menu?? You don't need to see the menu!! Chicken and waffles, that's what we got, chicken and waffles!"Needless to say, I got chicken and waffles with the gravy on the side. mmm mmm MMMMM!!!! Talk about finger lickin' good. And that gravy, ohhhhh that gravy was so buttery, and the waffles!!! Tasty without the need to use any syrup (I did anyway). I think we ate there around noon...I didn't eat the rest of the day. haha....damn good food. damn good.

Reviews.Author: Rekha G.
Reviews.Content: If the Fresh Prince frequented this place on that silly TV show (whilst he lived in freakin Bel Air) then you know this place has to be hands-down effin amazing...that's what I thought when I dragged my girlfriends down here.We were not disappointed!!! Some mothafizzin fried chicken on a waffle with sizzurp drizzled all up on it....I think that's how you might describe it. Anyhoo, it was damn good!Atmosphere left something to be desired but the food was so DAMN good and so DAMN cheap - it didn't matter. Perfect food in the late night!

Reviews.Author: Krista G.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty fantastic. I ordered the waffles and my friend and her mom both got chicken plates. Grits are pretty tasteless and it seems as though you are eating nothing. Very odd feeling. The waffles were fantastic! They were just the right flavor and they were ginormous! I could eat those waffles for DAYS.The chicken was also very good. The skin was just the right crispiness and I enjoyed munching on a piece of my friend's wing. Service was pretty fast. Our food was brought out five minutes after we ordered it and I was very impressed with that aspect.
