There is only one hour street parking outside and our parking meter said "fail" on it, so we asked the hostess and she said we could still park there for an hour, but we should probably check back because sometimes the meters randomly start working again. Boo to that. No ticket for us, though! Yay!Nom Nom Nom

Reviews.Author: Roxy H.
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The chicken was dry and overcooked.  If you gave this place more than 1 star, you've never had good eating! The waffles were dry and packed with cinnamon or something.  Not good! Our waitress disappeared and NEVER returned.  We asked another waitress to go find her. I thought maybe our batch of chicken was just bad because of the rave reviews. I also wanted another soda and napkins.  That waitress didn't find our waitress but instead returned with the check! In short I was pissed and did not leave a tip. Don't eat there! It's all hype.

Reviews.Author: Mari H.
Reviews.Content: Mmm Chicken and Waffles! Maybe not so much the chicken, but damn the waffles are delicious. Roscoe's is an experience you can't have anywhere else -- You just have to see for yourself! Great feel and vibe, homey atmosphere, quick service, and mmm mmm mmmm. Prepare for an immediate food coma upon consummation. Late night service earns the fourth star.

Reviews.Author: Emily Y.
Reviews.Content: Waffling (haha) between 3-4 stars for this place. It's pretty much crowded at all times, but when we arrived, we had to wait for about 45 minutes. Not too bad, given that we were in the midst of the lunch crowd.I ordered a quarter fried chicken and waffles and although I wasn't a fan of combining the two together, I have to say that this was still pretty darn good. We also ordered some collard greens and grits, which were very, very good.

Reviews.Author: Josh W.
Reviews.Content: I can see why this place is an institution.  The chicken and waffles here are done very well.  Both the crispy and smothered options were very good.  the waffles were nice and fluffy as well, served with a ton of butter and syrup.  Even the smallest serving size, a quarter chicken with 2 waffles is a lot of food.  I tried to finish it all and I was stuffed.  The chicken itself was nice and crispy, and the crust was tasty and savory.  Solid chicken and waffle place.

Reviews.Author: Daniel D.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to try Roscoe's after seeing Wicked at the Pantages.  We stopped by at around 11 on a Sunday night and were brought straight to a table with no wait.  The waitress was so sweet, she was a little slow to get our orders because of how busy the place was, but once we put them in our food was ready in no time.  We all got the Carol C. Special  - one chicken breast and one waffle, and shared a bowl of mashed potatoes with gravy, which was probably about the cheapest thing on the menu, but no less amazing!  I look forward to trying the other location in Long Beach soon.

Reviews.Author: Darren W.
Reviews.Content: First time I heard about Roscoe's, I was shocked that people would eat fried chicken and waffles w/ syrup together.  But after eating at this place, i understand why it's a great combination.  It's unexplainable how well the fried chicken and waffles w/ syrup combine to create such a great taste.  It's just one of the best thing's ever invented.  Fried chicken was some of the best fried chicken I've ever had.  It had a great crispy and crunchy outside.  It was seasoned to perfection and the meat was very juicy,not dry.  They used very good sized pieces of chicken to fry, they didn't use some small pieces of chicken legs or anything.  The waffles were great, I loved the hint of cinnamon in them.  I just wish the waffles had a little more crunch on the outside.   Throw on the maple syrup, and you're in heaven.  My friend had the gravy on top of his chicken and he couldn't finish it.  So i tried some of his and DAMN it was GOOD.  Portions are huge and service was very friendly.  I live in SF and wish they had a roscoe's up here.  I've been craving it ever since i left SoCal...

Reviews.Author: Dan N.
Reviews.Content: Indulge yourself in the world of Chicken and the world of Waffles in the same universe.Syrup and Butter, Gravy and Breading, married perfectly to conceive the most slothy and heathenist yet godly and heavenly dish of deliciousness .Paired with a sunrise or sunset, and I am in a state of bliss.   It's like ying and yang, god and the devil, good and evil, wright and wrong, love and lust, they go together and create a balance, life is beautiful but not without realizing how ugly it can be.  It's a perfect circle and the dishes in this restaurant paint the picture so eloquently spread over your palettes.HAHA just kidding but I love this place!!!!!!!!!!!  CHICKEN AND WAFFLES YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM.   Order a #4 and a Sunset!!!!!!You can learn a lot about a person by what they order here.

Reviews.Author: Brad R.
Reviews.Content: This one night a few months back while I was trying to drown myself in sorrow over my girlfriend, who I had dumped around this time and spent a lot of time kicking myself over, I recalled to my friend that she'd kept going on about how we'd have to go to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles because it was awesome. It seemed like a really good idea to get as drunk as possible at 2 a.m. on a Saturday night and go to Roscoe's.With two tallboys of 211 bubbling in our bellies we made our way to Roscoe's door. They have a bouncer guy and you have to wait outside before they let you in to sit, but we were pretty much immediately seated even though the place was full of people. By the time we sat down we were both so drunk that I was surprised people couldn't just look at us and tell how drunk we were. I was kind of swimming in my seat, since I weigh about half as much as my friend and had the same amount of alcohol. I am pretty sure part of my blood had been replaced by 211.When the waiter (or waitress, whoever it was had a face so blurry I can't really recall what gender they were or what language they spoke to me in) came over to us we said we'd never been here before and wondered what everyone orders. They pointed at something on the menu and we said YES THAT PLEASE. Don't remember what it was, specifically, but when it showed up it was a plate of waffles and chicken (surprising, really, considering where we were) and, boy, when I could actually focus my vision on it and stop my head from lolling about on my shoulders like John Paul II, it looked pretty tasty.After saying something like, "Oh my God, I can't believe I am this drunk," we dug into our plates and ate silently, ravenously.Now, I'm telling you, you should listen to all these other reviewers who tell you that the food is good. I probably can't be trusted. I was beyond drunk, not only on a $1 can of malt liquor, but also on self-pity, so just about anything would have tasted good at the time, but...I had preconceived notions of how good chicken could taste. I like chicken. It tastes like chicken and it's hard to screw it up. Roscoe's chicken was really good.What surprised me, however, was how good those waffles were. They were delicious. It was like God came down from his invisible throne in the sky and delivered my drunk ass a plate of spongy wonderful goodness and reconfigured my tastebuds in such a way that when I ate it it was like my tongue had a little clitoris on it that was being caressed lovingly by the ribs on the waffle. I mean, I was drunk, but come on, THAT drunk? The waffles must have been good.All in all: Dang.I have never been back. Subconsciously I am probably scared of something this tasty. Consciously it's just a far drive and I don't really believe the food was as good as it was and if I eat it sober and it isn't really tasty it will forever tarnish the memory of the waffle performing cunnilingus on my tongue. I can't risk it.Fact check: Apparently Roscoe's is only open til midnight. In this review I state that it was 2 a.m., though I am pretty sure it was 1 a.m.. It turns out that I can't possibly be right here, so I'll assume we were there at about 11 p.m. I'll also assume that no one cares but I don't want anybody ever callin' me a liar, ya hear?

Reviews.Author: Nancy G.
Reviews.Content: I would be lying if I said it wasn't Snoop Dog's show, Fatherhood that brought me to Roscoe's.  Seeing that he ate there day in and day out, I had to see for myself if it was as good as it was hyped up to be.  After 20 minutes of waiting in line, I was able to put my curiosity to rest.  We were seated in the frontal section of the restaurant with very dim lights & wood paneled walls (gave off a barnyard feel).  The waitress quickly took my order of thigh and waffle, while my friend had the breast and waffle, which she said was amazingly moist.After taking my first bite, I really wanted to ask Snoop, "what is all the hype?"  in my opinion, it wasn't any better than kfc.  I'm not sure if I was just unlucky that day, but my chicken came out luke warm and had no crunch.  If anything, I would of much rather opted for kfc.  It would of been cheaper too.  The waffle on the other hand was quite tasty.  It had a great cinnamon-y nutmeg flavor, that i found quite comforting. It reminded me of fresh baked holiday bread.  1 star for service with a smile, another star for perfecting a moist chicken breast, and one more star for creating such a unique waffle flavor.

Reviews.Author: Jenn W.
Reviews.Content: On my other visits to Cally, i love my Chicken & waffles. Thank goodness don't eat this all the time. Hear my arteries clogging up , or be like 250lbs...LOL!! But its like only once every 1-3 yrs-if I'm lucky. But When I do go, wanna be bad -get off your regimen, this is the place for it.2-pc chicken, with waffles. More then enough. Get house fruit punch. This concoction they make probably got some kool -aid mix with crystal lite for all know..but it's Damn-good!!! Can't wait to go back -get some on my visit.

Reviews.Author: Carolina H.
Reviews.Content: I usually eat at the Roscoe's in Long Beach but I have to say, this location beats the LB one by far. Every time I go to the one in LBC, I have to wait anywhere between 30 minutes to an hour. The last time I went, the manager seated us but after 20 minutes of waiting for a server (on top of already waiting in line for half an hour), nobody even came to take our order. AND when I got up to ask the manager for a server, she rolled her eyes at me! Really?!When the chicken finally came, it was dryer than the desert and so I decided that that was the last time I was going to that location.Well, I recently visited the LA location and it was a completely different experience. The staff was very kind and helpful, the service was really fast, and even the ambiance of the place was a lot more welcoming. Oh yeah, and the food...I went with the Scoe's 1/4 meal which is a 1/4 chicken smothered in gravy, and it comes with two waffles. The chicken was tender, juicy, and HOT! Sooo good! The waffles were warm, crunchy, and rich and they had a little hint of vanilla...? Or was it cinnamon? I couldn't tell but alls I know is that it was reaaally good :) if you want to eat at Roscoe's, make a little extra effort and drive to this location.

Reviews.Author: Nhi K.
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for a weekend and had to try out the place to see what the buzz was about. It was okay for me. I don't understand what the hype was about. It was interesting to pair fried chicken with waffles though. It wasn't as bad as I thought it would be, but it's not something I would crave. The server was all over the place. We had to ask for our items twice (water and  utensils) which was not okay. But the host was nice enough to tell us that we had to move our car before 4pm bc the street is closed after that time. I had the fried chicken breast and one waffle (not sure what it was called) the chicken was tender and juicy and I normally don't eat waffles but this was pretty good. Interesting mix dipping the chicken into the syrup.The was only okay for me. Nothing special.

Reviews.Author: Becky A.
Reviews.Content: Had to have some comfort food while out visiting with family, so we found ourselves here at Roscoes.  I had myself the Carol C. Special, one fried chicken breast & one decent size waffle.  There's not way I was able to finish it this day, so I made sure to eat the worst for you YET most delicious fried skin.  Very Flavorful.  I really enjoyed the waffle too.  What i probably should do next time is "syrup as I go" so it didn't end up soggy the way it did.  Otherwise as a none eater of waffles, this one was awesome.  If I had the room, no doubt; my plate would've been cleaned up completely.  Worth a visit if you are in the area.  Also taste one of their special drinks like the Sunset. Yum!

Reviews.Author: DJ Willow f.
Reviews.Content: All I ever eat when I'm in L.A. is Roscoe's!!!!!! Seriously, I think I gained at least five pounds on my last trip, and I had to treat myself to a facial when I got home. I broke out from fried food overload. But it's worth it, all of that sweet crispy goodness.  Sometimes after you've been dancing ALL night the only way to recharge is with fried chicken and a waffle drowned in syrup and whipped butter. Then of course you'll need a nap once the "food lude" hits you. -Dig in-  DJ Willow from Paris Absoultley Loves Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Jo A.
Reviews.Content: Background: We were a group of seven strapping young lads. Food: Bland and Overpriced.  Had the (fried)Chicken breast and Waffle. Service: Awful...The first thing the waiter says (without us asking): "We don't do separate checks. Just so you know." Instead of saying this in an apologetic way, he says it like he is stating the obvious,He does however inform us that we can do two separate transactions on the same bill.(What's the difference?)As we get up to the counter to pay(2 separate transactions, of course)the lady lectures us on the fact that we are supposed to write down who pays for what before we come up to the counter. I tell her, in the humblest of ways, that the waiter never said anything about writing it down beforehand. She informs us that: "That is not his job!"Good bye Roscoe's. I hope not to see you again soon!

Reviews.Author: Iris N.
Reviews.Content: After being disappointed by another restaurant... my Boyfriend and I decided we're not leaving LA till we get our "You can only get it in So Cal" fix. We ordered the Country Boy meal (I think), Wings and a Waffle. The wings were amazing! The batter was seasoned perfectly and crispy and the chicken was moist but cooked all the way through... and not greasy! I wish the waffle was little more crispy. It was very flimzy or soggy? Maybe those are not the right words... It's possible that it got soggy since it was in the to go container with the other wings... but we didn't leave it in there too long? Just took a few pics outside before we left. BBut it tasted good. It taste like it had a bit of sugar/cinnamon mixed in.I would def come back!

Reviews.Author: Sabrina G.
Reviews.Content: Are you kidding me with how friggin good this is??? Ok so yes...  I love greasy food. I love fried food. BUT I wold rate this as amazing as I did even if i didnt. Mmmmmm.... The fried chicken is super good and juicy! My random favorite thing on the menu: the scrambled eggs and cheese!! OMG I want it now! Go for breakfast and get the eggs, a waffle, and some chicken!

Reviews.Author: KayRenee H.
Reviews.Content: As one reviewer mentioned, this is definitely a "When Friends Come Into Town" spot.  It's famous and the food is good.  But it's just  SO uncomfortable, looky-loo and touristy. I go to another part of town for my soul food fix these days.

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's was off the damn chain. The wait was about 20 minutes, but it was worth it. The food was great. I had an omelet with the chicken chili on top and waffle. That was some of the best chili that I've ever had in my life. Next time I'm in Cali I will have to hit up Roscoe's again.

Reviews.Author: Nathan M.
Reviews.Content: You delicious bastard.The wait to get in is worth it.  Fried chicken & waffles - such an unlikely pair, but damned if they don't make a delicious couple.The neighborhood is kinda sketchy, but that's part of the ambiance.  This chicken is good enough to get stabbed for.Also, does the interior remind anyone else of being on a boat?

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: Its interesting and I can see how its unique, but this stuff will KILL you.  Not to say it wasn't good, but eating this will make you HUUUUUGE.We went here because its sort of a cult following here in LA and I was from out of town.  We came at nighttime and the location its in is a BIT on the shady side, especially when walking up to the place with a bouncer in it, but we were given a table promptly.  I got the waffles and chicken for $12 and got 2 large waffles and 2 pieces of dark chicken.  Lots of waffles, not so much chicken.  I can't say the waffles were too good because I definitely could have made better with a toaster and eggo and it wouldve stayed crispy...the ones at Rosco's were definitely not.  The chicken was deep fried perfectly and were GREAT to eat.  Two drumsticks though doesn't seem like much of a meal to me.  I would recommend getting a chicken dish and maybe getting a waffle on the side.  Cornbread was THICK, it was good and I couldn't eat much of it as it was clogging my throat going down.  Environment was definitely pubbish and therefore loud.  For this sort of establishment, I guess that's a good thing, but we weren't drinking so it was sorta hard to communicate.  Overall a new experience, but just once is enough.

Reviews.Author: Theo T.
Reviews.Content: as usual, i have to try out those places that gets all the hype, and usually i get disappointed, same with Rascos.If you really be honest with youself, the chicken isnt really that great. i could get something like that at ANY corner grocery store. nothing special, dry, overcooked/fried.but the waffles are a little better, sof on the inside, a little crisp on the shell. With the whipped butter is very creamy.but i think its a little pricy for 2 piece of chicken and two waffles for 10.50...

Reviews.Author: Francis N.
Reviews.Content: I was told that whenever you're in the LA area, you just had to stop by to Rocoe's chicken & waffles. At first, I never knew waffles and chicken go together like that, but as my first experience here, this place is definitely a must for folks, like myself, have a love for the fried chicken.I came here with my friend and his friend and the place was pretty packed. My friend and I weren't sure what to order, so I asked our waitress what she would recommend to us "first timers". She was very helpful and helping me find the right dish, so I managed to try the country boy (3 wings and a waffle). When our orders came, the chicken was FRESH and HOT! It's like they just took the chicken right off the fryer, the PERFECT way to serve fried chicken! The waffles were good, but I love the fact that the iced teas have unlimited refills.For a first timer, this place is great chicken joint. Probably when I come back again to the LA area, I'd really like to stop by!

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: Fucking amazing waffles. Nothing else comes close. Not even your mom's who you swear makes the best waffles ever.The chicken is aight (go with the Jeanne Jones omelette and you're good to go).Sides are delicious but expensive.Actually everything is pretty expensive but I'd charge high-prices too if people came from all-over to eat my food.

Reviews.Author: Francesco T.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoe's, I've been in love with this place since I took my first bite out that fried chicken with that red roster sauce all over it, followed by a big piece of their delicious waffles drenched in syrup.If you haven't tried Roscoe's yet and you've been in its vicinity then you should be ashamed of yourself (unless you don't eat meat, in that case carry on and be proud).Pricing isn't bad at all , about $20/person should serve you well and it's well worth it for the amount of food you get.The Scoe's 1/4 Chicken (I believe its the #1) with the waffles is always a hit. A little splash (or a quarter bottle) of Red Rooster Louisiana hot sauce on the chicken, butter and syrup on the waffles, and you'll be hooked. Just thinking about it makes me wanna take the 4 hr drive to LA.If you don't love Roscoe's then you're taste buds must be all f****d up. =)

Reviews.Author: Phillip L.
Reviews.Content: I've been living in LA for almost 6 years so I decided it's time to try this place. With all the hype surrounding Roscoe's, I had high expectations. I was disappointed. Food was mediocre and very pricey. My waffles were luke warm and stuck to the plate. The chicken was so-so and hardly distinguishable from any other restaurant. Salad was a massive bowl of iceberg lettuce with bland veggies thrown in. Corn bread wasn't tasty at all. Restaurant is very dark and poorly decorated. Strangely there are no windows - perhaps a converted strip club or bar. Service could be better too. For a person who loves the occasional cholesterol binge, I didn't leave this place satisfied as I had hoped. 6000 wasted calories.

Reviews.Author: Courtney P.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I waited outside of Roscoe's for two hours to get a table.  I feel that the wait was longer than it needed to be but the weather was nice at least.  Our waitress was great and the food was fantastic.  I'll bring all of my out of towner friends here.The chicken was plump and fresh and the waffles had a bit of cinnamon in them which was unexpected and extremely welcome.  I tried the mac-n-cheese it definitely wasn't worth the price, was good but I won't spend that money again.  The collard greens are pork free and delicious, yum.  Next time I'll bring enough money to buy a souvenir even though I live within walking distance of the place :p

Reviews.Author: Dylan M.
Reviews.Content: I really like this place. It's better than the Pasadena location. The chicken here is the best of the Roscoe's I've been to, but I think the waffles at the Long Beach location are better. I always get the Carol C. Special since I'm not a fan of dark meat. Get this, the corn bread, mac & cheese, and the sweet potato pie, and you're all set.

Reviews.Author: kristina m.
Reviews.Content: I've just been sucker punched by a big, gastronomical bastard named Roscoe.Lying there on the floor, after one and a half waffles, a double serving of grits, biscuits, greens and watching my sister eat those scary little chicken wings... my life flashed before me.  Somewhere in my future a cardiologist was crying.  Then, just before I went into the light, a big, gentle man in suspenders reached out his hand and called sweetly to me:"You done with that table yet, or what?"I burped."Because I have a line of people waiting to be seated, young lady."I offered to have his babies."You need to get off the floor now."Sigh.  Someone bring me a bottle of pepto and pregnancy test kit.  I'm gonna take a nap.

Reviews.Author: Socal C.
Reviews.Content: WHOAAAAA BABY!!!Finally made it to the famous Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles.Hot crispy chicken and warm soft waffles drenched in syrup.  I can't remember the last time I was this quiet during lunch!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy R.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the best food, and the longest wait EVER. This place was only about 5 tables deep a few years ago, now they bought the spot next door...now it's 25 tables...still not big enough. The atmosphere is hilarious!!  It's like a missing scene from Jackie Brown, or Pulp Fiction. It's kind of like having Thanksgiving dinner at Method Man's house. I bet a lot of crimes are premeditated here...I always order the Carol B with an extra waffle. The mac and cheese is weapons grade. The location on Pico has better parking, and rarely ever has a line. Expect to waste an hour here getting a table. ( 2 hours if you're a white dood like me ) If you are gangster enough to wait that long, you deserve what you get, the best food your belly has ever met.

Reviews.Author: Ann C.
Reviews.Content: On Sunday, February 28, 2010 I had fried white chicken meat and waffles at Roscoe's for the very first time. The waffles were well cooked and the meat was decent. I should have ordered gravy with the fried chicken.I have to admit that I am not a fan of grits which was bland with the butter topping. On the positive side, you will get plenty of food for your money.

Reviews.Author: Carlos G.
Reviews.Content: To the name they need to add "even though  you just made that face your life is about to change". Roscoe's house that even though you just made that face your life is about to change after this chicken and waffles. The menu is packed with Roscoe's take on soul food, but I must admit I can't go here and get anything but one of the chicken and waffles combos.Before you ask, yes it is chicken and waffles on the same plate. Yes you can eat either the chicken then the waffle or you can eat them together.  Yes you can put syrup on your chicken. It's delicious. I go as far as putting hot sauce on my plate and dipping both items in the hot sauce even with syrup. It's great. Roscoes is one of my definite musts for anyone visiting from out of town. YUM!

Reviews.Author: sher k.
Reviews.Content: might be a lil overrated, but pretty freaking good chicken. i've been there 3 times, each time i ordered the chicken & waffles. DELICIOUS! i like the sunset drink!overall: food is yum. drinks are good. service is really welcoming and friendly. feels like home inside the restaurant. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!

Reviews.Author: tammy h.
Reviews.Content: Oh gosh I love love love this place. Friend chicken + waffles are heaven together. Their waffles are so fluffy and tasty. If I weren't so full after my first waffle, I would have gotten 3 more! Their chicken is good too. Crispy and flavourful. Oh man just writing this is making me want some.. Service isn't too great. When they're busy (which is always) the waiters can take a while to get to you, but who cares. The food's amazing.

Reviews.Author: Vanessa T.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fried chicken or waffles person. There. I said it. Fried chicken is not one of my go to comfort foods and I prefer pancakes to waffles...and to combine the two? Errr, I don't know...Yeah yeah, go ahead and gasp. *GASP* I have to admit, I was already in a pretty disgruntled mood before we even got there. LA traffic + extremely hot day + already a line and not even 12:30pm + no free parking on Sundays?!?! I decided to drop the boyfriend off to put our names on the list and went to deal with parking, which actually didn't take too long. Quick Tip: there are 2 hour meters around the corner from the restaurant as opposite to 1 hour meters on N Gower. Now with all that being said, I was very pleasantly surprised with my first chicken and waffle experience. By the time I parked and walked over, we only had to wait a few minutes before getting called. Yay =) Inside and seated. Whew. A little on the warm side but not uncomfortable. Time to look at the menu. I didn't realize there were so many different options but after scanning the menu, I finally settled with the Obama: three wings and your choice of waffle, french fries or potato salad. I went with the waffle. Come on now, chicken and waffle! Gotta go for the staple. The boyfriend opted for Jeanne Jones Omelette: cheese and chicken omelette with friench fries or waffle. Of course he went for the waffle. Then again he's more of a waffle guy. The food came out relatively quick and did not disappoint. The chicken had a nice crunchy skin and the meat was tender and flavorful. The waffle was fluffy and not dry. Then, taking a combo bite of chicken, waffle and syrup?! Ummm yeah, now I fully understand the hype of chicken and waffles. Yuuuuuuuuuuuuuummy! We didn't know what to expect with the Jeanne Jones Omelette but boy was it yummy. I even traded the boyfriend a wing for a nice piece (ok fine two pieces) of his omelette...and then I swiped another bite. Conclusion? Satisfied

Reviews.Author: Jeromy G.
Reviews.Content: There is definitly some hype behind this place and I would tell you to believe it. I got the fried chicken and waffles with their house gravy on the side just in case I didn't like it smothered all over my chicken. Also got a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is cheesy and macky and tasty. The chicken has a crisp outside with a juicy meat inside and the waffle is perfect, not soggy but not crunchy like an eggo, perfect consistency. Everything tastes good and you get the sweet and the savory from the waffle and chicken. I ate them together and they taste good but I wouldn't do it the whole meal. Go from waffle then go to chicken and vice versa. The gravy was also good and helped make the chicken flavor even better but it wasn't the best pair with the waffle so watch for that. Overall I was very happy with my meal and satisfied like no other.

Reviews.Author: Kuting C.
Reviews.Content: First time to dine at Roscoe's last Sunday 01/13/13.  Staff were friendly.  We ordered: Scoe's #1, Obama, and mac n cheese.  You can taste the chicken's seasoning in the meat and not just on the skin, skin is crispy, and it's not covered with so much batter that you cannot appreciate the chicken anymore.  All that we ordered was good but nothing was great.

Reviews.Author: Rob P.
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I heard about Roscoe's... I was in LA, and I missed seeing my favorite band No Knife at the Roxy.  I ran into the singer and told him I had missed them, so he told me I should make the most of my LA excursion and try some chicken and waffles.  I looked at him like he was nuts.I didn't get to go to Roscoe's on that trip, but I went the next time and I am now a lifetime fan.  I never vary my order... it's always a #13 for me.  "One succulent breast and one delicious waffle."  Sometimes I add the B&G (biscuits and gravy, come on!) when I'm super hungry as they are amazing here.This location of Roscoe's is pretty funny... it's small, and there's a door guy with a clipboard and a velvet rope to take your name.  I've waited up to an hour to get a table here on a weekend night.  Because of this, I made the Roscoe's on Pico & La Brea my new go-to spot for chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Nicola V.
Reviews.Content: After a night of dancing and singing to old high school songs at the House of Blues on Sunset, Roscoes was definitely a must.  This location is kind of hidden on Gower, I actually had to drive down the street a couple times to finally find it.  It's a bit cleaner and more organized than other Roscoe locations, so that's definitely plus.I won't say that much because I think this place already has enough reviews but you cannot go wrong with Country Boy.  MMMMMM some greasy ass chicken wings and a waffle...enough said.

Reviews.Author: Thai D.
Reviews.Content: There's one thing I really hate about going to Roscoe's.  Is that I want to order more than I can eat.  It's not enough just to get their juicy fried chicken and their spectacularly fluffy waffles (so fluffy, it sucks up butter and syrup like a sponge!).  Roscoe's has great cornbread, collard greens, red beans and rice, and mac and cheese.  Oh MAN the mac and cheese is good!Oh yeah, there's the other thing I hate about going to Roscoe's - particularly this location.  The wait.  There's always a line, always a wait of at least 20 minutes.  But it's not because I'm an impatient person whose time is too valuable.  It's just because I'm hongry and I gots ta have my 'Scoe's!!!

Reviews.Author: Eric A.
Reviews.Content: This would be the 2nd time I've been here in a year and I gotta say the food never changes. IT'S SO GOOD. Anthony Bourdain can have his duck liver wrapped in truffles, I'll have my Chicken and Waffles.This time the server never approached us for 10 minutes, but the floor managers gave us free drinks on the house, which saved us a good 10 bucks.. So it was fine with me. Everytime i go to SoCal I try my best to get me some fried delight on the way back home to the 'bay...

Reviews.Author: Ricky V.
Reviews.Content: I had to stop by this place to see what the fuss was all about. Like most of LA its about really fucking Good low quality product.My waffle seemed overly soggy, and had the same flavor as 5 month old freezer burned Eggo's, my Chicken was paltry and more bone than meat, also a bit overdone.The food was great tasting no doubt, but overpriced by 5 bucks, and a stomach fortifying bowel explosion latter, i figure its just as good as CURLY FRIES from Jack in the Box while REALLY STONED.Sure i would go back, and take friends, but a 5 star rating it is NOT.Peace

Reviews.Author: Kristy R.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm...I love chicken and waffles.  I love my waffles layered with butter and syrup.  And I love my chicken covered in gravy and fried goodness.Mmmm...

Reviews.Author: Dee M.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is one of those places that doesn't need a string of reviews.  The delicious chicken and waffles speak for themselves.  I've been to most locations - Pico, Manchester and Maine, Lake, Long Beach...they're all good.  Long story short,  If you are in L.A. and haven't been, it's a must try.  Forget what everybody else has to say, get to Roscoe's and order the Scoe's Special for yourself.   You'll fall in love too!

Reviews.Author: Brian W.
Reviews.Content: I don't believe how much fried chicken I've had in the past two months-- I'm surprised I haven't had a heart attack yet!Roscoe's isn't the best I've had-- it's definitely close though-- but for some reason, the whole experience just fits together the best. All the other places, the chicken or waffle or something might be a skosh better, but Roscoe's just feels right.

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: 656!The deep fried chicken livers eaten by alternating hot sauce and syrup are fantastic.  Just don't let them tear up the roof of your mouth.  The secret waffle recipe is outstanding.  The fried chicken is good, but not incredible.  The experience is well worth the drive.

Reviews.Author: Melanie R.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place because my friends suggested it and it was mentioned in a book that I read recently.It didn't look that impressive: small, lots of wood and brown, rustic decor.We all ordered the classic chicken and waffles. I didn't much care for the chicken, but I haven't been a big fan of fried chicken for a long time. The waffles were pretty amazing. I even ordered one more since I had been sharing mine with someone else. Super soft and flavorful.I WOULD come back and order the waffles to go sometime, though I probably never will.

Reviews.Author: Erik L.
Reviews.Content: Been wanting to try this place for like forever. Had some time today so, even though it was a Sunday at 11 am, we thought, what the heck. Let's give it a shot.The host was a character. He was friendly, funny, and full of personality. Our waitress also stood out - personable, nice and very helpful. Since they don't allow for substitutions, I asked her how to order something. Within seconds she calculated our entire order in her head and figured the whole thing out for us.Basically, we ordered the... wait for it... chicken and waffles! The chicken was hot. And tasty. And crispy. The waffles, on the other hand, were... just OK. They were kind of undercooked and mushy. Like an Eggo that needs a few more minutes in the toaster. That being said, and I'm not sure why, but the chicken and waffles TOGETHER produced a joint effect that was greater than the sum of the parts acting alone. (Huh?) In English: the combination works. Gastronomical synergy at it's finest.To sum up: Chicken: 5 of 5. Waffles: 2 of 5. Whole experience: 4 of 5. Did the place deliver? Yes. Would I go there again? Again, yes. Note to self: next time ask for, "Waffles - Crispy..."

Reviews.Author: Tanakorn T.
Reviews.Content: Well, I went to Roscoe's a while back, but at the Long Beach location.  I wasn't impressed that time I went.  The chicken was regular and the prices were high.  This place was a bit different though.  Well, let's see:Coming back from Magic Mountain to get back from UCSD, my group decided they wanted Chicken and waffles.  Me, having been there and not enjoying my experience that much, didn't want to go back.  I suppose being 11 at night and been at the park since 11 didn't help much either. *shrugs* I couldn't do anything, I didn't drive.  As I said before, the prices were ridiculous, so as my group chowed down and gorged themselves in food, I patiently waited for them to finish...  SO WHY DID I GIVE 4 STARS?Well, Here is the deal buster:They had this "economy" deal which allowed you to get 5 thighs for 6 dollars!  It is take-out only so I bought it when my group was ready to leave.  They prepared it quickly and we were soon out.  I ate the chicken at home and to my amazement, the chicken was about 5 times better than the last time I had it!  Although the chicken had been sitting it's box for about 2 hours, it was still decently crunchy and the chicken still juicy.  I had to eat my own words and say the chicken was pretty good.  Lesson of the day: take-out FTW! and try more than one location... it can vary INCREDIBLY.

Reviews.Author: Jon D.
Reviews.Content: The #1:  "1/4 chix prepared southern style and two waffles, our own private mix."  Those, my friends, are words to live by. I never mess around with the other stuff; when "chicken and waffles" is in the name, you don't order the hamburger. If I'm feeling crazy I might order the #2, which is the #1 with gravy instead of syrup, but that's the furthest I'm willing to depart from my favorite. I prefer the white meat (they ask when you order) and a Coke to "washhhh this down" (that's the typed version of my impression of Jules Winnfield from Pulp Fiction), and that's it. The best fried chicken & waffles is at Roscoe's, and the best Roscoe's is on Gower. Best 2,000 calories you'll ever eat!

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to try this place, but never really had the opportunity, until now... We planned to go after a  Dodger game, and did. Fortunately for us, probably not for the staff we arrived at 11:50pm and they close at midnight. I was very happy that our waitress didn't take it out on us. This was our first time at a "soul food" restaurant, and it was an interesting experience, we were the only 2 non-black people in the place. It was not scary or anything, just different from what I am used to and honestly... I kinda expected more ethnic diversity. My girlfriend said, "What do expect it's soul food?"We let her know that it was our first time there and she helped us in selecting. We ended up with... Chicken & Waffles, go figure that's what we went there for. It was interesting, not something I would ever have thought of... (Kinda like Alton Brown suggesting eating popcorn the next morning after a movie night, in a bowl of milk like cereal)Our only complaint was the grits, they were pretty bad. Oh, and because it was so late, there was no problem getting a metered parking space out front. I didn't see any other place to park, so I don't know if during the day/evening there is a parking problem.

Reviews.Author: Betty C.
Reviews.Content: The hype is phenomenal but the product mediocre. So When I hear about a house of chicken and waffles. I'm expecting the best. I mean, this is their pies de resistance. However, I was sadly disappointed.Ordered the chicken, cheese grits, fried gizzards and the waffle. The chicken was dry; and the breading seemed to overpower everything and the seasoning was too salty. The cheese grits were good, the fried gizzards were okay, again a little salty, and the waffle (and this is where it really hurts) was soggy. Soggy! How you say? Well I think that they premake the waffles and keep them in a steam tray. I mean how hard is it to make a wafffle? You can even keep the waffle iron on!The gravy was thick, the biscuit was good. But if I were to go in search of fried chicken, I'd be better off at KFC and for my waffle I'd go to Dennys.So sad. I mean, I really wanted to love this. Who doesn't love fried chicken and waffles?Only street parking, and the tables were sticky. I felt like the decor needed a little livening up. The women's room was surprisingly really classy. Pink tile with decorative scroll tiles on top and faux-gold fixtures. Although I did have a moment when I pulled the toliet paper roll and the entire holder fell off.

Reviews.Author: Jay T.
Reviews.Content: If I had to pick one place in LA that has great food and represents the city, it would be Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.Excellent fried chicken, good waffles, butter, great maple syrup, and Red Rooster hot sauce all in your mouth at the same time. There's no wrong way to eat a Roscoe's.I've been to this location and the one on Pico and Labrea. This one's open later to cater to people getting out of clubs/bars. Hence the occasional bathroom disaster.

Reviews.Author: Sharee g.
Reviews.Content: It was just a few months ago, that I came to this particular restaurant.It was on a Monday...not sure if that had anything to do with the service. It was slow.waffles weren't crispy, chicken was good tho!

Reviews.Author: Ray R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's - so you think you're cool cause you have delicious, juicy, tender chicken and you pair it with huge, fluffy, cinamonny waffles?  you're not that cool.just kidding.  you're cooler than a menthol cigarette.I got the #3 Herb's Special - 1/2 chix + 2 waffles  = heaven on earth.

Reviews.Author: Allyson E.
Reviews.Content: Waaaaaay too small!!always crowded!!.....food is just as good though

Reviews.Author: Chantelle A.
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to LA and to Roscoes...I was realllllly excited to try this place out. Im from VA so I'm used to the chicken and waffles combination made famous by Waffle House. Walked in...and was seated promptly. I ordered 3 chicken wings, grits, biscuits and a fried egg. The fried chicken wings were well seasoned and tasted pretty good  but everything else was blah.....the grits had no taste whatsoever. I can do better with a bowl, milk, butter and a packet of Instant Grits. The fried egg...looked like a fried chicken breast...WTF?I really wanted to love this place but it fell short way too many times.

Reviews.Author: Ticha B.
Reviews.Content: 5-stars cuz they expanded the place and fixed up all the restrooms and made this location more nicer! But if you go during peak times, you're still going to have to wait for a table.What's more delicious than CHICKEN and WAFFLES, a side of mac n cheese, smothered potatoes, red beans and rice, potato salad and a Sunset (fruit punch and lemonadge). Refills on SODA, COFFEE, ICED TEA only. No refills on the Sunrise, Sunset, etc.Hard to find parking at times since you have to park right on Gower. Prices are a bit expensive though. Pay extra for syrup, butter, etc. BUT...it the foods total awesome!!! YUMMIE!

Reviews.Author: Bridget B.
Reviews.Content: I've heard about this place for ages and have tried knock offs in Boston and was underwhelmed by the whole fried chicken and waffle pairing.That is because apparently I was going to the wrong place. Roscoes is really good, their fried chicken is really really good. I was underwhelmed with my waffle though....but the fried chicken was REALLY good. The prices range from cheap to a little overpriced and since you can't make substitutions you can quickly end up spending more than you anticipating if you, like me, have food allergies and still want to try different sides.I was going to check their website to see about prices/sides however google is telling me their site will fuck my shit up due to malware so that's sort of a shame. Again I was underwhelmed by the waffle (too thin) and the maple syrup wasn't (to the best of my knowledge) real maple syrup, but the fried chicken was so good that it made up for it. The candied yams were also supper yummy. On two different occasions the staff ranged from super friendly and nice to ignoring us and unhelpful. Once they let me bring in a bottle of water with me (sealed) another time they did not. So it seems to vary. Probably based on the day of the week or something.

Reviews.Author: Jackie S.
Reviews.Content: I heard some great reviews about this place, so my hubby and I had to try it. The verdict: Okay. The sides were good. Chicken was not that great.We waited 20 minutes to get into the restaurant. We originally drove by the Pico location, but the line was way too long. The service was okay, nothing too special. My hubby ordered two waffles with 1/2 chicken (leg and breast). The waffles were pretty good. They remind me of a larger and slightly mushier version of Eggo waffles.I ordered the combo platter with cornbread, candied yams, collard greens, and two thighs. The cornbread was a huge square piece. The candied yams and collard greens were delicious and were not too sweet. I was really disappointed with the fried chicken. Our chicken pieces were really dry :( In order to pay for the meal, you go towards the side with the kitchen and pay at the register. Credit cards accepted.When I'm back in the Bay Area, I'm going to "Hard Knox Cafe" in San Francisco. The fried chicken is a moist and taste a lot better. The prices are cheaper too.

Reviews.Author: Andrzrej K.
Reviews.Content: If it was the house of Waffles & Chicken- 4 stars, But when you pronounce yourself as Chicken First- it must be 3. For all of us from the East Coast that have ventured into a Kennedy Fried Chicken (or one of the knockoffs of the aforementioned knockoff)... thats what the Fried chicken tastes like- Which isnt a bad thing, but its just basic fried chicken.The service was great- a little o.d. that you couldnt walk out the door you came in even when the place isnt the crowded.

Reviews.Author: Cee A.
Reviews.Content: The nearly-one-thousand Yelp reviews still can't possibly describe just how good Roscoe's is. They try, but they simply cannot do this place enough justice. I've eaten many places up and down the west coast, but nothing I've experienced even comes close to the delight that is Roscoe's. And even in light of the fact there are many viable contenders -- particularly with regard to chicken and waffles -- none do it the way Roscoe's does. Moreover, I feel there is no dining experience that could possibly be anymore quintessential Los Angeles.You know the hype -- it's all about the chicken and waffles. You must experience it. Don't be ridiculous and come here and not try it. It's simply uncivilized. As I mentioned, many try (and come close) to carry the chicken and waffles mantle, but none is as great as Roscoe's -- the greatest of all time.That sweet, delicious waffle, drowning in maple syrup, and the crisp, savory chicken, doused in hot sauce -- I'm drooling just thinking of it.The wait at the Hollywood location is generally a long one. And this wasn't always the case, but even during off-hours this location tends to be very busy. The good thing is though that the staff generally buses and turns over tables very quickly. But that doesn't matter when many patrons tend to take their time at their respective tables. Nonetheless, given how busy this location is, their staff is top-notch and gets the job done.The crowding is somewhat alleviated by the expanded dining room. But for you first-timers, you can't really get a feel for how popular this place is until you get there. So be ready to wait. But believe me, the wait is absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Esther A.
Reviews.Content: I've ALWAYS wanted to eat at Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles and how I wished they had one in New York.  The only chicken and waffle meal I've had was at Amy Ruth's up in Harlem. I was overly excited and amped when my day had finally come when I had a chance to try this eatery during my first trip to Cali. It was on top of my itinerary of things to do. I dined at the Hollywood location on Gower St.I'm bit conflicted  on my rating for Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles and my overall  food experience with my chicken & waffle meal. I waited for this day to find out that the food at best is just mediocre 2  1/2 . I've hyped myself up. But will give it a second chance just because its Roscoe's Chicken & Waffle So I rate it a 3 for novelty. There are plenty other food items on the menu  and locations to try out their meal again. My meal experience consisted of ordering the  chicken & waffles along with scrambled eggs w/cheese on the side. I also ordered a Sunset drink (lemonade & fruit punch) which was very sweet. My dining partner from the UK who's never heard of such a chicken & waffle combo ordered the same but smothered. I didn't bother trying to taste her smothered meal because it looked to smothered and unappetizing. I like my waffles crispy, their waffles are of a bit softer borderline soggy for my taste. I did taste a bit of cinnamon in my waffles. My waffles was loaded with scoops of butter  which look like heaps of ice cream. The butter actually made the waffles taste even better. The  chicken portion consisted of a wing and nice crispy thigh. My scrambled eggs was cooked a nice running cheesy consistency that I like. I couldn't finish all of my meal the portions was plentiful for me.But I did enjoy my experience overall. The place has history. What interesting they actually had security in front of the property. As if it was a night club. I was tempted to buy a t-shirt. So maybe next time I will.

Reviews.Author: Ellis J.
Reviews.Content: Ive been here twice and I have to say that the waffle (w/ a cinnamon batter) is by far the best part of the combination. The chicken is okay, my piece was a bit dry but was still pretty tasty. i would say its a place to try at least once or twice but for me isn't a place i have to frequent often. The sides are also pretty good (mac & cheese, yams, etc).If the chicken was a bit more juicy and flavorful then I would have given more stars. As of now, its just the same chicken I could get anywhere but the waffle is def a must get!

Reviews.Author: Kim-Anh P.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 star review. I'm still a die-hard fan of the chicken at Breakfast Klub in Houston. I did have a great experience at Roscoe's and like any other fried chicken lover, give me a waffle with it and I'm all yours! I stopped by for lunch and was greeted by friendly waitstaff and seated immediately. The waitress I was such a darling and was very attentive. I got the chicken and waffles and was very pleased! This may sound silly, but that butter ball they put on the waffle was DROOLINGLY delicious. What's in it? Honey?? I don't know but I was so tempted to eat the whole ball of butter by itself. I loved the sweetness of the waffle and the nice crisp. The chicken wings were good...but I like mine to be bigger and juicer. I think this is the original location, fun decor and relaxed environment.

Reviews.Author: Ariel M.
Reviews.Content: This place is the bomb. I arrived around 6:30PM on a Tuesday evening. No wait! Fast service! YUMMY YUMMY fried chicken, YUMMY for the TUMMY waffles, and mac n cheese. Oh and the sweet tea had a tropical kick to it.Our waitress was sweet with a giant tat on her neck, I liked the rough/soft balance she had going on. Our food came out quick! The BF and I shared a half a friend chicken, two scrumptious waffles, and a small dish of macaroni and cheese with two sweet teas. The bill came out to about $26 so it can cost more than KFC but damn, it's REALLY REALLY worth it. That macaroni and cheese is bomb, real talk, order it, it's legit.Try to go when it's not crowded cause the line can last a long while. Otherwise, if you don't mind waiting in line, after you taste the goodies, you'll realize why you waited.Next time, I'm gonna order ahead and see what happens.

Reviews.Author: Glenn L.
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was 5-10 minutes away from Roscoe's so we decided to give this place a try. But since it was lunch time and figured the place would be extremely busy and packed, we decided to call ahead of time and pick up the order. When we got there, we saw how many people were waiting outside, so caling ahead of time was the best idea ever! We also had to wait several minutes for the lady to pack everything up since we ordered a lot of food for 6 people, which was fine. I was a little worried that she might have missed something or get one of the orders wrong, but everything was on point when we got back to our hotel!I'd come back again!

Reviews.Author: Juan F.
Reviews.Content: I came here because I was craving fried chicken. I got number 13 which was a fried chicken breast and waffles as well as a side of mac n cheese. My gf got the fried thigh and waffle. The service here is really quick! We got the food fast.The chicken was delicious. It was very juicy and flavorful even though it was the breast. The waffle was just average. The mac n cheese was average as well. Overall, too expensive for fried chicken but it is definitely good.

Reviews.Author: Yvette B.
Reviews.Content: OMG!  This is just some awesome food!!  Fried chicken, waffles with syrup, collard greens, mac & chz and some corn bread.  There's something about fried chicken and waffles with syrup!  Yummmm!!!  Wear loose pants!  ;0)The setting is humble with unique artwork spread about.  It's a very laid-back environment that sometimes offers music in the later hours.  The service is great, irregardless of the constant flow of people coming and going.  It's a great place to take someone especially if they have never tried chicken and waffles!  This is a favorite HOTSPOT of mine!  It's not the healthiest of choices---but, hey----you gotta live every now and then!!   ;0)Check it out sometime and come back and write a review!!!   =0)Yvette L. Brownstone from Ventura. CA

Reviews.Author: Sylvia K.
Reviews.Content: Thisis a deifinite MUST anytime I have visitors in LA from out of town.  It's a famous hot spot in Hollywood so it's almost ALWAYS packed, guaranteed to be on Fridays and all through the weekend.  Prepare to wait for a seat, but it's well worth the wait!  They've remodeled this locatoion so it's bigger than it used to be but still packed.  The Pasadena location is more spacious and a lil easier to get in and out of and they have a parking lot.The food here is delicious so leave your diet at home!  Gotta have the #13 Carol C special which includes one succulent chicken breast and one tasy waffle! I usually add a side of mac & cheese cuz I just can't resist it!  Cornbread is pretty good too! The spices/recipe they have for their food is soooooo tasty!! I dont' know anyone who's come here and not thoroughly enjoyed their meal.  Service is good also, helpful and friendly.  Food comes out fast and always cooked to perfection... now i'm hungry! lolso what are you waiting for... go and get you some!!

Reviews.Author: Nick V.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is probably my favorite place to eat in the world. The place is absolutely perfect. No matter how crowded the place is there never seems to be a wait over 5 minutes and the staff there is usually super quick (especially the nice guy at the door who seats you). The waitresses can sometimes be a little slow if the place is totally slammed but I can forgive that.Now onto the food. The chicken is probably the best fried chicken in the world. I don't know how they manage to keep it so hot and fresh while at the same time keeping the chicken from drying out. It is extremely juicy and it usually only takes them a couple of minutes to get it out to you. The waffles are incredible and there is some flavor in the syrup that keeps me wanting more. My mom usually gets a couple of pieces with the red beans and rice instead of a waffle and those are very delicious too. The only thing that I have ever had there that wasn't that great was the collard greens although that is probably because I don't like those very much to begin with.The only negative of the place is the people who are outside on Gower always trying to sell you stuff. But you can bypass them quickly and right inside to enjoy some perfect chicken and waffles. Simply the best

Reviews.Author: Tina V.
Reviews.Content: The chicken here is good and service can be frustrating but they are known for their chicken and waffles... unfortunately i'm not a fan of waffles or pancake period so my friends taking me here was an epic fail... However, i am rating for what i did have here.  3 star for the chickenminus 1 star for the grits and biscuits (mushy and gross)minus 1 star for the ridiculous wait on weekends

Reviews.Author: Rita L.
Reviews.Content: On my last day in LA, I went to Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles to try out their famous...chicken and waffles. I had to wait 15 minutes on a Monday to be seated, which was not bad. The waiter was really friendly and helpful when I asked what were their recommendations. I had the Country Boy meal, where it came with waffles and also wings. For an extra $2, I added another waffle. The waffle was yummy, soft and tasty. Their wings were good as well. It was light battered, so it was not that fried and also not dry, which was a PLUS. Definitely give this place a try, and you will see what I am talking about! I was tempted to taste the chili cheese fries as the waiter suggested it to us and told us that recently, more people have got that, but my next stop was In-and-Out Burger, so I passed on the fries.

Reviews.Author: Erin T.
Reviews.Content: I must admit, this combination sounded crazy to me. But it must be worth trying if there's always a 20 minute wait, right?The food is good. Nothing too special, nothing too blah. The collard greens were quite good. The waffles were good too. Honestly, the gravy was super bland.However, if you go in not thinking this place not expecting it to be amazing then it will probably be quite good!

Reviews.Author: Katie L.
Reviews.Content: Always fun to people watch here.Chicken is consistently good, if not sometimes a little dry.Waffles are inconsistent but most of the time good. Watch out for soggyness that happens from the steamed plate! Sometimes my waffle is burnt or underdone but most of the time it is cooked to perfection.Mac & Cheese really is not that good, which I also think about the other sides. It's a fun place to bring out of town guests to because of all the hype surrounding it.I saw Akon my first visit there and their conversations were hysterical. It's a fun time but I would never go sans out of towners.

Reviews.Author: Alice K.
Reviews.Content: Short & sweet: Service: 4Food: 4Wait time: 20-25 minPrice: 3.5Cleanliness of bathroom: 4I'm the 1266th review so I'm thinking I have nothing new to say. Not that there's much to say: it was good. Fried chicken smothered in gravy. Waffles smothered in butter and syrup. Mac 'n Cheese. It was busy (to be expected), but I was a little disappointed with the biscuit I ordered on the side. It wasn't warm when I received it and I asked for another one. I also felt the waffle was... soggy. It was a very soft waffle. Not my preference for waffles, but the deliciousness of the other items made everything okay.

Reviews.Author: Bobby C.
Reviews.Content: Mac n Cheese may actually be better than the chicken and waffles. Waffles are still my favorite. Service still sucks and the combo meals are weird. Order ala cart.

Reviews.Author: Rachael K.
Reviews.Content: Occasion: Lunch with PwC Case Competition teammates What I Had: Carol C. Special (1 chicken breast, 1 waffle) ($8.95) Food Review: The food isn't anything special in terms of its separate components, but who knew the combination of chicken and waffles would taste so darn amazing?? My dear friend Manny had eaten here before and rightfully recommended it to our team for our little reunion. The chicken-waffle combo is pure genius.  Service Review: Nothing much to say about the service. Everyone was really friendly. Venue Review: Love that it's not super up tight and feels very homey. Most of the restaurant is made of wood and reminds me a lot of restaurants we went to in Baton Rouge. It has a really southern feel.  Overall Impression: This is such a fun place to go with friends! I'll admit that the company I kept really made the lunch, but it really is an experiential place for people like me who hadn't tried it before.

Reviews.Author: Rusty S.
Reviews.Content: Ever since my first visit to Roscoe's a few years ago I've found myself daydreaming about Scoe's Chicken & Waffles every now and again... couldn't wait to indulge on my most recent trip to LA!My brother and I tried to dine here fairly late on a Friday night after hitting up a few bars.  I think the hours posted were till midnight, but at about a quarter till the doors were locked and we were denied.  Oh well, I think Scoe's is best enjoyed for breakfast with coffee the morning after going out anyway, so that's what we did.  There was no wait to be seated and service was fairly quick.  Food was just as hot, greasy, tasty and filling as I remembered-- and a relative bargain in LA at about $10 a plate.  I'm not sure that this place has the very best chicken OR waffles out there, but the combination is something magical.  There's a reason this place is famous and even President Obama made a point of stopping by the West L.A. location recently.  Looking forward to coming back here next time!

Reviews.Author: Pamela S.
Reviews.Content: I usually try to avoid really hyped up places... but I've been meaning to try Roscoe's.Yes, the chicken was crunchy and flavorful and delish, and the waffle was great as well, but I am not blown away. I would be okay not returning. Maybe it's just because I'm not usually into messy, super oily food.But we got seated right away, and service was great. Super casual environment. Came at 7 something PM on a weekday and did meter parking in front.P.S. The mac and cheese side is yummy! The greens and cornbread were ehh.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Had a Carol C. special and split Mac & Cheese side with my date. Not the cheapest place around, but you can safely say you get what you pay for. Superb food! Service was par, but we were busy with our food regardless.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: 2 stars since I have no other meal within Roscoe's to compare it too..I loved the chicken!!! but was confused when It said it came with gravy & biscuit and rice. I don't like gravy over my rice.. so that was a big negative for me. When I return I now know to ask for the gravy on the side and the only reason I am returning because I was a fan of the chicken breast, it was so juicy and mouth watering.I did not notice on the menu but I wonder if they have just chicken only takeout?

Reviews.Author: Richard L.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and Waffles! Soul food here is aptly named.  So I know Chicken and Waffles originated in Harlem, NY, and I was told by a pretty good source that this is THE place to go for soul food and chicken and waffles. In my youth I used to go with some friends down to random soul food places from the famous (Sylvia's in NY) to this corner place we used to go to that seemed like home cooking in a small shack of a store front.  Soul food is soul food.  So i know my soul.I would give this place 4 stars if the service we received wasn't so bad.  Ok ok we came at an odd hour around 330pm ish so between shifts with shift changes and what not.  But it seemed to take overly long waiting for any particular wait staff to come over to us.  So we went and walked around and got a waiter to come by, he'd look at us point at someone else and then he'd leave too.  Happened twice.  Ok So the food - Chicken and Waffles smothered in a chicken gravy.  I opted to put the whole thing on top of the waffle and eat it all together.  The chicken had a wonderfully crispy and flavorful skin with tender chicken meat.  Perfectly cooked, i was more than happy eating just the fried chicken alone, but with the gravy, it added that extra something, that made it not just great but amazing.  I'm a gravy kinda guy - so i like tons of gravy dripping all over the plate - and Rosco's didn't fail.  There was more than enough gravy for me to get all over my waffles.  Which sounds gross, but is actually awesome.  A little gravy, a little maple syrup, a pair of Waffles a little Butter and good god you got a meal!  You got the salty, you got the sweet, you got the waffle and you got the chicken...you got everything right there on one fork!  Try it.  You won't be disappointed.  Over all the food was good, best soul food ever?  Not sure about that...great soul food - definitely!

Reviews.Author: Andrew R.
Reviews.Content: I went here with a group of 8 at around 9 PM on a Saturday evening, probably the worst time to go.  The wait was around 30 minutes or so, which wasn't too bad at all.  They have a pretty good system where they keep everyone outside.  It makes the dining experience really nice for the people inside who aren't dealing with the rabble and discourages people outside so they keep leaving, decreasing the queue and getting me inside faster!The staff were super friendly and nice, especially the waiter (and excluding the cashier who decided to glare when we didn't realize they only allow two forms of payment but fixed our mistake in about 2 seconds anyway, i.e. cash and 1 card or 2 cards only).  The speed of the food was average, which is impressive for a restaurant that's consistently filling every seat all night long.  And just for the record, the perfect bite is a waffle with syrup and maybe butter, some fried chicken, and a healthy dousing of hot sauce.  Perfect, I tell ya!Individual foods: Waffles: Consistent with the perfect balance of fluffiness and crispiness.  They're a little thing for my taste, but it works with the rest of the food.  Chicken: Cooked just right with the perfect amount of crispiness and fried batter.  Not overly greasy or oily like most fried chicken places. Mac and cheese: Pretty tasty and very cheesy.  It was thick and tasted like it was made the right way with a roux. Grits: Sort of disappointing and too watery, but I think I just greatly prefer cheese grits.Cornbread: A bit on the dry side, but you get a huge block of it.  Sweet potato pie: Amazing!  I think I like it because you can't taste sweet potato at all, it's more like a thinner pumpkin pie.

Reviews.Author: JR C.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is late late night grub. I would not have it any other way, but chicken and waffles you say? I've had it elsewhere (Brian's 24), but I can't say that the chick & waff combo go together ever so perfectly. It's like saying cottage cheese and hash browns, good separate but not necessarily together.-=- Chicken & Waffles -=- First timer like me had trouble finding it on the menu, but it's there in several forms. I got the one that included 2 thighs and mac&cheese (single breast was 2 bucks more, what up with that?). I traded mac for waffles. At $12, this place ain't cheap, but you have to try it at least once. It is imperative young Jedi, that you must:GET THE GRAVY. EAT WITH CHICKEN....YUM.-=- Cornbread -=- I had this huge brick of cornbread with my meal. It was the largest thing on my plate. Ate it with butter, lots of it. Cornbread was bleh. I would have enjoyed it more if it was either more corn-ish or butter-ish, but this had neither.-=- Mac & Cheese -=- It's alright. I preferred this to the waffles. Cheese was laid on pretty thick and mac was tougher than usual. Nothing special otherwise.-=- Greens -=- I ain't gonna rate this, since I am no expert. (So I had some and it was salty and butterish. You veggie heads pleased with that?)John, the door guy, is incredibly hilarious and friendly. We had a fun conversation about Hollywood parking woes. Talked about how Staples Center parking shoots up to $20+. What a funny guy.

Reviews.Author: Lester M.
Reviews.Content: When  in Rome....I couldn't leave LA without visiting Roscoe's. Sure it was one time and it was a short visit but worthwhile. I had the SCOE'S 1/4 chix southern style with mac and cheese. I always try to take a pic of my meal for Yelp purposes but by the time I realized I need to take a picture, the chicken was gone. The chicken was nice and crispy and juice. The waffles were fluffy and covered in butter and syrup were just right and the mac and cheese was creamy and savory. I will advice you that nothing I ate rates as the best I have had but I can't deny the power of soul food. The fact that every time a piece of food hit my stomach I was in heaven.

Reviews.Author: Jackie T.
Reviews.Content: When I visited this place as a kid, it had its appeal. What 12 year old doesn't like food that's unhealthy, salty, AND sweet?As time passed, I realized that store-bought fried chicken, and ego waffles were just as good. If I'm going to a restaurant that specializes in these foods, I should be blown away with the taste..right?Unfortunately, this place is all hype and no substance.  The only reason I go to a Roscoe's now, is to appease my family/friends who visit LA for the first time, and insist on trying the famous chicken and waffles combo. The only reason I gave this place two stars are for the service (the staff is friendly) and the food is decent.

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: You come to L.A. you have to make the pilgrimage.  It was Sunday morning and I had worked up such a craving that only Roscoe's was going to handle.  Luck was with me as I found parking only 2 blocks away and that luck was extended once inside as I was seated immediately.So many good things on the menu but if you coming for the first time, what do you order?  That's right boys and girls, chicken and waffles!  Ordered the Scoe's 1/4 chicken dark meat with 2 waffles and I could not finish it all.  I think the chicken is the star here.  Juicy, crisp, tender...all the things you look for.  The waffles are a bit different than I am used to.  These aren't fluffy pillows here, these are dense.  It took a bit to get used to as did the flavor but I came to enjoy them for being different.Service was friendly and I love the murals painted on the walls.  Next time I have to have a biscuit and some greens!

Reviews.Author: Brenda T.
Reviews.Content: I stopped by for dinner on a Tuesday evening and we were seated right away. Friendly staff, casual atmosphere. I ordered the Carol C. special (one chicken breast and waffle) and my friend ordered the Country Boy 'Obama' special (three wings and a waffle). The chicken breast was overcooked and the meat was dry. The waffle was softer than I expected and I'm not sure about the chicken/waffle combination. I'm spoiled by the addictive, spicy Popeye's Chicken Recipe. I will give Roscoe's another try and next time, I'll check out their gravy and sides.

Reviews.Author: Angela F.
Reviews.Content: I know this place is loved by most, but I just can't seem to get into it. I have been two times and still don't think it's for me. I have had better chicken elsewhere and better waffles elsewhere as well. I don't know if it's the waffles or the syrup that has a strong vanilla flavor or something, but that is really good. It's still just a thin waffle though. The mac and cheese is pretty good though. I would get that again.

Reviews.Author: Mary Jo G.
Reviews.Content: I had the special, my son had the chicken burger and my friend the waffles with chicken......the chicken was good, the burger was ok, the french fries where not crispy and the waffles where big buy nothing special. The only reason I give it 3 stars, due to the excellent service, people skills and attentiveness of the waiters and as I said the chicken was good.

Reviews.Author: De D.
Reviews.Content: I come from Eischens Fried Chicken world so I may be more critical than the rest. So here goes.  The fried chicken was dry. Seasoned well. Just dry.Waffle, dry.Greens and cornbread were good.Not worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Daniella S.
Reviews.Content: Yummy, yummy in my tummy.The chicken was good.  Even better dipped in the onion gravy that the smothered potatoes came in.  They were awesome.  Perfectly seasoned & not overcooked.  The mac & cheese was ok.  The waffles were soggy & a bit more sweet than savory.  I love fired chicken & I wish there was a Roscoe's here in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Jamie F.
Reviews.Content: Never have I ever...... though of eating chicken & waffles together.I was skeptical about trying at first, but I'm so glad that I did.  Genius combination of flavors.  Colonel Sanders would have been impressed with Roscoe's fried chicken and Aunt Jemima would've approved the soft, buttery waffles.  The Eclipse and Sunset drinks were just as awesome and perfectly balanced.  This is a must-try in LA!

Reviews.Author: Tammy T.
Reviews.Content: FYI: I don't like waffles, french toast, pancakes, and eggs! Sorry breakfast meal.EXCEPT, for their waffles and eggs (which have onions; I don't like onions, however I loved them anyway). Oh-Em-Gee! I really do love their waffles, I have no idea why I do, they seem cinnamon-ish to me. Call me crazy. Their gravy is, eh. But their waffles...so good to me.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! I am not a fried chicken fan or even waffles for that matter, but this place rocked. The chicken was perfection - not too greasy and full of delicious meat. The mac and cheese was good. Collard greens a little salty, but worked with the meal. Corn bread - awesome. I tried a bite of the buckwheat waffles and enjoyed it. Chicken was definitely the best part though, as it should be.

Reviews.Author: Kaili C.
Reviews.Content: This place is so overrated, way overpriced, service was awful, the waiter kept on walking passed us for a thousand times, we didn't get served til 40 mins later, they looked like they were stoned.   The chicken wings were soggy and super salty.  The combo, Not much selection to choose from.   The Mac n cheese was cold, the waffle was dense and soggy too.   The giblet was hard as rock.  The corn bread was dry, 42 bucks for breakfast for 2 peeps, best to get a darn steak at outback, never comin back here, bad experience overall!!!!  Popeyes taste better than roscoe, hands down, WTHH.  No substitution, that's bogus.

Reviews.Author: Leilani P.
Reviews.Content: When I moved to the bay area several years ago, Roscoe's had opened a new location in Oakland. I drove my high maintenance ass to the ghetto streets of Oakland to get my Roscoe's fix. Sadly the quality didn't compare to the Gower Roscoe's at all.People not in-the-know here in the bay area always ask me "Chicken and Waffles? Together?"Little do they know when their flavor powers combine you will experience something more powerful than Captain Planet and his five little minions.Four stars for the chicken - and the waffles. Not to mention the greens and mac salad. Good luck with parking, try not to go during peak hours, and bring money for the meters out front!

Reviews.Author: Lizzie C.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles! Their fried chicken is good - not too dry, and moist and delicious enough to eat without ketchup. I also had their mac 'n' cheese and it was everything I wanted and more. At first I thought chicken and waffles were a weird combination, but it's actually amazing. Plus the host at the door looked like Morgan Freeman!Just... less articulate.

Reviews.Author: MARK B.
Reviews.Content: Who would ever thought to have waffles and fried chicken. It might sound like a weird combo, but it works real well together. Roscoes has the best fried chicken in L.A. Besides great chicken and waffles, you can't go wrong with there corn bread, greens or french fries. Since they expanded and added valet parking, getting a table became easier and parking is no longer a big hassle.My favorites drink is the sunrise. If you have never tried Roscoes yet, what are you waiting for.

Reviews.Author: Julia L.
Reviews.Content: WOW - what a difference 20 years makes!  There's valet service for EIGHT dollars in the front - uh no thanks.  I parked on Sunset Blvd & ran back once to put in more quarters in the 1 hr parking (free after 8 p.m. on Saturday night).The place was giamongous - they expanded over to the next door.  Chicken was as yummy as ever - light batter w/ a crispiness that stayed throughout the meal.  Waffle became super sized but it wasn't as crispy as 20 years ago...kinda mushy (minus one star 'cos it's 1/2 of the main course!).Service was excellent - busy as expected - waited outside for an hour before being called in (seating for 7).  As we left around 8 p.m., realized almost NO line outside...so if you don't mind snacking on something to tie you over, go there a little later to minimize the wait.Been to the Pasadena location & hated it back in the late 90's.  I'm glad I gave Roscoe's another chance by visiting the flagship store.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan K.
Reviews.Content: I love Roscoe's.  It's hard to understand how good fried chicken and waffles can be together without going here first.Get the Number 2, which includes 1/4 chix, 2 waffles, and gravy with onions.  You probably want your gravy on the side, it is heavy as hell and you don't want your chicken smothered in too much of the stuff.Both the waffles and the fried chicken are some of the best I've ever had.  The meat is always tender and succulent (just as it is described on the menu), and has tons of flavor.  The batter the chicken is fried in is delicious as well, it tastes good dipped in the gravy, maple syrup (no joke), and the Red Rooster hot sauce they have on every table.  The waffles are large, fairly flat, and taste incredible.  The waffles are more savory than sweet, and go great with the maple syrup.  The waffles do taste good with the gravy as well, definitely a very rich taste.Some of their other options are delicious as well (although I rarely stray from the Number 2).  The cornbread is really good, and their french fries are surprisingly good as well.The food always comes out piping hot, so much that you will probably burn your fingers tearing apart your chicken (something that is an inevitable consequence for us).  Another typical result of eating here is the food coma and lack of hunger for the rest of the day (or into the next day if eating here at night).The service is usually reasonable, the servers can range from very nice to grumpy.  At peak times you can end up sitting outside on the bench waiting to be seated, something to keep in mind.  Prices are probably a little higher than they should be (around $10 for the Number 2), but the food is so good it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: Chicky Chicky Chicky !!!the wonderful smell of waffles and chicken fill the air as you are standing outside. it is worth the wait and oh so yummy!we ordered the chicken and waffles and a side of gravy and some mac-n-cheese. it was kind of late at night and so we didnt finish the whole thing. i was dreaming about chicky all night long and how i would devour it the next morning for a little breakfast. it was just as good the next day! it is moist and flavorful and the mac is super cheese and filled with comfort goodnessi thought it was well worth the wait and the price. if i am ever in the area again i will stop by for a little wingy or two!!

Reviews.Author: Gloria C.
