Reviews.Content: Food is very good. Service is okay but there's an individual that hangs out outside ALL the time , the last time I was there he threatened to "kick my ass" he looks like a drug addict. Security didn't do anything about it. Not good business for you them at all.

Reviews.Author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.
Reviews.Content: Is it wrong to leave the same review for all three?  NAHHH SON!Same damn thing wherever I go.Prolly  2x mac and cheese, and a breast and waffle.The one I used to go to was open 24 hours or REALLY REALLY late, but I think someone got shot there so it closes around 3am.

Reviews.Author: Bani S.
Reviews.Content: Everything good you ever hear about Roscoe's is absolutely true.  How good can chicken and waffles be? Damn good!!I have no idea what it is that makes their waffles so good, or their chicken so irresistible but everyone in our party inhaled everything that was set in front of them.  It was my first time there so I decided to with, what else, the chicken and waffles.  Go for the 1/4 chicken with 2 waffles.  This is more than enough food to keep you busting at the seams for a couple hours.  There is good reason for the semi-long wait to be seated (20-30 minutes).  It's worth the wait .  Going back here is a no brainer...oh...P.S.  If you're counting calories, stay home.

Reviews.Author: Sonny D.
Reviews.Content: After 4 years of living in L.A. I had yet to go to this landmark, until one of my best friends from Dallas came to visit and I decided to bring him here. Now after driving around for 15 minutes we finally found parking, at least I think we did because there were no signs, there were white dividers painted on the street signaling car space yet the curb appeared red. We took the chance anyways and walked the few blocks. First off the security guard outside was surprisingly nice and helpful, he even went out of his way to get us seated! I am so not use to that from LA security guards. As mentioned in other reviews the staff is very friendly, which I think sets the tone for their atmosphere. I can imagine the different personalities they must get particularly when they come in drunk. Thus I admire their constant pleasant attitude.So I played it conservatively, order the Carol C. special (a chicken breast, a waffle, butter and syrup) and added a side of gravy as well.   It came out, the famed myth combination I've heard about for years. I've long been skeptical about this mesh of foods and my first bite made me go not bad. Then it became addictive, second as I poured syrup on top of the gravy. Yum. Heading back to my car I saw a parking police pull up, I told my friend to get in the car fast which he didn't. Jumped in the car and off we went as guy walked towards my car and the ones parked behind me. Hope I don't get a ticket.

Reviews.Author: Laina T.
Reviews.Content: It was my last night in LA and I wasn't going to miss Roscoe's again.  I had dinner with the family and then some ice cream.  I was stuffed but I HAD to have chicken and waffles, even if it meant that I might explode from all the food that I had eaten in my LA food marathon in the last 6 hours.  I walked around Hollywood to digest a bit before having more food.I shared a drumstick, a thigh, and a waffle.  I just wanted to sample it.  The chicken was good.  It was crispy and flavorful.  The waffle was okay.  I made sure to eat it the way Alton Brown from the Food Network eats it... a piece of chicken and a piece of waffle with syrup smothered all over it.  It was definitely good.  The environment was a little different than I had expected.  The door that I had come through was roped off.  A security guard let me through.  Initially, I thought I was going to some exclusive club.  Then I started to see all the people eating.  It was very homey.  No Snoop Dogg in sight.  The service was very pleasant and down to earth.I'd come back if my friends wanted to grab some grub here.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS!! I've been to Roscoe's many MANY MANY times but this time was by far the best.FoodScoe's 2 gravy on the side please!!Delicious crispy fried chicken with equally amazing gravy. I generally find gravies really bland and tasteless but this one was DELICIOUS!! ^_^Waffle:  nom nom nom. I love filling each pocket with syrup. it's really good

Reviews.Author: Mak J.
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go here since I saw Snoop Dogg take Larry King here on CNN years ago.   I love soul food and legendary stuff and old Hollywood kitsch so this place is pretty much my utopia, and it did not disappoint.I went there late night on a week night and it was packed but we were able to get a seat without a wait.  I, of course, got chicken and waffles but also mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and greens.   It was an odd combo for me as I have always had chicken and waffles as a breakfast thing but it was yummy nonetheless.I would like to have a real, drunken, wait for an hour  and maybe see a celebrity at Roscoe's experience sometime though.

Reviews.Author: Kay B.
Reviews.Content: Hard to figure out parking so park on the street which is the metered parking

Reviews.Author: Kathryn G.
Reviews.Content: Consider me a convert.  I was a bit skeptical going in - but with so many people singing Roscoe's praises I had to check it out.  It was delicious.  The combination of the savory fried chicken and the sweet syrup is so delicious.  This is 100% pure comfort food.  The skin on the fried chicken was super crispy and fatty and the meat is moist.  The waffles are just average and could never stand on their own merit. - but that's ok.  Because in this case, the sum of the parts far outweighs its components.  The crispy skin, savory meat, eaten with a bite of waffle and sweet syrup - mmm, it is so good.  The service was incredibly fast - we waited less than 10 minutes for our food - and they were quick with re-fills.  The ladies bathroom was a bit dingy - but that's ok because you're not coming to Roscoe's for their restroom.

Reviews.Author: Josh B.
Reviews.Content: It's Roscoes. An LA institution, stands for everything that is beautiful about comic gluttony. The sad fact is that The Waffle nearby has fresher ingredients - fluffier waffles, crispier fry, and juicier chicken. Also, as a Caucasian who loves his collards, their greens are pretty mushy and flavorless.As one would hope, all there really is is chicken n waffles. The only real "options" are how many of what pieces of chicken you want on how many waffles; and whether or not to put gravy and sauteed onions on it. Go for the gravy. What, are you watching your weight at the last minute?Plus beers are too expensive here - $5 for a bottle of Bud - Let me have 2 or 3 beers for under $10 to wash down that tasty tasty lard.

Reviews.Author: Don V.
Reviews.Content: After a year of curiosity I was finally able to try Roscoe's. From where I was staying, it was only 7 miles away but the traffic made it more than an half an hour trip! I came during lunch and surprisingly it was pretty easy to find parking, what a relief. Upon arrival, I noticed a security guard in the doorway and it made me feel a little uneasy especially with Los Angeles' reputation. After 15 minutes my friends and I were seated. Our waitress was this super friendly lady and treated us like her grandchildren, now it really felt like home cookin'I ordered #1 Scoe's - 1/2 Chix with dark meat + 2 waffles. Honestly it didn't look like much but my god was I wrong, I was stuffed!! The chicken was perfect, crispy and juicy. The waffles' texture was perfect. I walked out of here a happy camper and I'm sure you will too!

Reviews.Author: vimal p.
Reviews.Content: One of my fav place in LA to go to! (Ro)Scoe's Special this place is simply AWESOME, I wish they had some in Northern Ca! GO TRY IT!

Reviews.Author: Byron G.
Reviews.Content: I've lived in Los Angeles 24 years and Roscoe's is a must if you're in the area. My first reaction when I heard of Roscoe's was probably the same as everyone else's, "chicken and waffles?! Wtf?!". But let me tell you, the combo is AMAZING! Their chicken is delicious, and their waffles are probably the best I've ever had. The vibe is really chill and dark inside, which I love. The service is ok, but the food definitely makes up for it.

Reviews.Author: Gabriela Z.
Reviews.Content: Horrible service, and the people seating tables don't know what they are doing. I would not recommend coming to Roscoes..maybe a To-go order. But other than that ... It's nothing that great.

Reviews.Author: Rockinqueen R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's chicken & waffles carol C special is the best! Very casual place to eat. The place has expanded ! Thats a plus!This place is a bit noisy but, they got great food!I would recommend this place anyone whose hungry!Thumbs up :)

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: YUM!  I have heard of Roscoes before (food network yada yada yada) and was excited to have the chance to go to one! My friend and I went on a weekday afternoon around 2, and I could tell it was going to be good since there was a wait even then.  We both ended up ordering chicken with onion gravy and waffles.  The chicken was possibly the best friend chicken I've ever eaten; flavorful and juicy.  I DEFINITELY suggest getting it with the gravy (I got mine on the side and dipped, my friend got his on the chicken, it was good both ways).  Now I'm not a big waffle fan, so bear with me.  It was good, had notes of nutmeg in it and a touch of sweetness, but I can't really say much more about it than that.  I would have probably given this place all 5 stars just based on the chicken alone, but the service was a little off.  We had to wait a bit (which was perfectly fine, no complaints there) but once we were seated it took a good 10 minutes for our waitress to come over.  We weren't sure who it was or if anyone noticed we were there.  However, once service started it was good from then on out.

Reviews.Author: Diane V.
Reviews.Content: Looking for a heart attack on a plate?  This place is what's up!  It sounds like a gross combination in theory, but in practice, chicken + waffles + syrup = a choir in your mouth!  The chicken and waffle combo is really delicious, and adding a touch of syrup to it made it all the more better.  Their biscuits were quite bland though.  I think it was lacking honey, butter, or anything with taste to it, so I would skip the biscuits.  The service was ok.  It could have been better, but with food that good, it almost didn't matter as long as it didn't take too long to get to you.  Parking was ok.  It gets crowded here, so it's mostly street parking.  Keep your eyes peeled.  I probably wouldn't go here more than twice of year since this is certainly not a healthy dinner choice, but it's good for the occasional taste bud treat.

Reviews.Author: doug m.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes does rock. To a virgin, waffles and chicken don't quite sound right....but if you think about it, a waffle is just a modified (and slightly lighter) buscuit. And when you try it....oh yeah. Also try their collard greens and cold water buscuits. Delish. For another decent fried chicken experience, check out Dinahs in Glendale on San Fernando Blvd.

Reviews.Author: cheng k.
Reviews.Content: It's everything that I thought it would be. The chicken is damned good. The  waffles are very tasty. Combine chicken with waffle and syrup and it's a coma inducing masterpiece. Service was fast and friendly too!I got home, my heart was beating fast and bam. Passed out for 2 -3 hours in broad daylight. Thank you Roscoes house of Itis

Reviews.Author: Annie L.
Reviews.Content: Sorry to a be detractor, but I am not a fan.  =/I went to Roscoe's for the first time a few weeks ago.  While my eating companion gleefully stuffed his face with the fried chicken smothered with gravy & onions and then proceeded to chow down on the waffles (you can tell that he's a true fan)...I was glad I asked for the gravy on the side so that my fried chicken didn't have to swim in a pool of gravy.  The fried chicken was good, and the waffles were good too (it's impossible for something slathered in melted butter NOT to be good).    But I wasn't really wowed by it.  Because people have hyped it up to me so much over the years, I think I was expecting the best fried chicken and waffles EVER.

Reviews.Author: Coco C.
Reviews.Content: This is the location I most frequent.It's good, but it's tourist good. Chicken and waffles is such a finger licking combination. I love it for sentimental reasons, but I know it's not the best spot. The wait can be really long. Mac and cheese is good, cornbread is not. The chicken can be dry and the waffle will usually be slightly undercooked. But this is the spot to go to, especially for 'first timers in LA'. You will spot celebrities and athletes here. Not me though.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: "is there a Joan hurr? Joan?...""did u say John?...""uhh yea, JOHN, party of five?""yea that's me! thought u said 25 minute wait?""aww yea my bad, i like to put a lil cushion of time on it just in case, ya know?""oh, it's all good"*seated down wit chad wondering where the other 3 fools r**head back outside n found them just standing there*"wtf u guys doin? get the f*ck in here!"hahaHELLA hungry after a long day at Six Flag's Magic Mountain.I ordered the Scoe's #1(2 chix with gravy and 2 waffles)...HELLLLLAAAA GOOODBest damn mother effin fried finger lickin chicken ever had in my effin life!!! Dizzaaamn! This is real talk foo!Oh How tasty the chicken was under that homemade gravy of theirs... And the waffles... THE BEST ever too. This place made me say "EF DENNY'S!!!"(which was actually across the street, haha!)Our waitress was cute and was very kind too. I guess you can call her service as that southern comfort type of service. =DCan't wait to come back to this place again. Only if they had one in norcal. =(5 stars! =D

Reviews.Author: Stanton C.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles? What an awesome idea! I've had this before at a different location and it's still good. Their Scoe's combo - 1/4 chicken with two waffles will get the job done. Delicious fried chicken, a tasty waffle, and syrup. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Alyssa G.
Reviews.Content: You can never go wrong with Roscoe's!  The food is always delicious (at all the locations I've been to) and the service has been just as great!  Although their chicken and waffles are FABULOUS and I heart their cornbread, I LOOOOOVE their mac and cheese much more!  Especially with their hot sauce.  YUUUUM-OOO!  I only wish they offered bigger portions of it :(

Reviews.Author: Marc W.
Reviews.Content: I think that this place has two main things that set it apart.  One is that is is a southern diner place in LA and secondly they bizarrely serve waffles with their fried chicken.  I have no idea why they do that.  I went for the classic fried chicken with biscuit, gravy and macaroni/cheese.  The chicken is crispy on the outside and mostly moist on the inside.  One of my breast pieces was rather dry.  I like mine with the Red Rooster hot sauce, which is one of my favorites.  It was very cool to see that on the table.  I skipped the waffles.  And I'm glad that I did because the portions are rather large.

Reviews.Author: Aaron C.
Reviews.Content: Best chicken and waffles everWish the prices were a bit lower though since chicken and waffles are very easy to get but... if you're lazy and don't wanna throw em together yourself and put syrup all over it then,hey you've got yourself roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Henry S.
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate soul food place. Fried chicken and waffle? Everytime I walk out of this place I feel like my lifespan shortens by a year. Not to say this place is not good but fried food stacked with pancake, butter and maple syrup just isn't the healthiest food. I think the food here is pretty good but nothing special. I have better fried chicken and pancake before. The service is not that good and it's not the cleanest place. A lot of times you got to wait for a while for a table.

Reviews.Author: Brad C.
Reviews.Content: Funny, it's been years since I ate chicken and waffles at Roscoe's but my mouth still waters thinking about it. The fried chicken was done up ridiculously good. Crispy, seasoned, juicy, all the right stuff. Maybe it is the total lack of good Soul food slash Southern food up in the Northwest that made Roscoe's so good or maybe it was the odd feeling of being a minority in restaurant for the first time in my life and not caring because the food was so good.Fried chicken, waffles with a side of red beans and rice. Doesn't get much better than that.

Reviews.Author: Arlynn A.
Reviews.Content: Ive been here many times and my go to order will always be the "Country Boy" - 3 wings and a waffle. best of the best for Chicken 'n Waffles. - Often duplicated but never imitated!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: My first attempt at Roscoe's was way back in 2006.  I naively approached the doorman to ask the expected waiting time, and was given a forward "As long as it takes" response.  I called my losses then and there and walked away with my tail between my legs.Today, I gathered my nerve, and gave it another shot.  The wait was very similar to my previous encounter of 30 or so people waiting outside.  The doorman was a bit older, and started joking around with me from the beginning.  After commenting on my smile, and jotting down my name on the list followed by a happy face, I began my patient wait.  In under ten minutes, I was called for a seat. I noticed multiple glares as I proceeded in the restaurant, and overheard a "oh, what the hell!" from a woman with a party of eight.He sat me at a spacious 5-seat table; fortunately, we had the sweetest waitress in the whole establishment.  Her name was Brittany, and she was very courteous, and attentive.  I ordered a #2 with the gravy on the side and shared a side of mac and cheese, and candied yams with a friend.  Everything tasted as expected, but this might not be for you if you're not particularly fond of Cinnamon.  It was quite prominent in the waffles and candied yams.  The doorman came back to check in on us, and make casual small talk.  I'm hoping my next experience will be just as pleasant as this one.

Reviews.Author: Liz H.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE ROSCOE'S.I have not been in far too long, because there is no Roscoe's closer than Long Beach, and I'm in South OC. When I went I got the chicken omelet and, of course, a big ol' waffle. I have to say I was really, really skeptical about this place. Chicken and waffles? Really? Did someone try to one-up steak and ice cream?I'm so glad I tried it. The chicken was moist, but not greasy, and delicious in the omelet. The waffle was heavenly. This place is fun, kooky, and amazing hangover food. Or just, up-all-night-and-need-a-waffle food.

Reviews.Author: Via D.
Reviews.Content: This place has legit chicken and waffles along with mac and cheese! TRUST. Whenever I come to SoCal, I always stop by this joint because it is just amazing! The chicken is fried to perfection, it's not oily or soggy. The breast is very tender and very juicy! Also, the waffle is perfect; it's very moist and soft! I also recommend the mac and cheese; super delish! It has a lot of flavor and on top of it, it tastes home-made rather than those boxed, easy mac n cheese, that you would find in other restaurants. Aside from the delicious food, service here is immaculate. The servers make you feel like you are at home. They always come up and check to see if everything is going well, and before seating, they always make sure the table is squeaky clean! Overall, this place is a must try when you're in El Layyy. It's cheap, delicious, and most definitely well-known. Rumor has it, Snoop Dog comes in here from time to time, so I guess if you're a regular, you might catch him here :)

Reviews.Author: Kemi A.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is like unicorns and leprechauns: you've heard about them, they exist, but are unsure of their awesomeness until you're face to face with it. While visiting friends in the LA area, I've heard so many rave reviews of Roscoe's and I thought, "What is the big deal about Chicken and Waffles? Sounds like a weird combo to me." Heck, I'm no Chef Ramsey, but I could put this together myself. So I casually suggest we go there and I'd see what the hype was about.We got there and were immediately given seats. The menu is extensive but I stuck with the 1/4 chicken and waffles, and I got really bold and added a biscuit because who would get full on silly chicken and waffles? Our conversation throughout was something like this:"Nom Nom Nom.""Pass the syrup.""OMG I can't believe this is so good!" "Nom Nom Nom"I'm telling you, the food is beyond the bee's knees. I couldn't get over how delicious and tender the chicken was, and light and fluffy the waffles. Maybe the put some love potion in their ingredients because I have fallen head over heels with that place. Oh and the biscuit? I didn't even get that far, poor buscuit. Delicious food, great staff, and dammit, I'm addicted now!

Reviews.Author: George C.
Reviews.Content: Waffles could be a tad bit thicker...  I cant help but grab a thick juicy chunk of dark meat and press it between a fold of waffle goodness.  Oh my, I am getting excited just thinking about the succulent folds of flesh!  My nose warms at the scent of  butter mushing between the bread and batter!Forgive me, this must be a PG-13 review, for I can't get enough of the chicken, the friendly service that surrounds me.  The parking needs to be a little more convenient.  And if you have a party here, or plan to, then just plan for less than 20.

Reviews.Author: Dude Food G.
Reviews.Content: The thought of this place makes me wanna eat.We used to eat here as kids growing up and hit it at 1:30am for last call.Now it is hard to get a table and they have expanded. The food here is great as is the service.  1/2 fried chicken with waffles and 2 sides; greens and smothered potatoes.The Pico location is good too and has a better parking situation than Hollywood.Mmmmmn mmmmmn gooooood.

Reviews.Author: Miryam A.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting LA for one day and Roscoe's was recommended by a friend from the area. It was a Sunday afternoon and we were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait, but it ended up being much shorter--ten minutes tops. They recommended the free parking down the street on Gower. Our server was prompt in taking our order and the food came out very fast. At the end of our meal, however, there was a shift change and she didn't bother to tell us anything about paying at the cash register. We figured it out, but had to flag down another server for the bill. On to the food...It was my first experience with chicken and waffles, and I found the combo to be good but not life changing. I got the Obama special, which didn't look like that much (three wings and a waffle) but I only ended up eating half the waffle. The fried wings were the best part; the waffle was warm and fluffy but I personally prefer crispier. My mom ordered #22 with greens, cornbread, two thighs, and mac n' cheese. She is an excellent cook and a harsh critic and she didn't complain, although I think she knew not to expect a gourmet meal.I probably would have appreciated it more if I were there late night, after having had a few drinks. I would go back, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so.

Reviews.Author: Dulce O.
Reviews.Content: First time visit was just Dec.14th!Definitely going back!The wait to get in was horrendous- the waffle mix and fried chicken was worth the wait, though!They gave me free pie for my birthday, so that was great! :DThe waiters are very kind and fun- super fast service!!

Reviews.Author: Crystal K.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Roscoe's several times so I don't know why this is my first review here. But yeah, I love this joint! I recommend their yams and mac 'n cheese. Their collard greens were salty for a while but they must've changed the recipe because now they're edible. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: For many years, I propagated the statement that Roscoe's was the best chicken in the world, and while it certainly does trump all the fast chicken chains, it isn't as good when it's cold. It just doesn't last...and you really have to be starving for the food to taste good...so if you're not hungry, don't read this review!then again, you probably wouldn't be on yelp reading about food if you weren't hungry :)the chicken is crisp and juicy, the waffles are steaming hot with melted butter and oozing with maple syrup. the best way to enjoy the chicken..fold the chicken into a buttered waffle, then dunk into maple syrup. mmm mm delicious.how they clean all those little maple syrup jars is beyond me. is there a specialized position for that?

Reviews.Author: Johanan L.
Reviews.Content: When I go here, I never order a waffle nor a piece of chicken...I ORDER MULTIPLE WAFFLES, AND MULTIPLE PIECES OF CHICKEN!  puahahah.There are few things that bring joy like an order of "Country Boy, Country Girl or Half chix smothered with gravy" (Don't be wimpy, put the gravy on the chicken not on the side).  I brought my family here 2 weeks ago and a friend this weekend and they kept wondering why the size of the smile on my face got larger the closer we got to Roscoe's!  I can't help it.  My smile suffers from Inversely Proportional to Distance from Roscoe's syndrome.  I gotta' have my Roscoe's!Oh btw, make sure to order the Orange Sunrise (half lemonade and half orange juice).  It's perfect for those times when you need to get hyperglycemic!

Reviews.Author: Kelson H.
Reviews.Content: 1/11/08It is my sad duty to write this review.  I must say I expected much more from this place as the house of chicken and waffles.  Maybe I had a bad batch.  I was expecting juicy tender fried chicken with a golden brown waffle.  What I got was a decent waffle and a dry piece of fried chicken.  I ordered a side of grits and it was a bit watery.  The service once seated was great.   A nice selection of lemonade drinks to my surprise awaited me when I looked at the liquid refreshments.  A mixture of orange juice, lemonade or ice tea was among the named items on the menu.Ordered a chicken and waffle with a side of grits.  Also tried the mac and cheese.Chicken: dryWaffle: Sweet & good, although a bit much for my taste.Grits: WateryMac&Cheese: Ok Tasted like standard mac and cheese.Service: 3Food: 1Decor:1Maybe I'll try again in the future, but don't bet your pastrami on it.

Reviews.Author: Ryan T.
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations was to high, maybe my dreams of waffle, syrup and chicken was a fantasy but my first Roscoe experience was a disappointment. I was excited to get my Roscoe cherry popped since so many of my friends love this place.  Parking was difficult since they had no parking lot and only street parking was available.  There was a crowd of people in the front waiting for tables so a good sign no doubt.My wife and I were seated right away since there was only two of us which was a plus.  I ordered the two waffles and dark meat combo with a side of cornbread while the wife ordered the white meat combo.  The waffles were big but flat and limpy...I prefer my waffles crispy.  The cornbread was dry and I only took two bites of it since it needed so much butter and syrup to make it moist.  The chicken is what I really like and even though I am not a fan of white meat the breast was done perfectly and juicy and not dry at all.  Overall I was a little disappointed but maybe that's because I over hyped it.  But it wasn't bad just not the enlightened experience I was hoping for.

Reviews.Author: Cortnie V.
Reviews.Content: I'm consistantly diappointed with Roscoes.  Before I review, I would like to let you know that I think I KNOW fried chicken....  I'm from Kansas City, which I woud consider honorary South.  The Midwest does some of the best BBQ in all of the US of A, and the fried chicken "ain't" bad, either.  My great-grandparents were farmers, and they made INCREDIBLE fried chicken (that was walking a few hours before I ate it!).  That being said, every single time I go to Roscoe's, the chicken is dry, the batter sucks, and I could get better waffles if I took an Eggo and popped it in the toaster.  Coupled with the wait, I just can't advocate Roscoe's.I get the novelty.  Chicken and waffles-- neat.  I get that Roscoe's is sort of an LA "thing"-- a novelty....BUT, I'm thoroughly convinced that because people on the West coast are unfamiliar with soul food, fried food, down home food, southern food, etc., people just don't know that they are eating shitty food.Ugh.  All in all, this place sucks!  DON'T GO!

Reviews.Author: Paolo P.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I should even add to the hundreds of reviews.I had it to-go last night so it's still fresh on my mind.This Hollywood Roscoe's doesn't have parking. Unless I missed it. Mostly street parking if you can find a spot. I parked at the plaza on the corner where Red Ribbon bakery is (I didn't see a guard and I was getting take out so I risked it).The food well, they didn't reinvent the wheel here. They combined decent fried chicken with decent waffles. Will I go back again? definitely. Was it good? yes it was. Will I go to the top of a mountain and exclaim it's glory, maybe not. Personally, I prefer my waffles to be a little bit more crispier. I love the hot sauce though.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: Overrated is an understatement.  The next time I want chicken and waffles I am going to buy a box of Eggo's and a two piece meal from Popeye's.  I think the hype around this place is because it is a tourist thing to do; everyone wants to say they have eaten their, now it seems passe.I went with high hopes.  I start all restaurants off with five stars then deduct as I go.  -1st star for the fake wait.  They let a line build before they will seat you even though there are plenty of seats available. -2nd star for service, we were seated and left for 20 minutes without as much as our drink order being taken.  -3rd star, for customer satisfaction, if I want to substitute greens for potatoes I should be allowed (it is an option in other "combo" meals they serve).I left disappointed, didn't even want a t-shirt after it was all said and done.

Reviews.Author: Deb B.
Reviews.Content: OMG...this is the best place to go to after drinking in Hollywood and needing to eat pronto! the staff took care of us, brought our food pronto...it was great.i ordered the chicken (dark) & waffles. my husband ordered the same with gravy...then asked for cornbread & macNcheese (my husband loves some macNcheese and knew it would be good here). EVERYTHING was good! he had no leftovers, but i took mine home for snacking and early morning hangover helpers.we WILL return!

Reviews.Author: Leily P.
Reviews.Content: How can you go wrong with grits, fried chicken, and biscuits? You can't. Also they have a pretty interesting variety of drinks.

Reviews.Author: Abraham P.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is apparently one of those "must try" restaurants in LA so I made my way over there.  I have to be honest here, I didn't really go in with any sort of high expectations.  C'mon, it's fried chicken and waffles.  I've had that combination before and it was good, but it wasn't anything special.  I just chalked up all the hype to Angelinos just not being used to the combination.We were escorted to our seats by a big bouncer-like dude wearing a security shirt.  We arrived around at 4 and the place was packed.  The interior was smartly done with a bit of that southern motif and nice mellow lights.  I ordered the regular fried chicken and waffles and my brother ordered the gravy smothered chicken and waffles.  The waffles were very well done.  One of the best waffles that I've had, although for some it might tend to be a bit on the sweet side.  My fried chicken unfortunately cannot get the same comment.  The chickens were a bit dried out and honestly, there wasn't anything special about it to set it apart from the other fried chickens I've had before.  The gravy chicken was another story.  The gravy replaced some of the lost moisture, so the chicken tasted better and the gravy was good too.  This would be the one that I recommend.Overall, I would say that it was better than I expected it to be.  I say that this is one of those restaurants that you should try, but I can't say that it's one that I would frequent.One thing to note, the waiters are apparently not allowed to handle your card/cash so when they bring out the check, take it over to the cashier.

Reviews.Author: Charlie S.
Reviews.Content: Why was this Roscoe's so amazing???I've been to the one in Long Beach a few times, and it though it was good, I have never gotten the craving to just go there, even if my boyfriend lived around the corner. It was always to bring someone uninitiated to the food.Maybe it was because we arrived just as someone was pulling out of a choice parking spot. Maybe it was because we arrived just after six and we could've cared less about the meter. Perhaps we had just had an amazing day at the observatory, where we ran into some of the Knocked Up cast on a hike.Maybe because we waited no more than fifteen minutes.Or maybe because:[+] the service went ABOVE AND BEYOND expectations. Great, friendly security/host, attentive waitress, refills w/o being asked, etc[+] THE FOOD. OH the food. split two dishes amongst 4 people: 1/2 chix w/ gravy and onions, 1/2 chix prepared southern style. dark meat all around baby ;)[+] southern style chicken: CRISPY, FRESH, JUICY. ketchup & rooster sauce only further complimented it[+] chix w/ gravy & onions: creamy & flavorful[+] syrup: everyone was raving bout the syrup. I take the butter off, put it on the side, and add as I please to sections right before I ate it[+] CLEAN BATHROOMS!!!!! Thank you Roscoes, for putting your profits towards sparkling your bathrooms up!!![-] table in a cramped locationThe stars were aligned. Roscoe's, you only contributed to an already epic day.The perfect re-fueling meal after the observatory hike. We all left satisfied and my friends happy w/ their first Roscoe's experience.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay A.
Reviews.Content: (This is a review of my one time experience)*Pleasant Staff*Potentially Challenging Street Parking *OPEN UNTIL 12AM (handy for people such as myself, working up until 9:45pm)I started off with the CHICKEN & WAFFLES. That's what the place is known for, so I figured it was a safe start. I added a side of beans and rice, and was expecting more in the way of flavor, but they were still okay.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: Best food of your life!!!!! Don't go here if you are on a diet though, you will seriously feel so guilty afterwards, you might shoot yourself. I have been going here for years and the only 2 food items I have ever gotten are the Fried Chicken & Waffles.... The Sunrise Drink & Arnold Palmer are really good but will give you a major sugar rush!Don't forget to use that hot-sauce with the Rooster on the label, somehow that blend of sweet (from the syrup) combined with spicy from the hotsauce mixed with chicken and waffles is just simply amazing...

Reviews.Author: Grace P.
Reviews.Content: Wish they had this in the bay too but blah oh well.It's always a treat to go here when I'm in LA.Of course the chicken and waffles are great but damn the Mac and Cheese is freakin on point.The Sunset drink is hella sweet but just water it down and its all good.LOVEz it.

Reviews.Author: Kimmie J.
Reviews.Content: Roscoesssss.I don't love you, but I like you though! :)Hitting up this spot after going to Les Deux, or being bored in the overcrowded Cabana is a highlight of my night.Chicken and gravy, one waffle, grits, a biscuit, side of mac and cheese, all bomb.DON'T FORGET YOUR STRAWBERRY LEMONADE. Tart as ever but good.The service is blah though, and they are not very flexible on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Kristina L.
Reviews.Content: long lines.. but worth the wait... waffles are average.. chicken is awesome!!!! :) tried the grits here.. light, fluffy, kinda reminded me of jook (Chinese Porridge) I got #12.. it's the breast and one waffle.. the one with 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles is way too much for a girl I think.. it even seems hard for the guys to finish it... just an fyi.I always come here when I'm in LA... it's a must go to place. :P Staff is sweet.. they gave me a Sweet potato pie for my birthday.

Reviews.Author: Susan R.
Reviews.Content: Yay  if you like to have chicken and waffles this is the place to go.  I love their chicken wings .  Their waffles are huge at least that what I think.  Upon arrival we were greeted and seated with no wait. Our server took our order. The food was done and served within 15 minutes.  Only 4 stars cause they don't have a parking lot for themselves. You have to park on the street.  I guess that goes with being in LA.  Also the place is dim inside.   They also have a security guard in front that looks like easy-e. Yup I am a fan of  Roscoe's Yum chicken

Reviews.Author: Theresa T.
Reviews.Content: Chicken? Waffles? These two delicious foods are delicious by itself... but when put together, your mind can't help but go, "What??" But trust mee, the combination of chicken and waffles is amazing! :) Although I gotta admit that it's rather pricey for just a piece of chicken and a waffle, it is deeelicious. The chicken was tender and crispy and the waffles were just yummm. Let's just say, KFC & Eggo's got nothing on them! Hahah.I think it's safe to say that if you're ever in the LA vicinity, it is an absolute MUST to hit up Roscoe's. It would be a waste of a trip if you didn't!

Reviews.Author: Ariel C.
Reviews.Content: We ate there a couple of days ago while driving around LA. I happened to notice the famous or infamous Roscoe's out of the corner of my eye. So we went in and were seated right away. We ordered the chicken and waffles since they are known for this combo. The food was served in good time and my friend wanted to order some sides which he did. He liked them more than I do. He ordered a side of beans, mac and cheese & potatoes and gravy.I enjoyed the meal very much and loved the fried chicken. It was cooked right and the batter they used to make the fried chicken was addicting. Probably the salt and seasoning factor. The waffle was a bit on the soggy side but hey you're gonna put butter and maple syrup so it don't really matter. The server who waited on us was very good and the guy who seated us (probably the manager) was friendly as well.One observation I made is you may see people selling stuff outside the restaurant. There was one guy trying to sell his CD (probably hoping to see some of the famous patrons known to eat there) and another one selling tennis shoes.This place I would definately come back.

Reviews.Author: Phil S.
Reviews.Content: I was at a bachelor party for a friend who lives in LA... Of course I've heard of Roscoe's, but we went here at about 4AM after a night of crazyness. The waffles especially were amazing. It might have been the best waffle I've ever eaten, and the chicken was damn good too. The combo cant be beat, especially after a night of drinking and partying when you just want something a little fried and greasy. This place is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Vivian L.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came down to LA and decided to eat here for the ORIGINAL Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. The one at Oakland is not as great as the one in SoCal, of course. Came here on a Friday around 8pm and there was a short line at the doorway. Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table of 7. Not that bad of a wait actually. There were also a lot of parking around that time.Got seated and got our menus to order. I ordered a #1 based on all the reviews on here. My other friends ordered a #1 and a #4 (fried chicken with gravy) as well. I got mixed chicken (dark and white meat), and I really liked the dark meat better. I felt the white chicken was too dry for my own liking. It was ESPECIALLY good with the gravy too. It made the white meat not as dry, and it tastes super yum. There was drinks with free refills that came along with the meal as well. The waffles were also very good. They add a lot of butter on it. The fried chicken coating was also very crunchy too. BEST FRIED CHICKEN EVER. My friends also bought 2 tshirts from here :)

Reviews.Author: Geoff Y.
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I wasn't too sure what to expect eating here.  I did see Bourdain's segment on one of these locations during his LA show, but I guess I just had to see for myself as a final meal before leaving LA.In the interest of further disclosure, I was hesitant about walking in given the handful of unsavory characters milling about outside the door, not to mention the fact that I was carrying a big camera to take pictures of the food.Once inside, the first thing that struck me was that I had the only light face of all the patrons.  I don't say this as a bad thing - as stereotypical as it may sound, I would attribute the quality of the food to be what attracted them in the first place.  So while everyone was giving me the strange "what's this Asian kid doing here?" look, I just sat down and went about my business and they all went back to their food.Now to the food and service: I would have given this place four stars, but I literally had to look around for a waiter to take my order.  At first I thought that it was busy and I wouldn't rush them.  But five minutes after I'd put down the menu and waited, I hadn't noticed anybody coming by.  I glanced behind me towards the kitchen, and I saw a few waiters filling syrup cups.  Not wanting to be rude, I patiently waited another few minutes or so, debating over my choice while glancing back more and more often.  Finally I caught the attention of one of them, who finally came to take my order: 1/4 chix (white meat) with two waffles.The food itself was decent.  I got a thigh and a wing, but it was really dry so I had to take some points off for that.  The waffles were okay, but they weren't hot enough to really melt the butter they gave me.  It's a good amount of food for one person, unless you're a football player or Michael Phelps, and I was thoroughly food coma'd by the end.  Very greasy and heavy, but it was good since I knew I wouldn't have many chances to eat before or during my flight.

Reviews.Author: Rey E.
Reviews.Content: This place is the king of chicken and waffles. I like how it's open sooo late. I was craving waffles for my fourth meal, so me and my buddies drove an hour just to eat.....and it was worth it. Add gravy to your chicken, it makes the chicken tasty.Just thinking of this place makes me hungry. I want some now.

Reviews.Author: Jorge S.
Reviews.Content: This place is HEAVEN! Friendly service, and AMAZING food. Their gravy-covered fried chicken was absolutely amazing. Waffles were made in-house and absolutely amazIng. Biscuits were delicious as well.ACCEPT NO IMITATIONS! This place is LEGENDARY.If you're ever in the Hollywood area, make SURE you try this place out.Might be a little rowdy at night though, hence all of the security guards at damn near every corner of the restaurant :)

Reviews.Author: Frank B.
Reviews.Content: A must eat place if you are in the Hollywood vicinity. Typically day includes a meal at Roscoes and walking it off browsing for records at Amoeba down the street.Best fried chicken EVER!!!!Best waffle EVER!!!Best drink (Sunrise) EVER!!!!Order the Carol C. Special as an intro to this So Cal landmarkStreet parking but what else is expected, you are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Anita V.
Reviews.Content: I am a sweet and savory kinda gal. Honestly, I did not know what to expect. I got there pretty early so I was sat right away. Service was friendly and efficient.  I ordered a leg, thigh and a waffle. Oh, and I split an order of the macaroni and cheese.After I took a bite of my chicken and then a waffle, I wanted to fist pump I was so happy. Best mac n' cheese I have ever had. I highly recommend this. MMMMMMMMM........(They also had a sign that said something like " we'll always have a table set for you, Teena Marie," which really warmed my heart)

Reviews.Author: Kristopher V.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of deep-fried foods so I was a little hesitant to try this place, but after hearing so much "buzz" I finally gave in. Jeanne Jones Omelet (3/5) - This omelet consists of eggs, fried chicken, and cheese. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it. However by the time I finished eating I felt like I had just consumed a vat of grease.Waffle (2/5) - I did not like this at all. Perhaps it was because I ordered it to-go and it became too mushy by the time I tried it.

Reviews.Author: Tram T.
Reviews.Content: Great food.  Chicken & waffles was delicious mixed with the gravy & syrup.  Almost anything ordered takes me back to my days growing up in the South.Bring lots of change for parking, the wait almost made it not worth it.Not great to eat all the time.

Reviews.Author: Rosemarie Ann A.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place for years from LA locals, I finally got the chance to try this imfamous place about a month ago. And well? though the food was good (the whole concept of fried chicken and waffles with maple syrup is delicous) I wasen't impressed. The waffles were nice and soft, and I can tell they were freshly made. However the fried chicken just didn't  stand out to me. It was just your ordinary fried chicken to me. And for the price I thought it was pretty pricey just for chicken and waffles, despite portions. The place itself was okay...pretty small, yet it gets super packed. The service is good.  All in all I feel that the hype wasen't worth it to me. Sorry. :( I feel like I could honestly find better out there. Would I eat here again? Sure, if I was in the neighborhood. However to journey all the way from SD and OC my answer is no. Sorry Roscoe's. :(

Reviews.Author: Claire L.
Reviews.Content: Yay Roscoe's!!! Oh goodness, does it get any better than a #1 or #2 'Scoe's? 2 pieces of THE MOST DELICIOUS FRIED CHICKEN GOODNESS YOU WILL EVER TASTE PLUS 2 OF THE TASTIEST WAFFLES! Top that with some syrup and/or gravy and mmm... :)Chicken and Waffles, seriously, how do people not love this combination? I don't understand because It's amazing! The amazing fried chicken gives the salty and crunchy, then you have the waffle with the butter and syrup for the sweet and soft. So good! I've had chicken and waffles at a few other places, but Roscoe's is definitely tops.And as a bonus to the delicious food, you have great service & clean bathrooms.Parking can be tricky when it's crowded (like on the weekend) so I recommend sending a representative to put your name down, while someone else in your party searches the side streets for parking.

Reviews.Author: Ula C.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I would have given this awesome place 5 Stars if it weren't for the fact that it's SO FAR AWAY from the bay area and quite pricey for friend chicken!With that said, let me just tell you that this place is a Salty + Sweet + Savory Heaven.  We were en route home from SoCal after visiting the happiest place on earth when we decided that for lunch my boyfriend and I would try the infamous Roscoe's (if Snoop Dog says it's good then it must be...).  I read on Yelp that the line at this place usually gets pretty long but I'm not sure if it was luck or destiny that at 12:00 PM, peak of lunch time, our wait time was only 30 minutes!  We ordered 2 #1's with a side of gravy and cornbread (then we added another #1 to-go for one of our friends...3 hours later the meal was still pretty damn good!)Chicken: (1 leg + 1 big piece of thigh/breast)  Moist, Juicy, with the right amount of seasoning, and the skin is oh-so crispy! Waffles: (2 large pieces) It taste like any other waffle...frankly, I've had better but with the syrup and chicken it's quite out of this world!Cornbread: eh. it's good for 2 though.Gravy: let's just put it this way, if i could've taken it home in a to-go cup with a straw, I would've--that good!It looks very simple and ordinary but the combination of the sweet and savory is unlike anything I've ever had before.  The service is pretty good too.  The staff are very nice including the older gentleman who is in charge of the front.  To tell you the truth, I'm glad that this place is that far away from where I live, otherwise I'll be there at least once a week-- so not good!

Reviews.Author: Molly A.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's, you make Hollywood worthwhile. Their fried chicken is moist, never soggy; perfectly accompanied with their delicious Louisiana Hot Sauce - mama love. Their waffles are soft and buttery without being flaccid or Denny's-like. Just heavenly, southern, carb-licious fatty yum yums with a side of syrup for your pouring pleasure.If you drink alcohol, live in Hollywood, or just want some warm lovin' - give mama Roscoe a call, you can even get this magic to go!

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: OMG why cant they have one in San Diego!? WHY!? I love Roscoe's! The chicken is so deliciously seasoned and tender its amazing how good it is!The waffles...UGH! The waffles... SOOO REMARKABLY DELICIOUS!Will go again and again when I'm up in LA or even Long Beach!

Reviews.Author: Ulysses M.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoes, how I love your chicken.  Unfortunately my second visit to this spot was similar to my first.  The first time I visited the Gower St. location, it was on a late Friday night.  The wait was understandably long, just because it was Friday and this location is small.  However, I came with a group of 5 friends and the wait was pretty long as well - and that was on a Wednesday afternoon.  The worst part about the wait was that once we were seated, it took an additional 20 minutes just to get our drinks and order.  Food = phenomenal but Service = could be better.  The authenticity of this location is a plus and maybe they had a bad day, but Oh well.  The LBC location and Pasadena locations run circles around this joint.

Reviews.Author: Blck R.
Reviews.Content: Grub'n. Nuff said. Parking sucks.Four trans-fats out of five.

Reviews.Author: Maryneth K.
Reviews.Content: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. Chicken and waffles. Chicken & Waffles.Anyway you put it; it is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Alice C.
Reviews.Content: I came here last Tuesday around 2:15 with a group of 11 and only had to wait for around 10 minutes which is very reasonable.I've been to other Roscoe's and the wait was always longer.This time I ordered A. Sir Michael, which came with 1/4 chix smothered with gravy and onions, grits, and a biscuit.The meat was so tender, and not salty at all which I liked, the gravy was good too but not hot at all =/. I did ask for butter on the side for the grits and the grits was kind of disgustingly oily/buttery. I really liked the biscuit, it was really fluffy =). The waffles are also good but my friends thought it was too sweet.The waitress that served us was nice but forgetful, one of my friends asked for gravy on the side with his dish but it never came and it was hard to get the waitress' attention even though the restaurant wasn't that busy. He ended up having to walk near the kitchen and get the gravy by himself.p.s you have to pay for street parking which is a bummer.

Reviews.Author: Ashley B.
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: For all of you who wrinkle their noses at the idea of Fried chicken n waffles, this is not a review or place for you. Please take your negative, ornate, unwilling a** somewhere else. Thanks. Alright, so for those of you that are interested in trying something A.) New, B.) Amazing, and C.) TANTALIZING TO THE TASTE BUDS, look NO FURTHER! This small soul food chain has five different locations, open late (HELLOOOO MASSIVE MIDNIGHT/ CLUB RUN MUNCHIES) and food is served rather quick! I personally get Scoes (#1). Two pieces of Chicken and two delectable waffles. A side of mac n cheese. (oh god). And a fresh squeezed oj. Most people opt for an eclipse (lemonade, oj, fruit punch)-Juices are fresh squeezed. There's grits, collard greens, biscuits, cornbread, fries, candy yams, giblets- YOU NAME IT!The best part is the waffles if you ask me. They have a secret recipe and there's a tasty hint of cinnamon. Oh SO GOOD. Everytime I come its the best service ever. Last time I came I was rather "out of the loop" if you catch my drift.. Left my iphone on the table and my server quickly flagged me down outside the restaurant and returned my cellphone. Can you say, HONESTY?!!  I love this place. My friends always crack jokes that I'm always checking into Scoes on facebook. oh well. It's my favorite. haha. Some tips: Parking can be a b**** if your not familiar with the area, yes there is parking across the street, but it's easier to just do valet. Second this a great place for groups, however-they won't split the bill so you best bring cash if you don't want that awkward "how are we gonna pay" moment. This place is filled with amazing food that will shoot your cholesterol through the roof, so I advise major detox and sweatpants post-meal. haha. Remember your heading to roscoes, smoking something sticky and enjoy! :)

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: Suuuuuper delicious. The chicken is very moist and juicy -- not dry at all! I didn't exactly order chicken and waffles but, I must say the other dish I had was just as good. Their grits were also really yummy while the biscuits were soft and freshly made. Service is a bit on the slow side but that's ok...you're ordering fried chicken and waffles. What can you expect? I will say, though, that the prices for sides and drinks are a bit much. Good thing about Roscoe's is that it's open until 12am Sunday-Friday and 4am on Saturday. Perfect for those late nights!

Reviews.Author: A.J. P.
Reviews.Content: A dream of mine has been to visit Roscoe's and waiting for our party of 15 to get a table was worth the wait.Truly a food coma experience unlike any other and I can't wait to go back when in the LA area!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie D.
Reviews.Content: As I said with the other location I went to...YUUUUUM! I never knew chicken and waffles would be such a great combo. Their chicken is juicy and their waffles are fluffy and just the right size. They have a combo with chicken breast and one waffle. That was deinitely enough to fill me up. Don't really like white meat? That's ok. They have a combo with one waffle and 3 chicken legs. They have something for everybody. The service great. We had no problems ordering or receiving our check. I can't wait to come back here again.

Reviews.Author: Michael P.
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to check out Roscoe's last Saurday Morning... Being from the east coast I hear great things about Roscoe's as a must go spot when youre in LA.  I went to the orginal spot located on Gower.  I ordered the Number 9 "Country Boy"  The fried chicken had good flavor inside and outside.  Some fried chicken tends to have most of its favor on the outside, but this chicken was flavored well.  The waffle was also delish and the kicker was the syrup, which tasted like a honey syrup it went well with the chicken and waffle.  I also ordered a side of mac and cheese which was amazingly good at 10 am in the morning hahahaha. I will def hit up Roscoe's when I return to LA!

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: This joint is amazing!I got fried liver and it was delicious.  No way could one person finish all the food they give you.The waffle was also incredibly large.  I was already full after eating it.Too bad there aren't any in Northern Cali.  I'd drive to LA just to eat here.

Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: What else can you say about Roscoe's except that their chicken is legend.. wait for it... and I hope you're not lactose intolerant because the next word is DAIRY. Ever since I've had it for the first time last summer, it's hard to visit SoCal without hitting up Roscoe's on my way out.When you have batter, that is so well seasoned and comes out perfectly crispy, coating a moist piece of chicken (I prefer the thighs, oh so sexy thighs) then you got a winning combination. Even the white meat comes out tasty and I'm all about that dark, dark meat. I wouldn't consider their waffles to be out of this world but with a small spread of butter and syrup, you've got yourself a sweet treat. I see a lot of people get gravy to cover their chicken or just to dip with, but I'm not too much of a fan of this. It takes away from the chicken itself. All I need is a bottle of hot sauce to send me off in the right direction.Top it off, their service has always been top notch, and always make me feel welcome no matter which location I visit. Every time I eat here, I always leave feeling satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Nora H.
Reviews.Content: Yay! I finally made it to Roscoes :) So I had been meaning to hit up roscoes for a while. I came with a friend on a saturday night and this place was definitely poppin'.  There was no trouble parking luckily!  It seemed like there was a long wait but since we were a party of two, they welcomed us in out of the rain right away.  This place is great.  The combination of chicken and waffles really worked!  My friend and I both got Chicken and Waffles combo, which seems to be what everyone else gets.  It was delicious.  He got gravy on his chicken and mine was plain, but I ended up stealing some of his.  I would recommend getting the gravy on the side unless you want your chicken drowned in a giant pool of gravy--it's a little overkill.So the food was great, service was good--ample water refills, and the homey down south feel of this place was unbeatable.  It's like a trip outta town without having to leave hollywood :)

Reviews.Author: Ann H.
Reviews.Content: I must admit that my sister and I decided to try Roscoe's, because of Snoop Dogg.  Well....snoop knows what's up!  The BEST fried chicken I've ever had.The BEST Waffles I've ever had.I have never had anything but the Chicken & Waffle's....and gravy mmmmmmmmm...get the gravy on the side if you want your chicken to stay a bit crispy.No....the chicken and waffles are not mixed...they come on the same plate and I know it sounds like a weird combo, but...TRUST me....it's rockin!

Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: Overrated.Been here a buncha times - chicken is inconsistent. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's not.The biscuits don't taste like they're fresh.Church's Chicken is better.

Reviews.Author: Kay Y.
Reviews.Content: My friend from out of town was visiting and she desperately wanted to try Roscoe's so we went to this location because it was closest to out hotel.  We actually tried to go the night before but it was too busy.  We got there at about 9AM and there was plenty of parking.  The nice guy outside told that we were lucky since we came early enough so we didn't have to put money in the meter.  He also said that most people don't think they will get ticketed on a Sunday so they avoid putting money in but sure enough they come out of the restaurant with a parking a ticket!  SO put money in the meter!Anyways, since this is my second time eating at Roscoe's, I suggested the chicken breast to my friend.  It was moist and cooked perfectly just liked I remembered.  Most "good chicken" places still give you a dry piece of chicken breast but Roscoe's definitely does it right.  I ordered some special (I forgot the the name) with eggs, potatoes, and a biscuit.  The biscuit was delicious and the eggs were too.  They were really fluffy and cooked with cheese and diced onions.  The potatoes, well, I feel indifferent towards them.  They were okay.

Reviews.Author: Shaun W.
Reviews.Content: This place is legendary.Every black person in L.A. knows about Roscoes and I finally made my pilgramage about 4-5 years ago. Their chicken is "good" not great. Their waffles are "thebestever" not simply "great."Their waffles seem so basic looking but it's like biting into divine manna with buttery and maple syrupy awesomeness.Their was some type of egg+meat thing I tried my last time which was amazing. Also liked their Mac n Cheese. This one of Gower has SHITTY parking. I was going to review one of the "real" Roscoes in the heart of Black L.A. but since I go here the most (proximity) I choose this.This one on Gower is huge however they reverse discriminate here. If you come with a Black group or just by yourself as a black person they seat you in the room full of black people. If you come with people who aren't black they sit you in a seperate room. I've come with friends and/or family and been in the black room every time and when the 2 times I brought dates (mexican & white) I was in the ethnic diversity room. -_-

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: Almost passed up an opportunity to eat here a few days ago because of the large crowd in front of the restaurant. Luckily, my friend and I decided to give it a shot. Surprisingly, we were seated right away.DO NOT miss the chicken and waffles. It may sound like an odd combo, but it is delicious. There's something about Roscoe's chicken and waffles that just works.My friend and I ordered the #4 with half a chicken with gravy and two waffles. We were hungry for chicken so we also ordered the daily special which was was two thighs, a biscuit, and gravy over rice for only $6! All in all, there was more chicken than enough!For drinks, we also ordered the eclipse which is a mix of orange juice, fruit punch and lemonade. Again, unusual combo, but delicious (notice a theme?)Our server was friendly and split the meal even without us having to tell him. Definitely will be back again (this was my second visit).

Reviews.Author: Cindy V.
Reviews.Content: Never been here? Get in your car right now and go.Everything here is delicious! I went with my family and my dad asked the waiter what's the restaurant best known dish. The waiter just laughed.Best thing you can eat is the chicken & waffles duh!!For parking I just pay $5 bucks and my car is in the private lot across the street.

Reviews.Author: Mel J.
Reviews.Content: First time checking out the hype...it was aiight but not amazing. If you're in the Bay Area try Brown Sugar kitchen in Oakland to really be amazed!

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came here I tried chicken liver omelet. It was yummy. We had a big group and I got to try their chicken and waffles they are so famous for. The food tasted delicious. I went back a few more times and the only complaint I may have is the service could be spotty...all depends on the night you crash the Chicken & Waffle Party.

Reviews.Author: Magic H.
Reviews.Content: This place is the quintessential chicken spot.Heavily rooted in a true "black america" fashion, Roscoes gives you a genuine experience.From the door greeter who is soulful, real, and all about getting this big ass line sorted out- people sat- and pretty girls attended to, ha.The food is true to the Southern core.There was an Obama special too I wanted to try, but just got the standard waffles and chicken.I can feel my heart get a big clogged up after eating the fried chicken, carbs, and syrup. But I like it. I went here with some English types, they didn't really understand any of it.I believe Roscoes is a true celebration of American cuisine, southern roots, and should partner in some capacity with the House of Blues.AT LEAST, they should have free style contests or something, because it could be a lot more than just a restaurant.Consider the line comparable to Pinks, as that's the closest thing I can think of to compare it to.Looking forward to the next time, and although my review is 5 stars-When you are as busy and in high-demand as this place, you are probably going to run into some bad experiences.You can't make everyone happy when you are dealing with high volume in any kind of service field.Hatters gonna hat. PS: VALET IS ABNORMALLY EXPENSIVE FOR A CHICKEN PLACE, WTF?PARK ON THE STREET, walk, or a cab if you are local will be cheaper. $10-15 I forgot.

Reviews.Author: Gracie H.
Reviews.Content: Best service ever on 4/20/13 - as soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated immediately. Drink orders were taken and our food came so quickly.  Not only was the service GREAT but the food was on point !  I am from No. Cali but we always make it a point to visit Roscoe's Hose of Chicken & Waffles when we're in So. Cal.

Reviews.Author: Shari P.
Reviews.Content: After having eaten here more times than I can count and going several years without, I found myself here for a late lunch. Ah, memories...Roscoe's isn't going to be the place for the best-of-the-best in fine dining, but it's an institution and it's really something that should be tried for bragging sake.The food is good. I wish the waffles were a little more well done, but you can ask for that. The chicken is yum. Very moist and piping hot. I really like the mac & cheese, too. Don't be scared away by the people waiting to be seated. The place is huge and you won't wait  too long. The service on the day I was there was great. Our waiter paid very good attention to us and returned a few times to check in and he was quite busy. All and all it was a nice return visit after many years of absence.

Reviews.Author: Missy F.
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego, but every time I'm in LA,  I make sure to stop by Roscoe's. To me.. the chicken is hit or miss. I've been to this location so may times... and I can say that I have had some " beyond fried chicken" before..But when the chicken is cooked just right... Man!!! Mmmm...Mmmmmm....The waffles are always on point. I can't get enough of that butter and syrup combo. The sides are pretty good too - but definitely not worth paying almost $5 A-La Cart for a side order. They need to mix up the combo meals a little. I usually park in the 1 hour parking on Gower. I have never waited more than 10 min to be seated. Your food comes out fast and hot!  You gotta give them a try..at least once if your up in LA!

Reviews.Author: Devo S.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmm...chicken and waffles from Roscoe's is as good as they say it is! I looked at the menu online, so before I got there i knew wanted the Country Boy (3 wings and a waffle) plus a side of cornbread (because I didn't already have enough carbs lined up for this experience!). When I got there at 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon, the throngs of people outside foretold of a wait. I went up and put my name on the list for my table of one, preparing to wait (you wait outside until allowed in!) for at least an hour. Five minutes later, much to the chagrin of folks who had obviously been waiting a while, I got called. Guess it pays to fly solo sometimes! I was led in by a very nice older guy, and seated promptly with the occasional "sugar" and "honey" thrown in (love that!). I looked at the menu just to make sure my Country Boy offering was still available...it was, but now they've renamed it the "Obama Special"...UGH! Since I couldn't bring myself to say that, I just ordered the "Number 9" with waffle ;)The chicken was hot, fresh, and delicious; the waffle was as sweet and chewy as all have said before, and the cornbread was super. Also, my iced tea was NEVER empty.Great place that lives up to the hype, in my opinion....so glad I finally got to try it, and lucky I didn't have to wait forever to get in :)

Reviews.Author: Martin J.
Reviews.Content: Went here to recover from the boisterous evening my cousins and I had the previous night. My recovery food consists of high calorie meals with fried meat as the centerpiece of the meal. We agreed that since we were in Los Angeles, Roscoe's was a must. We were fortunate to arrive during one of their slow periods of the day and we had a short wait time. However, after we were seated the wait time carried over and we waited almost 30 minutes before a server came to take our orders. The server's congeniality ameliorated our impatience and displeasure over her delay in taking our orders. The food arrived quickly, which worried me because quickly served food at a restaurant is generally mediocre at best. Also, it worried me that they served our food before they provided us the cutlery. To my surprise the food was delicious. I ordered the Scoe's dish that consists of two waffles and two pieces of fried chicken (breast and leg) covered in gravy. The fried chicken was crispy despite being covered in gravy and it was cooked to perfection. The waffles had the crispy texture that gives awesome waffles that crunch and the aroma of freshly cooked waffles permeated through the air. I don't even think I chewed my food; I must've breathed it in. The decor reminded me of 1980s Los Angeles and I felt like I was in my grandmother's kitchen. Their concept is obviously unorthodox, but despite the unconventionality the food is delicious. The only reason I didn't give this review 5 stars is because of the time it took to get serviced and the slight disorganization of not having our tables equipped with cutlery that resulted in waiting a little bit longer to eat our food. Also, the lack of the 5th star is a result of their policy of not splitting the checks. We didn't know this as we were about to pay which resulted in the bickering associated with settling the check. Hopefully the next visit will be spot on!

Reviews.Author: Channing M.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is awesome.  The ambiance, the wait staff, the chicken and waffles in gravy.  The only downside was the surly service from the fat chick manning the register who answered my question with a "BYE"

Reviews.Author: Joyce A.
Reviews.Content: COPY AND PASTED LETTER I TYPED UP AND MAILED TO ROSCOE'S.I wanted to take the time to type up a quick a note regarding my dining experience at your establishment.  This is the 3rd time I have ever been there and even though the first two visits were pleasant I have to say that this past weekend was one of the most pleasant and fun dining experiences I have had in a while.To give you a quick scenario of what you had to deal with, it was my birthday dinner and there were fifteen of us in our party including an eight year old, a one year old and a crying and screaming baby.  The host at the door did his best to get us seated as soon as possible and kept us updated on the status of our table.  When we were seated, there seemed to be a little huddle of servers that seemed to be discussing who and how they were going to handle our party.  I found it kind of funny because they didn't know I was looking at them having this little discussion.  In the end, I think Yolanda lost the bet or stepped up to the plate because she came over and introduced herself and offered us drinks.Yolanda, without a question or doubt in my mind and for a lack of better words was truly awesome.  She took control over the situation and took our drink order, explained to us the various meals that would best work for us and quickly took our order as we were starving!  She even laughed at my friends lame jokes.  I don't even laugh at his jokes!  When my one year old Godson started talking to her in his baby babble that only he understands she took the time to give him attention and have a conversation with him.  It was my birthday so I didn't pay but I hope my friends gave her a good tip because she deserved it.  She was friendly, she kept her cool despite our loud crowd, she was familiar with the menu, she up sold us on the sides, and over all kept the good vibe flowing.  Please make sure to share with her how awesome she is and let her know to keep up the good work, keep the good energy flowing and may she be blessed always.

Reviews.Author: Jessica U.
Reviews.Content: The best part was that they were open til 4am. I didn't eat very much of my #2 special though. It's now becoming soggy in a take-out container in my fridge. The chicken itself was good, moist/greasy, the gravy was really thick and kinda grossed me out but I ate it anyways. The waffle has this nice cinnamon flavor to it but I regretted spreading the butter it came with on because the butter actually muted the flavor. Probably won't go back, just cuz I think a burrito from a late night taco truck would be more satisfying.

Reviews.Author: Joshua Y.
Reviews.Content: Im gonna make this review straight to the point, If you happening to be in LA on a vacation or for a concert or a show , Roscoes is the way to go. The Pros for this location is the food is prepared well and it always hits the spot, the service is good as well. Now to the cons, since Roscoes is sandwiched on a busy street near the intersection of Gower & Sunset , your gonna have a heck of a time finding parking on the street especially because it's meter parking but hey it's Roscoes , it's worth the try and experience.

Reviews.Author: Darrell W.
Reviews.Content: Chicken. Good. Waffles. Good. loved the sides as well. had to wait nearly an hour and a half, but was happy that the food was worth the wait. a must try if yove never had.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: What can be said about Roscoe's that hasn't been said a million times before?  Not much.  Best place to eat in LA.  Period.  End of list.  Clearly, this is the kind of meal that is shortening your life, but you know what, it is worth it.  Scoe's number 2 is my go-to order.  Chicken, waffles, gravy and syrup are completely delicious.  I will not repeat what my brother first said when experiencing these things together for the first time, but it was an expression of pure rapture.  The chicken is always moist and delicious and the waffles have subtle but distinctive flavor that has been completely absent from most other waffles.  Everything is quality, even down to the syrup.  And not only are you getting all of this mouthwatering goodness, you are getting it inexpensively and quickly from friendly, accommodating people.   This is a win-win-win situation.

Reviews.Author: Joshua A.
Reviews.Content: This is a must if you visit the area. The chicken is phenomenal, so juice and well fried. Such a good place to eat. They are quick and friendly! The service is top notch.

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: I like the combination.  I think people really should try it with chocolate syrup though.If you like this stuff, you'd love Max's of Manila.

Reviews.Author: Cool J.
Reviews.Content: I finally came to this joint on a trip to Socal after hearing so much about this place from various rappers and tv shows.  I was really eager to come try this place and see how the combination of chicken and waffles would work.  If you are on a diet, don't even come here.  I forgot exactly what i ordered but I remember getting two pieces of fried chicken smoothered with gravy.  If that wasn't enough, I also got two huge waffles with a big ol piece of butter on top.  The food was so goddamn rich that I don't think I even finished it.Was I satisfied coming here?  Let's say I was  happy I finally made it here but I wouldn't say the food is anything special.  It's really nothing to write home about.  I think I was too hyped up for the place and that's why it was a tad of a letdown. Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't horrible, it just wasnt as good as  I imagined before i came here.I remember the dining hall being a tad small and cramped but it wasn't that horrible.  Thumbs up to the picture of Felecia from Mo Thugs on the wall that was autographed.  That's G-double O-D good!!!Inside joke....I think places like Roscoe's are a good reason why chains should not evade your city.  It's always a treat to find a place exclusive to an area.  You think I would care if we went to eat at Chili's in Socal? Hell no.

Reviews.Author: Jared W.
Reviews.Content: Almost as good as the Steak and French Toast, but still pretty damn good!I made a funny....NICE!But really, I enjoy this place. Great southern atmosphere, even better food. If only the wait wasn't so long....

Reviews.Author: Linda R.
Reviews.Content: `Scoey's, oh fabulousness of `Scoey's.  I must preface this review with the admission that I do not like fried chicken.  Except for `Scoey's, which is moist and juicy and tantalizing.  Chicken and waffles, why do they go so great together?  Who thought of this?  There seems to be some special seasoning in the waffles that makes them almost savory.  I love to dump a bunch of their oniony  delicious gravy onto my waffle and eat it that way.  Big momma's scrambled eggs are also very good.Unless you get there when it opens, there is usually a wait at the Hollywood location.I am devoted to the Hollywood location although the purveyors of bootlegged goods outside of Pico are quite amusing.  If you go to the Hollywood one, look for the painting of all the dead rappers in heaven surrounded by puffy clouds.  Tupac in particular has this beatific look on his face that slays me.

Reviews.Author: H.F. B.
Reviews.Content: Waffles and chicken on the same plate? its like having breakfast and dinner in the same sitting!Despite a long wait, the food is very good.  Waffles are good and surprisingly if you put chicken, waffle and maple syrup in your mouth at the same time, its still good!Try the sunrise....orange juice and lemonade(?) together

Reviews.Author: Erin J.
Reviews.Content: My sister came here years and years ago and always said that we had to go. Well last weekend we finally made it  and I can honestly say she didn't disappoint me. I'm not usually a waffles fan but I couldn't stop eating them. Truly the best waffles ever! (even beat out my grandpa's he use to make us on Sunday mornings) And the fried chicken was so good. I just wanted a big plate of the crispy, flavor filled skin (as gross as that sounds). Roscoe's made me want to become a Southern Girl who knew her friend chicken and grits. Other positives listed as follows:*Speed.... my sister and I were starving so when our food came out 5 minutes after we ordered it we were ready to kiss our waiter*Inexpensive.... the prices are good, especially considering how much food you get! *The service was great! Refilled drinks. Brought extra napkins (we are messy girls!) and everything else we wanted... and fast!Next time I'm getting the Mac n' Cheese.

Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: Finally able to make the trek down to SoCal to try Roscoe's. I came here for chicken & waffles and thats exactly what I ordered. Smothered 1/4 chix (white meat) & 2 waffles and knowing the portion I opted for non-carbonated beverage, ice tea.  First off, our wait was short 10mins for party of 4 in a sunny afternoon. I can definitely tell this is Hollywood because even Roscoe's have Valet parking service! The restaurant was actually bigger than what it seem from the outside and the bathroom was very clean.Now back to the food, the portion was exactly what I expected, HUGE. The waffles were topped with 2 wad of butter (looks like 2 scoops of ice cream) and 2 syrups. The chicken was delicious and the smothered gravy was so rich and tasty is like liquid fat. I can honestly say I finished the entire meal with nothing left on the plate except for 1 wad of butter. Had to loosen the belt a couple of notches but overall a great satisfying meal. Staff were nice and very reasonably priced. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Author: Erin L.
