Reviews.Content: One day, driving by we decided to actually go in instead of saying, "We should try it out one of these days!"  With the curious urge satisfied, we never have to wonder again...Yep yep, chicken and waffles and fruit punch!  You get exactly what you ask for.  Three stars for an enjoyable if completely predictable experience.  It's KFC plus!  (But without the tasty biscuits.)  Put some jelly on the waffles...it's good.

Reviews.Author: Dearyl M.
Reviews.Content: As far as this establishment goes, I will never put another penny towards supporting this joint. The last time I was there, which was years ago, I waited patiently to get a table. I was sitting outside while other parties (namely B-squad celebs) got seated. Now, I understand that you want to have your place get some Hollywood cred so you seat some recognizable faces, but there's a line you don't cross: if people that arrive after me get seated, eat, finish and leave and I still haven't gotten a table, then you're just an asshole (the establishment, not the workers - unless you're the prick that works the door with the ugly hat).The bottom line is that I hate Roscoe's, and I will go out of my way to spread the hate. If you're looking for some real soul food, please don't go to Roscoe's Chicken and B.S.By the way, if you just got done with you're night and still a little inebriated and feel like munching on some chicken, there's a Popeye's right around the corner.

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Great chicken, portions were outstanding, place was packed but we got seated quickly.  All in all it was a great experience, can't complain.  Make sure you try the mac and cheese and the greens.  Both fantastic.  Cornbread was average but the chicken made up for it.  We took my brother in law who was in from out of town and he loved it so much he bought a shirt.  It had been awhile since I had visited but I won't wait that long to go back again.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to try Roscoe's for a long time, and I'm so glad we made it! The service was great, especially considering our waiter was already dealing with the drunks and clubbers by the time we got there at around 11 p.m. The waffles were nothing really special -- thin and more rubbery than crispy. But the syrup was out of this world. I think this is what syrup in heaven tastes like! With this and with the expertly friend chicken, I looked a lot more kindly on the waffle. Yumm! Did I mention the grits? With about a quarter cup of butter on top? I'm in love with Roscoe! :D

Reviews.Author: Doug L.
Reviews.Content: Fried chicken and waffles may sound like a strange combination until you try it. It's awesome.Get the chicken smothered in country gravy.You will gain pounds before the end of the meal, feel your arteries hardening in your chest, and probably not be able to move (in any sense of the word) for at least a week, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Author: Antonio S.
Reviews.Content: ummmmmmm-ummmmm-ummmmmmm finger tasting good!Roscoes chicken and waffles is D E L I C I O U S! When I first went to eat here, I really had zero expectation. My friends really didn't say much about this place. The first taste I had of their waffles ... hard to put it into words. It was just sooooooooo freaking good! I'm not sure if it was the syrup, the flully waffles, the butter or the combo of it all....all I know is that this place is forever engraved in my stomach. The chicken, well, another slice of heaven with the addition of their awesome gravy. This place is just a must go!Can't wait to be back in LA so I can have myself some chicken and waffle at Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: M R.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten at every Rocoe's they have so just picked one at random to review.  Yeah I know it's been reviewed to death but hey one more isn't gonna hurt :-).This place is legendary and it is for a reason.  They brought the glorious combination of chicken and waffles to the masses here in L.A.  Not only that they did so with great quality food, very good service, and a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.  Once you're inside and you get your first hint of the delicious smells coming out of the kitchen you feel right at home.  It's comfort food of the best kind and done with an attention to detail that is sadly lacking from a lot of places these days.I've had all of their combination's and I can say without hesitation that I have yet to get anything there that wasn't fantastic.  My stand by's are the #2 Scoe's, the Sir Michaels (or Lord Harvey depending on how hungry I am), the Big Mamma special, or the Carol C. special.  Do put butter and syrup on your waffles, do try the greens (even if you think you hate greens), and do get your chicken smothered in onions and gravy at least once and for heavens sake get a side of mac n cheese even if it's to take  home.Any of the three LA locations you're gonna be hard pressed for parking unless you go there off hours.  The Long Beach location isn't to bad nor is Pasadena.  Though Pasadena can have parking issues as well when it's really busy and sadly no valet service.  So get off the computer, get in your car, hop the train/bus/what ever just get outta that seat and get yourself to a Roscoe's because I can grantee that you will not regret it.

Reviews.Author: Jessica W.
Reviews.Content: THANK YOU MISS DAVIS. THANK YOU MISS BROWN!!I can honestly say this was my FIRST time to eat chicken and waffles. I always thought WTF. I don't like to mix my meals, EVER. but now have been turned on to CHICKEN AND WAFFLES.The waffle batter was GREAT!! The fried Chicken batter was DELICIOUS! I do have to say though, I could split the two pieces of chicken and two waffles with someone. Really big portions.

Reviews.Author: Laraine B.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's really knows how to fry their chicken. They also know how to make the most heavenly waffles I've had so far in my life. Sometimes when I'm eating a sandwich or a salad or whatever, I'd stop and wonder, "Why am I not at Roscoe's?"

Reviews.Author: Paul Christian M.
Reviews.Content: One word... Crackin...Me and my gf went to la on a one day trip and had to stop by...  Every mile driven ad penny spent was worth it... Kinda pricey but that's how it is for good food... I ordered half a chicken with gravy and some waffles... Waffles were the shit... Kinda cinnimoniiee which made it even better... Gravy tasted like gravy, good...  Chicken was cooked perfectly, seasoned well not to salty, so good I barely used gravy/hot sauce/ketchup... I had to save at least half of what I ordered because portions were rediculous...if you're in la you gotta stop by, what's there to loose?!?

Reviews.Author: De B.
Reviews.Content: Ummmm....hmmm... just got back from Roscoe's after not eating here since I was a drunken college co-ed. Damn, it's even better than I remember! The fried chicken breast- succulent as promised. The waffles- sweet and salty goodness. The greens- bitter with buttah. Thas right, go on and get cho grub on.

Reviews.Author: Ryan T.
Reviews.Content: We loved the waffles - they were scrumptious and promptly consumed. In fact, we ate them faster than was healthy! Kudos to Roscoe's for their ice-cream scoop sized serving of butter on top =). That said, the chicken-breast half of our 1/2 chicken (split an Herb's special #3) was over-cooked and a little dry (of course, chicken-breast has a tendency toward dryness, so....) Lots of down-home diner-type atmosphere - and the clientele was extremely diverse (good people watching! good "diversity-themed" mural!)... and then it's just a hop, skip and a jump over to the theatres on Sunset and Hollywood Blvd. Great hearty, pre-movie dinner perhaps?Oh: and we liked the guy with the red bow-tie who seated us.

Reviews.Author: Randy R.
Reviews.Content: hMmmm hmm Love me some chicken and waffles.. ooo gurl!!Waitress's there were so friendly and sweet. !l Love the buckwheat waffles!

Reviews.Author: Thomas O.
Reviews.Content: Lovin' it!This place was a lot smaller than I had expected, but the chicken was great, the waffle was great, everything was just comforting and delicious.  Something about the sweet and salty just works so well together.  This definitely is not health food, but it sure is good food.Decently priced and awesome sweet tea.

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: This place used to be good a long, long time ago.The waffles always sucked and now the chicken and corn bread does too.

Reviews.Author: J E.
Reviews.Content: YUM. Sigh... Oh Roscoe's why are you so far away from my hometown???Ninja was in town to hit up the Ellen Show at WB Studio's and was feenin' for some Rosce's.  With the appetite of a beast Ninja orders the "Carol Special" (Chicken breast & waffle), Cornbread, Potato Salad and an Ice tea.From the pictures you can see that the food was AMAZINGLY Deliissshhhhhhh!.::Overall::.Carol Special - So Soo Good when it hits your lips (Chicken - perfect seasoned, not greasy, juicy.... Waffles- light, fluffy, a hint of cinnamon)Cornbread - GoodPotato Salad - Very Good Ice Tea - Solid brew very yummy.::Recommendation??::.Yes! Go! and when you go bring back some for me!

Reviews.Author: Amber L.
Reviews.Content: Well, gave it another chance and of course it was wonderful!!! As it usually is. I love Roscoes...The creepy guy with the incense freaks me out though.

Reviews.Author: Brendon N.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place. I am from NorCal and this is a spot I ALWAYS hit when I come to LA.The prices aren't bad, but the food is to die for. Best waffles I have ever had, anywhere. The chicken is crispy on the outside and juicy in the middle, and the gravy just add even more flavor. If you have never been, you NEED to try it.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer F.
Reviews.Content: Something about fried chicken and waffles together is just completely right.I ordered just the simple fried chicken leg and waffle.  No sides.  Just the chicken and waffle.And it was yummmmm!  Soooo good.  The best waffle I ever tasted.  Accompanied by some bomb diggity fried chicken.The only complaint I had was the hostess.  She has MAJOR attitude.  There was 6 of us, so they had to find a table big enough for us.  She acted as though it was so hard to do that.  Once our table was ready, she was pretty much shouting at us to follow her (and there wasn't anyone in front of behind us in line!).  While we were eating, we saw Charles Robinson (Mac from Night Court) and he was kind enough to come to our table to say hello and smile.  Pretty cool. =)Our waitress was great.  No complaints.Street/metered parking outside.  I'll definitely come back for more!

Reviews.Author: Charlotte C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to every Roscoe's location there is.  The food is always great no matter which location you go to but there are subtle differences that set the others apart and force you to choose your favorite.  I've always been a fan of the Long Beach location.  Its always been my favorite.  It was my home since I lived closed by...  ... Until I came to this location.  Besides the crappy LA parking situation (1 hr max meter parking on the street, if you can find one OR valet... Valet?  No thank you), the inside is pretty big compared to the other spots.  There are 2 seating areas divided by a wall (except for the walkway).  The waitress was very sweet & attentive and the food came quickly after we ordered.  The only weird thing is that its pretty dark inside, which is different than the other locations, but I like darkness so it worked for me =)

Reviews.Author: Nicholas S.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was here on a bad day, but it seemed like what happened to me could have happened on any day, the way things went when I tried Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles.  The food was pretty bland and the service was pretty much terrible.We got in there and got a seat immediately, which is why the place got two stars instead of one.  Then we sat at our table for about 20 minutes waiting for anyone to offer us a drink or ask if we wanted to order food.  We had to flag someone down, and then a few minutes later someone finally came over and asked us for a drink order. The food was pretty bland.  The eggs of my chicken and cheese omelette didn't have any flavor at all, and there was nothing but dry-ass chicken inside.  Even though the menu said it should have been in there, there was no cheese at all.  Cheese is usually my favorite part of anything I eat.  People talk about this place like it's a must-visit joint.  Not sure why.

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: Had to wait about 45 minutes but what do you expect during dinner time? It was a bit cold for April in L.A., but it was worth the wait. Just like everyone else, I thought, how do chicken and waffles go together? I dunno, but once you've had Roscoe's, it just does. I came here with an out of town friend who wanted the experience. We ordered the 1/2 chicken and 2 waffle combo (I forget the name of it), and devoured it. Fried chicken with gravy and onions is a thing of beauty and the large waffles were the perfect complement. $20-$25 should do the trick unless you get some sides (highly recommend the candied yams) and a beverage. Always hits the spot and is definitely a place you want to bring visitors from out of town.

Reviews.Author: Hattori H.
Reviews.Content: This review applies to all Roscoe locations including the one in Pasadena. Say what? Yeah there's one in Pasadena.When it comes to fried chicken, Roscoe's is the LA icon that's been around forever.  I've already lost track of the times and locations I've been to.  The interior is old school; nothing fancy here.  It reminds of the '70s for some reason.  Le menu is pretty expansive and there's something for everyone.  I usually order the chicken breast and waffle combo.  I've gotten the mac and cheese although good, I've had better.  Good fried chicken, service, and price.

Reviews.Author: Hayley H.
Reviews.Content: FIRST---you are going to wait...deal with it...IT IS WORTH IT SECOND--order the Chicken and Waffles...get the chicken with the gravy it is the only way to do it. THIRD--Put a little bit of chicken with some waffle smothered in syrup and eat them together...be prepared it is addicting. This is an LA establishment is sooo good and the people watching is amazing. The customer service is good and they have good flow so you are not waiting forever. There are other imitations around, don't do it....only go to Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Jerald B.
Reviews.Content: WORTH THE HYPE! i love this location because it's always on the way home coming back up the bay area. I always come with a bigger appetite than I can handle and end up over-ordering, which means i always get the #2. Unless you have the stomach to compete in a food eating contest, just opt for the Carol C. Special. You'll have one of the happiest food comas of your life!Don't forget to get a T-Shirt!

Reviews.Author: Lih-Wern W.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's can be a real interesting experience. Outside you may see a couple of drug addicts on the street, yet at the same time you may see a limo pull up with a celebrity stepping out. I ate there once when Mary J Blige was there eating.I think the fried chicken is ok. I had better fried chicken at other places. I like the sunrise drink, and I think the waffles are actually more my favorite than the chicken.I wouldn't be against going back if a friend wanted to go, but it's not a place that pops into my mind when I want fried chicken.

Reviews.Author: A D.
Reviews.Content: Yummy, super fast, trendy but yet not snob Hollywood people! I didn't grow up on this type of food (as matter of fact 1st time trying it) but it still tasted like comfort food to me...:) The server was really nice too...Such a cool experience! Perfect to go after a night out since they open till late... So, yay! Valet is kind of pricey, though ($10) plus tip...

Reviews.Author: Jen F.
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I came to Roscoes.  My friend said we're going to eat Chicken and Waffles for dinner and you're gonna love it.  I thought it sounded as the most disgusting thing.But when we came up to the place, there was a line out the door and the big bouncer/door man said there is about a two hour wait.  At this time, the place was tiny and literally a hole in the wall, but now they have expanded.  Anyways, I figured anything worth waiting two hours for must be good so my expectations rose.  Once we finally sat down, I was eager to try this chicken and waffle combination that I thought was so disgusting two hours ago.  I ordered the chicken and waffle combo and was told to get a side a gravy for my chicken so I did.  It was the best fried chicken I have ever had and the mixture with the waffles was actually quite pleasant.  The gravy was outstanding and I was thankful that I ordered it.  From then on, I love Roscoe's and sometimes make the drive up from San Diego just to eat there.  It's definitely worth the drive!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy T.
Reviews.Content: Nothing like chicken and waffles! I've been here plenty of times, and the food never ceases to amaze me! I actually get full after eating here, which is saying something. It is a wonderful combination, and a friend tried the red beans, rice, and cornbread besides the chicken, and those were great as well!Bottomline: I love me some chicken and waffles!

Reviews.Author: Oh D.
Reviews.Content: I was totally nom nom nomin' it on their chicken thigh! The waffle is pretty good as well, but I looooove the chicken. My friends and I got here right when they opened on a Saturday 8am. I ordered a chicken thigh and a waffle for about 6 dollars.P.S. I felt like I was a cowboy pushing through those swinging doors to get to the restrooms :).

Reviews.Author: Brian Y.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good fried chicken and waffles. Not the best fried chicken or waffles I ever had, but it's up there. Roscoes is just one of those places you have to check out when in LA.Go early cause there was definitly a line when we left.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie J.
Reviews.Content: This place is A-ok, as is indicated in my rating.A cool place to take out of towners and for chicken and waffles.  I believe the mac and cheese is also pretty good but the omelettes and everything else are pretty mediocre.Stick to the Chicken and Waffles and you'll be a-ok!PS, I like this location better than the one on Pico by a long shot.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla L.
Reviews.Content: I can never get tired of this place. I usually come here after a night out on the town, and it's always worth the wait(There is almost always a wait, but you will not be disappointed)I recommend getting the mac and cheese. One of the best I've ever had. It's kind of a small portion and it's about 4 dollars and change but It's well worth it.Waffles are delicious. and so is the Chicken and Cheese Omelet.  I highly highly highly recommend the chicken and cheese omelet.

Reviews.Author: Jill F.
Reviews.Content: After years of hearing about Roscoe's, I finally made the trek down to the Hollywood location fighting traffic and searching endlessly for parking.  My friend and I worked up an appetite and I anxiously anticipated the the yummy goodness of fried chicken and waffles.I ordered the 3 wing/waffle combo.  I enjoyed the savory chicken combined with the sweetness of the maple syrup on the waffles.  The waffle was disappointingly limp, I like mine a little crisp on the outside.  It had a nice flavor with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg.  The chicken was nothing special.  But don't get me wrong, I savored every bite but I do think this place is a bit overrated. However, I do think if you've never been you have to try it at least once.  Compared to other reviews, the service we received was fast, efficient, and very friendly.  The place was surprisingly busy for a Wednesday afternoon.  Would I come back again???...sure I would.

Reviews.Author: Cody D.
Reviews.Content: So my friend was quite literally OBSESSED with the concept of chicken and waffles, and we figured this would be our best bet. I mean, it - is - in the name!! Even though we were soul food virgins, we've had a long and  torrid love affair with salty-sweet combos (Denny's breakfast skillets, anyone?) -- chix'n'waffles just seemed like an obvious marriage.The place itself can be a little intimidating to newcomers. There's usually a lot of activity going on outside, especially at night. You're likely to find the 'bouncer' negotiating with some drunk or other about whether or not they'll be allowed back inside -- not your typical 'family restaurant' scene! At any rate, once they realize you're (relatively) sober and willing to pay for your food, they're actually quite friendly, and welcome you in with a smile.Inside is even stranger, but kind of charming in its way. It's a mess of tables and oddly placed walls, wood paneling and ugly murals. TVs littered throughout the dining room run a 24/7 'Roscoe's TV' channel, a kind of Comic Sans-infused BET on silent. I've never been to a restaurant chain (yes, there are plenty more of these!!) that felt quite so down-home, been-in-the-family-for-years-ish. Nonetheless, it kind of suited the food and atmosphere. What can I say? It works.The menu was disappointingly limited. I don't know what I expected, I mean, you obviously go here to get chicken, waffles, or both -- still, a few more 'inspired' options would have been nice. At any rate, this is the kind of place where the main portions are so ludicrously large, they don't even bother with much in the way of sides. I like a little more variety on my plate, especially when your entire plate is going to be one big, syrupy mess anyway. The waffles come with a golf ball-sized butter, and the chicken has that oily, deep-deep fried appeal -- douse in syrup, and you've got your self one reasonably delicious heart attack. Was it good? Yeah, sure... not the best chicken I've had, not the best waffle. That said, there's precious few centrally located restaurants where you're going to get both on the same plate for $15 or less. Try it once, at least... some Sunday in the wee hours, when you're only just sober enough to slip past the bouncer.

Reviews.Author: Serious C.
Reviews.Content: Another Los Angeles staple.. Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles.This is one of several locations.It looks very country roadhouse inside. We deeply enjoyed watching people take prom-like photos by the sign out front.The food is good and decently priced. The hot sauce on the table, though.. that's money. I'd steal it off the table if I couldn't purchase it over the internet.

Reviews.Author: Luis T.
Reviews.Content: The last 4 times I visited LA I went to this Roscoe's. Like Pinks Hot Dogs, the wait can be long. But just to see the plate of perfectly breaded fried chicken and the best waffles is legendary. Their arnold palmer is fresh and it can be. Love this place and they have perfect service here. I love this place... Can not wait to eat there again.Well, what are you waiting for..... GO EAT!!!!

Reviews.Author: Marilyn W.
Reviews.Content: Seriously, who hasn't had Roscoe's before? You HAVE to eat here when you're in Socal, well at least I do. Don't hate me for this, but I absolutely do not like waffles. I know, shameful especially going to a place like Roscoe's. However, I absolutely love the #22. It seriously comes with all my favorites: fried chicken, mac n cheese, collard greens, and corn bread. The chicken I do not need to explain because we all know it's the best. Their man n cheese is so good! Well it tastes the best when it comes right out. After awhile, the cheese settles and gets cold which doesn't taste as appetizing. The collard greens are good and not too salty. The one thing I don't like is their corn bread. It's hella dry and doesn't melt in my mouth.There's always a wait, but it isn't too bad. It's a good thing there isn't a Roscoe's in my area, otherwise I'd seriously get a heart attack from eating that chicken every week. See you next time Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: S. R.
Reviews.Content: Y'all don't need another flowery description of this place. Let's git down to bidness. Top n' Bottom 5:Top 5:1. Chicken2. Waffles3. Mac n' cheese4. CHEAP5. Super Duper friendly staffBottom 5:1. It's in LA and I live in NYC2. ...3. ...4. ...5. ...As you've probably surmised from the above, this place is fantastic and you feel like Snoop Dog and Biggie have hugged you the second you walk in. Make the effort to go when you're in the area. It's so so so worth it.

Reviews.Author: Niah N.
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about my greens Mac n cheese and fried chicken at 3am lol #yes I didAnd our waitress was a dollface!

Reviews.Author: Karla V.
Reviews.Content: Talk about reasonable and delicious. I am not a foodie. I am just your typical anosmatic girl from the hood.  So, with a lack of sense of smell comes a very weak sense of taste. Food for me has to have the right texture and a good zing to it. As I do not normally crave anything and most things tastes the same.The chicken here is crispy and amazing. The waffles are what American waffles were meant to be. People talk about overcrowd and yada-yada. Just be smart, you are an Angeleno... be smart about peak hours, parking nightmare avoidant, etc.Did I mention the prices are super reasonable, and I am below poverty-level. Yet, I still can save my beans and enjoy chicken done the right one a few times a year Tip: Add on mac and cheese and try some dang honey on your chicken!

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place from family and friends that visit  LA, I had the chance to try it last week.  It was worth it!  The chicken was crispy and juicy, and waffles are big and warm.  Next time we come down here we'll definitely order more chicken and less waffles.  Parking sucks but since we got there early we got a parking spot pretty easy.  One down fall is that we did get there early in the morning,  it smelled like pine-sol cleaner, but once they start frying that chicken I guess the smell goes away a bit.

Reviews.Author: Jay B.
Reviews.Content: FOOD: finally tried this famous place at the original location. The manager said 50 cent was in last week, as well as Justin Bieber. However, I thought the food was just ok. I think both the chicken (needs more seasoning) and waffle (should be crisper) could be improved. I've had a better combination of the two in the south as well as at Merritt Bakery in Oakland.SERVICE: our waitress was suuuuper sweet! I thought she was Southern, but she's from Detroit.DECOR: feels like the south. I kinda want one of the t-shirts just cuz they're hilarious.Go once to cross if off your list. Next time I crave this, I'll pick up some Popeyes and toast some Eggos.

Reviews.Author: Courtney H.
Reviews.Content: Finally did it. I can now say I've experienced the legend that is Roscoe's! There are some haters out there, but don't be fooled! Roscoe's DOES live up to the hype.You might be surprised to know that until recently, I was never a fan of fried chicken. Two reasons: 1) The concept to battered, fried chicken skin freaked me out and 2) grease upon grease upon disgusting grease! I did not encounter either of these issues at Roscoe's. The chicken was absolutely delicious! The batter they use is surprisingly light and fries beautifully to a perfect crisp. The waffles are also really tasty and huge! Not the fluffiest waffle I've ever had, but there's something about the taste...different in a good way. I had Combo #9, which came with 3 wings and a waffle. I was perfectly satisfied...neither wanting nor uncomfortably full. I didn't have any sides this time, which I regret. Greens, hot water cornbread, mac n cheese, & more to choose from! I'll be back, next time with a bigger appetite.

Reviews.Author: M. L.
Reviews.Content: This was the place I had to go to once I heard about it. The food is AMAZINGGGGGGG! Never had such good fried chicken in my life before and the waffle is the kicker. It's not soggy or anything just crispy enough for the chicken to have a sweet and savory taste to it. The corn bread is a lot of people's favorite here too but I'm not much of a fan of it so didn't try it. Parking here is not too hard to find, but could be difficult at the wrong time too. Came here on a trip to socal for the first time and I have been here like 5 times since. Everytime i go socal now this is a must stop and I just have to eat it everytime! It's like tradition now haha. There is definitely a lot of hype to this place too and it does live up to it. Sometimes the lines are long, but hey if you want good food you better wait for it.

Reviews.Author: Caitlyn R.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Roscoe's.  I had heard great things.  The food did not disappoint but the service was awful.  We were seated and sat there for 15 mns until our waitress finally came by.  Our food came out fast but we literally didn't see our waitress until the end of our meal.  We sat there was empty waters the whole time.  Probably wont come back, at least not to this location.

Reviews.Author: Jason J.
Reviews.Content: I could eat here every day if the wife let me. A little syrup on the fried chicken, im done. Best grits in town!I like to make a waffle sandwich. Fried chicken, grits, cheese eggs, smothered in butter and syrup on the waffle. Amazing!Great biscuits and cornbread!

Reviews.Author: Mark D.
Reviews.Content: Love Roscoes...come down to SD!

Reviews.Author: Philip O.
Reviews.Content: Damn I'm hungry just thinking about Roscoe's. The chicken and waffles are bomb. I make sure to go extra on the hotsauce on each bite of the chicken...Damn I should just stop already before I force myself to drive to LA again next week just to eat at Roscoe's. We need one in SF!

Reviews.Author: Julie D.
Reviews.Content: UGHH!! I'm still SOOO mad! I went 2 nights ago for the first time. NEVER AGAIN!!! My boyfriend and I ordered the #1 Scoe's and a side of Mac n cheese. We got our plates and no Mac n cheese. After we received our food the waiter never came back! We assumed he probably didn't write down our order for Mac n cheese. We finished eating and the food was pretty good but we waited nearly 20 minutes and our waiter didn't even show his face so we asked a random worker for to-go boxes. Waited another 10-15 min for our check and he never even passed by us and never gave us our check. My boyfriend was furious and just went straight to the cashier to pay. The cashier hunts 4 our check, we pay and leave, he was never handed a check or receipt.  We had to come back because I made my calculations and it didn't match what my boyfriend was charged! We were charged for the Mac n cheese we never received! When we asked for a refund the cashier had the nerve to say "really? For 5 dollars?" to which my boyfriend replied angrily "yea! Would you pay for something you didn't receive?!"  And I also said " excuse me? If your upset that you have to do your job blame your waiter!" He then says he has to ask a manager about the refund and I finally just say " do what you gotta do but make it happen!"  UNBELIEVABLE! it was Monday at 10:30 pm, not busy! I don't even remember the food, when I think Roscoes I just get angry!!! I rather go to the Hungry Fox in the San Fernando valley! Closer, delicious chicken and waffles and most importantly GREAT SERVICE!

Reviews.Author: Khom V.
Reviews.Content: I love fried chicken and this was authentic for sure. They actually open at 8:30 AM which was fine since we happened to stumble on it when running out for coffee. If you are ever in CA, it is a must to try. Great the chicken and waffles - you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Raquel H.
Reviews.Content: oh Roscoes, why do you have to be so far far away from me !had to order the famous chicken and waffles ! it was top notch ! food is great ! biscuit and gravy so yum ! the portions are huge for the price ! yummy crispy chicken ! they make the food fast ! our waitress really nice ! i will be back here when im in LA ! this is a HAVE to go PLACE !

Reviews.Author: Michelle R.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for the weekend & my sister reminded me to try to this place so we did & I don't regret it at all! Sooo good! Before trying this place, I never thought the idea of waffles and fried chicken was very appetizing. haha. I think it's cause I'm filipino. My boyfriend & I enjoyed it. Very filing & we weren't hungry for a few hours being that we had to drive back home to San Jose. We plan on coming back to So Cal in February so we'll definitely stop by again!

Reviews.Author: marie m.
Reviews.Content: So damn good -- both locations -- although I have a preference for the Pico spot.  What better than chicken and waffles on a foggy Sunday morning???Be prepared to wait if you're not the early riser.

Reviews.Author: BrasilPo P.
Reviews.Content: BEST Chicken 'n' Waffles in soCA!!!Really. Trust me. Got "Magic" Johnson's autograph there... so you just never know who will be 'round for some chiggin-n-waffo. YUMMY!

Reviews.Author: Douglas R.
Reviews.Content: I love Roscoe's, but every time I go, I have a completely different and unusual reaction the following morning. I remember one time the following day, I felt like I was having a heart attack, but then it turned into a panic attack and a full fledge panic attack at school later that day while watching "American Beauty." Then the next time I went, I ate not as much food as the prior time and I felt fine the following morning. Roscoe is very necessary and everybody needs to go at least once in their life.

Reviews.Author: Jason D.
Reviews.Content: I do not regret moving to the Bay Area one bit.  Except ... when I think of Roscoe's.There is a reason why when I drive down to LA to visit family I make time to go to this LA institution.  I mean, where else could you eat fried chicken and waffles behind Jesse Jackson and his entourage (make sure to not look them in the eyes)?And the food:  I never knew that fried chicken and waffles put together, in one bite could be so good.  Thank you Roscoe's, for your awesomeness.

Reviews.Author: Natalie P.
Reviews.Content: I have found Heaven!  It's in an old joint called Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles in Hollywood.  The Carol Special - One Breast & One Waffle does me just fine!!  (with a side of Mac & Cheese & Lemonade)... and I'm seriously in heaven.  The waffle is a flavor I've never tasted before (& eating is like my 'job')  ;).  Seriously.  I went to Mexican twice in LA this weekend b/c it was around the corner... this place I had to drive to & ALSO went twice.  I just couldn't resist.  I would move to LA for this place.  no joke.  (ok - 1/2 joking).  But if I had to - I would diet all week long just to eat Roscoe's on Sunday.  It IS a religious experience.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany G.
Reviews.Content: Yay! After living in LA almost 4 years, I finally made it to Roscoes. This place has bomb Southern style greasyyy food, great for hangovers. :-)I walked in right away and sat down, and the service was much faster then I thought it would be. I ordered the Omelet with cheese and chicken, of course with a waffle on the side that was delicious. I have to admit the food here is super greasy and gooey, so if you are walking in thinking you can order an egg white omelet - don't even bother! Although most people know what to expect when coming to Roscoe's.I'm not a huge fan of fried chicken, ironic I know, but I did taste it and it was very yummy. Tender and juicy! The Louisiana hot sauce on the table made everything taste great. I wouldn't mind taking a bottle home.The mac and cheese was also awesome, but I like mine a littler more cheesier and gooey then the kind at Roscoe's. I could however, definitely eat a bowl of it!All in all - a spot to  check out in LA - if you are visiting or a tourist. I don't think I would go back consistently because of the way my stomach felt after-wards, but this spot is one worth going back to for sure... when you are up for it! Wear a bib!...or not!

Reviews.Author: Realtor Karl B.
Reviews.Content: Hollywood!Want to spot a star before eating?Put your name on the list, wait outside for an hour and watch the rapstars valet their cars before they come in to eat (I think i saw Common drop off his RollsRoyce).Chicken is very tasty if you dip it in their gravy or hot sauce.Waffles are very fluffy and loaded with taste.Bring your East Coast friends & family here to show them how we do here on the West Coast.Hopefully, ya'll will see Snoop Dogg valet his car right in front of your eyes. Fo shizzle.

Reviews.Author: amber m.
Reviews.Content: I HEART FRIED CHICKEN !As a matter of fact when I'm craving fried chicken, this is probably one of the only places that will fully satisfy the craving. So much so, that I'm willing to make the piligrimage from San Diego to LA !!....... The last few times I went to LA, I made it a point to have lunch at Roscoe's. I usually opt for the Scoe's special: fried chicken, and two fabulous waffles. I've also tried the fried chicken smothered in gravy, and it's heavenly as well.  In addition, I've also tried their biscuits, mac and cheese, and greens. Which are good, but not as great as their chicken and waffles. Even their chicken sandwich with fries plate is good! Needless to say they do chicken right!  Maybe one day this LA institution will make its way down South to San Diego. In the right hood, I'm sure it will do well.

Reviews.Author: D H.
Reviews.Content: When I 1st saw Anthony Bourdain in No Reservations visited Roscoe, I was like "chicken with waffles??? WTH?" 1st, I dun like oily & fried stuff, 2nd who would have syrup & ketchup together? But boy, I love it right from the moment it was place in my mouth.Not really sure how to describe it; u just gotta try it urself. It's just strangely addicting. I love the waffles =) The chicken was tender too. Not too fond of the gravy & onion, it was a bit salty. But the Southern chicken was good.my cousins & I just ate & ate & we finished like after 10 or 15 mins. LOLCan't wait to come back!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dorian T.
Reviews.Content: ROSCOES CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!We've all heard it whether in rap songs or from the word of mouth from our buddies. THIS PLACE IS THE SHIT!On the contrary, I thought this place was decent at best. The fried chicken was nothing to die for but the waffles were quite the delight. Definitely a one time thing for a tourist like me a native from San Francisco.What I found amusing is some guy sitting at the entrance trying to sell me his cd. Homeboy, you know thats not how Biggie did it.

Reviews.Author: Lalala B.
Reviews.Content: Good interior design.  Okay service.  Good chicken.  We got served for something we didn't order and overpaid for the things we ate.  Okay waffles.  Okay biscuits.  Yum mac n cheese.  Good chicken. And where in the world do you park before eating at this place besides the streets?  I'll come again for the fried chicken but that won't be until a long, long time....

Reviews.Author: Ashley H.
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about going to Roscoe's you have to try:1. The Waffles2. The Chicken 3. The Macaroni4. Jeanne Jones Omelette (eggs never tasted so good)I have to say that the waffles are delicious! They're large, dense and have the best cinnamon-y flavor. YUM!! And I love the butter and syrup that comes with the waffles oh my gosh it saturates the waffle smothering it in awesomeness. The macaroni is scrumptious, the kind of southern comfort food you can't go without just add a little pepper and you are good to go!**My advice would be to bring cash because they do not separate the check.

Reviews.Author: Kirsten A.
Reviews.Content: I can't say that the chicken is amazing by itself, but when paired with brown gravy (which I ask for specifically because I don't like white gravy), it turns into an entirely new piece of fried chicken. The waffles are good, but a little thin for my tastes. I like a big Belgian waffle, myself, but these were still tasty. The sunrise and sunset drinks are another reason why this place is great, so don't forget to order one.

Reviews.Author: elaine w.
Reviews.Content: Nope, nothing special about the food here.I'm not sure why everyone makes such a big deal about this place. The waffles were nothing different than you would get at Denny's. The verdict on the chicken (from my friends, I'm vegetarian) was similar.The wait was waaaaay too long. There is no parking, and none to be found on the street, except Sundays. The dining room is icky looking, and seems like it is as greasy and sticky as the food... but that is probably an illusion. I gues it is clean in there.If you want good breakfast food, head north on Gower to Franklin and stop in at the 101 Cafe . Even though it isn't in their name, they can make a good waffle.

Reviews.Author: Jessica K.
Reviews.Content: Day 10 of my Cheap Eats quest.Once again, I feel a crucifixion coming on.  I went to Roscoe's for the first time tonight, which is sort of a shocker seeing that it's the LA institution that it is. My first introduction to Roscoe's was shortly after I moved to LA, when my roommates friend told me told me that every time she goes there she ends up spending the rest of the day in the bathroom, "but it's totally worth it".  I couldn't really imagine anything being worth that, but I figured Roscoe's must be something really special.After going there I must say, I wasn't that impressed.  I got the Carol C Special, because with a name like Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles you kind of have to get the chicken and waffles. The waffle was really nothing special.  The fried chicken breast was good, and definitely satisfying after I'd been dreaming of fried chicken for weeks.  My boyfriend was shocked to see me eat every last morsel of chicken.  Still, it was no better than any other fried chicken I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Roscoe's the morning after seeing R.E.M. at the Hollywood Bowl and we enjoyed the entire experience.  It has become a staple for us whenever we stay over night in tinsel town.My wife and I both had the # 2 "Scoe's" and loved it!  Since it was our first trip to Roscoe's we wanted to keep it simple and order the food that made this place what it is today.  It's was so surreal being there after many years of wanting to check this place out after seeing it being referred to/commented on in several feature Hollywood motion pictures.I remember watching the timeless movie "Jackie Brown" when Samuel L. Jackson's character (Ordell Robbie) said to Chris Tucker's character (Beaumont Livingston) the following:After we get done with this job, we going to go to Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles."  From that point forward I wanted to check out the joint and it did not disappoint.I recommend this place (the Hollywood location) to anybody that wants to dive into a living piece of Hollywood and it's glamor for penny's on the dollar in comparison to other tinsel town restaurants with equal fanfare.  This place is unique and well worth your time if you like to dabble in the Hollywood scene.

Reviews.Author: Kellie P.
Reviews.Content: We're fried chicken lovers in my San Francisco workplace. Ever since Little Skillet opened in SF (to much fanfare), we've become obsessed with chicken and waffles. So when I was on a business trip to LA, my friend and I made a point to come to Roscoes. Honestly, I was a bit disappointed. The fried chicken was just not as good as Little Skillet's is. Also, there was no Crystal hot sauce on the table, and that's the best for fried chicken. The chicken's coating was too crispy, and the chicken was a bit dry.I did, however, like Roscoe's waffle very much. It reminded me a lot of the waffles from Waffle House, which are my favorite. They were big and round, and not puffy like a belgian waffle. I also had some chicken livers, which I normally really like, but these were overcooked inside (very dry) and almost burned on the outside.I wouldn't refuse to come back here, but I won't go out of my way again.

Reviews.Author: Amanda J.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to pig out in the world! I always get the #3 and take some with me for the ride up the 5 home. I looove the smothered potatoes, the mac and cheese, and the corn bread. I like getting chicken sausage and eating it with the waffles too! My mouth is watering right now!I have always gone to this location as it is my favorite and iconic. Hell it was in a Tupac video and I always see a celeb (last time Chris Brown after the Rihanna mess), athlete (Kobe once), or whatever when I go. Now that the location is larger I have never really waited. I NEVER go on Sundays until around 4 and later. Nor do I really go late night Fri or Sat cause you know, fat girl gotta eat.

Reviews.Author: Shauna Y.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was just really hungry.. but.. HOOOLY CRAP... this place is awesome!I've heard of chicken and waffles but never had it until now. And, man, was I missing out! Ok, I've regained my composure... On my way back from the Happiest Place in the World, decided to go to Roscoe's. Again, I've heard of the place from people and movies but never expected what I experienced on the lovely afternoon of June 21, 2010.I ordered simply the two piece dark meat fried chicken with two gigantic fluffy cinnamon-y waffles. Seeing as we'd gotten there pretty early (~10:30am) and it was a Monday morning.. there weren't too many people, so our food came out fast and HOT.. I stared at it. Just stared. I believe I may have drooled a bit. Again, regained composure, snapped a few pictures, then proceeded to DIG IN!OH MY GAWD was what was going on in my head, couldn't say it out loud.. mouth full. I might've mumbled it through my chicken'd waffled filled mouth.. either way, it was good.. no, great!The chicken was juicy and oh-so-flavorful.. the skin wasn't caked on with coating, but  nice and thin which kept it so so crispy and definitely not sopping in grease. Ick, grease bad.. The waffle, though not crispy as a belgian, was not soggy either.. just a good balance of fluffiness. It was scrumptious... It tasted like it had cinnamon, but I could be wrong. Though other reviews stated some cinnamon-y notes... so maybe I'm not too far off.So, growing up I would never think to eat a savory fried chicken with a sweet waffle with a nice light syrup.. and, now, I'm a bit saddened that I didn't. Because for the last 30 years, I have definitely been missing out.Long story short (yah, a bit late now), but most definitely a MUST have every time I venture to SoCal. I will say this, I'm jealous of you LA. You have the Happiest Place in the World as well as the most scrumptious meal.. Verdict: What d'yah think??? WINNAR! ;)

Reviews.Author: Karena R.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!! I'm here this weekend to celebrate my anniversary and this was the first place we stopped!! The waffles and chicken us superb, not to mention the tropical tea is go die for!!!Prices are very reasonable, service and delivery of food quick and efficient!! Would give more stars if available!! Plan on hitting up the spot again before leaving L.A11.15.10Went back today before leaving LA and things were just as good today!!

Reviews.Author: Jon R.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a while with friends. For months we had joked about visiting the Legendary Roscoe's, but in came a rainy day during Fall Break, and off we went. Surprisingly good.  Seated quickly, service was pretty good, and the food was true comfort. Another convert to the chicken and waffles trend! Who knows why it makes such a good combination. Personally, its the waffles that make the meal for me. These are the most unbelievable waffles I have ever had anywhere. They are fluffy, flavorful, and are perfect with the massive amount of butter and syrup they give you. The fried chicken was decent, certainly good, but nothing particularly special. Get the gravy if you get the chicken; added a whole other level to the quality. Overall, it's a legendary place that you should try if you get the chance. Even if it doesn't seem like your cup of tea, give it a shot. You too could fall for the quaint combo of chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Ishah C.
Reviews.Content: We've been here a few times and every time the food has been great.I usually get the #2, Scoe's 1/4 chicken smothered in gravy with waffles. The chicken is perfectly seasoned and the gravy is sooo good. The waffles are light and crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside.I can never finish and have to take it home, although the waffles are never as good the next day as they are fresh.The interior is kinda dark and crowded, but I guess it adds atmosphere. The person who seated us was a little abrupt, but our server was very helpful and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Cindy C.
Reviews.Content: I am honestly giving this 4 stars because I like that I can have fried chicken and waffles, lol. #noshameI had wonderful expectations for this place, and I was greatly disappointed. I expected this to be the best waffle ever, and it tasted not too different from a frozen eggo waffle. I still expected the best fried chicken ever, and I have to tell you that KFC is better. Sad, sad, sad...this makes me so sad. I thought that I could find my heaven here, but it is true that I have not.Will I come here again? Heck yes, did you hear me? I CAN EAT FRIED CHICKEN AND WAFFLES!!!I hate how you can't substitute sides because I don't freaking want to eat green beans with my waffles. I really loved the candied yams, and often dream of them. They need new cutlery. I hate dirty, or old cutlery and dishes. This is hands down the best mac n'cheese that I have ever had in my life. This is what I idolize in mac n' cheese. It's a shame the sides are good and the main thing is not. Honestly, come here if you'd like to be a pig--because who goes somewhere just for sides? Subpar fried chicken and waffles.I also didn't like the cornbread. Woah, the disappointed there! It was probably store-bought. Dry, dry, dry...and tasteless.We had a crappy chola server, but the other waitresses looked and acted really nice.

Reviews.Author: Gene W.
Reviews.Content: Well, earlier this month, i had my first visit to southern California. And there was no way I wasnt going to make sure I went to Roscoe's. I mean, this place is world famous for what they do. I think every major city has a copy cat Roscoe's, but I resisted trying any of them. Finally it was time to hit the real thing.I went around 2pm on a Sunday, and there was about 25 people outside waiting to get a taste. I spent my time shopping a couple of the local street vendors and taking a few pics of the "Hollywood" sign.  You can see it from Gower St., even thought it is way high up the hill.  I went alone, so I had a shorter wait than some, a little over 30 minutes.It was dimly lit inside, compared to the sunny day outside, but after my eyes adjusted to the menu, I didnt know what to choose. I ended up ordering a fruit punch / lemonade drink, a waffle with chicken breast, added a wing and some grits. My order came quick so i was very happy. My waffle wasnt hot, but warm. I was wishing it would be hotter, so that my butter would melt easy, but no big deal, i surely wasnt about to complain. The chicken was hot though and it looked soo good. I have to tell you, the combination of the sweet and salty meal was amazing. Thing is, you can try to create this at home, but it wont come out the same. Yes, you can make a waffle, but i think they may have their own mixture or something. While I was eating, one of the street vendors came in the building and said "Excuse me Roscoe's customers, if you parked on this side of the street, the police are checking the meters and you need to make sure you are current or they will tow your car. Thank you". This place, despite how world famous it is, still has a neighborhood feel to it. And that made me feel comfy there..... even on my first trip. i cant wait to come back for more!!

Reviews.Author: Franklin P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing fried chicken.  This is the spot in LA to get your chicken and waffles for sure!  Famous Famous Famous.Check out the Roscoe's post on my blog for pictures and the storydinedelish.com/2011/05/1…Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Julia F.
Reviews.Content: Yum! I love places that are casual, no frills, good food. Came for a Sat morning brunch and left with a food coma. Found street parking pretty easy, and since we were early enough (a little past 10am) we got seated immediately. The menu had a lot of options, so had to make my choices carefully!We got Scoe's #2 ($10.40) and the Stubby ($10.30). Wow, that is a LOT of food! (Please see photos). Between the two of us we had two large waffles, two drumsticks, two breasts, a biscuit, two scrambled eggs and a bowl of grits. Yowza! I couldn't eat all the chicken and biscuit so had to get a doggy bag for munching on later.Taste: scrumptious. The chicken had a very nice seasoning, and such a  satisfying deep fried crunch. Not too greasy at all! And they were good sized chickens. The waffles were just plain amazing! soooo good plain, but when buttered, syruped, gravied, and piled with chicken, it made such  a delightful sweet and savory mix. The grits were also good, and the eggs and biscuit were great as well. Service: Fast, friendlyI think it's a little pricey, but man, our tummies were happy. And it didn't make me feel gross afterwards, like eating KFC does.

Reviews.Author: Rose B.
Reviews.Content: 1. the chicken is overrated. I think KFC has the same quality for less.2. the host/hostess basically don't communicate because 3 of us came in and said 5 other people in our party were parking, so he sat us at a small table and said as soon as the larger table was done being cleaned, we would get seated there. then, .34930 seconds later, a hostess that was also at the entrance went ahead and sat this party of 4 at our "reserved" table. We were like wtf? and he was like umm you guys will get the next table. AND THEN THE SAME SHIT HAPPENS AGAIN. Only reason we didnt throw a BF was because the waitress that gave both our tables away, looked like she could kick all 3 of our ass, at the same time.3. I think for the classic meal, its like 12.90 for the country boy/girl (2 pieces, waffles)4. Parking - pray to find meter street parking or pay for parking for $10

Reviews.Author: Jer N.
Reviews.Content: After Seeing this on TV, I had to try it.  I still think it's a must see, but really not too impressed with the dry chicken breast.  I actually just went to a "no name" place in VC - Virginia City, NV called Cafe Del Rio.  That is how chicked and Waffles should be made - this is my new standard.--RibChamp

Reviews.Author: Travis M.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is exactly what you want it to be.  Good fried chicken, delicious waffles...and good fried chicken on delicious waffles.  In addition, they're lemonade is awesome and it makes for some interesting people watching.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Angel S.
Reviews.Content: Chicken! I love the fried chicken! So juicy and tender and full of flavor! Also, I got some collard greens, mac and cheese, and the massive corn bread. Now, I am not a fan of mac and cheese but Roscoe's was very good and comforting to eat. You can see the cheesey goodness and I ate it, lol! The waffles was warm and delicious. Strange to eat with the chicken but I tried it and it works well together!Service was slow. The waitress forgot a few things like our dessert and gravy. However, the restaurant was clean and next to the liquor store. This place is a must to visit when visiting SoCal.

Reviews.Author: Pawl E.
Reviews.Content: Gimme that number 9.I came here on sort of a reunion with some homies of mine and I have to say. It was fantabulous. Being a Roscoe's virgin, my friend recommended something simple, yet effective: number 9. It's just three chicken wings with your choice of fries, waffle, and something else (I forgot, my bad). I chose the waffle [obviously], and I wouldn't have chosen anything else. Maybe it was the butter? Maybe it was the pool of syrup? Or maybe it was just the super dank combo of well-made waffles and super crispy fried chicken wings.I sampled my friend's chicken wings with gravy and they were hellaaaa bombbbb as well. I also tried the "Sunset," which is lemonade and fruit punch combined. It was a little too sweet for me, but my friends thought it was heavenly.The people at this Roscoe's were hella nice too. Our waitress was at the ready with everything and was genuinely nice to us. The host was really fun to talk to as well. I chatted it up a bit with him as I waited for my friends to roll through, and he will chat with you as if he was your long-time friend. Nice dude.Overall, boss comida + nice people = my vote.- pawl e.

Reviews.Author: Robert R.
Reviews.Content: The food is spectacular! Chicken and waffles, a great combination. The waffles almost don't need any syrup or butter at all.The down side: they do not accept separate checks, and, like any place that has high demand, service suffers because service is not what brings in the customers, its the food. Not a good excuse but it is what it is. Plus it isn't the healthiest food you can buy but nothing good ever is right?

Reviews.Author: Sabine N.
Reviews.Content: I can see why this is LA's favorite and an iconic foodie spot.  The fried chicken and waffles here is so delicious.  I like fried chicken, but I'm not that into it like my bf.  But, even I have to say that the chicken here is fabulous.  So juicy, tender, and flavorful.  Even the breast meat was juicy and tender.  Usually, fried chicken breast pieces are nasty because it's often dry.  Here, it's not dry at all.  Both the skin and the meat are seasoned and have a lot of flavor.  The waffles are delicious too.  Thin, light, and perfect with a little maple syrup.  I don't like to drown the chicken and waffles with maple syrup though which just covers up all the fried chicken with sweetness.  I want to enjoy the super delicious chicken!

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Okay. This place is JUST OKAY.Went here last Saturday with couple friends and they popped my Roscoes Cherry. Waffles are good. Not going to lie. I got the OBAMA SPECIAL or how they call it, the COUNTRY BOY? GIRL? I forget. I got 3 little pieces of chicken and waffles with Macaroni. Beers are about $6 each and I think the chicken at Albertson's Deli taste sooooo much better. But waffles here are GOOD. CRUNCHY AND CRIPSY...BUT seriously?? 3 little pieces of chicken? W. T. F.I didn't get full.Maybe I should have ordered 2 meals.Other than that, this place is overrated but I guess it would taste really good when you are really drunk or have those midnight munchies!I'll be back when I'm Drunk.ATTENTION ROSCOES!!!It would have been nice for you guys to let just wait inside in the warm restaurant rather than have us wait outside in the rain. Not Nice! Pew PEw!

Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: This is the original Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, so we were there for the memory as much as the food.  The chicken is incredible. Both pieces were crispy and steamy hot fresh from the fryer.  The chicken breast was huge and very moist!    The waffles were just ok, but I'm not a huge waffle fan to begin with.Parking was bit complicated, and the valet didn't look like a valet at all.  Our server was nice and friendly and took really good care of us the whole time.  Overall, a very enjoyable dining experience with a friend while we talked business.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: I cant remember the last time I enjoyed a new flavor combo like I did my first visit to Roscoes. Deeeeelish comfort food bomb that will resonate for hours. Chicken was crispy and juicy, waffles were tender and yummy. Wait can be a pain in the keester, open another one across the street please!Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Alex R.
Reviews.Content: I think I might have gone to this place with my exceptions a little too high. The place was a little run down and beat up, but i just saw that as character. It was my first time there and of course I was gonna order Scoe's special. The waffles were great, the chicken was good .... but not GREAT! i just found my self drowning it in hot sauce half the time. None the less, its a good place for some good comfort food.

Reviews.Author: Don C.
Reviews.Content: Parking is horrible, don't get enough food for the price you pay. But DAMMITT! What you do get is really really good. Had the Obama special which is 3 wings and a waffle was beyond delicious. The sweet tea was good. The corn bread was nice and moist. I can see why Roscoe's is world reknowned. But they need to give more grub for what they charge

Reviews.Author: Dave A.
Reviews.Content: The QUINTESSENTIAL SoCal spot for chicken & waffles!  If you don't know, you betta acks SUMBODY!  Even President Obama knows what's goin' on @ Roscoe's... proof is on more than one wall.  This is the Hollywood Roscoe's, so its a great spot for people watching/star searching as well.  Be prepared to hoof it a little bit here.  Unlike the Pasadena or West Los Angeles branches, its all metered street parking here, with a 2 hour limit.  So, beware of the parking meter maids, they can be relentless!  Usually we drop half our party off to get our name on the list while the other half searches for parking... to save time.  Its always been about 30-45 minutes wait time.  Not as airy as the other Roscoe's sites, kind of a East Coast basement feel when you first walk in.  Staff is always friendly and attentive.  So what to get on the menu?  WHAT ELSE?!?  Chicken & Waffles!!!  There's various options here... 1 or 2 waffles, whole or half chicken, or fave piece(s) of chicken.  Chicken is always juicy, never overly greasy, with a nice crisp exterior.  Waffles are thin large circles that start slightly crisp, but quick melting butter and a tasty syrup turn it into some kind of amazing!  And, THE AROMA that permeates the air when these first hit the table... Mmmm!  All kinds of ways to chomp down... From prim & proper to waffle chicken taco.  Regardless of how you choose to consume, it is... so, SO GOOD!  There are some delicious sides to had here too!  Chicken chili fries, mac & cheese, Sweet Netta Ta Ta pie & cornbread are our fam faves.  Not the healthiest meal, but they sure are SERVIN' YUM HERE!!!  Definitely something to hit when in the City of Angels.

Reviews.Author: Erika H.
Reviews.Content: The food here is amazing. I had the Obama which includes 3 chicken wings and a waffle. I tried some of my boyfriend's chicken chili and I had to order my own bowl. That was the best chili I have ever had!!!

Reviews.Author: Skylor J.
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to Roco's since 2006. I usually go to the one on Pico. But this was within walking distance from my hotel.  The staff just stood around talk the service was slow and the food was not as good as I remembered. The chicken was small it just wasn't good. I will not return to that location. I will go to the Pico location and try it out the next time I am in California.

Reviews.Author: Stephen W.
Reviews.Content: I am not from LA and when I heard about chicken and waffles I was disgusted. THEN I had Roscoes. This changed my life. I have been to every Roscoes there is now and this is one of my favorite spots.

Reviews.Author: Ken M.
Reviews.Content: lots of people talk about this place a lot and how obama comes here and all that! but i seriously think this place was nothing special!! I would still go for kfc or church chicken and other chicken fast food!!! rather than here!!! plus their prices are not reasonable for their food!!! their side dish was nothing special and waffle were ehhhh ego waffle taste better hahaha after you eat!! dont wait for the waiters cause you would have to stand up and go to the cashier to pay for your sloppy food!!! also the waiters would not even bother telling you that after they have served your food and would act so f**ing mean when you ask for your bill hahaha...I would suggest  give this place a try!!! if u like those fried chicken from kfc just go to kfc!!! I guarantee side dish, chicken and prices are way a lot better....

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: Never ever EVER again will I come back. My guests and I decided to dine at this location for dinner. We were seated first and the two girls that came in after us were seated at the table behind us. Tell me why their drinks were ordered and food and still no one greeted our table? We sat there a whole 15 minutes before we decided to get up and leave. The place was practically empty so the staff were not  busy. As a matter of fact they were all lounging around having conversations that weren't work related although most of the language that was spoken was Spanish. I have never experienced such poor service from an establishment that can use the business. So despite that my car takes 91 gas and its current hitting $5/gallon. We decided to go to Roscoe's on Pico in which the manager on Pico needs to manage this location. As a MBA grad in business management. This location is headed for disaster. As I walked out the door. I expressed my issue to the cashier who then shrugged her shoulders at me. I see why unemployment is so high, because people like these folks. I think they forget, that our consumer dollars is what pays their rent and feed their children. You guys need to wake up!!!

Reviews.Author: Dariush R.
Reviews.Content: Just sooooooo damn good... I named my dog after this place for gods sake!If your looking for a quick fix, i'd recommend getting take out, the economy special for $6 with 5 legs/thighs.If your sitting in, expect a wait, this place turns into "Club Roscoe's" after 8... Gotta be a VIP hahaha.  But the wait is definitely well worth it and the customer service is always top notch too.

Reviews.Author: Teresa C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a few friends during a road trip and was hit with a long line. Waiting for about 25 minutes before we were seated. Service was very good. Waiters are really nice. Ordered their fried chicken with waffles. I love their waffles! It's light and fluffy, and tastes perfect. Can't say I enjoyed the chicken as much.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: Had the Jeanne Jones special fried chicken omelet. One of the most unique and delicious morning meals I've ever had. Waffles were great too. Classic spot.

Reviews.Author: Bryan A.
Reviews.Content: I can't even wait until they open the one in Anaheim.  Then i can stop driving 50 miles out of the way to get some great waffles and chicken.  But I still continue to do it so that must say something.

Reviews.Author: Erica M.
Reviews.Content: I've ways wanted to come here and finally we stopped here late last night. At night, the location seemed a little scary,however, the food/staff/atmosphere at the restaurant was great. I will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Author: P M.
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhh.......Buckwheat waffle, crispy fried chicken, mac and cheese and a cold Corona......it just doesn't get any better than that.And don't forget the Red Rooster sauce for your chicken...and anything else for that matter.

Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to a Roscoe's, you are seriously missing out.I've now been going here more times than I can count. If you go at lunchtime or dinnertime, get ready for a 10 - 20 minute wait. Otherwise, you'll get a seat no problem.I always get the Country Boy which comes with a waffle and 2 chicken wings although I get a buckwheat waffle. I also get some mac and cheese. This has to be my favorite of any mac and cheese I've tasted. Then I wash it all down with a big Sunrise which is a mixture of orange juice and lemonade.I've been Roscoe's many times and I have to say I've never once gotten sick of the food here. It's just that good. If you haven't tried them yet, do so when possible; you won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Kim O.
Reviews.Content: This is an LA institution. One of the best random parings of food ever! But I have to admit I am a creature of habit and had never ventured beyond the beautiful simplicity of chicken and waffles. Recently, I took a couple friends who just moved to town. My friend DARED to get the onions and gravy on the chicken. I was shocked, appalled even. And then I had some and it was even better. Now I can't have it without the gravy. Ah to fall in love with this place all over again. To top off the welcome to LA, we watched someone get arrested right in front of the restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: OK I tried this place about a year ago and am finally getting around to writing a review.This place is good.  REALLY good.  Be prepared to wait, as the lines can get long.I had the 4 piece (1/2 chicken) with 2 waffles, gravy on the side.  The waffles were crispy and chewy without being dry.  The chicken was crispy and juicy.Here's what I recommend: slather butter on the waffle and apply syrup liberally.  Cut off a bit of waffle.  Cut off a bit of chicken, dunk it in the gravy and then shake on some hot sauce.  Put the chicken on top of the bit of waffle and put it all into your mouth together.

Reviews.Author: Joe R.
Reviews.Content: The waffles are fantastic but the chicken is just OK.The service was downright awful and slow.The prices are high.I'd go back there again, not soon though.Portions at least were quite decent.

Reviews.Author: mrs q.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place !  Too bad the one in Oakland closed.

Reviews.Author: Tyler E.
Reviews.Content: Fried chicken and waffles go together like peas and carrots! Who knew? I liked Roscoe's from the start. Before I even crossed the threshold, I was sold. This place is authentic from head to toe. When we were seated we discovered that Bartles & Jaymes was a beverage option. Ummm... lemme see... yeah, we'll take 2 of those. I ordered the #1 with 2 waffles and 2 pieces of fried chicken.  The anticipation of waiting for my food was nearly unbearable. Thank god I had my Mojito flavored B&J to pass the time.  When the food arrived, it was on.  A buddy of mine once told me that if I ever go to Roscoe's I have to put hot sauce on the chicken and then take a bite of waffles with syrup. Sounds bizarre, right? It is oh so right. Trust me.As we were nearing the end of our scrumptious meal I took notice that none other Vince Vaughn himself was sitting right next to us. I shit you not! It was the perfect exclamation point to the magic that was Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Brett O.
Reviews.Content: Totally Legit!!Waffles were soooooo goood !!!  probly one of the best ive ever had.  Chicken was tatsy tooo.  Me and my girl will b remembering this for awhile!!\m/

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this place several times, I made it my mission to investigate.  I checked out all of the reviews here and had already made up my mind what I'd order when I went.I get there a little after lunch on a Sat, but the parking lot was full.  No problem, there's a CVS just up the street with a huge mostly-empty parking lot.  Come back, am seated instantly, and order the #13 which was a waffle and massive chicken breast.  I topped this off with sweet tea.Disclaimer:  I was pretty darn hungry and could have eaten cardboard by the time I went.Anyway, the food arrived, I smothered the pancake with butter, then dumped the maple syrup on the waffle and chicken.  Topped it off with the rooster hot sauce.. I think I was done within 15 minutes.  Chicken had a super-crunchy skin.  Waffle wasn't quite as crisp as I'd been expecting, but still tasty.  Seems like it'd be hard to go wrong with anything I saw on the menu.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Author: marc l.
Reviews.Content: As good as everyone says.  Some of the best chicken and waffles you'll find.  Fantastic fried chicken livers too, which can be hard to find at other places.Not a novelty...really good food.

Reviews.Author: Ethan S.
Reviews.Content: I love Roscoe's. It's so good. Some of them can be real ghetto, but this one's pretty good since they expanded the place. Never in my wildest imagination did I ever imagine chicken and waffles going together so well, but they do. And afterwords, I might be walking around with a brink in my stomach, like a pregnant nun for the rest of the night, but it's worth it.If you haven't tried it, then you need to try it. And you can't do one, without the other, at least once.

Reviews.Author: Katherine S.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is awesome!!!Fried chicken for one, and then, waffles...delicious. I usually get the chicken burger and fries, but recently had a few bites of my friend's chicken and waffle plate and let me tell you it was amazing! I was a little drunk at the time, but still I have to say I am a fan of waffles with my chicken and chicken with my waffles. Service is friendly and quick enough, parking kind of sucks. But I can't complain about a place Too $hort and Flavor Flav eat at (not to mention, we all know Snoop is a fan).

Reviews.Author: Brooke B.
Reviews.Content: THE best waffles.jeanne jones is good for breakfast.otherwise - straight up chicken & waffles can't be beat.

Reviews.Author: Pamela P.
Reviews.Content: Fried Chicken... yummmmmmSo two of my friends and I went down to LA for the weekend and our first stop was Roscoe's, and surely the place/food did not disappoint! The food was so good we went again on our last day. During our two visits we were greeted by a staff member sitting on the benches outside. Threw us off at first because they didn't look to be working there. They seated us right away at the dining area near the kitchen, no wait. When we got in, it was packed with diners. Waitress, and servers were friendly and got the food out in a timely manner. Atmosphere and facilities were clean. Simple decor. Okay, you'll laugh but I skipped on the waffles... not a big fan of it, but my girlfriends loved it. I enjoyed my fried chicken. Crispy and substantial. YUM! I'm always down for southern comfort food, so I was blown away with the chicken and sides (mac and cheese, collard greens, smothered potatoes). The biscuits were okay, but if you slather their butter on it, everything tastes better with butter. Paula Dean approved! The food came out hot and fresh and I was not disappointed. If only there were a location in the Bay Area.

Reviews.Author: Kelly G.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time trying "soul food," and before I went in, I wondered, what a strange combo - chicken and waffles? But it was indeed a good combo.I can eat a lot, so I went against my friend's caution and ordered 1/4 CHICKEN WITH GRAVY and 2 WAFFLES. That sounded like a lot of food, and it was. I was not hungry for the rest of that day.Chicken is good, but I liked the cinnamon waffles more. They're kind of soggy and bread-y, and you can feel them getting piled up in your tummy. As you walk out of the restaurant, you realize they're expanding in your tummy and that's when you can't walk anymore.

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: #13 Carol C. Special (1 chicken breast and 1 waffle).  And yes eating both at the same time, in the same bite with syrup is AMAZING in my mouth.Sides: biscut, gravy, mac & cheese, and corn bread.Drink: Large LemonadeEVERYTIME!!!!!!!!!!  I can't find better fried chicken in LA.  The waffles are thin but amazing.  They match perfectly.I'm sure they have many other good things, but all that is MONEY.Parking - sucks, deal with it.Waiting - Fri-Sun seem to be bad.  Mon - Thurs doesnt seem to be nearly as bad.If you don't give this place at least 4 starts, please do not eat here anymore so I don't have to wait as long to get this amazing food!!!  Yes I'm SURE other places inthe south have better, but I'M IN L.A.

Reviews.Author: nic j.
Reviews.Content: Good chicken great waffles. best of timesyou need the chicken and waffles the only question is how much? dark meat or white?pretty cool drinks like the sunset or sunrise. fruity/lemonade combos

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: This place was simply AWESOME.  The chicken was as fried as it gets, but really tasty.  And the waffles on the side - even better.  The maple syrup made me feel at home (eh?), and mixing that in with some chicken made it all taste even better.If you're ever in LA, this is a must stop.  For a group of 4, you're looking at spending about $55 with tip for lunch, so it's pretty reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Karen V.
Reviews.Content: Friday Night February 18, 2011Relatives were in town from AZ. and they wanted to go to the famous Roscoe's House for some chicken and waffles!It was pouring rain, but we were determined. We had to park about a block away, because there is NO parking lot for this place. Street parking only, with meters. No biggie, welcome to Hollywood.It looked like there was a long line....we gave our name and the hostess said 30 minutes to an hour. It turned out to be only 15 minutes.We walked in and I was kinda surprised how small this place is...only 2 rooms....2 PACKED rooms!We, of course, all ordered chicken and waffles....and beers. It was pretty wierd eating waffles and beer (whatever, welcome to Hollywood).The chicken was really good and the waffles were good too. But anything smothered in butter and syrup is great! I will probably go to another location if I ever get the Roscoe craving.

Reviews.Author: jeremy d.
Reviews.Content: Best thing about LA.I believe I had the Chicken n Waffles WITH Gravy.Yummm!The only bad part I remember was them serving me a Pepsi in a can ... and having to order a 2nd drink. But other than that it was Fantastic!Bought a shirt and it has long since faded out, next time I come to LA I'll be back for more!

Reviews.Author: Karen M.
Reviews.Content: Gee, how much more praise can be heaped on this LA institution?We took our teenage daughter here (hey, we always take her around town!) one night after Dia De Los Muertos at Hollywood Forever Cemetery to get late night grub and were NOT disappointed.  Both the hubby and the kid got the traditional chicken and waffles.  Both gushed how crispy both the chicken AND the waffles were.  I got the fried chicken and greens (since I just love greens!)  The greens were just perfectly savory and the biscuits were melt-in-your-mouth delish.  All in all, a great late night dinner.

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Scoe's on more than one occasion, the most recent being in February of this year.I never leave this place unsatisfied.  I usually get the 1/4 Chix Southern Style with 2 waffles.  On this visit, I also ordered a side of Mac & Cheese.  No complaints about the food or service whatsoever.We did wait over an hour, but that's because it was on a holiday weekend.  Other times I've visted, it was only 20 min or less.

Reviews.Author: Thomas G.
Reviews.Content: Got my name on the list and dude says 20 min but got in within 5 min...Got mi a half chickens smothered in gravy and drowned my waffles in syrup.. For drinks got the eclipse.. I WAS SOOO FULL!!! and Service was good..The mac and cheese wasn't all that great.. But would def go back to get stuffed!!

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Be patient, it's worth the wait!#3

Reviews.Author: Anne H.
Reviews.Content: I wish they opened a Roscoe's in NYC. I took my friend who was very skeptical, but he caved. We love the waffles which have some cinnamon in them, and the salty-sweet taste combination really rocks. The chicken was really great.
