If you are going with two, I highly recommend getting one combo and 3 sides so you can taste their smothered potatoes, collard greens and mac-and-cheese. My friend wanted to go to Roscoe's for the remainder of our stay. Home-cooked and delicious!

Reviews.Author: Tom G.
Reviews.Content: I get the #13.  Always reliable.The sides are a bit bland.Service is attentive and pleasant.This location is much airier and brighter than the one on Pico.Parking is a pain, valet recommended.

Reviews.Author: Marcello A.
Reviews.Content: What else is there to say..................F'n Chicken n' waffles!!! The place is a little small and compact compared to LB and Pasadena. The place is like getting into a club, you must have your complete # of ppl before you can come in and sit. Otherwise the food is good and the atmoshpere is chill.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: Meh. 2.5 stars. I'd rather eat Popeye's chicken any day. It's nothing special and I'd save my heart-attack inducing food quota for something more worthwhile. They did have a nice spicy dipping sauce though.The waffles were ok. Nothing special. Nice touch of cinnamon.Service was good. Girl had just started working there, but was knowledgeable and very pleasant.I will say I got it to go.Not sure if that makes a difference, but to me it doesn't (my expectations are the same).

Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is one of my LA favorites!  Every meal I've eaten here has been amazing.  The chicken is always juicy and the waffles are good too.  They also have yummy eggs.They have great drinks too!  Get a sunset....perfect blend of lemonade and red kool aide!  Roscoe's is simply delicious...and they have valet!!!

Reviews.Author: Westley J.
Reviews.Content: Came here because we were in Hollywood for a movie and it had been craving some Roscoes. Of course had to get what the place is known for. I ordered the Carol C special which is one chicken breast and one waffle. I didnt want to stuff myself and this turned out to be the perfect portion. Chicken was friend to perfection and was delicious, but I saved the best part for last. The waffle smothered with syrup and butter is simply heavenly. So addicting.Service was quick and easy and we were in and out fast which was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Author: Brandon Y.
Reviews.Content: Walked there from hollywood and vine metro station.  Had the thigh and leg with the waffle.  Chicken was moist waffle was not over done.  Soft in the middle and crispy on the outside.    Atmosphere.  a bit old but prices were not high either.

Reviews.Author: Joe F.
Reviews.Content: As good as it gets. Excellent service. Chicken and waffles are great. I don't go for anything else. I waited like 10 minutes to get in but got my meal in about 5 minutes.Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is just something you have to try.

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: Waffles with gravy, yummmmm. And their chicken skin, to die for. If you're looking for a hot satisfying meal, stop ya looking.

Reviews.Author: Chi W.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved their fried chicken here!!  It was crispy on the outside, and amazingly tender and juicy on the inside!!  I had the Stubby (breast, 2 eggs scrambled, grits, and a biscuit), and it was cooked to almost perfection (almost because the biscuit was a bit too dry)!  But I was salivating at my friend's plate of half a chicken.. and ended up getting another waffle to share!  Yum!!! Roscoe's truly lives up to their reputation as THE PLACE to go in Southern California when it comes to soul food!  I'll definitely come back to visit next time I am in town.

Reviews.Author: Andres D.
Reviews.Content: I never thought of combining fried chicken and waffles, but this spot pulled it off pretty well! Great place to have a late breakfast/ lunch.. especially after a long night clubbing in hollywood. I ordered the Obama Special a favorite by many. Great service that welcomed our business. I definitely reccomend this spot and refer it to anyone I know headed to LA!

Reviews.Author: Scott G.
Reviews.Content: I have heard about this place from twitter an TV and it did not disappoint. This location is near the walk of fame the menu has plenty of options. If you like southern style food this the place to go I had the chicken and waffles everything was cooked to my liking, my wife had chicken, Mac and cheese, greens, and this huge piece of cornbread. We both left satisfied and would recommend Roscoes as a place to stop if visiting LA. Great meal for our last evening in town.

Reviews.Author: Denise D.
Reviews.Content: After all the hype about this place, I found it to be ok. I ordered the Carol C. with a side of mac and cheese, and the boyfriend ordered the chicken liver omelette. Because of so many reviews and recommendations, I came here thinking that this will be the best fried chicken, boy was I let down. It was definitely dry. I tried to dump some of my maple syrup on it to make it somewhat better, that futile attempt. My waffle did make up for the chicken though, I don't know what they put in that waffle batter, but they are doing something right. And as for the mac and cheese, it was decent, not the best, but not the worst. I may have left not having the best fried chicken, but I did leave having the best waffle.

Reviews.Author: Kimmy C.
Reviews.Content: My husband ordered fried chicken livers - they were over cooked. Angel, our waiter, promptly returned with delicious chicken livers cooked perfectly. The food was great. Their fried chicken reminds me of my late granny's. The side of mac n' cheese is way overpriced. Over $5 for a small dish of mac n'cheese. Wish they would serve more or charge less. Service was good except we waited for water refills, asked for water refills and waiter never returned with water refills, but he did return with our check. Now, if a waiter/waitress forgets something, gives slow service,  makes mistakes with an order, even spills something on me,  I will still leave a nice tip if you are friendly and attentive. An empty glass is enough for my husband to want to cut the tip in half - if not more - especially after we requested water. FYI- make sure you read the parking signs if you park along the street! If you are even a minute late, you will get a $63 ticket. Those meter maids are just waiting to write you a ticket!!

Reviews.Author: Valentina B.
Reviews.Content: When I want fun (which is often) I venture out to Roscoe's.  I like to see the stars but I like the groupies even more.  Yes, the gold chains that weigh down the rappers get me interested but I even like the overdressed young starlets and girls for the moment even more. Now for the food.  The chicken is out of this world!  Delicious, crisp, juicy and outstanding.  The waitstaff is helpful, informed and lots of fun.  Ask for lots of water because that fried chicken will make you thirsty.  The side dishes are a hit with my friends.  I am too busy eating the chicken.  The waffles are good.I would love for Roscoe's to get plates that are not china or even stoneware.  That is my only recommendation. Look for me.  I will be the one posing by the rooster in the back.  I like to make my friends jealous so they will know where I was.

Reviews.Author: shant v.
Reviews.Content: Food is ok. Service is horrible. I sat down and it took about 35 minutes for someone to approach my table and the place wasn't busy at all.

Reviews.Author: Denise F.
Reviews.Content: Wandered here after the ASAP show at the Palladium... the chicken was very tasty very filling.. thats all but everybody enjoyed the food no complaints here.. our poor waitress though it was 1 am and she was exausted!

Reviews.Author: Shawn L.
Reviews.Content: Awesome warm home feeling like place to eat and enjoy fried chicken with syrup :)

Reviews.Author: Meilani M.
Reviews.Content: I think it's over rated. Its an OK place to eat. I've eaten here 4 times thinking it was just me. I was still looking for the wow factor. Nope, I still don't think it's anything great.

Reviews.Author: Allen E.
Reviews.Content: Everything was good, I didn't have to wait in line before getting seated or have to sit at the table for too long before we got a server. It wasn't anything spectacular but the food was good, a little pet peeve of mine the orange juice they brought us was very warm. I wouldn't scurry back here for any reason but it was a good experience trying chicken and waffles for the first time. I will definately say this, if you have a huge appetite and can eat a huge portion of food then this is the place to be. Pricing was okay but a bit on the higher side, I think I would rather eat somewhere else if it came down to it. I have since then ate at other chicken and waffle joints and let me tell you, Moe's Chicken and Waffles in Fontana blows this join out of the water, but all in all it was a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: There are few things in this world better than fried chicken OR waffles.  But not together.  They don't belong.  Being from Chicago, I was always hypnotized by this Los Angeles legend of Chicken and Waffles.  I love them both dearly...more than my family, and could never put them together.Then I had Roscoe's.  I was expecting an awesome tag team combination of flavor like TANGO AND CASH but all I got was SONNY AND CHER.  How are these waffles good?  They're just chewy pancakes.  A good waffle has got TEXTURE.The fried chicken was some of the best fried chicken I ever had though.  Absolutely outstanding.  I think I'm gonna skip the waffle next time and get some grits.

Reviews.Author: Seth W.
Reviews.Content: If there was a Noble Prize for food, the genius that served chicken and waffles together deserves it.The waffles are delicious.  Usually I'm pretty picky about my waffles, pancakes, and others of the sort, but Roscoe's has the waffle recipe down.  I could eat the waffles all day long.The Chicken is amazing.  Juicy and full of flavor.  i usually get the dark meat and it is so good.  For an even better Roscoe's experience, get the fried chicken with gravy poured on it.If you are visiting in the area, it is definitely worth the visit.  If you are a local and haven't ever been, just go already.  You should feel obligated.   The service is usually pretty laid back (which i like).  Atmosphere is kinda dark (makes it romantic to watch your loved one shove their face full of waffles and chicken).  Everyone is really friendly.  Close to a lot of L.A. hotspots.  There is really nothing bad to say about this place.  wait... ok.  only one.  They don't do separate checks.  So of you are going with a large group, make sure someone is planning on fronting the money, or bring cash.  But other than that, its is an A+.  Every time i go i want to try something besides the chicken and waffles, but can never get myself to do it.  its just too good.  The cornbread is way good too, and big.

Reviews.Author: Charley W.
Reviews.Content: It's Roscoe's, how much more is there to say?Waffles + chicken + gravy. Come hungry, leave feeling like you're bout to have a heart-attack.

Reviews.Author: Christie R.
Reviews.Content: This past Friday night my boy Piff Herrera & I decided to hit Roscoe's at 9pm, We arrived around 11:30p-(We had to hit up CVS real quick to buy some alcohol). It was pretty lovely. My Waffles & Mac 'N Cheese were so MACKIN'. The Cheese from the Macaroni practically melted in my mouth. (Totally turned me on). Roscoe's isn't as ghetto as people make it out to be. There's nothing but white people trying to be "ghetto", NOT COOL !Like, seriously. Just because you're wearing a BANDANA w/ a RVCA shirt & sagging VOLCOM jeans doesn't make you ghetto. You look silly. I'm surprised they didn't bust out the C-WALK while sitting in their chair(s).People do the dumbest shit sometimes  =)Peace to the Sunset & my parking ticket.

Reviews.Author: Fergus M.
Reviews.Content: The chicken is pretty good, but not the best in town. I actually like the Lord Harvey which is fried chicken with gravy and onions topped on the chicken. The waffles are really good though, even though they aren't crispy. But you don't end up caring. And they're open late.

Reviews.Author: Ben K.
Reviews.Content: Pros: It's delicious chicken and waffles, lots of character, very unique placeCons: Very very fillingWant to go somewhere with a lot of character and some delicious chicken and waffles? Go to Roscoe's! This place is a great break from the plastic people you might think of when you think of L.A. It has a ton of character and some of the best chicken and waffles anywhere. Pour the syrup over everything and enjoy. There might be a long wait but it's worth it. Get Scoe's #1 and have one of the best soul food experiences you can have in Southern California.

Reviews.Author: Kevin K.
Reviews.Content: GOOD THING: homestyle cooking at its bestBAD THING: go late, prepare to wait. LOLThe wait is so worth it once you get your meal, but prepare to take that extra lap around the gym after getting your feast on with your friends and family!

Reviews.Author: charlie t.
Reviews.Content: Pre-visitThis is my first visit to roscoe's I'm pretty excited I have heard great things. Fried chicken is one of my favorite dishes. all i can say is, " i can't wait for my next visit."Food was delicious, service is prompt and pleasant.

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: I have been to this location before a few years ago and it was busy. We ordered to-go and drove (2 hours) home before eating and the food was still good! It was a late night impulse thing. Anyway, I was going through Hollywood and it was a slow night, we decided to stop and eat there. Service was horrible! The place looked dirty. The food was, MAYBE, at room temperature. I can deal with bad service if the food is worth it. It was not worth it. I might consider visiting another location, but I recently visited The Waffle which is like a block or two away and I think I would rather go there.

Reviews.Author: Kyle C.
Reviews.Content: Legendary!While waiting, you might think this star struck waffle wonderland will be selective and expensive. Both are untrue. The wait is about the same as anywhere else despite the fact that your sitting next to some random movie/basketball star.The food is what makes Roscoe's great! The waffles are the greatest things on the planet. I have no idea how they make them so good. I'm really to the point were I can't even describe how great they are. The chicken is just as good. Then why not top it off with a tasty fruit smoothie? Rated one of the top eats in America by the travel channel for a reason. Go experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Author: MaryJane S.
Reviews.Content: I've done the Chicken and Waffles thing, having lived less than 2 miles from the Long Beach Roscoe's location..but believe me when I say that THIS ROSCOE'S is the BEST of THEM ALL! The chicken was much juicier and tender..the waffles were still warm and soft.. ahhhhh!! Just thinking about it makes me salivate.. Being that this is the original location and that the food is amazing, I can overlook the fact that parking is terrible (after all, it's Hollywood). But after eating here, I don't think I can eat at any of the other places. And for those of you who have never had Chicken and Waffles before, you really don't know what you're missing..

Reviews.Author: Evan S.
Reviews.Content: Who ever thought fried chicken, waffles and maple syrup could be so good!  So much good stuff on one plate!! It was definitely worth the 45 minute trip out here. You'll really want to make sure you go in the late afternoon though cuz it can get really busy!

Reviews.Author: Francisco M.
Reviews.Content: I will keep this one short and to the point.Parking is a drag, chicken was too dry ( i had to pour a lot of Louisiana hot sauce to enjoy it). waiters were friendly. I think it might be a little over pricedBUT THE WAFFLES OMG....BEST WAFFLES I HAVE EVER HAD PERIOD

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good. LOVIN the syrup that i put all over the waffle & CHICKEN. :) Thought the size of the waffle was too small, but it fills you up! Great place to go w/ friends.

Reviews.Author: BunnyRanchCami P.
Reviews.Content: Get Carol's classic chicken and waffles... (I get the breast) Smother it with maple syrup AND hot sauce... Sounds crazy but just do it! The only competitor Roscoe's has for Chicken and Waffles is Sylvia's in Harlem, and that's on the opposite coast so hardly any competition unless you're a jet setter like we are. Interesting characters too... Last time We were eating here with a Dr client of mine, a lady came up to us and told us what a huge fan of our show she is... On her 80th bday! Watching Cathouse when youre 80?!? I hope I still got it like that when im 80!!!!! Don't forget to check out the o-so-interesting characters plying their wears in the parking lot. Last time, Daddy got a tee shirt that says "My President Is Black"LOVES IT!!!!!!!(he wears it all the time... It has rhinestones and cost $12 lol!!!)Can't go wrong w Roscoe's... It's world famous for a reason!!!If chicken n waffles sounds weird to you, like it did to me before the first time I tried it, just get brave and try it! It's incredible!!!!!!!Don't get the gravy... It's great as it is.. Get it plain .... Butter your waffle, put the chicken back on top and smother it all with maple syrup and hot sauce. Make sure every bite has equal parts : chicken meat, crispy,salty  n yummy chicken skin, butter, hot sauce, maple syrup. If not, you need to be schooled. Chicken n waffles is an art.If your review is based on ANYTHING besides chicken n waffles, you're  dumb. (SORRY!!!! sad, but true! Lol) It's called HOUSE OF CHICKEN AND WAFFLES for a reason. If you don't want chicken and waffles, go elsewhere.  It's their claim to fame, and well deserved. Havnt tried anything else, but it's all a hand job. Y try anything else?!? It's the house of chicken and waffles.Get the chicken n waffles. It's their specialty, its the BOMB!!!!!Excellent food, people watching is even better!!!

Reviews.Author: Chelsea D.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food, 1st time ever eating chicken and waffles and am such a fan now.. Used to sound gross but ive changed my mind! Service however was gosh awful!!!! They weren't busy we were sat promptly and there the Restaurant was 50% full. Took like 10 min to get a waitress, she didn't bring me a drink (a water, simple..)just my friends drink came, she forgot our cornbread and then didn't bring it till we were done. Each time we had to flag someone else to get us this stuff, waitress never came round till the end.Will return for food though because it's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Basem A.
Reviews.Content: They must be whipping up great waffles and chicken at Roscoes because when I entered the place, it was slammed! I had to take my order to go. I can't  knock on Roscoes, it was good old fried chicken season'd properly with crispy skin and a moist center. you can also top your fried chicken with their homestyle gravy, but I opt'd for the standardThe waffles were large, fluffy and delicious! Topped with a small scoop of butter and drizzled with maple syrup, you couldn't go wrong. Overall the combination was a different yet, a unique contrasting meal. And I enjoyed it. I'll go back.

Reviews.Author: Monica G.
Reviews.Content: I give Roscoe's five stars for their chicken and waffles but THREE-minus stars for customer service. I've been trying to reach Roscoe's for two weeks regarding a potential visit with a semi-large party and no one will return my call or respond to my email. I called and was sent to a vm that was full, so no message could be left - called right back and was put on hold FOREVER - called again and was put on hold AGAIN and no one came back to the line. Called a different day and same thing: Hold.... And for the record, I called during off-peak hours because I know how busy they get. Then I decided to go to their website and leave an email - hoping they would respond to my email. But to no avail. After leaving two emails and several phone call attempts, I gave up.I guess they are just so popular and arrogant that they can't be bothered with reservation requests. Really too bad because I was hoping to share the Roscoe experience with a group of friends who have not yet had the pleasure.Suffice it to say, I love them and resent them at the same time. : /

Reviews.Author: Katie F.
Reviews.Content: So I imagine you know what to expect when you go to Roscoe's...which is deliciousness. Amazing fried chicken, best smothered in gravy and onions...with a side of mac and cheese and a block of cornbread or a big huge waffle and there ya go, greasy buttery southern comfort food happiness. Also their lemonade blendy drinks are the bomb. And the guy at the door is super friendly and hilarious. I've heard that this place gets really busy I guess, but I've only been during the week for a late dinner (around 9 or 10pm) and never had to wait...though the parking can be kinda lame but that's the city of LA, so...whatcha gonna do.

Reviews.Author: Ken S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the LB and Hollywood location. I prefer the Hwood location. It being a shady wood paneled building with doorman guarding the entrance. He tells you "Wait outside, I've always got a line"...I'm a big fan of the ambience.About the food, I usually get the standard chicken and waffles, this time got the new chicken chili over rice. Chicken and waffles smothered in gravy are solid, leaving me with a guilty conscience and heavy stomach. My friend likes to omit the gravy and put hot sauce and syrup on his. I dig how everyone has their own favorite way. The chicken chili is lacking tho...and really expensive for a little bowl. Their Lisa's Special (Ice tea+Lemonade) is pretty good as well but expensive ($3+). In fact everything is pretty pricey here, they can get away with it I guess.Overall, I would say Roscoe's is a great place to take out-of-towners for the hype and character.They don't split the bill here unless it's 50/50 and you pay up front. They wouldn't even let us split the bill when we were paying cash...which seems kinda lazy to me but again ...they can get away with it

Reviews.Author: Rana R.
Reviews.Content: Been to the Pico location as well. Love Roscoe's, kind of an LA staple. Always get the same thing and it's always like the first time I'm having it. (I think) I order the Scoe something w/a side of scrambled eggs. Delicious! Haven't had much else, don't think I want anything else. Best chicken&waffles around. Very good meal for a very good price. I'll be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Jeriel T.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in about 3AM after partying at the Supper Club one night.  Service was fast, but the food was some of the worst quality I've ever had.  You'd after drinking all night some comfort food like chicken and waffles would be bomb, nope, wrong!  Maybe it was a bad night cause one of the girls that was with us was raving about what stuff to try and even she thought it wasn't what she remembered.

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: OFF THE CHAIN!!!!! The chicken is always so good. Services is fast and friendly. Will totally go back. Parking is awful. But worth it

Reviews.Author: Briana B.
Reviews.Content: Pure deliciousness!! I am so glad I was able to stop here on my way home from Long Beach. The chicken is cooked perfectly, waffles were tasty. Next time I am in So. Cal I will definitely be visiting here again!!

Reviews.Author: A K.
Reviews.Content: Omg. Best place ever!It's way better than knott's berry farm fries chicken. I usually put honey on the chicken and syrup on the waffles and eat together!mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. mmm. That's the best combo ever!I love the collard greens, fried chicken, waffles, and everything else!This is the best breakfast/lunch/dinner ever!You gotta try this!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay S.
Reviews.Content: Really really really good! Comfort food, you will leave feeling satisfied for sure. I recommend the chicken breast and waffle of course (#13) but the Mac n cheese and cornbread are also great. Service is always quick and without bs which I appreciate coming from Silverlake!

Reviews.Author: Debbie M.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's was delicious, if you've never tried chicken and waffles, this would be a good place to venture and try 'em. The service was good and our waiters were attentive. If your not a fan of cinnamon waffles, you may not be a huge fan. Either way, Great food.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy F.
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand what the hype is about this place. I went here once and I didn't think the food was anything special. The chicken was dry in my opinion and I could get a waffle like the one they served anywhere else. Their sauces/gravy didn't stand out to me and on top of that everything seemed rather pricy (for mediocre food, anyways). I don't think I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Irina Q.
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this place is leaving.I don't know what to say about the serive...

Reviews.Author: Anthony S.
Reviews.Content: Chicken is very crispy which is a good thing for me the waffle is very good and moist it's not dry and service is really quick and is not pricey at all

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: Wow, if you are a resident of Southern California and haven't been to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, you need to make this you next meal. This is some damn good breakfast/brunch/anytime food really. Their fried chicken is AMAZING and really juicy. Their waffles are equally as good. This place is an awesome meal for breakfast, lunch. dinner, late night, drunk or completely sober.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas A R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's has the tastiest waffles I've ever had: buttery, spiced, extra-fluffy.  In a word, their waffles are 'perfect'.  Their fried chicken is also very, very good.  Extra crispy outside but moist and tender inside-excellent!Outside of those two items, there really isn't alot to choose from (you can get eggs, mac & cheese, other assorted sides, etc.).  The prices aren't phenomenal, but the place won't break the bank.  I suggest going with a friend and sharing the 1/2 chicken, 2 waffle combo meal.  For a moderate eater, you share that plate and get 1/4 chicken and a waffle and that should be more than enough!  Check this place out, it's worth it just to say that you've been to Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Renee D.
Reviews.Content: We brought some visitors here on our "Snoop Dogg Tour of LA", and I have to say this is the best chicken & waffle place I've ever been to.  Okay, it's the only one, but the food was pretty tasty.  I had the Scoe's special.  The chicken was good, and flavorful, and the waffle was nice and crispy.  Not THE BEST CHICKEN EVER or THE BEST WAFFLES EVER, but they went well together, and if Snoop likes it, I like it.  Parking was annoying-- I think there was valet, we got a spot on the street approximately 4 miles away.  There was a pretty long wait, but it was Saturday night.  Honestly, I wouldn't come here again for a casual dinner with just the husband, but it was a fun experience with guests and I was pretty happy with the food.

Reviews.Author: Nicklaus B.
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Roscoe's for the first time, don't defeat the purpose of ordering anything else than Chicken and Waffles.  Who would've known that the combination of the two would be the best breakfast I've had in my life so far.  If you are to order something in addition to your already awesome Chicken and Waffles, definitely get the Macaroni and Cheese.  You'll thank me for doing so.Parking is going to be quite difficult if you go during the peak hours.  We were fortunate enough to be there before noon.  Although dimly lit, the experience was still enjoyable.  Our waitress was friendly and helped embrace my first experience at Roscoe's.  Portions are huge and expect to take a doggy bag home if the capacity of your stomach can only take so much.  The menu was easy to follow and the "Sunset" drink was pretty good; not too sweet.  If you're craving some serious Soul Food and need a hearty breakfast anytime of the day, stop by Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Christina Y.
Reviews.Content: My friend wanted to go get some chicken and waffles and what better place than Roscoe's. Parking was a bit difficult but we managed to find some street parking about 2 blocks away. Be prepared to wait at least half an hour to get seated.I never thought chicken and waffles would be a great combo but was I wrong. It was delicious! Be sure to ask for gravy on the side otherwise it will come with gravy all over your meal and I'm not sure if you want gravy on top your waffles.Great place and multiple locations around LA. The only downside is that I think I am done with eating fried chicken for a few weeks.

Reviews.Author: Ed L.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the rough look of the exterior of this building and the suspicious characters hanging out by the front door scare you away!After a few laps around the block fighting your way to find  a parking space and  after that doubt in your mind goes away that this IS the place your friend told you about  and it's not one of those underground Mob joints where you do the secret knock on the unmarked door to be let in...you will be pleasantly surprised to see a busy and crowded soul food joint inside that serves up  a satisfying meal well worthy of purchasing one of their souvenir T-shirts that for some reason is never available in XL.Tell anyone that you had a plate full of chicken and waffles and they give you that constipated look like you should be shunned out of Humanity for suggesting such a combination. Roscoe's will be more then glad to take any Fried chicken skeptics and turn them into true believers. I've been to Roscoe's a few times in their stores in Pasadena and their Gower location and I've been very satisfied with the service and the food on all occasions. Like most I didn't find the chicken and waffles combination very appealing but I was open to the idea. After wolfing down a 3 piece chicken plate on my first visit I was shocked and content to find that the grease of the chicken, the sweetness of the maple syrup, the saltiness of the butter and the sponginess of the waffles made for one great  delicious combination. It was like I was having a party in my mouth and  the bouncer was letting the ladies in with no cover charge...even though it wasn't even ladies night. They offer various soul dishes ranging from grits, collard greens, mac and cheese, corn bread and chicken prepared in different variations. From sandwiches to fried to covered in gravy Roscoe's will serve up your bird any way you choose it..but be bold and try their signature dish, fried with waffles...it's definitely a conversation starter.Best Kept Secret: The Mac and Cheese...no not even your Mom can make it this good! Only complaint...wish it came in bigger portions!

Reviews.Author: Adrienne N.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's, I love so much about the things that you choose to be.Especially the #1 (though I very much recommend the Carol C. special for first timers).Your chicken is tender on the inside; the skin is crunchy, and it is delicious, delicious, delicious. Your waffles are like hugs from your mother after a shitty day, cinnamon-y deliciousness and twice as big as my face. And with that syrup? Roscoe's, you slay me. I happily greet the food coma that comes with inhaling the #1. I love, I love, I love you.In all seriousness, though, the service is pretty good--my friend and I got there towards the end of the lunch rush and had to wait only 20 minutes (walking to the nearby thrift store makes time go by faster). We had to wait awhile before our orders were taken, but it wasn't an obscene amount of time, and neither was the wait to get the food. The main point is--the food is worth everything: the drive, the wait, the food baby. WORTH. IT.

Reviews.Author: Jay A.
Reviews.Content: The good: The food of course, chicken and waffles, although it sounds crazy, works well together. Its like an accidental chemistry. If you order the one in gravy, make sure you order it on the side just in case, cuz they pour it on your chicken like its no tomorrow.The bad: Holy Chicken Run Batman! the waiting period is atrocious, the parking is next to zero and the parking meter right next to it is maxed to an hour. By the time youre called and gets to eat, you have to make sure you go back to your car and put some coins or you'll get ticketed.The ugly: Nothing really that I can think off the top of my head, but they need to make it bigger or expand!

Reviews.Author: Sasha G.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! me and my bf eat here often or oder out!the greens,yams and macaroni&cheese! Is the best if you like soul food then u have to eat here!! It is pricey but most thing we happen to like are lol!The place is always really busy so call ahead!

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: I just found myself dreaming about those waffles....Wow!  I can't wait to go back, I don't even live in Hollywood and try to avoid Hollywood at all costs, and yet I want to--I could probably try their other locations but I know this one is great, so I'll go for the sure thing!The mac and cheese is also amazing!I went on a Saturday night and had to wait 40 min, but it was so worth it!

Reviews.Author: Sandro R.
Reviews.Content: When you think of L.A. You should think of Roscoes!! It's a place you have check out! I went with my friend, which I believe was a first for her, so we got a little of everything, well not everything. We started off with cornbread (which was moist and awesome) chili and Mac and cheese, which they are a must try. We ended our meal with chicken and waffles! Crispy, moist, flavorful chicken with an awesome waffle which you cannot describe without trying it the chicken and syrup.You will not be disappointed and if you are, your a freak!

Reviews.Author: Theresa L.
Reviews.Content: Ah, Roscoe's.  This place hits the spot like no other.  I usually with go with a big group because it's so much better to experience the satisfaction with a lot of fellow fans.  My go-to order is the succulent breast and waffle.  And it is always succulent.  Such a great word to describe the juicy chicken and crispy skin.  I always order the mac and cheese too because it is perfection. Bits of chunky cheese and soft pasta.  Mmmmmmmm.

Reviews.Author: Angela J.
Reviews.Content: With all the favorable reviews and accolades...I just knew I'd hit the soul food jackpot!!!  But...I crapped out!!! :(Sorry folks but this place was TOTALLY OVERATED!!! All these years I've been fighting to get to Roscoe's, and last week was my chance.  So I took it, and expected CHICKEN ' N WAFFLE perfection.  Ordered the 1/2 chix smothered in gravy with onions, accompanied by two waffles.The chicken was just okay, could have used more spices, and the waffle was soggy and wayyyyyyyyyyyyy too sweet (it was like eating a cupcake covered with syrup).If you are not used to reallllllllllllly gread soul food, this place may blow your mind.  But for me, it was just below average.Although it took a while to get served, even though it wasn't busy, I will give the joint two stars for service.  The staff is very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Author: Hubert H.
Reviews.Content: I feel like I'll get a heart attack every time I come here but it's so worth it. The idea of fried chicken and waffles baffled me but it strangely works. Chicken is crispy here, waffles are great. The sides are mostly great. Very hole-in-the-wall feel, but very fun.

Reviews.Author: Terra C.
Reviews.Content: First time I came here, I bought a shirt. That's how much I liked it.

Reviews.Author: Seth H.
Reviews.Content: The wife and I finally had a chance to partake of this delectable delicacies of fried yard bird and doughy goodness.  It did not disappoint.The chicken is spectacular and the waffles were good.  The syrup and Louisiana Hot Sauce were great additional to help wash down the food.  The fries were good but I would not recommend taking them home in a To-Go box because they get a little soggy and lose their luster.The best part of the evening was sampling their Fried Liver Dinner!  The livers with the hot sauce made me wanna slap somebody!Good food every once in a while.  If I ate here every night I would see myself weighting well over 300lbs.  Good stuff!

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: One of my all-time favorite restaurants. I discovered it as a kid with my mom as a result of it being featured on the Arsenio Hall show. Instant love.My friends like to call me the Roscoe's Ambassador because I take such joy in introducing new people to the restaurant. I start everyone off with the #13 for their first time, but I generally order the #5 (chicken omelet). Best waffles in the business, some of the best chicken anywhere, and fantastic mac 'n cheese and yams. And it's tough to find faster service at a restaurant.If you haven't been, go. If you've been, go back. There's nothing not to love about Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Carmen T.
Reviews.Content: July 8, 2012 We were hungry after delivering a Singing Telegram as a Pink Gorilla to "Whipple", the Work Flow Specialist at Sony Pictures. Driving down Sunset Blvd., we seen a busy Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. My honey mentioned he went there once and Loved it. Somehow, we didn't wait too long at all. I ordered the #8 Country Girl. Succulent 3 piece chicken with secret recipe along with a Sweet Tea.I laughed out loud when the plate came. It was Chicken. Only chicken. No side. I was confused. I told my honey I was excited about seeing a Secret Recipe with my chicken (thinking a side dish). He then laughed. The secret recipe was the ingredients used IN the chicken. So he shared his waffles with me. All in all, we had a great time. The chicken really was tasty.Carmen TellezCharmandHappy comSinging Telegrams Los Angeles

Reviews.Author: Gina N.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best fried chicken i've tasted! I love that the chicken is so crispy but not the least bit oily. The waffle on the other hand is good but nothing special. This is one of those spots thats a must stop if you're ever in LA. Expect a little bit of a wait, but lines usually go quickly....so don't let that deter you.

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing concept... but the food was just too much for me. Maybe I have just heard so many positive things about the place that in my mind I put it on a pedestal... but the fried chicken was not very good. The waffles were okay... but I was just not impressed by the place. The service was decent... parking sucked... but that is the nature of the neighborhood. I think everyone should give this place a try... but I personally will not be coming back there on purpose.

Reviews.Author: Wil S.
Reviews.Content: Everything you think this place is and more. Amazing waffles and chicken like no other. Very busy during peek hours/weekends, but worth the wait. A pivotal eating spot in LA!!!

Reviews.Author: Joey P.
Reviews.Content: This is a haven for chicken and waffle lovers. You get more than you pay for if all you're looking for is chicken & waffles done right. The breast is white and juicy. The skin is brown and crispy. The waffle is soft, the butter is fluffy and the syrup is rich and sweet. There really isn't a better place if this is what you want. If you're looking for something fancy, head down the strip for something exotic.

Reviews.Author: Shawanda R.
Reviews.Content: The chicken here is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Danielle B.
Reviews.Content: I see what all the hype is about. I enjoyed it so much I went back 2 days in a row. The chicken is cooked perfectly. The waffles were OK, it's a nice combo with the chicken. I LOVED the rice and gravy, the gravy reminds me of my moms. The mac and cheese was expensive, 4.80 for a little side and it wasn't that great. My fiance loved the grits. The daily special was a great deal, $6 for 2 thighs, rice, gravy and a biscuit. Well worth every dollar. The food comes out extremely fast, I was amazed by the speed of service. Great spot!

Reviews.Author: Reginice C.
Reviews.Content: I feel like like this restaurant is over-rated! The chicken was...decent that's why I've given an extra star instead of just one. The beans and rice were not seasoned; yuck. It was not worth the hour and fifteen minute wait.

Reviews.Author: Blue U.
Reviews.Content: i was really excited about finally eating at the famous roscoes.i asked the waitress if the chicken sandwich had any type of sauce on it.she says no,i say "good because i dont want any sauce on it".about 30 minutes later, the food arrives.the restaurant was pretty empty & it was only the 2 of us at the table.i look at my plate & my sandwich is SWIMMING in mayo.the waitress was really rude so we left.i never got to eat a thing

Reviews.Author: Tyler B.
Reviews.Content: Next time I come back to California after an extended period of time, the first thing I will want is ROscoe's --not In-N-Out. I had the Country Boy (waffle with wings) which is the most dank thing ever. Don't forget a side if Mac and Cheese.
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Baby Named C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the excitment is about this place.  If I loved gut rot and swampy drawers, this would be my go to spot.  If you're looking for a lil soul in your life, there are way better joints.  Just because you are not supposed to be there, doesn't make it cool that you are, no matter how tight your jeans are.  I prefer syrup!

Reviews.Author: Lynne H.
Reviews.Content: It's been over a year since I visited this place, but I think about it all the time.  Before that visit, I had never experienced a chicken and waffle place before.  There was a line outside but we didn't care.  We put our name on the list, but only stood out there for a short time before they called us in.  I regret not ordering the waffles.  I was too focused on the chicken.  I've since learned that lesson.  My next trip down south will include both Roscoe's, the waffles and of course...the chicken!!!

Reviews.Author: picnic n.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving them a 1 star for bad to go service.  If you call in your order, they will not make it until you get there and pay for it, so no point of calling in.  Also, I came all the way from SF order to go and they charged me for everything I ordered but I did not get everything I ordered!!  Of course my fault for not checking while I was there but I was in a hurry to catch a plane home.  So, to my disappointment when I opened it at the airport, I did not get what I paid for.My order was #19, thigh, leg w/rice/gravy and I wanted extra wings for a couple dollars more, plus a side of potatoe salad. I did not get my side of potatoe salad, which is $4 and I did not get my thigh and legs, which is most of my meal.  All I got was 3 wings, rice and gravy!! Roscoe's owe me big time!  I'm very disappointed and probably will not go there again.I suggest if you order to go to always always check your orders if you have the time.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn O.
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE RIDICILOUSLY over crowded! theres this waitthat seems like youll be there all day!the sun shines right where your waiting to be seated if your going in the day time.

Reviews.Author: Junior H.
Reviews.Content: To all my Yelp Friends and Non Yelp Friends, come!!!!!Can't wait.  :)

Reviews.Author: Evan H.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a must try, at least once and there is a fat chance you won't like it. I even bought a tshirt!

Reviews.Author: Bryan R.
Reviews.Content: This review has been LONG overdue. I mean, from when I first had tried Roscoe's back in 2005, nothing has changed. GREAT food, GREAT service and INCREDIBLY cheap! What's even better is that these qualities spread out to all locations. I've been to four locations across the LA area and I've never been disappointed. Taste and quality doesn't change, as well as the friendly employees. Instant classic in my book, and I'm always shocked when people say they haven't been :0Obviously get the chicken and waffles, but as many would state...Mac n cheese is literally amazing.

Reviews.Author: Kenny G.
Reviews.Content: Food is OK, a little pricy.  I could have gotten better food, service for the money.$17.00 bucks for half of fried chicken and 2 waffles.Middle aged waiter calls me young man and seats me and my daughter in the corner of the entire restaurant when there were plenty of empty booth tables.A younger server/waiter takes our drinks/orders.  He was OK, when asked for recommendations he was quick, polite and wanted to keep the job.Our half of fried chicken came with 2 whole waffles.  Chicken was tasty, waffles were OK.President Obama and Will Smith visited this place, according to J-Leno's show.  That's why I tried it out.  It was OK,

Reviews.Author: Deb H.
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our second trip to the area.  We didn't have time to stop in here during our first trip but I made SURE we hit it this time.Boy, I'm sure glad I did!  I had a waffle and a thigh and they were both the best I'd EVER had.  The waffle wasn't much to look at (I was envisioning a a big, thick fluffy one as I ordered) but as soon as they brought out the food the smell immediately won me over.  It was almost like a freshly made waffle cone but better. After slathering it with the giant hunk of butter and pouring the syrup over it, I dug in and I was in HEAVEN!  I nearly forgot my chicken because the waffle was soooo good!  Once I got my head back on straight, I attacked the chicken and it was FABULOUS!  A nice crisp crust and not too greasy.  Better than mom makes!  :)As a tourist, I also thought the location was great.  The two tables near us were both talking Hollywood business--reality shows and movies!  I might even check out the reality show they were talking about, to see if they actually do they things they were talking about.  Yeah, I eavesdropped!And, just to be thorough, the service was great too.  The guy at the door was very nice and super sweet to my 2 y/o daughter.  The waiter was attentive and very friendly.  I can't wait to go back!Word of advice -- get there right at 9AM (no parking on the street 7-9AM) and you can nab a parking space right out in front.  :)

Reviews.Author: Lane K.
Reviews.Content: Kind of like In-N-Out you really should not leave Los Angeles without trying this absolute staple.  Last time Obama came to town, he stopped here.  Killer chicken and waffles, this place invented the whole chicken and waffles craze.  They also have beer & wine.  What more convincing do you need, just go there already!

Reviews.Author: Becky S.
Reviews.Content: Every time we visit LA, this is a must-stop.  We've always gone on a weekday, so there's no problem parking, and no wait.  Can get a little expensive if you order a bunch of sides, but it's soooooo worth it!  If you're not a big eater, plan on sharing a plate - this is heavy, rich, stick-to-your-ribs grub.

Reviews.Author: BigTex K.
Reviews.Content: Lovely

Reviews.Author: Magnolia B.
Reviews.Content: Yum!

Reviews.Author: Catherine H.
Reviews.Content: good

Reviews.Author: Kathy V.
Reviews.Content: Overrated!!! Service Sucked here at this location. We came here early for breakfast to beat the morning crowd, and had the slowest service on earth! Move like a turtle will ya? It took our waitress 15mins to approach us. My party was for 6 people and all 5 of us received our meal in 15mins except for 1. My lil bro was waiting on a side of scrambled eggs with cheese, and it took 30 mins to receive it? ughh.. Let me get back to their fried chicken, nothing special about it! lol lets put it this way I rather went to Church's chicken. Waffles? umm so thin & boring. Like Jay Z say's "ON TO THE NEXT ONE"

Reviews.Author: Greg T.
Reviews.Content: I've got two issues with reading Yelp reviews (yea I'm bitch'n' again). The first one I mentioned just recently in my Counter Burger review, and the second issue is that you often get reviews by people who simply can't discern between good and bad food - even some of the crappiest places I can think of will get a couple 5 star reviews/ratings - That's whats good and bad about Yelp cuz you get everybody's valid feedback, but it just sucks having to go through all the ones you might not relate to. I've got an ex and a couple friends who can attest to this because getting their feedback is often answered with "oh ya, I like it" or "yea, it was good" for every eff'n meal good or bad?!?!, hahaha!! Well, what did you like about it? "I don't know, but it was good"...did you know the salmon you ate was rancid and it was burnt "oh well, I liked it". Ok, thanks. That was very insightful, and ideally I'd only think this type of rating system is only good in the bedroom.Now taste is subjective but preparation isn't. Since I cook a lot, and I've worked in the restaurant industry, I know cook'n mutha' eff'n fried eff'n chicken is eff'n nearly impossible for me to get like Popeye's chicken. I've tried lard, Crisco, bacon grease, different types of oils, different kinds of flour, starch combo's, buttermilk marinating, and multiple preparation/cook'n techniques but none of them gets me close to the holy grail of fried chicken which is Popeye's. I love me some Popeye's.This isn't a Popeye's review, so I will say Roscoes is no Popeye's. The preparation is a lot more basic here, and I'd liken it to "home cook'n". I could easily replicate this chicken in my own kitchen which means "I'm not impressed" - hahahaha!! (refer to gripe number 1).They definitely get an extra star cuz they have my favorite hot sauce which is Louisiana hot sauce. Memphis in Costa Mesa offers Cholula and Tabasco for their southern fried chicken....weaksauce!So just like 'Anthony A' says, this is another joint that is on the hardcore list of the "Most Overrated Places to Eat in LA". I think it gets this hype partially cuz it's the same thrill some Colorado folk get when they venture into little Saigon off of Federal, but then again I guess there's nothing wrong with being happy with everything you eat being the best fried chicken ever!! Five stars!!!...........but enough is ENOUGH! I have had it with these motherfn' 5 star reviews (snakes) on this motherfn' fried chicken joint (plane)!

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand people's fascination with this place...i think its the name that gets people coming back...because for me it was just mediocre...first off the place is filthy...even for me...whose used to living in filth...plz...my mouth alone...what comes out of this mouth is just constant garbage...but this place is pushing it...if the food was fabulous i'd overlook this misstep as i always do when there are diamonds in the rough...my motto a little dirt never hurt nobody...but that only applies to little hole in the wall places that are dirt cheap and have amazing food...this place falls flat on its face...now anyone who knows me knows i love me some chicken...i swear i was reincarnated and in another lifetime i was black...or mexican...cause i love me some southern soul food and some mexican food...i love me some chicken...i am a connoisseur of chicken...i know a good chicken when i taste one...I"M A CHICKEN SLUT...i've been around the block with some chickens in my day...and this one wasn't that fabulous...it didn't have the nice golden brown exterior or the flaky crispy coating...or the delicious juice that dribbles down your chin when you eat it bitching hot you can barely hold it in your mouth...but its so freaking good you don't spit it out...you just do that "woo ha" in your mouth trying to not burn the inside of your esophagus...I ordered a two piece with a waffle...it was good...the waffle had a slightly crispy texture but i wish it was crispier...it has a hint of cinnamon and nutmeg that i enjoyed...it was probably the best thing..a little pat of butter...some syrup...yum..overall the waffle was the best part...together with the chicken it was good..the waffle being its saving grace....i just wished the chicken was better...also considering the ambiance and what not you would expect the place to be cheaper...but its kind of expensive for being such a cruddy place and the parking is terrible...lol...god...who do i have to blow around here to get a good parking spot....jeez....

Reviews.Author: Anthony A.
Reviews.Content: THIS is the world-famous Roscoe's? The place people just can't seem to get enough of? The place I just stood in front of for 45 min waiting to get inside? Add this one to the same list Pink's is on for "Most Overrated Places to Eat in LA.". My gf and I arrived and were met by a gathering of people waiting in front. They take your name at the door, which is roped off, and you stand around outside for a loonnnggg time. We got in about 40-ish minutes later, were handed our tiny menus and seated near the kitchen. The service was prompt for such a busy joint, so they get some props there for staying on top of things. The menu was smaller than I expected, but I planned on ordering one thing and one thing only: chicken and waffles. But, oddly enough, they don't have a big "CHICKEN AND WAFFLES" special listed anywhere of note. It's just crammed in there, listed as "1." (without gravy & onions) or "2." (with). So, I ordered one of those (at a steep $10.20) and my gf got a chicken burger with fries. The food came in about 15-20 min., quicker than I anticipated. Visually, I was drawn in by the succulent yet bizarre pairing of fried chicken and waffles dripping in melted butter and syrup. However, once we dug in we learned that the aesthetics outweighed the actual taste. My chicken tasted like everyday fried chicken. They claim to use their "own special mix", but it honestly didn't taste any better than KFC, and it sure as hell wasn't any healthier. The waffles had a hint of cinnamon, which was a nice touch, but they were flaccid, spongy and tepid. I thought they were cranking these out all day? You could have told me they heated it up in a microwave and I wouldn't have questioned it. Weak. I savored the experience of mixing my chicken and waffles together, but it was hardly the revelatory food-gasm that many make it out to be. My gf's chicken burger underwhelmed, and her fries were THE WORST I've ever eaten. Anywhere. They were limp, cold and bland bland bland. Total bill out the door was $25 with tip. I can't say I'd return. Maybe if I were with some friends who insisted, but there's nothing special about the food or the atmosphere that begs me to come back. Like Pink's, this is another LA. landmark restaurant I can cross of my "need to try" list, and it's also one that's vastly overrated.

Reviews.Author: A B.
Reviews.Content: Chicken is good. Waffles are good. But chicken AND waffles, together? Not particularly appetizing. Nonetheless, I finally went and sampled what Roscoe's had to offer. Initially, we were lucky to find a parking spot near the front of Roscoe's. Upon entry, a kind (older) man led us to our table.  I opted for 1. Scoe's -- which is a 1/2 chicken prepared southern style, with 2 waffles. After about 10 minutes, our food arrived. The waffles were great -- perhaps the best waffles I have ever had. The chicken was certainly above average -- the meat was white and moist... the way I like it. Entrees range from about $9 to $16. Moreover, I found the service to be very friendly, as our waiter was extremely accommodating. Additional Notes: - Operating hours are from 8 AM to midnight -- 7 days a week.

Reviews.Author: Diana N.
Reviews.Content: i've been up to my nose in fried chicken it seems. i seriously cannot eat anymore for at least 4 months.SERIOUSLY.anyways, came here with my girl who stared aghast at me for not eating here yet...I KNOW I KNOW..but dude, i hate waiting in line to eat "fast food" so yea, came here...waited about 7 minutes. and walked in. i felt like i was in that movie "Roadhouse" with patrick swayze. dimly lit reddish lighting with wooden EVERYTHING...honky donk people (shuttup, i'm included in this mess), the smell of grease and sugar abundant in the air. u get the point.anyways, so i ordered 2 piece dark meat with a stack o waffles. i camei atei was fulli lefti had stomach problemsi ate peptofelt betteri guess it's ok. but dude, for 2 orders of chicken and waffles with a side of mac was $30!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!EFF THAT..i'd rather roll through popeyes (do they have this in LA??) or KFC....JEEBUS.i don't think i'll come back. AND parking sucksAND i stepped in pee in the bathroomEW

Reviews.Author: Rod C.
Reviews.Content: Tasty blend of savory and sweet comfort food all together put in Roscoe's House.  Must come back!

Reviews.Author: Cijae K.
Reviews.Content: they had me at "rice & gravy"ive been to more than one location but for some reason ive come to this particular location more than the others.not by choice, but by location convenience.. i always seem to be "in the area"seriously, this franchise is THAT good..and you wont really know until you've tried it.i dont even know where to begin.. or how to describe it..its just SO GOOD, period.even if fried chicken's not your thing.. it will BECOME your thing.so just pick the closest location and GO already!![sorry roscoe's but i took a star away cuz of your whole "NO SEPARATE CHECKS" policy..]fried chicken, rice & gravy.. with a side of greens.. now thats what im talkin bout![takes me back to philly..]

Reviews.Author: Vivian X.
Reviews.Content: Chicken & Waffles? Interesting combination I must say and had to give it a try since a LAYs chip was designed after it (lol) . Came with a large group of people, had to wait for everyone to arrive before being seated. Waiter was nice and quick with the orders. I ordered a #2 and it arrived fairly fast. The waffles did not taste like anything special, the chicken was really juicy and the gravy was a plus. Their mac & cheese was supposedly the best in LA but it tasted like normal mac & cheese... Thats about it, nothing great.

Reviews.Author: Alexis R.
Reviews.Content: Rocoe's is straight up the BEES KNEES! ;) I really need to come here more often. The waffles are so fluffy & warm & the chicken is definitely some of the best fried chicken I have ever tasted. YUM! Soo much flavor. Gulp it down with that half lemonade/half iced tea drink, it's superb here. Can't wait to go again!!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia P.
Reviews.Content: I'm from Brooklyn, NY and when visiting LA roscoe's was on my list of places to visit, i wasn't pleased at all, this place is over rated , I don't see a difference with Roscoe's and peaches hothouse or Peaches in Bedstuy, BK , we also visited the one in long beach and did not like the waffles, we had better soulfood

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: As my good friend Nima wrote, "I double-dog-dare you to find something more intrinsically LA than Roscoe's." That summarizes all the hype and authenticity of this place, which has made "chicken and waffles" almost synonymous as "double-double animal style." Of course, In-n-Out has expanded well out of Southern California, but we all know why there are palm trees on the cup. Anyway, back to Roscoe's.I love this place. I love their gravy-smothered chicken. I love their gravy through a straw. I love the fluffy waffles that break up my enjoyment of said chicken. I love this place, which is why it's getting 5 stars. So don't look for anything else from this review other than a few stories because... yes, I am that crazy Yelper that writes ridiculously long anecdotes.Almost 12 years ago I decided that I needed a little break from high school, so I decided to ditch school for an entire week. I managed to keep myself busy for most of the week, but by Friday I had run out of ways to amuse myself. Not knowing where to go I decided to visit my friends at their school down the road and convince them to play hookie with me. I thought I'd have to talk them into it, but my car decided break down right in front of their school, so they had no choice but to help me push it down the road, which worked out in my favor. All that pushing worked up a mighty hunger and they were already late for class, so one of my friends suggested we go to Roscoe's. At that age I wasn't all that keen on driving 30 miles just for food, so I'd never been, but since my car was out of commission, I wouldn't have to do the driving. Despite being a weekday, we still had to wait an hour to be seated. Up until this point in my life, I had never ditched so many days in a row, driven 30+ miles just for food, waited for longer than 30 minutes just to sit down in a restaurant, or experienced a food orgasm. My trip to Roscoe provided a first on all those counts and that was the first of many trip. When I got home later that day my mother was waiting for me at the door and played back the voicemail that the school had left, inquiring about my absence... so yes, that sweet memory ended on a sour note, but to this day I still believe it was totally worth it.Years later I missed a plane back to Sacramento after running my first marathon because I took too long enjoying my meal at Roscoe's. I ended up sleeping at the airport since I didn't want my folks to know I'd missed my flight. Was Roscoe's worth sleeping on those crappy seats in LAX? Yes. Totally.Years from now I will die of a heart attack because I decided to eat Roscoe's. Will it be worth it. Totally.Get off your ass and go already.

Reviews.Author: jodi h.
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine told me about Roscoe's ten years ago.  He told me I had to order the number 13.  I asked what this was and he replied just order it luv. So here I am ten years later hopelessly addicted to the number 13 (the menu reads 1 succulent breast,1 waffle)...The chicken is always piping hot and juicy (hmmm are we talking chicken) and the service is fun served with an extra side of attitude...which by the way works at this place. Their smothered potatoes are super yummy too. You can order a fine (HA HA) rose wine by the glass, but don't be surprised if the doorman comes by and says "wining and dining"to give ya a  not so subtle hint to get a move on out the door. I think they truly have an hour time limit cause it is soooo busy and good! It is a long wait, but if you get there at noon, you are guaranteed to get in before they close at 4am

Reviews.Author: Lori K.
Reviews.Content: Been a Roscoe's lover forever, but I just recently discovered THEY SERVE LATE INTO THE NIGHT! I can't believe I didn't know that all this time!!!!! I can't believe I've wasted so many late night snack attacks on other less deserving food establishments! No worries Roscoe's... I know now.... and inl ight of this newly discovered knowledge we shall be renedvouzing more often! Fried Chicken with syrup drizzled on top with collared greens yuuuuuuuummy!!!!

Reviews.Author: Kendal C.
Reviews.Content: All im going to say is bomb.com

Reviews.Author: Abraham L.
Reviews.Content: Went one night for the first time. I saw the huge line but was seated within 5 min, which was great. I Ordered the chicken and waffles with Mac and cheese and it was all delicious. The chicken was so juicy and rich, the waffles were super soft and had an amazing flavor, and the Mac and cheese was creamy and good. Service was awesome as well. A+ in my book

Reviews.Author: Oanh L.
Reviews.Content: its just fried chicken done absolutely right.. with gravy on the side (there's like.. onions in the gravy... uhhmazing)and then the fluffy waffle..sighthe first time i had this, that first bite was absolute HEAVEN. and where the HELL have u been all my life Rooster's Louisiana Hot Sauce ?! i have to admit that the more i go there, the more inconsistent it gets.. but i can always come back because i know their potential.. I BELIEVE IN YOU ROSCOES. don't let  us down. i always feel weird at first because we're usually the only asians there but once u get ur food you enter this zone.. where everything is kinda blurry and u just keep dipping ur fried chicken into the gravy..u cant go wrong with the "1/4 chix Scoes",  gravy on the side

Reviews.Author: Lyn P.
Reviews.Content: Getting my chicken and waffles fix here is a no brainer when I am in L.A. I rarely deviate from my standard order of a thigh and a waffle - if I am really hungry, I'll throw in a wing or a leg and some mac and cheese.  I love that their food tastes consistent from location to location - you just know that it will hit the spot if it is what you are craving.

Reviews.Author: J B.
Reviews.Content: Can't get no better than this. I actually think I hurt myself I ate so much. To get the ultimate benefit of Roscoe's, you have to order the Scones#1: 2pieces of your choice of chicken, and 2 waffles. The chicken was so juicy and moist. It was truly enough for anybody. I HAD to order a side order of their mac/cheese cuz I had heard so much about it. Yes...it was awesome. I will be going back. Not anytime soon cuz my poor lil stomach probably couldn't handle it.

Reviews.Author: Lauren M.
Reviews.Content: i just ate here today for lunch for the first time in a very looooong time.and its just as remarkable as i had remembered it.i ordered the #1 Scoe's that came with 2 pieces of chicken (with the option of white or dark meat), 2 Waffles with butter and syrup, and a side of mac n cheese.  mmmmmmmmm! delish.  the skin on the chicken is why i personally love roscoes and the fact that you can eat chicken with yer waffles and vice versa.the prices are a little expensive but i didnt care cuz i didnt pay!  :)oh, and it made me really stuffed the WHOLE DAY!  that hardlly ever happens!

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: It's really good to have their chicken and waffles, I don't mean good for you.  The chicken is yummy, though could be a little spicier, a little crispier, and a little hotter.  The waffle has good flavor but wasn't crispy enough on the outside, i.e. no one likes it limp.

Reviews.Author: Jess G.
Reviews.Content: BOYCOTT ROSCOE'S! MY GIRLFRIEND AND I WERE ASKED TO STOP EMBRACING BY THE SECURITY AND MANAGER, WITH A FLASHLIGHT!! We had just finished eating and were feeling positive about the Bjork show we has just seen when these 2 men approached us in a negative manner and said " you need to stop that"! We were shocked and couldn't believe that we had just experienced homophobic actions by these 2 men! While we were shocked and angered by this humiliation and unfair treatment, we managed to leave with the business's human resources without anyone getting physically hurt or arrested!! Phew! We ask that if you're a person that believes in the fair treatment of lesbians, gays, trans, bi, black, white, red peoples everywhere!!!! DON'T SUPPORT THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!! Or you'll be haunted for eveeeeeerr! just kidding about the last part...

Reviews.Author: Jennifer A.
Reviews.Content: Finally was able to make it back to Roscoe's and simmer in their buttery goodness. Both treks out to this famed institution have been a 2 hour fight though traffic on the 15, 10 and 101 just to savory their unusual mix of chicken and waffles that just hits the spot every time. My eyes were bigger than my stomach and I ordered Herb's Special w/o gravy; my gf got with gravy so we could try both. I also ordered a biscuit and grits because what kind of southern meal would this be without some grits? We gorged ourselves until we were going to pop and took half of each plate home for breakfast. Everything was cooked to perfection and my monthly grease quota for the month has been filled.Bring some quarters and skip the valet. You can find a spot within walking distance but if it is before 8 pm (on weekends) keep an eye on the clock or you will be paying a hefty fine. If you have time to kill before you are seated, Hollywood Blvd is a leisurely ten minute stroll and the tourist (am) / hoochie (pm) watching is prime.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle G.
Reviews.Content: This is the original Roscoes. I think the food is better here compared to the other ones. The only downside to this location is parking, the wait, and its so tiny, but they expanded a few years back. Plus this one stays open the latest so its a great place to go after partying in Hollywood

Reviews.Author: Party R.
Reviews.Content: I'd give it a 2 1/2 stars if I could.Went to eat there on 3/10/07, yesterday. I came all the way from Northern California with great expectations.The wait was 35 minutes and when I got in the waiter and hostesses was nice. Very friendly. The food however was not as pleasant as the wait staff.I think all the reviews before me were overrated. The waffles were soggy even though I ordered it well done. I wasn't bothered by that but the waffle batter wasn't anything near good. The chicken was plain.. No spices or anything. Just fried.Nothing special. KFC makes better chicken.Maybe I'm spoiled in Northern California but Home of Chicken and Waffles in Oakland  is soo much better.Overall for 10 bucks a plate I would not come back. The portions were very  small for what they charge you. 4 bucks for an extra waffle??The plates used to serve customers  were the kind you would see in a nursing home. Plastic cheap tan plates.I don't expect ambiance or anything but for ten bucks a plate at least give me a real plate.I'm sure Roscoe's was much better back in the day but it seems that the original owner sold the business to people who don't know how to run the business and are stingy and uptight.  Definitely not  a place I would recommend for soul food.

Reviews.Author: Cassandra D.
Reviews.Content: Food was very good such a great combination. Staff was friendly and quick service. We ate at 4:00pm and it had a fair amount of people.

Reviews.Author: Amanda H.
Reviews.Content: I got the Obama Special and it was delicious. They do take names/reservations if it is not too swamped. What we did was go put our names in (they told us it would be 30 min wait) and then we just hung out for a bit around the area. The waiter who seated us and took our order was very friendly and had good recommendations. The food was great, chicken very moist and the mac and cheese was incredible. The only thing that was a bummer was that it was so very busy that the waiter did not come back once to refill our drinks and i even had to go get him and get the check to pay because he literally never came back to the table. The beer is way overpriced and it was like 6$ for a Corona.

Reviews.Author: Tony C.
Reviews.Content: This is the better of the L A Roscoe's locations.  Although I like Long Beach the best.  The chicken is juicy and the staff is funny.  "Taste so good you'll wanna slap yo mama".  So go for it and get the greens, dirty rice, and a t-shirt.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne C.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is home of the best fried chicken that I've ever tasted in my life! There was a huge line, so we decided to order our food to go. We decided to skip the waffle because we figured that it would get soggy. The chicken was fried to perfection! I look forward to trying the chicken and the waffle together next time!

Reviews.Author: Shelly N.
Reviews.Content: Hahha I agree that Snoop Dogg knows whats up! I HAD to try this place since I read so many positive review. Thank you fellow yelpers for not failing me! Crispy waffles and perfectly seasoned, crunchy, juicy fried chicken ohhhh dizzam! You can order it with your chicken smothered in gravy or you can keep it crispy like I did and omit the gravy. All in all, I highly recommend this place to those who haven't had chicken and waffles! Ask Snoop Dogg while you're at all. He loves this place too =]

Reviews.Author: Roger W.
Reviews.Content: om nom.  and nom nom.  nom.So I lived in the south for ages.  Never had chicken and waffles before.  Sounded very southern.  Sounded like it'd be good once in a long while.So I got the smothered with onions.  And I thought, hm.. this should taste weird.But these guys are here and have been here for a while no?so I took a bite of everything together.phenomenal.Really.Somehow all those tastes come together as.. super delicious :).

Reviews.Author: Robyn d L.
Reviews.Content: Love the combination of savory and sweet.  Love the gravy.  Love how you're treated like family.  As I was slowing down during my meal, one of the waitresses passed by and said to me, "Mmm, child, you betta' finish yo food."  Where my only response was, "Yes, mamma."

Reviews.Author: Tasha M.
Reviews.Content: As a native Southern Californian, I absolutely love me some Roscoe's. And there is nothing quite like it in Washington, DC where now I reside. Being that I hadn't eaten here in a few years and was traveling back to the west coast for a vacation, I specifically requested it as the first stop on our way to Oxnard from the airport. Of course the 110 and 101 traffic was dummy stupid on a Saturday afternoon, so we were good and starving by the time we arrived... only to find a huge mass of people waiting outside for a table. Ugh. Yes, Roscoe's is that famous, and that damn delicious...Rather surprisingly, it actually didn't take us long to get in. We were quoted 30-35 minutes, but it felt more like 15-20. Props for that. Our party of five (three adults and two children) was seated at somewhat of a cramped table in the front corner, which none of us really cared about because we were ready to have a worship experience with this fried yumminess. To say that we enjoyed the $100 worth of food we ordered was an understatement (see pic). Everything placed in front of us was muy sabroso, minus the "sweet tea" they had the audacity to give me. My best friend liked it, but my persnickety palate decided to pass. It had a weird kind of fruity flavor and didn't taste "southern" sweet like I've grown accustomed to. If I can remember properly, all together we ordered a mix of fried chicken breasts (which were huge and moist), mac and cheese, greens, yams, waffles, cornbread, and sweet potato pie. Thumbs up for it all! The waffles are made of a special house recipe, which to me seem to have a cinnamony-nutmegish flavor. Definitely far from the Belgian-style ones that I lust after, but tasty nonetheless. My favorite items were the greens and mac and cheese. Sooooo good. The downside to this positive review, however, is that the service was a tad bit on the slow side. It took our server at least five minutes to greet our table, which I believe to be completely unacceptable as a former restaurant hospitalian. At one point I had to ask for a drink twice, which resulted in me getting two Cokes back to back o_O This all occurred after I had consumed half of my meal, of course, which was highly annoying. I like to drink when I eat. Someone tell Roscoe to get that together when you see him...All in all, this restaurant is worth the wait and somewhat pricey plates. Go get your chicken and waffles on. It's pretty much a Cali classic.

Reviews.Author: Shari D.
Reviews.Content: Hello, Roscoe's!! Finally made it here after drinking sangria all night with peeps at the Do Over, and it REALLY hit the spot! It's a lot of food, so 1/4 chix with waffles, biscuit & gravy was shared by me & my sister and we couldn't even come close to finishing it. Plus I ordered corn bread, which was good but not the greatest. The biscuit and gravy were way better than I'd imagined, though, and my husband said the grits were right on. The chicken itself was DELISH, and perfect for soaking up all the alcohol in my belly...  I felt lots better about the rest of the night after some of Roscoe's chicken was in me! Yum yum yum!

Reviews.Author: Josh F.
Reviews.Content: I lived in LA 10yrs ago and my roommate took me to Roscoe's one morning after a wicked night of partying on Sunset led to a massive hangover.  We were physically removed from the Saddle Ranch Chop House after 11 straight hours of drinking (hey, I woke up and watched Leaving Las Vegas... what else could you do?) and my roommate got the bright idea of pretending to be a vallet and see if we could park some hot cars.  Luckily, we were in walking distance of home and made the trip safely.Anyway, this was one of those next mornings where you swear some small gnome crept into your head with a hammer and just punished your brain for a while.  The thought of chicken and waffles made me sick... but then when that maple syrup hit my mouth and the greasy taste of fried chicken followed... all pain went away.  This place was magic for me.  Of course, in your early 20's you can eat this crap all the time and not gain a pound.  These days it's rare for me to even get a hangover, let alone eat a styrofoam container filled with fried chicken and waffles, but if I had the chance again, I would.

Reviews.Author: Ryan P.
Reviews.Content: It's just one of those things everyone in Los Angeles has to do. I've come to this location too many times to count now. The best times to come are late nights and weekdays. Get in at the right time and you'll be full and out the door in 40 minutes.That waffle is something special to behold.

Reviews.Author: Jen S.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a "must-vist" when you go to L.A.!  With 550+ reviews, I'm not sure that there's more that I can add.  I gotta say that I didn't find the drink, Eclipse, that great.  I agreed with my friend that it tasted like Tang but the novelty of it was pretty cool but $3.25?  I think I'll pass next time.

Reviews.Author: Jenna D.
Reviews.Content: who thought of this combo? a f*uckin genius, that's who.that wait sucks but the pasadena one isn't as crowded usually...

Reviews.Author: Sovannary S.
Reviews.Content: I feel really stupid writing a review on this. After eating here, there's no damn way I am ever going on a diet.

Reviews.Author: Leslie C.
Reviews.Content: Everyone has to try Roscoe's at least once.  Of course, I ordered the Scoes #1 which is two pieces of fried chicken with 2 waffles.  The fried chicken is so crispy (and a bit spicy) on the outside and so juicy on the inside.  The waffles are the best and the combination of chicken, waffle dipped in maple syrup is sinfully good!  I usually like their gravy with my chicken and waffles too, but I was trying to eat light?  I wasn't even that hungry when I arrived, but I managed to eat my entire plate of food, in addition to trying my friends' chili, fries, and grits.  Warning, the chili looks a bit like dog food--but it is delicious.  I had a bit of food coma afterwards, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: Candice B.
Reviews.Content: What makes this place one star higher than Home of Chicken in Waffles in Oakland is not only that Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is the supposed original place of chicken and waffles but also the CHICKEN... Not skimp but plump juicy chicken with a great seasoned crispy skin. The waffle is good also..

Reviews.Author: Kellis L.
Reviews.Content: I can only visit Roscoes once or twice a year but those one or two times are soooooooooo worth it. I get the chicken smothered in gravy and have a few bites of waffle in between. They should bring you a pillow with this because I eat it and go stright to sleep with happy dreams.

Reviews.Author: Gene A.
Reviews.Content: It's all been said.

Reviews.Author: Daisy N.
Reviews.Content: The name says it all... Chicken and waffles. I LOVE THIS PLACE. quick service, good food, home atmosphere. The parking here can get a bit hectic.
