We found meters outside, I believe they have a valet on the weekends. The last time I came I got the weekday special which consisted of 2 leg pieces and a waffle for under $6. The waffle is thin and crispy. The greens and cornbread are also delicious! Great late night meal!

Reviews.Author: Sassoun H.
Reviews.Content: There are over 1200 reviews for Roscoe's, so I'm not sure what I can say that hasn't already been said both positive or negative but here it goes.  Two friends and I were at a nearby bar and decided we were hungry (code for drunk) for some some really good bad food.  We drove over a few blocks to Roscoe's and pulled up behind a couple of limos.  Kudos Point #1 - Cool valet guy walk up and say to just pull up in front  the first limo and he'll take care of the rest.  SCORE!  We get out of the car and my two friends had already walked to the door man and asked for a table for three.  Kudos Point #2 - The guy was super cool.  Told us to wait right here for a few minutes and he'll get us right in.  There must have been at least 20 people out there but in less than 5 minutes, we were seated inside and ready to go.  Kudos Point #3 - very soon after we sat down a very friendly waitress walked up took our drink order, asked if we were ready and made some $$ saving combo suggestions because all three of us wanted something different than the other.  In less then 5 minutes our food was up. Complete and perfect!Now for the food:  The waffles were hot and fluffy with that sweet, golden butter melting atop it.  The maple syrup on the side is warm and comforting and seeps into the buttered waffles perfectly.  The mac and cheese was hot and creamy and with little burnt ends on top that give it a wonderful texture.  Finally, the chicken. My, oh my, THE CHICKEN.  Hot, crispy, crunchy, and just all around perfect!  The dark meat was juicy and flavorful and the white meat was cooked perfectly but still had a lot of moisture.  And then we have the skin.  Yes, the skin.  The most guilty pleasure of the culinary world.  Seasoned perfectly, crunchy, hot, with a touch of spiciness.  It was perfect.  Of course I woke up this morning feeling like crap because of the 5000 calories I consumed at 1AM, after 5 stiff cocktails and half a pack of cigarettes, but hey, it's Hollywood! You gotta love it.Thank you Roscoe's.  You never disappoint!  I fondly look forward to our next drunken and hungry encounter!

Reviews.Author: Daniel Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah this is some great Soul Food! Respect SCOES!

Reviews.Author: N. B. K.
Reviews.Content: fried chicken... waffles... genius.*bonus - tell them i sent you and watch them stare blankly!!!

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: We came in at about 6:00 on a Tuesday before we were off to see the Red Hot Chili Peppers at the Fonda Theater which is just a block away, and all I can say is MMMMM!!!  We came in and were seated immediately to our surprise.  Drinks were always refilled and our server was so awesome!  He suggested instead of getting two #1's, get one #3 to share and he was so right!  Saved us $4 and the extra waffle would have been way to much food!  By the way, the chicken is super moist and crispy, but I think the waffles are where it's at!  Light, fluffy, and damnit, spread ALL the butter on them.  I mean, you are at roscoes, not the vegan place down the street!

Reviews.Author: alexia p.
Reviews.Content: roscoe's....when bad food happens to good people.how sorry i am the chicken / waffle joke house didn't pan out.  one extra star for the cool cat that sat us.  if you reaaaalllly like food, and haven't ever craved popeye's or KFC (that would be me), don't waste a meal here.  the laughs end when your food arrives;  the word food being a v.loose definition of what was on the plate.

Reviews.Author: Diane L.
Reviews.Content: Awesome! but you have got to try the chicken livers! Now I see why Steve Harvey, Martin Lawrence and Snoop Dog hang out there!

Reviews.Author: Katherine H.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what Kale B. is talking about...Roscoe's is amazing, sober or otherwise!  I went to Roscoe's two days in a row, I loved it so much.  The Hollywood location is really cool, cause they have that bouncer guy at the door with a really deep, rattly voice and really great service.  The first day, I got chicken and waffles, cause obviously, you have to get chicken and waffles.  Perfect fried chicken, basically the best I've had (minus the Southern Cafe in Oakland, which is now closed.) The waffles are really good too, though not as crispy as I'd like.  I also got a side of grits- they were drowned in butter, and thus very good.  The second day I went to Roscoe's in Pasadena.  The one in Pasadena lacks the same kind of charm that the one in Hollywood has- it looks like it used to be a McDonalds.  However, the food is just as good.  This time I got the chicken with greens, cornbread, and mac and cheese. SO GOOD! Mmmm.  Next time I need to try the chicken smothered in gravy and onions, and the sweet potato pie.  I would totally make the 6-8 hour drive from the Bay Area just for Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Brooke M.
Reviews.Content: Ridiculously delicious! The waffles, fried chicken, and mac and cheese hit the spot and are the ultimate comfort foods. I'm glad I live no where near this place because I'd eat here so often I'd gain 300 lbs. I will definitely hit up Roscoe's the next time I venture to LA.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl D.
Reviews.Content: The wait wasn't bad; about 20 min. It was very busy, but service moved pretty well. Have to try the waffle with the chicken at least once, but the waffle is pretty ordinary. Chicken is great with hot sauce and syrup. Large portions. The potato salad was pretty good also. You pay at the counter on the way out.

Reviews.Author: Benito L.
Reviews.Content: It's not bad, but I really don't understand how the reviews are so fantastic for this place. I've certainly had much better fried chicken as well as much better waffles; HOWEVER, I suppose not at the same time...... and there lies the dilemma.

Reviews.Author: C C.
Reviews.Content: So this place is over-yelped.  Big fricking deal-- I like it!  So I won't re-hash what others have said, but will reiterate that the delicious combo of salty and crispy fried chicken, sweetness of maple syrup, and soft sponge of waffle beneath soaking in all the butter and maple syrup goodness is my weakness and one of the reasons I make it a point to come here whenever the opportunity presents itself.  We've even gotten it to go on our way up to the Universal Amphitheater for a concert and ate it in the parking lot - it was even good luke warm!  (Note: If you're ever in San Diego though, Hash House does a cracked out version of Roscoe's with a waffle with bacon baked right in and their sage fried chicken is extra crispy).Whenever I've gone the service is efficient and friendly.  Atmosphere, OK so its a lil klassy with a k and yea its small but for homestyle food and low prices, what else do you expect?  Minus one star for the crazy wait at all hours of the day, but other than that everything's on point.  Huge props for the time we came here and saw Mike Tyson.  The host even chit-chatted with us about him, how Mike was so quiet now not as boisterous as he was before he went to prison, and we sent him a drink and was nice enough to give us a lil cheers in return.  You never know who you'll see!  If you're not from the area, definitely put it on your list of things to try since its an institution you've got to try at least once.

Reviews.Author: Mai L.
Reviews.Content: i'm curious if anyone else has ever notice  us "other folks" get seated to the left of the resturant?avoid the lines go on a monday or tuesay night.

Reviews.Author: Andrew E.
Reviews.Content: A waffle, buttered, with fried chicken on top, then drenched in maple syrup.  Genius. I really couldn't believe how good this was the first time I had it.  But you know what I REALLY couldn't believe?  That there used to be a Roscoe's in Oakland, during my formative years... and I didn't know about it.  I don't know who to blame for that -- my parents, my friends, myself.... but I do know this: I have years of chicken-and-waffleless living to make up for. From now on,  I will make a  point to visit Roscoe's at least once every time I'm in L.A.

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: One night, you will go to Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles with a group of your friends. You will sit next to a 94 pound French girl who is studying for her PhD in Existentialism. She will eat twice the amount of chicken, waffles, biscuits and eggs that you do. You will try to keep up with her, but you can't. You will be embarrassed and shamed, as you should be. Later that night, when you are vomiting off the rooftop of a 50-story downtown Los Angeles housing facility, your friends, who are floating lazily about in a freshly heated jacuzzi drinking Mccallan 18 year old single malt straight from the bottle, will laugh at you. But, the last laugh is on them. Because Roscoe's tastes just as good coming up as it does going down.

Reviews.Author: Kat K.
Reviews.Content: The chicken here has a thin, crispy layer of skin that you can't find at places like KFC, Church's, or Popeye's. Although the wait was pretty long (about 30-40 minutes), it was worth it. My friends and I ate the chicken wings down to the bone and left there fully satisfied. The place could be a bit cleaner, especially the restroom. Service was friendly.

Reviews.Author: Rachel A.
Reviews.Content: Whenever people find out about my secret (or not-so) love for fried chicken, they immediately assume I must adore Roscoe's. Since I love breakfast food too, I also assumed I'd love Roscoe's. That is, until I went there. Sadly, the one star I'm giving it here is for ambiance alone.I do love fried chicken--but only GOOD fried chicken. The chicken at Roscoe's is dry, the fried batter is too hard and thick, and the gravy on top only adds brown glue to the mess.  Just because you love chocolate doesn't mean you love disgusting dime-store waxy chocolate; just because I love delicious crunchy juicy heart-stopping fried chicken doesn't mean I like Roscoe's' version.  Oh, and the waffles--eh, they're fine, but you could do better at home with some Bisquick and a waffle iron. Nothing to write home about.The most enjoyable part is the atmosphere. No Hollywood scenesters in expensive tee shirts, no girls with little dogs...just mostly people who look like they stop in for lunch with their crew on a regular basis. It's loud and downmarket and fun. Oh, just to note: I did try Roscoe's twice, thinking maybe my first disappointment was a fluke. Nope, just as mediocre the second time. Maybe I should have gotten wasted first--everything tastes good then!

Reviews.Author: Melinda C.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and waffle is one of the strangest food pairings, yet it works deliciously at Roscoe's ... so good.

Reviews.Author: Pamela s.
Reviews.Content: parking is a bitch for this place cuz you're near the hustle and bustle of the madness that is hollywood. but once you get that first bit in your mouth, it's all worth it. this was my first time at this location, i usually go to the one on pico, but i think they're pretty much the same. i tried the greens for the first time, and they were delish! i usually go for the corn bread or mac n cheese, both of which may make you o, not gonna say i didn't warn you.anyways, my friends and i have come up with the conclusion that their waffles are made with one of the following or a combo: crack, love, and/or magic. make your choice, but beware the consequences. you'll want to come back for the deliciousness more often than not.

Reviews.Author: Jan D.
Reviews.Content: Better than average but not worth the hype. Ive lived in Harlem before and have had better from hole in the wall places. It was possibly an off day, a restaurant has them every now and again. The chicken tasted like it sat around for a few hours, like as in the bins from KFC. The waffles however were simply delish, crispy on the outside fluffy on the inside, I'd assume the breakfast is the bomb but havent made it there in the AM. Going back to my stinginess of appropriate portions, 10 bucks for a piece of chicken and a waffle, to say it metaphorically I want DD-Cups not a B-Cup breast. I'm a hungry guy, I need my meat. Wont be going back any time soon but I'm sure there's plenty of tourists and celebrity wannabes who will still pack the place. I hear there are other locations which are better than the Hollywood location, I'll give those a try.

Reviews.Author: Chris N.
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful big ass piece of juicy chicken breast with louisiana hot sauce, and of course the waffles. Yum a Licious!

Reviews.Author: Brian D.
Reviews.Content: it lives up to the hype.and the wait to sit, is worth the wait...that first bite of the chicken is just, amazing.

Reviews.Author: Sh A.
Reviews.Content: i wasn't sure about chicken with my waffles... but i have enjoyed them separately before so i figured why not?i ordered #2, it was actually pretty decent.  i thought the water was bad.  i have been here in ca for 6 months but i still yearn for new york water.  i ordered eclipse, it was very tasty.i would've given 3 stars but i took out a star because when i asked the host if he could take our picture, he responded with "i'm too busy."  fail!

Reviews.Author: aemie c.
Reviews.Content: Who knew fried chicken with a waffles could be so good? I've been there twice and both times it's been really good. Chicken is cooked to perfection and the waffles are good. Now let me tell you about the macaroni & cheese.. it is the tastiest and cheesiest and butteriest mac & cheese I've ever had!! My one complaint is paying $4 for a small teacup size of mac & cheese. Whatever, I would totally order it again :P

Reviews.Author: Patrick T.
Reviews.Content: sadlyi do not like this place. the chicken was not seasoned well. and there was a difference in moisture content between my chicken and my friends chicken. mine was dry like the desert. i also used a lot of hot sauce to ameliorate the lack of flavor.the waffles were nothing special and almost reminded me of leggo my eggo waffles. i personally like Vans. and the entire time i was eating the chicken I was craving mashed potatoes!!!i also accidentally ordered the wrong plate for my friend which they brought out and graciously took back. there is also a guy who stands outside and brings you all the way in to a table, from which we decided to move and then he came in later and gave me the evil eye. the service was friendly.at the end of the meal i felt rather gross like post in n out gross. its not really healthy and maybe you can call it "grub" good for after the club rub a dub

Reviews.Author: Adrianna L.
Reviews.Content: It's like the thing to do here...1528 reviews. Pictures of Chicken and Waffles?WHY will this review even matter? I'll tell you why, because the info on this place is wrong...cause FYI they are open until 4am on SATURDAY NIGHT!! On my way home from Knotts Scary Farm we had the sudden urge for food. Yeah, yeah, that's a little vague and we were honestly looking for tacos like any other Spanish blooded American. My friend screams out...GOWER! GET OFF ON GOWER!! after pissing off a few LA drivers at 2am, I exited the 101 freeway.The only other words I heard out of her mouth was Roscoes. Park. Now. I did, when women are unbearably hungry I never question them, I just agree.We stood in line for about 20 minutes, this place is the spot to be apparently. I even witnessed a man in a robe in Gucci slippers! I was impressed. Even more impressed that he was let in wearing that attire. I had the basic bird and waffle. It satisfied my need to eat chicken with a waffle, cause lets face it under any other circumstance we as humans would not put these two on the same plate. But THEY did, and it was amazing. We also had the mac and cheese on the side. She put pepper, I like that about her. The moral of this review is, they are open until 4AM ON SATURDAY NIGHT. And of course I'll be back, in my silk robe. Told you this review would make a difference. You're welcome.Try it. Love it Yelp it...

Reviews.Author: Lena N.
Reviews.Content: This place really doesn't need another review, it's just GOOD! But I guess I wanted to mention that I saw Kelly Rowland from Destiny's Child when I went here. She got something dressed in gravy. You go girl!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie P.
Reviews.Content: I do love chicken and waffles. I found my chicken to be a little too well done. and when the bill came I was paying $40 but they accidentally charged me $400 - i was furious! The charge didn't come off my card for a few days - that's just plain silly. But the food was ok... just next time don't forget about my chicken and leave it in the fryer too long.  I do love chicken and waffles such a good combination!

Reviews.Author: Bobby L.
Reviews.Content: A buddy of mine gave up red meat till easter which limit our selection for the night. I asked what he can eat and he said supposedly fish that day but he's up for chicken. Coincidentally my room mate was cooking up fried chicken as well. What the hell, let's do Roscoe's! I haven't been to one in over 10 years (pasadena), and I didn't know he never been so it was perfect. Needless to say Hollywood has a infectious disease on all, even on Roscoe's. I can understand the scarce parking need for a valet, but come on dude, $6.50 to valet at Roscoe's??!! We found street parking 4 blocks away.I love the fact we were greeted by some guy approaching us with a gangsta walk only to say, "Hi, welcome to Roscoe's, how are you this evening, how many are in your party?" It just added a nice touch to the place. Waffle was great. Hot and somewhat sweet. Chicken tasted a little bland but nothing Louisiana Hot Sauce wouldn't cure. Stick with the dark meat as the breast starts to get a little dry as you try and claw your way in with grease-covered fingers.Our waiter was always attentive and there. Not your usual formal waiter way but more like eating at your homie's place as he opens his doors to you.The best part is how a bouncer (security guard) ropes off the entrance with a regular rope and make people stand in line for a table as if waiting to get in a club...only in Hollywood.If you can get past all these "influences" it is what it is. Chicken and waffle. Tasty and greasy. You know you are indulging so get over the need to be pampered and enjoy the food. I might have gave it a 4 but it just seem like it was trying too hard.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn S.
Reviews.Content: Had the stubby and the Scoes, 3 pcs of chicken, biscuit, 2 waffles, 2 eggs, grits, and gravy total. Devoured everything on our plates in about 30 mins flat. Didn't even talk to eachother.  It was that good.  I'm still thinking about it. **go early, there will be a crowd outside.

Reviews.Author: Tanisha B.
Reviews.Content: Since I was in LA a week ago, I knew I wanted to come here and see if it was really worth the hype. I'd never had the chicken/waffle combo and had to try it. I ordered the Country Boy (3 wings and a waffle). I liked that the waffles had cinnamon in them, I'd never thought of doing that at home, but it gave the waffles a little pizazz. The chicken was good. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I can't say I was completely blown away, but this could be a regular for me when I'm in the area and I love their late hours.   Also, I like that they realize their parking situation sucks and will give you change for the meters.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer W.
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of stories from friends about Roscoe's and they all LOVED it! The first thing I thought of when my friends told me about Roscoe's was "EW! that sounds disgusting! why would anybody eat chicken AND waffles together?! Mixing something sweet with something salty?!?" Oh Boy, was i wrong! This place is DELICIOUS! after a few bites I wanted more!!!The portions are HUGE! So I shared it with my friend.  We got the #1 Scoe's 1/4 Chix prepared Southern style, with 2 waffles, our own private mix - $10.20.  The fried chicken wasn't oily so that was a plus.  Its not like KFC's dripping oil and sloppy. The meat was tender and juicy and dipping it into the gravy sauce and biting the waffle together was DELICIOUS!  I thought the breast meat would be dry. Nope, the meat was tender and juicy!! We got some of their slides - fries, mash potato, biscuit, and mac and cheese.  My friend and I couldn't even finish our meal so we had to take it to go.  The prices are good and the portions are big, so sharing is well worth it!I also got the Sun Rise drink ~ $3.25Finding parking in that area is HARD! Make sure you don't park in some plaza because they will tow! We were about to park at some shady looking plaza and walk over to Roscoe's but then we saw some security looking guy standing and staring at us in front of some Pay Day/ Insurance company.  We knew it was a big NO No to park there because we have seen tow trucks driving by.  We decided to move our car to the street which was okay because it was only a minute walk to Roscoe's.  When we got to Roscoe's, there wasn't a line to get in so it was pretty empty when we got there.  A security came out and told us to wait for our whole party to get there and we couldn't even stand inside to get away from the cold. Then he got nice and let us stay in and got a waiter to get us seated.  The service was okay, it wasn't that great.  Our server kept forgetting to refill our drinks and forgot to bring out some of our food.The bathroom is clean. THAT'S A PLUS!!Overall, good food and its a MUST TRY whenever you are in the LA area.

Reviews.Author: Harsh K.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles together at last, despite the long wait this is the best location to go to because they also serve beer and wine.  For your money you can't beat a scoe's special with a smothered biscuit on the side ( that way you can get the gravy an onions, and also go old school butter, syrup chicken, waffle.   Oh and if the booze isn't your thing go for a sunrise, the mix of lemonade and oj cuts the grease nicely.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about this place. I thought FOR SURE that it couldn't possibly taste food. Thinking about sweet syrup that goes on pancakes on chicken disturbed me. Then I actually tried it and totally had a change in heart. DEEEEE-licious! I love their grits and pecan pie too!

Reviews.Author: Maria A.
Reviews.Content: you want pure awesomenessss? this is the freakin place. i will drive here anyday anytime to fulfill my Roscoe's cravings. this location is the first one that opened, i heard. and the one where all the celebrities supposedly go. but i havent seen any. maybe cuz im too busy to look up from my yummy plate of awesomeness! this location and long beach are my favorites. long beach location is a little bigger and nicer looking but that doesnt really matter to me when it comes to Roscoe's. JEANNE JONES OMELETTE!! gooey yummy cheese & juicy ass chicken packed in an omelette with a waffle on the side. oh yeaaaaa. damn, my  mouth is watering just thinkin about it. the hell you still doin? you must try it. go now go. wait, take me with you, pls :)

Reviews.Author: Pheel W.
Reviews.Content: The worst breakfast I have ever had. I ordered the chicken liver omelet and it was dry as hell, which also means the liver was not fresh at all.  It made me feel like i was eating a liver from a very sick chicken...My bf ordered "house special" sausage and eggs and the sausage was dry and had no taste as well (ya, we r talking about house special here).  On top of that, the portion was poorly small and it cost $8 for that one dish... Their fried chicken was plain.  One chicken drum stick cost $3.1.  I never finished a meal with anger and i never felt like i would have rather go to some fast food for breakfast with much better fried chicken and food.  The food at Roscoe's was awfully prepared and the price was unreasonable.

Reviews.Author: Ethan K.
Reviews.Content: what more is there to be said about roscoe's?  I can't even get myself to try any dish other than #13: the Carol C. Special....one succulent breast and one delicious waffle.  The description on the menu couldnt be any more accurate.  My mother, who doesnt really give a crap about waffles or down home country cookin'....raving about the waffle completely on her own on at least two occasions following the meal. my friend swears by the Immoral Omelette (the baby chicken egg wrapped around its own mother) though i'm sure you'll have to find it by some other name on the menu.  The refreshing Sunrise beverage is also rather baller.and they're open til 3 am on the weekends, so if you're in or near hollywood late on a friday or saturday night, there's really no other choice.

Reviews.Author: calder g.
Reviews.Content: You haven't lived life until you've eaten chicken and waffles at the same time.  Add in some mac n' cheese/mashed potatoes/cornbread and all your troubles will melt away.  I feel sorry for vegans every time I come here.

Reviews.Author: iddells E.
Reviews.Content: As my cousin and I were brainstorming which restaurant we should eat at, a light bulb turned on when she suggested Roscoe's.  I wanted something good, something unique to California and Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles was perfect!   Yes, it's a chain, but it's a chain only in California and I have no problems with that!   I am a chicken and waffles fan and have heard great stuff about Roscoe's.  I ordered the Carol C. special, which had 2 waffles and half a chicken.  First of all, we received our orders in no time.  The nice waiter also separated the 2 waffles since he knew we were sharing.  The chicken was crispy and the batter used was amazing!    Because the chicken was really good, I didn't want it to go to waste and packed it in my backpack to take back home to Chicago.  It survived the 6 hour commute and ended up being my lunch!   2-day old Roscoe's chicken was not that bad!

Reviews.Author: Smitcha B.
Reviews.Content: What a crazy mix. Waffles and fried chicken. I never thought they would go together, but to me they do. I always get the Carol C. Special which is one fried chicken breast and one waffle. That's the perfect combo I need from Roscoe's. I think that when visit Roscoe's, you also have to order some side dishes. Some of my personal selections include: the smothered potatoes w/ gravy and the candy yams. You can never go wrong with this place. I'm not saying I'm here every week but from time to time, I definitely get a craving for this place. Parking at this location can be a pain sometimes because you have to find street parking and the meter nazis will ticket you right when your meter runs out of money. So be aware about how long you've been parking and how much time you have left in the meter!!!

Reviews.Author: Dwayne X.
Reviews.Content: This is the worst service resturant ever.  I arrived at 2:15 am with a party of 20.  It was my sister and brothers birthday.  I was told it would take 30 mins.  I wanted 1 1/2 hours.  To be told that a party of 14 that came after me would be seated before my party because they decided to split up into 7 first.  I was upset.  Then after an additional 15 mins. They decided to seat 12 of our guest on one side of the resturant and the other 8 on the other side (two separate rooms.  Then the seating host was rude.  So most of us decided to go to Denny's across the street.  But the ones that remained text and said 15 mins after eating their stomachs were hurting. The service was bad, most orders were wrong and returned. Crazy night.  Never again. Bad choice.  With a split party our after party was ruined.  Never again. Most people that say this is great food, do not know any better.

Reviews.Author: Cameron C.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast places aren't generally worth the wait in my opinion. If the wait to be seated is over 20 minutes, I'd be quick to consider a second option. This place is one of the few that gets a pass. The #13 Carol C. special is the pinnacle of southern morning satisfaction. Throw in a biscuit & gravy and you can't lose. This place is inexpensive as well. Parking can be a hassle at this location and it can get noisy depending on the time of day. #HangoverHeaven

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! The food here is great ! My favorite is the scoes' #1 which is a 1/4 of a chicken with two waffles. The candy yams and mac n cheese are so so delicious. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu. I prefer this location cuz its the closer one to me but parking is tough. They only have street parking or you can pay at a nearby lot. Waiting to be seated can be long but its worth it. Do yourself a favor and stop in.

Reviews.Author: Mark J.
Reviews.Content: Damn this place does chicken right!!! Everytime I head down to southern california this is a must stop for me and my buddies. Southern style fried chicken with mac and cheese, cornbread, gravy. Wow I am getting hungry just thinking about it.  Wait time is usually long during busy hours but it is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Nicole N.
Reviews.Content: I can officially say that I have eaten here but won't be going out of my way to eat here again. Service was good it just wasn't as good as I had hoped, I have had so much better at other chicken & waffle places... won't be returning.

Reviews.Author: Gail C.
Reviews.Content: I Like Roscoe's and have been coming for years. Except lately it hasn't been that good. The chicken is not cooked throughly and sometimes it's too salty. The kitchen staff seems to be so busy and overwhelmed that they are not paying attention to what is coming out of the kitchen. The servers are polite and seem to be doing the best that they can. Usually I do take-out and it's quick but as I say there's just not a lot of attention to detail anymore.

Reviews.Author: shar t.
Reviews.Content: omg, chicken & waffles w/ gravy = heaven! it's sooo good..you won't even know until you try it... =) oh mah gahhh..it is to diiie for hahah. =P everytime i come to LA..i always have to stop by this place before i head back home. i think i came here on a sunday afternoon and the wait was pretty long. i guess it was because of the large amount of people i came in with but i must say...it's really worth the wait! but really though..try it. it's good. yummy food =)

Reviews.Author: Kale B.
Reviews.Content: Rosco's is far from fine dining. In fact I don't think I could ever under any circumstances recommend this place to anyone... while I was sober anyway. But that's the problem. As soon as I'm drunk Rosco's sounds like ambrosia. Poorly cooked chicken smothered in fatty gravy with a side of cheap waffles and fake maple syrup. What's even better is I can get one last beer in before the night is over... This place is heaven when intoxicated, but hell when you're sober. Every time I eat here sober I feel like JCVD sucker punched me in the gut. But when I'm drunk all I can remember is that sweet sweet gravy.  I only go to Rosco's with a Blood Alcohol Content of  .1 or more.

Reviews.Author: Jacek W.
Reviews.Content: It's Roscoe's.  It's a classic.  Great chicken.  Delicious waffles.  Scrumptious gravy.  The ultimate comfort food.  Going here makes you feel like you just won at life.

Reviews.Author: Jessica F.
Reviews.Content: went here recently with the boyfriend, I was pretty excited for the main fact he's half black and you know he can get his soul food on ( so i thought ) AND because I recently started eating chicken again ( I was vegetarian for over 2 years, FML ) so we go in, coool I see someone annoying I know, I kept walking and seated myself. We sat at the table for over 30 mins. Talk about horrible customer service and my boyfriend would not let me say anything so we sat there like idiots while the over weight hispanic waitress' stood by the kitchen. on to the food, it was okay, I experienced better. Perhaps just not MY day to go into this place. WORD OF ADVICE, if you get the fat blonde young waitress thats wears 4much blush acting like she's sponsered by MAC don't ask for a refill, not only will she roll her eyes and huff and puff but she will bring it 20 mins later. .. she pretty much got the wrapper of the wet naps they give you as a tip, your welcome.

Reviews.Author: Josef A.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's food is always good. I deviated for the first time and instead of getting the common #1 (chic and waffles), I got the Jenny Jones (cheese and chic omelette). The fine that always ruins the experience though is when i  comes time to pay. I always forget their rules and when you go with a group of ppl its really inconvenient.

Reviews.Author: Victor B.
Reviews.Content: Does this establishment really need another 5 stars?  I'm all about that combo number 22!  Two pieces of chicken, some savory greens, the king of mac n cheese, and rounding it out with a big o' cornbread slapped with buttermilk buttery goodness.   Service is great!  Make friends with your server, they are good people.  Oh and make sure your entire party is there or else you will be waiting in the cold/heat.  Taking left over chicken to go is never a wrong answer. Do your digestive system a favor and take a visit.

Reviews.Author: Jordan M.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre chicken at its best.. I always get the country boy, but i dont put the waffles and chicken in my mouth at the same time, I swear.. At first I didn't think this was an authentic Roscoe's until I saw brother man selling his own personal musk outside *sigh of relief* BRING CASH, or else you will have to put the entire bill on your credit card and that will just fuck up your whole day.. unless you're the kind of person that likes to go places by their lonesome, i'm not judging.. oh yea, and don't be a thirst bucket and drink your beverage because homegirl is not gonna bring you a refill. even if you are so parched to the point where your spit looks like mounds of clay she will still make you pay for another one. That's their policy, screw whatever you are going through...

Reviews.Author: Evans B.
Reviews.Content: Only consistent southern breakfast place in LA. Great for a Sunday meal. I love the sweet potatoes and greens. They get it right. Fried chicken is a delight. If you are a sweet tea drinking beware they make it with something that tastes like passion fruit and honey.

Reviews.Author: HR Muffinstuff M.
Reviews.Content: Lived  up to it's reputation. Waffles and chicken were hot and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Angelo F.
Reviews.Content: Over 10 years ago I would have given it a 5 star ratings.  Quality has dropped since then... Last Time I had take Outs... the chicken is as bland as could be and the waffleswas as soggy as could be.

Reviews.Author: Peter L.
Reviews.Content: This place is the original.  The inside is pretty small with many pictures and autographs of celebrities.  Waiters and hosts are friendly.  I love the fried chicken.  The waffles goes perfectly well with the chicken.  Make sure you get tons of butter and maple syrup.  I don't care about my cholesterol, just give me that FRIED CHICKEN AND MY WAFFLES.

Reviews.Author: Alexander M.
Reviews.Content: Yet another stop on my list of must-try LA eateries and perhaps the only one that wasn't disappointing. Roscoe's is amazing! I know, I know - I was probably the last Angeleno who hadn't been here, and I'm sure a lot of people find it gimmicky and/or overrated. But I was thrilled. Somehow I missed out on all those freshman year Roscoe's trips - when it was as much a USC staple as El Cholo. So friend and I finally made it out to the Hollywood location (I wanted to go to the original, but Hollywood was closer and, as you'll soon learn, every bit as authentic). First of all, the scene outside of the unassuming Gower storefront is like no other - as if a chunk of Crenshaw had been transplanted a couple miles north. All the black regulars were not only super stylish, they all knew each other! It felt like a small town, down home country watering hole. There was a wait to be seated but believe me: the people watching outside on the sidewalk is worth it. Once we got in, we were placed at a table up on a little elevated area in the front room (the room by the kitchen is bigger but super loud). The menus are long and somewhat indecipherable... you'd think a restaurant that is famous for one, classic dish would feature "Chicken and waffles" in big bold letters, screaming out at you from the menu. But you have to decide how much you want (I guarantee your eyes are bigger than your stomach) and what piece of the chicken you prefer. But anyway, the wait staff are SUPER FRIENDLY so they'll help you figure it out. Our waitress, who was gorgeous and had the most beautiful voice, brought us out refills of our drinks when we had barely begun the first and said "Oh I'm sorry - I thought you'd want more!" Very sweet and attentive. Beware: their sweet tea is suuuuper sweet 'n southern, and is hard to stop. The food came out quickly and still hot and we wasted no time digging in. To tell the truth, there is nothing really unique about the Belgian-style waffles or the fried chicken, but it is their studied combination that is genius. The best part is the assembly of each bite - pulling off a piece of hot chicken, squirting it with Louisiana hot sauce, stabbing a chunk of buttered waffle, and dunking the whole thing in maple syrup. HEAVENLY. The cornbread we got was hot, crumbly and delicious too. Afterward you are stuffed with a lethargic, carbo-loaded bliss. Oh and good prices for everything. Not the healthiest dinner but WELL WORTH IT.

Reviews.Author: Willie B.
Reviews.Content: Yeh 5 stars. My family and i drove across three states and over 800 miles to eat Roscoes, and was well worth the drive. We went on a wednesday and glad we did. The coolest parking lot guy i ever met said weekends are super busy. We got  lucky when we pulled into the twenty space parking lot ,someone was leaving so we got a spot. When we got out of the car we were greeted by the coolest guy ever. He gave us all the inside scoopes on what to order.   We walked up and were seated right away no wait. So we sat down and ordered what the parking guy tolds us too. Basically we sampled a little bit of everything. But the onion,cheesey scrambled eggs were awesome. The fried chicken n waffles were to die for. I would drive even farther to eat at Roscoes.         I ate at alot of food places on my recent road trip and Roscoes was by far the friendliest place we ate. From the parking guy to the hostess and waitress to the security guy all treated us the niciest. I thought for a minute i was Snoop dog. I will go back next time and everytime i goto Los Angles again.Thanks Roscoes for a great trip and great food.

Reviews.Author: Sandie L.
Reviews.Content: where can you go where you are greeted with velvet rope and "bouncers" on the streetway entrance... ROSCOES!"bouncer": how many?me: thinking to myself 'do i need to show my ID?"Inside feels like a dark lounge and just like the greeting, the customers inside were just as entertaining.... what will their food entertain me with...????WAFFLES!  they are the best.  the whipped butter is amazing... i'm still wondering what extra ingredient is added that gives it the flavor.  Fried chicken was average.  Be prepared, the food portions are HUGE!

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: #19 - breast of chicken, white rice smothered in gravy and a side of sweet yams makes my day!

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: Ah, I did find Hollywood street vendor hotdogs on Yelp.

Reviews.Author: Catherine C.
Reviews.Content: There's just something horribly wrong and f*cked up about a vegetarian writing a review of Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles.  But I'm going to anyway.FOOD: Actually, there are a number of vegetarian selections, even if they are all side dishes.  The cornbread here is as good as I've had in the deep and dirty South.  The mac n' cheese is very yummy and flavorful, albeit a bit on a drier side - just don't expect huge drippings of creamy sauce from your fork.  Ah yes so by this time the butter is coagulating in my arteries, but I eat on.  And while I couldn't eat the chicken, I did have Roscoe's famous waffles, which, unlike the ones at the Pasadena location that I had tried last time, were actually very good and everything that a waffle should be - soft and fluffy with just a hint of cinnamon.  The red beans and rice are good as well, surprisingly vegetarian, but frankly I think I could make them at home for better.  Will pass on that one next time. Wish they had a veg version for collard greens.  But all in all, YES, it IS possible for a vegetarian to be satiated in the House of Chicken and Waffles!AMBIENCE: We waited 45 minutes to be seated. Being a vegetarian, that would have made me leave immediately AND demand my valet money back if it weren't for that fact that my out-of-town guest really wanted to go there. However, once we were seated I liked the restaurant quite a bit - a homey feel, well-packed but not cramped (hence the long-ass wait that everyone seemed to be willing to put up with) and still quiet enough to have table conversation between stuffing our faces with heart-attack inducing joys.  Our server was nice, and very knowledgable of which foods were and weren't vegetarian (i.e. she warned me that the mashed potatoes and collard greens weren't veggie... darn!).  On top of that, she looked like a pleasant-looking, matronly Latina version of Queen Latifah.  Definitely added to the home-style cookin' ambience.PRICES: Pretty good for the amount of food they pile on.  Brunch/Lunch for the 4 of us was about $67, but all of us had enough leftovers for at least two more meals .  Not a bad value for better than decent food, even for the vegheads.PARKING: Ok this is worth taking a star off for.  There's valet service for $6.50, which, although I hate paying for parking more than I actually hate looking for parking... it's worth it for this neck of the woods.  If you live close enough to walk to Roscoe's, all the more power to you.I can see why the original House of Chicken and Waffles has been around for as long as it has... now to try to get them to add perhaps a vegan chicken option...

Reviews.Author: Dee W.
Reviews.Content: I really like Roscoe's I think that the service is nice and the food is pretty good. Not as good as it is in my house but then again it never will be! For the uninitiated, Roscoe's has southern comfort food done fairly well. I think that some items lack seasoning (mac n cheese-I'm a talkin' about you!) and find some things too bland for my tastes. I disagree with other reviewers who say the same thing can be found at IHOP. Yes I hop has chicken and waffles but where do you think they got the idea? If I wanted to dine on spongy waffles and over fried chicken strips, I would go to IHOP. For succulent pieces of fried goodness, I'll take Roscoe's thank you very much. I always get the Carol B. Special and a Sunset to drink. I also think that the quality of service and food depends on the location. I've never had bad service in the late afternoon at this or the Pico location.  Happy Eating!

Reviews.Author: keith f.
Reviews.Content: Made a recent return after not coming by for a long time (I don't live nearby). First of all, I'm not a big fan of fried chicken (I'm chickenskinaphobic), but my daughter and her friend were totally bowled over by the 1/4 white that they each ordered. "I'm so full ... AND I CAN'T STOP!" was their reaction.I'm a fan of the Jeanne Jones omelet plus chili and waffle. Very cheesy, big chunks of white chicken. The chili overlay has a sort of grainy texture that may not live up to the expectations of some chili affectionados, but I'm good with it.As to the waffles, NICE! I'm not a fan of crunchy waffles, so if that's your thing, you'll be disappointed (as apparently several reviewers here were). Soft, nice, lots of butter and more than lots of syrup. WAY TO MUCH food for $11 and change, but no complaints from me.It's a busy place, so your best bet is to come during off-hours (before noon, before 5pm). Street parking is difficult and waiting for a seat during normal hours can be lengthy and there's really no good place to wait there, so that's why I'm holding back a star. Service is pretty quick. Tables and chairs are kind of rickety, but I guess that's part of the charm.

Reviews.Author: Jeff F.
Reviews.Content: Have no idea what the people who say they don't like this chicken are talking about.  This is some damn fine bird!  Up there with Strouds in KC.  Had the 1/4 Bird/2 waffle combo, gravy on side.  Sweet waffles and syrup a great compliment to crispy, salty chicken.  Louisiana hot sauce on it as well..  Gravy was a bit bland, tasted more like beef broth than a good gravy made with a roux.  Couple next to me were ooohing and aahhing with every bite of their meal....pretty funny.  Stick to what made them famous...chicken and waffles. Service and hospitality was great!  Food came out piping hot in like 10 mins.  For $20 including tip, walked away happy and stuffed!

Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: It was late at night and my friend decided to take me to Roscoe's.  I have heard so many great things about this place and I had high expectations.  The place looks like a hole in the wall and apparently, this was the original Roscoe's.  They were pretty busy at 1am but we were seated quickly and the service was good.  I got the Herb's special which was a half a chicken with 2 waffles.  I've never had waffles with fried chicken but now I am a fan!  The waffles were really soft and thin and delicious.  I don't think you can really go wrong with fried chicken unless it's too dry but this place hit the spot.  The gravy and fries were also really good.  The prices aren't cheap and I ended up spending about $18 but it was worth the experience.  I would definitely check this place out again but for that price, I would rather get all you can eat korean bbq at one of the many places in LA.

Reviews.Author: Dee C.
Reviews.Content: Food was delicious! Must go back. It was worth the wait... Please bring franchise to GA.

Reviews.Author: James W.
Reviews.Content: This place is iconic... and the foods good too.you must try the mac and cheese if you even remotely like mac and cheese. Cant beat the salty sweet combo of chicken and waffles. The chicken is great and the waffles are nice and fluffy!

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: Everyone exaggerates how great this place is. However, I gotta say that their chicken is finger lickin' good! The waffles aren't that special. I've also heard many people say they have the BEST mac and cheese. Once again, I don't think so....and please don't charge me over $4 for a scoop of mac that doesn't even look appetizing. It's actually just mac cuz I can't seem to taste or see the cheese. My drink of choice here is the Sunset (or is it the Sunrise?). It's the one with fruit punch and lemonade. It's gonna cost you 3 bucks and a quarter with no refills so sip sparingly. They're lucky their chicken's good or I would've rated it 2 stars.

Reviews.Author: Jose S.
Reviews.Content: In the movie Tupac Resurrection, 2PAC tells the interviewer that his 1st meal out of jail is Roscoes. God rest his soul and thank God for the grease fried chicken and buttery waffles that Roscoes delivers to its guest. Every single time I go to LA, Roscoes is a must eat joint even though it has the most unhealthy ingredients in it.

Reviews.Author: Katie P.
Reviews.Content: Suprising, but I thought it would be a bigger piece of chicken. My boyfriend and I both got #18 with a thigh, which is just a waffle and a thigh. The waffle was delicious, and their sweet tea is amazing. Next time I'm definitely going to get 2 thighs.

Reviews.Author: Miriam H.
Reviews.Content: Best fried chicken EVER. I could eat this EVERY DAY *AND* the service here is AMAZING!!! LOVE this place.

Reviews.Author: Jerry K.
Reviews.Content: Always look for the special before ordering! Always a great deal. Lives up to the name!

Reviews.Author: Eyndiyah H.
Reviews.Content: Carol C all day long!! And don't forget a extra syrup!!!!!! Talk about a workout destroyer!!

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: The truth.  When I lived in La-la land, the first place I took visitors was Roscoe's--I agree that if you have a large group, hit the Pico location as it's about 5x larger than the Sunset spot...but the point is, JUST GO, and go NOW.

Reviews.Author: Beverly G.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the finer Roscoe's that I have visited. The bathroom was newly remodeled (perhaps) and was very clean. The establishment itself is very well maintained and actually looks like it was a converted steakhouse or something. I could eat a lot, but I didn't feel like ordering my whole calorie intake for the day, so I got  a Carole Special I believe : 1 fried chicken breast, and 1 waffle. But, I also got a side of cornbread and mac n cheese which were both really good! Overall, my breakfast was about $15.

Reviews.Author: Sara J.
Reviews.Content: O sweet and succulent chicken, you are my late night answer to sleepless study sessions bundled with my Netter book and my cat.  The chicken here is really juicy and my fav waffles are the buckwheat waffles.  Its the same stuff that soba noodles are made of, but can have a "too healthy" taste for those that don't like wheaty foods.  Parking is sometimes obscure, don't park in that open plaza at night or "they gonna tow yo ass".

Reviews.Author: Pia S.
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been here in over a year and I had no idea that they expanded the restaurant over to the other side! More room, less wait time! It was dead and there was no line when we got there. The young lady who served us was super nice. The chicken was still as good as I remembered it. I guess they stay open until 4am on the weekends now?? Awesome.

Reviews.Author: Ann V.
Reviews.Content: easily the best branch...-good parking-crazy fast service-clean bathrooms-REALLY nice waitresses-bump into rihanna

Reviews.Author: Lucy M.
Reviews.Content: My review is based on take out ... The atmosphere is good I loved the painting mural on the wall its basically a painting of the community black white Indian Asian gays etc  I like how they incorporated everyone in it...  Staff and host were nice and helpful  take out didn't take that long over all it was good food was nothing special, I was expecting OMG since I always see a lot of people outside everytime I pass by.. I ordered the chicken legs waffles and fries ...I could have made the exact same thing at home it like having an average home cooked meal ...fries were tasteless and lumpy...the chicken was well cooked but seasoning was off ...waffles were average waffles nothing big the store bought ones taste better :/ sorry2 waffles 4 chicken legs and side of fries came out to be $23

Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: If you love soul food.....Get your A** into this spot.  I discovered it about 10 yrs ago when I was in college and I have been a loyal customer every  single time I go to LA.  Who was this genius that came up with the chicken and waffle combination and can I marry you?  I get the same thing every time because no need to mess with perfection.  Here's the winning combination if you would like to follow  my lead, and you should; Fried chicken breast with the notorious waffle, mac and cheese (because something is wrong with you if you don't order this) and greens.  That's all folks, don't need anything else.  The one thing I am not a fan of is the cornbread.  But who needs that when you have the rest.

Reviews.Author: timothy h.
Reviews.Content: So on a whim me & two of my friends drove from S.F. To L.A. Last night. And after getting some sleep, Roscoe's was our first stop of the day. I have to say the hype was worth it, great chicken, the greens were awesome (they have bits of ham in them) and the gravy on the side was cool (good for dipping, or drinking straight, as mark did) The waffels were really good as well, they're huge. We got so full it was ridiculous! I recommend the Country Boy & Scoe's, both good eating!

Reviews.Author: Singto K.
Reviews.Content: "Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles", hey, if it's good enough for Snoop Doggy Dogg and David Beckham, why not?  So I basically commandeered my friends vehicle, put a "Glock 40" to their heads and force them to take me to the nearest "Roscoe's" upon arrival, OK, a little over-exaggerated, but I was definitely excited.  Then out comes the chicken and like a deflated ballon, my anticipation quickly turned into bewilderment, the chicken looked a little burnt, but for fear of being ostracized by my "Cali-friends", I ate it like a good "Soulja".  The chicken itself was just alright, with the waffles, it works, a novelty that I fell a "Sucker" too, "Yezzzir"!

Reviews.Author: Jill B.
Reviews.Content: I lived in the Hwd Hills near here for years and drove by about a zillion times, marveling at the long lines starting in mid-morning.  I wondered, who the hell would stand outside in the blazingn sun waiting for what sounded like the weirdest combination in the world?  Now that I live nowhere near there, we of course decided this was the thing we simply had to have for dinner tonight so I ordered take-out.  Huge portions -- 3 large chicken breasts and 2 giant waffles for $15 -- and deeeeliicious.  The staff was super friendly, great vibe.  Everyone inside who's eating is happy, everyone who's outside is dying to get in.  Only downside?  I'm in my gluten-free countdown (less than a week to go) so this may be my last visit for a while.  Or I may decide the gluten is worth it... this place could tip the scales.

Reviews.Author: lulubelle l.
Reviews.Content: A dream come true! Well, when you're on a college fact-finding road trip, you try to combine fun stuff with the routine school stuff, and the kids had their own goals and I had mine! We all ordered variations of fried chicken and waffles, and everyone enjoyed their selection. In fact, we'd love to come back for more, but we are about 500 miles away! Next time!

Reviews.Author: Ronnie C.
Reviews.Content: Food is good, but not great. IMO, I think they're over-rated. Sad to say that I've had Roscoe's twice and I wasn't too impressed or was dying to have more. Service is good, but parking in the area is horrible. Also, the food is overpriced..

Reviews.Author: Dustin K.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes is legit, it took me 9 years to bring my lazy a$$ in here and Im glad I finally did.  I went straight for "chicken and waffles."  I am no soul food connoisseur by any standard. All I can testify too is I thought the chicken and waffles combo was great, ultimate sweet and savory.  I will definitely go back for a second round. I will say this, my GF ordered the fries, they sucked. Soggy, taste like frozen grocery store bake at home lamer fries.  Also when we went, there was no waiting for a table.  Anybody encouraging you to brave a long wait must know something I dont.  The service was good and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Xenia G.
Reviews.Content: this place is still the champ for our out of town guests...they always want to eat here before they leave and can ya blame them?the chicken is delicious and the waffles are so yummy!

Reviews.Author: Keiko T.
Reviews.Content: The fried chicken was pretty good, same with the waffles (flat and cripsy just the way I like them). The two together was a nice salty sweet combo... but I was just dying to wash my face after, I felt covered in oil after.Only thing is DO NOT ORDER THE SALAD. I got a bowl of 2/3 lettuce, 1/3 cheese... and thank God I asked for the dressing on the side, cause that bowl of dressing was half the size the bowl of salad... but I guess it's just not the place to eat salad, I should have known, I should have known.

Reviews.Author: JJ W.
Reviews.Content: GREAT FOOD WHAT ELSE CAN I SAY! I work odd hours anyways so that way I never have to wait to get my CHIX AND WAFFLES. I figured out that it is the syrup and butter that brought  these waffles to fame. The fried chix is outstanding. I get the country boy which is the 3 wing combo. I like the smothered potatoes that come with the gravy and I am off to heaven. The OJ is always good but if I am on a budget I will opt for the water. The sweet potato pie is nice also. The one down side is that it get pricey if I am to get everything but that is what eating out is all about.

Reviews.Author: YaVonne H.
Reviews.Content: Yum ya-yum ya-yummmmm! Oh so good. Took my boyfriend to Roscoe's as a V-day surprise (crass i know, but he'd been hinting at the place for, well forever. Plus for a guy this is heaven! Hell for me it was heaven too!)We opted to park across the way in the Denny's lot instead of going for the valet. Just seemed bit too much to valet at Scoe's. We only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. I'd been prepared to wait at least another 15 before i got antsy. This was Valentine's Day AND a Saturday to boot!The burly security guard seated us near, nay next to the kitchen, the kitchen (not too good) and no one acknowledged us for close to five minutes (definitely not good). However, once the service was underway we had our generous drinks and chicken and waffles in front of us in under 10 minutes. Hoooboy, what a waffle!!!! Something to write home about and then some! Something in the batter, maybe cinnamon, maybe magic- I don't know and i don't care. Hell it coulda been soylent green for all i would have cared! I wont say anything else about the meal because anything else would be anticlimactic. We settled our bill and off we went into an early LA evening and down Sunset to home with the lingering taste of God's own breakfast on our lips.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: why did two vegetarians wander into Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles? maybe just b/c it's called "Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles".. maybe that was enough. so obviously we did not eat the chicken, which the place reeeked of btw (i get that ppl like this smell b/c they like chicken, but if you're not used to it... its not appealing) we did each get a huge waffle.. it was ok- i mean it should have been like $2 tops.. i think it was $4.BUT i liked the atmosphere.. everyone eating here was happy. it's so out of place in west LA and i like that...check it out..

Reviews.Author: Tess E.
Reviews.Content: Wow! I can't believe I haven't written a review for them yet (though I'm positive I've mentioned them in other reviews).  Well, as other yelpers have said, this place has the best chicken and waffles ever!  They were actually my first experience of the famed combo and set the bar so high, that others can't quite compare--they'll come close, but that's it! It's such a friendly environment too. Good music (haha--literally, one time while there, Common walks in), good people, good food. Oh one of the things I miss about going to school down south!

Reviews.Author: Michael V.
Reviews.Content: Ate at this location yesterday with one of my Franchisees.  Just happened to be in the area.  The place was a little dark.  It took a few minutes to get a waiter to seat us.  I ordered the Chicken Salad Sandwhich w/ Fries.  The portion size on the fries was pretty big.  The overall on it was pretty good with the exception of a small chicken bone in the sandwhich.  But what the heck it was made most likely from scratch.  The reason I gave it a two was that it didn't give me that good vibe feeling and seemed more like a tourist spot than a hang out.  I will try and go to another location to see if it is the same.

Reviews.Author: Mr S.
Reviews.Content: The best chicken and waffles in town (if not the world).  Great for any meal.  Especially great after a late night out.  Just writing this review is making me want to go and get some right now.

Reviews.Author: eric f.
Reviews.Content: if you were a chicken, you would only hope and pray to end up in a roscoes fryer.  your short, steroid-induced life would result in a victorious and magical eating experience for a handful of lucky customers, who gain a new appreciation for the chicken race.your breasts would beg to be coupled with that waffle, your thighs with that mac&cheese, and your legs the collard greens.your last wishes would only be, that some punk-ass wannabe's from brentwood wouldn't take you for granted by not finishing every last bite on their plates.

Reviews.Author: Andrea W.
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I wrote our names down on the list to be called for tables, the man in the front said the wait would be between 20-30 minutes. We didn't get called for another 20 minutes. It was so difficult to hear our names being called, especially since his voice was so low. If my friends and I hadn't doubled check if he called our names, he would've skipped us. When you first walk into Roscoe's, two things you'll notice is the smell and the lights. The smell of the place was a bit difficult to distinguish, but it did smell pretty greasy. When I eat, I like to see what I'm eating, so eating in a dimly lighted restaurant was a bit difficult for me.Overall, I like the food, probably because of the gravy. I ordered the Scoe's #2, which is two pieces of chicken drowned in gravy and two pieces of waffles. I don't really eat waffles, so this was the best dang waffles I've ever had. The chicken was pretty good, I had a difficult time eating it since the light was so dim and the chicken was swimming in gravy. I wasn't sure what piece I was eating. Although the gravy was so good, it was a bit cold. I expected gravy to be smooth and silky but this had lumps (when gravy turns cold, it starts to thicken), it was still good but I wish they warmed it up a bit. I also ordered the smothered potatoes w/gravy, which was okay, a bit over priced for something so small. Our server was pretty cool, he was really patient with us, especially since it was our first time. It was a bit hard to get his attention towards the end, especially since we wanted him to take our check but it was all good, he seemed like he had a lot in his plate.Overall, it was a good experience. I'd definitely come back, but not anytime soon. I think my stomach is still trying to digest all of that food.

Reviews.Author: Angelie A.
Reviews.Content: If you want some awesome soul food, Roscoe's is where to go. Open till 12 am. My friends and I often share and we always order the fried chicken, with gravy on the side, macaroni and cheese, cornbread, collard greens, and buckwheat waffles. The bomb baby just the way I like it!

Reviews.Author: Matt W.
Reviews.Content: I'm always amazed a place like Roscoe's even requires Yelp reviews. It's a Los Angeles staple. The food is amazing. Word of mouth is strong. I mean, come on, it's chicken, and it's waffles. If you haven't been there, go. If you've been there, no need to read this.I can't vouch for the entire menu, as I've only had the chicken and waffles, but that's why you're there, right? I'm convinced at this point that the waffles are made of magic, and the batter is mixed in the kitchen by unicorns and fairies. They are the best waffles I've ever had, bar none. They have such a unique and tasty flavor that it's hard to describe. There's a very distinct exotic spice flavor. Add a huge dollop of butter and some irresistible syrup and there you have it. The chicken is equally good. Great skin taste, moist inside. But really though, the waffles.....The atmosphere is casual. Waiters are nice. Almost every time I go someone famous walks in the door, if you're in to that sort of thing. Also, if you're looking to cut calories, you're at the wrong place.OK, had enough? Stop reading and go try the waffles. Did I mention the waffles? Waffles.

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing and a must for anyone who visits or lives in LA. The best fried chicken in the city. Last time I was here Little Richard was there which was fun. My issue is service is inconsistent.  Sometimes friendly sometimes not so much. Food is consistent every time

Reviews.Author: Dave A.
Reviews.Content: i don't ever want to pull the race card out. But after an experience like this just makes you wonder why segregation still exist. We waited outside for an hour. we had a party of 5+1 child. We wanted to try what everyone talks about. We where next in the list for a large party but for some reason a group of 5 made it in before us. We brought it to the host attention and he waved us off. The next group that went in before us was a group of 5 then mention they were adding one more person, but the party wasn't present, the host took them in. We brought it to his attention again... and he just we waved us off. For the first time in my life i felt i wasn't dark enough. REALLY? it was BS. I'm sorry i had to throw racism into this, but clearly we felt offended by this. People can still say the food is great, but the service SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Author: Monica A.
Reviews.Content: They really know how to make good juicy southern deep fried chicken, and the waffles aint too bad either.

Reviews.Author: David K.
Reviews.Content: This place is soo good, probably one of the best fried chickens in the world. The customer service is off the chain as well. I know it sounds weird the combination of chicken and waffles but believe me it works. Instead of putting syrup on the the chicken i would highly recommend using the red rooster, just be careful if using too much of that stuff will make your nose run. This location is the best out of all of them primarily because of its Hollywood scene. its been known in the past for the food being sooo good that Celebrities such as Michael Jackson will pay to shut it down for the night. Go out to this wonderful location on Sunset and Gower  and ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Author: Larry C.
Reviews.Content: I tried this place while I was in L.A. just to see what the hype was about, and it was basically what I expected.  The chicken and waffles were ok and the place was VERY busy, but I had fun!  I will be back when I'm in the area again for sure.

Reviews.Author: Michael E.
Reviews.Content: The Chicken was dry. The waffle was undercooked. I've had better mac & cheese many times. The prices were ridiculous. Did I mention the service was slow and rude? Then to top it off we go to our car when leaving and employees were smoking pot outside. Needless to say, won't be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Janet G.
Reviews.Content: I've never been to this place until a week ago. I've heard my friends say that this place was really good. They kind of hyped it up for me but from my experience the food was ok. The greens were a bit salty for my taste and the candy yams were way too sweet. The chicken and waffles were good. Overall, it's an OK place to go out and dine with friends on a Sunday afternoon every now and then.

Reviews.Author: Lucy W.
Reviews.Content: I think this place is overrated and too simple, even in taste. It's an experience but the fried chicken was no tastier than the semi-dry tasting fried chicken I can buy in a box at my local grocery store. The waffle was ok and they just give you regular pancake syrup. I guess I just preferred Bru's mango salsa and flavorful chicken cutlet style chicken! This was was a miss for me. The chilli cheese fries also had more chilli than cheese but so was Bru's. Maybe it's a California thing. This is not my kind of food but everyone is entitled to their taste.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne D.
Reviews.Content: My friend said we may be the only white girls in Roscoe's, and we probably were. This is one of those traditional, uniquely LA places you need to go to at least once, even if you have never thought of combining chicken & waffles.

Reviews.Author: Mina K.
Reviews.Content: three stars because i was really high; even a jack in the box jalapeno popper tasted glorious that night.i don't know about the parking situation. me and my friends had driven up here from orange county to see six organs of admittance at amoeba so we parked in their structure and walked down sunset to roscoe's.the place was really dark and seemingly a hole in the wall. cool vibe. the service felt like it took foreverrr but time was going slow for me, maybe it was actually a matter of minutes! now the chicken tasted so sweet and salty, surprisingly moist with a crispy skin. and the waffle... damn. that waffle. so good. not soggy, but soft with a toasty outside. our server was really funny, or maybe he just seemed that way to me.i'd like to try it sober sometime! (:

Reviews.Author: Arthur K.
Reviews.Content: I've been craving this place for a few months now.  Times like this, I wished I lived in LA.

Reviews.Author: Diana N.
Reviews.Content: i finally tried it for the first time recently. i'm not sure what the big hype is about. i had the 3 wings and waffle. i mean the chicken is good...much better than KFC, but i guess because i'm from the south i don't think it was any better than the down and dirty chicken places back home. i hated the waffle...i like mine crispy and instead it was soggy. my friend raved about the syrup but i dunno...it tasted like ...well syrup. i'd rather toast my own eggo waffle and get some timmy chan's (i guess only people from houston would know what i'm talking about)....but i guess it still makes a good late night post-clubbing meal

Reviews.Author: Claudia B.
Reviews.Content: Well, I've never even eaten here.......so why, you ask, do I even bother to rate this place?  Because I did walk in here, sit down, and read the menu.  Then I looked at my friends and said, "There's no way I can eat this."  It was all grease and fat and a whole buncha yuck jumbled together.  NO WAY.  I'm just not into that kind of eating or food combinations.....so NOT appealing to me.  So we left.....yet, it's a local institution of sorts.  Oh well.

Reviews.Author: Michael J.
Reviews.Content: If you don't have exact change, don't go. Screw those guys.  Food's only good if it's fresh too.  Go on a busy night and youll get hours old food.

Reviews.Author: Brenda L.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite spot to get fried chicken. Whenever I go they always sit our party right away. As soom as your order be prepared your food comea out fast..when I say fast I mean FAST. Fried Chicken is always tasty along with the buttery biscuit. I always see celeberties whenever I go. Which means there doing something good!

Reviews.Author: Katie W.
Reviews.Content: I can see liking this place if one is from the South and has not had real Southern food for awhile.  Unfortunately, I live in the South and, although I went here on the last day of my extended stay in LA, my memories of real Southern fried chicken had not faded enough to make me really like this place.I liked my waffle but that was probably because it had half a pound of butter on it and a lot of syrup.  But, whatever; it worked and I ate the whole waffle.  The biscuit I tried was way too dry and not buttery enough.  The grits I sampled were average Southern diner grits - very standard, boiled up grits and not creamy.  The mac and cheese was indeed the Southern custard-style mac and cheese, which is not the really creamy type, and I thought this was good but also very oily - it could have used a bit more creaminess.  The sweet tea was bad.  If you are from the South and have a hankering for sweet tea, you may want to skip it here lest you tarnish your happy memories of how really good sweet tea is supposed to taste.  The tea had a strange, almost artificial sweetener taste to it.  The chicken was very disappointing.  It seemed to have very little seasoning and the inside was dry.  It was your standard grocery store deli fried chicken.  I really expected more.The service was slow.  Once we ordered, we got our food very quickly but it took them about 20 minutes to even come to our table to take our orders, and then they brought all the food out without giving half of our table silverware - we had to ask four times to get it and sat there waiting as our food got cold until someone finally brought it.  They were not even that crowded (several open tables) so I don't know what the issue was.  We valet parked for $6.50 and that was all fine.I give them three stars for effort, because it's great to see Southern food someplace other than the South but, unfortunately, they're not quite pulling it all off.

Reviews.Author: Ariza S.
Reviews.Content: Number one: I'm from Dallas and know what Southern cooking is all about, TRUST ME. Number two: Roscoe's was definitely Southern dining but this was not the best chicken and waffles to hit these lips of mine. I arrived to Roscoe's to find the place packed, music loud and lights dimmed. My party of seven was given a 30 minute wait time but my name was called in less than 5. We were seated and greeted by a super sweet waitress who thanked my group (navy men) for their service and offered a discount for our tab (sweet!). I wasn't very hungry and knew we would be bar hopping after this so I shared the chicken and waffle plate with a side of mac and cheese and biscuit with a buddy. I was surprised at how small the 3 chicken wings were compared to the ginormous waffle. I'm thinkin this makes getting a little chicken and a lil waffle in every bite difficult. The chicken itself was very lightly flavored and the waffle was a little soft to my liking. As for the 'famous' mac and cheese? Well that was definitely another disappointment. I'm not sure I know how to describe the not very cheesy and 'out of the box' flavor that hit my taste buds. Sorry west coast yelpers, Roscoe's just didn't do it for me.

Reviews.Author: victoria r.
Reviews.Content: So different from anyplace I've ever been to. Very unique combination of fried chicken and waffles! I never thought to ever try something like that but it was interesting. Very casual. Chicken was all white meat and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sean R.
Reviews.Content: Syrup everywhere . . .  as long as I keep the sweet stuff away from my chicken I am good to go.  Been there several times but my stomache still can't handle the combo.  Just good home cooked type food.

Reviews.Author: Ann T.
Reviews.Content: We had the #1 and # 3. I believe it was whoever came up with the idea of chicken and waffles is simply genius. The chicken was not greasy and totally had the homemade feel to it. Waffles were good too. We also had the candied yams (OMG! Almost more for dessert than anything), cornbread was okay better than that stuff from a box, mac was ok for me I still recommend Creole Cafe's mac. Wouldn't drive all the way up to LA for it though but I see why they have alot of fans. Service was GREAT and the food GOOD!

Reviews.Author: Lowell H.
Reviews.Content: Best waffles in L.A. and great fried chicken with brown gravy.  Bad for you, but great food.  A must try item.  L.A. landmark.

Reviews.Author: j c.
Reviews.Content: I love that this scruffy little location on Gower has a velvet rope, although I guess it makes sense when you see the big crowds on weekend nights, for which they don't take reservations. I know that everyone gets the waffles here, but I personally prefer the Sir Michael, which is fried chicken with onions and gravy + grits. As one of my friends descriptively put it, you do end up feeling like gravy (i.e., a big congealed blob) when you leave, so this is not for the no-carb/eats-like-a-bird crowd.

Reviews.Author: Chatree T.
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of things about Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles, mainly from the Food Network, so I decided to check it out.  Of course I ordered the famous chicken and waffle.  The chicken was superb! Probably the best chicken wings I have had so far.  The waffle was also excellent. It was soft and kinda melt in my mouth.  I would really go to this place again. I give it a 4 star because their bathroom is really dirty. With all the $$$$ they are making, they can afford a renovation.

Reviews.Author: Luan N.
Reviews.Content: I love fried chicken, I love waffles, I love history and this place is full of it.  I can't really add what hasn't been said except my chair was wobbly.  Probably because of the additional weight it took on because I ate so much here.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: I use to think that eating fried chicken with something sweet such as breakfast waffles and syrup was the oddest thing. Was I in for a surprise, I loved it! Their fried chicken is so tender and crispy it just melts in your mouth. Don't forget to get the gravy on the side so you can dip your chicken in it. So mouth watering! I've only tried the waffle and chicken there and I can never finish the quarter chicken. Keep in mind I do eat A LOT, the portions were just too big. Every time I'm in the area, I look forward to stopping by Roscoe's for a bite to eat. The staff is also very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Steph P.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and waffle were both dry. I have definitely had better chicken and waffles elsewhere. The mac n cheese looked nasty but tasted ok since it was stuffed with butter. This food is so unhealthy so please don't eat it more than a couple times a year ok?

Reviews.Author: Kazuo O.
Reviews.Content: How can you come to LA and not go to Roscoe's?  I made a mistake and ordered the chicken with gravy so it wasn't crispy at all.  Oh well it was still good.

Reviews.Author: Eli A.
Reviews.Content: To start off the chicken was delicious and im a big fan of sweet and salty foods, however the waffles in my opinion were not my favorite; BTW the Corn Bread and Macaroni and cheese were delicious also, We waited in line for only about 15mins so that was good and even got souvenier T-Shirts, I would tottaly comeback but dont be a hype beast and say it was to die for because really its not.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: By far the best place to go to for fried chicken & waffles!!  The only draw back is parking is hard to find. If you park on the street you only get 1 hour of meter parking.

Reviews.Author: Abra S.
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all.  I do not know what the buzz is about this place. The fried chicken was OK, but the waffles were less than par.  I ordered a chicken sandwich too and here I am thinking I would be getting a fried chicken sandwich, instead it was frozen chicken patty and it cost around $7 or $8 bucks. The fries that came with it were super soggy and the one of the worse fries I have had. I won't be back!

Reviews.Author: Crystalle M.
Reviews.Content: All I can say is, yes. I had never even heard of the chicken and waffle combo before Roscoe's...who knew fried chicken with those buttery waffles doused in sweet maple syrup could be so amazing?! Okay, maybe everyone else. But once I tried it, I was hooked. Been several times and am never disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Theresa F.
Reviews.Content: Chicken was dry, dry, dry!!! Waffles tasted and felt like they had been made way earlier in the day and sat around till someone ordered them. Would have to be in the area to eat here again, definitely will not be going out of my way to come here!!!

Reviews.Author: Arlene C.
Reviews.Content: What???  Never had Fried Chicken ~n~ Waffles??? Oh hell yeah, I love me some Fried chicken n waffles and some grits.
