Okay, so the waffles may not be the best I've ever had, what do I know, all the times I went to Atlanta and never once stopped at one of the million Waffle houses on each corner, but there's something about the combo. I'll never forget the look on my friend's faces when I told them we were coming here. Clearly they had never had this combo & thought I was crazy. Needless to say they were singin' a different song after we left. If you come here in the wee hours, you may see a celebrity or two. Bay area folks, don't be fooled by the bogus chicken place in Jack London.

Reviews.Author: Blandie M.
Reviews.Content: Sorry, but I have to be honest here. I feel like we have come to the end of an era . Back in the day Roscoe's used to be such a good spot for soul food. That's the reason why they are popular now. The chicken USED to be succulent, flavorful, and fresh. The waffles USED to be hot, crisp, and spiced. Things have changed. The last two times I visited a Roscoe's  (Long Beach and Hollywood, respectively) I was saddened. The chicken was dry and paltry. It seemed to have been previously frozen. It hardly had any flavor. The waffles were soggy and tasted like Ego waffles from the microwave. I'm guessing they are franchised and operated by different people. Hence the inconsistency in quality. I remember the one on Pico being good. Hopefully it still is.I come from a family of good Southern cooks. My grandmother owned her very own soul food restaurant so I know what good soul food is. But oftentimes I cook better than some of these places.

Reviews.Author: Pauloantonio G.
Reviews.Content: Parking kinda sucked but we got seated fairly quickly.  Waffles are really good but the chicken was eehhh.  Good but not the greatest.  For being very famous, i don't have much to rave about this place.  I will definitely have to make it back to try different menu items to review.

Reviews.Author: Big J.
Reviews.Content: This place is off the chain.It's always busy yet the service is fast and friendly.Everything I have had is tasty.Nuff said.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Just because rappers mention this place in their lyrics doesn't mean it's worth paying 9 bucks for a leg thigh and waffle.  Okay so it's decent food, but still I can go to norms and eat a more rounded meal for less.

Reviews.Author: xochi c.
Reviews.Content: DELLICIOUS!!!!!!!!! at first i was takened away from security standing at the door, thinking it was a bar. But coming in the place is small and the staff is quick and friendly. I ordered a waffle with the onions and gravy and 3 chicken wings.  When ordering something to drink, make sure to ask for the "Eclipse" it was good!

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: After my first trip here I would have given Roscoe's a solid 4 stars, but my visit tonight killed my positive attitude towards it. We were sat right away. After my company and I used the restroom we are met by our waitress, an older latina named Marta. Marta doesn't speak english very well. Marta speaks so quietly that you can hardly tell she doesn't speak english very well. Marta is incredibly inattentive. Marta couldn't even remember our orders right. Marta never checked on us once during our meal. Marta is clearly in the wrong position at Roscoe's. Marta is the reason that, even after a great first experience here, I am only giving them 2 stars. Time to replace Marta.

Reviews.Author: Britt B.
Reviews.Content: I really feel like I gained some street cred when I came here some time back for my first chicken and waffle experience at like 11PM.  Maybe I didn't...  And maybe chicken and waffles aren't a big deal anymore-- but either way, this hole-in-the-wall alley way is where the magic is at.  I love waffles more than words can express so quite frankly, they would've had to try really hard to mess that one up.

Reviews.Author: Ben C.
Reviews.Content: While it's not the best place to visit for its cleanliness, the food is absolutely delicious.  I think it was a little on the pricey side for soul food, but there's just something unusually good about the combination of fried chicken smothered in gravy and waffles.  My friend had decided to go with a chicken-and-cheese omelet instead.  After trying her dish, I have to say that Roscoe's makes one hell of an omelet as well.  Despite the apparent simplicity of its menu, I'd still consider coming back again to eat.  I just can't turn away from the craziness (and deliciousness) of mixing fried chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Eddie S.
Reviews.Content: Was doubtful about eating chicken and waffles together, but now I've tasted it, I'm breaking out the old waffle maker at home.  Took my kid - he loved it.  Right down the street from Mann's Chinese Theater - so it's a good place for out-of-towners when they check out Hollywood.  A bit pricey - but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jordan B.
Reviews.Content: The Best Damn chicken and waffles in town, they have some many great recipes and so many great sauces, the people who work their are so nice, and its a place just to enjoy. Great for hangin out

Reviews.Author: Sia N.
Reviews.Content: Comes very close to achieving what I imagined heaven to be like.  Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles sets the standard for such a strange pairing and kicks me right in the face every time I indulge in their magnificent plates of soul food.This place is located right  in the belly of Hollywood off Sunset Boulevard and is swarming with customers, especially on a Saturday night after 2 am when most bars and clubs shut their doors.  Eager clubbers and various other people, those of whom you'd only encounter on such a night in the city of Angels descend upon what has become one of the most ubiquitous and famous Chicken houses in the west coast.  The plot is simple, the staple menu items are the southern fried chicken and the homemade waffles served with their house syrup and hot sauce.  I have been here now on multiple occasions and typically order the #1 Scoe's which consists of HALF CHIX (whatever the hell that's supposed to mean) and two of their generous waffles.  At about 11 bucks a pop it's not the cheapest late night grab but it satiates the appetites of all who indulge.  The chicken breasts are massive and hearty, much bigger than your typical KFC portion and it doesn't taste quite so greasy either.  The waffles are delicious and have a flavor unique to Roscoe's, lathered in their light-cream like butter there really is nothing better.  Once you douse the breakfast treat in syrup, you've just opened up a can of glory in your mouth.  I could have sworn I heard the theme music from the Sound of Music playing out of my mouth as I bit into that thing.It obviously is very popular and well known since it's mentioned in many films and by various rappers.  The main reason I feel Roscoe's doesn't deserve the five star treatment is that their guest service isn't the best, on a late night visit expect to be handled like a piece of meat in a factory..they have a waiting list to get in and as you're surrounded by a bunch of moronic drunken people and agitated freaks who have no semblance of courtesy or patience, everyone and their mother is busting a move to break into the restaurant as if they are somehow implicated in The Great Escape.  So you have to be forthright and also a little pushy to get into the restaurant, being seated is the biggest challenge here.  Overall, though, this place is a must and any other place that claims to serve chicken and waffles is surely a poor imitation.

Reviews.Author: Chloë C.
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal. You really just need to go.

Reviews.Author: Angela L.
Reviews.Content: i don't know why i haven't tried roscoe's until now. i think i had my doubts because it's a chain and i figured it was just hyped up.shit, was i wrong.yes this place is hyped up but for DAMNED GOOD REASON. i'm one of those folks that doesn't like to mix sweet and savory, so i ordered the combo with 2 thighs, greens, mac n cheese, and corn bread. the boyfriend ordered the chicken and waffles, with gravy on the side, and we shared everything. where do i even begin? the chicken was perrrfect, not that greasy, super moist inside and flavored well. you know how the chicken was good? i didn't use any hot sauce on it, and the boyfriend didn't use any ketchup. that kind of shit just doesn't happen, ever. the mac n cheese is really baked, none of that weird saucy stuff. greens hit the spot, and they give you a huuuuge chunk of corn bread. the gravy is also bomb, but the best part.... those fucking waffles. WHAT do they put in there?! seriously, i've been searching for a place that has waffles as tasty as my parent's restaurant.. the waffles here were tastier =X [sorry mom]. i can't put my finger on what the hell it is, but the waffles are full of flavor. i'm hella sad i didn't bring some back. pleeeassseee come to the bay area!

Reviews.Author: Lena D.
Reviews.Content: the pook has been craving roscoe's for months now and with work being so busy we haven't had a chance to visit. finally.. this weekend we were in the area for the glee live concert. yay!we came on a friday around 6pm. there was no line. we were greeted quickly and sat down. i've been to a roscoe's once before and i ordered the same thing. #19 with dark meat. it comes with rice and gravy and a biscuit. there is plenty of rice and and gravy. the dish came out lukewarm but it was still good. the chicken itself i thought was a little bland. i felt bad for eating it with ketchup. the biscuit was kinda gross... and had no flavor. even the pook can agree with me on that one. the pook ordered the smothered chicken. it came with a waffle. the waffle was simple and tasty. the smothered chicken came with the same gravy used on my rice. it made the chicken taste better but i feel like for a chicken place.. the chicken should be good on its own. i ordered a side of mac n cheese and for over $4 it did not disappoint. in fact... we have leftovers and i may go heat it up right now!overall it was a good place. i would come back and get the smothered chicken and the waffle. its not amazing but it's a nice spot to share with good company.

Reviews.Author: Mal C.
Reviews.Content: Got the thigh and waffle. I have to say the chicken was alright, but the waffle was YUM! All in all, it's not something I think I'd ever crave, but it was good.

Reviews.Author: Malyssa C.
Reviews.Content: i went here while visiting with family. heard it was amaaazing, but wanted to see for myself! and oh boy, did this place live up to the hype. i ordered a quarter of chicken and waffles, gravy on the side, eggs, and an eclipse drink. everything was so good! chicken was huge and so crispy. waffles were so good. i have no idea what they put in them, but they taste great and smell amazing! these were the best waffles ever! this place definitely lives up to its name. the chicken and waffles here are the best i have ever had! eggs were cooked with onions and lots of cheese. they look a little funky, but they taste great. the eclipse drink looks so cool! it's a layered drink: oj, fruit punch and lemonade. 3 layers of awesomeness! it was yummy and fun to try and drink each layer individually (: service was pretty quick even though we had a group of about 10.as leftovers the chicken and waffles aren't that bad! just make sure to get the gravy on the side. my family actually went back a few weeks later and delivered some to me and my bf in san jose on their way back home! haha we can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Author: Jill T.
Reviews.Content: We ate here quite a while ago when checking out the area for my son's college choices. This place was really good, good chicken, good waffles, we very much enjoyed being at the famous chicken and wafffle place in LA. Worth stopping at for the experience and the food for that matter!

Reviews.Author: Liz M.
Reviews.Content: Scoe's 1/2 chicken w/ the gravy on the side to split w/ bf, nuff said!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Mimi S.
Reviews.Content: Can you say "Yum"?  Cuz thats all you'll be saying if you eat here.  My girlfriend and I were riding down gower and figured we always wanted to eat here so we did.  Employees were friendly and attentive. We ordered their famous chicken, waffles and biscuits. KFC has really good biscuits and are hard to top but Roscoe's does an excellent job!  I left very satisfied and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Phil M.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here more times than I should have. It's really good though! The parking situation sucks, but so does the rest of the city.

Reviews.Author: Three M.
Reviews.Content: The big mama special, a breast (or thigh, depending on your mood) and share a waffle with your friend. Hallelujah!

Reviews.Author: Belle M.
Reviews.Content: No one does chicken and waffles better than Roscoe's.  It's artery clogging but  just don't even think about that when you are chomping down on some crispy chicken breast and waffles.  This is definitely a must try dining destination in L.A.

Reviews.Author: Austin V.
Reviews.Content: Late night scoe's special with gravy!  Roscoe's is a star in a very faded socal late night eatery scene...

Reviews.Author: Kristin S.
Reviews.Content: I seriously think they put crack in their syrup. It's addicting and one of the many reasons I prefer Roscoe's waffles over anybody else's.

Reviews.Author: Zell C.
Reviews.Content: Decided to check this place out on my first trip to LA. Went here on a Friday evening. Parking was not a problem at all, and seating wasn't much of a problem, only a 10 minute wait (but I'm sure it gets packed late nights). The service was nice and friendly. Food is TOTAL comfort food. I ordered the Scoe's, and loved the gravy soaked chicken. I'm not really a waffle person but I enjoyed every bit of its fluffiness. Although it's not in the most glamourous area, it's a sure stop for good, cheap eats!

Reviews.Author: Adrian H.
Reviews.Content: The staff here cracks me up!  The food is run of the mill.  There's not much else to say about this place.  It was just aight'.

Reviews.Author: Aprille R.
Reviews.Content: i came here to see what all the hype was about. i was a pescatarian for awhile, but i had to break that to try this place for myself.in my opinion, its just HYPE. i feel like i can just buy some popeye's chicken or something and pair it up with some waffles and it would be the samething. i like wing stop's lemon pepper chicken better.out server was chill though. the lady who worked at the cash register... not so much. whats the attitude, girl? i just wanted to buy a stupid tourist t-shirt and pay for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin P.
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was excited to finally try this place.  It's been hyped up so much for me that I had this image in my mind of something fantastic.  I was a bit disappointed with it, however.  I just wasn't impressed at all, and I felt bloated and gross afterward.  I suppose that's to be expected with a place like this.  Oh well.  Maybe I'll try it again some time, maybe not.  I am undecided.

Reviews.Author: Milique M.
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. I went here with my friend and the waffles are like no other. Like a classic breakfast anytime of the day you want. Our waitress had class too. So much props to her. I'm so glad I went to Roscoe's. I have not been to one since the one I went on Pico in 2004.

Reviews.Author: Edgar G.
Reviews.Content: I ordered #9 which was the 3 wing combo with the waffle on a Tuesday afternoon. The wings were smaller than I expected but still delicious. I've tried chicken and waffles before but it's great to finally try the original. All in all it was been a great dining experience and I would return if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: Douglas M.
Reviews.Content: There's what might be called an "awful experience loop." It's the length of time between an awful experience and its repetition. My AEL for Roscoe's is ten years. That's how long it took me to fully forget how nasty this place is. Fortunately, this means I am not due for another visit to Roscoe's until 2018, by which time it'll probably be closed due to the total collapse of society. Bye Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Che'Ron Q.
Reviews.Content: Man...where can I begin!  The place is awesome!  i LOVE THE CHICKEN!! Its full of flavor and all the times I have had it it was just right!  The Waffles are addicting....I don't know if its the syrup, or the batter all I know is I love it!  I had the chicken both fried and smothered!  I have never been disappointed!  I love the staff they are always friendly and very nice to me!  The place is just great....except when I have to wait...but hey the food is great what can I say!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P.
Reviews.Content: What I'm about to say might be controversial, even blasphemous to Roscoe's fanatics, but I've had way better chicken at Popeye's.  My group and I went around dinner time on Sunday night and it was crowded with about a 30-minute way to get a table.  I ordered the combo with rice and the dark meat leg and thigh with a biscuit on the side.  The biscuit was soft and buttery as I expected.  The rice was nothing to write home about.  I thought the chicken was over-cooked and dry.  I'm not a fried chicken connoisseur but I can honestly say I've had better and cheaper chicken at Popeye's and KFC.  Sadly, I will not return for my fried chicken cravings.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla A.
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT LOVE IT!! Chicken and Waffles with syrup what is wrong with this picture? ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!

Reviews.Author: Genaro R.
Reviews.Content: Waffles were good. Chicken was overcooked and that was disappointing. Staff was friendly and overall a pretty good experience. The food is also really overpriced. They are milking the name for all its worth.

Reviews.Author: Janice T.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to know what the fuss was about, so I had my hubby take a side trip to Roscoes to try their famous chicken and waffles.  We were there on a weekday just in time for breakfast.  They have valet parking but we opted to do the metered street parking.  Upon entering, we were immediately greeted and ushered to an empty table.  I thought the place to be dingy.  But at least service was fast and efficient.  The menu had too much to choose from that it was a bit overwhelming.   I finally settled on the Obama Special (...not because I'm a fan of Obama but because I'm a fan of chicken wings!).  IMO, the chicken and waffle was good, but I've had better (i.e., Brown Sugar Kitchen in Oakland).  If you're already in the area, it wouldn't hurt to try Roscoe's.  But to make a special trip just for it?  I think I'll pass.  At least I can now say I've tried it :)

Reviews.Author: Sam L.
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine ordered some food from this place me to go. I thought the food was ok, it wasn't because it was order for take out. But, really it just taste generic to me. It's also a bit pricy for the food and I think fried chicken in the supermarkets taste almost the same. THe waffles however were a bit better than my expectations and tasted pretty good. However, not my place for food, but only if a friend drags me here then I'll stop by and dine.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this place, only been once and its quite an experience. nothing like any other. would go again, but over priced for what it is $$$$

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M.
Reviews.Content: OMG how did I forget to review the FAMOUS Roscoes chicken & waffles?!!? It was my first breakfast in Los Angeles!I went with my friend and we got there super early because he told me it's ALWAYS packed but luckily it wasn't. So once I went in it felt like a very down to earth homey joint like something you would see in Food Network's Drive-ins and Dives show. We sat down, I took a look at their menu although I already knew what I wanted which was OBVIOUSLY the chicken N waffles. It was my first time ever having chicken and waffles and I'm happy I went to one of the best spots. Waffles are my ultimate favorite so I went for that first and I was a bit dissapointed that it wasn't like the thick big cripsy waffles I'm used to and I kind of expected but it was still good. The chicken was OUT OF THIS PLANET! Sooooo crispy and juicy, yeah it was AMAZING, like nothing I've ever had! So I had to cut a piece of chicken and waffle and have it together and it was a foodGASM in my mouth! lol!!! Can't wait to go back another day and try something else :)And of course I couldn't finish everything! lol

Reviews.Author: Matt T.
Reviews.Content: I get 2 waffles with a side of fries. Waffles are amazing, fries and crispy and excellent. The other Roscoe's on Pico doesn't even compare.

Reviews.Author: Diane C.
Reviews.Content: Strange but wonderful combo. Price could be lower but wow the portions are huge! I would definitely wait and never complain about it. It was awesome... just not 5 star awesome.

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: It didn't live up to the hype.  The ambiance felt like a suffocating basement.  The presentation of the food felt like cafeteria faire.  While the fried chicken was slightly above average, it wasn't the best I've ever had.  The waffles just seemed typical; batter, griddle, sizzle, sizzle, voila!  You have waffles.  Serve with syrup and butter.  Again, I have had better, and I believe that experience was in a foreign country.My rating is such because quality is commensurate with price.  The quality of the food built in with the hype doesn't justify the price point, especially when there's better alternatives.I've gone there too many times, and often on a lark, but I'm afraid this bird has flown and never again.  There's too many fried chicken joints in this town to patronize.

Reviews.Author: FutureC EO S.
Reviews.Content: I would like to officially renign my previous compliment to this restaurant. The Pico location provided a totally comfortable atmosphere. If you decide to patronize this chain, I suggest you try the Pico location. The Gower location simply TRIES TO HARD to be Hollywood. I mean seriously, your a chicken joint, relax! It's nothing like ordering food to go, which is suppose to be a flyby and fairly easy experience, and receiving the worst possible treatment one can have in a matter of 30 minutes. Let's began! The guy at the door was fairly nice. Except that he talked to my guests and I like we were slow. Yea, it was our first time visiting the Gower location, so we didn't know that there is a SYSTEM to ordering to-go in which you have to walk through the whole restaurant, which is dimly lit, to find a small booth by an exit door. There, you will find the most rudest and obnoxious waiters anxiously waiting to NOT take your order. From then on, prepare for the waiters to mix up your tickets, give you the wrong food, skip you in line to help more "prestigious" looking customers (Old, guys in Hawaiian shirts), and to be stared at by nosy customers throughout the whole dreadful and LOUD experience. Oh no! If I am going to pay $50 for a few pieces of chicken, which I can attest are not better than the soul food I get in Houston, Texas, then I expect superb customer service no matter what location the restaurant is in. The Hollywood act of exclusiveness is inappropriate for this level of a restaurant (Especially since it is located right behind a rusty shopping center and next door to a liquor store GIVE ME A BREAK!) The waffles are good at this restaurant, but if I have to deal with sorry customer service like this, I rather make my own down home southern meal (which I have been doing every since!). Pass up this restaurant (Gower location) for a better deal at Popeye's, you get more for your buck and when you order to go, it's not a meet and greet. Or just cook at home, lol, fried chicken isn't healthy anyway!

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this place, but it fell short of expectations for me. Admittedly, I had lofty expectations for Roscoe's, and I think that it's still worth checking out for yourself even if it's just to say that you've tried the experience. But to be honest, the food is just ok. I've had better fried chicken and I've had better waffles. Plus, other places don't have 45-60 minute long lines to get a table. If you want a good brunch spot or even a good chicken and waffles spot, you have plenty of better local options. For brunch nearby, I would recommend The Waffle or The Griddle Cafe. For chicken and waffles, I'd recommend Otis Jackson's Soul Dog or even Bouchon if you want to go fancy and get a $25 plate of delicious chicken (not fried) and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Janelle L.
Reviews.Content: After a fundraising festival event at the Ford we were hungry and craving some Rosce's!  It's been a while, and sure I had to work in the morning, but what the hey?  It was about 11:30 pm when we got there, there was a small line outside, luckily for us, we were a party of two and took us right in.  I've always noticed that at this particular Roscoe's, sice people like to come here before or after clubbing/drinking with their friends, it's a MUCH longer wait to get a table for a big group.  We must ave looked likeout of towners or something because the guy at the door kept telling us a littleof Roscoe's history and how great this place was from taking our name to seating us at our table.  I didn't mind it, that's the stuff that gives this place it's character.The wing lovers that we are, we both ordered The Obama special, 3 wings and a waffle.  We also got a side of fries, some cheese eggs and two Lisa's delights (essentially, what we know as an Arnold Palmer).  Typically, I'm an order nazi, I don't like everyone...or anyone...in my party ride ring the same thing, but I've been here a dozen times and tried mst ofte food, so tonight, duplicates were ok.  Flavorwise, the chicken is good as usual (personally and texturally, I like a little more crisp and skin). The cheese eggs were DELICIOUS!  The fries were soggy and limp with not quite enough salt.  However, the ranch dressing flavor was good and help with the salt factor.  The Lisa's delight was especially good, very nice and tangy with the right amount of sweetness.  I've saved the waffle for last, it wasn't my favorite, I am a bigger fan of crunchy waffles but that's not a big deal, it made it easier to shovel the eggs nd chicken in together.  After all, if it were hard, it might've cut my mouth up andi might've not gotten all the flavors in!  I have recently had my tonsils removed and it has slightly, ever so slightly, heightened my taste buds.  In this case I was very sensitive to a spice in the waffle batter, I think it was the nutmeg, it made it a little bitter for me.  Again, surgery, taste buds, I think I'm still adjusting.Overall, Roscoe's is always a good late night snack joint if you have some...ok, a lot of time to wait.  The service is ok, I think they are always so busy that the wait staff is always rushing and seemingly annoyed.  It would e nice if they upgraded the old table tops, they're a little sticky and gooey even with the busboys attention.  Parking on the street is usually metered but free after...8 pm, I believe.

Reviews.Author: aricka a.
Reviews.Content: Do not recommend after hours. Horrible service!! I went to roscoes last night and experienced a NIGHTMARE with the entire door STAFF, host, security even the "manager"!! my friends and i left an outting and decided to wrap up our night with a nice waffle and some good ole' original Roscoes Chicken. I put my name on the list for 4 aproximently around 1:50am, seceurity told me my wait would be about 40 mins. REMINDER it's all-star weekend ROSCOES was NUTS. Taking the crowd into consideration, i patiently waited. around 3:15am... 1hour and 15mins later, i check my status on the wait list. I was fourth one down!! OK, still fine. Stepped aside still waited. While waiting i heard 3 names (3 different parties) being called within the 20mins of me waiting (btw roscoes doesnt take reservations). Therefore i knew i was next to be called. NOPE! nothing. i check with the hostest again! I'm STILL FOURTH ONE DOWN!!! how the *BLEEP* is this even possible! i TRIED to explain to the host (who recognized and acknoweledge my patience) that the seating arrangment is UN ORGANIZED & UNFAIR, which he agreed, but he said it wasnt in his hands.... it's in the security guards pick!! WHAT KIND OF CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THIS?! In conclusion, security guard. Who even DRESSED unprofessionally in a ALL RED dickies botton down shirt and TATTOO of the los angeles dodgers "LA" symbol tatted on the BACK of his bald head! Didnt "care" about my wait & even in trying to come into agreement with the security guard, about my nearly 2hour wait he, in response yelled & screamed negative words and even threated. I was too through! I had to take this to another level by explainging to the the "manager" (said his name was james) that i've been patiently waiting for my table and MY NAME ON THE LIST NEVER MOVED after 3 parties have been sat in 20mins after my 1hr15min wait.... did manager come up with a solution for his disatisfied customer? NO, STILL DID NOT GET SEATED!!!!! nor did i eat. =(A story of POOR seating service, UNFRIENDLY, UNORGANIZED, UNPROFESSIONAL, HORRID CUSTOMER SERVICE. again, DO NOT RECOMMEND after hours. I WILL NEVER EAT AT ROSOCES IN HOLLYWOOD, AGAIN! EVER!!!the roscoes off labrea is much more friendly and organize but close early =/

Reviews.Author: elizabeth q.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten at the Roscoe's in Pasadena which is more like a diner. This week I tried the Roscoe's on Gower and it was a regular restaurant. It had a rustic feel and the lighting was dark. Kind of a nice ambiance. We went at 4:30 on a Tuesday afternoon and there was hardly anyone there.  I have never tried anything except for the Chicken and Waffles (fried, not with the gravy) and I doubt I will try anything but that. The $10 plate had 2 big waffles and 2 pieces of chicken (your choice of a thigh and leg or a breast and wing). The waffles have cinnamon in them and are really good. I've never heard of eating chicken and waffles together, but I was born and raised in the south and have had TONS of fried chicken and biscuits. So, as someone who knows what GOOD fried chicken tastes like, I have to say, this was good fried chicken. It didn't have a lot of batter and it was nice and crispy. My kids (all under 5) CHOWED DOWN on the waffles - they really liked them.Good food. Will be back for sure.Oh, we rode the metro subway down to Hollywood and Vine. Short walk from there to Roscoe's. The metro parking lot is free and the ride is only $1.25 each way.

Reviews.Author: Tom T.
Reviews.Content: First off, the chicken and waffle concept was foreign to me, now I can't have it, any  other way!!!! The parking situation is the only downside....I LUV the juicy, chicken breast and waffle, you can't go wrong! This is always at the top of my list to take, out-of-town guests, not pretenious, and probably one of the most laid back establishments for a sit down- meal. It is typically crowded, but not to the point, where you can't hear the people that you came with. ...very affordable.

Reviews.Author: Steve D.
Reviews.Content: Our new favorite resto. Not because of the ambiance or the service but the food! It's sooo yummy, it outweighs all the negative things about the place..like the parking and the long wait. I can say that the wait is all worth it. The fried chicken is just the tastiest, yet not so greasy. I wonder how they did that? The waffles are also great. Can be too sweet for some, but I like it. What surprised me was the mac and cheese side dish. My daughter loved it so much, we had to taste it. It's definitely a must try too. We'll definitely be back for more..

Reviews.Author: Helen V.
Reviews.Content: Woooo please open one in San Francisco! I'm on a friend chicken craving right now! Thanks! :)

Reviews.Author: Brian R.
Reviews.Content: I will definitely be back, so delicious!!!

Reviews.Author: Leroid D.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a must-eat every time I'm down in LA. Though the spot is small, the service is always cool. This is where I get messy with my chicken and waffles, collared greens, cornbread, and some sweet tea. Oh yeah... bring some extra cash because it's bit pricey and you'd want to take a shirt home.

Reviews.Author: Sherie J.
Reviews.Content: I love Scoe's....mmmmmmmmmmmm YUMMY! Waffles...maple syrup...and fried chicken, I used to wonder what's the big deal...now I get it. Live a little...go to Scoe's.

Reviews.Author: Cam H.
Reviews.Content: I like the fried chicken; I like the waffles. But I'm not crazy about the combination. Also I had to wait about an hour to be seated. But I did see Wayman Tisdale there.

Reviews.Author: Helen C.
Reviews.Content: Lawdy, lawdy, why does such good food have to make me so fat?

Reviews.Author: Angelica R.
Reviews.Content: It is all about the fried chicken here, tasty and crispy.  The waffles are a tasty with them, though they are not the best waffles I've ever had.  This is just good solid southern comfort food. You can't have this all the time, but once in a while it is just right!  If you are not that hungry, you can just get one waffle and one piece of fried chicken.  My family enjoyed most of the meal, but felt that the sweet tea, and eggs were below par.  I would totally recommend the chicken though, totally worth the visit.  Sit in the back if possible, there is more ambience there than in the front.

Reviews.Author: rachface -.
Reviews.Content: this is gluttony at its finest.  clouds of fried chicken, mounds of mac n cheese, fields of collard greens, rippling waves of waffles, and a fountain of maple syrup... sounds like my slice of ghetto heaven.

Reviews.Author: Nima F.
Reviews.Content: I double-dog-dare you to find something more intrinsically "LA" than Roscoe's.The chicken is above average but the waffles excel. The chicken and waffles is what you come here for and they are a great combo indeed. The key, to me, is to eat the chicken and waffles together at the same time, as if it were a rice and meat dish. I wouldn't call it healthy, and so I wouldn't made it a point to come here often but its a nice gift to yourself, like a holiday made more special because it only occurs once a year. This is definitely is on my list of places to show anyone visiting from out of town. And I think it would be a good start to introducing someone to this great city.

Reviews.Author: Lily R.
Reviews.Content: From what I remember, the chicken was crispy and juicy. The waffles were warm and cozy. I just can't put the two together in a meal! LOL I did indeed like Roscoe's but if I only get to have it once in my lifetime I will be OK with it. ;)

Reviews.Author: Kearstin E.
Reviews.Content: Get's packed as hell so you have to be ready to wait. i do like all the celebrity autographs inside and its a cozy little atmosphere with friendly staff ... I guess my rating it just  'meh'  because it's nothing special at all. The chicken is greasy as hell and fatty and nasty (to me) since it's not all white meat. The waffles? eh... I've had better waffles at Denny's. I don't know who decided they'd be cool together but eh.... greasy fatty chicken+plain dry waffles- eh... I'd rather hit up McDonald's... but hey people love greasyness and fattyness so enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Hugh B.
Reviews.Content: I have heard of this place, and finally we went there... Was not sure about chicken and waffles in the morning.... I must say... they do have wonderful fried chicken. The waffles are still waffles but they were good. I feel like I ate at a classic spot. If you haven't been... you should.

Reviews.Author: Heather D.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, you alone are worth the long trip to LA. You are my first true love!

Reviews.Author: Annie G.
Reviews.Content: I must preface this review by saying that I actually really enjoy roscoe's chicken and waffles. I just hate the original Gower St. establishment.I have been here twice now, and both times they made us wait so long that we decided to leave.  The first time it wasn't their fault.  It was Sunday at noon, and there was a whole church crowd lined up to eat their chicken.  Fine, we'll just order to-go.  Many orders of chicken, waffles, eggs, gravy on the side, and all their other goodies go in, and in maybe 15-20 minutes, the food was ready.  Cool, I thought, they filled our order pretty fast.  I was very excited to go home (or in this case, to my friend's nearby apartment) to break open the chicken.We get "home" and hungrily start to dig into the food when we realize that they forgot what I consider to be the most important ingredient: the gravy.  Now, of course their waffles and chicken are good without it, but to me the gravy is what makes them GREAT.  And I'm positive we asked for gravy (in fact we may have asked for extra gravy).Strike one for this Roscoe's.A few months later, we decide to come here again, this time in the middle of the night (they do open till 4), after a bar or something.  We get there and are told that there's an hour wait.  Kinda long, but everyone wanted chicken so we all gladly waited.  Our name goes on a list and we sit down and wait with all the other 4th meal goers.  Not 15 minutes later, two scantily-dressed girls strut up to the host and ask to be seated.  To our utter amazement, he takes them in and sits them down at a table.  What happened to the waiting list?!  Will showing my cleavage and maybe a thigh and half a cheek shorten my waiting time?  Is that how they roll?  We decided to wait it out still, because girls get away with things like cutting in line all the time, and it seemed like they were still seating all the "normal" people in a timely manner in the order they arrived at the restaurant.  We wait about an hour and a half when the last group before us on the waiting list get seated, and by then our stomachs were growling and our mouths watering for some of their chicken.  Then, when the next table opened up, the host actually had the gall to seat another group, even though we all saw them arrive about 20 minutes after us!  We went to ask him what the heck that was about, and he just gave us attitude, and basically asked us to leave.  !@#$#$#@~~@#!  We waited our turn like everyone else!  If we knew the host was going to hand-pick who gets to go in and who doesn't, we would have taken our business elsewhere without wasting 1.5 hours waiting in the streets of Hollywood!  What the heck kind of service is that?!So anyway, to me this Roscoe's does not exist anymore.  If I want Chicken and Waffles, I go to the Pasadena one.  Sure, it may not have as much character as this one, but at least I get to eat without being discriminated against.

Reviews.Author: Juan M.
Reviews.Content: I know my two Stars could be considered blasphemy, but this was based on my experience on a late Saturday night which probably isn't the best time to go but I got home late and decided I would call ahead and take my chicken home.  When I got there my order wasn't ready and I waited an additional 20-30 mins, I got home they hooked me up with two tiny dry pieces of dark meat only.   The waffle was ok, my Mac and cheese was delicious but small and expensive.  I'm sure this place is good just don't come to the Hollywood location it's just not worth it.  Next time I'll try the one in pasadena and give them another chance.

Reviews.Author: Tommy C.
Reviews.Content: OVER...RATED... 30 minute wait to go inside for some dry a$$ chicken and average waffles. Fries were soggy and not crispy. Supposedly have the "#1 rated" mac and cheese but our waiter forgot to bring it to us. Will definately NOT be back.

Reviews.Author: Peter C.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmmmm, fried chicken over waffles.  Rarely do I make a trip down to LA and not visit this fine dining establishment.  The salty-sweet combination may sound disgusting at first, but try it and you'll start planning out your next visit.

Reviews.Author: Diana H.
Reviews.Content: ROSCOE's....YO!!ive been fantasizing about eating here forever.  The time had come on a thursday when we were freakin fried chicken hungary!  Since it was a weeknight there was no wait, we sat down immediately. The place was smaller then i expected, its old school country in the south decor. The menu was a little hard to follow, being that it was overwhelming enough that I was finally eatin' the roscoe's dream.  They have a large menu, mainly southern influenced, SCOE's #2 was the ticket.  They have a "gravy" option to add on the chicken & i was hesitant about the extra gravy, I thought it would be too much, but Im so glad I was convinced by my brother to get the damn gravy! There was another roscoe's virgin in my party & he was glad he got some gravy too...The chicken with gravy was so moist, tender &  flavorsome....it was a poultry orgasm with gravy on top! skeet skeet! Now the waffles, I usually like belgian style waffles, but these were the thin waffles.  They were really tasty, even better with the chicken & gravy.  The portions were a good size.  I was completely satisfied with my first Roscoe's meal.  I wanted to go back the next day.  The only reason why Im not giving them a 5 star rating is because of the service. It was fast, but  the waitress didnt really give me a welcoming southern roscoe's feelin, nor did i think she was listening to us half the time, so Im knockin' em for it.  I would go back anyday except on the weekend, because it  seems it would be a long wait...other then that it was finger lickin' gravy drippin' good.  Live the Roscoe's dream...

Reviews.Author: Cat L.
Reviews.Content: Fried chicken n waffles is like the best pair since PB & jam...or Ren & Stimpy! It's always crowded at any Roscoe's but can you blame them? The food keeps ppl happy and draws in new fans all the time. I don't know a single soul who has a bad thing to say about this place. If you hate crowds, get it to-go. But I like it eat it there so I can get my fill of their hot sauce. Mmm...I could drink that stuff.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth H.
Reviews.Content: Finally got to try this place and it was everything I expected it to be.  Chicken & Waffles.  Interesting combo.  Or shall I say heart attack on a plate?  I probably had the worst heart burn of my life after eating the chicken smothered in gravy with waffles smothered in butter and syrup, but wow - it was tasty.

Reviews.Author: Mario S.
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest with you, the food here is pretty much middle of the road.  Maybe two stars. And yeah, yeah, I'm a vegetarian so how can I possible critique a place like this?  Well, some of my favorite restaurants are BBQ spots that serve rich, steaming sides bursting with flavor (mac 'n cheese, beans 'n rice, cornbread 'n gravy, collared 'n greens), okay?  And the sides here are not so rich, steaming or bursting with flavor.  But the experience here (the surly atmosphere, friendly wait staff and history) is worth an extra 1/2 star, and I'll round up 'cause Yelp doesn't do half-stars and I'm in a good news right now.

Reviews.Author: Kendra G.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place, when I first moved to Los Angeles this was something I couldn't wait to try out. The food is delicious, not very health friendly but good to splurge once in awhile. I had never had greens before and I fell in love with them here. Their mac n' cheese is amazing too. Everything is. If you're looking for a great tasting meal, you gotta try this place.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: There are few ideas more appealing at 3am than coming here.

Reviews.Author: Rhonda S.
Reviews.Content: Consistently delicious!!! You almost can't go wrong with any of their menu items.  Order the #9 (3 wings and a waffle) and add a side of smothered potatoes.  Are they heavy? Yes, but worth the weight!!!! Also pick up a Lisa's Delight, their version of an Arnold Palmer. Yummy!

Reviews.Author: RollingCode T.
Reviews.Content: Yet another LA classic. Perfect chicken. Not an everyday thing, but when you want chicken, there is no other place.

Reviews.Author: Janis M.
Reviews.Content: ordered the chicken thigh and waffle...waffle was, like another poster said, an enlarged eggo ..not a thick buttermilk waffle like I was expecting...the chicken was delicious, fall off the bone, crispy greasy goodness! tried my daughter's greens, and they were so good I almost swiped them from her...the place is cramped and noisy, but that goes with the experience...would eat here again, and get more chicken and greens, and probably pass on the waffle..

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic portions - what a combo

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: out of all the locations... this one is my favorite.i LOVE coming here. i LOVE their fried chicken. i LOVE their gravy. i LOVE the atmosphere. i LOVE their waffles (but it must be accompanied by fried chicken). i LOVE the paintings on the wall. i LOVE their homemade fries. i LOVE roscoes. l always get the country boy (3 wings and a waffle), 1 extra wing, 1 thigh, order of fries, and a side of gravy (for the chicken and fries). another meal on my top 5 meals if i were to die.

Reviews.Author: Evelyn R.
Reviews.Content: This place is great!!  I love the waffles.  Waffles are good!!  At this place one will fill you up!  They are huge...huge!!  I can only eat one and trust me I can eat!!  The place is small and it gets packed so you will wait, but its worth it!!!  You gotta try it..I really dont care for the chicken, but the waffles are yummy :)

Reviews.Author: Daniel W.
Reviews.Content: Chicken, Gravy and Waffles.  Damn good.  I used the waffle to pick apart the chicken and dip in gravy.  Delicious.  I can't believe the locals pick apart this place.  If you aren't from LA, visit this spot.  Its straight up good.

Reviews.Author: chris b.
Reviews.Content: It's good.  It's alright.  It's like, whatever.

Reviews.Author: Modern L.
Reviews.Content: Yum!  First time for chicken and waffles and I will be back!!!!  I had the quarter fried chicken and 2 waffles combo - perfect!!!!

Reviews.Author: Mark L.
Reviews.Content: Kicks ass. There's nothing like mixing waffles, fried chicken, and Red Rooster. Our waiter was funny so thats a plus. Maybe one day, they will liquify the food for us to inject, it's that good.

Reviews.Author: Zoe T.
Reviews.Content: the first time i came here, it was darn good. my overall experience was worth about 4 stars.came here again last night. the whole ordeal was enough for me to pass on ever going again. not to be a dick or anything. i recently became a pescatarian and theres hardly anything on the menu i can eat now. a side of potato salad cost me 6 bucks and it was about 3 teaspoon size scoops. not worth it.first of all-valet. the valet guy was a flat out douchebag. he refused to take my car because it was a stick shift. hmmmm thats kinda odd considering you park cars for a living. so he tells us if we wait a minute he MIGHT be able to move a car and i can park it myself for 10 dollars. no thanks. but whatever. a little bit on the ghetto side and if you're not with at least one person of color it can get akward. im not trying to play the race card, some of the fellow diners can be a bit rude with the staring as if you dont belong. just not worth the journey, the parking, the waiting, and the sticky maple syrup tables.

Reviews.Author: Rj S.
Reviews.Content: Being from the bay, the closest thing to roscoe's was eggo waffles and kfc chicken. Finally got a chance to hit this place up, and I was not disappointed. I was expecting this place to poppin all the time with ridiculously long lines like Pink's, but it was not, maybe due to the time. To my surprise, the menu featured items that are not chicken and waffles. I ordered the house combo with 2 chicken wings, mac and cheese, greens, and cornbread with a side of waffles. The chicken was finger lickin good and the waffles were larger than expected. The side dishes were good as well and portions are generous. I can see why Snoop Dogg eats here all the time.

Reviews.Author: TheChef K.
Reviews.Content: I'm on a diet. So, I gotta stick to eating chicken. This place has good chicken. Really good chicken! I'm trying to stay away from white bread and this place has waffles with their chicken. The last time I checked waffles looked brown. So, I got my healthy chicken and brown waffle meal to keep consistent with my diet. I would highly recommend people who are trying to eat healthy to visit this joint. Make sure to drink diet coke!

Reviews.Author: Mike B.
Reviews.Content: If you want to eat and fall asleep happy without the use of alcohol or narcotics stop by this place for chicken and waffles. Some of the best waffles I've ever had, probably the best at a restaurant. Red beans and rice holds its own, and the corn bread is perfect. They have some signature drinks too, sun rise, half oj, half lemonade,  you can see the split. They have some other "sun" drinks, sunrise if I remember right and sunset, really though you will feel like the sun is shinning out of your ass when you leave this place, nothing could phase you after a meal here! Favorite place in LA!

Reviews.Author: Muffy F.
Reviews.Content: If this place were in Atlanta it would close in a week out of shame.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Always crowed, small cramped place, and sometimes my people's don't give the best service but the food is good! It's on point simple and plain! I usually call in my order it's a simple pick up and I'm out! Lol been coming here since I was a kid! Love it

Reviews.Author: Tony J.
Reviews.Content: Ok it's a little cramp, but if you can get past that and get to your meal you wont be disappointed. The chicken is one of the best I've had.  The combination of the savory and sweet is on point.  One other thing be ready to drive around looking for some parking if you happen to drive.

Reviews.Author: Cherrie W.
Reviews.Content: I always just order 2 piece of chicken and waffles with the gravy on the side! I don't want the chickens to be soggy. Perfect amount to fill me up. sometimes i'll get their corn bread, they give you a good amount to share with 2 people. It was kinda dry to me, but once i added some honey on to it, i demolished it!

Reviews.Author: Du T.
Reviews.Content: Best fried chicken I've had. Waffles were just OK. Come here is you want to go into cardiac arrest because you will come out a few pounds heavier. I ordered the traditional Scoes fried chicken and 2 waffles. I only finished about half my meal. Guy next to us kept asking if they had grilled chicken salad. I wanted to slap him. People in LA are so image conscious. Its southern food. There isn't anything that is not fried. No free parking nearby so bring some change for the meters.

Reviews.Author: Vera P.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it... I'm sorry guys, I'm kind of sad to write this review. I really wanted to like this place like everyone else. This was my first time going there, just like every body mentioned the wait sucks! (But I went there expecting that.) The service was also equally as bad. I understand that waitress must have been busy, but we waited for 20 min with no one acknowledging that we were even there. Then when the food finally came, we were not given utensils and just sat there looking at our food while someone brought some, that kind of sucks because by now we were starving.What Im sad about is that the food was bad too! I ordered chicken with gravy and waffles and mac and cheese...Pretty simple and straight forward. The waffles were soggy! I have always been under the impression that waffles are supposed to have a texture, maybe crisp or something. These didn't, they were just limp and boring, at least they got the shape right. The chicken, also soggy. I made a mistake with the choice of gravy on top, bad move. The mac and cheese was good/average, it was the best thing I ordered. I felt bad because my boyfriend likes this place, but I cant share any of the enthusiasm for coming here.

Reviews.Author: Hana G.
Reviews.Content: HEARTBURN. Wish someone told me dark meat was WAY better than white meat.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and Waffles...AMAZING! The chicken is great, get white chicken ( dark chicken? ew....) haha. But they have the BEST syrup and waffle mix ever. Dont get the Orange soda, it tastes kinda like its been sitting in mold. :/ The service isnt very good, they dont really pay attention to your needs, but the food is really good, so it makes up for it! I even went twice in one weekend! oops. :)

Reviews.Author: Cisco P.
Reviews.Content: " To me, heaven must be like a cross between a Sir-Mix-Alot video, and Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, cause I can have a thigh in one hand, AND A BREAST IN THE OTHER! " - Will Smith - Fresh Prince of Bel Air.Well said my man, well said. For me though, heaven would have to be a cross between Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles, AND ANOTHER ROSCOE'S CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! Yep, I was THAT blown away but the sheer over the top quality, and feel of this whole place. I came here from San Jose CA, where the only fried chicken we have is either KFC (garbage), or Popeyes (much better tasting garbage). As far as waffles go, I hear there's a good brand of frozen waffles you can get at any grocery store called Eggos (good until you had an ACTUAL waffle, then its  garbage). I only had food from here brought to me from LA to San Jose before so I was VERY interested in trying to all-mighty Roscoe's in its entirety and all its glory. I proceeded to order 2 breasts, 2 thighs, and a waffle. As I finished ordering, I saw a very small sign that said " ECONOMY SPECIAL! 6$ for 5 thighs! To-go orders only. So I did what any self respecting man and lover of fantastic chicken would do, I ordered 3 economy specials, duh! The wait to be seated was something like almost 2 hours so we ordered our food to go, as we were on our way back home to San Jose anyway. While waiting for our orders, I noticed there was a couple pictures of President Obama at Roscoe's. I thought that was pretty cool and that added a whole new depth of hype to the experience. I mean come on... THE PRESIDENT went out of his way to come here. That's kind of a big deal. Our orders finally came out and I love that they show you everything you ordered before they hand you the bags. I think this is something that EVERY place should do to avoid getting wrong orders. We headed back to the car and proceeded like kids who have just found a treasure chest on a deserted island, to open our containers of food...First thing I saw was the most golden colored, deliciously smelling 2 breasts I have ever seen. It made the KFC breasts I have become so use to, look like a murky pile of skin and bones. Right away I tore of a huge chunk of skin and the whitest and juiciest meat I have ever seen and inhaled it. OH MY GOSHHHHHH! I swear my whole life just flashed before my eyes just to let me know that nothing else in this world has even come close to being compared to the sacredness that I have just eaten. Absolute perfect. Next I tried to succulent thighs and before I knew it I had finished 8 of them. The skin on the chicken is so crispy and retains so much flavor. As full as I was, I knew I had to at least try to finish the waffle. Unlike the waffles I have become accustomed to, which are crunchy and small, this waffle was big and fluffy. It had a nice soft texture and a rich cinnamon-like flavor. I slathered that bad boy in butter and syrup and took a knife and fork to it. It was the most brilliant way to finish of the meal of gods. What ensued next was a nap for the next several hours. I finally realized what the Eurythmics were singing about when they said " Sweet dreams are made of these. "

Reviews.Author: Alison H.
Reviews.Content: How can you go wrong with chicken and waffles? Yummy!!!

Reviews.Author: Kelli A.
Reviews.Content: Brought family from out of town here and they loved it.  You can't NOT go to Roscoe's if you're visiting California LOL!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Heather Z.
Reviews.Content: My friends took me here last night for the first time because I've been DYING to try it. We got there at around 10 & had to park a little down the street because there was no parking nearby. There's a valet but we felt it wasn't necessary. We got to the little stand outside to give our name & waited around 20-25 minutes. Walking in I got blasted with the delicious smell of fried chicken & waffles, my mouth started watering. We sat down & our waitress was quick to ask what we'd like to eat & drink, I settled on the simple chicken breast & waffle w/ a glass of lemonade. The lemonade was too sweet for me, it tasted like they just dumped a bag of sugar in it but enough about the drink. The food came out so fast but so hot & fresh. Now I'm not the biggest fan of waffles but their waffles changed my mind almost instantly. If I'm ever gonna eat a waffle, I'm going to roscoes. & their chicken was delicious, fried to perfection & not at all dry on the inside. The whole experience was just this flavorful explosion with every bite. Definitely coming back soon !!

Reviews.Author: Van M.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to be very critical of a place that serves chicken and waffles on the same plate. I think that's fantastic. I like that they added on another room. That wasn't there the first few times I went and now it's much easier to get a table.

Reviews.Author: Chuck N.
Reviews.Content: "Scoe's" is everything it's hyped up to be. The 2 hour wait. Buying from street vendors who pull up in vans filled with stolen goods while waiting. Bums telling you how they beg for money just to buy a waffle and a sliver of chicken. The experience in itself is golden. The food, delicious. It's what you think it is. Crispy battered fried chicken with more gravy than a Thanksgiving dinner. What more could you ask for. I think I dipped my chicken every 12.2 seconds into the gravy. The waffles, not really my taste, but I could see how it would be other's fortes. I believe that I did gain 4 pounds eating a meal here. The cornbead is bomb too! I had to walk the entire Sunset Blvd and back just to work it off. Great "every once in a while" experience, though definitaly a heart-attack meal.

Reviews.Author: Michelle A.
Reviews.Content: Always heard good things, decided to stop in after walking by last night in a starving haze. Chicken was just ok, but with the waffles and syrup it was a great combination. Would go back if I'm in the area and my arteries are up for it.

Reviews.Author: Patty O.
Reviews.Content: Went to Roscoe's before a show at the Palladium saturday night...I haven't been to Roscoe's (the one on Pico) for almost 10 years so my memory was a little hazy. The only thing I remember is that I was full for about 48 hours after my meal. I ordered the breast & waffles and a biscuit on the side. The chicken was moist, not dry and tasted good with the waffle. The waffle wasn't the best I've had but it was still good. The only thing I was disappointed in was the biscuit. The biscuit tasted like it was microwaved-I tried to tear it apart and it actually was rubbery! I would go back only for the chicken and waffles but will pass on the biscuit. I recommend the punch/lemonade-very tasty :)

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: My friends kept on telling me that I had to try Roscoe's while I was in LA.  However of all the times I've been to LA, I never had time, or maybe I just didn't want to go on my own and try it.  So, when I was in LA with the friends that recommended this place, I went.  In our group, there were two of us that were 'Roscoe Newbie'.  So we walked from Kodak Theater to here, 1.25 miles to be exact.  We got seated and I had to ask my friends what they usually ordered when they came.  They started to throw numbers, etc., so with that, I reviewed the menu carefully before placing my order.I ordered Waffles with  dark chicken and side order of mac 'n cheese.  When my order came, I had two slices of waffles, a drum stick and thigh.  Maybe I don't know my waffles, but I thought they were same as waffles I get other places, so I wasn't impressed with their waffles.  I tried the mac 'n cheese and again, I was not impressed.  I had the fried chicken and outside of KFC, their chicken was good.  I guess it was over hyped... not sure if this was the cause, but I must admit, I was not impressed.  Service was great, the lady took care of us, but I think my friends hyped it up too much and I was expecting gold and I got silver.  I still enjoyed the food, but not sure if I would go back again to spend $14 on waffles and chicken...

Reviews.Author: Kaylin O.
Reviews.Content: See my other review for the other location.  The food at this location isn't as good as the other location.  Parking sucks and space is so small compared to the other location.  I prefer the other location so much better.

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Fried Chicken and it doesn't get any better than Roscoes. I've had fried chicken from New Orleans & Texas and it can't compare to Roscoes! This will be the BEST fried chicken and WAFFLES you've ever tasted! I'm from NoCal so they do not have a Roscoes here. But everytime I visit SoCal, I always pay Roscoes at least TWO visits. Try not to get the breast as it is MUCH bigger, which is less juicier and tastier. The smaller wings are VERY tasty.

Reviews.Author: Susan D.
Reviews.Content: Oh so tasty. First time I went here one of my friends of color insisted "I know it sounds strange, but trust me ... this place is off the chain." They were right. Love me some Roscoe's! Chicken is fresh, cooked just right -- and those waffles add a wonderful balance to the salty chicken.... hmmmm....

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place!! This is usually my first or last stop when entering or leaving the L.A. Area. Their fried chicken is crispy and juicy! The Mac and cheese, greens, and waffles are all tasty and fresh. Great service too! Saw the rapper Too Short there the day after Christmas last year. Pretty cool.

Reviews.Author: Wolfy W.
Reviews.Content: OK, I'll confess  that i went to Roscoe's a few moths back, but hey its still a review right? Anyhow, I had no problem finding this place in LA because I was here even before this. By all means, it is The BEST Hands Down Fried Chicken EVER for me (other than my Moms!!). The breast portions are very large with rib bone is incredibly moist and tender with the best crunch when biting into the chicken.  I didn't mind the prices if the product is very good !! I was going home the next day, so I order extra breasts  & thighs to take back to the SF Bay Area, Yes, Roscoe's cold fried chicken is also very good the next day!!

Reviews.Author: Pete C.
Reviews.Content: Combining breakfast with dinner... genius!

Reviews.Author: Jessie M.
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. If you can't handle it, leave so I can get a seat!

Reviews.Author: Alice L.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with chicken and waffles! Just thinking about it is making me hungry! Clearly, it's not the healthiest meal, but if you're gonna dine at Roscoe's, you can't be counting calories!I went this past Saturday for a late lunch and man...even at 2pm, there's still a wait. For a table of 2, we waited about 25 minutes. Not too bad considering the crazy amounts of people gathered outside. Food at this place is not really cheap. Getting chicken or sides a la carte can run anywhere from $1-5 (ie. a chicken leg is about $3!). Hence, we ordered one of their large entrees and shared it (1/2 chicken with 2 waffles $15). My bf also got a biscuit with gravy, which was about $1.50. It was plenty of food and we actually didn't even finish it. The fried chicken was crispy, fresh, and flavorful. Really tasty especially with the red rooster hot sauce! The biscuit and gravy and waffles were good too but not memorable. The waffles tend to be on the soft side (almost soggy), but I still liked it, especially after you cover it with butter and drench it with syrup ;) Maybe it's just that combination of chicken and waffles that makes everything oh so good!Parking is mainly along the street. You can also take the subway if you feel adventurous. Just pop out at Hollywood and Vine and walk about half a mile and you're there!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy F.
Reviews.Content: This is perhaps my favorite chicken and waffles resturant in the US. There is chicken and waffles place in Inndianapolis, but Roscoe's is amazing every time.I am a great fan of chicken and waffles and this place is a classic. I suggest getting the chicken, waffles, greens, and a biscuit. They have a combo that you can get all of this for around $15. I have been to the one in Hollywood and Pasadena. The staff is very friendly and the food is amazing. I like the dark meat more so, but that is a personal choice. Whenever I am in LA or the area, I make sure to stop at Roscoe's and you should too!

Reviews.Author: Mel G.
Reviews.Content: I live in the Bay Area now, but lived in LA for 5 years, and Roscoe's was a staple of comfort.  The chicken/waffles combo can't be beat, and they have delicious sides, too.  The mac and cheese and the cornbread are amongst my favorites.  You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: Is this the best food in the world? No. Does it hit the spot when the time is right? Yes! Don't be scared. Load up a fork of chicken and waffle and cover it in syrup. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Kim P.
Reviews.Content: We went here twice during our 4 day visit to Los Angeles. It was the first place we hit up after we got off the plane. I got one succulent breast and one waffle. The breast was indeed very succulent and juicy and the waffle was big. I couldn't finish it all. Our second visit was in the wee hours after club hours where it took a little longer to get a table, about 30 minutes. I ordered just a waffle, but picked off of my friend's chicken chili cheese fries. Yum. I will now have to have chicken added to all my future chili cheese fry orders. The food doesn't take long to come out and the service was great. Thumbs up Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: What can you say about this place that hasn't been said.  Its amazing!!!  Food is great.  Just the high calorie kick that I need every once and a while.  I always get the chicken and waffles.  So good.  This is a place you need to go to and experience first hand.  Also get a side of gravy for the chicken.  You wont regret it!!!

Reviews.Author: CHRISTY L.
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure that this is the first time I ever had to go past a bouncer to get to my fried chicken. The chicken was juuuuuuuuuuicy but I didn't think it had much flavor. Thank God for syrup and hot sauce.

Reviews.Author: Chloé M.
Reviews.Content: I just went to Roscoe's this year a couple months back, ashamed I know since I been on this Earth for 21 years. I'm so glad I drove from a bar in Pasadena to meet my friend there when he asked me if I would like to go with him after he got out of work. Ever since that night I been head over heels for that place and go every chance I get. I will purposely make errands in that direction so that we can stop in for dinner after. I absolutely love their waffles, smother on some butter and honey {I don't eat syrup} and I'm in heaven. Then, finish that off with a cup of hot cocoa and I'm in a good mood.Like any place in Hollywood, parking is pretty hard to find but the past few times we've been lucky. The wait for Roscoe's can be pretty tedious but again we've been pretty fortunate with that too. I really enjoy the atmosphere of the whole restaurant though it can get crowd, everything is well spaced so that you're not on top of each other and have a sense of privacy. There's an older gentleman he's never been our waiter but he is so funny like that grandpa you wish you had who's an old wise ass. Hopefully I'll be lucky enough to have him serve me one day since I'll be in there soon.

Reviews.Author: Kristina K.
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to try Roscoe's for so long that I was especially giddy about the opportunity after a crazy but awesome mud run that my friends and I did that very same day. As exhausted and drained as we were from that 4 AM wake up to the grueling run literally in mud, the idea of Roscoe's was extremely appealing that night.We hopped in the car and chose the Hollywood Roscoe's as our destination of feasting. The parking CAN be a pain (there is really only metered parking or valet) but we were able to snag a metered spot whose metered payment ended at 8 PM. We only had to pay 30 minutes worth of parking since we arrived at 7:30 PM. Win! Unfortunately, we were stuck in a line that quoted 30-45 minutes until we could enter. I took this as a good sign that the food was going to be great since it was a Sunday night and it was still packed. After about 45 minutes, we were quoted another 10 minutes...which sucked but we had already stuck it out and were craving fried chicken. We were finally called in and I saw that the restaurant itself is pretty roomy - there are two relatively big but divided sections. We were given our menus and were surprised at how many options there were! Since I wasn't super hungry, I decided to go with the Carole C Special.  This included 1 chicken breast and 1 waffle. It doesn't sound like too much but it was definitely A LOT once I received my plate. The chicken breast is HUGE! The skin was crispy and dipping the chicken into the syrup actually made it a little less dry. Other than that, I was disappointed at how dry the chicken was on the inside. I imagined the chicken to be juicy and succulent. The waffle was yummy though. It was a little bit on the flat and soft side as I was expecting a crispy waffle, but the flavor of it made up for my expectations. The waffle had a great cinnamon taste to it. My friend also got the same Carole C. Special item and we were dead after being quite close to finishing our plates. We must have been hungry after that run.My other friend ordered the Herb's Special that came with 2 waffles, 1 thigh and 1 breast. He finished his whole plate but not before having to  take a nap before the last few pieces. That's a nice thing about Roscoe's - you don't have to feel jipped of food since they give you PLENTY. We also ordered a side of biscuits and their famous mac 'n cheese which was difficult for us to finish. We should have stuck with our plates and not been too ambitious.I would return again...but not for a while. Service was great and I am finally able to cross this landmark off of my list. Win.

Reviews.Author: Lyn C.
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to try Roscoe's and now I finally have!  It was right before an interview, so I didn't want to eat too much...I got the Obama special: wings and a waffle.  Good chicken +  good waffle= good meal!  Kinda pricey, but I expected so.  Fortunately, there was no wait at all, so that was a plus.  The one complaint I have is PARKING which was a pain in the arse to find.  They do offer valet, but we just circled the block for street parking.

Reviews.Author: Johanna P.
Reviews.Content: This place is SOLID the best place to get chicken and waffles. Service is fast, excellent food, and prices are very reasonable. Not to mention you will walk out full and experiencing massive food coma. Every time we visit L.A. this is one of our favorite spots. Thanks Roscoe's

Reviews.Author: Ruobin W.
Reviews.Content: Eat the chicken with the waffles and syrup. Delicious. Obama special is great. Expensive though. 9 dollars for chicken and waffles.

Reviews.Author: Conor B.
Reviews.Content: The best thing that every happened to this place is the expansion. I've always loved coming here (especially for late night meals) but originally it used to take forever to get seated. A couple of years ago they expanded into the building next door and wait times are rarely over 15 minutes when I go. Service is always friendly and incredibly fast. It's a good thing I don't live walking distance from Roscoe's because if I did I would be there every day of the week and weighing several hundred pounds over what is healthy.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Ate here last night, I got the special they had and the chicken is pretty good. I would give the chicken a 8/10, the only problem was that one of them had a pretty bloody spot. I mean it was flowing red, so I just didn't finish that one and ate the other. The gravy is not bad, but it is only a step above bland. The rice was also bland, but I usually eat asian rice, so I guess I'm just not use to starch-less rice. It came with a biscuit that was small but pretty good, didn't even need any butter on it. Everybody I was with got pretty big sized portions and I think I only one other chicken was a little bit bloody like mine. I'm sure if I said something they woulda gave me another piece or something but I didn't care. If I lived in around one, I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Author: Brenda W.
Reviews.Content: YUM YUM YUM!!!! I had been really excited to try to Roscoe's on my recent visit to LA. I got the Carol B special, which was the perfect portion for me! The chicken was good, but it was the waffles that really made me swoon! I don't know what they put in the mixture but these are a must try!!!

Reviews.Author: Mister X.
Reviews.Content: Was not that impressed , first off parking is horrid , its metered and only goes up to a hour everywhere . The wait to get in was 55 minute for our table . It was hot as heck outside you wait in full sun nothing's covered . Lets just say the company outside is a lil strange homeless folks galore .when we finally got in the first thing the waiter says to me is we don't do separate checks .... It was my wife 4kids aged 5-17 my niece and her b/f aged 18 !!! I found that a tad odd !!!  I had the chickbreast waffle and a side of greens THE side was 4.60$ so I was expecting a huge amount ((((( NOT ))))) it was at best a ice cream scoop full way overpriced !!!! On the way to pay my bill the security guard follows me to the cashier to pay the bill !?!? Really how ghetto is that I truly thought this place was gunna be great but it was NOT !!! I truly think KFC tastes better Popeyes is 100% better !!!

Reviews.Author: Annie D.
Reviews.Content: I can't seem to figure out what is it that people love so much? The only thing i loved was the service other than that I'm not sure what the hype is about. So you can get chicken and waffles for breakfast/lunch.... The chicken wasn't crispy, no flavor. The waffles were just an average waffle. Maybe the gravy was good, but nothing here I can say was great. Just your average soul food joint, nothing special. Maybe I wasn't hungry enough..

Reviews.Author: Caroline Y.
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm...I kinda have mixed feelings for this place. The food is good. Very heavy but good. I saw Topanga from that show "Boy Meets World" there. I enjoyed the food and it was a very laid back place. The only thing I had a problem with here was that we had a cute little wittle baby cockroach roaming our table while we ate. Hmmm...we had to kill it. We had to okay?! So we squashed the cute little thing with a napkin and gave it to our server. He said, "Oops, sorry about that." and went about his business and that was that. The disturbing thing is...we all still finished our dishes...don't think I'm gross!

Reviews.Author: Eli B.
Reviews.Content: I'm another very occasional Roscoe's goer who likes the waffles better than the chicken. I think the combo is pretty bizarre. Honestly, I just go for the vibe, which is pretty darn special.

Reviews.Author: Lesly S.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars for Roscoe's, especially now that this location is much bigger and the waits are much shorter! We always end up here, and I am never mad when we give up on going somewhere else and just head toward Gower. I've narrowed the menu down to a perfect portion size to be totally satisfied and not feel like a total pig--thigh and a waffle, a side of smothered potatoes, and either a beer or lemonade. Sigh.

Reviews.Author: Dev C.
Reviews.Content: So it took me 4 years to come back to this place, but nothing much changed except that the waffles are better. The fried chicken is still meh. I REALLY gave it a go, I had a wing, thigh, leg, breast, and an omelette with fried chicken in it - and waffles. Nothing... I was left flaccid and unsatisfied. Am I missing something here?

Reviews.Author: Joseph C.
Reviews.Content: I went to Roscoe's during my trip to L.A. and it's one of my most memorable experiences of that trip. This particular Roscoe's is not too far off of the sunset strip near all of the "must see" attractions in the city. The restaurant facade is not very eye catching and neither is the decor inside. It isn't a fancy joint by any stretch of the imagination. But the decor isn't why you go to Roscoe's. You go to try the most amazing and yet unexpected combination of foods you will ever eat. CHICKEN & WAFFLES!My cousin had told me about this interesting combo after his trip to D.C. and assured me that it was something that I just had to try for myself. I ordered the half chicken with waffles, a side of mashed potatoes, and the mac n' cheese. Everything tasted really great. The mac n cheese and mashed potatoes were a great compliment to the meal. The star here though was the chicken and waffles. There's just something about the savory fried chicken, the softness of the waffles, and the sweetness of the syrup that just plain works. It's really something that you just have to experience for yourself.

Reviews.Author: Robert P.
Reviews.Content: Came here on Sunday night (9/1/13) for my first time and noticed there was a wait, I thought "must be good" so we put ourselves on the list.  I've been waiting to check this place out for a long time since we live in the Sacramento area and were in LA for the Labor Day weekend.  Once we got in the wife and I both ordered the #1 which is 2 waffles and 2 pieces of fried chicken, we also ordered sides of mac n cheese.  I will say that everything was TASTY!  The mac n cheese tasted just like what my grandma used to make.  The waffles had the best flavor of any waffles I've ever had, even the fried chicken was unbelievable.  The food and service was great.  The only reason why I didn't give it the 5th star was because once we sat down one of the hosts tried to get us to move somewhere else so they could give other customers our table, I thought that was pretty rude.  Other than that it was great!

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: Heck Yeah!!  We went here searching for a Hangover cure after a late night at the Hollywood Bowl and we were not dissappointed.  It was walking distance from where we were staying in downtown Hollywood and it was the perfect way to shake off the cobwebs of too many bottles of wine the night before.  I had the chili omelet and their chicken chili is AMAZING!!  Too bad we don't live close to this place as there were so many menu items I wanted to try.  It's actually probably good I don't live close to this place, I'd have coronary heart disease in two years.   Great Comfort Food!

Reviews.Author: James G.
Reviews.Content: If you're in Hollyweird, you MUST visit Roscoe's.   Thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Author: Myke R.
Reviews.Content: I remember coming from Florentine Garden's just to get this fried fantasy in my belly.
