Now it's just every LA trip I can make requires a stop at Roscoe's...didn't  they make a movie called House of Chicken and Waffles? So this is what I like, a whole fried chicken with gravy on the side, and waffles. Sometimes the gizzards cuz I gotta get back to my roots. Then you smother the waffles in syrup and butter. You take some hot fried chicken...Add a lil hot sauce...dip it in gravy....and pile it with waffle...that is where the magic happens.A chemical reaction to the combination of this chicken causes endorphins to rush into your body and makes it convulse into an oral orgasm. Thus in reaction...."if you ain't got no rhythm...hehehe you will....When you walk out of there....you may waddle and smile from being soooo bad witchoself.  Steer away from the Cali cuisine of salad and seared ahi....and git stuff that stick to yer ribs.....Hehehe my favorite roscoe's memory was a wet day from rains and I was waddling out of roscoes with extra for later ya know...and I stepped on poo ....yea it was disgusting....and I cleaned it off as much as I can - my friends were mad from the smell especially in the car. But Roscoe's covered it up like a good air freshner...oh yea....

Reviews.Author: Rob L.
Reviews.Content: My vice when I go to LA! Where can you go and see the likes of many RnB/Hip Hop artists and Black celebrities chowing down on some DAMN good Chicken, however you GOTTA dip in the maple syrup! The grits are some good stuff! It can get cramped in there and loud and busy, and sometimes the wait can be like hors long, but DAMMIT this is one good spot!

Reviews.Author: Theodore W.
Reviews.Content: Wow, the scrambled eggs were spectacular, the best I've ever had. The chicken sausage patty was as well. The buckwheat waffle was pretty good (from someone who has eaten a lot of buckwheat pancakes). Others in the party were a little less impressed. Smothered potatoes were also pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Cherlyn B.
Reviews.Content: I've been to 3 different Roscoes locations. The chicken is so good. It seems like they don't make it til you order it because as I bit into my chicken wings, steam was coming out. Mac&Cheese, collards, and corn bread was exactly how I imagined, Mmm Mmm good. The environment is... um.. interesting. The people are very nice, but found it weird when first arriving to one of the locations. It kind of felt like I was at a club or something because there was a man dressed in all black. He asked how many people were in our party, and then closed the door. 15 minutes later he opened the door and brought us in. I thought it was so funny. I was like, "well there's a story to tell" Definitely stop by ROSCOES just to say you've been here. I mean.. Snoop goes here!

Reviews.Author: Bryan N.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles together at last!!! After a night out in Hollywood, Roscoe's provides the food you need to make it back home. Roscoe's chicken is delicious alone but top it with their trademark gravy and you have a whole new experience. Their waffles are light and fluffy and compliment the flavor of the fried chicken perfectly. While a bit on the expensive side due to its prime location, the generous portions make up for the price. The service has been excellent the times I have been to Roscoe's and the dining area is nicely adorned and cleaned. Food is quickly bussed to your table, even late in the night. Be sure to make a visit to this LA landmark!

Reviews.Author: Jeff P.
Reviews.Content: Wow. What's not to love here?  The best fried chicken. The best waffles. The nest red beans and rice. A great, happy atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Kathy R.
Reviews.Content: I've heard so much about this place and I expected so much. A lil' ol' girl from Texas in the big city and the food was kindof dissapointing! The place was so greasy! I mean, its probably the best soul food they got out there in LOS ANGELEEZ.

Reviews.Author: Tonie B.
Reviews.Content: The food was okay even though they have made the waffles so thin that you can almost see through them.  The chicken was a little salty.  The server was good but the guy Jay, who seated us skipped over us on the seating list and after the hostess told him that he asked us in and then had us wait while he seated another lady and then didn't even acknowledge that he had made a mistake and called us guys, I mean I know I have worn my hair short but I have never looked like a guy, then the water boy came and threw our water at us without a hello or an apology that he splashed water on the table because he threw it down and then did it at the table across from us so I know it wasn't just me tripping because the guy across was upset and his girl had to calm him down.  I called the manager to complain who stood there eating Cheetoes while we talked to her, I mean a big bag of Jalapeno Cheddar Cheetoes, imagine that.  The water boy stared at me until I asked him if he wanted me to punch him in the throat.  I think I will make my own waffles and fry my own chicken at home from now on.

Reviews.Author: Jack C.
Reviews.Content: I know everyone loves this place, but my first (and only) impression of this place was negative. First off our silverware was dirty, which was promptly corrected. When we received our order, the eggs were absolutely dry despite us telling the waitress how we wanted them done. The chicken was super dry and hardly any meat and super saturated with grease. I understand fried chicken has grease, but when It's dripping then there's a problem. Quality fried chicken is not saturated with grease. The waffles were crap and everything was plastered with salt. The service was fast, and the waitress was pleasant,  but all I wanted to do was go barf. I felt ill from the grease for a good 6 hours. I've made up my mind that the average person is clueless to what is good food.

Reviews.Author: Keith H.
Reviews.Content: Good Food!  Great Staff!

Reviews.Author: Dee W.
Reviews.Content: THis place was talked up but after a night of drinking, the fried chicken dripping (slathered) with their delish gravy was the perfect meal.  Service was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Author: Lily L.
Reviews.Content: Very yummy stuff but really rich and super greasy.  Be prepared to be full till the next day.

Reviews.Author: Beth B.
Reviews.Content: The waitress yelled at my friend to get his elbows off the table, then served us one of the most delicious down-home N'Awlins style meals I have ever had -- and my Mom's from New Orleans! Not for the faint of artery, however....

Reviews.Author: Miguel V.
Reviews.Content: Well, I'll try to be brief cuz I'm just updating my previous review for this place. Came here this morning with my wife for her first Roscoe's ever! I've been to this location a few times, but this was just the second time that I actually got to eat in the restaurant as it is usually way too busy to even bother, so I just get take-out. This time was pretty early, so we got a table right away and were attended to very closely by our waitress throughout our visit.       I ordered the Jeanne Jones chicken and cheese omlette with a waffle (about $8.50) and my wife got the thigh, leg, rice, gravy and biscuit (about $8.50). Mine was just what I expected, maybe better. Pieces of cut up fried chicken with melted cheese wrapped in eggs? Genius. And the waffles and syrup are always on point. My wife enjoyed her food as well, but, of course, it was not as good as momma's home cooking. I have to agree with that, but it was about the experience and momma was over 100 miles away. Great service at this location, but very small dining room and usually a long wait. However, I found that the food digested quite nicely on this visit, without any of the unpleasant feelings that go along with heavy food (see cement mixer).

Reviews.Author: Katie O.
Reviews.Content: My first "Chicken & Waffle" experience.  I was a bit hesitant of having breakfast (waffles and syrup) with fried chicken, but I'm so glad I came to roscoe's.  It was delicious!  If I'm ever in LA and craving for some chicken and waffles, I'm coming to roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Ashley L.
Reviews.Content: First of all I'm giving one star solely based on their customer service. I didn't get to eat here unfortunately. Based on the other reviews it seems like the service is usually good and the food is awesome, so maybe I came here on an off day or something. First of all, we were seated quickly which was nice but then it all went down hill. The restaurant was not busy, there were plenty of open tables and plenty of servers standing around. Somehow though we waited for 30 min without even getting acknowledged. Now I've waited tables before so my patience level is very high when it comes to customer service. Even some eye contact or a be there in a minute hand movement from across the room and I would have stayed. I plan to try a different location but have no desire to come back to this one.

Reviews.Author: Jonnell T.
Reviews.Content: Still LUV Roscoe's!

Reviews.Author: Gladys C.
Reviews.Content: Chicken, waffles, GRITS and lots o butter! This place is the best. There's usually a long wait at the LA location, but the Pasadena location is not as crowded and the food is just as good. The collard greens are really yummy and the grits are to die-for! Definitely give it a try! And Yes - I've been here many times sober and it's still very good.

Reviews.Author: Angie J.
Reviews.Content: good fried chickengood crispy wafflesgood syrupy syrupokay serviceokay space - kind of crowdedno elbows on the table!!nonetheless - i still love roscoe's

Reviews.Author: Mel L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 3 times now. I don't really get the hype. I mean, the chicken is good. The waffle is good. The combo is surprisingly not gross. but the hype? i just don't understand. the portions are pretty good, grant you that. our server has always been super friendly too. 3 stars cuz it's good overall, but not spectacular. this'll sound weird.. but go doing dinner when there's more people. it makes it more... fun.

Reviews.Author: Rosella S.
Reviews.Content: greasy goodness: this is an absolute guilty pleasure. deep fried chicken and grits - i must have been a southerner in a different life!parking sucks and sometimes the wait for an open table can, too.  but it's worth the artery-clogging fried chicken.  don't forget to order cornbread and some sweet potatoe pie - yum!

Reviews.Author: Talle R.
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm a late bloomer and have not been to Roscoe's prior to coming here this weekend. I was in serious need of sobering up after our pub crawl through downtown L.A. and Roscoe's did the trick. As a first timer, I was convinced to try the Scoes #1 meal. It consisted of two pieces of chicken (I'm a white meat eater) and 2 huge portions of waffles. Can I just say that these are probably the best tasting waffles I've ever had? I want the recipe! I've had better chicken but with a ravenous appetite @ 2am, it was delish. Chicken and waffles...what a concept. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Anni L.
Reviews.Content: I went on a Thursday around 2PM. It was slow and the service was great.  The chicken is good. It tastes home made. Its NOT nasty KFC!!! My Husband is from the south and he said it tasted like the Fried chicken his mom made when he was a kid. I had one drumstick, one biscuit and one waffle. Perfect. They did however put a HUGE amount of butter on my waffle and biscuit. ( I scraped them off my food and put the two butter balls together and it must of been a little over 1/4 cup!)  He are usually healthy eaters and this is a good "once every few months treat" to eat yourself to some comfort food.

Reviews.Author: Ramil M.
Reviews.Content: Man I just don't understand why people would have such a bad experience, maybe at times you do get the swift non celebrity back of the line, swift kick in the butt, except if you really come to deny Roscoe's chicken or it's waffles, then it gets personal. Like the dude who lives in Hancock, Ca. where the hell is that? It sounds like a closet case city, where people who eat vege burgers , and drinks fruity martini's, and discuss their calorie intake. Hey Roscoe's is a man's meal, it doesn't mean men whip out their slongs for meals, or any gay stuff. Roscoe's is a great establishment, with great food, and great service, the only place I think that resembles Roscoes, is Waffle House in Georgia. If you don't like Roscoe you can live in Hancock, CA

Reviews.Author: Sheryl P.
Reviews.Content: my bf & i went here because of snoops reality show.we were going to venture melrose after lunch so fromour drive from norcal we decided to just eat at this onerather than the long beach location. we dont know if itsjust this one, but we were definately disappointed. shit,the chicken was hella burnt, yet it was served cold? wecouldnt understand how that happened. the sweet teawas good, i was surprised that it was peach tea. i wasassuming it was just regular sweet tea. the service wasawkward, i mean it was quick & all, but the lady rushedus in ordering our food. i mean it was our first time thereso of course its going to take us a little while to decidewhat we were going to order. ehhhh. & lastly, i did lovethe waflfles. they were definately good, no joke. maybethe next time we'll head down to long beach & try thatlocation & maybe my thoughts of these place will change.

Reviews.Author: Hannah L.
Reviews.Content: Out of curiousity came here with the boyfriend to try the place out since we were down in so cal for a week of vacation. You always hear about Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles from rappers to celebrities to random blog rantings, which made me even more curious since there is none in the bay area. I've got to say the mixture of eating chicken with waffles sounds somewhat disgusting, but it's actually pretty good. The chicken is very crispy and the waffles are very fluffy. This place will totally fill you up though, so be prepared to have the longest case of food coma once you're done eating.

Reviews.Author: Vivian L.
Reviews.Content: MMMM hella good. Came here yesterday. The waffles have a hint of cinnamon flavor inside of them and the chicken isn't overcookedor anything. Too bad I don't live in SoCal hahaha

Reviews.Author: Ali F.
Reviews.Content: Food came out VIP FAST! Lived up to its name! The chicken was on point! But sorry Roscoe Waffle House has the best WAFFLE!

Reviews.Author: Ramzi E.
Reviews.Content: Had Roscoe's for the first time tonight and thought it was ok.  Honestly, the best thing about the place might have been incredible smell of fried chicken lingering in the air as the friendly host led us to our seats in the back room.  We both ordered chicken breast and waffles and found the waffles to be less than average while the chicken turned out slightly better than average.  I guess I'm glad I checked it off my "LA restaurants I have to eat at before I regain my sanity and finally decide to move to Europe" list, but at the end of the day, it was a pretty forgettable experience altogether.

Reviews.Author: Susan L.
Reviews.Content: Damn good chicken and some fine waffles too. I filled up on the waffles so next time I would probably order only one waffle and more fried chicken. My bf got the red beans and rice and we were both unimpressed. He's a Louisiana swamp rat so knows his red beans and rice and I'm a glutton so know my food. I've only been once but based on that I would stick with the friend chicken and waffles. Staff was friendly but our server could have been a little more attentive. I also ordered a Bartyles and James. I was hoping for a wine cooler but got a margarita flavored malt beverage. I probably will not order that again, ahh nostalgia.

Reviews.Author: Rommel N.
Reviews.Content: Finally got to try the legendary Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. And the verdict? It was aight. I don't know if it was the hype but it kinda fell flat for me... the chicken anyway. I kinda found the chicken a little dry and not a lot of seasoning. I don't know if it was just a bad batch of chicken or a bad day, or the wrong location, but I just wasn't feeling the chicken. I didn't even get to finish my chicken. Now the waffles on the other hand I could've eaten for days. They were so fluffy and loved the hint of cinnamon in the batter. Their mac n cheese was ok and the biscuits were fluffy as well, but their fries were on the uber greasy side. All in all it wasn't bad, but it wasn't the greatest either. I think the hype kinda killed it. I'll probably get flamed for my comments, but it is what it is.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: Came here to grub before heading back to San Jose!!!! Got a half chicken and 2 waffles just to make sure I have left overs to bring back home. This place was very cozy and welcoming! We had the best waitress ever! She was able to chit chat and joke around with us since we were hungover and distracting. The food is to die for! Even with its cold its still flavorful, (ate a bit while driving back teehee). Definitely cannot miss going to Roscoe's every visit to LA.  =]

Reviews.Author: Janice V.
Reviews.Content: Took my sister and boyfriend to lose their Roscoe's virginity. Luckily when we went here it wasn't busy and there was parking right in front. I'm so glad we stopped here because I've been craving their waffles for over 2 years now since the first time I've ever been to a Roscoe's. I think the reason why I love their waffles because it taste like cinnamon, lol. I suggest getting the chicken leg rather than the breast just cause the breast is really dry.

Reviews.Author: Rasheda H.
Reviews.Content: OMG some of the best food I have EVER had!!! Amazing chicken!! I got the chicken and red beans rice. AMAZING. I also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese. My best friend and I ate here twice during our four day stay in Cali. Even tho I hate LA, next time I cant wait to come back to eat some of their amazing food!!!

Reviews.Author: Peter D.
Reviews.Content: Come here for my first time after a late night screening of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow" (with Johnny Depp) at the Paramount studios back in '99. We were hungry, wanted something different...and got it. Since then it's been simple: Hit me up with a CAROL C. SPECIAL (juicy breast/waffle) and get out DA way! No need to fuss with what works. The one-two punch of the sweet and salty makes for a perfect taste combination. I've been to their other locations, but I will always come back to Gower.

Reviews.Author: Jen M.
Reviews.Content: Fried Chicken?  Yummy!  Friend Chicken Livers?!  YUMMERS!!!  Plus, served with grits and a side of gravy? I'm in Foodie Heaven.I've heard this is the original establishment for California.  I love this place.  I guess because of the local nightlife, they have a valet, doorman, and a guy standing sentry at the exit door too.  All to keep us hungry foodies safe and sound.  I'm good with it.Between this location and the one in Long Beach, I think I prefer this one.  It's a little cozier, and the people here are just downright FRIENDLY and NICE!!!I know I should try something different, but I just LOVE the Stymie's Special.  I could probably actually do without the biscuit, the serving of chicken livers is just outrageous.  My son is always happy when we go to Roscoe's, even if he isn't with me because he knows there will be some yummy leftovers coming home!  There is just no way anyone can finish that whole plate in one sitting.Their candied yams are yummy too - they serve them diced up.  Love drowning my grits in butter with just a dash of salt and some nice healthy shakes of pepper.Some sweet iced tea to help it all go down....mmmmmmmmmmThis is definitely our go to spot anytime we see a show at the Pantages!

Reviews.Author: June P.
Reviews.Content: Big Mama Special!!! The potatoe and gravy is delish... Mix that with the scrambled eggs..... Heaven.... Nom nom nom

Reviews.Author: Janelle G.
Reviews.Content: Ok, when I first heard "Chicken & waffles" I thought SICK...THAT'S NASTY!!! I finally decided to give it a try...OMG!!!! I kicked myself in the ass for not trying this long ago!!! It's so delish!!! The service here is fast and super friendly! We decided to go at the last minute and were walking up to the door with like 3 minutes left before they closed and one of the workers (a chick) told us "hurry, hurry...we're gonna close!" I thought that was cool of her to let us in, most places would of told us we were S.O.L! And since we got there basically when they closed, we were not rushed at all! The only thing I was iffy about was the area and the parking. Parking can be a biatch at times but totally worth driving around and around to find a spot. :-)

Reviews.Author: Erica T.
Reviews.Content: Waiting to be seating was about 10-15 mins for a table of 4. Which I thought wasn't bad since it was a busy night.  Once we were seated,we waited another 5mis just for a waiter to take our drink order. Once we got our drinks ordered we decided to order our food as well. Once the Food came the waffles were cold chicken was OK. I can now mark it off of one of my places to try. But that's about it. I will NOT be returning.

Reviews.Author: Felisha M.
Reviews.Content: The best chicken and waffles I've ever had! I definitely recommend this place everytime I'm in town I make sure I stop here! We also had the greatest service ever Yolanda was an amazing waitress! Thanks for the great experience!

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: I loved it ! First time ever having chicken and waffles and I can see what all the fuss is about . It was the best dang waffle and the chicken was divine . Even the syrup was ahhhmazing . I will be back for sure ! My niece ordered the Mac & Cheese and I thought it was pretty good too, but she thought it could have been cheesier . Fun spot to stop in and we were thankful we found a parking spot on the street and didn't have to pay the 10.00 valet. Add it to your bucket list of places to try!

Reviews.Author: V N.
Reviews.Content: I don't think anyone who owns or works at this place gives a crap but service is so terrible I cant even describe. Food is food though

Reviews.Author: Kay V.
Reviews.Content: i'm not exactly BIG on fried chicken...but i'm such a FAN when it comes to ROSCOE's fried chicken breast with a sweet piece of waffle. that's my fave - the Carol C. specia: 1 piece of succulent chicken breast & 1 large waffle...the perfect size for a mini-mouth eater like me! i am proud to say i ate 3/4 of my plate than my average 1/2 plate!! my MAMA would be proud! i loved the mac'n cheese as well. gravy mixed with rice is also one of my personal fave's! it's worth the wait!! this location is near a starbucks where we killed about a half hour of our wait drinking a late morning cup of joe & time to read the paper!

Reviews.Author: KP P.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is one of my all-time favorites. I have been to the Pasadena, West L.A. and Hollywood locations at least 15 or 20 times and never once was I disappointed. Don't let the other menu items distract you, even though many of them are great. They are called Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles for a reason. Pairing together fried chicken and moist spongy waffles covered in butter and syrup (Scoe's special #2) is one of the most genius combinations ever invented. The space is crowded and there is often a wait, especially on Sundays or after 2 am, but again, there is a good reason. I've seen more than a few celebrities roll up in their limos to pick up a take-out order and avoid the crowds. For first-timers though, you should really enjoy the whole atmosphere of the place.

Reviews.Author: Manali K.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome and an LA must go to place. Anyone who does not appreciate the sheer genius of combining fried chicken, belgian waffles, and gravy topped by mass amounts of butter and grease is crayyyzie! Usually when I come here, (which is not often because I do not want to die of a heart attack) I get the 2 waffles, white meat chicken along with some gravy and a side of mac and cheese. Then, i pour maple syrup over the waffle, eat it with a bite of chicken, and enjoy. The first time I came here, I could literally feel my arteries getting clogged by all of the grease that I had just consumed. I went for a repeat visit late last nite at 2:30 am during a drunken food run, and I have to personally thank Roscoe's from preventing a really nasty hangover from occuring this morning. I savored every bite of it and looooved the mac and cheese.  Thank you Roscoes, thank YOU!

Reviews.Author: Ross R.
Reviews.Content: split the herb's special or get the jeanny jones omelette. nuff said.don't order an arnold palmer here.

Reviews.Author: Anita L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!! (And I'm originally from the South)More to follow

Reviews.Author: Greenballoon X.
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, I want to tell you to bring an appetite: plates of fried chicken, syrupy waffles and rich southern sides are something to leave room for. But practically speaking, you could be in for quite a wait, especially at the Hollywood location. But once you're in, forget your diet (you'll be hard pressed to find anything endorsed by a nutritionist) and remember the cooking from the southern grandma you never had.

Reviews.Author: Shahboz K.
Reviews.Content: HOLLYWOOD!! After hearing so much about the chicken and waffle craze I finally talked someone in to going with me.  BOY HOWDY! that is the best chicken I have ever had. Everyone talks about how awesome the waffles are. Don't get me wrong they are pretty good but the chicken is where it is! I love that place I love waiting in line, I love sitting in the dark, I love the Biblical Pictures on the walls. I Used to enjoy drinking a Michelob, but now they serve Michelob Ultra. Screw that! MY girlfriend brought me leftovers the next day I ate them cold. I could do a seperate reveiw about how awesome thier cold leftovers were. But I wont.   I have personally only met two people who do not like this place. You know what I call them CRAZY! thats right dad! I called you crazy.

Reviews.Author: Jared A.
Reviews.Content: If by chance one day I am held hostage and am offered one last meal...I would order Scoe's #2 with Greens. I would die happy and full. I think the secret is in their waffles man....the best I have ever tasted. I'm going there now...

Reviews.Author: Monica J.
Reviews.Content: Yummy!!!  Its all about the number 13- Carol C Special with 1 succulent breast and 1 delicious waffle- and all you need is a side of Greens and you are good to go!!!

Reviews.Author: Monique C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place after a long night of drinking best fried chicken i ever had! But you have to be served by Big Mama shes the best!

Reviews.Author: Alex R.
Reviews.Content: It should go without saying but the chicken and waffles are very good. I would also recommend the biscuits and gravy. Everything else on the menu I haven't found to be very good but the greatness of chicken, waffles, and biscuits and gravy are all you need. If you're going to this place late at night/early in the morning, be prepared for a bit of a wait. Oh, and the parking situation is terrible.

Reviews.Author: Roger C.
Reviews.Content: I effing LOVE this place! Their chicken is always super moist with a fresh crisp on the outside. And the gravy is sooo good. I usually get it on the side for dipping my chicken and thats all you need. Corn bread is kind of dry sometimes, but still good. And of course the waffles is what tops it all! they actually have buckwheat waffles as well. Either or, its all kinds of amazing.

Reviews.Author: Joey B.
Reviews.Content: Chicken Breast,Waffle,Maple Syrup...Great Combination...This place made me like a waffle other then the Belgian kind...So good...

Reviews.Author: Alvaro T.
Reviews.Content: Slow death on a plate. Sweet, buttery, fried (and smothered, when I get it) death on a plate.  Sooooo bad for you, yet sooooo tasty!

Reviews.Author: Joanne S.
Reviews.Content: minimal wait time for saturday lunch. really good service, nice waiter. he did forget about my side order of greens, but whatever. ordered the #19 which was two pieces of fried chicken and some rice with gravy. it said it was gonna come with a biscuit too but it didn't. nevertheless, i had plenty of food and couldn't even finish it. i tried the waffles and they were good.....overall, pretty good. the chicken was mad dry but it still hit the spot.honestly, i miss the real deep south soul food. aint nothin better..

Reviews.Author: Ume E.
Reviews.Content: My mouth likey but my belly don't....  darn good chicken and waffles, but makes me think twice about eating my way closer to a heart attack.

Reviews.Author: Alicia T.
Reviews.Content: i love the sage fried chicken at hash house a go go and we have had two different waitresses there tell us that the chicken was like roscoe's...so we had to go the next time we were going to be in LA.let me just say this:  the fried chicken was great.  it gave me a feeling of being back in the south.  i don't think it was better than the sage fried chicken at hash house and the tractor room, but it was damn good and i never really expected it to be similar.the waffle on the other hand was....nothing to write home about.  for being the "house of chicken and waffles" i feel a little disappointed.  but what the heck!  four stars because the man that seated us was RAD!, the chicken was rad and i would go back.  i'll just make sure to pass up the waffle and go straight for the chicken with candied yams, mac and cheese, greens and corn bread!  yuuummmm.

Reviews.Author: Chris W.
Reviews.Content: We came, we conquered, we would do it again. Howver, eating like this everyday is not a great idea unless you want to die somewhere in your early 30's. But it was definitely filling and amazing nonetheless.

Reviews.Author: Courtney R.
Reviews.Content: When you go to So. Cal how can you not go get chicken and waffles and the rice and gravy from Roscoe's. My dining companions were digging the mac & cheese but I took a bite of it and "meh". Where is the Nor Cal Roscoe's?!!

Reviews.Author: Clara C.
Reviews.Content: another one of my favorite comfort food restaurants.  when i'm feeling naughty it's off to roscoe's for some rib stickin' fried chicken & gravy. i usually get the "2." 1/4 chicken covered with gravy & onions with 2 waffles.  this is just way too much food for one person and i end up taking food home.now i've never been to the south so i don't know how it compares but ya kow, who cares...it tastes damn good!service can suck...just depends.

Reviews.Author: Carlos F.
Reviews.Content: Overrated. Had the number 13. Chicken was really oily and was kinda bland....maybe the seasoning was off. Mac and cheese was dry only thing that held it's own was the waffle.

Reviews.Author: Xandy M.
Reviews.Content: Everytime I eat Roscoes Chicken & Waffles I always go to this location, I have yet to try out the one in Long Beach and the one off Pico.  Fried chicken will probably be the death of me because i love it soo much, and for reals, Roscoes Chicken & Waffles makes THEE best fried chicken EVER!  It is the best because people pay big bucks to eat here.  I've never seen fried chicken so expensive.  And who would ever thought pairing Fried chicken and waffles would taste so amazing.  Chicken and waffles definatley goes hand in hand.  Walking into this restaraunt you immediately smell the goodness that's cooking.  The restaraunt itself is dim lighted and there aren't too many tables and seats so be prepared to wait a little.   Their mac and cheese is really good with your meal I always order the Herbs special, it comes with 1/2 chicken and two waffles.  Eat this and you will be full, trust me!

Reviews.Author: Judy H.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoes! This place is oily from all the grease ... the door handles to the restaurant, bathroom, chair stools, and table ... everything is covered in chicken grease! It is sooo delicious .... the chicken stays crispy despite being smothered in the yummy gravy.  The pancakes are amazing with a hint of cinnamon.  The sunrise and sunset drink is also fun to get.  You could never go wrong with Roscoes, but you can only go there every once in a while considering the heaviness of the meal =)

Reviews.Author: Jason D.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best fried chicken I have ever had.  I also think the waffles are incredible with that cinnamon batter they use.  I mac n cheese if awesome with the black pepper in it and the biscuit is homemade and delicious.   I love it however I only come here once a year for this kind of food.  Very heavy for me but I split the #3 with my girlfriend and we were perfect.

Reviews.Author: Jonny A.
Reviews.Content: We found meter parking practically in front of the place. We walked in and were seated immediately. We had a very nice lady for our server who did everything perfectly. Food came out QUICK and HOT!  No joke, I had to take mini breaks from pulling apart my chicken because it was that hot hahahaha. The gravy on the mashed potatoes is extraordinary. I would bathe in that. The chicken itself is like no other. You will never have chicken as tasty as this -- same goes for the waffles. These are not Eggo's. There's something in there -- cinnamon? Brown sugar? Something in them gives them this sweet taste I've never had in other chicken and waffles knock-offs. Prices are great and I saw all kinds of deals posted on their walls -- even for carryout. If you haven't been here yet, I feel sorry for you.

Reviews.Author: Steve W.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so may be it is because I use to live in Houston and had great home made sole food and home made Fried Chicken, but I was not impressed. I was so looking forward to trying Roscoe's, perhaps I created a false level of expectation in my mind before I sampled the food. You need to try it since it is an LA institution, but do not get your hopes up.

Reviews.Author: Somchai S.
Reviews.Content: In LA for the day and had to stop by. Parking does suck. We came on a Sunday evening and were seated instantly. Being chicagoians we had never heard of chicken and waffles. My bf has the country boy and I had 3 wings w smothered potatoes. The gravy tasted like flour.  Next time I think I'll stick to chicken and waffles. But the fried chicken was amazing. Very juicy and tender. It was very fresh and we were served quickly. What shocked me were the prices.  It was $9.40 for my 3 wings n bowl of potatoes..... But if I'm in Cali I'll probably stop by again just for the chicken. On our road trip back we were kickin ourselves for not grabbing somethin to go.

Reviews.Author: melissa d.
Reviews.Content: walked into this place with 12 people we got seated about 5mins after. just in time because once we did it got really packed!i ordered the Scoe's 1/4 chicken smothered with gravy and onions with 2 waffles. FAIL !i wanted my chicken dry but my chicken literally came smothered .. DOUSED with gravy.. it was REALLY good its just i didnt know what part of the chicken i was eating. i've been here before and didnt order the smothered gravy and the chicken was sooooo good! im not saying this place sucks, i just ordered the wrong thing. i misunderstood the directions hahathis place is really good though. i want to come back and get the chicken n waffles minus the smothered gravy...

Reviews.Author: Rick S.
Reviews.Content: Not somewhere I would frequent, but good home style cooking and a friendly staff. I know a lot of the hype comes from this joint being a little out of place, but groiwng up in rural midwest got me used to this kind of food, so that's the only thing keeping it from being 5 stars. Obviosly, the waffles are the best... airy...not too havey but with substance. The chicken sausage was a bit dry, but I don't think it's one of their popular dishes so it should be expected. Portions were large. Mac and Cheese was only 3/5 stars for me.

Reviews.Author: liz s.
Reviews.Content: Yum, I love fried chicken and Roscoe's is great. Had lunch on a Friday afternoon and I was surprised that the place wasn't packed. The fried chicken came out piping hot. It was really juicy and seasoned so good. The waffles are yummy too and compliment the chicken well. Steer clear from the fries. Mine were all soggy. They were made from fresh potatoes but needed to go in the fryer one more time in order to get crispy.

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: I've heard of this place, the chicken with waffle meal has always enticed my curiosity to try such an odd combination.  The chicken was fried perfect juicy with a lot of flavor.  The soft waffles were so good soaked in butter and smothered with maple syrup.  I'll be sure to go back when I visit SoCal again.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place. Fried chix is one of the best I've ever eaten. Waffles r crispy and yummy. Service kinda blows.

Reviews.Author: Reese G.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Sunday and it was my first time at this location. We usually go to the one is Pasadena, but this one has better hours.The food, as always, was delicious. Even though it seemed crowded outside when we got there, there was no wait. sweet!Our waiter was very nice and we got our food right away. I think I like this location better than the Pasadena one. I just like the way they have the inside set up better than the one in Pasadena. The entrance was a little confusing though. It was dark so we werent sure which door to use LOL

Reviews.Author: Rebecca B.
Reviews.Content: Such a fun place to go. Kid-friendly, and nice wait staff. Don't bother if you are on a diet. Large portions and very reasonably priced. Comfort food all the way.

Reviews.Author: Travis B.
Reviews.Content: OK this place is awesome. First off we got there 10 minutes before they closed and the staff was extremely friendly even at that late hour.  Our server was very fast and friendly and stayed on top of our drinks and needs the whole time. The chicken is amazing here, very simple very crisp. The waffles have a hint of cinnamon that keeps you going back for more. This is a place that stays true to itself and doesn't pretend to be anything other than what they are and they do it very well. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Ed D.
Reviews.Content: All around goodness can never go wrong in eating there .....this place is real.finger. licking good not like kfc

Reviews.Author: James W.
Reviews.Content: Food was good, kinda what I'd expect at any roadside diner in the south. There was a long line, and once inside they kinda rushed us through our meal and dropped the check pretty fast. I think this place feeds on it's own hype. If there wasn't a line out the door, you wouldn't think it was that great. Don't get my wrong, it was delish, but fried chicken is delicious even if you mess it up.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer D.
Reviews.Content: Eat here.

Reviews.Author: Steve B.
Reviews.Content: I finally tried this place out after people were telling me to come here.  I had the 'Scoe' which consists of 1/4 pound chicken prepared southern style, 2 waffles and a private mix.  It was really good only thing I felt a little sick as the fat and sodium content on that dish was probably off the charts... The atmosphere is pleasant although there some people smoking outside..... I won't say what but you get my drift :) Staff was also very helpful.  I would give this place a 4 stars but I cant since I admit I have tasted better although I would definately recommend trying this place once... especially after a Dodger Game!

Reviews.Author: Yingjue C.
Reviews.Content: We were lucky, table for four opened up right as we walked in, I'm a chicken and waffles convert. Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Justin K.
Reviews.Content: Not one thing on the menu is bad. The mac n cheese is out of this world, waffles made to perfection and chicken was handed down by god himself. Lets just say i am a fan for life.

Reviews.Author: Jenny B.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles are always delicious! But on my recent visit, I tried their chicken&cheese omelet with some of their Louisiana hot sauce on top and it tasted amazing!! This omelet came with their yummy waffles, and together it was just one of the best brunches I've ever had!

Reviews.Author: Wavalen F.
Reviews.Content: Best fried chicken I've had in a long time, the waffles were yum! I just wish they used real maple syrup, either way it was so so good!

Reviews.Author: Allison J.
Reviews.Content: Not much further to add that everyone else has said, but Roscoe's makes one of the best fried chicken meals I have had.  This is one of the staple places that my hubby likes to go to in LA.  Parking is fairly easy to find, but generally metered street parking.  We prefer to park in the 2 hour spots rather than the 1 hour because the wait alone can take up to 30-45 minutes to be seated.  Came in Saturday around 230 with a 1/2 hour wait for 2 people.  Service is pretty efficient; actually really good - the waiter checked up on us frequently to ensure we enjoyed our food and we had enough water.  Their gravy is addicting on top of the chicken so I recommend 2. Scoes.  Plenty of food - I'm pregnant and couldn't even finish my meal!

Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: I've only been to the Hollywood location off of Sunset. It's well worth the wait; I've never waited less than 30-45 minutes to get a table. The chicken is well seasoned, juicy and crispy, just how it should be. You have to try wrapping a piece of chicken with the waffle then dipping it in the syrup... the sweet and saltiness make it the perfect bite! You also have to get a side of their mac and cheese. I love this place!

Reviews.Author: Jess O.
Reviews.Content: LONG WAIT - GOOD FOOD. what is a girl to do???

Reviews.Author: Andy T.
Reviews.Content: I like Roscoe's.. it's not the best fried chicken in the world, but when you're in hollywood, and craving fried chicken.. it is the spot to hit. The classic chicken/waffle combination is not to be missed.. the waffles have a nice cinnamon flavor, which is not overpowering. The chicken has a 'light' sweet batter, as well. The question is, would this place be popular if it wasn't coined in so many films/pop culture references? I'm not sure.

Reviews.Author: Hillery G.
Reviews.Content: Crispy, hot, tender chicken - so good.  I am not sure why the waffle has that good "chew" to it, but I couldn't stop eating it.  The cornbread is good too I hear.

Reviews.Author: Bryan S.
Reviews.Content: What can I say?  If you want great fried chicken, macaroni and cheese, greens, and corn bread, go to Roscoe's.  We had 2 combos and split an order of fries, a beer and a lemonade for $40.  We left full and happy and in about 50 minutes.  The service is quick and friendly enough, but one goes for chicken.

Reviews.Author: Kevin K.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Who would have though chicken and waffles would go well together? This southern style restaurant really keeps me coming back. Their chicken is delicious and so are their waffles. Good, juicy and tender. Crispy on the outside and soft inside. Their service is typical and there really is nothing more to say. The price is meh, you're going to be dropping ~15 bucks including tax and tip. Parking is valet.

Reviews.Author: Thithien N.
Reviews.Content: The serving sizes are small. Although, I ordered a two piece meal, I was surprised  at how small the chicken pieces were maybe I am just spoiled coming from a popeye's chicken world. But when I came here, I ordered a chicken leg and a wing and they were scrawny and even the serving sides were tiny. Hence my dissatisfaction when I left hungry...Come here if you haven't been, but don't return again; unless you enjoy small portions.

Reviews.Author: Jay L.
Reviews.Content: I love Rosco's chicken & waffles but I hate this location.  The service is awful here! I took my cousin out for dinner once and it took them 45mins to even come to the table and take our drink orders (45mins!!! and I'm being kind, it was probably closer to an hour).  Every time I have been here (which has been about 3 times) their service is horrible. I'd rather go to the one on Pico Blvd and wait the hour to get into the restaurant, at least there you get prompt service. Avoid the Hollywood Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Matthew K.
Reviews.Content: Must Try There Glizzards, Pretty Great Tasting Actually. Also Tried There Chicken & Waffles. That Hit The Spot !

Reviews.Author: Joy R.
Reviews.Content: I've been here many times and can't believe I haven't reviewed it.  Parking is difficult since there's no longer valet, but drive around a bit, someone is sure to come out and you can follow them and take their spot.  It's a hit and miss with waiting.  If you come during the day and early evening, the wait is long, but if you come in at odd, abnormal hours like 1130pm, there's no wait.  My husband and son always get the Carol C.  HUGE breast, waffle with creamy whipped sweet butter and a side of Mac N Cheese.  My baby loves omelets and she really loved the chicken and cheese omelet with a side of waffle.  I LOVE WANGS, so I always get the #20, 3 wings and smothered potatoes or greens.  I haven't had anything I didn't like yet.  Their sweet potato pie is a must and their cornbread is a large portion.  Best drinks are the sunset, sunrise or eclipse.  The eclipse was a bit too sweet for me, but the other two are delish.

Reviews.Author: Fatima H.
Reviews.Content: I'm broke so that is a big part of why Roscoe gets a 3.  But that isn't to say the food isn't good.  It's great, but a bit heavy, you will be stuffed for days.

Reviews.Author: Alex P.
Reviews.Content: This place tastes good, yes. The only reason it doesn't get a 5 is that I've had better chicken and waffles. Jennifer Murse (an elite yelper) claims the Pico locale is better. That's insane. She's wrong!!! That one only gets a three 1/2. I don't think I can do 1/2 stars though. Oh well. I guess it'll have to get a three to distinguish it from this better locale

Reviews.Author: Monica T.
Reviews.Content: So the problem with this place is that it's too good.  If I could I would eat here every day.  Thank God I live in Norcal or else I would be at least 300 lbs.  The chicken is juicy and waffles are fluffy.  If you like organ meat, like I do - get the fried livers.  Be warned though the order of livers is huge.

Reviews.Author: antonette m.
Reviews.Content: -Good 'ole Heart clogging fried chicken served with waffles was strange to me at first...but when I tasted the combo----WOW----who would've thought of such a meal.  The wait is just tooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo long.  I'd have to go back theree when it first opens in the morning or something.

Reviews.Author: O K.
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I came here on a lovely Saturday night to escape the confines of Westwood. I ordered Herbie's special... I think it was called that. Well it had some CHIX and TWO WAFFLES. The great thing is they give you two cups of homemade syrup. Yes, I used both. I poured that syrup all over the chicken, in fact doused the chicken with that golden aphrodisiac. Then I smeared the creamy rich butter all over the perfectly crisp waffles. I ate the entire meal, and then rejoiced. We also ordered corn bread, which I wouldn't do again because it wasn't that great. But the waffles and chicken get five stars alone. SoooOOoOooO Tasty I am going back again as soon as my heart allows me to!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dj Rage S.
Reviews.Content: yo if u dont get it -- chicken n waffles -- dont review it... lol..  some of reviews are hilarous.... 1 star? if u aint in the community that loves this... may b u shouldnt review it.  Roscoes is not upscale neva have been neva will be .. its just a place to grub down on some soul food and chill out.....been here times before always a lil something fun.  last time i was blessed to meet Atallah Shabazz (Malcolms daughter) who was on the under in a baseball cap and glasses.  this time just good food n laughs.... ok why my boy his first time there doesnt order waffles....what the hell... mannnn we gave him a hard time, but we came back so he could get some the next day....   the hollywood location stays open later.. so it gets packed.. and get the sunset drink its on hit..

Reviews.Author: d. t.
Reviews.Content: oh man. cheese eggs and onions. the waffles are SO good... and it's just a good ol standby. i guarantee you will walk away regretting everything you ate but having loved every bite you took.

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles.. order a Sunset (Lemonade & Fruit Punch) with your order and your set!!  The chicken is nice & crispy and the waffle... topped with that ooooh so fattening butter ball and syrup.. SO GOOD!!  And the French fries are BOMB 2 with Tabasco sauce.

Reviews.Author: T M.
Reviews.Content: I had the infamous Roscoe's and similar to Pink's hot dogs I think this place is a little overrated.   The fried chicken and waffles were good - but nothing amazing and I've actually had better waffles elsewhere.   On the plus side, the piece of chicken I got was pretty big and it wasn't overly oily - the chicken was moist but the breading was pretty dry/crispy.    It is good late night food if you've been out drinking and want a snack but I wouldn't go there for a normal meal.

Reviews.Author: Jenna A.
Reviews.Content: What can I say..I drove to LA from San Diego(me and my roommate) one boring Sunday afternoon to have Roscoes Chicken and Waffles.  I was not dissappointed. With GPS working like a champ, we got there in no time. Park on the street and walked up to the line.  We were told a 30 minute wait, but it was more like 17 minutes.  Got a table and ordered a Carol c. Special, with a side of greens, rice w/gravy, and candied yams (hey! it was  long drive).  The chicken was juicy and the waffle was like cake! OMG so good.  The greens were well seasoned and no need for salt/pepper or hot sauce.  It was a good meal well worth the drive and price!

Reviews.Author: Brad J.
Reviews.Content: This is an experience.  Had to talk my wife into going into this place even though it was her idea to go there.  It's a little rough looking on the outside and you never really know who's hanging around.  But very happy we tried it out.  Employees were very friendly and the food was great.  Go check it out.

Reviews.Author: Andrew D.
Reviews.Content: SENSATIONAL... this place is for sure right up my alley. i must say that i went to this perticular location once on a sunday afternoon and felt a bit underdressed. good service, not too expensive. great food. a must try if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Laurent H.
Reviews.Content: Good food, good service, good times...just don't go near a scale or a cardiologist After enjoying this cholesterol laden grub!

Reviews.Author: Angenette L.
Reviews.Content: Oh Roscoe's how I miss you!!!! The best fried chicken ever!

Reviews.Author: Cecile S.
Reviews.Content: food: 5/5service 5/5This place has good food and great portions. I never had chicken and waffles before but it was great. Definitely going there again. I came on an day where there weren't many people so service wasn't a problem. They were really nice and took our orders promptly. The chicken I go had a lot of flavor but could be more juicy. Even though this place is a chain, it didn't feel like one...

Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: This trip made it 3/5 of the Roscoe's eaten at for me.  We ate in the first room, kinda small and I can see now why the place usually has a big line outside.  We went later in the afternoon and were seated right away though.  I went for something different and got the 2 chicken sausage/2 egg/waffle combo and it was pretty good.  A bit overpriced though.  I'll stick with my omelette from now on.  Service was quick and friendly also.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: this place is TINY so be sure to get there early and wait to score a table - its worth it. don't expect to be seated quickly on Sundays though.. everyone comes here after church and the line is usually over a block long.the chicken is friend to perfection.. not too greasy and not to charred.. seasoned really well. the waffles are huge. seriously, i think one meal can serve two. if you are ready to get stuffed, come here - you will not regret it.

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles!!! Yum. Don't order anything else. Just chicken and waffles and maybe a side if you feel like it. I got the collard greens while my friends got the grits. Greens were really good. A lot of people like gravy with the chicken but next time, I'll leave off the gravy because if you don't eat the chicken fast enough, the gravy soaks through leaving it all soggy.

Reviews.Author: Josephine C.
Reviews.Content: Great comfort food.  I asked my friend to take me here when I was visiting since I'd been waiting to try it for a while.  We got there around 10? I want to say, but there was a fat line, velvet rope and a bouncer outside.  I was weird-ed out to say the least because it seemed like the rest of Hollywood's little clubs where it had turned into some kind of trendy place to go and you needed to know someone to get in.  Got the chicken (which was great, but not utterly amazing like I imagined - ie, not the be all end all of chicken, but pretty good), great waffle, LOVED the mac n' cheese, collard greens were FANTASTIC, and the corn bread is to die for.  Grits were tasty, but I wish they had cheese grits.  Anyway, a little more expensive than comfort food prices, but delicious for the experience.

Reviews.Author: Nicole N.
Reviews.Content: Whoooa 727 reviews!!  I love roscoes!! Service sucks but who cares just bring me my fried chicken and waffles so I can be happy!! My fav is the 1/2 chicken with 2 waffles. As if that was not artery clogging enough they give you some extra butter and syrup which I scrape off and put to the side. Still amazing no if ands or buts. Their corn bread is the best I have ever had I want to sing to it! Soul food at its best!! If you have not been here pleease go. Save yourself the headache and bring cash because they do not seperate checks PERIOD.

Reviews.Author: Luis P.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's chicken and waffles is one of the best I've tasted. I ordered mine southern style (in dark meat) smothered in gravy (gravy is sooo good I spooned some over my waffles as well). The chicken stayed crispy despite being drenched in the equally tasty gravy, and paired with a generous serving of their own delicious and light waffle (house special batter mix), it was indeed the best breakfast for lunch I've had. Parking is relegated to the streets (be sure to bring some quarters for the meters), so I suspect this becomes an issue during busy hours around this heavy-traffic area. Good service, great food at a fair price, and if you're touring the Hollywood area, then this is a definite must-try place!

Reviews.Author: Angela C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! I've always been a fan of pairing sweet with savory but I had not had the pleasure to try fried chicken with waffles until now. You always hear of this chain on the foodie TV shows and I'll have to say this place did not disappoint. I came here with 2 other people. I ordered the chicken and waffles and they ordered the same but with gravy. I think mine was just fine without the gravy but I had a taste of theirs which was good also. In addition we order a side of fries, they were nothing really special though.

Reviews.Author: London T.
Reviews.Content: Both the chicken and the waffles are very good in my opinion. The mac n cheese is also pretty good (big mac n cheese fan). It's not so creamy, but more of a dry version. The service is a bit slow at times when they're busy, but it's bearable. Overall, this is a place that everyone should at least hit up once to try. Go to this location in Hollywood, not to the other locations. I've been to the Pasadena one a couple times and it's not nearly as good. One other thing to note is that they don't split bills either.

Reviews.Author: T. C.
Reviews.Content: ok soo im supper picky when it comes to food or actually i just really expect it to taste great lol i mean specially if people hype this place up ...righhttt?... and i had my concerns i mean fried chicken for breakfast !?..ive never really thought about having fried chicken for breakfast i really dont ever eat it ....but i gave it a try i chose the one waffle one chicken leg meal to b cautious u know lolz.and i really did like it .... i cant see myself having this every sunday but hey when in hollywood def a must.... ps i made sure to get there early bc of their parking its not too great once the place gets busy ....

Reviews.Author: Paula V.
Reviews.Content: Parking is hard to find in Hollywood unless you're lucky and you manage to get parking in front. The wait can be long on busy nights but if you come at the beginning of breakfast, lunch, or dinner you'll be seated right away with your order taken really quickly. I just like getting the fried chicken thigh and a waffle because the food is so bad for you (but so goooooood:) I mean the chicken is perfectly fried and the waffle makes me melt from its tasty fluffiness ahhhh. However, once I did get the omelette with fried chicken and waffles - oh my god, that was like the unhealthiest omelette I've ever had in my life. There was just TOO MUCH CHEESE. I guess you come here just to try the main chicken and waffles. Roscoe's is good for big groups and the service is very good. I always enjoy coming here. They also have a pretty good takeout deal.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa B.
Reviews.Content: All in all it was a delicious dinner that had a good combination! The chicken had a good seasoning and the waffles were good. It was ok I would probably visit again.

Reviews.Author: Faye F.
Reviews.Content: This is the first Roscoe's I'd ever been to (and the one in Oakland - Home of the Chicken and Waffles restaurant doesn't really count) and I was pretty pleased. I was glad that it wasn't all "hype" because the food was pretty darn good! Their chicken... OH! SO AMAZING and their waffles are huge! I couldn't even finish my Scoe's southern style chicken and waffles. I looked around at what others had ordered and some were mouthwateringly delicious. Some had chicken completely doused in gravy, some had waffles up the wazoo! Great place!

Reviews.Author: jonathan h.
Reviews.Content: When i stop in la i have to visit roscoe's and pinks lolz... the chicken has a nice thin crust the spices, the waffle is a thinner style nice and light plus the staff is friendly, my cousin took me here years ago and i've been hooked since lolz

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: YES!! Finally a place to get some good corn bread and biscuits! Great service too as they keep the coffee coming. The waffles are to die for. I've been searching far and wide for some decent breakfast and finally discovered the holy grail that is Roscoes.

Reviews.Author: Linda K.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles? Salty and sweet? Hm.. interesting.A friend from LA showed a couple of us around and introduced this place to us. The wait was about 25 minutes but they said that was pretty good for how long it usually takes. Once we got our seats a sweet woman came instantly and asked us what drinks we wanted. As she went to get our waters and lemonade, we gazed through the interesting menu. I just couldn't imagine myself eating chicken with waffles so I just ordered the omelet with waffles. It was really good! (seperately btw haha) The waffles had homemade syrup. It was warm and sweet but not too sweet, it was soo good! The waffle wasn't super thick,but I thought it was good since the syrup would soak into the waffle all the way. The omelet included chicken and cheese inside, and it was so good! The waitress came by constantly to ask us how we were doing. She even asked us if she can take a picture for us. She deserved the fatass tip she got! This place was super yummy, and interesting!

Reviews.Author: Samuel G.
Reviews.Content: Gotta give props to Roscoe's since it's an L.A. institution and a long time favorite of mine. Now that I am back in Hollywood, I can walk there from my apartment, which is awesome when I need a good hangover cure or just some comfort food on a lousy day. I agree with what most of the Yelp reviewers say: the waffles are incredibly amazing; the chicken is pretty damned good and the two taken together are a fusion of taste like no other. The food rocks, but stick to the chicken and waffles. The sides are overpriced and unimpressive. The only real downside to this joint is that the service is hit and miss. Most of the time, you'll have a full cup of coffee and you'll get your waffles lightening fast, minutes after walking in the door. But, just now and then, you'll get some rotten luck and get stuck waited on by some lazy ghetto rat who will completely ignore you. Even so, the busboys will usually help keep your coffee cups full. Like I said, hit and miss.Beware, after hours this place gets UNBELIEVABLY crowded.

Reviews.Author: Benison A.
Reviews.Content: BEST Chicken and Waffles in LA so far! I had some friends from Norcal who came to visit here in LA and Roscoe's was on our food trip list! We did wait for 1 1/2 hr (just for To-Go) and it's all worth it. The waiting list for Dine in is kinda unorganized though. But hell, I would still go back!

Reviews.Author: Melisa G.
Reviews.Content: I love love love Roscoes! I think this is the better location as the one on Pico is kinda sketchy to me.  This one doesn't have a lot of parking available though.

Reviews.Author: Val B.
Reviews.Content: So yummy, I usually don't like the savory/sweet combo - but this is an exception. I'm afraid to get to get ck & waffles anywhere else.  But I'm not the huge fried chicken connoisseur so I minus 1 star because I don't know all that's out there.  But this will be my standard until I find something better.  And if I don't find anything better, I'll upgrade to 5 stars.  Service is always great.  Parking can be iffy.

Reviews.Author: Will G.
Reviews.Content: There's a bum outside of Roscoes with a paper mache hat. See what I don't understand is how its pouring right now and yet, his hat is waterproofing the storm. In short, we need better security outside.

Reviews.Author: Jeff Y.
Reviews.Content: Very good service and great chicken and waffles! I came here with about 8 people, and they were able to sit us pretty quickly for a weekend. I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the Jeanne Jones Omelette with a waffle, and both were quite good.

Reviews.Author: W C.
Reviews.Content: The chicken here is pretty damn good. If it was just chicken, I'd give it 5 stars. The biscuits are subpar, the dough seems overworked and tough, even KFC biscuits are better. The waffles are rather plain, and seem more like pancakes with grids on them. The good waffles I've had at other places have always been sorta crispy on the outside and moist and fluffy on the inside, these were just kinda floppy like pancakes. Anyway, that might be just personal preference but I thought it might be a useful description. Service was great, and waitress was really friendly. Valet is $10, which is ridiculous! And if you notice, the valet stand is covering up a valid metered parking spot, which is kinda shady if you ask me. Parking in the area is fairly easy so do yourself a favor and find street parking.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here dozens of times and until the last time the food was outstanding.  The service usually sucks but it's a trendy, touristy type joint so I don't expect much.

Reviews.Author: B F.
Reviews.Content: I've been to other famous chicken and waffles on the East Coast and they blow Roscoe's away. There is a full concept here that consists of chicken AND waffles. The chicken was good, but the waffle was just ordinary. Waffle House has better waffles than the limp thing they served me. Also, we sat there for a long time waiting on our waiter and the sweet tea with lemonade was average. I might not know a lot, but I'm originally from Georgia and I know my sweet tea and lemonade. Even the chicken and waffles in Dallas, TX was better.

Reviews.Author: Saul J.
Reviews.Content: Luv this place after a good night out partying or any time of day. I don't have say anything about the food everybody has done that already. Im writing this to give them my appreciation and support.

Reviews.Author: Cel J.
Reviews.Content: chicken is really bomb..when u really hungry...! came here at 2am after the cabana, packed! waited awhile, but once seated the service was quick! love my chicken & waffle!--it was yummmy!

Reviews.Author: jon j.
Reviews.Content: Woohoo! As good as it gets! Overall star rating should tell you everything.  Crispy fried chicken with syrup and waffles, words cant explain the flavor explosion in my mouth

Reviews.Author: Piper W.
Reviews.Content: YUM!!! I was craving chicken and waffles and this hit the spot! I had the #1 (comes with 1/4 chicken  w/o gravy, 2 waffles with huge scoops of butter and syrup on the side) and a side of Mac and cheese. The husb had the #B which is half chicken smothered with gravy with onions- that came with a fresh buttermilk biscuit and a side of delicious grits. Wow, all was so good! And the other yelpers are right, that Mac and cheese is scrumptious for you cheese lovers! Service was friendly and good, and the price was great too! I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I had some GI upset after... Hadn't eaten anything else the 9 hrs prior so... Not sure. Hubby was okay. I'll definitely give it another try and hopefully this was a fluke and not related.

Reviews.Author: A. L C.
Reviews.Content: I came. I ate. good service. huge portion. Needless to say I couldn't walk the rest of the night.  Amazing if you are drunk and need some good home cooking to fill your belly.

Reviews.Author: Andre E.
Reviews.Content: Must try the chicken WITH gravy and the waffles. Best waffles I have EVER had and the gravy on the chicken although sounds weird it will blow your mind.

Reviews.Author: Sandra D.
Reviews.Content: I am a long time fan of this joint.  It sounds odd, fried chicken with waffles, but it really works.  I give it 3 stars because the restaurants are kind of run down and there is always a wait, but I guess that just goes to show people want to eat there.  The prices are reasonable.  The chicken is good, the waffle is just OK.  It is not the best fried chicken, it is not the best waffle, but what you get here is the convenience of both on a single plate.  I'd rather have fried chicken at Knott's Chicken restaurant, and I'd rather have waffles at Bruxie, but Roscoes has it's charms so I will keep coming back.  It's open late, and once in a while you might spot a celebrity, or so I've heard.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Lynda D.
Reviews.Content: ROSCOES is one of my favorite restaurants in LA. My friends introduced me to the concept of waffles and fried chicken and it was GENIUS. who knew butter, syrup and hot sauce were such a divine combo! I go here almost every time in LA and I order a waffle and thigh which is probably the lightest thing on the menu.  Its a lot of food and heavy but that's because I'm a little girl. ;)  I recently discovered adding a  little hot sauce takes it to a whole other level. The fried chicken is awesome and I have no complaints about the food, I think its perfect when you are hungry and continue to crave it every time I leave LA.  They also have a great lemonade iced tea! This place is packed too but you can still be seated before you go hungry.  I also love the diverse population here.  Chicken and waffles really are universal!

Reviews.Author: Arthur S.
Reviews.Content: I heard good things about this place so i decided to check it out. Ill start off with theres a wait for a table 50% of the time. Service was kinda slow, but they did a good job bringing people in and out. After 15 min wait with few friends sat down and started to look around in the menu. There menu is preety complicated , their specialty is chicken and waffles but i didnt see that anywere. Our server helped us with out order and we got the chicken and waffles. I really liked the waffle but the chicken was kinda dry for me but it was still ok.

Reviews.Author: Maile T.
Reviews.Content: FYI, it's open till 4 am on Fri and Sat.

Reviews.Author: William W.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is hands down THE BEST Waffle House in CALIFORINA!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The wait is a bit long but you can understand why as the food is so GOOD that every1 in the LA area is trying to get up in there to eat!!! The staff is always so friendly and nice!! I have been going to Roscoe's for over 12yrs now and I absolutely love it!!!

Reviews.Author: Garrett S.
Reviews.Content: Never had chicken and waffles before. Was a little more than expected, i asked my server for his recommendation which was one "succulent chicken and a waffle" i didn't think it would be enough but it definitely was. I am so full and the chicken was full of flavor. For those who love chicken and waffles this is the place for you.

Reviews.Author: Kiara J.
Reviews.Content: I really like roscoes but was a little disappointed with the size of the wings in the Obama special. I haven't seen wings that small and pathetic in a while. It was still good, but because of the size I will only give this one 3 stars. Otherwise we were seated promptly and the entrees came out fairly quick.

Reviews.Author: Julia S.
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Jeanne Jones Omelet; it is perfection!

Reviews.Author: Brenda H.
Reviews.Content: I always order the SCOE's #1...I ask for 2 chicken thighs. I'm not much of a fan of chicken breast. The chicken is crisp on the out side and juicy inside..Delicious! The waffles are good and the syrup is great! For Tomi B, apparantly you went to the Roscoe's on Sunset and Gower. This the one that I go to the most. I always park down the street....wow you parked free??? There are meters all along the streets there..have been for years. You're lucky you didn't get a ticket!

Reviews.Author: Shenay A.
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hollywood area for a concert with my friend and decided to find out what Roscoe's was all about. It was around 1pm and had to wait about 15-20 min for a table which is totally understandable. Once seated we ordered chicken and the mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is supposed to be amazing--however, i thought it was less than stellar. The chicken was good-not greasy. I don't understand the hype though...i just thought it was average. Amy Ruth's in Harlem NY is by far the best of the two.

Reviews.Author: Teena M.
Reviews.Content: Luv this place, was here 10/8/12,  food is so good, chicken is great and the grits are groovy!  Staff very nice.  Second time and will def go again.... soon!

Reviews.Author: dave w.
Reviews.Content: In case you can't tell from the name, it's not for the faint-of-appetite.  If you're looking for down-home, high-cal comfort food, this is the right place.  Service is friendly, and though there can be a wait, it's definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Ben A.
Reviews.Content: another original.with bomb ass soul food.that's all i gotta say.

Reviews.Author: Phil T.
Reviews.Content: 4 1/2 stars.the first time i've been here, my convoy got into a car accident. the second time i've been here, which was about around the same time i went for the first a year before, my convoy got into accident again. needless to say, this area is just plain bad luck, but......I WILL BE TALKIN ABOUT MY SECOND TIME HERE.another thing about this place is that its kinda of in a bad area, so be careful where you park your car because someone might break in and steal your stuff. don't give any incentive for someone to break in your car. hide all your valuables!as for the restaurant, the wait was not at all long, i went around 4:30 in the evening and their was not many people, so the time really varies, on sundays in the afternoon, expect a long wait...the service was very fast, and the waitress was very patient with my crew, which made the overall experience that much better. two of my friends ordered a 1 piece chicken and waffle for $7 each, and the waitress suggested getting the the 2 piece chicken and 2 waffle meal and just split it for $10.20. so she made it easier for our wallets =].the food was served in about 5-7 minutes. just amazing.i ordered a #2 which is a 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles, which makes a good hearty meal for a hungry person, for about $10.50. the chicken was nice and crispy and with the gravy, it yummy. the waffle was soft and fluffy, not so much crispy but the flavor was unique for that restaurant. plain ol' good soul food.IF THIS IS YOUR FIRST TIME, YOU OUGHT TO GET A MIXED DRINK, EITHER THE SUNRISE (lemonade/oj, SUNSET(oj/fruit punch), or the ECLIPSE(oj/lemonade/fruit punch). it will make the meal so much better. trust me.by the time my crew was done, we were out of the door in less than an hour.this is a must return when i'm back in SoCal.

Reviews.Author: Kendra K.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my bro in Hollywood, and he brought me to Roscoe's (now immortalized by the film Jackie Brown). Came with an appetite, did not leave unsatisfied. Had always wondered how fried chicken and waffles worked together in an unholy union, but while these bits of pure unadulterated greasy goodness may bring about apocalyptic changes to your waistline, you will gladly sell your metabolism to the devil for how these taste. Sweet tea, mac n' cheese, and the Carol C. special==perfect after a day of avoiding 4-dollar popcorn at Disneyland.

Reviews.Author: Aaron H.
Reviews.Content: Went here for breakfast. Yes, the wait's not too fun, but as long as you know that, then don't stress about it. I always get the chicken and waffles combo with plenty of syrup on both. It's a fun atmosphere and the prices aren't too bad. Good stuff...

Reviews.Author: MeChan W.
Reviews.Content: Great place to eat especially after leaving the Highland night club just a little small, hated waiting out side with the loud people, but they have expanded so there should be more space and a shorter wait.

Reviews.Author: Angela M.
Reviews.Content: Alright, so I've heard all the hype. I was kinda skeptical. But alas! I was more than pleasantly surprised. Who knew that fried chicken and waffles of all things actually GO GREAT together?! Who knew the salty and sweet phenomenon hit a home run with this combo? Their mac and cheese is pretty good, as are many of their other southern-style sides. The service is friendly and very homey. THe only downside I could think of was and maybe I'm wrong but I don't think they had AC. And on a hot day in LA and w/me dowsing everything in hot sauce, I need some AC! But overall, a great meal with some good company! I shall never doubt you again Roscoes!

Reviews.Author: Rita L.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's offers basic home cooking prepared with that most important of ingredients - love.  When I first heard about putting chicken and waffles together I didn't think it sounded great, but once I tasted it I was an immediate convert.  Now I crave the combination of savory, juicy rfied chicken and sweet, golden waffles.  I like the number 13 then I get a side of greens and a cold beer.  The mac n cheese is great, too!

Reviews.Author: Josh F.
Reviews.Content: If you are in L.A. and haven't been, do it. It may be an experience you have never had before. Waffles AND chicken. You can eat them separately or you can eat fried chicken the way the food gods wanted you to. With waffles. I've even seen people mix maple syrup and Tabasco on top of their waffles and chicken. I haven't done it but you know what? I probably will.

Reviews.Author: Auna C.
Reviews.Content: What can i say other than YUMMY! i have been going here for years and i love it. and everyone ive ever taken here gets hooked.... Please try this place you wont be disappointed at ALL. don't let the sound of chicken and waffles fool you!!!!

Reviews.Author: Olivier L.
Reviews.Content: I had the Country Girl for lunch.  For $11, I received two overcooked deep-fried legs and two dried-out thighs, with literally nothing else on the plate. I found the pricing related more to the reputation and atmosphere than to the food.  The people I was with liked their meals. They may have cared less about eating vegetables and avoiding cholesterol than I did. Maybe I should have tried the waffle.

Reviews.Author: Kristine W.
Reviews.Content: If you've been wanting to try Roscoe's, but were afraid for your safety, this is definitely the location to go!  Decent area of Hollywood.  (I drove past the Pico location one time, and it definitely was not as nice as this place).   Had the Scoe's plate (fried chicken with gravy poured on top + 2 waffles) and it was damn good.  Ok, if you're a waffle snob, these aren't the best waffles in the world, but the fried chic and gravy were great and having the waffles, butter and syrup on the side took care of your craving for something sweet after the savory, salty chicken.  Service was very good too.  I enjoyed my experience.

Reviews.Author: Christian J.
Reviews.Content: I really love this place! The food is awesome, really delicious chicken, and the waffles are to die for! Service could be a little more happy and helpful, also they charge for refills and dont pour water unless you order it; which kind of sucks, but that wont keep me from going back! I love their Chicken & Waffle plate =]

Reviews.Author: Tony D.
Reviews.Content: Came here for lunch, and got some chickens and waffles! The chicken was crispy, juicy, and savory. The waffles were good with the butter and syrup. Prices weren't bad for the portions, took a quick nap after eating the food.

Reviews.Author: Erika B.
Reviews.Content: best chicken... EVER... friendly people... good service... who would've thought that chicken and waffles could work together...

Reviews.Author: Ambor C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The staff is fun and the food is delicious. They have the best yams I've ever tasted. Their chicken is good and their greens are fabulous. It can get crowded so plan ahead. Friday and Sat. nights especially, but its worth it. Also if your a celebrity spotter this is the place to be. I've seen Kobe Bryant here on a number of occasions as well as other basketball players. Plus you can buy souvenirs. What can I say, you have to check out Roscoes!

Reviews.Author: Kayla P.
Reviews.Content: um all I can say is YUM! My boyfriend lives in Hollywood and last time I visited him I really wanted to try this place out. We went and really loved the food! The waffles are soooooo good like super good, really sweet. The chicken is great but for me I thought it was slightly dry. The chicken taste's a lot better when you put it on the waffle and then put the syrup on top, YUM! We also both got a side of mac and cheese, that was so delicious some the best mac and cheese I had ever tasted. And to round it all out had some cold lemonade, pretty great meal. My only complaint is that it's a little too pricey didn't expect that it would be as expensive as it was. But that probably won't stop me from coming again!

Reviews.Author: Desiree N Miguel L.
Reviews.Content: I had take out cuz my boyfriend was too drunk to get out of the car. But I've been wanting Roscoe's for ages so I wasn't gonna let a drunk idiot ruin my Roscoe's plans.
