I'm basing my review and stars solely on the fried chicken wings. BOMB! Seriously the best fried chicken I've ever had. Hopefully next time I'll be able to get down and enjoy the whole Roscoe's experience.

Reviews.Author: Joshua J.
Reviews.Content: Now I see what the fuss is about... Chicken and waffles, well at Roscoe's it is excellent. Salty fried chicken with the sweet waffles butter & syrup... Plus it's in Hollywood. Great prices too, not too expensive.

Reviews.Author: Ron B.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's chicken & waffles is a must when you are in the hollywood area. It's a landmark tah needs to be visited when you are in the area. Their food is great, especially their chicken & waffles combo, as well as their fresh cornbread. The only thing I would say that I do not enjoy too much is the wait, but I guess that really means the food is good enough that people are willing to wait...I do!

Reviews.Author: Aileen C.
Reviews.Content: The parking situation here sucks...I guess that's like most of Hollywood. There is no parking lot nearby, the only parking space available is curb side with parking meters. There is also a few parking spaces next door but its for customers of the liquor store only. The food part is good...next time I go I will only order the chicken and waffles because I was not impressed with the sides I ordered last time... which were the greens and macaroni. The waffles are really good...they are fluffy and soft like if you are eating pancakes...must be because they make their own batter. The chicken is pretty good too...crispy but not too greasy.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen k.
Reviews.Content: I went to Roscoe's last night with 3 friends, with expectations of an hour wait to be seated and an an even longer one to eat. I went hungry, so my negativity was at an all time high. we were greeted by an older gentleman named John who had a voice and a character that could leave you saying "James Earl Who?"...after taking our name, he seated us promptly, and we were greeted by our waitress who was funny, charming and accurate! our food was to our table before we could locate the restrooms, and the food was comfortably southern. I had a waffle and dabbled in some mac n' cheese, and corn bread (carbotarian) and was full and satisfied. i had a very surprisingly great experience!

Reviews.Author: Sophia N.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is pretty expensive for how much they give. Their quality is good but I heard it's all about the sides. It was also a little too dark for me.

Reviews.Author: george g.
Reviews.Content: I wish I was there right now, Hollywood location is the best - hands down!  This is the absolute best chicken and waffle joint in the world. Every and anytime I am in SoCal, I make at least one stop at Roscoes in Hollywood!!!

Reviews.Author: Philip C.
Reviews.Content: You could go to 'Scoe's a million times and go to all of their different locations, but the food is always consistent. There seems to never be a good/bad day for the food at Roscoe's. Every time you go, it tastes exactly the same as it did a month ago, or 10 years ago. That's important.

Reviews.Author: Ashleigh S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this Roscoe's and the one in West L.A.  I definitely prefer this one between the two.  I used to think, "Well, I love chicken and I love waffles, but I would never eat them together!"  I'm so glad Roscoe's opened my tastebuds to something greater than my narrow-mindedness!

Reviews.Author: Suavecito m.
Reviews.Content: What's to say that's hasn't been already said. Like many have been wanting to go to this place but didn't understand the hype.  Chicken and WAFFLES? I don't like chicken very much and I don't like flat/think waffles. For some reason this work and I think much of the credit has to go to the tasty syrup/smooth butter and the sauce on the chicken which "dress up" the food.  I thought I would be one visit and "seen it done it" ...no mas. After visiting however, I may have to make some time to hit up another roscoes whenever I'm in town.

Reviews.Author: Courtney L.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that everyone should try at least once when visiting LA.  I cannot say anything about the chicken (which I don't eat), except that my friends always seem to enjoy it.  But the waffles...YUM!  The side of mac n' cheese is also delicious.  Overall, if you want a bit of good ole southern cookin', this is the place to get it!

Reviews.Author: Brian G.
Reviews.Content: A staple establishment in a rather scary part of town.  Great feel to the place and amazing chicken and waffles.  I had heard of Roscoes for years and finally had a chance to go with a colleague a few months back.  I would say any first timer should stick to the basics, but I have also heard good things about the chicken livers (though not tried them myself).

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: I love Roscoe's!! I've been to all of them except the one in West LA. The Hollywood one probably has the worst service and that's why they don't get a 5 star. The Pasadena and Long Beach stores have the best service so far I think. So if you go to the one in Hwood, be prepared to wait a bit to be seated and to be acknowledged. At least the food comes out super quick. I recommend the #13, one breast and one waffle. Get it every time and it always soooooooooooo good!

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: I would have given this place a 5 star rating, but because I was sat down and waited for someone to help us for a good 15 min. i am giving this place 4 stars...O man this place was pretty good.. the chicken and gravy was amazing! the waffles had something in that gave it that extra je ne se qua. I would definitley give this place another shot as far as service goes. But When I was sat down I feel like the waiters just looked at you and didnt say anything, I dont know if my particular section was just overly busy or what. But definitly will give this place another shot.

Reviews.Author: Ella G.
Reviews.Content: So I love me so chicken and waffles, especially from this place. Granted...the line can be long and so can the wait...but in my opinion it's worth it. It's not super fancy and parking can be scarce especially when it's busy (like on a Sunday after church), but the food is scrumptious and filling. You'll wanna nap after eating here. I always get a waffle with 3 wings and sometimes a side of macaroni and cheese if I'm starving. All in all, it's the place to go in LA.

Reviews.Author: Theresa N.
Reviews.Content: Great food, good service, and the wait wasnt so bad. Yay for good soul food.

Reviews.Author: Sandi W.
Reviews.Content: Had Chicken and Mac& Cheese.  They were excellent.  1 star less since we had to wait for 30 min....

Reviews.Author: Brandon L.
Reviews.Content: I had heard about this place before but I have no idea where from or from whom. Anyway my recent virgin visit to Roscoe's was out of complete chance. After getting out of an incredible show by St. Vincent at The Music Box (shameless plug), my friend and I realized we were pretty hungry. I pulled up the handy dandy Yelp app on my phone and, lo and behold, I see 'Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles' come up. Even more tempting was the fact that it was still open at a late hour and less than a block away on foot. Onward we trekked!As I walked in, I already was liking the ambience of the joint. Lots of wood paneling and a very home-y/country cabin vibe. The perfect environment to enjoy their famous dish. We were seated right away (keep in mind, it was within a half hour of closing). There were a lot of option on the menu, more than I imagined, but I wanted to keep it simple for my first experience. I ordered a waffle and one chicken breast. It seemed strange to be eating both at the same time but my apprehension soon turned into delight when the meal was laid before me. The waffle comes with a slab of butter or a cup of syrup. I've never been one for other fancy toppings so I was more than pleased. The syrup has just the right amount of sugary-ness, with that thin consistency that I'm partial too. As for the waffle, it took up almost the entire plate. It's not Belgian-style. Instead it's relatively thin and completely delicious. Then there was the chicken still to devour. It was perhaps a bit dry and didn't seem super fresh, which may or may not have had something to do with it being near closing time. Nevertheless, it shouldn't matter what time you come. You pay the same amount as everyone else throughout the day, so the food ought to be just as fresh. Despite this, the chicken breast was still pretty darn tasty. Just the right amount of herbs and seasoning and juicy and tender white meat.Oh, and my friend just had a side dish of macaroni and cheese which she said she liked but I cannot personally attest to. So will I be returning to Roscoe's whenever the mood and opportunity strikes again in Hollywood? Absolutely. I'm very eager to try the rest of their menu.P.S. If you're wondering how waffles and chicken taste in the same bite, it's quite amazing.

Reviews.Author: Christina K.
Reviews.Content: I didn't think it was anything special. Just tastes like what you'd expect, fried chicken on top of a waffle. Yum?

Reviews.Author: Bill T.
Reviews.Content: The last 3 visits to Roscoe's in Pasadena have been a disappointment as the chicken has been overcooked and dry.

Reviews.Author: Loriana H.
Reviews.Content: We have Roscoe's at least once a month. I never get tired of it because it is good, really good. The chicken is moist and crunchy and never tastes like chemicals or rubber like KFC or any other fried chicken fast food spots. The sides taste home made, and the sweet tea is not too sweet. THIS is the one to go to! The original Roscoe's off of Gower. For some reason this one taste the best, I don't like the one on Pico that much. Their chicken tends to be on the dry side. This one feels like home.

Reviews.Author: Margarita S.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's totally lives up to the hype. I won't bother to mention the wonderfulness of the chicken, as there have been enough reviews that have covered that ground. Everything I ate here was great, but the most divine thing was the fried chicken livers. I haven't had chicken livers this good in years! I can't say enough about how good they were-- perfectly crisp on the outside and oh so very tasty. I am now going to lapse into  food coma from my wonderful brunch at Roscoe's and dream about the great meal that induced this state.

Reviews.Author: Ala S.
Reviews.Content: I've been to the downtown location, so the quality of food at this one was comparatively disappointing. I got the same thing as last time, which was a side order of biscuit & gravy and a buckwheat waffle, but I definitely missed the piping hot freshness of the downtown spot. I also bit into a piece of chicken liver that somehow found its way into my otherwise vegetarian-friendly gravy. The waffle was nice and melt-in-your-mouth, but only after copious amounts of cinnamon syrup (which, by the way, is delish) were applied. I don't have anything to say on the actual chicken aspect of this chicken and waffles joint, but I'm sure there are enough reviews to cover my gap.

Reviews.Author: Mark P.
Reviews.Content: Love me some Roscoe's - but the Pico location is the best. This is the location for the out of towners to go to that are afraid to go to the Pico location. This location gets 4 stars.. Pico gets 5.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: Scoes #1: a great deal for the money. Leaves you full, but not too full. I loved every bite! We need a Roscoe's in the bay area. Very attentive service. Excellent all around.

Reviews.Author: Stan A.
Reviews.Content: Second time and Roscos but first time in this location. Very tough to find parking here. Saturday is usually really busy there. We got the table fast but our waiter was very slow to arrive. Food was good though and the waffle was tasty. Biggest issue was parking and slow service.

Reviews.Author: Wilson K.
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of this place for years. You get a great mix of people. Personally, I don't like anything that I have tried here but the chicken and waffles -- and I have tried it all, or friends have -- but that doesn't skew my rating much. They would get a higher rating if they sent their staff to charm school, but I know to expect slow, slightly rude service when I come here. For whatever reason, I don't mind. Give this place a shot. Love it or hate it, it's worth a try.

Reviews.Author: Troy B.
Reviews.Content: As an east coast resident, I had no clue why chicken and waffles would go well together as a meal.... well when I went to Hollywood for vacation I quickly found out why it's so loved!!! I love Roscoe's and wish we had one I  NJ/NY but until then I will always stop there when I'm on the left coast!

Reviews.Author: Genghis H.
Reviews.Content: Been going here since it was 15% of the size it is now. Food is always hot and the service is fast. I go before 9AM because waiting in line is not for me and I like to park close. When I walk out full and fat, the sidewalk is packed with people. I will continue to frequent this spot. My wife and I usually order a D. + a waffle and smothered potatoes.

Reviews.Author: Dawn H.
Reviews.Content: Okay I will admit it...I came here after seeing Snoop eating here on his reality show. Oh how I wish I wouldn't have !! I got my first case of food poisioning !!

Reviews.Author: Heather F.
Reviews.Content: I don't live in L.A but I try to come here every time I'm in town. I have been to multiple Roscoe locations and this one is by far the best. First off, if you can, call ahead and order take out. They usually will have it ready 10-15 minutes after you call and you don't have to wait to get a table which can be a very long wait. (regardless of the day or time, it is usually busy) They always hook it up too. I never ask but they always add syrup, butter, hot sauce, etc in my bag. One thing I need to point out. Don't come here trying to change up the menu. Order it how it comes. Don't order a salad. Order the chicken and waffles, isn't that why you would come here in the first place. The mac and cheese is pretty amazing too. Overall if you are visiting L.A you have to stop and try this place!

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: The best fried chicken in town, hands down!

Reviews.Author: Nerses K.
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come to visit family in CA its tradition to come to Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles off Gower for breakfast at least once. Love the chicken and egg combo and top off with famous waffles. Jeanne James' Omelette for breakfast, Amazing !

Reviews.Author: khris L.
Reviews.Content: i understand all those people who can't quite acquire the taste of syrup on waffles with fried chicken.  that's just too bad for you.  but, if you haven't tried it, you best make sure that you do once in your life!  you haven't got anything to lose.  besides, if you don't like them together, try either of them seperately on different visits and you won't be sorry.  i'm also glad that they've physically expanded this location to accomodate more people, thus, less waiting.  unfortunately, i couldn't bring myself to give them 5 stars because parking sucks, and the prices could be better.

Reviews.Author: NewTo S.
Reviews.Content: Food is amazing...just be sure to give yourself plenty of time because you'll probably have to wait an hour or so to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Moni F.
Reviews.Content: I made my first pilgrimage to the infamous Roscoe's last night. The line was about 30 deep and people were attempting to cut left and right. We were sat very promptly though, even though it was a tiny joint. Everything smelled absolutely wonderful in there and I had high hopes that perhaps they could come close to the perfection that is my grandma's fried chicken. My hopes were dashed when the food arrived. It came promptly at least. The waffles reminded me of Eggos and the chicken was undercooked, but had a very tough breading on it. Sadly, I have had much better at KFC. I'm sorry Roscoe's. I wanted to love you but the food was poor to mediocre. I might try you again in a different location.

Reviews.Author: Darren A.
Reviews.Content: Chicken was really good.  Waffles were good as well.  Minus one star for slow service.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas Y.
Reviews.Content: this is how much i love chicken i drove all the way from SF to LA to try this chicken i was hearing so delicious about. parking is hard to find. but theyres a guy that valets your car for you. when i went i got lucky and found parking in the front. when i first went i got the 1/4 chicken smothered with the onion gravy sauce.  and 4 fluffy waffles. people think its nasty like waffles and chicken. but you are so wrong its so good. i can honestly say words cant really describe you gotta try it yourself. cause some of my friends found it nasty and some were just dumbfounded by it. the service is awesome there. btw. if your in LA or going to LA give this place a try for sure.

Reviews.Author: ChRiSTiNa C.
Reviews.Content: When I hear the words Chicken and Waffles I think of Roscoe's and how delish that combo is yum-o, I always get the chicken and waffles and some sides. This place is always packed and it's small on the inside, It's not the best area so occasionally I'll see homeless people getting crazy with one another, and be prepared to wait in line for a while depending when you go, but it's worth it...

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Scoe's Number 2. Nuff Said. Love everything about this place, EVERYTHING, from the heart attack inducing menu, to the run down whole in the wall vibe. If you want to enjoy some of the best waffles and fried chicken you've had, Roscoe's the spot.

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: This is as good as it gets when it comes to soul food or southern cooking in LA...It's two blocks from my place in Hollywood, which isnt good, I'm there way to much!!..for breakfast I normally have 3 chicken wings, biscuit, grits and eggs...Dinner I normally have chicken breast, smothered potatoes, greens and cornbread..Today, for lunch I had a chicken breast, a chicken wing, smothered in gravy with two Waffles and its some of the best cooking you will ever eat!!..If you havent tried it, your missing out!..Now I got to go lay down!

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place is as good as you've heard. Fried chicken is perfect, the waffles and syrup are incredible.

Reviews.Author: Lucy R.
Reviews.Content: Hard to find parking but worth the trouble. If you order Lisa's Delight make sure you ask them to go light on the lemonade...it is too sweet. Must have the chicken&waffles.

Reviews.Author: Torrance W.
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I have only been in the LA area for 1 yr...moved here from the South after living in Alabama and Tennessee. Many think chicken and waffles are a Southern tradition and I am afraid to say that it is not. However, I have to admit that I really enjoyed their food. The quality of it all is the closest I have had to my mother's cooking since I have been in LA. A friend of mine was in town from Houston and we both thought, let's see what the hype is about. We were both pleasantly surprised. I didn't think I would like the chicken and waffles but I did and I am now a fan.

Reviews.Author: The V.
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this place four stars. The food was really good! I didn't really like the chili, it reminded me of cafeteria food in elementary school. The waffles are the shit!! Mmmm.. Place is extremely rowdy! Wouldn't want to step foot in there if you wanted to have a quiet, relaxed meal. The only thing that I sucks about this place is that they include tip in the bill. My waiter guy hardly did anything to walk away with my $5 pffftt....

Reviews.Author: Ernie F.
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the BEST DAMN MEAL I HAVE EVER HAD, bottom line!

Reviews.Author: Rose L.
Reviews.Content: The only down side to this place (besides heart attack on a plate ha) is that there is only metered parking around and usually a long wait to be seated. The food is amazing...just don't wait until you are already hungry before you go.

Reviews.Author: Shannon K.
Reviews.Content: Can't be beat. Order the Scoe's #1 (1/4 chicken and two waffles) and you'll be good to go. I have NO IDEA what spices are in the waffles -- it's like cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin pie spice -- but whatever it is, it's the key to success. You will never have another waffle this good, so don't be afraid if it's not the belgian waffle experience you're used to. Just go with it. Chicken is always crispy and perfectly seasoned. I've been to both this location and the one in Long Beach. If you want the original recipe, definitely go here. The Long Beach one has the exact same food, but the atmosphere is completely different -- not in a bad way, just in a different way.

Reviews.Author: Betancourt E.
Reviews.Content: One of the best fried chicken breast in the history of mankind!!! The place is great, throw some hot sauce on the chicken and you will be enjoying this life of your's. I highly recomment this joint!!

Reviews.Author: Lynn S.
Reviews.Content: how can you say no to Roscoe's!!! crispy fried chicken, eggs, and waffles are the best combination all over the world lolservices are always quick and fulfilling, the only thing not so good about Roscoe's is the waiting line... but trust me, the wait is always worthy~

Reviews.Author: Ruth M.
Reviews.Content: First time I went to Roscoe's the fried chicken and collard greens were too salty, but mac n cheese and corn bread were excellent!  Second time I went everything was excellent, not too salty.  I'm guessing the first time I ate there the cooks accidentally over salted the food.

Reviews.Author: Nicole M.
Reviews.Content: Yummy!!! There is always a long wait here but it is worth it! Im not huge on fried chicken but I LOVE theirs! The waffles are also pretty good although not the best. My favorite is their corn bread! I could eat it it every day!

Reviews.Author: Dantae M.
Reviews.Content: The food here was on point I loved everything I had

Reviews.Author: Aubrey V.
Reviews.Content: Love this location not far from one of our building we service. So when we get a chance to get some Mac and cheese and  Chicken and waffles I'm game !!!

Reviews.Author: Clay C.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm....... Fried Chicken at it's best!!

Reviews.Author: Xibie C.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so if I could rate the experience, it would probably be a 5... but listen, I've NEVER had chicken like that. And it was yummy I would say, but it is a high price to pay and you need to have the stomach for it. It was truly, deeply and seriously fried. On that note, the waffle was ok too, nothing that I have never eaten before, nothing special. The mac and cheese tasted pretty good, interesting taste, but far from cheesy. I would go back, again, for the experience, but I would pretty much only order the waffles so that when I leave the place I don't think I am going into a food coma. :o)

Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: If I could eat Roscoe's everyday, I would... Their waffles are perfection!  Parking can be a little difficult in this area of Hollywood, so make sure you bring money for street parking.

Reviews.Author: Carlos Z.
Reviews.Content: by farrrrrrrrr the best fried chicken i ve had in my life ! hands down! hats off!  salute and respect !!  great food !  the service not what you would expect  but in reality  who cares the chicken is so tasty it keeps your mind so busy .i don ever eat food with fingers !!!!! i found myself licking my fingers and  sucking on chicken bones ... how embarrassing  but at same time  it felt so right.

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: You can barely go a week without hearing about this place on Food Network.  So, since i was in LA i thought I would try this place. i was with two others and we have never eaten anything like this before so we were a little loss.  Is the waffle as a side, do you do something to combine it? Well, we all took to different routines.  I ate my chicken by itself and treated the waffle as a side.  i wanted to see if there was anything special about the fried chicken.  One other person shredded the chicken and put it on the waffle, i guess a sort of tostada.  another person treated the waffle like a taco.  we did get some looks from the table next to us. The final assessment, what is the big deal.  Yeah, chicken was good but nothing for me to rave over.  I was expected some great belgian waffle but to me was just a large eggo waffle. Sorry, but don't get it and why someone would pay big bucks for this combination. I expected it to have bigger pieces of chicken but just basically the size of what you'd get at a fast food joint. I guess to each his own but sorry, this isn't my thing.

Reviews.Author: Glenn S.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that in all the years that I used to live in L.A. and drove past Roscoe's every day on my way to work, I had never been in to try it. Well 20 years later I finally tried it yesterday for breakfast I can't believe what I'd been missing. Friendly staff, delicious food and reasonable prices. I had the Big Momma Special which was scrambled eggs with onions, potatoes drenched in country gravy and a biscuit. The eggs were cooked to perfection, as was everything else. My wife had the chicken omelet and a buttermilk waffle. Again, perfection. Portions are just right. It was a great experience and left satisfied and wanting to come back.

Reviews.Author: CP P.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the more popular joints for anyone visiting the LA area. I've been here countless times in large and small groups. Personally I think their food is great, but a tad bit overrated. However, their service has always been above par. The last time I was there with a group, we arrived a couple minutes before their kitchen closed, but they were accommodating and kept it open a little extra longer for us all to order. I would recommend to anyone visiting LA or general surrounding area.

Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: I need a round two for a full review.

Reviews.Author: Danny U.
Reviews.Content: Better than I thought it would be !!!! Chicken was good waffles kinda to soggy for my taste but did have great flavor !!!! Service was very good !!!!

Reviews.Author: Angel D.
Reviews.Content: i like Roscoe's ... but i like the Pasadena location better..

Reviews.Author: Tracey S.
Reviews.Content: Late night , it's just what is needed, afternoon, starting to really get crowded but still worth it, dinner, the wait can be long but still to me worth the wait. Just good ass food.

Reviews.Author: Victor J.
Reviews.Content: The chicken and waffles combination was ok. Expected way more but can't complain.

Reviews.Author: Maria DJesu R.
Reviews.Content: First time going to this place and all I have to say is WOW. Never in my life did I think this combination of fried chicken and waffles would work, but I was wrong. Nice restaurant. It has an intimate setting. The food!! Amazing! I ordered the "Obama Special" (3 wings with a waffle). The syrup is liquid gold!! Service was great. Everyone there is really nice. You have to try it. Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Author: Ravenous T.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! The chicken was so tasty and the waffles were perfect with all that butter smothered and syrup. The service was awesome and the people at the front including the security guard were so nice. They were telling us where we can park, etc. Go early though or be prepared to wait!

Reviews.Author: Nicole C.
Reviews.Content: After hiking for about an hour, my best friend wouldn't stop talking about how she wanted chicken and waffles. So, in an effort to help satisfy her craving, we headed to the famous Roscoe's in Hollywood. An unassuming establishment off the beaten path, this place is so popular, it had a line out the door and down the street. As we sat down, we were promptly greeted by our server. We already knew what we wanted, and were ready for a chow down. As most Roscoe's patrons do, we ordered fried chicken and waffles, with a side of mac and cheese and corn bread. Before we knew it, we were stuffing our faces with a decently tasting meal, albeit greasy. And while it was an overall decent dining experience, I don't know that I'll be heading to Roscoe's again, anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Michael O.
Reviews.Content: When I get back from LA,  I tell people here in Chicago that I ate at Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles and they all seem to think I'm either kidding or really stupid.  Oh, well -- it's their loss.

Reviews.Author: me u.
Reviews.Content: If you serve KFC's (or Ralph's) fried chicken with nicely toasted Eggo waffles, you would have a similar meal.  Maybe try it with some Tabasco sauce, butter, and maple syrup to add dimension and delight to the combination.  I bet my suggestion would even taste better!  Of course, if you are craving it all in one place, then Roscoe's is a convenient one-stop shop for this combination.  I do commend Roscoe's for their good service--professional, attentive, and quick.

Reviews.Author: I really h.
Reviews.Content: Im from nor cal and this is the shit. beats eating pho any day of the week

Reviews.Author: arja r.
Reviews.Content: I love fried chicken and this place was pretty good. The prices are alittle steep but for a treat once in awhile its good. The menu is alittle confusing though.

Reviews.Author: Trevor R.
Reviews.Content: Compared to the Pico location, this one is harder to find decent parking for, but the food more than makes up for any difficulties.  The chicken is the best tasting, juiciest chicken you've ever had.  The french fries and mac and cheese are to die for.  And the waffles are the sweetest, richest waffles I've ever had.  This place is an institution and deserves tons of praise.

Reviews.Author: Jean P.
Reviews.Content: I do not know what the deal is about this place but I must say that I am not too impressed with some of the stuff that I have heard about this place having now gone to the location. I wish I could fully understand why the people like this place so much because the customer service is not so great and the food to me was horrible. Why mix waffles with chicken, and do not tell me that it is a southern thing.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle B.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE ROSCOES CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! I live all the way in Virginia but always have to get my Roscoe's fix when I am in town. Very filling and worth the wait (when there is one.) MUST GO!!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca M.
Reviews.Content: I was just reminded today how much I LOVE Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles.  I'm living in San Francisco, and I found this tiny lunch only place that serves chicken and waffles.  It has all these great reviews on yelp, so I've been looking forward to getting chicken and waffles since I first learned of it's existence.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't Roscoe's.  In fact, after eating there, I want to drive six hours south just to eat Roscoe's this weekend *sigh*.  I miss the buiscuts, the gravy, the chicken, the waffles, the grits.... pretty much everything about it.  If you're in the area, you should definitely try the place out.

Reviews.Author: Holly B.
Reviews.Content: Yum yum yum....It was the best fried chicken I've ever had....

Reviews.Author: Chi-Chong s.
Reviews.Content: Foods pretty good.  Friendly People. and oh NO SAGGING PANTS!! otherwise you wont get any service. word!

Reviews.Author: Restie D.
Reviews.Content: I really don't see what the hype is all about. The chicken is ok, but nothing to write home about. It just seems like another trendy place to go after clubbing.

Reviews.Author: Alex N.
Reviews.Content: Ate at this Roscoe's for the first time last week. Food and service were both great. Our server even got my cousin a free dish of the collared greens because she'd never tried them before. The only thing I have to complain about is the parking. We got lucky and found a spot right in front, but that was at 10:30 at night. I can't imagine trying to go around dinner time.

Reviews.Author: Lauren K.
Reviews.Content: Everyone talks about this place where I'm from so I had the expectation it would be mind-blowing. It wasn't. It was pretty good though and I'd go back again... eventually.  When I first got my order (I ordered the chicken and waffles) I thought the portions weren't that big, but I was wrong. It was so filling. The waffles were the best part. There was cinnamon or something in it. The fried chicken was so-so for me. It was good in that there was not a big fat crust of the fried part but to me it was just fried chicken. Nothing special. Plus the service we had (only a party of 3)  wasn't good at all. It was not even crowded.

Reviews.Author: Sam Q.
Reviews.Content: Oh...My...God! All my life I thought everyone always hyped up how good Roscoes was. I honestly and truly enjoyed every single bite of my food. What ever you do dont forget to get a side of Mac N Cheese, and a extra waffle... MMM

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: Forget the chicken, eat the waffles.

Reviews.Author: Robert A.
Reviews.Content: Just finished eating at roscoe's.  You can never go wrong by coming here.  Everytime it's always the same good quality food.  There always on point.  I would have to say this is the best fried chicken in L.A. The waffles are the best too.  They have a special delicious taste to them.  Been coming here for years.  I've tried all the different Roscoe locations.  This is the best one!!

Reviews.Author: Keith H.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place, I eat here everytime I'm in LA, they have the best waffles..

Reviews.Author: Master R.
Reviews.Content: I love coming here for one reason alone... Home cooking. Mmm

Reviews.Author: Valerie V.
Reviews.Content: Great Place to eat.  Love it....

Reviews.Author: K K.
Reviews.Content: The food here was SO GOOD!  I was in LA on vacay for just a few days, and I was told I HAD to come here.  I'm glad I did!  It was worth the wait.  The fried chicken was delish.  The waffles were actually light and tasty.  And the mac 'n' cheese must have been the creamiest I've ever eaten.  I wish we had one of these in DC!

Reviews.Author: Tabitha B.
Reviews.Content: One succulent breast and one delicious waffle...the carole c special!

Reviews.Author: Carol R.
Reviews.Content: Please!!! This restaurant really isn't very good. I ended up paying $20 for forgettable chicken and waffles. When I read all the wonderful reviews, I wondered if they just came here with low expectations.

Reviews.Author: Shelley M.
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times and have yet to be disappointed!!  And this location - the original - has expanded since the last time I was there, which is a plus.  It was dinky before!  Parking, as usual, blows, but you'll want to walk after mowing the insanely delicious fried chicken and the waffles.  Seriously, the best fried chicken I've ever had - crunchy, well seasoned, and juicy!  And the waffles.  I wish I could figure out what seasoning they put in them, but it's awesome and they are sponges for the butter and the syrup.  I know the idea of chicken and waffles together sounds weird to some people, but it is the BEST!

Reviews.Author: Anthony S.
Reviews.Content: Awww Man, just thinking about this place makes me hungry. I have to eat Roscoes anytime I'm in LA. Took the entire family there while visiting inlaws last week and the food and service was as good as I anticipated. The host a former Navy guy like myself from Louisiana was really cool. We had a large party and he easily accomodated us even though they were extremely busy (like always). I always get the country boy w/ a side of grits and an eclipse. I tried virtually everthing on the menu though being a southern boy myself I must say that nothing on thier menu has dissapointed me. The only pitfall to this place is the PARKING SUX. Same thing for the Pico and Manchester locations. You may have to park and walk to get there because parking spaces are always full. I even got a ticket during a visit a while back. oh well, lesson learned.

Reviews.Author: Tim M.
Reviews.Content: Great chicken. Just like I steeped into a time machine and was down south delicious home fried chicken

Reviews.Author: Ed M.
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say that hasn't been said already. This place is awesome. Get the number 13 for sure. Best chicken ever!!!! Good waffles too. Took my family that came in from San Diego they wanted to see what was all the hype and they didn't leave disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Feng H.
Reviews.Content: Love Roscoe's  chicken and waffles! The wait can be a bit of a pain if you come during prime lunch or dinner hours, but the fried chicken is worth it. There is free street parking if you park further away. Also, try eating it there because it's not quite the same if you do take-out.

Reviews.Author: Donna L.
Reviews.Content: I've heard so much about this place, so maybe the it was overhyped for me.  The food was good, no doubt, but the prices were too pricey.

Reviews.Author: Jay C.
Reviews.Content: the usual hang out spot w/ my bf & his crew :)i love me some GRITS!

Reviews.Author: Krista R.
Reviews.Content: So shortly after moving to Hollywood I decided to go a see what all the rave was about with this place. Now being as I'm from the south I had high expectations. Needless to say I walked away deeply disappointed. The chicken was perfectly mediocre and the waffle was ok but I honestly can't figure out why everyone raves about this place, I've definitely had better authentic southern style food. The service wasn't too great either, my cup was left empty for 15 minutes, a HUGE no no when I go into a restaurant and then the girl who rang us up at the end was pretty rude too. Idk if I'll come back...

Reviews.Author: Juicy C.
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE.... every time Im in so-cal I make a stop here. Im loving the Oj for sure. They give you so much food that you can share a plate and trust me, Im a good eater. Customer service is always outstanding. Never had any issues. Reminds me of Atlanta and my granny's cooking. Comfort food...

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: I was craving fried chicken and was not feeling like cooking last night so I thought to try Roscoe's, since I have heard good things. I phoned in an order for a pick up of chicken from the Gower location in Hollywood (1/2 a chicken, a 1/4 chicken and waffles, and a biscuit). While I was very excited for some really good fired chicken, I was very disappointed. The chicken was dry and tasted old, like it was under a heat lamp for most of the day. I hate to say, but I have had better chicken at the deli in the grocery store. While the biscuit had potential, it was under cooked and almost raw. The waffle was the best part of the meal. However, it was not worth the $25. I most say that this place is over rated and does not deliver on all the hype. I wish it did, since it is so close. I guess I will just go back to making real fried chicken when I get the craving. Sorry Roscoe's, but I think my first visit will be my last.

Reviews.Author: Irene U.
Reviews.Content: after a long drive from SF, we got to roscoe's chicken and waffle about 7am. i was disappointed to find out they didn't open til 8:30! boo. the bf and i killed some time at starbucks across the street but when we couldn't take any more sitting, we went to hollywood blvd. it was pretty cool there. not a lot of shops were open but that means not a lot of tourist yet, even though we are one ourselves...okay, that was completely irrelevant. roscoe's chicken and waffle was delicious! don't know if it's cause i'd been snacking on pb&j sandwiches and kix cereal all night, but the fried chicken was so crunchy and moist and flavorful. i wish the waffle had a little crunch on the sides, but that didn't stop me from devouring that too. the bf and i shared corn bread and mac&cheese. wasn't a big fan of either one but he enjoyed it so that's good. i forget which place but one restaurant had pieces of corn in their cornbread and i've been trying to find it since! if you find it, let me know please. -1 star for the oily menu's and some dirty utensils..but that doesn't stop be from coming back next time i'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: Darlene S.
Reviews.Content: Loove Roscoe's! It doesnt matter which location! I like the setting inside.. and the ambiance.. it looks like a big country house with the different rooms converted into dining rooms. Lots of celeb pictures inside because the place is pretty famous and a fan of a lot of celebrities. We even walked in here with Mike Tyson! Literally!!  Anyways, food is delicious. Juicy flavorful chicken! just the right seasoning.. and matches well with their yummy waffles and syrup! A MUST TRY!! This my younger bros favorite place to eat!  He is such a fan, he bought a Roscoes t-shirt for souvenir here. Roscoes is famous for all the right reasons ;) Everyone should try at least once!

Reviews.Author: S S.
Reviews.Content: I heard so much about this place so on my trip to LA, i stopped by and got some chicken and waffle. The food was tasty but didn't hit the spot. Next time I'm gonna try something else on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Daniel F.
Reviews.Content: awesome~!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: Redbull doesn't give you wings, Roscoe's does..... Aside from the wait (40 mins on a Saturday night) it was awesome. Worth the wait so if you're mulling it over, just go!

Reviews.Author: Ara D.
Reviews.Content: Best chicken and waffles hands down! I might be treading a thin line with this statement as I'm sure there are some great chicken and waffle places throughout the south, but my enthusiasm can't be overcome. I've been to Roscoe's in Hollywood, Pasadena, and Long Beach, and nothing but great experiences. The fried chicken breast is incredibly succulent and moist with just the right amount of batter. It's crispy without taking away from the flavor with the chicken unlike most places that just lay on the batter to detract from the mediocrity of the chicken. And of course, the waffles are soft and warm with some excellent, unhealthy butter and syrup that makes for a magical combo. For the price, it's a very generous portion and unless you have a Kobayashi belly, you won't leave hungry.I can't speak to the sandwiches or other items on the menu. Just stick to the classic chicken and waffles combo and you'll leave with a happy tummy.

Reviews.Author: Brian D.
Reviews.Content: Great waffles and peoplewatching. Our waiter could've done a better a job explaining how we might order exactly what we wanted given the maze of menu options. I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Marisa M.
Reviews.Content: I hate writing bad reviews but I feel like people should know how awful this place is. The only good thing I can say about it is that the staff was friendly. The food is atrocious! OMG there aren't enough negative words in the English language to describe it. Bleh! The chicken was DRYYYYYYYY and bland - there was barely any breading/batter on it - it was like they just dropped an unseasoned piece of chicken in oil, fried until every drop of moisture fled from the chicken and then threw it on a plate next to the soggy, circular object that slightly resembled a waffle and charged me too much money for it. The potatoes and gravy tasted like a wet pile of dirt and the Mac and cheese - blaaaaaah. Overcooked, soggy macaroni  with a small amount of greasy cheese and overall no flavor. I will never come back here and in the future, I will pay more attention to the negative reviews on yelp. I had high expectations simply because there were so many good reviews but they were all wrong. Avoid this place at all costs fellow yelpers! You will be thankful you did.

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch at ROSCOES on my way to the Playboy Mansion ESPY VIP PARTY!  Roscoes, hands down has the best chicken and waffles in town, actually the World!  At first I thought it was odd to mix the two together, but after I tried the "Stubby" it was all making sense to me!   The service was FAST, Chicken is TASTY, Waffles are Yum Yum, and  parking was right on time real easy right off of Sunset!!!  and if you Go to Roscoe's Please bring me back Chicken and Waffles!! Oh Yeah!! Roscoe's is a must go to hot spot at least once in your lifetime!

Reviews.Author: Richard P.
Reviews.Content: The combination of fried chicken and waffles is addictive! The staff is friendly and service is prompt. The restaurant is small so expect to wait in line during peak hours.

Reviews.Author: Armando T.
Reviews.Content: I have been West Coast proud all my lifeThat is why it is sad that I can only give three stars.I just returned from NYC and ate at Amy Ruth's in Harlem.  I had chicken and waffles there and was totally blown away by their food.I arrived ready to claim victory for Roscoe's in the West Coast Vs. East Coast -- chicken 'n waffles war.  I ordered the contestants -- white meat chicken w/gravy on the side and waffles.RESULTS:1.  Chicken --- moist, good crust, this was very close but the WINNER is Amy Ruth's.  Roscoe's chicken while very tasty was not as flavorful as Amy Ruth's.  I would give the chicken 4 stars2. Waffles --- They were OK.  They were a little better than most waffles I have had; however, I was comparing them to Amy Ruth's'  WINNER is Amy Ruth's.  Amy Ruth's were crisp on the out side and fluffy and tender on the inside, even after you put syrup on them.  Amy's waffles were deep with flavor and were like nothing I have ever tasted.     Roscoe's waffles just do not compare.  They turned soggy with just butter put one them and had an average taste.  2 StarsOver all the food was OK.  I was bummed.  I took my son here and wanted to proclaim to him that he was eating the best chicken and waffles ever.  Sadly, I had to tell him that this was the best chicken and waffles HE has ever had.  This is due to Roscoe's being his 1st chicken and waffles experience.  Damn!!!!

Reviews.Author: Xs X.
Reviews.Content: Careful, you can get addicted to fried chicken here.

Reviews.Author: Mitchell T.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and waffles together at last! Great food, people and atmoshpere. Good prices as well

Reviews.Author: Frank C.
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the chicken and waffle.  I especially like it when the syrup i put on my waffle makes it over to my chicken.  Who would of thought?  The chick is nice and crispy on the outside and juicy inside.   Just how i like it.  Throw a little Louisiana hot sauce on it and you got yourself a tasty piece of chicken.  But it is the waffle that really completes the meal.  I am not sure what it is that is in the waffle that makes it so savory but my God I didnt want the waffle to end.  The prices are decent and I have not tried ant of the other main dishes but the chicken and waffle is definitely worth the drive.  I did try the Mac N' Cheese and it is worth it to get on the side.  It is extremely cheesy and creamy.  I try to visit this place every time I am in LA and you should to.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth T.
Reviews.Content: I'm from the south, so I know fried chicken. This is not really the way that we make it, so I was very skeptical at first, but after a couple of pieces you start to appreciate what it's trying to do. It's great with the hot sauce.But the waffles, the waffles are amazing. They have cinnamon, i guess on them which make them that much more divine. Go on a Saturday night, they stay open until about 4 a.m. You will wait a while, but you will be very entertained. I promise.

Reviews.Author: Jeff B.
Reviews.Content: Had chicken and waffles. The waffles were good, but not great. I would say above average. The chicken was good, but again not the greatest. Again, above average. If you want to try chicken and waffles I say try it. Other than that, not much else to order there.

Reviews.Author: Eddy L.
Reviews.Content: You must try eating the chicken and waffles together.  mmmmm  crunchy chicken offset by the syrupy sweet, buttery sponge of moist waffle NOM NOM NOM. I was trying to convince myself that i was drunk and that during the day this stuff isn't that good.   It's such a simple but brilliant concept that delivers.  I will return!

Reviews.Author: Duckee D.
Reviews.Content: The ORIGINAL Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles.  :)We came on a Sunday evening around 9pm and the wait was about 30 minutes.  Not bad.  They had estimated 40 minutes, and waiting less time than anticipated is always nice.  ;)Read reviews before we came so we knew we wanted of course Chicken & Waffles, but also opted for gravy, Mac n' Cheese, and grits.Chicken ~ Good - a tiny bit dry, and I've heard people say they like Popeye's better - sorry - it's sacrilege, but I'd have to agree.  I think Popeye's injects their chicken and that keeps it juicy.  Nom.Gravy ~ Yum.  Delicious.  Some people say get it on the side, but I'd only do that if they gave you MORE.  ;)  I like it smothered.  Maybe because the chicken's a bit dry.  ;)Mac n' Cheese ~ Great, standard baked Mac n' Cheese. A "drier" style - not gooey with cheese, but great flavor - they salt their noodles, which goes a long way to imparting flavor to the whole dish.  Enhances the cheesiness.  :)Grits ~ NO.  I think I read ONE review that said they LOVED them and for some reason missed all the ones that said the grits were tasteless.  They weren't actually tasteless though ... they tasted like the tap water they were made with.  Come on, people!  I know some like their grits plain so they can add different things to them ... but then at least put "cheese grits" on the menu so people know if they're ordering the regular "grits" they know they're absolutely plain.  Not even butter in them!  =P  BUT ... we added leftover waffle syrup to them and they were not half bad because ... the Waffles ~ were HEAVENLY.  Oh man.  Perfect.  Malty, soft, chewy, lightly crispy, all at the same time.  Butter was nice and soft, and the SYRUP.  Oh the syrup was perfect for these bad boys.  This is what waffles should be.  I think they were the best waffles I've ever had.  And I love waffles.The service is fine, although since there's always a wait, they're sometimes so busy busing and seating that there will be lulls in attention.  Shortly after we got our food, we were asked three different times if everything was okay, but then after that were left alone for like an hour!  Not a big deal though - we just asked someone walking by whenever we needed anything.I'd definitely recommend.  It's one of those places you just have to try anyway.  Get the Fried Chicken & Waffles, and the gravy.  Yes.  If you like Mac n' Cheese, get that too.  We also go the Sweet Potato Pie, and that was yum as well.  :)

Reviews.Author: Brent F.
Reviews.Content: This is an iconic place to eat.  You would never eat Chicken and Waffles together, but they make it work.  The food is not nothing to die for, but its good.  The chicken is simple.  The waffle has a certain cinnimon taste to it, but I like the waffle better than the chicken.  The mac and cheese is good.  I would normally give this place three stars, but I added an extra one b/c the owner has supported my friend in his congressional campaign.

Reviews.Author: Debbie B.
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Roscoe's in 5 days!  This location is not as bright as the one in Pasadena....but the food was still delicious!!!  I still cannot get with the concept of chicken and waffles!!!  Anyway, great experience ...we all enjoyed our meals ...I was the only one with chix,potato salad and mac n' cheese...met comedian Paul Mooney....Drew Carey recommended this place ,the day after we went to TPIR......hmmmm!!!!   This completes my tour of California 2010......until we meet again!!  date of this visit was 10/18/10

Reviews.Author: Anthony C.
Reviews.Content: You have not had chicken and waffles unless you have ate at Roscoe's. I had waffles that were so light and fluffy. they melted in my mouth. The chicken was fried golden brown (not greasy). It was so good i can not eat chicken and waffles no where else

Reviews.Author: Stephen L.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. This place is a must if you're ever in Hollywood. I was initially a little thrown off by the combination of fried chicken and waffles but due to its fame I had to try it. The two foods actually paired surprisingly well together, the sweet and savory syrup and waffles combined with the saltiness of the chicken, pure genius. I tried Scoe's -1/4 chix with gravy and onions and 2 waffles, it was great, although it does promote gluttony, haha. The drinks are awesome as well- Sunrise (half lemonade/half OJ), Sunset (half lemonade/half fruit punch) are especially good. I will definitely be back for more. I wish there were a restaurant in Boston that offered a combination this delicious!

Reviews.Author: Siyi Z.
Reviews.Content: Went here for brunch before starting out our day. My friends and I thought there was a long line after seeing a huge group of people waiting outside, but we only waited about 10 minutes before we were seated inside.We all ordered #18 with a piece of leg and a waffle because it was one of the cheaper options and didn't come with THAT much food. My waffle wasn't toasted as well as my friends' because it was a little soft and not as brown in color, but it was still delicious. The waiters there were friendly and brought the food pretty fast.Parking can be a little tricky since there is no designed lot. All there is available is street parking. If you get lucky, you might end up parking right outside the restaurant. If not, then you might have to walk a few blocks.

Reviews.Author: Eric K.
Reviews.Content: This place has really gone downhill. Dry chicken. Soggy greens w/o the stems removed (a sad å la carte portion that costs over $4 for some reason). Undercooked waffles AND the waitress got our order wrong. It's been a few years since I've been here and it will be a few more before I go back.

Reviews.Author: Ann-Marie N.
Reviews.Content: Living on the east coast it is not everyday that a girl gets to eat at Roscoe's. I was in LA for two nights and two days and Roscoe's was on the to-do list. I was not disappointed. I had the waffle with the leg and a glass of sweet tea. The waffle was delicious. The chicken leg was great but I had no idea that it was going to be so tiny  or I would have ordered an extra leg or a 1/4 dark meat.

Reviews.Author: Darwin M.
Reviews.Content: Best Chicken and waffles combination I've ever had... love this place... great service... its always pack on The weekends... so make sure you come hungry and be ready to wait a few mins... in the end its gonna be a meal well served... Chicken and waffles, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: The best chicken in cali!!!! Country boy and greens please.....

Reviews.Author: K J.
Reviews.Content: I was a waffle & chicken virgin & I am now addicted. The food is amazing!!! The chicken reminds me of my Mom's chicken.

Reviews.Author: Martha F.
Reviews.Content: Very YummY!!! I wish they would make one closer to where I live but the chicken and waffle combination is definetly worth the drive. Don't forget to try the Sunrise. Delicious and refreshing drink :)

Reviews.Author: Edgar H.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's opened a new world to me a world full of chicken and..and waffles and their together with syrup. They're so far the only place which has done it well.

Reviews.Author: A. J.
Reviews.Content: This was my second time here, the first for dinner and this for lunch since I had time to kill from waiting for my car at Toyota on Hollywood Boulevard.Both times I found the chicken, whether with waffles or not, on the dry side.  For lunch I had a thigh for $2.60 (steep price indeed for what I got--how do you justify that?), and the very much touted in Yelp reviews mac and cheese for $4.90.  The mac and cheese was very good, but that price for maybe a cup and a half?  I'd've saved much money at KFC with better results.And both times I was assailed throughout much of my dining experience by loud-mouthed rude women who did not care that they were in a social setting.  The explosive, loud laughing was very uncomfortable.  Was it already not loud enough in there???  For sure, don't go into the back room. There are so many other ways to spend my money for better food, more of it, and a comfortable environment.

Reviews.Author: William W.
Reviews.Content: I love ordering the chicken in gravy with waffles.  The biscuits and corn bread are also good.  Be aware that the line can take forever (hour) and it is a little expensive for dry out chicken.

Reviews.Author: Pam C.
Reviews.Content: OFF THE HOOK!!!  Best chicken ever.

Reviews.Author: Maggie S.
Reviews.Content: NOM. This restaurant is an LA staple. Hands down, one of the best plates of fried chicken in the whole city! Sadly, the rest is just fine. Regardless, GET THAT CHICKEN.

Reviews.Author: Veronica G.
Reviews.Content: Been there twice, I think it's over rated and pricey... food wasn't all that great, and it took for ever to get a table... just not a fan and i loveee chicken and waffles!

Reviews.Author: Ernesto R.
Reviews.Content: I literally had an epiphany while eating at Roscoes. Chicken was perfection, the Mac N Cheese was goooood and the waffles were amazing!

Reviews.Author: Gladis C.
Reviews.Content: Love the food! The greens and yams are delicious! Fat slices of corn bread! We didn't have to wait for a table. Fell in love with the whole menu!

Reviews.Author: Ryan P.
Reviews.Content: Yelp calls two start "meh. I've experienced better". I'd give it two and a half if I could, but that description is exactly how I felt. Really basic waffle. Not much flavor to the waffle itself, so it needed a generous slathering of butter and syrup to make it enjoyable. Neither the butter or syrup were anything special either though so it really came out to just a "meh" experience. I've had better waffles at diners for much less money. The chicken was fried nicely and had good flavor. I'm a West Coast guy, so maybe I just don't have that sweet spot in my heart for chicken paired with waffles that some do, but while they are both things I like in general, having them together in the same meal just didn't do anything wonderful for me. Over $10 for the dish is the main reason I can't give it more stars.. If the dish had been half the price, I'd have overlooked the less than impressive portion size and flavor level, but at this price for chicken and waffles, it needs to really stand out, and it didn't.Service was prompt, the guy who greets at the door was very nice, and the food came out very very quickly - but it's fried chicken and waffles - there's no reason for it to take more than a couple minutes to make, so should that be impressive or just par for the course?

Reviews.Author: Fidel C.
Reviews.Content: Came to Roscoe's Chicken and waffles for the first time, it was only a 5 minute wait which was good. Once inside i got to say the service was great, fast and polite. Their chicken breast and waffle combo was good, a big chicken breast, definitely hit the spot. Although the food was good i think this place is over rated. Too much hype for its signature dish. Well worth the try though, but nothing out of the extra ordinary.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: If the chicken hadn't been so dang tasty, I would have given it ZERO stars. We were typical tourists and wanted to read the menu so when we asked for a few minutes, she gave us like TWENTY.  The sweet tea tasted off, like it was yesterday's and the greens were bitter.  And WTF???  No pepper vinegar?  And you claim to be SOUTHERN style.  Our server didn't even know what I was talking about!   Besides the chicken and waffles, all the food was lukewarm.  I grew up in the south on many items from this menu and I was not impressed by anything except my giant piece of chicken.  My advice:  throw your tea out every night, get some dang pepper vinegar, tell your servers NOT to act so entitled and put some neckbones up in dem greens!!!

Reviews.Author: Mitch K.
Reviews.Content: Some good old home cooking not for health minded.  Great fried chicken and the sweetness of the waffles made it a meal to remember the good old days of my childhood.  Now when you add the mac n cheese then you've gone to the next level.  A stop when your in Hollywood for sure!

Reviews.Author: Raquel P.
Reviews.Content: I left universal studios just so I could eat. Mac and cheese is the bomb...everything here is sooo good. Too bad northern cali don't have any locations. Every time I'm down visiting childhood friends and family its one of my fave places to eat..I even order to go after I eat. Take me some goodies back to the telly..yup they are that freak en good.

Reviews.Author: Cy D.
Reviews.Content: Love the food. I've been a few times now, but the service this time around was unfortunately very bad. Otherwise, it's a good place to try out!

Reviews.Author: Aaron G.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes Nuff Said

Reviews.Author: Simone V.
Reviews.Content: Of all the Roscoe location's have been too, I have to admit, this one tops my list.  I had the Scoe's #1, dark meat, which was 1/4 deep fried chicken (translated to leg and thigh) that came with 2 waffles topped with butter and paired with syrup.  The chicken was awesome!  And to be honest, I wasn't a big fan of Roscoe's in the past and I always thought it was overrated and overpriced.  Maybe I was craving chicken and waffles like crazy, I don't know, but I really enjoyed every bite this time around.  The chicken was crispy and flavorful and the waffles was more than enough to make me full.  I can't pour syrup over my plate like other patrons... it's just too sweet for me, so having it on the side to dip was a good compliment to the meal.  Service was great from the moment we walked to the front door of the place, we were already greeted by a host with a menu ready to seat us.  Roscoe's... thanks for satisfying my chicken and waffles craving with your o so yummy, southern goodness!  I'm sure to be back!

Reviews.Author: Kelly B.
Reviews.Content: I swear I must get mental block when it comes to this place because I don't eat here nearly as much as I ought to!   I don't know much about Southern food but I know enough that if you want good chicken you come to Roscoe's because their chicken is amaze-balls!!!  For fried chicken its is light in texture, juicy and perhaps the moist-ists chicken I've ever eaten.    What is particularly good about this fried chicken is that they get both the inside and the outside RIGHT!  The waffles are amaze-balls too. I guess when you have a restaurant tooting chicken and waffles you better do those two things right and boy do these guys ever get these delectable morsels right!!   If you have the room in your tummy, they have plenty of yummy sides.   You will read the menu and it will all sound good.  You will be hard pressed to pick something... To sum it up, If you are looking for comfort food, come no further, Roscoe's is the place!

Reviews.Author: Anora S.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of fried chicken, but this place didn't wow me. Don't get me wrong, it was good, just wasn't really impressed. Not much of a breakfast person so I didn't get the waffles, but I did try it and the chicken & waffle combo wasn't so bad, as weird as it sounds! But my friends couldn't stop ranting and raving about so I guess it was okay.

Reviews.Author: mascha r.
Reviews.Content: Listen. Who does not like good food ?I mean this place is fab. Tastes good and is priced well. I can not recommend this place enough. I was impressed! I ordered waffles to go and was worried it would be poor by the time it got home... ,but to my surprise it was just great The waffles are eggo-like in thickness but larger, about 8 inches wide but MUCH better quality. Sitting in the Styrofoam boxes, all I could smell was the maple syrup, even though all the syrup containers were tightly closed. The chicken was deliciously fried but NOT greasy (unlike popeyes, which is equally delicious but 5x as greasy). After figuring out how to eat both the waffles and the chicken with knife and fork, I resorted to using my hands to eat both...which is okay because all orders come with wet naps! I ordered the thigh and leg and both were tender, moist and perfectly seasoned. Dipping the waffles in the gravy is really good as well. I wouldn't recommend ordering the fries, there's nothing special about them besides that they're FRESH and hot, I burnt my tongue. My order of 4 pcs of chicken, 3 waffles, gravy, and fries came out to about $22. A little bit pricey (causing this review to lose a star) but no complaints because I was completely satisfied with my meal. Highly recommended, I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Sabrina W.
Reviews.Content: I heard the Pico location was alot better than this one, but I came here when family was in town. I got the smothered chicken! So GOOD! I don't care for the biscuits or cornbread here, but everything else is wonderful. Definitely not something you can eat everyday, but a true treat when you are craving comfort food. Very good. Great service.

Reviews.Author: Sookie P.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Another L.A. staple...this is my second review in a row about chicken places...what can I say, I love fried chicken! And this place has the best fried chicken, its seriously addictive. I was a vegetarian for 5 years, and having dreams about fried chicken was what finally did me in. Anyways, the food is great, and the wait staff are friendly and attentive. Maybe not the healthiest in food options, this is a guilty pleasure that's totally worth giving in to once in a while.

Reviews.Author: Ms. S.
Reviews.Content: Pico and La Brea location...Delicious, some of the best food I ever had...so amazing. BUT ! They've got roaches (bold ones that crawl on tables...my table!)I'm sticking to the one off of Sunset/Gower.

Reviews.Author: Skag M.
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews???  I've had Roscoe's twice and both times the food was inedible.  The waffles were rubbery  and the chicken was really greasy.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it. Sometimes it takes a while to be seated, but it's definitely worth it. .Best waffle I've ever had, and I never would have thought of dunking chicken into syrup--but it's genius. I've never ordered anything but the Carol C., but I don't need to!

Reviews.Author: Zack R.
Reviews.Content: This isn't your father's roscoes. For all my life, I have been a huge fan of this place, and used to go many times when I was young. I haven't gone in such a long while until recently, and needless to say, I was let down. Spending some time in New York over the last summer, Ive been to 2 soul places in Harlem and Roscoe's doesn't even come close. First off the prices are jacked up so high. Really Roscoes? 4.50 for an Iced Tea? 10 bucks for Fries? Prices have been jacked up the motherfucker. And honestly, I was there at 12 am, and only saw tourists. The chicken was OK. Waffle was delicious, and Mac and Cheese was good. But Roscoes is not the best anymore. And sad to see what it has become :(

Reviews.Author: Aang A.
Reviews.Content: chicken and waffles. find a DD because you wanna take a nap afterwards

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Had the 1/4 chick with waffles and it was great. Can't go wrong with their specialty. Big mama's special is also good.

Reviews.Author: Lee T.
Reviews.Content: When I try to explain Roscoe's to a newcomer, I usually end up telling them that you'll only want to eat here once, because this place is once-in-a-lifetime good. And honestly, if you ate Roscoes every day you wouldn't need much else out of life. The food, the atmosphere, everything is just-so that you'll never want to leave (or never be able to leave depending on whether or not you get the half chicken over quarter chicken). Delicious.

Reviews.Author: Steve M.
Reviews.Content: Usually it's packed and there can be a wait, but I'm never disappointed. Chicken & waffles whose idea was this anyway? Nevertheless it's delicious. I've unsuccessfully tried to eat them together, I prefer the waffle first and then the chicken. The collards are okay, but mac & cheese to kill for! Flawless service every time.

Reviews.Author: Paul M.
Reviews.Content: No bones about it. The chicken and Waffles are the bomb!

Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food I would eat here every week if I could... My man is cool with the manager so we never has to wait in line but I do see a lot of people waiting outside sometimes.  The place is pretty small and packed in so prepare to get to know your neighbors a little lol. But they do have fast service and the greens are bomb so I highly recommend eating there!

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant lives up to the hype. I was not expecting to like the combination of chicken and waffles?? Already craving more. It was worth the wait to get in. The prices are fabulous. The atmosphere was wonderful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: Its worth the wait! Yeap, good things do come, so wait out the line for the best fried chicken and sides around.

Reviews.Author: Ellen M.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to eat at Roscoe's for quite some time and had the opportunity to do it on sunday.  There were several people waiting to get in and be served.  I was able to find a parking space right in front of the restaurant.I found the hostess to be very friendly and efficient.  My server was polite and pleasant. I ordered a la carte, had two chicken thighs, a biscuit and candy yams.The biscuit was so so.  I really expected to get a light and fluffy biscuit, not one that was flat.  Popeyes and KFC have better biscuits.The chicken thighs were a good size, however, I really expected more because everyone, including President Obama raves about Roscoes.  I found the fried chicken to be average.The candy yams however, won the grand prize!  They were awesome!The meal prices were ok.  Overall I found my meal to be average, not sure if I want to come back again.

Reviews.Author: Anthony J.
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant , waited 15 mins for a waitress to show up. There was at least 6 more tables with large groups with the similar experience . Only reason we stayed was because the bday girl likes eating there Will never return.

Reviews.Author: Michelle S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite LA restaurant!!!   This is a must try if you live in LA and haven't done so already or if you are visiting!

Reviews.Author: Carl S.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited LA for Memorial Day weekend and had to try roscoes chicken and waffles. I had high expectations and it met them the food was good and the service was fast. The only thing I not crazy about was the chicken wings although good were a little bigger than I like. Great experience overall. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Charlie F.
Reviews.Content: Meh. These are hit or miss. I always have a fun time at Roscoe's, but the chicken and waffles are only ok. I do like the mac and cheese and the potato salad, and the giblets are weirdly addictive.

Reviews.Author: SamAntha G.
Reviews.Content: The food is delicious, the service was great, and prices were pretty cheap.It defiantly hit the spot!

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: Best fried chicken ever.  Greens are amazing.  Try the omelette too.  So good and always worth the 10-15 minute wait.

Reviews.Author: Josh W.
Reviews.Content: Homophobic, rude and condescending management.  If you're a decent person, avoid this place whenever possible

Reviews.Author: Harriet K.
Reviews.Content: How good can a piece of chicken and waffle be was my first thought? Well the answer is it was incredible and delicious. Wow I was blown away! Great food. Love the atmosphere. Always busy!

Reviews.Author: M y.
Reviews.Content: awesome gravy but overpriced

Reviews.Author: Natalie L.
Reviews.Content: can you believe they had a natalie special? this is destiny! and to top it off, the natalie special was EXACTLY what i wanted to order (just 2 waffles). roscoe, you are a genius! parking sucks. there are guys outside that makes this place feel like a club. i almost thought, i'd be asked for my ID. but the food is coo. atmosphere is laid back.

Reviews.Author: Carla O.
Reviews.Content: I died and gone to heaven!! I seriously love Roscoes Chicken!!  We've been at this place at around 3am in the morning after a night of clubbing in LA - at 3am we still had to put our names down on the list!! Yes, its that good!! The waffles are so fluffy and the chicken so crispy and oh so flavorful!! Its the best chicken hands down!! Roscoes why do you have to taste sooo good!!! You've gotta try Roscoes at least once and I'm sure you'll be hooked!!

Reviews.Author: Sam Y.
Reviews.Content: its good if you are too scared to go to the one on pico.

Reviews.Author: Anthony P.
Reviews.Content: This was my first Chicken and Waffle experience, and it might be hard to beat. Located in North Hollywood, the restaurant is big and it was fairly packed (which is always a good sign). Our server was decent, but the gentleman server waiting on the tables next to us was very knowledgable. I didn't have many questions, and the few I did he answered while talking to his tables. My girlfriend and I split the number three (two gigantic waffles with three huge chicken breasts- by request) and the macaroni and cheese. The chicken was fried perfection. It wasn't greasy, and the meat was plentiful and juicy. I ate my whole breast and finished off my girlfriends. We couldn't eat the third. The waffled were gigantic served with two big butterballs. I let my waffle soak it in and doused it with syrup. It could have been a little crispier, but overall it was good, and great with the chicken! The macaroni was also very good and flavorful. I didn't need to add salt or anything, it was already perfect. If you live in LA and like chicken, you should defintely get to this place.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Love that's it's open late!!!

Reviews.Author: Judy T.
Reviews.Content: such succulent and tasty chicken!  dipped in the gravy is delicious.  i had the carol c special #13.  good size for one person.  the chicken is also not super greasy and dripping oil.  was lightly fried and very tasty.  the mac n cheese was pretty good too.

Reviews.Author: Chardá F.
Reviews.Content: Love the chicken, waffles, biscuits, mac-n-cheese and greens(make sure to put hot sauce on them though). I don't understand what people are talking about saying they didn't get the hype or came here for the "hype" really meaning all the celebs that have gone here and wanted to catch a glimpse maybe...this place is not about hype it's about eating some good ass fried chicken!!! Don't expect to go in here and get treated with the royal carpet treatment because it is in the middle of "hollyhood" which is hollywood but if you've been to hollywood you know it is very low class and trashy looking. This location can be very busy depending on what's happening in the area or what day it is(sunday busy day) and very small (I think the smallest one in LA). I don't expect anything but to eat some good food when I go here. If you went here with high expectations you obviously did not do your research. I go to Roscoe's almost everytime I'm in LA. I always get a waffle, leg or a breasts and a side of mac-n-cheese. The biscuits are so soft and delish too! If you don't like Roscoe's chicken and waffles then you don't know the taste of  "true" country fried food and I feel sorry for you :(

Reviews.Author: Jon B.
Reviews.Content: Living in Alabama for 3 years made me a little skeptical about trying soul food on the west coast but, let me tell you Roscoe's is on point!!! I've been to a couple soul food places here on the west coast and I guess you can say it lacks well um how do I put it, SOUL!!! I was preparing myself to get a small portion of chicken and a waffle so I ordered one of the combinatons which brought 2 thighs, candy yams, greens, cornbread, and I ordered a side of waffle!!! I was waiting for my food when I started to look around and noticed the portions that were coming out of the kitchen, HUGE!!! When I got my meal it took up half the table!!! Everything was delicious!!! The chicken was crispy, the candy yams were sweet, the greens were just right (not salty like most places),  the corn bread was like 5 inches tall, the waffle was perfect, and the snozzberry tasted like snozzberry, oh shit ........ wrong place!!! I really like the fact that the whole place is wall to wall wood interior, it gives it that southern charm!!! Prices are very reasonable for the portion sizes!!! If you decide to go on a weekend, you might have to wait a while for a table but, trust me it's worth the wait!!!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C.
Reviews.Content: i puked in the bathroom here and then just left it. nobody followed me out or stopped me. unquestionably worth it.

Reviews.Author: Lauren O.
Reviews.Content: I am not rating Roscoe's poorly because of the food. I have been coming to Roscoe's for years and their chicken and sides are good. I'm rating them poorly because of the service me and my friends received on June 27th. We arrived 6 pm and waitress said take your time and told us where to find the cashier. The 2 minutes after I finished boxing up my leftovers, the grumpy, old hostess told us to go and pay our bill. We told him we would and sat trying to finish up a conversation. 5-7 minutes later while I was on the phone and my friends were talking, the same rude, hostess came to urge us to leave and even tried to motion me off the phone so he could encourage for us to leave again. He came by and gave us the most annoyed look and it made us feel so uncomfortable that we left. I have never been treated so poorly by an eating establishment. Whether you need my table or not, you still need to maintain customer satisfaction. I plan on calling the manager today, so I can express my dissatisfication.

Reviews.Author: Jay F.
Reviews.Content: I don't get it. I mean it was good but I have had MUCH better fried chicken and much better waffles. The service was very friendly though I didn't find any reason to go back, nothing really lit me up.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: you already know yelpers (WESTSIDE) :) i'm a yelper and i approve this message

Reviews.Author: Vinh C.
Reviews.Content: it's a great hot spot for a lot of celebrities.. ex: rihanna, t.i., etc. i first ate their years ago. love the food.. the sweeet and salty combination you get from chicken and waffles is great.. however. i must admit this is heart attack central so i can't eat it all the time, at least without feeling extra guilty.

Reviews.Author: kristin e.
Reviews.Content: i love eating a bite of chicken and a syrup-soaked waffle at the same time. the wait could be long, as this place can get packed. i haven't been to their other location yet, this is the one i've been going to everytime I go to LA.

Reviews.Author: Tony T.
Reviews.Content: Sorry Roscoe Fans...this place has gone down...seriously.  I used to LOVE Roscoe's.  I went there once a week.
