I also used to go to the one on Pico once a month, but now every time I go to either one I have to keep sending my food back.  I even asked the manager if they were training a new cook or something.  The food is not as hot as it used to be and you can forget about flavor.  Just so you all know I went there again this morning before I made one more final judgment and...oh man, I had the same problem today on Gower.  The waffle was ok, the fries were cold and the chicken had NO flavor or seasonings.  Yep, I sent it back and it came out with no better results, so I asked the manager about it.  She apologized and took the plate off my bill.  The place is really for tourists and not local LA people who know good chicken.  Someone told me about Louisiana Chicken so I am going to give them a shot next week.  I'll let you know how that is...

Reviews.Author: Tuan D.
Reviews.Content: Faaaaaatttt!!! Oooohhhh  yeahhhhh...rub the belly, beeee the belly.  WHO'S your Daddy!!!  Who's YO DADDY?!!  That's right, Daddy treats you reaaall well, don't he belly?  Buuutttteeerr...waafffllees...Goood!  Order the chicken, order the waffles, mix and drizzle with syrup...nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Dana T.
Reviews.Content: Newcomers can't go wrong with the #9-three wings and a waffle. But their cheese eggs and a side of grits won't disappoint you either. The food is delivered quick and usually hot. Just don't go Sat or Sun brunch unless you don't mind waiting forever. But if you're in that line on Sunday, check out Adu's paintings and artwork.

Reviews.Author: Ashley H.
Reviews.Content: hell fucking yes!!!!!!! this place is off the hook! the chicken was hella good. i got the 22 with 2 tighs, greens, mac and cheese and cornbread. "itis" set in almost immediately. i couldnt even pay my bill before i started nodding off. the rice and gravy were ok... but i wish they had one in the bay area!

Reviews.Author: Cathy B.
Reviews.Content: My friend wanted to try this place, raving that it was delicious and that its famous, so we all decided to give it a try. There was a HUGE line outside but the hostess (I guess hostess?) told us our wait is only 20 minutes which was not bad. We spent our time waiting being tourists and taking pictures in the front of the sign. When we got in, I was not surprised the place was small and so dark. I thought it was going to turn into a night club for a second. Our group of six sat down at a table that was meant to be for a table of four, we were so crammed and I couldn't even cross my legs. Anyways, our waiter was so slow with everything - bringing the water, bringing napkins, and our check. I ordered the Country Boy and my boyfriend ordered the Country Girl with the chicken patties and chili cheese fries. Our other friends ordered chili soup and waffles with chicken. I am not a huge fan of waffles so I did not order waffles. So when our food came, I thought the chicken was OK - reminded me of Popeyes Chicken but a little crispier and honestly their chili cheese fries? EH. I was not impressed. Overall, the food was OK - nothing WOW about it and their prices were kind of pricey (Chili cheese fries for $8 dollars???). Service was terrible, but what do you expect? Anyways, I don't think I would come back here, but it was a experience.

Reviews.Author: William S.
Reviews.Content: OK, I have to admit that the food is really good, but lacks in service. First of all, the people who work in this Roscoe's (Compared to other ones) took forever to take my order. I could see a bunch of them talking over the side and not even looking if someone needed assistance. Other than that, they served the food really fast. Not sure if that's OK but the food was delicious. The chicken was nothing special but it was good. What really caught my attention was the waffles. The waffles are much better than IHOP for sure. I ate them really fast and I was not that hungry. Really recommended. I also tried the fries and it was good too. The reason that I am not giving it 5 stars is because of the people that work at Roscoe's. I came in with 2 friends and we wanted to pay in separated checks. So we all wrote our amounts on the bill and handed our credits cards to the cashier but she told us that we could not do separated checks for 3 people, only two. That made me mad cause 1 of use had to pay for the other person since none of us had cash. I mean, separated checks is so common and I don't know why the cashier told us that. Anyways, will try a different whenever I bring cash cause I just learned this is in all of the Roscoe's unless I am mistaken. If they can fix this issues, then they will get 5 stars from me.

Reviews.Author: Jeff R.
Reviews.Content: Roscoes has the best chicken in the game.   Seen my girl Kym Whitley doing a show there.   line was crazy long!   Food was on point.   Staff was friendly and courteous and asked me if i wanted to leave a written notice about the service and were genuinely interested in improving the quality of my visit.   overall I was satisfied and will me going their again.

Reviews.Author: Ron C.
Reviews.Content: mmmmmm Chicken and Waffles

Reviews.Author: maiko h.
Reviews.Content: Who doesn't love Roscoe's?  Maybe people who don't have souls.  But everyone else has got to have a tender spot in their cholesterol-clogged hearts to love fried chicken, waffles, mac-n-cheese, yams...y'know, soul food!  Roscoe's is the king of chicken and waffles, and on weekends, people are drawn here to brunch on the greasy goodness--sometimes, a wait of an hour isn't unusual.  I think the W Pico location is more popular than this one, but strangely, all Roscoe's dining rooms always seem smaller than how they appear from the outside.  You can get chicken and waffles in various combinations of white meat, dark meat, half chicken, one waffle, two waffles, etc.  The chicken pieces are kind of petite, but well-flavored and juicy as hell.  The waffles are the thin, non-Belgian type, and their batter tastes excellent--I wish I knew what their secret is.  You can also get the chicken with sides such as mac and cheese, stewed collards, or yams.  All sides are delicious, and it is a pity that the human stomach just doesn't allow one to eat everything offered by Roscoe's in one sitting.  Unfortunately, there isn't much on the menu for vegetarians (the collards have bacon) and vegans are shit outta luck.  They sell Roscoe's t-shirts and hats at the register.  They have most sizes up to XXL so you can eat a lot of fried chicken and grow into it.

Reviews.Author: Retired B.
Reviews.Content: If you don't feel like waiting an hour on a late Saturday night (after midnight), get to-go. It literally takes about 5 minutes. I can't believe how fast they were. I was eating my fried chicken and waffles in the car on my drive home.

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: How many restaurants do u go to for supper and there is a security guard at the entrance.  I guess because Roscoe's is in the Hollywood Club district that people can get rowdy waiting for their chicken and waffles.  Roscoe's is a Southern California institution, and being from Canada's east coast it has taken me a few years to get here.  I have had amazing Chicken and Waffles, in NYC, San Diego, Chicago, but everyone says that Roscoe's make the best.  I ordered the Country Boy for $8.40, which comes with a waffle and three wings.  The waffles they serve aren't like airy breakfast waffles, they are more substantial.  For the chicken it was hot, crisp, and juicy.  The contrast with the salty skin and sweet maple syrup is unbeatable.  Roscoe's is always busy, so be prepared to wait during peak hours, but the staff are really accommodating.  Roscoe's equals the best Chicken and Waffles on the West Coast.

Reviews.Author: Timothy W.
Reviews.Content: infamous place.. we had one up north but it closed down.. so i never had a chance to go to it.. but once i moved down to LA I HAD TO TRY IT... ohh yea baby was it worth iit...i was starving.. 3 piece dark meat with waffles ...i've never been so happy to feel my arteries clog :P no seriously it was sooo good KFC n popeye's got nothing on Roscoes.. i'm a believer! and now a follower

Reviews.Author: dee w.
Reviews.Content: i mean, this was pretty much the tastiest fried chicken i've ever had in my life so far, and trust me, i've had my fair share of fried chicken. the waffle accompaniment was perfection. it was my last day of vacation in LA, and i had to meet my family for dinner, but stopped by roscoe's for a quick #18 to go. it took about 20 minutes for my (small) order to be ready, which seems a little ridic, but wow. it was worth the wait. my only regret is that there aren't any roscoe's in dc :(

Reviews.Author: Jess B.
Reviews.Content: the food was yummy as expected but i have a few bones to pick. "can i order the lisa's delight" (basically arnold palmer) "and just get refills of iced tea after i finish the first glass?"  (you cannot refill a lisa's delight).  this makes sense to me.  it's iced tea and lemonade for about $1.50 MORE than regular iced tea (which comes with refills)...so why can't i just pay more for one glass with some lemonade added and then get refills of regular iced tea?  just because.  that's why. our drinks took 15 minutes.  15 minutes to fill up four glasses and bring them to the table.  it wasn't even the waitress delivering them.  it was another person whose job was specifically filling up glasses and delivering them.  it doesn't take 15 minutes.  "can i get cheese in my grits?"  did i get it?  no."can i get some more iced tea, please?"  (this, after my glass had been empty for 10 minutes without a sign of our waitress).  "sure."  5 minutes later i had a refill. look, i like fried chicken.  the waffles are fine.  not great.  fine.  the grits i could probably just do without.  the eggs were freezing.  i just don't think i'll be back.  it's not the greatest.  i'd rather not wait a half hour for a table when i know to expect awful service.

Reviews.Author: Heizel M.
Reviews.Content: Finally popped my Roscoe's cherry and I'm glad I did.  Ordered the #2 Scoe's 1/4 Chicken smothered with gravy and onions and 2 waffles.  The waffles are mediocre.  The "mix" I don't get.  I wouldn't say it tastes like any other waffle I've had, but when you claim a "mix" of your own, I expect to be blown away.  Thankfully the chicken saved the day being as moist and when smothered with that lovely gravy it was heaven.  Gravy was real good, but I wouldn't mind a bit more seasoning.  I made the table next to me jealous when my dish came.  I was wondering why there were staring at me.  When I looked back at them (thinking they were looking at my SF Giants clothes) the couple gave props to my order.  Since the waffles were just ok, I wish I had the 1/2 chicken.  The order was filling enough however.  Their menu is plentiful with many options.  The place was packed.  Definitely a place loved by its fans.  Our host/server was nice, but you could tell the amount of people kept him too busy to interact too much with their customers.  Too bad.  It's always nice to hear some verbiage other than "What would you like to order" and "Thank You.  Come back again."  Anyways, I hope to be able to dine there again when I find myself in SoCal.

Reviews.Author: Charlie C.
Reviews.Content: It is tradition to drop in before attending The Do Over.  On this trip I ordered the number 18. You have a choice of leg or thigh and a waffle. I went for the thigh. The chicken was fried to perfection. The first bite into the chicken, the sound of the crunch gave me the chills. hehe It was pretty crunchy and was not over cooked. The meat was really moist. Usually, a lot of place take advantage of the dark meat because its naturally moist and over fry it. Not here though it was perfect. The waffle tasted different to me this time. The last time I was here I remember the waffle being a lighter and had a hint of cinnamon. The waffle I had was a bit cakie (not sure if that is the correct term, but you get the idea). I normally do not dip it in syrup but I had to this time because it was pretty bland. Over all great chicken joint! Something to keep in mind is that this place gets crowded very quickly, and the wait could be pretty long. So just relax, have some patience, and enjoy one the city's gem!

Reviews.Author: Po C.
Reviews.Content: i think it was hyped up and i had higher expectations.  the greens were pretty bitter, which i was really disappointed with 'cause i luv good greens.  the chicken was good....but i expected more flavor.  s'allrite.   ; /

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: 3 stars because ridiculously long wait and bad parking. but AMAZING food. didn't think that the combo would work but it def does. i echo what everyone else says, and def recommend this place. went with some friends late at night and had a lot of fun. we had to split up though because... again too many people coming to this restaurant(!!!) ... but i guess that just means that they need to open up more roscoes!!

Reviews.Author: gimilz p.
Reviews.Content: i heard about by word of mouth after reading it was a spot in COMPLEX magazine so when i check it out IT IS THE BEST EVER my trip monthly is to try new sides and  arrangements i think the sir michael is a good choice . i have found the number 1 with the waffle and 2 pieces of roscoes world famous chicken is good too ! try a sunrise

Reviews.Author: Waynele Y.
Reviews.Content: this is THE BEST fried chicken and waffles.  we had to wait pretty long (maybe 30-40 minutes), and it is a little pricey for breakfast (around $10) but i think it was damn worth it-- even the syrup tastes better here.  i have no idea what they put in it, but i want to take some of that syrup home and eat it with my pancakes!

Reviews.Author: Rochelle F.
Reviews.Content: roscoe's was no disappointment at all.. it was delicious and lived up to its name and reputation. who knew that chicken and waffles made such a great combination! i had the Country Boy which consisted of 3 wings and fries. i ate off my bf's plate and devoured one of his waffles. the chicken was cooked just right with a flavorful batter and very juicy and tenderrr. the fries were a bit greasy, but they were still tasty. the waffle was super yummmmy and everything tasted great with the gravy. roscoe's gets two thumbs up and 5 stars.. i'll be back for more!!

Reviews.Author: Jackie A.
Reviews.Content: i love chicken. i love waffles. i LOVE roscoe's. this place is great. service is great. food is amazing. their succulent breast is definitely succulent. their greens are delicious as are their mac n cheese. its definitely a warm place. only downside is the street parking... but you're in la can't expect much from that.

Reviews.Author: Gladi G.
Reviews.Content: It was a "wrap" for the day's film shoot and so, the Producer and Director took me and the rest of the cast and crew for a dinner outing. Unknowingly, following them to a cozy, cute restaurant on Hollywood area. I found parking on one street side by the restaurant. As an avid Southern cooking food lover, this was a place I didn't expect to find far away from the Southern neighborhood I lived in for years. Southern home-cooking scent in the air. Finally, I geared up to have an exciting taste of Southern food again but in this City of Filmdom and it delivered! The chicken was scrumptious to its juiciness and moistness! The waffles were familiar and great sustenance with the cinammon-y taste of the syrup. The coleslaw filled with goodness of a mixture. Corn-it to the moistness cornbread. Unbelievably, the Pecan Pie and the Sweet Iced Tea quenched every bit of my Southern-y soul. The restaurant's filled with diners all enjoying their meals. A Southern feeling inside this soul food place. Country-like wooden furnishings and southern music accompanies the tummy-filling. My tastebuds were appreciating. Service was amiable and attentive. Don't be surprised to see notable showbusiness and celebrity entertainers dining in around you. Do you like chicken? I do, in this notably, go-to place in this Hollywood city.

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: The chicken is good and moist. However, I don't think it is the best I've had. The service was great! We had a large party and they were able to seat us right away and it was 10 AM on a Saturday. We ordered a few of plates of Scoes, Carol C special, Obama, 1/2 chicken plate and their special meal of the day. We also ordered sides of corn bread, potato salad, greens, and mac and cheese, which were kinda pricey and did not have much flavor. However, I love their fluffy biscuits! It was the best part of the meal.

Reviews.Author: caroline l.
Reviews.Content: after you eat chicken here, everytime you fried chicken you say, thats nothing like roscoes. go there when you arent hungry yet, cause the wait is long, but worth it.

Reviews.Author: Kev Z.
Reviews.Content: i was here last week and the waffles smelled so good, honestly, the chicken was ok (i had dark meat) not the greatest since i enjoy my chicken juicy.. overall im glad i got to try Roscoe's !

Reviews.Author: Mike G.
Reviews.Content: Who would think that Fried Chicken and Waffle would go together like peanut butter and jelly. This place is awesome, and reasonably priced. Although, much better service can be found at their Pico location.

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: people honestly make a big deal out of this place. it's not all that and a bag of chips dammit!..it's an alright place..plus it's always super crowded..it's so annoying!..and they have nasty orange juice

Reviews.Author: Charlie L.
Reviews.Content: service was good!  crowded. and waffles with chicken was delish!

Reviews.Author: Monica M.
Reviews.Content: there is nothing more amazing that i can say that hasn't been said already about this legendary establishment. the pairing of chicken and waffles has yet to be beat on the comfort food list, and i have yet to find anyone who doesn't leave with a smile on their face after eating here. waiting can get long, especially on the weekends, but the food is definitely worth it. the greens are especially wonderful, but you honestly can't go wrong with the classic fried chicken on top of your waffles. simply amazing.

Reviews.Author: Nikki B.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken and waffles in Hollywood....THUMBS DOWN!!! Used to be an intimate little joint where you could enjoy some good home/southern food and satisfy and sweet and salty craving....now it's just a tourist attraction for the masses; AND I DO MEAN the masses...and their mama, and the parking enforcement people who sit around waiting for patrons to miss a meter-feeding on a 1 hour parking meter while waiting 45 minutes to an hour to be seated, then another 45 minutes to get served mediocre food by 3 different sets of waitstaff. Definitely NOT the after church Sunday lunch experience I was looking forward to....SMH.

Reviews.Author: Alfred M.
Reviews.Content: the kind of place you put up with for a friend who's never been - but it's not horrible or anything

Reviews.Author: Tracie S.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING! The waffles are awesome just a hint of cinnamon. The chicken was incredible, simple flavor perfectly crisp.  The wait staff was friendly and the service was quick.  They are open until 4am on the weekends.   I can't wait for our next trip to LA. We will definitely be back to Roscoe's

Reviews.Author: steve s.
Reviews.Content: worth the drive to la alone. roscoe's chicken is so good and the waffles so golden brown and butter soaking. aw man if i keep talking i'm on the 5 to get my favorite #8, two wings, a breast and two waffles. ain't nothing like a plate of roscoes. the gower location is good for people watching and the. i've seen ossie davis, barbara barrie, peter faulk, marcus chestnut all greasing down ont he best chicken in la. sundays at the pico location are like the bet awards, just sit eat and watch who comes in.

Reviews.Author: dae m.
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong with waffles and fried chicken. there mac and cheese is realllll good too.  and if u wanna dine on the edge go to the one on pico near south central.  it's always a good experience being the only non-brotha there.  even better if your group is best described with the words: pasty, white...=D

Reviews.Author: Vicky T.
Reviews.Content: waffles..chicken..tons of gravy and an eclipse to wash it down.... it is the simple things in life that make you happy... but what doesn't make me happy is the four hour drive plus in order to get some scoe's loving ... damnit

Reviews.Author: Donnell O.
Reviews.Content: This place was given a 2 star rating mostly because the service sucked. First time eating at Roscoes chicken and waffles and was kinda disappointed seeing everyone hypes this place up. I ordered the Obama special (three wings, a waffle and a side of Mac and cheese). The chicken and waffle was pretty good, but when I went to dig into my Mac and cheese, it was freezing cold... I asked a gentlemen (which looked like the owner) for a new side Mac and cheese because mine was friddged cold and he had our waitress bring it to me. On a side note, she only stopped by our table to check on us a total of two times. When It came to paying, you can only offer two methods of payments which makes it hard for a large group to split checks. Also, we offered two forms of payment at the register and the other person was charged twice. Which happens to be a bit of an inconvience.. I probably won't visit roscoes anytime in the near future..

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: When first faced with the idea of eating fried chicken and waffles together, I was grossed the heck out. But how can I have lived in LA for 17 years and NOT have tried this place?! So I went to Roscoe's for the first time last night and was pleasantly surprised at how well the two dishes come together to create delicious comfort. I ordered the Scoe Special #1, which is 1/4 of a chicken and 2 waffles. The chicken was pretty good, but the gravy was what made it happenin'. It looks a little gross at first because it's so dark and thick, but the taste is very hearty and flavorful. The waffles were my favorite. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside with a good amount of butter and sugary syrup to top it off. The chicken and waffles combine forces to ease you from stress and really drown you in the flavor. Real soul food. My only complaint is that the menu is so limited- it's pretty much just different variations of chicken and waffles along with sides like grits and fries. It won't be the best meal ever but it's just plain old delicious and will hit the spot. If chicken and waffles is what your soul craves, this is the place to go to, baby.

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: I never thought chicken and waffles would taste good together... how wrong I was.  The waffles were perfect and the fried chicken was sublime.  I miss you Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Doug ..
Reviews.Content: danngg was it worth it to wait 1.5 hours for chickens and waffles. the chicken sure was.  i got it without the gravy and i gotta say it was the best fried chicken i ever had in my 25 years of eating food.  it was crispy, not greasy, and seasoned to perfection.  the waffle however was... anything but.  it was huge, but the waffles were soggy and almost cold.  i live in san francisco so it was a cool place to eat while visiting but i think its a bit costly for fried chicken.  and it takes FOOORRREEVVVERRRRRRRR.  good hearty meal that'll make you run the tread mill for the rest of the day... but you gotta have fun somtimes

Reviews.Author: Brian O.
Reviews.Content: An LA classic.  The food is a great and is worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Wayne C.
Reviews.Content: I agree with Chris. This is also the place I take all my friends from out of town. Food's great, but the place is a bit small. This location is my favorite out of the 3 or 4 Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: Rose S.
Reviews.Content: Everytime I visit LA...I have to eat at Roscoe's because I'm a Southern Belle who loves wings and grits. The food is sooo cheap. I absolutely love this place! I had to unbutton my jeans the last time I went. Phew!

Reviews.Author: Jayson W.
Reviews.Content: its famous, its soul food, its chicken & wafftles, and its good for white people too! i was raised on southern food so i am partial. the gravy here is good, my dad is the king of homemade gravy, and i dislike every place elses except here. roscoes #2 is with chicken rubbed in gravy and two waffles and syrup, mix it together, and stay full the rest of the day. i have been here many times, and it never gets old.

Reviews.Author: Zack R.
Reviews.Content: I don't use the word scrumptious often. It's really a word that isn't in the popular nomenclature. Neither is the word nomenclature, but what else would you call it? I mean, lexicon also apt, but that seems obscure too. I wrestle with these types of things often, but never at Roscoe's House of Chicken & Waffles. There, you see, both the chicken and the waffles are scrumptious.

Reviews.Author: Lysabeth L.
Reviews.Content: we went for a late night saturday dinner and YUM! this place never fails to please! the staff was super friendly and the food was great! the only set back is that they don't seperate checks and they don't take more that two seperate payments on one check. other than that, this place is AWESOME!

Reviews.Author: Zeela D.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles is so good that you'll kick the bucket...the KFC bucket that is! My favorite plate to order is the Carol C. special because it has 1 breast (love the white meat) and 1 waffle with syrup on the side. I also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese and ended my meal with the sweet potato pie. The food was mouth watering good, I always feel satisfied after having a meal at Roscoe's. I love the $6 valet service, so convenient to the front door entry.  Try and sit in the front portion of the restaurant, that's more of the original Roscoe's, plus it is more of a down home feel. It can get a little loud, but no worries, once that food hits your table your mouth will be busy, I guarantee it! The macaroni and cheese had a home cooked taste to it, as if the cheese was freshly laid in there with subtle chunks, very tasty! The chicken was moist on the inside, but my favorite part is the skin, perfectly coated, not too salty or crunchy, cooked to perfection! I suggest laying the syrup all over your chicken, waffles, heck even on your sweet potato pie! I believe Roscoe's has the best fried chicken in LA!

Reviews.Author: Anshel S.
Reviews.Content: This is literally my favorite place to come whenever I'm in LA. I'm currently on a 3 for 3 streak when I've come up and gotten Roscoe's. I don't know why, but this location always seems to be the one I end up at. There is usually a few minute wait, but nothing a slightly hungry tummy can't bear. Once you get seated, you are very quickly greeted by a usually polite waitress that immediately asks you if you would liek to order. If you've been here enough tiems you already begin to know what your stomach is capable of. Usually  #1 will satisfy most people. Their chicken and waffles are literally to die for and if I ever have a last meal it will probably have to be the #13 just because it is such a large but satisfying meal. They also have a fantastic gravy to go along with it, but I usually just stick to their amazing syrup and hot sauce for drenching and dipping. I could go on and on all day about this place but you can't understand the awesomeness until you've tried it. Chicken and waffles are not nearly as bland as you think, far from it. They also have an awesome take-out deal that I highly recommend considering as well.

Reviews.Author: Kim N.
Reviews.Content: i love roscoes. so much i'm pretty sure i've written a review for another location already but decided to write one for this place too. it can get pretty crowded here any time of the day but the wait goes by quick. the workers are friendly, service is fast. i always share the 1/2 chicken with gravy and 2 waffles. looooove their gravy and always consider getting extra on the side, but it is more than enough! this meal is perfect for breakfast, lunch, or late night after a night out in LA

Reviews.Author: Adam T.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Roscoe's for a long time and I've got to say it is the best fried chicken place in Los Angeles. I go primarily to the one on Gower Street because it's close to where I live. When you walk inside it looks like a kind of southern style diner. The staff there is very friendly whenever I go there. I usually get the Herb's Special which has 4 pieces of fried chicken with two waffles. The fried chicken is phenomenal, it's very moist and there's a lot of meat on the bone. The waffles are very fluffy and taste homemade. Their cornbread and grits are very good as well. Prices are very average for a diner. So I have to say if you come to Los Angeles you've got to come to Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: E. R.
Reviews.Content: I visited Roscoe's in Hollywood with friends. Someone was excited about the place. However, I was not impressed. It was a Sunday and we had to wait 25 minutes to be seated. Frankly, I don't like to wait in line so if I could, I would have gone elsewhere. I ordered Sir Michael which consisted of 1/4 chicken, gravy, onions, grits and a biscuit. I asked the waiter for another plate and I wanted to replace rice with some greens but the waiter was inflexible so I chose Sir Michael. The waiter asked me if I wanted the gravy on the side or on top of the chicken. I told on top and I later regretted making that choice. The plate came and the chicken was completely covered in gravy. The grits was nothing special. The biscuit was the worst part of the meal. It was partially cooked, a little harder than fluffy and it had no comparison with the biscuits at places like KFC or the Cracker Barrel. I was not impressed and I think the restaurant is overrated. Waiting in line for average food is insane. People could choose better. This place does not deserve 4 stars. I give it 2.5 or maybe 3 at the most.

Reviews.Author: Se L.
Reviews.Content: everything else was good, but thier waffles...what the hell? i think they put crack in thier waffles. they're so good and you just want more. how can waffles be so damn good? its just a waffle. or is it?

Reviews.Author: Patti G.
Reviews.Content: The chicken is great, the Lemonade (try the eclipse, it's a mixture of fruit punch, lemonade, and OJ) is great and the waffles are delicious. Don't forget to put their hotsauce on your chicken. That's all you need to know.. food related.. If you plan on visiting on a weekend be prepared to wait awhile since it gets pretty busy. Parking is difficult, but I usually park in the Denny's Lot on Sunset Blvd. It's not the much of a walk, just down the street. Service is good and fair, the waitresses there are nice, I'd advise you not to go the Pasadena Roscoes because the few times that I have been there the service is absolutely terrible. It isn't too expensive, if it's your first time visiting and you're not sure about the combination of both plates then I'd share with someone. It's about ten dollars for a dish and three for a lemonade. The best one really is this one here, in the smack dab middle of Hollywood.

Reviews.Author: Jackie J.
Reviews.Content: Went there yesterday and the food was awful!  I got so sick after eating half of my food -- probably would have had to be hospitalized if I had eaten it all.  They need more Jermain's and LaShawn's and fewer Santiago's and Maria's!  The food lacks soul.  NEVER GOING BACK THERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Author: Linda G.
Reviews.Content: I pass by this place on a daily basis and always see a huge line. It's right down the street from me so it was on my list of places I HAD to eat at. I figured with the big crowds there had to be something that kept drawing them back . I love southern food, soul food etc.. this place was a horrible horrible disappointment I gave them two stars because I detected some aromatic vanilla flavor in the limp thin waffles chucked along next to the extremely dry flavor less fried chicken. I make better chicken following Martha Stewart's recipe. Gone are all the down home flavors of the south, the typical savory sweet sauce that marries the unlikely combination of waffles and chicken. Instead you get under seasoned fried chicken that (albeit I ordered the breast) was ridiculously dry!! and gross and a skinny soggy waffle with syrup from a bottle that had been warmed up. waaay over hyped waaay over priced. I say order a waffle at ihop down the street and pick up an order of shakey's fried chicken (which is actually pretty darn good)  and save yourself some money and disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Reese D.
Reviews.Content: big Roscoe's fan since they were located in Oakland ca near lake Merritt back in the days... more like early 90's, the best way i can describe the taste of the chicken is "THAT'S IT, THAT'S IT !!! AWWWW" OK, wipe your mouth. as for the waffle, it doesn't get any better. it's crunchy and very flavorful.  add butter and maple syrup and your in heaven.  Roscoe, please come back to OAKLAND...  PLEASE !!! now i am crying like a little school girl..

Reviews.Author: Ms G.
Reviews.Content: sooooo good. my friend took me here on a recent trip to la. i used to think, what's so good about chicken and waffles and then i tried it and i fell in love. haven't found any place since that even compares to roscoe's. it saddens me :( now i understand snoop's obsession. why not 5 stars? because the only thing i ate was chicken and waffles. cant really rate food i've never eaten. sorry!

Reviews.Author: Joey H.
Reviews.Content: this is a must LA restaurant.  we see this as a treat meal, because we would go crazy here. she can't get enough of the waffles. i loved everything that i ate and rolled out of this place, which is good. parking is tough here and if you get there at the wrong time you could be waiting, but its worth it.

Reviews.Author: Ken D.
Reviews.Content: you get what ya pay for and what you pay for at roscos is serious amounts of awesome goodness. granted you get the 'itus' and need a nap afterwards but its awesome:)

Reviews.Author: Brett T.
Reviews.Content: girlfriend took me here for my first time after talking about it forever.  it definately lived up to the hype.  the gravy was tasty and nice and salty (which is how i like it, hehe).  Standard waffle on the flattish side kinda like waffle house, very generous portions and nice staff.  great food for after clubbing :)

Reviews.Author: Russell S.
Reviews.Content: always busy it seems, but this place has great food, not for the healthy at heart..so to speak

Reviews.Author: wolfie g.
Reviews.Content: definitely over rated place.it's literally chicken, and waffles. Don't expect anything more than that.the chicken is all typical.it's just drowned in a bunch of onions and gravy.the grits are bland.the sides are not very tasty.the service is horrible.the waitresses aren't very attentive. they take forever to bring your food. there's not much service going on. they pretty much rush you in and then rush you out.the waffles were soft and mushy.i don't see what the big deal about this place is.it's over priced, over rated, and definitely not worth my time.kfc, popeyes, anything is better than this!never again !

Reviews.Author: Bruce K.
Reviews.Content: After I finally did my review, I went down to Roscoe's.  The first wonderful thing I noticed was that the place had doubled in size.  Yes, I hadn't been in over two years, which is when the change took place.  So, it's no longer quite the hole in the wall it was and that's a good thing.  The wait, I'd imagine, isn't quite as bad as it used to be.  I went just after the lunch crush and got right in.  I had what I always have - the Carol C.  That's one fried chicken breast and one waffle.  First off, their chicken breasts are HUGE - the June Wilkinson of chicken breasts.   They almost seem like mutant chicken breasts, but all that matters is the taste, and it's simply the best fried chicken in LA (and most other places).  It's so succulent and wonderful and I ate every bit of it.  Their waffles have a unique flavor that I just love.  I slather it with butter, extra syrup, and it's just perfect.  I also had one of their great biscuits (with yet more slathered butter), and some potato salad.  After I was sated but felt great.  As you kids say, Roscoe's is the bomb.  Well, I think you kids said that about ten years ago - I need an update on my lingo - I'm so yesterday.

Reviews.Author: Conrad B.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, and the location.  Eating here has made me forget that we now have healthcare.

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: dammm good southern cookin rite herre - get the combos!! mac n cheese collard greens cornbread w/ buttermilk & chicken (fried to perfection) = hitting the spot! =P w/ sum iced tea or lisa's mmmhmmm the only con is finding parkin on gower lol

Reviews.Author: Erwin S.
Reviews.Content: Went here years ago while visiting L.A. and was sooo impressed.  I couldn't wait to get back for another round of chicken & waffles. Finally got back here, and it didn't seem as good.  Forgot how expensive a few pieces of chicken and a waffle are...geez. I guess when you get famous and well known, you can jack up the prices :-(

Reviews.Author: Angelica R.
Reviews.Content: theres nothing bad i can say about Roscoe's  theyre always on point. i only wish you could sub some sides for others. other than that it's great if you love pseudo-soul food

Reviews.Author: R K.
Reviews.Content: i must go to one of the roscoes any time i'm in socal.  some dark meat fried chicken & waffles with a sunrise, and i'm set.  this is the 3rd roscoe's i've been to.  only one i haven't gone to so far is the one in inglewood.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: crispy fried chicken and golden belgian waffles together. seems like a match made in heaven to me. looks like a log cabin inside, meanwhile souped up luxury automobiles line the street parking on gower. not only do their chicken and waffles ROCK, the fried giblets are yummy too, and also the cornbread.

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: i got the half chicken smotherred in gravy oh my god it was so delicious id give this place 10 stars its my 5th time going there havent been there for awhile i kno they remodeled and made the restaurant bigger. it is a definitely a must to stop by wen you pass down the LA area

Reviews.Author: Oscar L.
Reviews.Content: Been wanting to come here for the longest and I finally did when I was in Hollywood. It started off pretty bad when looking for parking was an issue. I assume that the restaurant has been there for a while because they do not have their own parking lot. Having bad experiences with parking meters, I looked for the closest parking lot to the area which was still maybe about two blocks away and it also cost $10. However once I stepped inside the restaurant the mood changed right away. The atmosphere seem just right with the kind of environment that has the comfortable feeling to it. Everything on the menu sounded like good southern comfort food, but of course I had the go with what the place is known for, no other than the famous chicken and waffles. I didn't think that I was going to get full, but boy I was wrong! I had to waffles with two pieces of chicken. Not being a big fan of fried chicken, it was actually pretty good especially with syrup; yeah I know that it doesn't sound right, but it's actually good this way. Other than the parking, I was satisfied with everything. I probably won't go back to this location, but I will definitely stop at the one in Pasadena since it's the one closest to home.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: i love this place. you would think chicken and waffles would be a strange combo, but its fantastic. even when the place is packed the service is great and really fast. i was lucky and didn't have to wait in any line to get in which was really nice too. parking was a bit of a pain but hey its LA.

Reviews.Author: Cryetti C.
Reviews.Content: aww man! ive been wanting to try this place out for so long after hearing all the wonderful things about it.  unfortunately it did not meet my expectations.  i will give them this though.  the waffles were YUMMY. soft, delicious and cooked to perfection.  i could've eaten 10 of these. the chicken was tasty but did not knock me out of the park.  i ordered the weeknight special, which was chicken, potato salad, greens, cornbread.  the potato salad and greens were so so. the cornbread was, to say it nicely, inedible.  it was dry, hard and difficult to down... and i usually love cornbread!!!!  the service was ok.  parking is a mutha, like others have said.  my first time here wasn't what i expected, HOWEVER, i will come back. perhaps they were just having an "off" night.

Reviews.Author: T S.
Reviews.Content: i've been waiting many years to finally eat here.  i had always been suspicious of this whole chicken and waffle thing until i had the amazing combo at West Coast Tavern.  when i finally had the chance to eat at the chicken and waffle mecca, i couldn't pass it up.sadly, it wasn't spectacular.  the chicken was delish but everything else was just so-so.  and pricey for the quality.  $7 for a side of fries??  $5 for a small bowl of greasy mac n cheese?  not sure what the draw is here when LA has so many fabu places to eat.

Reviews.Author: Maya D.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food, quick & friendly service.... You can't ask for much more! Roscoe's never fails when it comes to providing delicious comfort food and we got our food SUPER quick. The chicken and waffle that I had were great. I'd have to say the red beans & rice were just okay, but the mac & cheese was really good. I'm craving Roscoe's again just typing up this review! Mmmmmm! lol :)

Reviews.Author: taylor f.
Reviews.Content: roscoes is a hot spot for the locals. they have delicious fried chicken, and even better waffles, which are the best food on the menu. order that and a sunset (fruit punch mixed with lemonade) and you are bound to enjoy your meal. all i have to say is be prepared to sit and wait for a table, and dont expect many drink refills while you eat. also be aware with big parties (8+) the waitresses might screw your order up and we got ripped off once

Reviews.Author: G. L.
Reviews.Content: too little meat on the chickens - and why is it so expensive?  try honey's kettle in culver city for good fried chicken.  they don't have waffles, but you'll want to grill your own after tasting their chicken.

Reviews.Author: oreo b.
Reviews.Content: its a bit heavy but delish.. mommy orders ehre every now and then.. the scrambeled egg is suppose to be VERY yummie.. but i think mommy makes better.. and the mac n cheese mommy steals some when she can..

Reviews.Author: Larry C.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's is a legendary place which I had been wanting to try for a long time and I enjoyed it.  It was a fun meal albeit one that will probably shorten my lifespan by a few years.  I had a mac and cheese and 1/2 chicken southern style with gravy (that was too much food incidentally, I would definitely suggest getting 1/4 for one person).  Given all the buzz about the place, I expected parking to be atrocious and a long wait, but maybe because I came on a Tuesday evening, I found parking right on the street outside and didn't have to wait really at all to get seated.  Overall, I think I give this place an extra star because it was my first time having chicken and waffles, and I did enjoy it, although in all honesty, I feel like there was not anything in particular about the chicken or the waffle individually that would make it stand out as much as the combination.

Reviews.Author: Dth S.
Reviews.Content: i'd rather go into the 'hood' (like to 'berthas') to get the real deal soul food instead of coming here, plus i don't like to wait outside. but i do like their greens...but then u can't mess that up really.

Reviews.Author: Tina B.
Reviews.Content: ... #1: good ol' 1/4 southern fried chicken & 2 waffles.  delicious! ...

Reviews.Author: Ava P.
Reviews.Content: Went to Roscoe's for a late-night meal after spending the night at Drais. I just got the basic chicken n waffles. Waffles were a lil' soggy but the chicken was good. I would go back but would try something else. Service was really fast and prices were decent.

Reviews.Author: Bugal K.
Reviews.Content: its ok..... i like seeing all the hot black chicks

Reviews.Author: Alejandra S.
Reviews.Content: this is THE answer to a night of dancing and drinking, sweet, salty, crispy, tasty, YUM!!!

Reviews.Author: Monica B.
Reviews.Content: Rosoce's is my favorite restaurant and this was hands down the best service I have ever had! Staff friendly and attentive, food came fast and it was hot and delicious! Everything Excellent overall!

Reviews.Author: Steve m.
Reviews.Content: Best fried chicken!!!!!  Love this place and you always get your money's worth.  This is another L.A. institution and a place you must stop if you're a fried chicken fiend like me.  Place is usually pretty busy and parking is kind of hard to find, but the service is quick and the food is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Joel L.
Reviews.Content: Well let's see, we just went there for breakfast.  Got there at about 8:30am, it was 3 of us.  Staff was pretty friendly, but the place had a old musty smell ( not good for a eating establishment ).  We ordered coffee, orange juice, water and their signature waffles with chicken.  It would have been great if the food was made to order, but it wasn't.  We ordered, and I'm not kidding, the food came in no less than five minutes.  Now I like fast but I like fresh better!  I could tell they nuked ( microwaved ) the food because the food was so damn hot!!!!! That just looking at it burned my mouth.  Now your waffles are famous and your chicken is a great side to it.  Why blow it with food already made!  If I want that I'll go to Mcdonalds or the box for breakfast.  My waffles were kinda of rubbery, so I knew that they were microwaved.  The orange juice was fresh but had a little tangerine taste,  meaning it might have been too fresh.  Question,  how do you have Luke warm coffee and scalding chicken, meaning the chicken wasn't scalding from just being cook, like juices coming from the chicken.  It was scalding with no juices, looking like it was just blasted with heat!!!  Shameful.  Please roscoe's don't rest on your past, make your future bright! Start serving fresh food not frozen fresh.  For $16.10 for one plate I think fresh is warranted.  So if you do go to Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles on Gower in Hollywood, it has to be for nostalgic reasons and not cause you want a fresh meal.  Come on Man!!!

Reviews.Author: Desiree C.
Reviews.Content: mos definitely hit the spot, the food was everything I imagined (based off all these yelp reviews) yeee^^ ohhh it was delish!  chicken breast, waffles, and Mac n cheese. the deal sealer was the little / no wait to be seated. Note: beware PARKING SUCKS its LA!!

Reviews.Author: Kate P.
Reviews.Content: Its not a party!!!! Went for good southern food and good southern hospitallity and all we got was attitdude! 3 out of 5 patrons were at the table but apparently that was NOT good enough. We were told to contact our other 2 members or leave! I have never been treated more poorly! So sad they don't care about the customers who wait in line for more than 30minute just to be disrespected by the staff! I would not recommend the hollywood location.

Reviews.Author: Roger E.
Reviews.Content: too long a wait, but well worth every minute.

Reviews.Author: Milly M.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why people are raving about Roscoe's. The food's okay, but not something worth coming back for. The people who dine here are loud.

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was my first time in LA, so I knew that I had to hit up one of these before I left.  Some friends and I ordered carryout there for a late breakfast since we didn't know how bad of a line/wait it would be.  I got the 1/4 chicken and 2 waffles.  According to the menu on the website, it's 1. Scoe's.  It's exactly what you wanted it to be: comfort food.  The waffles are good and the chicken is even better.  They provided hot sauce for the chicken, which was very enjoyable.  Dipping the chicken in syrup is also amazing.  The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because the waffles were slightly rubbery.  I'm sure this is only because we picked them up probably 10 minutes after they had been ready.  I really wish that I was able to try the other items on the menu, but I got the main two out of the way.  If and when I return to LA, I'll be more than excited to go to this place again.  Maybe next time, I'll eat inside.

Reviews.Author: James E.
Reviews.Content: Sad to say, I was disappointed. Being a fan of fried chicken and soul food, and being from the south, honestly the worst fried chicken I've ever had. Ordered the half chicken with gravy. First, it was served at room temperature. Gravy was clearly instant or canned gravy. If it wasn't then a new recipe is needed. The gravy made the chicken soggy. So I had room temperature, soggy, chicken.  I had the breast and wing. The breast was extremely dry, and both pieces were flavorless. The cornbread was typical, the greens boring, (fyi, I make the BEST collard greens!). The one good food item tried was the mac and cheese. Made well, very dense and full of flavor, but I know 3 people who make it the same way so not too impressed. The waffle had a decent flavor but very ordinary.  Service was uninspired. I had one friend who swore by this place and was so excited to have me go because of my Southern roots. I told him he's never had good chicken. I had high expectations and sadly, I will never go again. Take my advice, stick to Popeye's!

Reviews.Author: lil timmy j.
Reviews.Content: what can I say.. wings and waffles :) the end

Reviews.Author: MynyoBiz S.
Reviews.Content: Love love the food.  3 wings and a  waffle will fill anyone up you can split it if you like.

Reviews.Author: Lance L.
Reviews.Content: the pancakes are the BEST!.. the chicken are like the same as the others but the difference is the gravy.. they have the best odd combination for food.. lol.. and add some giblets too..

Reviews.Author: Dani C.
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING! the waffles were limpy and the chicken was super dry.  $20?!!! GO TO POPEYES!

Reviews.Author: Heather E.
Reviews.Content: Im one of those weird people who usually doesnt like to mix foods and chicken and waffles is a weirrrd combo; but ive got to tell you, this place was AMAZINGG! There was somewhat of a wait when I went (and im sure it felt longer than it really was because I was hungry) but once we were seated we orcdered within 10 min. The fod was served within another 10 min and it sure was something else! Ordered the signature dish (1/2 chicken and 2 waffles) and my god it was DELICIOUS! BESTTTTT fried chicken I have had and the waffles were to die for! The good thing is although the two items are served on the same plate, it is easy to keep them seperate if you arnt up to letting the syrup touch your chicken haha. Pricing and customer service werent too bad but the food is what really topped it off! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: R K.
Reviews.Content: Love the fried chicken!!  The waffles is just ok but I had to have more chicken! It's sooo good!

Reviews.Author: Tom M.
Reviews.Content: Had an interesting experience at Roscoe's tonight.  The food was wonderful.  I had the Fried Chicken Livers and my wife had Chicken Breast with a Waffle.  Both were great.  The interesting thing was that apparently the kitchen was backed up so the manager came out to the dinning room and made an announcement that food might be a little late and wanted to apologies.  I have never had that happen before.  Kudos to management.  The food was at our table within 15 minutes and was delicious.  I will definitely go back the next time I want chicken.

Reviews.Author: rometria g.
Reviews.Content: Finally tried the so called famous Rosco chicken and waffles. Nothing to brag about. I can make better beans and rice! Well I can now say I tried it and will not do back.

Reviews.Author: Anne Marie M.
Reviews.Content: I don't live in LA, but visit from time to time. Last month I was there for a week and met a different friend for dinner every night. Everyone was taking me to "brass and fern" places -- you know, too loud, too hip, too crowded, entirely ok, but not really special food. When I met up with a friend at the end of my trip I said I want some gritty, real food, how about Roscoe's. We were not disappointed. We got chicken, waffles, and grits. It was everything I had hoped for! The grits with some chicken gravy are outstanding! This made my trip to LA.

Reviews.Author: Matt B.
Reviews.Content: I would fly to LA from DC just to eat here again.  Been to the Roscoe's in Hollywood 3 times on two separate trips to LA.  Ordered the quarter white with 2 waffles last 2 times and, while it was a lot of food, i ate everything but the plate and bones.  Unrivaled!  The chicken is great - better than Popeye's and the waffles are fantastic (better than waffle house).  I feel like they put some pecan flour in the batter because they have a great nutty flavor.  We never had to wait because we went at strange times (weekday afternoon, late afternoon on a Saturday).  Actually saw Dan Aykroyd and Rob Reiner in there last time.  Just go!  Now!

Reviews.Author: N Z.
Reviews.Content: Meh. Maybe it's just me but I thought the fried chicken was bland, and the waffles were soggy. If you prefer strong/spicy flavors you might not like Roscoes, but I'd say try it once because it's one of those places in LA that everyone talks about.

Reviews.Author: Dawn D.
Reviews.Content: So, my friends and I went to a taping to Let's Make A Deal and were starving afterwards.  We were not sure where to eat when someone said Roscoe's is super close by.  Some co-workers had been saying how amazing the chicken and waffles were so we gave it a shot.  It's 3pm on Saturday and we waited a couple minutes for a table.  I ordered the Carol C (fried chicken and 1 waffle).  The food came out very quick.  The waffle was DELICIOUS.  It was the best waffle I've ever tasted.   Everyone else agreed their food was so good as well.  My only disappointment is I asked for some sweet potato pie to go and my waiter never brought it (and didn't charge me).  When I went up to pay I told the girl and she looked like she had no idea what to do.  Is it a complicated request?  She said she didn't know where the waiter went and couldn't do it.  Okay?!?!?!  As I walked out I found out where the waiter went... for a smoke break... Oh well.  Price was reasonable $50 for 4 ppl... plus two of us had leftovers.  I would definitely try it again, but maybe the West LA location.

Reviews.Author: Money M.
Reviews.Content: Bomb. Never fails. Try it all!

Reviews.Author: Gabriela p.
Reviews.Content: waffles are the best.. and chicken is great..

Reviews.Author: Jessica P.
Reviews.Content: I had heard great things about Roscoe's so I decided to go with a few friends. After waiting almost 45 minutes we were finally seated. Despite the long wait outside, our food came very quickly once we ordered. The fried chicken with gravy was really delicious. While the waffles were decent, they could have been a little more hearty. I'd definitely go back, but this is not the kind of food I could eat on a regular basis.

Reviews.Author: L. L.
Reviews.Content: Best chicken and waffles I've had thus far. Great chicken, crispy skin and not overbattered and really juicy on the inside. The waffles are excellent as well. Good collard greens to boot! You have to go at least once.

Reviews.Author: Na P.
Reviews.Content: Chicken and Waffles!! Can't go wrong there!  We had the regular fried chicken and also the smothered.  I love them both!  But we had a bad case of food coma afterwards.

Reviews.Author: Dee B.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, Roscoe's is over rated. When my friends visit from back home (Baltimore), they generally want to do two things in LA: see the Hollywood sign, and eat at Roscoe's. Luckily with this location, after we park we can see the sign anticlimactically as we walk from our parking spot to Roscoe's. I like the down home atmosphere, at least when the Hollywood element isn't overbearing, and the chicken and waffles are consistently pretty good. In fact , they are good enough to the point where I don't mind the fact that I have to take an obligatory trip here each time I have a new visitor from back home.Having said that, I grew up on what most would consider southern cuisine (fried chicken and porkchops, greens of all sorts, sweet potatoes in various manifestations, macaroni and cheese, chitterlings, etc ) and I was really disappointed when I strayed from the beaten path here. The greens were abysmal--reminiscent of the crappy canned greens that were overly limp, soggy, and flavorless that my aunt who couldn't cook to save her life used to heat up and give us. The corn bread was brutally dry. The sweet potatoes were a travesty.

Reviews.Author: Mary L.
Reviews.Content: i happen to stop by here a few months ago on my trip  to LA, you would think that this place would not be so crowded at 2:30 am but we waited for 45 minutes for a table i thought to myself is it really worth it whats all the fuss about. 'oh yes' it is. we finally got seated. everyone ordered the chicken & waffle and even though at first you think how could this taste good together? but let me tell you it is freak-en awesome. every time i go there i have to stop by. its the best place ever.  they have pretty fast service and a good combination of other things. if you want greens, mac & cheese, whatever. they have it. My choice are the waffles I LOVE THE WAFFLES. its my new top choice in LA

Reviews.Author: Emily P.
Reviews.Content: Fluffy biscuits my....! The waffles were soggy, the biscuits were neither fluffy nor crunchy, and everything else was mediocre at best, including the smothered chicken. Is this famous place just coasting on a no longer deserved reputation?

Reviews.Author: Gekeya H.
Reviews.Content: The man at the head of the house was very polite and courteous.  I happened to come on a Sunday afternoon, so there was a short wait. I had the chicken and waffles. The chicken was ok, I've had better in Texas. But, the maple syrup, mixed with the butter on top of the waffle was to die for. All in all, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Author: Francis A.
Reviews.Content: omg fried chicken, collar greens and waffles are really good, this was my first time eating there at hollywood.... i never taste collar greens but it was very tastleful.. i put some red rooster and its good...

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: Being in the area on business, I was looking forward to having lunch at  the Best Fish Tacos in Ensenada but because business concluded early, at 9:30 am, we opted for breakfast and after searching the area on Google maps, Roscoe's was our best choice and we're glad to have chosen it. Service was great when we arrived but then our waitress never came around to refill our coffee, they seemed busy doing other things other then serving refills. I really liked the chicken, it had a thin crunchy crust, well seasoned and not oily. I'm really not much for waffles, but my wife and son really enjoyed them. Overall, Roscoe's is a great place, food was good, not expensive, and we were in and out in about 40 minutes, just wish our waitress would have topped our coffee off at least once. I tipped her accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Tru E.
Reviews.Content: Big ups to the late Biggie Smalls. If it wasn't for that song "going back to cali" when he rapped that verse about Roscoe's, I'd probably have no clue about this place. The chicken here is quite tastey and the bomb served with waffles. Some people cant see the 2 as a combination. It's actually good. Look at it like the other meats that is served with breakfast like sausage, bacon or ham. Nothing different with having chicken on the side. To me I don't think its too greasy and heavy I would say. I guess depending on how much food you order. But its not the way on how your stomach feels after eating at a KFC or Popeyes. Here at Roscoe, you end up leaving satisfied and not feeling bloated. I give it up, it lives up to the hype. Everytime I come here to eat, I would see some famous hip hop artists there eating like ludacris who was eating next to my table,  fat joe getting the vip treatment by cutting everyone during a wait on a table, and dwayne wiggins early morning having breakfast.  Most likely you'll find  someone famous at the gower location off sunset. Busy on sundays and during when the award shows are in town,  like the bet and soul train. At the end you will end up spending at least $20....but its worth the smack on every finger tip.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl C.
Reviews.Content: Honestly the best soul food I ever had at a restaurant. Almost close to real home cooking that your mom or grandma makes. Mac n cheese, waffles (so good, tastes like cinnamon or some kind of seasoning like nutmeg is baked into them), chicken,  smothered mashed potatoes were all great. The only thing I found wrong with the place was the location and the building looks kind of run down. They need to move it to a better neighborhood and put it in a better building.

Reviews.Author: Alexis A.
Reviews.Content: Been here once and now I always crave it. I stuck with the traditional Fried Chicken and Waffles, perfect combination!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles. Maybe Im biased since Im from the south and I know what real soul food is. Dont get me wrong it is edible. But the chicken is just average (I ordered the country boy). I've had better chicken and waffles in the south. The service is not so great either. My brother and I waited for our server to come to the table for 10 minutes. When I asked the server if she knew who our server was she replied "no" and thats it! I asked her to please find out who our server was and if she could come to our table. The server did eventually come and take our order. I understand that this is a staple of LA but I just really think its overrated.

Reviews.Author: Chauncey C.
Reviews.Content: Their fried chicken isn't that good.  That was surprising.  Now when I go, I get the smothered chicken.  Their sides are really hit or miss.  HOWEVER, their waffles are usually very good, and a couple of times, absolutely fantastic.  Maybe I'm posting to the wrong restaurant, because I've been to the Hollywood one the most, but the waffles have been best at the Long Beach Roscoe's.

Reviews.Author: nick t.
Reviews.Content: its freakin Chicken & Waffles come on its fantastic. if its good enough for snoop dogg its good enough for me. the waffles and chicken by themselves are pretty good but when you combine them and add some syrup they are great.

Reviews.Author: Gina A.
Reviews.Content: After many visits to the area I finally made it to Roscoe's! I never had chicken and waffles before! The place was clean, staff was friendly, service was prompt and food was delicious! Greens were awesome too!! Good value for my money! I would go again.

Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: I visited here because it's what you do when you're trying to do all the touristy things in Hollywood.  I'll return because these people make some of the best damn chicken I've ever eaten.  I'm a sucker for the whole salty/sweet combination, so the waffle was the perfect match.  And the waffles are good.  But the chicken -- OMG the chicken!!  It was juicy, full of flavor, and had just the right amount of crunch.  I took a bite and didn't know whether to laugh or cry.  It was, as we say in the South, "slap yo'mama" good.  Don't miss it, and don't waste time looking for parking -- just use the valet and find a comfortable seat outside while you wait for your table.  It'll be worth it.

Reviews.Author: M E.
Reviews.Content: This place used to be great  a few yrs ago...did they change ownership? The food was not the same.  Everything was super salty and the chicken dry.  The chicken franchises do a better job...so sad.  The corn cakes were so tough that they kept sliding around the melamine plate; was told that's the way they're suppose to be!  And, the waffles weren't crispy like they used to be...what happened?!  We're extremely disappointed. We will not be craving this place anymore.

Reviews.Author: Kong N.
Reviews.Content: overrated. not worth the money and wait. two stars for the good service.

Reviews.Author: Kenrick L.
Reviews.Content: Roscoe's, known for their chicken and waffles and they delivered.  Chicken was good and what really amazed me was that it was not too oily like other fried chickens.  Waffles were pretty good too.  What gave this place 3 stars were the greens (ridiculously salty) and the service.  It legitimately took the waiter 20 minutes for them to notice us.  I purposely stuck my legs out in the walkway so that a waiter would notice but they literally just walked around our table for 20 minutes.  We were legitimately thinking about walking out.  Definitely not a good way to start your dining experience.  Also even if the place is not packed they still stop you at the door like a club which is kind of weird.  Overall worth a try but go in a group so you don't mind waiting for service.

Reviews.Author: Samuel P.
Reviews.Content: Better than expected , chicken was good, waffles were good , left with a full belly and a smile on my face .

Reviews.Author: Aja Y.
Reviews.Content: This place was so awesome!  Fast service and friendly.  I couldn't stop eating eventhough I was so full.  I had the friend chicken and waffles which were to die for!  I would definately go back.

Reviews.Author: Peter K.
Reviews.Content: los angeles is the capital of over hyped places and roscoes is on top of that list. to all those who gave it 5star review...have you ever had great fried chicken? if you like dried out chicken this is your place.

Reviews.Author: Joseph M.
Reviews.Content: Gives me comfort sometimes

Reviews.Author: Judy S.
Reviews.Content: not sure what the hype was all about.  our friend was so excited to bring us here & we were so excited to try it!  1st of all, the table was a bit grimy... I didn't want to touch anything, but I figure if the food was as good as we were being told, it might be worth putting up w/ a little bit of grime.  we ordered 2 plates of chicken & waffles, a chicken sandwich & the day's special which was 2 pieces of thighs, a biscuit & gravy over rice.  I was so disappointed but since our friend was so excited, we didn't say much. the chicken was ok, nothing 2 drive over 2 hours for that's for sure, the biscuit was dense & blah, the waffles, same dense & heavy, and the taste was nothing to jump for, and the gravy?  bland...  my gf did like her chicken sand but it looked like a frozen patty, nothing special.  she did also order the candied yams which she couldn't eat cause it was way too sweet!  and this came from the woman that put about 5 tablespoons of sugar in her coffee!!  overall it was sad.  and expensive especially considering the quality of food!  I said the chicken was ok, well we used up the entire hot sauce bottle on the table... maybe because even the chicken needed help :/  I will never eat hear again & I didn't even get into the service.  waitress took our order, brought our food but never came back for our refills or to check to see if we needed anything else... ugh is all I can say.  I guess the hype is that the president ate here... boy the president has bad taste!  I know if he eats somewhere now, I will stay away!

Reviews.Author: Cassaundra B.
Reviews.Content: yeeeeeeeessssss!!!! all of that and more

Reviews.Author: Giles S.
Reviews.Content: roscoe's would get 5 stars if i could eat there more than once a month. it's so delicious, but i feel like i need to run four miles after to burn the calories then confess my sins to my priest, and i'm jewish! make sure you get the chicken and waffles and use the maple syrup on the chicken.

Reviews.Author: Michelle H.
Reviews.Content: so yummy:)...i found the combo a bit weird at first, and actually still cant eat the chicken, waffle and syrup in one bite, but what the heck, it's tasty!

Reviews.Author: Carmen C.
Reviews.Content: I was impressed! I ordered the chicken and waffles to-go and was a bit afraid that the quality would decline, but even if it did after bringing it home and reheating it, it was still delicious! The waffles are eggo-like in thickness but larger, about 8 inches wide but MUCH better quality. Sitting in the Styrofoam boxes, all I could smell was the maple syrup, even though all the syrup containers were tightly closed. The chicken was deliciously fried but NOT greasy (unlike popeyes, which is equally delicious but 5x as greasy). After figuring out how to eat both the waffles and the chicken with knife and fork, I resorted to using my hands to eat both...which is okay because all orders come with wet naps! I ordered the thigh and leg and both were tender, moist and perfectly seasoned. Dipping the waffles in the gravy is really good as well. I wouldn't recommend ordering the fries, there's nothing special about them besides that they're FRESH and hot, I burnt my tongue. My order of 4 pcs of chicken, 3 waffles, gravy, and fries came out to about $22. A little bit pricey (causing this review to lose a star) but no complaints because I was completely satisfied with my meal. Highly recommended, I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: I guess you gotta go once to say you have gone but I don't know if it's worth all the hype. The wait was long and the security guards outside just stood there while some guy who was high on drugs was harassing people in line and stopping traffic in the middle of the road. Someone eventually called the cops on him so I am thankful for that. Definitely quite an experience. The waffles were nothing different than what you buy at the store frozen and heat up. The chicken was good but I can't say it was anything better than fast food fried chicken. There's not much more on the menu but a few additional sides. The macaroni was not worth the hype and again on par with tv dinner macaroni, good but nothing special. I guess you go here for the experience and not the food and that is definitely what you get. Our server kept forgetting to check on us and refill our drinks but I'll assume that's not a common thing. I'm glad we checked it out but we're not in any hurry to go back.

Reviews.Author: Frank C.
Reviews.Content: stuff comes hot and fresh but parking is a bit hard and chicken is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Author: Elaine J.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fussy eater, but I like the food to taste like it was just made, not warmed over.  So Roscoe's passes that test with flying colors, even if the chicken wasn't very seasoned.  I was there maybe 15 years ago, and the cooking is the same, no disappointments.  And the service was fast, the waiters pleasant.  BUT...yesterday was my birthday, I called 2 weeks before to make a reservation for a large party.  I was told they didn't take reservations, but if I got there early, I could probably put some tables together.  Got there very early, some of my party was already there, sitting at a big table.  I thought that was our table, but the big guy in the front said it was reserved for "The Campaign".  THAT burns me.  Regular big parties can't get a reservation, but a bunch of politicals get VIP treatment?  At this moment in our political history?  Final judgment: good enough food, great service, the people at the door and overseeing the rooms need to get their act together.  It seems like everyone at our table came to that same conclusion, for various reasons.
